actors: John Wayne, Rita Hayworth, Claudia Cardinale, John Smith, Lloyd Nolan, Richard Conte, Wanda Rotha, Kay Walsh, Miles Malleson
description: American impresario Matt Masters embarks with his circus for Europe. His unconfessed purpose is to find Lilli, the woman he fell in love with and who disappeared following the accidental death of her husband and who left him to take care of her daughter. Upon arrival in Barcelona, ??things immediately turn bad for him and Matt is forced to move to Madrid where he finally meets Lilli.
notes: Hollywood blockbuster with many famous actors, important collaborators and a director with a solid profession. But between pathetic lunges, delays and circus digressions, the film is rather boring.

title: The Haunted Palace
actors: Vincent Price, Debra Paget, Lon Chaney jr., Frank Maxwell, Leo Gordon, Elisha Cook jr., John Dierkes, Milton Parsons, Cathie Merchant
description: In 1765 in the village of Arkham, Joseph Curwen was burned at the stake, accused of human sacrifice. A century later one of his descendants, Ward, settles in Arkham with his wife. Under the influence of his ancestor, he comes to identify with him, despite the villagers' vain efforts to defeat Curwen's hold on Ward and his wife. Part of the Cormanian cycle dedicated to Poe, but actually also inspired by a Lovecraft novel, the film highlights a careful realization and a stylistic complexity that redeems the shortcomings of the screenplay. As usual, handsome Vincent Price.

title: Ghost Town
actors: Franc Luz, Catherine Hickland, Jimmie F. Skaggs, Penelope Windust, Bruce Glover, Blake Conway, Laura Schaefer, Michael Alldredge
description: Frontier-obsessed MP finds himself in a ghost town in the Arizona desert. Mix of horror and western.

title: City Beneath the Sea
actors: Robert Ryan, Anthony Quinn, Mala Powers, Suzan Ball, George Mathews, Karel Stepanek, Hilo Hattie, Lalo Rios, Woody Strode, John Warburton
description: Bran (Ryan) and Tony (Quinn) are hired by an insurance company to recover the precious cargo of a sunken ship. They soon discover that the captain, the only survivor of the shipwreck, has provided false indications to calmly take possession of the treasure. The ship is on the seabed where there are the remains of a city that sank during a tsunami and for the natives the area is taboo. Another earthquake collapses the city and buries the treasure forever, but the two are saved. Entertaining film about manly friendship by Boetticher, a former bullfighter who then directed exemplary westerns such as The Seven Murderers.

title: Class of 1999
actors: Malcolm McDowell, Bradley Gregg, Traci Lind, Stacy Keach, Patrick Kilpatrick, Pam Grier, John P. Ryan, Darren E. Burrows, Joshua John Miller, Sharon Wyatt
description: We are in the near future, in an American high school. The disciplinary situation is now uncontrollable by traditional means. The principal of the institute then decides to resort to extreme remedies: he turns to a robot manufacturer, asking him to solve the problem of order through his machines. But this decision, instead of returning to normal, unleashes an internal war that ends in carnage.
notes: With "Class 1984" Lester had already had his say on the subject, but evidently he was not satisfied. Malcolm McDowell, former "Clockwork Orange" thug, here is on the other side of the fence.

title: Cocoon
actors: Don Ameche, Hume Cronyn, Tahnee Welch, Tyrone Power jr., Wilford Brimley, Brian Dennehy, Steve Guttenberg, Jack Gilford, Maureen Stapleton, Jessica Tandy, Gwen Verdon
description: Some guests of a Florida seniors' community suddenly and mysteriously regain lost youthful energy. The reason is to be found in the cocoons (cocoons), which some benevolent aliens have deposited in the pool of the retirement home. All the guests of the place benefit from the unusual situation and, when the aliens return to space, the more enterprising old men go with them.
notes: Funny and polite comedy-fantasy, a metaphor for hope and glorification of life. Alongside the glorious elderly actors Don Ameche (awarded with the Oscar) and Hume Cronyn, two scions of art: Tahnee Welch, daughter of Raquel, and Tyrone Power jr. Oscar also for special effects.

title: Raw Deal
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Kathryn Harrold, Darren McCavin, Sam Wanamaker, Paul Shenar, Robert Davi, Ed Lauter, Joe Regalbuto, Steven Hill
description: Banned from the FBI for his hasty methods, Mark Kaminski (Schwarzenegger) scrambles to find the killers of Harry Shannon's son, a no longer young ex-colleague. After faking his own death, he infiltrates the ranks of the powerful Petrovita mafia family, causing such a disruption that he is rehabilitated as a federal agent.
notes: Fracassona and approximate story, which fails to please despite some successful touch of humor. Schwarzenegger, at the height of his career after films like "Conan the Barbarian" and "Terminator", could already afford to make a living on his character.

title: Martial Law
actors: Chad McQueen, Cynthia Rothrock, David Carradine, Andy McCutcheon, Philip Tan, Tony Longo, Vincent Craig Dupree, Jim Malinda, Rick Walters, Patricia Wilson
description: Sean Thompson is a Los Angeles cop, tough, mean, and at least as skilled in martial arts as his colleague Billie Blake. Sean is on the trail of Dalton Rhodes, someone who steals sports cars to sell them in Hong Kong and who also smuggles weapons to South America. But the real trouble with Dalton is that Michael, Sean's younger brother, has also fallen into his gang. Sean's avenging fury is not slow to strike.
notes: Chad McQueen doesn't look like dad Steve. Cynthia Rothrock is such a star, but neither young actor can get the film out of boredom.

title: Martial Outlaw
actors: Jeff Wincott, Gary Hudson, Vladimir Skomarovsky, Krista Errickson, Liliana Komorowska, Natasha Pavlovich, Gary Wood, Ari Barak, Christopher Kriesa, Richard Jaeckel
description: Los Angeles Special Cops, the "Martial Outlaw" are all martial arts experts at the highest level. They are also not required to abide by any rules in order to deliver criminals to law. Harris is one of them and is now on the trail of old friend Roberts. This is the most delicate battle of his life: a battle from which, however he goes, the winner will come out with the bitterness of having had to defeat his closest friend ...
notes: Guards and thieves, martial arts and former friends armed against each other: the ingredients are all in place, the combinations too, the rhythm is there. But the fantasy, where is it?

title: The Comancheros
actors: John Wayne, Lee Marvin, Stuart Whitman, Ina Balin, Nehemiah Persoff, Michael Ansara, Patrick Wayne, Bruce Cabot, Joan O'Brien, Jack Elam, Edgar Buchanan
description: Paul Regret is a professional player who, after killing a man in a duel, flees to Texas. Here he meets the beautiful adventurer Pilar, but is also captured by a ranger captain, Jake Cutter. But the troubles are not over because the two men find themselves having to deal with the "comancheros", a gang of whites who sells alcohol and weapons to Indians.
notes: Michael Curtiz's latest film (that of "Casablanca"), a western still conducted with a sure hand. The great spaces of Texas are evocative and well photographed in Cinemascope by the expert William H. Clothier. The interpreters belong to the myth.

title: Commando
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rae Dawn Chong, Dan Hedaya, Vernon Wells, James Olson, David Patrick Kelly, Alyssa Milano, Bill Duke, Drew Snyder, Sharon Wyatt
description: A former dirty business agent John Matrix, their daughter Jenny is kidnapped. Instead of ransom, Bennett, a former comrade of his now employed by General Arius, asks him to kill Velasquez, the president of Val Verde, democratically elected in place of Arius. Matrix accepts, takes the plane to Val Verde, but manages to escape taking Cindy, a black stewardess, with her.
notes: Apart from the bucolic scenes between Schwarzy and the little girl, frankly embarrassing because they are a bit reminiscent of "Frankenstein", the film has a good pace. Lester was perhaps more original in his early low-budget films ("Gas Station", "Born 1984").

title: Conan the Barbarian
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Max Von Sydow, James Earl Jones, Sandahl Bergman, Ben Davidson, Cassandra Gava, Gerry Lopez, Mako, Valerie Quennessen, William Smith
description: The men of Tulsa Doom storm a village where the only tribe who knows the secret to forging the steel and therefore the swords of its warriors lives. The result is a massacre from which only little Conan is saved. Years pass and the little boy has become a giant with only one idea in mind: to find the man who killed his parents and consummate revenge. Directed by John Milius, co-written by Oliver Stone, played by Schwarzenegger, it's as spectacular and gross as comic book adventures. For productive commitment and quality of direction it is far superior to the numerous imitations.

title: Conan the Destroyer
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Grace Jones, Wilt Chamberlain, Mako, Tracey Walter, Sarah Douglas, Olivia D'Abo, Pat Roach, Jeff Corey
description: In a timeless age, Queen Tamaris sends her granddaughter Jenna in search of the horn of the god Dagoth, who has long been asleep. The object assures whoever holds it dominion over the universe, but the queen secretly wants the young woman to die. To protect her, however, there is the strong Conan and, after many and dangerous adventures, the evil ones turn back on those who had put them in place, not before a monstrous metamorphosis of the idol of Dagoth.
notes: Second episode of a saga built to exalt Schwarzenegger's pectorals and biceps. Some interest in the accompanying figures and costumes. More in the frame, however, than in the painting.

title: The Final Conflict
actors: Sam Neill, Don Gordon, Lisa Harrow, Rossano Brazzi, Barnaby Holm, Mason Adams, Robert Arden, Leueen Willoughby, Marc Boyle
description: The Antichrist is alive and more powerful than before. At the moment all his energies are aimed at averting the Second Advent, or the birth of a new Christ, scheduled for those days in England.

title: Congo Crossing
actors: Virginia Mayo, George Nader, Peter Lorre, Rex Ingram, Michael Pate, Tonio Selwart, Kathryn Givney, Tudor Owen, Raymond Bailey
description: Construction engineer David Carr intends to "civilize" the independent region of Congotanga Falls in West Africa, thereby promoting its annexation to the Belgian Congo. But the criminals of all kinds who have found refuge there, headed by the shady Carl Rittner, are not at all in agreement ...
notes: The honest craftsman Pevney professionally directs a film that is not exceptional but enjoyable, with a cast (Mayo and Lorre above all) suitable for the need. The Universal production also guarantees respectable technical contributions, among which the one provided by the great director of photography Russell Metty stands out.

title: How the West Was Won
directors: John Ford, Henry Hathaway, George Marshall
actors: Carroll Baker, Lee J. Cobb, James Stewart, Henry Fonda, John Wayne, Carolyn Jones, Karl Malden, Gregory Peck, George Peppard, Robert Preston, Debbie Reynolds, Eli Wallach, Richard Widmark
description: The history of the West through the events of a family of settlers. A sister marries a lone hunter; the other, a professional player. The son of the former participates in the Civil War, during which he also saves the life of General Grant. After the war, he becomes sheriff of a frontier city and thus contributes to the affirmation of order and the new American civilization.
notes: The film is the result of a complex spectacular operation: the technique of shooting and projection of the cinerama was experimented there. Three directors; the cast made available to them is stellar. Memorable Ford, so-so others. Oscar for screenplay, editing and sound.

title: The Plainsman
actors: Gary Cooper, Jean Arthur, James Ellison, Anthony Quinn, Charles Bickford, Helen Burgess, Porter Hall, Paul Harvey, Victor Varconi, John Miljan
description: A young cowboy captured by the Indians crushes an arms trade at the cost of his life. Spectacular and idealistic film.

title: California Conquest
actors: Cornel Wilde, Teresa Wright, John Dehner, Hank Patterson, Alfonso Bedoya, Lisa Ferraday, Eugene Iglesias, Ivan Lebedeff, Tito Renaldo, Renzo Cesana
description: In 1848, the citizens of California were divided between two trends: there are those who would like to join the United States and those who plot to hand over the region to Russia. Shadowy princesses, noble and haughty "don", mellifluous and cunning bandits and even a sweet but intrepid girl are the protagonists of this very romantic political intrigue. A solution of which, needless to say, the good ones win.

title: Conquest of Space
actors: Walter Brooke, Eric Fleming, Mickey Shaughnessy, Phil Foster, William Redfield, William Hopper, Benson Fong, Ross Martin, Vito Scotti
description: Launched from a space station destined for the Moon, a spaceship reaches Mars by mistake. Science fiction dated but well made by a master of the genre (War of the Worlds).

title: Tip on a Dead Jockey
actors: Robert Taylor, Dorothy Malone, Gia Scala, Martin Gabel, Marcel Dalio, Jack Lord, Joyce Jameson
description: Lloyd Tredman spent two years as an aviation pilot in Korea. Now he lives by expedients in Madrid, but the trauma of the war haunts him. So when a mysterious Mr. Smith offers him to fly a plane in a smuggling operation, he at first accepts, then gets scared, then gives up fear and takes flight. Then, unhappy, he repents again and reports everyone to the police, a rather cheap film version of an Irwin Shaw novel. The actors, chosen without too much sagacity, show that they do not believe much in the story they interpret.

title: Against All Flags
actors: Errol Flynn, Maureen O'Hara, Anthony Quinn, Alice Kelley, Mildred Natwick, Robert Warwick, Harry Cording, James Craven, Tudor Owen
description: In the seventeenth century a group of pirates took possession of the island of Madagascar. The British government, determined to free the Indian Ocean from privateers, sends Brian Hanke, an officer who pretending to be a deserter must defuse the guns placed in defense of Porto Suarez. Brian manages to obtain a plan of the fortifications and completes the mission. While trying to secretly leave the island with his companions, he is surprised by the men of the filibusta.
notes: Errol Flynn, despite his years and a few extra pounds, is still convincing in this action movie, one of the last of his heyday.

title: Convoy
actors: Kris Kristofferson, Ali MacGraw, Ernest Borgnine, Burt Young, Madge Sinclair, Franklyn Ajaye, Brian Davies, Seymour Cassel, Cassie Yates
description: Rubber Duck is a truck driver with a particular charisma. Together with two colleagues he publicly scoffs at Lyle, a street cop, old friend / foe who previously provoked and fined them. Lyle unleashes a colossal manhunt behind them. The three, on the other hand, together with a courageous journalist, organize a column of trucks that takes on gigantic dimensions.
notes: Even nostalgia is no longer what it once was, the old Peckinpah would say, who, even in a contemporary context, continues to cultivate western values ??in the background, contrasting the anarchist rebel with the sheriff sold to the capital.

title: Courage of Lassie
actors: Elizabeth Taylor, Frank Morgan, Tom Drake, Selena Royle, Harry Davenport, George Cleveland, Catherine McLeod, Morris Ankrum, Mitchell Lewis
description: Kathie Merrick (Taylor) is a young girl with a great passion for animals. One day he finds an injured dog, treats him and gives him the name of Lassie. The dog is trained to graze sheep and, due to his exceptional skills, is enlisted in the army where he performs heroic deeds. Third film dedicated to the dog, with a teenager Liz Taylor.

title: Rope of Sand
actors: Burt Lancaster, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Peter Lorre, Corinne Calvet, Sam Jaffe, John Bromfield, Mike Mazurki, Kenny Washington
description: In South Africa, neither the torture nor the flattery of the beautiful Suzanne convinces Mark Davis to reveal the hiding place of a diamond treasure. Mark repairs in Angola, but someone plots an infamous blackmail to get the loot. Good pacing, some "strong" scenes and a great cast.

title: The Crimson Pirate
actors: Burt Lancaster, Nick Cravat, Eva Bartok, Christopher Lee, Torin Thatcher, James Hayter, Leslie Bradley, Margot Grahame, Noel Purcell
description: The famous corsair Vallo captures a Spanish galleon loaded with weapons. The idea is to sell them to the rebels on the island of Salina, commanded by El Libre, who is currently being held. At the request of his daughter, Vallo frees him together with the scientist Prudence and embraces his cause. The pirates, however, are not there. One of the swashbuckling masterpieces, comical and colorful, full of gimmicks, with an acrobatic Lancaster (as always without a stunt double) and the silent "shoulder" Nick Cravat.

title: Short Circuit
actors: Ally Sheedy, Steve Guttenberg, Fisher Stevens, Austin Pendleton, G.W. Bailey, Brian McNamara, Tim Blaney, Marvin J. McIntyre, Barbara Tarbuck, Penny Santon, Vernon Weddle
description: The robot "Number 5" was designed with others of its kind as a war machine. When he is accidentally struck by lightning, he escapes from the factory and takes refuge in the house of a nice girl. After having gobbled up an infinite number of notions from books and mass media, "Numero 5" realizes that he is "alive", but his designers, the multinational company that made it and a patrol of heavily armed soldiers hunt him down.
notes: A pacifist-inspired apologue that affects not only US militarism but the entire civilization of communication. You get attached to the little robot in a second and a half ...

title: Jeremiah Johnson
actors: Robert Redford, Will Geer, Allyn Ann McLerie, Delle Bolton, Josh Albee, Joaquín Martínez, Stefan Gierasch, Richard Angarola, Paul Benedict
description: In 1840, Jeremiah Johnson, tired of social life, retires to the Rocky Mountains. His new existence as a hunter leads him to start a family, adopting an orphan and marrying the daughter of an Indian chief. When the Ravens, in revenge, kill both of him, he begins a personal war against this tribe, for which his figure assumes a legendary stature.
notes: Johnson is the symbol of a return to nature made not of pious illusions but of love and pain, of blood and fatigue. Extraordinary film by Pollack with an absurd Italian title: there is no character called "Corvo Rosso" !.

title: Will Penny
actors: Charlton Heston, Bruce Dern, Donald Pleasence, Joan Hackett, Lee Majors, Ben Johnson, Slim Pickens, Clifton James, Anthony Zerbe, Roy Jenson
description: As winter approaches, Will Penn, an elderly cowboy, travels to Montana with his friends Dutchy and Blue to look for work. Along the way, the three come across the Quint family, evil wanderers who can't wait to lead their hands. For possession of a deer, a firefight occurs in which Dutchy is wounded and a member of the Quint family is killed. Arriving in the village Dutchy is entrusted to a doctor while Will and Blue leave for the mountain where the Quints are waiting for them.
notes: A laconic western, with classic intrigues, restless atmospheres and good performers.

title: Country
actors: Jessica Lange, Sam Shepard, Wilford Brimley, Matt Clark, Theresa Graham, Levi L. Knebel, Jim Haynie, Sandra Seacat, Alex Harvey
description: The Ivy family, who have owned a farm in the Midwest countryside for three generations, is fighting to prevent the expropriation of their land. Husband Gil, wife Jewell and children Carlisle and Marlene have to fight against the government that has enacted restrictive economic measures against agriculture.
notes: Film of declared civil commitment and first work by Richard Pearce ("The long way home" and "For sale miracle"), in which Jessica Lange, in the role of the indomitable mother of the family, has the opportunity to vibrate all the dramatic chords. Lange is the executive producer of the film.

title: Moonfleet
actors: Stewart Granger, George Sanders, Viveca Lindfors, Joan Greenwood, Jon Whiteley, Liliane Montevecchi, Melville Cooper, Sean McClory, Alan Napier, John Hoyt, Donna Corcoran, Jack Elam, Dan Seymour
description: Jeremy Fox lends itself to tutoring young John, an orphan, but Jeremy is also the chief smuggler of the village of Moonfleet and this means that even for John, the doors of lawlessness are opened. Betrayed in her feelings, Jeremy's woman spies on the police who ambush the smugglers from which Jeremy and John barely escape. However, a precious medallion found changes the fate of the two.
notes: One of the masterpieces of adventure cinema, and (despite being based on a novel by John Meade Falkner) one of the most genuinely "Stevensonian" films ever made. A story of adventure and training, shot in a nocturnal and gothic technicolor, and in a format (the Cinemascope) from which Lang gets the best, even though he hates it ("only serves to shoot snakes or funerals").

title: Cowboy
actors: Glenn Ford, Jack Lemmon, Anna Kashfi, Brian Donlevy, Dick York, Victor Manuel Mendoza, Richard Jaeckel, King Donovan, Vaughn Taylor
description: Frank Harris is Deputy Hotel Manager in Chicago, but he would like to join the woman he loves in Mexico. To succeed in the difficult task he joins a group of cowboys, led by the rude Tom Rice; he takes on the task of "educating" the rookie to the harsh law of the West. At his school, Frank becomes a new man, capable of dealing with the most dangerous situations and caring more for livestock than for people: a real cowboy, finally.
notes: The western is the genre that best suits Delmer Daves' strings; here he gives us a beautiful virile friendship film, set among large, well-photographed landscapes.

title: The Cowboys
actors: John Wayne, Roscoe Lee Browne, Bruce Dern, Slim Pickens, Colleen Dewhurst, Alfred Barker Jr., Nicolas Beauvy, Steve Benedict, Robert Carradine, A Martinez
description: Will Andersen is a tough man, with no company since his two sons were massacred. He hires eleven boys to transport a massive herd of cattle across the prairies. He also takes with him a middle-aged Negro with the duties of a cook and a young mulatto. The problems of the journey are difficult, the company is risky, but Will manages to turn those boys into real men of the West.
notes: Rydell uses a monument of the western epic, John Wayne, to tell the end of a myth, but also the need to transmit the torch in other hands, which represent a new America, tributary to that of the past.

title: The Last Voyage
actors: Robert Stack, Dorothy Malone, George Sanders, Edmond O'Brien, Woody Strode, Jack Kruschen, Joel Marston, George Furness
description: While making its final transoceanic voyage before scrapping, a large cruise ship catches fire. At first the fire breaks out in the engine room and the passengers are kept in the dark. Then, when some of them end up in danger, the news spreads and sows general panic.
notes: Forerunner of the catastrophic genre, effective and credible.

title: D. A. R. Y. L.
actors: Barret Oliver, Mary Beth Hurt, Michael McKean, Kathryn Walker, Colleen Camp, Josef Sommer, Ron Frazier, Steve Ryan, David Wohl, Danny Corkill, Amy Linker
description: A car runs through the forest. At a bend he lets a little boy get off, drives off again and crashes into a ravine. The boy is called Daryl, he is 12 years old, he is very intelligent, good at playing baseball, lightning fast in calculations, but he does not remember anything of his past. On the other hand, he is adored by the childless couple who took him up for adoption. The family idyll ends when two scientists arrive ... D.A.R.Y.L. in fact it is a laboratory product. The idea isn't bad, but Wincer manages to make it trivial pretty quickly. A year after Wolfgang Petersen's "The Neverending Story", Barrett Oliver hasn't changed much.

title: From Noon till Three
actors: Charles Bronson, Jill Ireland, Douglas Fowley, Stan Haze, Damon Douglas, Héctor Morales, Bert Williams, Davis Roberts, Betty Cole, Anne Ramsey
description: After a premonitory dream, Graham decides not to participate in the planned robbery. He takes refuge with Amanda, a beautiful widow, and seduces her. The gang is destroyed, Graham escapes, but is arrested.
notes: Undecided in the modulation of the different registers, the film is discontinuous.

title: Dakota
actors: John Wayne, Vera Ralston, Walter Brennan, Ward Bond, Ona Munson, Hugo Haas, Mike Mazurki, Olive Blakeney, Nick Stewart, Paul Fix, Grant Withers
description: John Wayne and Walter Brennan still together in the tough struggle between settlers and bandits, for the possession of the lands and twenty thousand dollars of dowry of the enterprising Sandy.

title: Red Heat
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Belushi, Ed O'Ross, Peter Boyle, Laurence Fishburne, Gina Gershon, Richard Bright, J.W. Smith, Brent Jennings, Gretchen Palmer, Pruitt Taylor Vince
description: Ivan Danko, a Soviet police captain, is sent on a mission to Chicago to capture Viktor Rostavili, a dangerous drug dealer who killed his best friend and colleague. In the United States, the extrovert agent Art Ridzik is joined by the granite Danko, and the forced coexistence between the two creates many problems. Meanwhile, Viktor wreaks havoc in the city and challenges the two cops.
notes: Walter Hill tries to replicate the success of "48 hours" by staging another "mixed" couple: after Nick Nolte and Eddy Murphy, here is Arnold Schwarzenegger "Russian" and James Belushi "American". For Danko, Walter Hill imagined a kind of modern, "masculine" and decidedly anabolic version of "Ninotchka". And the result is really fun. Superb action sequences, remarkable script, full of jokes and twists.

title: Sergeant Rutledge
actors: Jeffrey Hunter, Constance Towers, Woody Strode, Billie Burke, Juano Hernandez, Willis Bouchey, Carleton Young, Judson Pratt
description: Lieutenant Cantrell defends Sergeant Rutledge in a trial. This is a black man, accused of killing Major Dabney and his daughter. Appearances are against the accused, but Cantrell investigates and manages to dismantle them until glimpses of a different truth emerge. The testimony of the father of a young man killed by the Indians will be decisive: with a twist the culprit will be unmasked.
notes: A curious trial western shot almost entirely indoors, in which Ford traces the profile of a noble black soldier.

title: Green Dolphin Street
actors: Lana Turner, Van Heflin, Donna Reed, Richard Hart, Frank Morgan, Edmund Gwenn, May Whitty, Reginald Owen, Gladys Cooper, Moyna MacGill, Linda Christian
description: William joins the navy. On leave in the port of Singapore, he gets drunk in a tavern and wakes up the next day as a deserter. He finds a passage to New Zealand and settles there. He writes a letter to his former benefactor asking for one of his two daughters to marry but, by mistake, names the one he is not in love with. The latter joins him and marries him: they will live happily. Novel and adventure are the main ingredients of this film. After all, Victor Saville is Kim's director. Academy Award for Special Effects.

title: The Delta Force
actors: Chuck Norris, Lee Marvin, Martin Balsam, Joey Bishop, Shelley Winters, Robert Forster, Lainie Kazan, George Kennedy, Hanna Schygulla, Susan Strasberg, Bo Svenson, Robert Vaughn
description: A Palestinian terrorist group hijacks a passenger plane; having failed the diplomatic path, the American president authorizes military intervention. The tough guys from the "Delta Force", an anti-terrorist commando led by Colonel Alexander and Major McCoy, have been appointed to resolve the issue.
notes: Spectacular scenes, strong Manichaeism and vulgar populism are the simple formula of this cartoon from the producer of Rambo. Chuck Norris is the most woody actor since Frankenstein. The film is very modest but seeing Lee Marvin's granite and warrior face is always a pleasure.

title: Ten Who Dared
actors: Brian Keith, John Beal, James Drury, Ben Johnson, R.G. Armstrong, L.Q. Jones, Dan Sheridan, David Stollery, Stan Jones
description: In 1869 a group of ten men, Major Wesley Powell, his brother Walter, and eight other explorers, prepare for an expedition to sail the Colorado River for the first time. They will discover one of the most beautiful regions of America. The film, produced by Disney and based on the memoirs of the real Major Powell, is deadly boring. It should be an adventure movie, but there is very little action.

title: Night of the Creeps
actors: Jason Lively, Steve Marshall, Jill Whitlow, Tom Atkins, Wally Taylor, Bruce Solomon, Vic Polizos, Allan Kayser
description: Johnny, found lifeless near the body of his girlfriend torn by a maniac, is hibernated. Years later, two university students remove him from his box as a bet: Johnny has become a zombie and strange beings that lurk in his brain quickly spread the "contagion" in the city. Singular variation on a usual theme in the horror repertoire.

title: 'Doc'
actors: Stacy Keach, Faye Dunaway, Harris Yulin, John Bottoms, Michael Witney, Denver John Collins, Dan Greenburg, John Scanlon, Penelope Allen, James Greene, Antonia Rey
description: To become the Sheriff of Tombstone, Wyatt Earp has the Clanton family as his only obstacle. His old friend Doc Holliday arrives in town and goes to live with the prostitute Katie Elder whom he has promised to marry. Although his reputation as a gunslinger has not faded over time, Doc is too tired and sick to want to put on his holster again and get into trouble: even if, in the decisive moment, he is still at the side of his friend Wyatt ...
notes: The characters are those of _Sfida all'O.K. Corral_, but the intent here is to throw the legend overboard to bring out the humanity of the characters.

title: In Old California
actors: John Wayne, Binnie Barnes, Albert Dekker, Helen Parrish, Patsy Kelly, Edgar Kennedy, Dick Purcell, Harry Shannon, Charles Halton, Emmett Lynn
description: Business history and poisons of jealousy for doctor-pharmacist John Wayne.

title: The Ballad of Josie
actors: Doris Day, Peter Graves, George Kennedy, Andy Devine, William Talman, David Hartman, Guy Raymond, Audrey Christie, Karen Jensen, Elisabeth Fraser
description: Widowed at a young age and with a small son to raise, Josie sets up a sheep farm, which, however, does not appeal to the cattle ranchers in the area who try all ways to stop her. Josie doesn't give up and her "enemies" end up leaving her alone. All but one, Arch, who is determined to exterminate the flock. But Josie finds a "champion". A comedy set in a western setting, with some weaknesses in the script and without a particular "vis comica", almost entirely on the shoulders of the actors.

title: Wild Women
actors: Hugh O'Brian, Anne Francis, Marylin Maxwell, Marie Windsor, Sherry Jackson, Robert F. Simon, Richard Kelton, Cynthia Hull
description: US Army engineers are mapping an important communication route through Texas. We are in 1840, at the time of the annexation of Texas to the States of the Union. The Mexicans, however, refuse to cooperate; a fake settler caravan is thus sent, actually made up of soldiers and ex-prisoners. Good example of a western in which the classic element of adventure is contaminated by the tone of comedy.

title: Westward the Women
actors: Robert Taylor, Denise Darcel, John McIntire, Hope Emerson, Julie Bishop, Lenore Lonergan, Henry Nakamura, Marilyn Erskine
description: A California valley is inhabited by a peaceful settler community. The only problem is that there are no women. Roy is thus entrusted with the task of going to Chicago to recruit 150 girls willing to accept the hard life of the West. Roy succeeds in the feat, but the return journey is fraught with pitfalls. Choral and feminine Western written by Frank Capra and directed with great refinement and figurative power by Wellman.

title: The Glory Guys
actors: Tom Tryon, Harve Presnell, Senta Berger, James Caan, Andrew Duggan, Slim Pickens, Peter Breck, Jeanne Cooper, Michael Anderson jr.
description: An Indian revolt is taking place along the Doringo River. An expedition departs from Fort Doniphan, under the orders of General Hoffman. Between the guide Sol Rogers and Captain Harrod there is a rivalry for the love of a beautiful widow, but as the clash between the two approaches, friendship flourishes again. Sol will give his life to save Harrod. The expedition ends with a bloody battle that stops the revolt - an ordinary western with some good passages, notably the final battle. Laven is just a good craftsman, Sam Peckinpah writes a stereotypical script.

title: Double Impact
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Geoffrey Lewis, Alonna Shaw, Corinna Everson, Philip Chan, Alan Scarfe, Bolo Yeung, Andy Armstrong, Wu Fong Lung, Peter Malota
description: In Hong Kong, Paul Wagner is murdered with his wife by business partner Griffith. The orphaned twins of the slain are entrusted: one to a local boarding school, and the other to the US family friend Frank. Years later, Frank and the two brothers reunite to make both Griffith and Zhang, head of the parents' killers, pay her. One of the twins has meanwhile become a karate instructor.
notes: Although lacking in great original ideas, the film is shot with a great sense of rhythm. Muscular movie star Van Damme, also co-writer here, shows unexpected flexibility in the double role of twins with almost opposite characteristics.

title: Man of the West
actors: Gary Cooper, Julie London, Lee J. Cobb, Arthur O'Connell, Jack Lord, John Dehner, Royal Dano, Robert J. Wilke
description: Link Jones was a robber in his youth, then paid his debt to justice and got his head right. While he is bringing his fellow citizens' money for school, he is attacked by a group of bandits, one of whom recognizes and blackmails him. Link pretends to yield and participates in a robbery to protect the other hostages in the hands of criminals: then he kills the robbers, rescues the hostages and delivers the money entrusted to him.
notes: The western seen by Anthony Mann is closely related to the Greek tragedy; plus there is also an aged Gary Cooper here, with an unforgettable look and step. This is the last of his great westerns. Adult, of few words and of great sensitivity.

title: Bend of the River
actors: James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Julie Adams, Rock Hudson, Jay C. Flippen, Lori Nelson, Chubby Johnson, Stepin Fetchit, Harry Morgan, Howard Petrie
description: Glyn is a former adventurer who after rescuing Cole, a horse thief from the halter, joins a pioneer caravan from which he is hired as a guide. The journey is far from smooth and becomes even more complicated when the provisions (already paid for) for the winter are slow to arrive from Portland. Furthermore, Cole decides to betray Glynn and to put himself at the service of the gold miners, to the detriment of the pioneers. But Glyn's revenge is relentless.
notes: A nice western by Mann, written as usual by Borden Chase and interpreted with great intensity by James Stewart. From the anthology the whole sequence of the chase and the final showdown.

title: Deadly Friend
actors: Matthew Labyorteaux, Kristy Swanson, Michael Sharrett, Anne Twomey, Anne Ramsey, Richard Marcus, Russ Marin, Lee Paul, Andrew Roperto
description: Paul is a young genius of electronics applied to brain research. Bee Bee is a very sophisticated robot built by Paul for self-defense and other services, which is destroyed by a neighbor. Samantha, whom Paul falls in love with, who is accidentally killed by her drunk father. The boy does not resign himself to his death, he kidnaps the body kept in the morgue; in the brain it then inserts the microcircuits of the destroyed Bee Bee. Samantha actually comes back to life, but as a vengeful robot that sows death.
notes: Craven's horror may appear grungy at times, but it must be acknowledged that he often manages to achieve a revealing unsustainability. The director of "Nightmare" is also capable of juggling with special effects and cinematic winks. Even when, as in this case, not everything is convincing, it leaves its mark while using materials that are at first sight worn.

title: Dr. Cyclops
actors: Albert Dekker, Janice Logan, Thomas Coley, Charles Halton, Victor Kilian, Frank Yaconelli, Paul Fix, Frank Reicher
description: A group of scientists joins Dr. Torkal, who conducts mysterious and ingenious experiments in an isolated location in Peru. But Torkal uses the guests for his research, then miniaturizes them and the poor people find themselves in the situation of Odysseus 'companions in Polyphemus' cave. The film, one of the first horror films produced in Technicolor, was nominated for an Oscar for successful, and still enjoyable, special effects. Flamboyant photography, effective interpretation of Albert Dekker, archetypal Hollywood villain, in the part of the mad scientist.

title: The Undefeated
actors: John Wayne, Rock Hudson, Bruce Cabot, Ben Johnson, Antonio Aguilar, Roman Gabriel, Marian McCargo, Lee Meriwether, Merlin Olsen, Melissa Newman, Edward Faulkner, Harry Carey jr., Paul Fix, Royal Dano
description: After the Civil War, the Southern Colonel Jim Landon heads to Mexico with some comrades and their families. On the way he meets former Northern Colonel John Henry who is reaching Durango with a herd of horses. Once enemies on the battlefield, they will now join forces to defeat a band of outlaws
notes: A good opportunity for "pacification" on the screen between southerners and northerners. But not everything goes smoothly as it should, perhaps because John Wayne and Rock Hudson are a mismatched couple. The spectacular contexts, the determination of the Duke and the presence of Ben Johnson still make the show visible.

title: Bird on a Wire
actors: Mel Gibson, Goldie Hawn, David Carradine, Bill Duke, Stephen Tobolowsky, Joan Severance, Harry Caesar, Jeff Corey, Alex Bruhanski
description: Rick is trying, amidst many difficulties, to start a new life, protected by the federal police, after helping to dismantle a drug trade. One day he meets his ex-girlfriend, Marianne. She is still in love and ends up getting involved in his very risky existence. But, between chases, shootings and love skirmishes, all is well that ends well.
notes: From the director of "Short Circuit" a fast-paced action comedy. But there's just nothing beyond the mechanical combination of breathtaking pursuits known sentimental brawls.

title: Gun Brothers
actors: Buster Crabbe, Neville Brand, Ann Robinson, Slim Pickens, Michael Ansara, Walter Sande, Lita Milan, James Seay, Roy Barcroft, Dorothy Ford
description: Chad Santee, a former soldier, wants to raise cattle and marry the girl he loves, while his brother Jubal wants to be a bandit. Chad disapproves and walks away, unaware that his action has led to the discovery of his brother's hiding place, subjecting him and his entire gang to a bloody repression. Jubal first wants to take revenge, then thinks about it and heroically dies defending Chad from his cronies.
notes: A lively but disarmingly simplistic Western, directed by the honest craftsman Salkow (specialized in the genre: _The Sioux Massacre_, _Thousand dollars for a Winchester_, _Speed ??gun_, _The Iron Sheriff_).

title: Duel at Diablo
actors: James Garner, Bibi Andersson, Sidney Poitier, Dennis Weaver, Bill Travers, William Redfield, John Hubbard, Ralph Nelson, Bill Hart, John Hoyt, John Crawford
description: Traveling to Fort Creel, Jess Remsberg frees a white woman who lived as a slave to an Indian tribe, and brings her back to her husband. The pair, along with Jess and a cavalry squadron make their way to another fort, but are attacked by the Indians. Jess runs in search of help but, when he returns, he finds the small caravan massacred: only the woman and her son (had by the Indian chief) were saved. Violent, lively, an "adult" and multiracial western from the director who five years later will sign "Blue Soldier".

title: Duel in the Sun
actors: Jennifer Jones, Gregory Peck, Joseph Cotten, Lionel Barrymore, Lilian Gish, Herbert Marshall, Walter Huston, Charles Bickford, Harry Carey, Joan Tetzel, Tilly Losch, Butterfly McQueen
description: Pearl is a passionate girl, the daughter of a dancer who was killed by her husband out of jealousy. Raised in a God-fearing family, she meets the violent and possessive Lew; she feels attracted to it in spite of herself and becomes its lover. He dominates her and ends up killing his own brother Jack, who tried to make her repent. Between Pearl and Lew it all ends in a tragic final confrontation. King Vidor (who signs the film, although Sternberg, Willem Dieterle and Otto Brewer took turns directing him) masterfully intertwines western and melodrama in this torrid and baroque film, marked by the intervention of David O'Selznick, screenwriter and producer . Excellent cast and great work on color, to underline the ferocity of passions. The final duel / embrace is famous. It was a scandal: the sexy Jones had just been Bernadette in a very pious film.

title: The Scarlet Coat
actors: Cornel Wilde, Michael Wilding, George Sanders, Anne Francis, Robert Douglas, John McIntire, Rhys Williams, John Dehner, James Westerfield, Ashley Cowan, Paul Cavanagh
description: The war of independence against the British is now in the decisive phase. The US military instructs an officer to find out who the general is who passed information to the enemy. The officer insinuates himself into the enemy ranks and here he meets the beautiful Sally, with whom an English officer is also in love. The American manages to find out who the traitor is, while Sally falls in love with him; for his part, the English officer accepts the shooting without batting an eye.
notes: The future director of the "Magnificent Seven" also proves skilled in this espionage story set two centuries ago. The color lives up to the Metro tradition.

title: Second Chance
actors: Robert Mitchum, Linda Darnell, Jack Palance, Roy Roberts, Dan Seymour, Rodolfo Hoyos jr., Reginald Sheffield, Margaret Brewster, Judy Walsh, Fortunio Bonanova, Milburn Stone, Maurice Jara
description: A woman living in Mexico is sued by an American court: she is the main accusation against a gangster on trial in the United States. A killer, who has long been in love with her, is tasked with silencing her. The woman, in turn, is defended by an ex-boxer.
notes: Breathtaking story full of twists, halfway between the story of a gangster and the traditional adventure. Among the performers dominates Robert Mitchum, at ease in the role of tough with a soft heart. Mexico is hot and passionate, as is often the case in American cinema.

title: Dune
actors: Kyle MacLachlan, Silvana Mangano, José Ferrer, Sting, Francesca Annis, Jürgen Prochnow, Brad Dourif, Linda Hunt, Freddie Jones, Richard Jordan, Virginia Madsen, Sean Young, Everett McGill, Leonardo Cimino
description: In the year 10.191, the powerful Space Guild entrusted the Atreides family with the government of the powerful planet Dune, a completely inhospitable but important reserve of the "melange", a drug that has the fabulous power to extend life in an extraordinary way. However, the Atreides are destroyed by the evil and ruthless Baron Arkonnen; survives, together with his mother, only the young Paul, who has inherited extraordinary powers from his father ...
notes: From the famous saga signed by Frank Herbert, here is a real cult destined for all fans of director David Lynch, who moves with ease between science fiction and mystical instances. Widely manipulated by the producer De Laurentiis, and therefore full of discontinuities (after all the events of the Herbert saga were exterminated), it nevertheless maintains happy moments.

title: Hard to Kill
actors: Steven Seagal, Kelly LeBrock, William Sadler, Frederick Coffin, Bonnie Burroughs, Andrew Bloch, Branscombe Richmond, Charles Boswell, Zachary Rosencrantz, Lou Beatty Jr., Geoffrey Bara
description: Mason (Seagal), an honest police officer, discovers that Senator Vernon Trent is covering a lot of underworld trafficking. The politician then sends a gang of brutal killers to Mason's house to attack her. Mason, seriously injured, remains in a coma for seven years, assisted only by a splendid nurse (Le Brock) who, in love with him, does not stop hoping for his recovery. He regains consciousness, but when Trent finds out, he sends his henchmen again to kill him. The nurse rescues him again and in a safe place helps him in rehabilitation therapy. Mason is soon able to take on the gang. The film is eventful but crude.

title: Tough Enough
actors: Dennis Quaid, Warren Oates, Carlene Watkins, Stan Shaw, Pam Grier, Bruce McGill, Wilford Brimley, Fran Ryan, Christopher Norris
description: Art Long (Quaid) lives as best he can by singing country music, which he himself composes, in small provincial clubs. However, what he earns is not enough to support his wife Caroline and son, so much so that he is forced to change jobs. Embraced his career as a boxer he became famous under the name of Country Western Warrior. The film is not bad: Dennis Quaid was a rising star and the presence of Warren Oates, albeit in a minor role, is always good news. But the idea that an ephebic singer of ballads and lullabies can suddenly become a boxing champion is hard to swallow.

title: Edward Scissorhands
actors: Johnny Depp, Winona Ryder, Dianne Wiest, Kathy Baker, Vincent Price, Alan Arkin, Anthony Michael Hall, Robert Oliveri, Conchata Ferrell, Caroline Aaron, Dick Anthony Williams, O-Lan Jones
description: Peggy discovers in the castle on the hill a curious young man, Edward, "created" by a strange inventor who died before he could fix his upper limbs. His hands, incomplete, are in fact two long scissors. Peggy decides to take him home to her husband and two children, Kevin and Kim. Edward becomes the darling of his neighbors, until a series of daring amorous circumstances lead him to transform into a "monster", hated and chased away by everyone ...
notes: From the director of "Batman" a postmodern parable on the dangers of diversity, with beautiful directorial ideas and a subtle modern fairy tale atmosphere. Last role of the old glorious Price. Bravissimo Depp.

title: El Condor
actors: Jim Brown, Lee Van Cleef, Marianna Hill, Patrick O'Neal, Iron Eyes Cody, Imogen Hassall, Elisha Cook jr., Gustavo Rojo, Florencio Amarilla, Julio Peña, Ángel del Pozo
description: Lute, a young black escaped from a US penitentiary takes refuge in Mexico, where the revolution is raging. Having met an adventurer who calls himself El Condor, Lute proposes to him the attack on a fortress where the treasure of Emperor Maximilian is kept. The fortress is conquered, but a nasty surprise awaits the winners of the battle.
notes: Nothing new under the (Mexican) sun; the film follows very exploited patterns even if it is quite compelling, especially for those who like strong scenes of violence.

title: El Dorado
actors: John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan, Charlene Holt, Paul Fix, Arthur Hunnicutt, Michele Carey, R.G. Armstrong, Edward Asner, Christopher George
description: Jason, a wealthy rancher, wants to take over a farmer's pastures by force; to this end he hires a gunslinger, Cole Thorton, but he instead allies himself with his old friend, Sheriff Jimmy Harrah, who has long been a slave to alcohol. Together with him he stands up to the arrogant breeder until victory, restoring peace and order to the country.
notes: Very similar in the plot to the previous "A dollar of honor", "El Dorado" traces some themes dear to Hawks: manly friendship, the reestablishment of the law, the sense of duty. Even if his heroes have grown older, and the look has become more ironic and melancholy.

title: El Paso
actors: John Payne, Gail Russell, Sterling Hayden, George 'Gabby' Hayes, Dick Foran, Eduardo Noriega, Henry Hull, Mary Beth Hughes, H.B. Warner, Robert Ellis
description: A lawyer turns into a bandit to bring to justice the corrupt authorities of El Paso, used to stealing veterans from the Secession war.

title: Hercules in New York
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Arnold Stang, Taina Elg, Deborah Loomis, James Karen, Ernest Graves, Tanny McDonald, Harold Burstein, Merwin Goldsmith
description: Thrown into the sea from Olympus, Hercules lands in New York, and not even Juno can prevent his muscular triumphs. A rambling and boring film, with Schwarzenegger still far from the stars.

title: Rescue Me
actors: Stephen Dorff, Michael Dudikoff, Ami Dolenz, Peter DeLuise, William Lucking, Dee Wallace, Liz Torres, Danny Nucci, Ty Hardin, Kimberley Kates
description: Frances is a serious high school student with one weakness: he is madly in love with the most beautiful girl in college, Genny. One day Genny accidentally witnesses a shady traffic between criminals and for this she is kidnapped. Frances can not help but photograph the moment of the kidnapping and then go and ask Mac, a friend of hers, a Vietnam veteran, for help.

title: Killing Streets
actors: Michael Paré, Lorenzo Lamas, Jennifer Runyon, Alon Aboutboul, Ishai Wureit, Shaul Mizrahi, Uri Mauda, Rahely Chimeyan, Hashem Yassin
description: Chris Brandt (Paré) has a twin brother, captain of the Marines, given up for dead in Lebanon in 1983. The official version, however, does not convince him and so he leaves for Beirut where he is treated like a fish in the face by the American ambassador (Lamas) and is kidnapped by terrorists; however, he does not give up and eventually returns to Ohio with his twin safe and sound. Michael Paré was the good lead in Walter Hill's Streets of Fire, a film in which everyone cheered for villain Willem Dafoe. For this child with a lost and innocent air, the role of Rambo does not fit, so much so that he is not credible even for a second.

title: Let's Get Harry
actors: Mark Harmon, Gary Busey, Robert Duvall, Michael Schoeffling, Tom Wilson, Glenn Frey, Rick Rossovich, Ben Johnson
description: Harry, a worker in a plumbing company, is kidnapped, along with the American ambassador, by a gang of South American drug traffickers. Faced with the indifference of the government, four of his work colleagues take it into his head to go and free him. They seek help from a disarmed old mercenary, Norman Shrike (Robert Duvall).
notes: If an American director wants to remove his name from the opening credits of a film, the pseudonym that is usually used is Alan Smithee. This time it was Stuart Rosenberg who resorted to makeup. Two great actors like Gary Busey and Robert Duvall, however, could not deny their participation in one of the worst films of the eighties.

title: The Exorcist
actors: Ellen Burstyn, Max Von Sydow, Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Lee J. Cobb, Kitty Winn, William O'Malley, Barton Heyman
description: Regan MacNeil, daughter of a well-known actress, begins to show unusual signs of imbalance. Violent noises come from her room, she becomes hysterical and fulfills monstrous dreams. Moreover, a director friend of the family is found dead after being alone with her. Little by little, however, the doctors who are treating her declare themselves helpless in the face of the very strange manifestations of the girl, even whispering that the poor woman is "possessed" by external forces. The mother is also convinced of this when she calls a priest. But he fails. Another exorcist, after an epic battle, manages to prevail, but at a very high price.

title: The Exorcist III
actors: George C. Scott, Ed Flanders, Brad Dourif, Jason Miller, Viveca Lindfors, Nicol Williamson, Scott Wilson, Nancy Fish, George DiCenzo, Don Gordon, Lee Richardson, Grand L. Bush, Mary Jackson
description: The policeman Kinderman, investigating a series of atrocious crimes that took place in the city, discovers that between them there could be a common religious bond. The case becomes complicated with the killing of some priests, but Kinderman thinks he identifies the perpetrator of the murders in a madman locked up in an asylum who would be the reincarnation of a maniac killed in the electric chair fifteen years earlier.
notes: William Peter Blatty, screenwriter of the first "Exorcist", goes behind the camera. We are far from the thickness of Friedkin's film, but this third part actually "grows inside" ...

title: They Live
actors: Roddy Piper, Keith David, Meg Foster, George 'Buck' Flower, Peter Jason, Raymond St. Jacques, Jason Robards III, John Lawrence, Susan Barnes, Sy Richardson
description: John Nada, who has landed in Los Angeles in search of work, witnesses a bloody police raid on a chapel. When the waters have calmed down, he enters and finds a pair of dark glasses through which reality appears completely different to him: the world is all black and white, and many "normal" people are aliens who have occupied positions of power and they keep the population subliminal through subliminal messages broadcast on television ...
notes: The film hides under a patina of light-hearted horror staging: its true nature, however, is a harsh and ferocious condemnation of certain American society and its methods.

title: Evil Toons
actors: David Carradine, Monique Gabrielle, Dick Miller, Arte Johnson, Suzanne Ager, Madison, Barbara Dare, Don Dowe, Michelle Bauer
description: Four friends work on the renovation of a long-uninhabited house. By opening a book of black magic, they free an animated demon who tries by all means to take possession of souls in order to earn immortality. He finally manages to penetrate the body of one of them.
notes: The mix of cartoons / actors could have interesting developments in the horror genre, but for this time there is no need to get too excited. Fans will still find something for their teeth. A curiosity: Fred Olen Ray, Californian B-series author, is considered the most prolific director after Jesus Franco.

title: Excalibur
actors: Nigel Terry, Helen Mirren, Nicol Williamson, Nicholas Clay, Cherie Lunghi, Paul Geoffrey, Robert Addie, Gabriel Byrne, Keith Buckley, Liam Neeson, Patrick Stewart
description: Arthur is the king designated by the wizard Merlin for the Crown of England and his is Excalibur, the marvelous sword. The knights of the Round Table have gathered around him, but the union of vassals is shattered by the alleged betrayal of Queen Guinevere with Lancelot.
notes: "Excalibur" Boorman version. Kitsch and redundant (the soundtrack includes Wagner and "Carmina Burana") but also full of passion and with a bloodthirsty fury not seen since Kurosawa's time. Nice Williamson who plays Merlin, a sort of stunt double for the director. The same year George A. Romero shot, on the same subject (even if set today), "Knightriders", an even better film but never distributed in Italy.

title: Explorers
actors: River Phoenix, Ethan Hawke, Jason Presson, Bobby Fite, Amanda Peterson, Dick Miller, Robert Picardo, Dana Ivey, Taliesin Jaffe, James Cromwell
description: Ben, Wolfgang and Darren are three distracted kids with a passion for space adventures. For this mania they stay up at night planning intergalactic journeys. Using their computer knowledge, the three are able to identify and control a magnetic force which, harnessed with the help of scrap appliances, becomes a spaceship.
notes: Joe Dante's most personal film after "Matinée", unfortunately massacred by the production that sent him into trouble without even finishing postproduction. A shame, because some ideas are brilliant. River Phoenix, just a teenager, is the bespectacled genius.

title: Phantom of the Opera
actors: Claude Rains, Nelson Eddy, Susanna Foster, Edgar Barrier, Leo Carrillo, Jane Farrar, J. Edward Bromberg, Fritz Feld, Frank Puglia, Steven Geray, Barbara Everest, Hume Cronyn
description: One of the musicians of the Paris Opera, after being robbed of one of his compositions, in the throes of fury was responsible for a murder. Horribly burned his face, he has since taken refuge in the basement of the theater. From there he reappears as a ghost from time to time, spreading death and ruin in his madness to favor the career of his daughter, chorister of the Opera. Remake of the version made in 1925 with Lon Chaney, it is rather traditional and not very personal. The use of color (quite unusual at the time, especially for a horror movie) allows for some suggestive solutions. Oscar in photography and scenography.

title: Heart Condition
actors: Bob Hoskins, Denzel Washington, Chloe Webb, Roger E. Mosley, Ja'net DuBois, Alan Rachins, Ray Baker, Jeffrey Meek, Eva LaRue
description: Jack (Bob Hoskins) is a police sergeant in love with Crystal, a beautiful prostitute. After a heart attack, the heart of the hated Stone (Denzel Washington), a black lawyer who has just died in an accident, is transplanted. From that day on, Stone's ghost begins to live with him and, after a rather turbulent first period, helps him find Crystal, unmask a political scandal and destroy a drug trade.
notes: Of course, the populace Bob Hoskins would make a nice couple with the refined Denzel Washington, if the script were less cumbersome and the direction a little faster.

title: A Distant Trumpet
actors: Troy Donahue, Suzanne Pleshette, James Gregory, Diane McBain, William Reynolds, Claude Akins, Kent Smith, Judson Pratt, Bartlett Robinson
description: The young Lieutenant Hazard is stationed at Fort Delivery, where General Quait arrives with a squadron to attack the Black Hawk tribe. After a first, bloody battle, Quait tries the path of negotiation and sends Hazard with an Indian guide on a mission to the rebels. Hazard succeeds in composing the parts, earning medal and promotion.
notes: Times change; The era of the "revisionist" western, intent on restoring dignity to the ancient enemy, is fast approaching. In the film, which closes his fifty-year career Walsh, this time turns a non-critical look at least perplexed on the history of the West.

title: The Virgin Queen
actors: Bette Davis, Richard Todd, Joan Collins, Herbert Marshall, Jay Robinson, Dan O'Herlihy, Robert Douglas, Romney Brent, Leslie Parrish, Lisa Daniels
description: Walter Raleigh pleads with Elizabeth I to grant him three vessels, with which he proposes to reach the New World. Conquered by the young man, Elizabeth does not grant him the ships, but makes him Captain of the Bodyguard.
notes: The lack of historical accuracy is canceled out by the actor's performances.

title: Cover-up
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Louis Gossett jr., Lisa Berkley, John Finn, Gil Kopel, Howard Rypp, Ofer Lehavi, Zadok Zarum
description: Prior to being a reporter, Mike (Lundgren) was a member of the Marine Corps. When eight American soldiers are killed in Israel and the responsibility is officially attributed to a terrorist group called Black October, Mike, not convinced, decides to investigate and discovers that in reality there is a plot behind the affair that wants to cause an international crisis. In a race against time, the journalist foils an attack by saving the situation. Lou Gosset jr. in this film it nullifies the credit earned with the Oscar ("Officer and a gentleman"). Dolph Lundgren gives all his energies to the end, but in the popular imagination he can't go beyond the famous "I split you in two" said to Stallone in "Rocky IV".

title: At Sword's Point
actors: Cornel Wilde, Maureen O'Hara, Robert Douglas, Gladys Cooper, June Clayworth, Dan O'Herlihy, Alan Hale jr., Blanche Yurka, Nancy Gates
description: Although Louis XIII, dying, left a minor heir as heir to the throne, the Duke of Lavalle actually dominates the kingdom of France, with the intention of marrying the Queen's daughter and thus making his power legitimate. The children of the famous musketeers, three young men and a girl arrive to help the sovereign. Never four will have their problems returning the throne to the Dauphin.
notes: Some good duels, but there is little new compared to the other films in the series. Allen directs with impeccable rhythm, the actors are the right ones.

title: The Space Children
actors: Michael Ray, Jackie Coogan, Adam Williams, Peggy Webber, Johnny Washbrook, Richard Shannon, Raymond Bailey
description: Under the influence of an alien, some children attempt to sabotage the launch of a space missile.

title: The Son of Sheik
actors: Rodolfo Valentino, Vilma Banky, George Fawcett, Montagu Love, Karl Dane, Bull Montana, Bynunsky Hyman, Agnes Ayres
description: Love, exoticism, adventures in one of the great successes of Rudolph Valentino, in his latest film.

title: Son of Frankenstein
actors: Basil Rathbone, Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Lionel Atwill, Josephine Hutchinson, Donnie Dunagan, Emma Dunn, Edgar Norton, Perry Ivins
description: Doctor Frankenstein's creature was rescued and hidden by the scientist's faithful servant. Frankenstein's son discovers her and secretly takes an interest in her, but the monster escapes his control. Enthusiastic settings and cast for lovers of the genre, with Boris Karloff for the last time in the role of the revived brute, and a great Bela Lugosi in the part of the sinister servant Igor.

title: The Son of Kong
actors: Helen Mack, Robert Armstrong, Frank Reicher, John Marston, Victor Wong, Ed Brady
description: On a distant island, the same man who discovered King Kong meets the monstrous ape's son, who saves his life. Modest and not very fortunate sequel to the 1933 masterpiece. Almost a banal adventure film.

title: Son of Lassie
actors: Peter Lawford, Donald Crisp, June Lockhart, Nigel Bruce, Leon Ames, William Severn, Donald Curtis, Nils Asther, Robert Lewis, Fay Helm
description: Lassie had a puppy: Laddi. Laddi is very fond of his owner Joe. But when Joe has to leave for the war (he has to reach the RAF camp), Laddi secretly follows him. Joe's plane is shot down over the skies of Norway, so Joe is interned in a prison camp but the good Laddi will always be able to track down his master, and save his life on more than one occasion.
notes: The war comedy is the backdrop to the adventures of the famous collie.

title: Firefox
actors: Clint Eastwood, Freddie Jones, David Huffman, Warren Clarke, Ronald Lacey, Kenneth Colley, Klaus Löwitsch, Nigel Hawthorne, Stefan Schnabel
description: The latest in Soviet warfare is an aircraft that delivers astounding performance as long as the pilot thinks in Russian. The CIA hires Russian-speaking Colonel Gant (Eastwood), a Vietnam veteran, and sends him to Russia to steal the plane. Before reaching his goal, Gant must overcome the obstacles placed in the way of the Soviet intelligence network. From the moment Gant finally manages to get his hands on the plane and escape, the film acquires rhythm and tension.
notes: The aerial duel with the pursuers introduces a fantastic dimension, thanks also to the special effects of Dykstra ("Star Wars"). Eastwood's eighth direction.

title: Red River
actors: James Arness, Bruce Boxleitner, Ty Hardin, Guy Madison, Ray Walston, Gregory Harrison, Stan Shaw, Robert Horton, John Lupton, Laura Johnson
description: A group of cowboys have to carry a large herd across the United States. Work puts a strain on men's nerves. The most dangerous friction is that between the herd leader and the younger cowboy. At first, the boy willingly accepts the protection of the most experienced colleague, but eventually he begins to argue more and more fiercely.
notes: The 1948 version, starring John Wayne and Montgomery Clift, was considered an "adult" western. In this remake for TV, psychology is the cornerstone around which the action revolves. But don't even think about making the comparison.

title: My Friend Flicka
actors: Roddy McDowall, Preston Foster, Rita Johnson, Diana Hale, James Bell, Jeff Corey
description: A horse breeder who lives on a farm on the edge of the forest near a large lake gives his teenage son a freaky filly in order to have her tamed. The boy will learn that it is necessary to sacrifice and commit oneself fully for the good of those entrusted to us. The plot is very tenuous, although the filly is now dispersed, now "mad" and now infirm. The risk, not always avoided, is therefore that of a certain monotony. The way in which the educational "message" inherent in the film is offered is quite naïve, but the shots of the natural environment are technically very valuable and very fascinating. Detail for the dog Lassie.

title: Florida Straits
actors: Raul Julia, Fred Ward, Daniel Jenkins, Victor Argo, Jaime Sanchez, Ilka Tanya Payan, Antonio Fargas, Jesse Corti
description: A trio of adventurers face the dangers of the Cuban jungle, hurricanes, outlaws, ambushes and machine guns to get their hands on a gold fortune buried by one of them: a Cuban nationalist just released after more than twenty years of jail. Directed and performed by good professionals, the film remains a lively and enjoyable TV-movie.

title: The Fog
actors: Adrienne Barbeau, Jamie Lee Curtis, John Houseman, Hal Holbrook, Janet Leigh, Tom Atkins, James Canning, Charles Cyphers, Nancy Loomis, Ty Mitchell, Regina Waldon
description: Antonio Bay, on the Pacific. The city is celebrating, the anniversary of the foundation is approaching. The ancestors of the inhabitants of the town, however, were guilty of an impious crime: they let a sailing ship crash on the rocks to rob it of its treasures. The ghosts of those ancient sailors now return transported by the fog. It will be a massacre.
notes: Grande Carpenter: a horror made of ghostly atmospheres that reflects clearly on the loss of innocence of a community born on the ruins of sin. The Puritan pilgrim fathers of America do not sleep soundly but the cinema in these parts rejoices.

title: The Emerald Forest
actors: Powers Boothe, Meg Foster, Charley Boorman, Dira Paes, Yara Vaneau, William Rodriguez, Estee Chandler, Eduardo Conde, Ariel Coelho
description: Bill Markham has been looking for his son Tommy for ten years, who was kidnapped by a tribe of Indians when he was the manager of a shipyard on the Amazon River. She finds him again but the latter, grown up in the tribe and now an adult, is about to get married and does not want to go home; on the contrary, it involves his father in a bloody war against the "Ferocious" people and in the clash with speculating adventurers.
notes: Always interested in the clash between modernity and archaic cultures, this time Boorman combines it with the ecological theme, also involving his son (he is the young white man adopted by the Indians). Remarkable direction, highly spectacular.

title: Fort Massacre
actors: Joel McCrea, Forrest Tucker, Susan Cabot, John Russell, George N. Neise, Anthony Caruso, Robert Osterloh, Denver Pyle, Francis McDonald, Guy Prescott, Rayford Barnes
description: The few survivors of a battalion attacked by the Apaches take refuge in Fort Crain under the leadership of the only non-commissioned officer left alive, Sergeant Vinson (Joel McCrea). But there is a problem: Vinson's family has been exterminated by the Indians and this makes the sergeant unnecessarily angry and vengeful against the Apaches. Before he can do any more damage, one of his soldiers kills him. Western directed by one of the masters of the B-movie. Nothing special, but (unsurprisingly) some tight action sequences.

title: Invasion Force
actors: Renee Cline, Walter Cox, Richard Lynch, Douglas Harter, Charles Stedman, Graham Timbes, David Marriott, Steve Bullack
description: Actors and technicians of a war film shot in Richmond bravely transition from fiction to reality, confronting a small army of terrorists determined to blackmail the White House by taking the entire city hostage. David A. Prior has directed more than one extravagant B movie like this one, which is actually more original in subject than in staging. Released only on tape and on TV.

title: Frankenstein
actors: Boris Karloff, Colin Clive, Mae Clarke, John Boles, Edward Van Sloan, Frederick Kerr, Dwight Frye, Lionel Belmore
description: The baron and scientist Dr. Frankenstein transplants a new brain onto a dead person and brings it back to life through the application of a magnetic fluid. But the grafted gray matter is that of a criminal madman: the creature, childish and bloodthirsty at the same time, gets rid of its guardians and begins to kill.
notes: English in Hollywood, James Whale made Mary Shelley's Frankenstein a true icon of the 20th century. It seems he was the one who invented the monster mask, even if the credit was attributed to the brilliant make-up technician Jack Pierce. Sublime Boris Karloff in the main role.

title: The Naked Dawn
actors: Arthur Kennedy, Betta St. John, Eugene Iglesias, Roy Engel, Charlita, Tony Martinez, Francis McDonald
description: Santiago is a former Mexican revolutionary who has gone into hiding and is a bandit. During the robbery of a train he meets Manuel and Maria, peons and newlyweds. Maria, mistreated by her husband, asks Santiago to take her away; he also accepts because he discovered that the greedy Manuel was about to kill him. A woman next to an outlaw, however, can sometimes become a good ballast ...
notes: An unconventional western, internalized and modern, of extraordinary formal elegance. Absolute masterpiece of the brilliant Austrian-born director Edgar G. Ulmer, made with scarce means in about ten days.

title: Rock Island Trail
actors: Forrest Tucker, Adele Mara, Lorna Gray, Bruce Cabot, Chill Wills, Barbra Fuller, Grant Withers, Jeff Corey, Roy Barcroft, Pierre Watkin
description: The interests of Reed, an engineer, are opposed to those of Morrow, the owner of a river shipping line. With dynamite and the Indians, the latter tries to prevent the success of the railway on which Reed works, which has also stolen his girlfriend. Acceptable product of Joseph Kane, director specializing in western series B.

title: Arrow In the Dust
actors: Sterling Hayden, Coleen Gray, Keith Larsen, Tom Tully, Jimmy Wakely, Tudor Owen, Lee Van Cleef, John Pickard, Carleton Young
description: After deserting the United States cavalry, he returns to illegally dress the uniform to lead a caravan persecuted by Indians to safety to Fort Laramie. The heroic mission ends up rehabilitating him for all to see.
notes: A western by trade, starring Sterling Hayden, Hollywood tough, redeemed in the end.

title: Copper Canyon
actors: Ray Milland, Hedy Lamarr, Macdonald Carey, Mona Freeman, Harry Carey jr., Frank Faylen, Hope Emerson, Taylor Holmes, Peggy Knudsen, James Burke
description: A group of men who fought in the ranks of the Northerners undertake the exploitation of a copper mine, but the only foundry in the city is owned by a former southerner who refuses to collaborate with those who were his enemies in the war. Former Confederate Colonel Desmond comes to their rescue. He goes into trouble but, with the help of a girl, he defeats all the wicked. Even without elements of particular originality, the narration is fairly compelling and the show works.

title: Trail Street
actors: Randolph Scott, Robert Ryan, Anna Jeffreys, George 'Gabby' Hayes, Madge Meredith, Steve Brodie, Billy House, Virginia Sale, Harry Woods
description: In the town of Liberal, settlers and ranchers are fighting for the right to land. Sheriff Masterson intervenes to settle the dispute ...
notes: The narrative scheme is a classic of the western tradition: and in fact that of Enright is a vintage B movie. A treat for cinephiles and fans of the genre.

title: Fighting Caravans
actors: Gary Cooper, Lili Damita, Ernest Torrence, Tully Marshall, Fred Kohler, Eugene Pallette, Roy Stewart, May Boley, Eve Southern
description: Three fusiliers escort a caravan on its way to California. Weak western in which only the star of Gary Cooper shines.

title: Tarzan Escapes
actors: Johnny Weissmuller, Maureen O'Sullivan, Benita Hume, John Buckler, Herbert Mundin, William Henry, E.E. Clive, Darby Jones
description: Some of Jane's relatives join her and her man in the jungle to convince her to return to the civilized way in order to settle an inheritance issue. The expedition leader captures Tarzan and hands over his clients to a savage tribe. Fortunately, there are elephants who obey the Monkey Lord. The couple formed by Weissmuller and Maureen O'Sullivan is the most famous of all those who played the two heroes of the forest. The story is of course, totally naïve, but Thorpe draws from it what Tarzan fans expect.

title: Dreamscape
actors: Dennis Quaid, Max Von Sydow, Christopher Plummer, Kate Capshaw, Eddie Albert, David Patrick Kelly, George Wendt, Larry Gelman, Chris Mulkey, Peter Jason
description: Alex Gardner (Dennis Quaid) discovers that he has special powers, that is, being able to enter the dreams of others. In the laboratory of Doctor Novotny (Max Von Sydow) who studies these phenomena he also discovers that there is a plan to kill the President of the United States through sleep. Political intrigue is less interesting than paranormal, but the film works and Dennis Quaid does too.

title: Blind Fury
actors: Rutger Hauer, Brandon Call, Terrance O'Quinn, Lisa Blount, Noble Willingham, Nick Cassavetes, Rick Overton, Randall 'Tex' Cobb, Charles Cooper, Meg Foster
description: Nick Parker was left blind during a war action in Vietnam. Back in the United States, he goes in search of Frank, a fellow soldier. The man is in trouble with the mafia who are trying to force him to work in a drug factory and has decided to kidnap his son Billy. Nick arrives at the right time, saves the boy and, with him, sets out in search of his father.
notes: The Australian Noyce "burns" himself with this silly action movie, evidently directed with his left hand. The hero looks like the Daredevil of comics but the script blows up all of its dramatic potential. Rutger Hauer collapses with the film.

title: Tarzan's Savage Fury
actors: Lex Barker, Dorothy Hart, Tommy Carlton, Patric Knowles, Charles Korvin
description: A caravan led by Rokov and Edwards reaches Tarzan in the jungle. Edwards pretends to be Tarzan's English cousin (whom he killed instead) and says he has an important mission to accomplish: recovering a lot of diamonds guarded by the Wasuri tribe. But their scam will be discovered and Tarzan, with the help of Jane and their adopted son Boy, will defeat the evil ones. Cyril Endfield, an American director of South African origin, after having directed a couple of good thrillers, was the victim of the so-called witch hunt. This Tarzan is certainly not one of his best things, it is still a good suspense and adventure film.

title: The Left-Handed Gun
actors: Paul Newman, Lita Milan, John Denher, Hurt Hatfield, James Congdon, James Best, Colin Keith-Johnston, John Dierkes, Robert Anderson, Wally Brown
description: William Bonney is a cowboy with no art or part. When his friend and protector Tunstall is killed by four men, including a sheriff, for venal reasons, he hunts down the killers with a couple of associates. He liquidates two, but is injured and must escape. He will be able to eliminate the others as well, but his mad thirst for revenge isolates him. Hunted, he is killed by an old friend who became a sheriff.
notes: Film written for TV by the corrosive Gore Vidal (and adapted for cinema by Leslie Stevens) with evident psychoanalytic references. Director Arthur Penn gives some healthy shakes to the myth of Billy the Kid, directing with a style that is more lyrical than epic The figure of the gunslinger is rendered by Paul Newman with an admirable interpretation over the top, according to the canons of the Actor's Studio.

title: Futureworld
actors: Peter Fonda, Blythe Danner, Arthur Hill, Yul Brynner, John P. Ryan, Stuart Margolin, Allen Ludden, Robert Cornthwaite, Angela Greene
description: Two television reporters, Chuck and Tracy, discover that Delos, a robot-animated Disneyland, is the center of a conspiracy led by Dr. Schneider, who wants to kidnap the powerful of Earth and replace them with double automatons he controls ...
notes: Effective ecological-moralizing following of _The world of robots_ by Michael Crichton.

title: Demon Seed
actors: Julie Christie, Fritz Weaver, Gerrit Graham, Berry Kroeger, Lisa Lu, Larry J. Blake, John O'Leary, Alfred Dennis, Davis Roberts, Patricia Wilson
description: After years of work in a secret laboratory, some scientists have developed Proteus IV, a very sophisticated computer, capable of self-programming and which highlights human behavior. Proteus soon shows that he is tormented by the idea of ??procreation and Susan, the wife of the computer programmer, pays the price. Not without difficulty Proteus is deactivated, but in the meantime Susan is expecting a baby.
notes: On a subject fascinated by the myth of Beauty and the Beast, based on a novel by Dean R. Koontz, Cammell constructs a film that oscillates between pure thriller and science fiction. Charming and mysterious Julie Christie.

title: The Getaway
actors: Steve McQueen, Ali MacGraw, Ben Johnson, Al Lettieri, Sally Struthers, Slim Pickens, Richard Bright, Jack Dodson, Dub Taylor
description: A politician manages to get Doc, a hardened criminal, out of prison before he has served his entire sentence; in exchange the latter has to rob a bank for him. The blow is scored with some accomplices who, however, compete for the booty. Doc escapes to Mexico with his money and his wife, chased by his accomplice, whom he had thought dead, and by the police. However, the road is very long and the dangers are always lurking. Will the skilled Doc succeed in his intent?
notes: From a Jim Thompson novel, adapted and scripted by Walter Hill, Peckinpah directs the only detective story of his career. The director of the "Wild Bunch" transforms the escape to freedom of the robber and his beautiful and courageous wife into a contemporary western. Deadly traps, a chase to the last breath and an unpredictable ending. An opaque remake of the film was shot in 1994.

title: Ghostbusters
actors: Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Sigourney Weaver, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis, Annie Potts, William Atherton, Ernie Hudson, David Margulies, Steven Tash
description: Peter, Raymond and Egon have been kicked out of college, but their partnership against the ghosts that populate New York and cause serious ailments works wonders. It's a tough fight but our heroes fear nothing, not even the evil one.
notes: The terrifying trio of Canadians (Aykroyd and Harold Ramis as screenwriters, Ivan Reitman as director) make this wild and imaginative comedy that was an incredible commercial success. The best things are legacy of the "Saturday Night Show", with the addition of state-of-the-art special effects for the time. Priceless Bill Murray.

title: The Mountain Men
actors: Charlton Heston, Brian Keith, Stephen Nacht, Victoria Racimo, John Glover, Seymour Cassel, David Ackroyd, William Lucking
description: Bill (Heston) and Henry (Keith), two seasoned trappers, with the Ravens resist an attack by the Blackfoot led by Black Eagle, whose mistreated squaw, captured, falls in love with Bill. Black Eagle manages to take back the woman and destroy the Raven village, but the battle is not over. Nostalgic Western, beautifully set, where mature cowboys make Indian girls' hearts beat faster as "fire water" flows freely. With Heston we see Brian Keith, the excellent protagonist of Death rides a Rio Bravo (1961), the debut of Sam Peckinpah.

title: The Last Starfighter
actors: Lance Guest, Robert Preston, Dan O'Herlihy, Catherine Mary Stewart, Kay E. Kuter, Dan Mason, Barbara Bosson, Norman Snow, Chris Hebert
