description: Alex is a very good guy in video games. For this reason the extraterrestrial Centauri (Preston) takes him to his planet and proposes him to fight on the spaceships of the Star League against the fleet of Xur, a treacherous rebel. Alex refuses to stay close to Earth's affections, but Xur is now hunting him. Thus accepts the proposal of Centauri and, trained by an old and bizarre pilot, he defeats the rebels.
notes: Pleasant variation on the classic themes of the "Star Wars" vein. Effective characters built by Bob Preston and Dan O'Herlihy (the old Grig), and a series of imaginative contraptions of futuristic technology.

title: Days of Thunder
actors: Tom Cruise, Robert Duvall, Nicole Kidman, Randy Quaid, Cary Elwes, Michael Rooker, Fred Dalton Thompson, John C. Reilly, J.C. Quinn
description: Cole is a reckless young race car driver. He enters the stable of an elderly and wise mechanic who provides him with a prototype. After the first misunderstandings, the two find a great understanding. A serious accident, however, throws Cole and his rival into a coma: Cole recovers, also thanks to the love of a beautiful neurologist, and will win triumphantly. Few motor racing movies have worked - this isn't one of them. The film is based on the skirmishes between the two rival pilots first, and on the amorous ones with the Kidman, then.

title: Young Guns
actors: Emilio Estevez, Kiefer Sutherland, Charlie Sheen, Lou Diamond Phillips, Dermot Mulroney, Casey Siemaszko, Terence Stamp, Jack Palance, Terry O'Quinn, Brian Keith
description: Lincoln County. Two landowners are at war with each other, and one of the two hires six vigilantes, including a rather skilled young man with a gun who takes the lead. He is William Bonner, aka Billy (hereafter known as "the Kid"). When their boss is killed, the six will have to hurry up against coalitioned and far more armed opponents ...
notes: Christopher Cain at the time bet on the rebirth of the western, betting on the legend of Billy the Kid and on a handful of (then) young stars, mostly veterans of teen movies. Today those faces refer to very different scenarios (mostly televised) and the experiment, as we know, did not have the desired result. However, it remains a good entertainment film.

title: White Water Summer
actors: Kevin Bacon, Sean Astin, Jonathan Ward, Matt Adler, K.C. Martel, Caroline McWilliams, Charles Siebert, Joseph Passerrelli
description: A guide specialized in trips to the limit of survival takes a group of children to heart: he is convinced that facing so many difficulties is the best push to move from adolescence to maturity. So with four of them he faces a difficult crossing and behaves very hard in particular with one, the most rebellious.
notes: Lazy children's film, with many beautiful images of wild nature and with Kevin Bacon, one of the four interpreters of "Fandango".

title: The Savage
actors: Charlton Heston, Susan Morrow, Peter Hansen, Joan Taylor, Richard Rober, Don Porter, Ted De Corsia, Ian MacDonald, Milburn Stone, Angela Clarke
description: Jim, who grew up with the Sioux tribe, who had kidnapped him as a child, is adopted by the Yellow Eagle chief, who already has a daughter, Luta. When he is sent to Fort Duane, to check the soldiers' intentions, he falls in love with Tally. War breaks out, but Jim, despite the pain of Luta's death killed by Captain Vargant, averted the conflict and then returns to the fort, where Tally awaits him. A young Charlton Heston in this rather predictable western. Solemnity sometimes borders on boredom.

title: Instant Justice
actors: Michael Paré, Tawny Kitaen, Peter Crook, Charles Napier, Eddie Avoth, Scott Del Amo, Lynda Bridges, Lionel A. Ephraim, Maurice E. Aronow
description: A young marine is killed by his sister. The boy cannot bear without reacting. He then decides to leave the uniform to engage in the search for those responsible for the murder. A beautiful girl with a dubious reputation follows him in spite of himself.

title: Posse
actors: Kirk Douglas, Bruce Dern, Bo Hopkins, James Stacy, Luke Askew, David Canary, Alfonso Arau, Katherine Woodville, Mark Roberts, Beth Brickell
description: A politician (Douglas) hires adventurers to catch an outlaw (Dern). But it turns out he is almost a popular idol. Little violence and a lot of psychological tension: a surprising neo-western directed and starring Kirk Douglas.

title: Gladiator
actors: Ken Wahl, Nancy Allen, Robert Culp, Stan Shaw, Rosemary Forsyth, Bart Braverman, Brian Robbins, Rick Dees, Michael Young
description: Rick Benson now has only one thought: avenge his brother who was killed by a group of thugs. Thus, moving on a truck he personally equipped, he wanders around in ambiguous rooms along the highways. He will have his revenge, but he won't prove to be much different from the assassins he hunts. Revenge and its effects, understood as changes in men (up to the worst abjections), is one of the characteristic themes of Abel Ferrara. In this television movie, the violence is less than that of his most famous films, but the rendering is quite effective.

title: Gorillas in the Mist
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Bryan Brown, Julie Harris, Constantin Alexandrov, Iain Cuthbertson, John Omirah Miluwi, Waigwa Wachira, Iain Glen, David Lansbury
description: The strong-willed Diane Fossey, having abandoned her boyfriend, goes to Congo to research the behavior of gorillas. With great patience, he approaches and studies them, learning and imitating their language. With the help of her loyal Sembagare she is forced to fight both against the men of the Batwa tribe and against the cynical Van Vecten. Dian also fights against the hostility of local authorities. After a happy period of work and love with photographer Bob Campbell, Diane is mysteriously killed.
notes: Based on Fossey's autobiography, the film describes the life of the young scientist with intensity of feelings. The result is a scientifically more than reliable work, but perhaps precisely for this reason a bit obsessive, as obsessive as the protagonist's passion for the favorite apes appears.

title: Brimstone
actors: Rod Cameron, Walter Brennan, Lorna Gray, Forrest Tucker, Jack Holt, Jim Davis, James Brown, Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Jack Lambert, Will Wright
description: A government inspector arrives in Oklahoma to bring a criminal to justice.

title: Jubilee Trail
actors: Vera Ralston, Joan Leslie, Forrest Tucker, John Russell, Ray Middleton, Pat O'Brien, Buddy Baer, Jim Davis
description: Love, jealousy and murder in a caravan traveling from New Orleans to California. Western routine tending towards melodrama.

title: The Big Sky
actors: Kirk Douglas, Dewey Martin, Elizabeth Threatt, Arthur Hunnicutt, Steven Geray, Buddy Baer, Henri Letondal, Hank Worden, Jim Davis
description: A trapper who roams the Great North meets a young daredevil hunter and becomes his friend. The two decide to embark together with a group of French hunters who want to reach an unexplored region to be able to trade in skins without submitting to the wishes of large companies. Indians and business rivals will try to block them.
notes: Hawks' classic western with balanced action and sharp writing. The friendship between the two protagonists is so virile as to be ambiguous, even if in the end an Indian princess with cat eyes intervenes to put things back in order. Great landscapes and an epic and philological spirit at the same time. Wayne refused to play the lead role, and regretted it. A cult.

title: Big Jake
actors: John Wayne, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Hara, Patrick Wayne, Christopher Mitchum, Bobby Vinton, Bruce Cabot, Glenn Corbett, Harry Carey jr., John Doucette
description: Little Jacob McCandles is kidnapped by a gang of outlaws who have attacked his family's farm and demand a millionaire ransom. Marta, the grandmother, decides to turn to her husband Jake, from whom she has lived separated for 15 years; he is still a vigorous type, despite his age. Pretending to accept the bandits' requests, he arrives at their lair accompanied by two sons and an old Indian; in the trunk there is no money but waste paper. John Wayne is in this film (the last directed by specialist George Sherman) sick, started towards sunset and looks like a monument to himself.

title: The Big Country
actors: Gregory Peck, Charlton Heston, Jean Simmons, Carroll Baker, Burl Ives, Charles Bickford, Alfonso Bedoya, Chuck Connors, Chuck Hayward
description: The rivalry for the possession of a spring separates Colonel Terrill and the Hannassey family. Jim, boyfriend of Terrill's daughter, tries in vain to resolve the conflict peacefully: plus he feels attracted to Julie, the teacher who owns the area. Eventually Jim buys the valley and convinces the two rivals to take out each other.
notes: Monumental Western (over two and a half hours) and pacifist by Wyler. Almost a mythical struggle between two giants so that the "big country" can pass from prehistory to history. At the time it was read as an anti-cold war film between the US and the USSR.

title: Rampage
actors: Robert Mitchum, Elsa Martinelli, Jack Hawkins, Sabu, Cely Carillo, Emile Genest, Stefan Schnabel, David Cadiente, Sylva Koscina
description: On behalf of a German zoo, Harry captures the "Enchantress" in Malaysia, a strange and very rare hybrid between the tiger and the leopard. After taking her to Germany, Abbott, a rival hunter, frustrated by Harry's superiority even in sentimental matters, releases the beast out of jealousy. A new beat is therefore necessary, this time between the roofs and the houses. Abbott falls victim to his own machinations as Harry saves his homeland once again.
notes: Scarce emotions, a mixture of genres and settings, in a film directed by a prince of B series films, also very active on television.

title: Cheyenne Autumn
actors: Richard Widmark, Carroll Baker, Karl Malden, James Stewart, Sal Mineo, Dolores Del Rio, Ricardo Montalban, Gilbert Roland, Arthur Kennedy, Edward G. Robinson
description: The Cheyenne are no longer able to survive in the wastelands and unhealthy lands where they have been confined. They then begin a march of over two thousand kilometers to return to the land of the ancestors. Decimated by hunger and fatigue, they are joined by Captain Thomas Archer and his soldiers. A difficult negotiation begins ...
notes: The western testament of the great Ford is a much more sincere and innovative "political" film than others that in the following years they wanted to pass in favor of the Indians. After the claustrophobic interlude of "The Man Who Killed Liberty Valance", the latest concession of Ford's unmistakable gaze towards the great spaces of American nature.

title: Gremlins
actors: Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton, Don Steele, Susan Burgess, Frances Lee McCain, Polly Holliday, Judge Reinhold, Scott Brady, Corey Feldman, Keye Luke
description: An original gift? Here is a Mogwai, a cute little animal that peeps out of a cage in the back room of a Chinese junk dealer. But be careful: he suffers from the light, he must not come into contact with water and, above all, he must not eat after midnight. The new owners, little boys, make everything wrong and from the wet down of the Mogwai splash fierce Gremlins, pestiferous creatures that quickly multiply excessively, put the city to fire and sword and terrorize all the inhabitants. A little boy, with the help of the "good" Mogway, tries to deal with the "enemies".
notes: The Amblin production, or the award-winning company Spielberg & C., has struck again. Joe Dante directs a hilarious bloodless horror, a ferocious Christmas fairy tale for naughty children, full of rhythm and cinephile winks.

title: True Grit
actors: John Wayne, Glen Campbell, Kim Darby, Dennis Hopper, Jeremy Slate, Robert Duvall, Alfred Ryder, Strother Martin, Jeff Corey, Ron Soble
description: Mattie Ross, a young ranch owner who was orphaned after her father's murder, teams up with an elderly sheriff, called "El Grinta", to avenge him. The two are joined by the young government agent La Boeuf. Reached the bandits, a firefight breaks out in which La Boeuf is killed, while the girl, bitten by a snake, is brought to safety by the "Grinta".
notes: The twilight of the western genre could only be represented by the "archaic" figure of Wayne. Eyepatch, whiskey and gun always ready, abrupt ways, but heart of gold to say goodbye to an epic genre. For this role alone, the Duke won the Oscar.

title: Star Wars
actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing, Alec Guinness, Anthony Daniels, Kenny Baker, Peter Mayhew, David Prowse, Phil Brown, Shelagh Fraser, Jack Purvis
description: The despotic Lord Darth Vader has waged war on a galactic empire. Princess Leia Organa, representative of the rebels, is his prisoner but she has managed to steal the plans of the Death Star, Lord Vader's space base that can disintegrate an entire planet. Elder General Obi-Wan Kenobi and young Luke Skywalker free Princess Leia and then lead the attack on the Death Star. An adventure that skillfully mixes the flavors of the western, myths of chivalry and horror. Large means, a lot of imagination and technological prodigies for a realization that has left a mark in American cinema, reworking myths and fantasies from the inside, and paving the way for the cinema of the following decades, Oscar for the soundtrack (very famous, by John Williams) , the scenography, the costumes, the editing, the sound and of course the special effects. A new restored edition with new sequences was released in 1997. Followed by "The Empire Strikes Back" (1980) and "Return of the Jedi" (1983), produced by Lucas and directed by Irvin Kershner and Richard Marquand respectively. In 1999 "Star Wars - The Phantom Menace" finally arrived, the first episode of a trilogy that tells the preamble to "Star Wars".

title: The Warriors
actors: Michael Beck, James Remar, Thomas Waites, Deborah Van Valkenburgh, Dorsey Wright, Brian Tyler, David Harris, Tom McKitterick, Marcelino Sánchez, Roger Hill, David Patrick Kelly
description: During the meeting called to bring peace between the New York gangs, Cyrus, the organizer of the meeting, is killed. The Warriors are accused of the murder, and for them the return home will be bloody and full of ambushes. At dawn, having reached the beach of Coney Island, the Warriors will have to face the final challenge ...
notes: A sort of metropolitan western with exorbitant doses of music and violence. The opening sequence is extraordinary, the clash with the female gang is like an anthology, the one with the baseball bats is heart-stopping. Inspired by Xenophon's Anabasis, it has generated a real apocalyptic-metropolitan vein.

title: Yellowstone Kelly
actors: Clint Walker, Edd Byrnes, John Russell, Ray Danton, Andra Martin, Claude Akins, Rhodes Reason, Gary Vinson
description: Yellostowne Kelly, an Indian-friendly white hunter has fallen in love with a squaw whose life he saved. The girl is also courted by the chieftain and his nephew, but she does not reciprocate either of them. Furthermore, an official fanatic insists on trespassing into Indian territory: two different rivalries that lead the Indians to open confrontation. After ups and downs, the squaw wants to return to her village, but Kelly has promised her father, the chieftain, to protect her.
notes: "Progressive" Western with good and bad Indians. But the hero is still a white man. Not Gordon Douglas' best result in the western.

title: Gunga Din
actors: Cary Grant, Victor McLaglen, Douglas Fairbanks jr., Sam Jaffe, Joan Fontaine, Eduardo Ciannelli, Montagu Love, Robert Coote, Abner Biberman
description: In India, at the time of the Tughs uprising, three British officers are sent on a mission along with their water carrier named Gunga Din. During the mission all three are captured and tortured. Gunga Din saves the situation by warning the rest of the army with the trumpet.
notes: Loosely inspired by Kipling, the film mixes adventure, heroism and comedy well.

title: Hansel and Gretel
actors: Cloris Leachman, Hugh Pollard, Nicola Stapleton, Emily Richard, David Warner, Susie Miller, Eugene Kline, Warren Feigin, Lutuf Nouasser
description: The famous tale of the Brothers Grimm in a version that adds a pinch of horror and suspense to the story.

title: Trouble Bound
actors: Patricia Arquette, Michael Madsen, Seymour Cassel, Billy Bob Thornton, Sal Jenco, Darren Epton, Gregory Sporleder, Paul Ben-Victor, Rustam Branaman
description: Harry thinks he has the wind behind him. After winning $ 5,000 at the game and a dream car, he sets off for Las Vegas so as not to miss the fleeting moment when luck seems to be on his side. He gives a ride to the beautiful Kit. What Harry doesn't know is that the girl has to do with the mafia and that in the hood of the car there is a burning corpse ...

title: Hatari!
actors: John Wayne, Elsa Martinelli, Gérard Blain, Hardy Krüger, Red Buttons, Bruce Cabot, Michèle Girardon, Valentin de Vargas, Eduard Franz
description: In Tanganyika, at Brenda's farm, a group of hunters embark on a safari. Together with them also a lovely Italian photojournalist, Anna. The capture of the animals will serve to supply the best zoos in the world. The two women become the protagonists of sentimental skirmishes. In the end, between one hunt and another, the respective loves will come to the right conclusion.
notes: The great Howard Hawks ("Susanna", "A Dollar of Honor") grappling with a wide-ranging adventure in which he can best combine dramatic tones and comedy. Hunting scenes almost all shot from life.

title: Starcrossed
actors: James Spader, Belinda Bauer, Peter Kowanko, Clark Johnson, Jacqueline Brookes, Ed Groenenberg, Roland Groenenberg, Chuck Shamata, James Kidnie
description: Joey suddenly sees an alien presence arriving: the appearance is human, moreover feminine and ironically she looks so much like her once wife. To the latter are soon added some dangerous killers from the other world who want to kill the woman, but ...
notes: The tone is a bit fairytale, hardened just by a slightly intrusive musical commentary and a video clip director style. James Spader, who became famous for the role of the frustrated blond in _Sex, lies and videotapes_, always looks a bit astonished, and is more comfortable with slightly perverse or over the top characters (like that of _Secretary_) .

title: Hud
actors: Paul Newman, Melvyn Douglas, Patricia Neal, Brandon de Wilde, Whit Bissell, Crahan Denton, John Ashley, Val Avery, George Petrie
description: Homer's large ranch, a proud, traditionalist old cattle farmer, is home to his 30-year-old son Hud, a rebellious boy, and his sensitive and idealistic grandson Lon. But when a serious illness strikes the herds and Homer is forced to have the cattle culled, Hud takes command of the ranch and attempts to have his father interdicted. One evening, Hud and Lon see the body of a man on the ground, when they get close they discover that it is Homer.
notes: The film is only a correct vehicle that Ritt hands with the highest professionalism to an extraordinary Paul Newman. The film earned three Oscars: for Patricia Neal, as a leading actress, for Melvyn Douglas, a supporting actor, and for photography by James Wong Howe.

title: The Light Touch
actors: Stewart Granger, George Sanders, Anna Maria Pierangeli, Kurt Kasznar, Joseph Calleia, Larry Keating, Rhys Williams, Norman Lloyd, Mike Mazurki
description: A thief of works of art meets a young Italian painter and repents. The slow pace makes the film slide towards the sentimental vein and the tension of the story appears too centered on the dialogues.

title: Empire Strikes Back
actors: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams, Anthony Daniels, David Prowse, Peter Mayhew, Kenny Baker, Frank Oz, Alec Guinness
description: Although the Death Star was destroyed, the imperial troops took over Yavin again. The rebels have taken refuge on the ice planet, but are still forced to flee. Han Solo leaves the pursuers, while Luke travels to the planet of Dogabah to find the "Force". In an attempt to free Leila and friends, she later meets Darth Vader, who turns out to be her father.
notes: Second episode (but in reality it is the fifth) of the saga of "Star Wars", with several allusions to the famous narrative cycle of the Breton knights: the parallel between Luke in search of "strength" and Parsifal is quite evident.

title: Hang 'em High
actors: Clint Eastwood, Inger Stevens, Ed Begley, Pat Hingle, Ben Johnson, Bruce Dern, Charles McGraw, Ruth White, Alan Hale jr., Arlene Golonka, Dennis Hopper
description: Jed Cooper accidentally bought stolen cattle. He is sentenced to hang, without the possibility of clearing himself. In extremis he is saved by Judge Fenton who offers him to return to his service. Cooper agrees for the sole purpose of revenge.
notes: After reaching stardom in Europe thanks to Sergio Leone, Eastwood returns to Hollywood, where he makes his star debut in this western by Ted Post. The avenger who "comes back from the dead" to do justice will remain one of his favorite characters.

title: The Running Man
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Conchita Alonso, Yaphet Kotto, Jim Brown, Jesse Ventura, Erland van Lidth, Marvin J. McIntyre, Gus Rethwisch
description: Los Angeles, 2019. The TV game of the year is called "The Running Man". The producer of the program, Killian, is willing to do any brutality in order to increase the audience. The rule of the game is simple: in a confined area a man must be able to survive the attacks of four deadly champions. Normally he fails, but this time the contestant is called Ben Richards (Arnold Schwarzenegger), one who is unwilling to be a sacrificial victim. Helped by two teammates and a fourth competitor, Amber (Maria Conchita Alonso), Ben manages to eliminate his fearsome opponents.

title: The Tall Men
actors: Clark Gable, Jane Russell, Robert Ryan, Cameron Mitchell, Juan García, Harry Shannon, Emile Meyer, Steve Darrell
description: After the end of the Civil War, two brothers are hired by an aggressive and ambitious landowner to bring his herd, four thousand head of cattle, from Texas to Montana, through Indian-infested territories. The road is long and there are many contrasts, sharpened by the fact that the older brother, Ben, badly tolerates the bullying of the breeder. Moreover, the three also compete for the love of a woman, who left with a group of pioneers hit by a terrible hurricane and rescued by the protagonists.
notes: A western with an epic breath, directed by a master of the genre, with a disenchanted Gable, a grinning and sneaky Ryan, a prosperous Russell object of desire.

title: Fast Getaway
actors: Corey Haim, Leo Rossi, Cynthia Rothrock, Ken Lerner, Marcia Strassman, Shelli Lether, Tabitha Thompson, Jack North, Kim Peach, Jeff Olson, Richard Jewkes
description: Nelson, his father Sam, Lily and Tony form a band of itinerant robbers who split in two due to internal rivalries. Nelson and Sam end up in the hands of the police. At this point Nelson's real mother, Lorraine, appears and claims the protection of her son. He has never met her, and she passes herself off as an old friend of Sam's. Nelson then lets his father escape from prison and the two manage to reunite.
notes: The debutante Spiro Razatos entertains us with an unpretentious film, which brings together the two aspects of action and family comedy, flavoring everything with moments of violence-like and erotic allusions.

title: Three for the Road
actors: Charlie Sheen, Kerri Green, Alan Ruck, Sally Kellerman, Blair Tefkin, Raymond J. Barry, Alexa Hamilton, Bert Remsen, James Avery
description: Paul is a bag holder for Senator Kitteredge; he entrusts him with his rebellious daughter Robin, to be taken to a reform school in the South because, free, she is a constant danger to his career. The journey turns into an odyssey, complicated by continuous misadventures. Comedy without great interest, despite the actors.

title: Lucky Lady
actors: Gene Hackman, Liza Minnelli, Burt Reynolds, Geoffrey Lewis, John Hillerman, Robby Benson, Michael Hordern, Anthony Holland, John McLiam, Val Avery
description: We are in Mexico, early thirties. Adventurers Claire, Walker and Kibby team up to smuggle five hundred cases of whiskey aboard the "Lucky Lady" to the US. The enterprise succeeds and the trio decides to persevere. But they soon find themselves annoying a real smuggling boss, who reacts brutally.
notes: Comedy and adventure intertwine in this film which, while not appearing among Stanley Donen's best performances, still offers two hours of entertainment and twists according to the classic Hollywood recipe. The three protagonists are really good.

title: The Rounders
actors: Henry Fonda, Glenn Ford, Sue Ann Langdon, Chill Wills, Hope Holiday, Edgar Buchanan, Kathleen Freeman, Joan Freeman, Denver Pyle
description: Two cowboys, specialized in capturing wild horses, come to grips with a roan that is absolutely rebellious to the saddle, but which nevertheless does not stop following them. The two decide to exploit the situation: they enroll the animal in a rodeo then bet on him and win a good sum. The horse, however, causes so much trouble that the money is barely enough to pay off the damage.
notes: Between western and comedy, a film directed without great panache but with a couple of splendid old actors.

title: The Unforgiven
actors: Burt Lancaster, Audrey Hepburn, Lillian Gish, Audie Murphy, Doug McClure, John Saxon, Charles Bickford, Albert Salmi, Joseph Wiseman, June Walker
description: An old man, who has returned to the city after years, begins to spread the rumor that Rachel, daughter of Matelda Zachary, is, in fact, an Indian kidnapped while still a child from her tribe. Matelda denies it, but the city is in turmoil and so are the Indians, who attack the Zachary ranch to recover the girl.
notes: Racial hatred, family conflicts, virtual incest avoided at the last minute: a lot of meat in the fire in this dark western signed by Huston. The film is not one of the most loved by the director, who considered it a bit too conventional. In reality, although all the mechanisms of the western are respected, the film is one of the most anomalous and visionary of the time.

title: The Towering Inferno
actors: Steve McQueen, Paul Newman, Faye Dunaway, William Holden, Robert Vaughn, Fred Astaire, Susan Blakely, Richard Chamberlain, Jennifer Jones, O.J. Simpson, Robert Wagner, Susan Flannery
description: A skyscraper was built in San Francisco: a 138-story high crystal tower. The inauguration party takes place in the panoramic hall, on the top floor of the building, but a short circuit, which occurred due to the savings made by the manufacturer on the materials used, unleashes a real hell.
notes: The film was a milestone in the catastrophic genre, which has recently returned to fashion. Cast with all stars, very big productive commitment, effects, for the time, highly spectacular, breathtaking suspense are the ingredients of a show, perhaps taken for granted, but still compelling today.

title: Invaders From Mars
actors: Karen Black, Hunter Carson, Timothy Bottoms, Laraine Newman, James Karen, Bud Cort, Louise Fletcher, Eric Pierpoint, Christopher Allport
description: An eight-year-old boy, David, is the first to notice that a Martian spaceship has landed near his home. Extraterrestrials begin to take over the minds of everyone they meet, including David's parents and his teacher. The intervention of the army will be decisive. But then David wakes up: it was all a dream. Reworking of a classic 1950s science fiction ("The Space Invaders" by William Cameron Menzies, 1953), when space invaders were seen as villains as opposed to peaceful terrestrials. In this version there are many special effects, and the sure hand of Tobe Hooper considered one of the most important directors of the new horror.

title: Unconquered
actors: Gary Cooper, Paulette Goddard, Boris Karloff, Howard Da Silva, Cecil Kellaway, Ward Bond, Virginia Campbell, Katherine DeMille, Henry Wilcoxon, C. Aubrey Smith
description: The quarrel between two officers in America in 1764: Holden is the good, while Gart is a traitor. Among them Aby, an English girl sentenced to death for helping her rebellious brother, who agrees to be sold to the New World as a slave. She regains and loses her freedom several times before being captured by the Indians: Holden frees her definitively, but then she has to face the attack of the Indians at Fort Pitt ...
notes: De Mille's adventure movie, almost funny in its naivety. All reconstructed in the studio, all over the top, often beyond the threshold of kitsch but with an undeniable sense of entertainment.

title: Lawman
actors: Burt Lancaster, Robert Ryan, Lee J. Cobb, Robert Duvall, Sheree North, Albert Salmi, Richard Jordan, John McGiver, Ralph Waite
description: In the town of Bannoch, a group of drunken herdsmen go wild and, in the chaos, the dead man escapes. Sheriff Jarold Maddox, however, is one who does not compromise: he intends to identify and punish the culprit, at any cost. His obstinacy clashes with the attempts at accommodation proposed by the landowner for whom the cowboys work.
notes: Michael Winner shouldn't be asked for great directorial subtleties. Here too he points to the point: the spectacular use of violence is effective (the lesson of the spaghetti western is not far off). In addition, he has a very respectable cast at his disposal.

title: Valdez Is Coming
actors: Burt Lancaster, Frank Silvera, Susan Clark, Richard Jordan, Jon Cypher, Barton Heyman, Hector Elizondo, Phil Brown, Ralph Brown
description: Deputy Valdez kills Johnson, a black man hunted by breeder Frank Tenner's men, in self-defense. He then goes to the latter to ask him for a hundred dollars to pay to the widow of the dead man. In response, he is attacked and tortured. Leaving, however, he kidnaps Tenner's lover and hides in the mountains. Tenner unleashes his gang behind him, but Valdez, with cunning and courage, annihilates it. Direct confrontation is inevitable at this point.
notes: Unusually violent and stylistically over the top Western. A variation that perhaps wanted to be modern and that instead makes us regret the classics.

title: Mysterious Island
actors: Michael Craig, Joan Greenwood, Michael Callan, Gary Merrill, Herbert Lom, Beth Rogan, Percy Herbert, Dan Jackson
description: A group of Southern soldiers, imprisoned after the end of the conflict, manages to escape. In their escape they end up on an islet not marked on the maps, where they are attacked by strange animals. Two women live on the island and the fugitives sympathize with them by agreeing to take them away from that inhospitable place. While they are fleeing they are attacked by pirates, but a mysterious explosion destroys the attackers' ship. Now safe, the group will know that the decisive intervention was the work of Captain Nemo's submarine. Jules Verne adapted at low cost by a director known for his committed films is always fascinating. Delightful Effects by Ray Harryhausen. Old-time fantasy.

title: Ivanhoe
actors: Robert Taylor, Elizabeth Taylor, Joan Fontaine, George Sanders, Emlyn Williams, Robert Douglas, Finlay Currie, Felix Aylmer, Francis De Wolff, Norman Wooland, Basil Sydney
description: The Saxon knight Ivanhoe wants to free the King of England Richard the Lionheart, a prisoner in Austria, whose throne was usurped by Prince John. At the Ashbi tournament the knight wins against four Normans, but is wounded and goes to be treated by Rebecca, the daughter of the rich Isaac. Giovanni does not take it well and at that point he decides to make a scorched earth around the knight by imprisoning Ivanhoe's father, girlfriend Rowena, Rebecca and Rebecca's father.
notes: Spectacular cocktail of sieges, chivalrous clashes, intrigues and amorous passions drawn with a casual hand from the classic novel by Walter Scott.

title: The Body Snatcher
actors: Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Henry Daniell, Russell Wade, Rita Corday, Edith Atwater, Sharyn Moffett, Donna Lee
description: MacFarlane, a scientist, conducts studies in the field of pathological anatomy and is always in need of fresh cadavers. A grim driver finds them for him, who first goes to take them directly from the tomb, then decides to find them even fresher by killing people, and finally blackmails the professor, with tragic consequences.
notes: From an episode that really happened in Victorian England, told by Robert Louis Stevenson in one of his stories, Wise draws inspiration for one of his most beautiful films, which has become a horror classic over the years. Produced and written by Val Lewton.

title: Jesse James
actors: Tyrone Power, Henry Fonda, Randolph Scott, John Carradine, Nancy Kelly, Henry Hull, Slim Summerville, J. Edward Bromberg, Brian Donlevy
description: In the West, railroad agents often use violence to expropriate the land over which the railway will pass. The brothers Jesse and Frank James avenge their mother killed in one of these raids and, as farmers, they become outlaws. To survive they are therefore forced to commit other crimes, but, although they are now hunted by sheriffs and bounty killers, they are supported by the sympathy of the population who see them almost as Robin Hoods.
notes: George Barnes' stunning photography, some unforgettable spectacular scenes, and the effectiveness of the performers launched a cinematic legend, a monument to King's Hollywood classicism.

title: Joe Kidd
actors: Clint Eastwood, Robert Duvall, John Saxon, Don Stroud, Stella Garcia, James Wainwright, Paul Koslo, Gregory Walcott, Dick Van Patten
description: Joe Kidd is one of the many rancheros who live in an area of ??New Mexico where the natives were expropriated by a group of whites who, to achieve this, destroyed the archive where all the documents relating to the properties were kept with a fire. . The clash between the two communities comes to a head: on the one hand, the Mexicans are led by Luis Chama, on the other, the gringos have their leader in Mr. Harlan.
notes: Eastwood has been back in the US for four years, after finding stardom with Leone's westerns. He has already made his debut as a director, played the first film in the Callaghan series and founded his own production company, the Malpaso Company: "Joe Kidd" is precisely a Malpaso production.

title: Kangaroo
actors: Peter Lawford, Maureen O'Hara, Finlay Currie, Richard Boone, Chips Rafferty, Letty Craydon, Charles 'Bud' Tingwell
description: Richard Connor is an adventurer who works in tandem with an accomplice. The two become friends with an elderly landowner, tormented by the remorse of having abandoned his son years ago. Richard makes him believe that he is indeed the lost son, but then falls in love with the old man's (real) daughter. The intervention of a policeman who recognizes the two outlaws causes the clash from which Richard comes out alive and redeemed in order to love the girl.
notes: A sort of western filmed by Milestone in Australia, a circumstance that allows the eclectic director to suggest evocative exteriors and the staging of a nice duel with the whip.

title: The Karate Kid III
actors: Pat Morita, Ralph Macchio, Thomas Ian Griffith, Robyn Lively, Martin Kove, Jonathan Avildsen, Sean Kanan, William Christopher Ford, Pat E. Johnson
description: Champion Daniel LaRusso is challenged by Mike Barnes. He was hired by the billionaire Silver to avenge Kreese's defeat by Daniel himself. Master Miyagi does not want to train Daniel, because the match, despite all rules, will be "full contact". Of course Miyagi will change his mind and Daniel will arrive perfectly prepared for the appointment.
notes: Some new characters are introduced and the driving force of the bloody battle is added, but everything is then cooked according to the usual recipe. Each step is predictable, the acting banal, the "morality" taken for granted.

title: Kid Rodelo
actors: Don Murray, Janet Leigh, Broderick Crawford, Richard Carlson, José Nieto, Miguel Del Castillo, José Villasante, Julio Peña, Mike Brendel
description: Kid Rodelo, released from prison, goes to the abandoned town of Sheridan to search for $ 50,000 in gold that has been hidden there. But three fugitives and two adventurers accompanied by a woman also want the treasure. Prestigious interpreters in a film with an unlikely story, but narrated with discreet strength.

title: Kim
actors: Errol Flynn, Dean Stockwell, Paul Lukas, Robert Douglas, Thomas Gomez, Cecil Kellaway, Arnold Moss, Reginald Owen, Laurette Luez, Richard Hale
description: Abandoned by his English parents and raised as a Hindu by an old Lama, young Kim unconvinced enters the military college reserved for orphans and then becomes a British counterintelligence agent. Replaced by another agent who died on a mission, Kim successfully opposes the attempt by some Russian spies to stir up riots in the Himalayan region.
notes: From the famous novel by Kipling, the English Victor Saville has drawn a film in all respects Hollywood, in terms of production, cast and respect for the rules of the great show. Perfect Errol Flynn.

title: Kim
actors: Peter O'Toole, Bryan Brown, Ravi Sheth, John Rhys-Davies, John Glover, Lee Montague, Alfred Burke, Mick Ford, Bill Leadbitter
description: An English boy, raised on the streets of Bombay, is recruited by the British secret service. Beautiful version of Kipling's novel already brought to the screen by Saville in 1951. Don't miss Peter O'Toole as the bald monk.

title: King Kong
directors: Merian C. Cooper, Ernest B. Schoedsack
actors: Fay Wray, Robert Armstrong, Bruce Cabot, Frank Reicher, Sam Hardy, Noble Johnson, Steve Clemente, James Flavin
description: A film producer reaches an unknown island where the natives worship a giant ape. With him there is also a girl who the natives kidnap and offer to the animal. Contrary to usual, he does not kill the woman, but takes her to his hiding place and defends her from other giant animals. The white men, however, imprison the ape and transport him to New Yor to exhibit him for a fee, but here, when King Kong sees the girl again ...
notes: Lightning and ephemeral glory for the female protagonist Fay Wray and shocking special effects for the time. It is always a film to be reviewed.

title: King Kong
actors: Jeff Bridges, Jessica Lange, Charles Grodin, John Randolph, Julius Harris, René Auberjonois, Jack O'Halloran, Dennis Fimple, Ed Lauter, Jorge Moreno
description: An expedition goes to an unknown island to look for oil. The explorers are joined by a young paleontologist and Dwan, an actress rescued from a shipwreck. The island is inhabited. The natives kidnap Dwan and offer her to their deity: a huge gorilla. The men from the expedition free Dwan and capture Kong. Back in New York, they exhibit the ape but he escapes with the girl looking for an unlikely safety on the World Trade Center towers.
notes: Useless as expensive remake of the 1933 film of the same name.

title: King Kong Lives
actors: Brian Kerwin, Linda Hamilton, John Ashton, Peter Michael Goetz, Frank Maraden, Jimmie Ray Weeks, Debbie McLeod
description: Shot down by the American Air Force in the previous 1976 film, King Kong is saved by a group of scientists who graft him a huge plastic heart. The operation is also successful thanks to the blood donated by a female of her own species. Having fled to the mountains for fear of being divided, the two animals are hunted down: the army kills Kong, but the female and the baby born of their union are saved. The poetry and the mythical atmosphere of the first 1933 film have completely disappeared, only the plastic of the special effects of Carlo Rambaldi remains.

title: The Thief of Bagdad
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Julanne Johnston, Snitz Edwards, Anna May Wong, Charles Belcher, Sôjin Kamiyama, Brandon Hurst, Tote Du Crow, Noble Johnson
description: The thief Ahmed (Fairbanks) searches for a gold chest to steal, but he just has to glimpse the Princess to fall madly in love with her and think of nothing else. He manages to be received at court, his love is reciprocated, but here come the Mongols, who establish a ferocious dictatorship. The thief-patriot will resist the lure of a stupendous "enemy" slave and free Baghdad. The happy meeting between Walsh and the star Fairbanks (who wrote the film under a pseudonym) generated a resounding success. Amazing, for the time, the special effects and the accuracy of the sets. Mine of find and prototype of all oriental adventure films to come. Set design by William Cameron Menzies and costumes by Mitchell Leisen.

title: Ladyhawke
actors: Matthew Broderick, Michelle Pfeiffer, Rutger Hauer, Leo McKern, Ken Hutchison, Alfred Molina, John Wood, Giancarlo Prete, Loris Loddi, Alessandro Serra, Charles Borromel, Massimo Sarchielli, Nicolina Papetti
description: In France, in the 13th century, an evil feudal bishop fell in love with Isabella of Anjou. But the beauty's heart belongs to the head of the guard Etienne. The bishop casts a curse on the two poor people: he is condemned to wander at night in the form of a wolf, she to transform into a hawk during the day. The two lovers are therefore destined not to meet again in human guise. Then Etienne meets the petty thief Philippe who, with the help of the monk-magician Imperius, first saves the life of the hawk, then the wolf.
notes: A discreet product of its kind, thanks to the careful reconstruction of the historical environment and the common thread of the love story. The pop soundtrack is a bit silly, Storaro's photography is splendid (the film is shot in the Abruzzo National Park).

title: The Blue Lagoon
actors: Brooke Shields, Christopher Atkins, Leo McKern, William Daniels, Elva Josephson, Glenn Kohan, Alan Hopgood, Gus Mercurio, Jeffrey Kleiser
description: The Northumberland sailing ship is shipwrecked in the open ocean. Three are saved: the ship's cook, Paddy Burton, and two teenagers: Emmeline and Richard. Paddy acts as a father to them, teaching them to survive, and then he dies. Meanwhile, the two boys have grown up, discovered love and discovered how children are born. Sooner or later help arrives.
notes: An archaic-idyllic tale that has touched the hearts of many spectators, slipping into a very cloying form of soft eroticism. Shields was already famous at the time for playing an underage prostitute in Malle's "Pretty Baby". Enchanting landscapes, photograph by Nestor Almendros.

title: Oh, Susanna!
actors: Rod Cameron, Lorna Gray, Forrest Tucker, Chill Wills, William Ching, Jim Davis, Wally Cassell, Jimmy Lydon, Douglas Kennedy
description: "Hawks" and "doves" compared in the handful of soldiers guarding a fort bordering Sioux territories. There is also a strong love rivalry between an officer and his subordinate.

title: The Sheepman
actors: Glenn Ford, Shirley MacLaine, Leslie Nielsen, Mickey Shaughnessy, Edgar Buchanan, Willis Bouchey, Pernell Roberts, Slim Pickens, Robert 'Buzz' Henry
description: In a small village in the Far West, the big owners of cattle dominate, with Colonel Bedford as their leader. Jason arrives, a stubborn sheep farmer with an infallible gun. The man first refuses the offers that are made to him to leave the region; then he responds to threats and ambushes by putting his hand to his gun.
notes: Marshall renews the western from the inside, opening up spaces for humor and comedy. MacLaine is very young and already very good.

title: The Jungle Book
actors: Sabu, Joseph Calleia, John Qualen, Rosemary DeCamp, Frank Puglia, Patricia O'Rourke, Ralph Byrd, John Mather, Faith Brook
description: Mowgli, in the course of the Shere Kan tiger hunt, finds a lost temple in the jungle and a fabulous treasure. Buldeo, a village chief, steals one of the precious stones, but is forced to abandon it to avoid the curse.
notes: Fascinating film, loosely based on Kipling's book; phantasmagoric colors, grandiose scenographies and a famous score by Miklos Rozsa contribute to an enchanting illustration, signed by a great specialist in exotic cinema. The protagonist is the young Sabu, discovered by Robert Flaherty in the "Dance of the elephants" (1937).

title: Lionheart
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Deborah Rennard, Harrison Page, Lisa Pelikan, Brian Thompson, Ashley Johnson, Voyo Goric
description: Enlisted in the Foreign Legion, Lyon defects and flies to Los Angeles to rescue his brother in trouble with some drug traffickers, but finds him dead. While his sister-in-law and granddaughter hold him responsible for what happened, the defector fights against a cheat in the world of kickboxing and against two bad guys from the Legion who want to bring him back at any cost.
notes: The lack of originality of the story is redeemed by the fast pace of the action and by the use of some beautiful fight scenes. Belgian Van Damme (now adopted by Hollywood) will again be a legionnaire in Peter MacDonald's "The Legionary".

title: River of No Return
actors: Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe, Rory Calhoun, Tommy Rettig, Murvyn Vye, Douglas Spencer
description: Matt Carter, a farmer who lives alone with his son Mark, saves a man and a woman from the river. The first takes his horse and gun, to go to the city to register the ownership of a mine won at the game. The woman, May, (Monroe) stays with Matt instead. Escaped from an Indian attack, the three manage to reach the city, where they find the adventurer. The showdown is resolved by Mark. May will stay with Matt and the baby forever.
notes: Marilyn finds here one of the most complex and suffered characters of her career. Adventurous Western, the film communicates an ideal push to the "resurrection", also symbolized by the memorable journey on the river.

title: Along Came Jones
actors: Gary Cooper, Loretta Young, William Demarest, Dan Duryea, Frank Sully, Don Costello, Walter Sande, Russell Simpson, Arthur Loft, Willard Robertson, Ray Teal
description: Melody travels to Texas with a friend, looking for work. Arriving in a small town he is mistaken for the bandit Mount Jarrad, whom he looks a lot like. To escape the hunt of the many citizens who would like to kill him, he accepts the hospitality of Cherry who hides him in her house. The girl is hosting the real Jarrad with whom she is madly in love. A violent fight breaks out between the two men, during which Cherry saves Melody's life by beating Jarrad to death.
notes: A mediocre production for a "star" at the height of his parable: the film is of little strength, despite the ironic touches of the screenplay by Nunnally Johnson. Gary Cooper has fun.

title: Lone Wolf McQuade
actors: Chuck Norris, David Carradine, Barbara Carrera, Leon Isaac Kennedy, Robert Beltran, L.Q. Jones, Dana Kimmell, R.G. Armstrong, Jorge Cervera Jr., Sharon Farrell
description: Wilkes traffics in arms without the knowledge of his boss, Falco. McQuade is a Texas ranger, embroiled in this traffic, blackmailed and guarded by Wilkes through the beautiful Lola. The ranger, however, finds the strength to react and, with the help of an FBI agent and a friend of his, engages in a fight to the death with Wilkes, during which Lola also dies, in the meantime falling in love with him for real.
notes: Paroxysmal violence in the great spaces of Texas. Steve Carver comes out of Roger Corman's award-winning school, where he cut his teeth with gangster-movies and pseudo-mythological films, and the film has the pace and unpretentiousness of a healthy action-movie.

title: Damien: Omen II
actors: William Holden, Lee Grant, Jonathan Scott-Taylor, Robert Foxworth, Nicholas Pryor, Lew Ayres, Sylvia Sidney, Lance Henriksen, Elizabeth Shepherd, Lucas Donat
description: Damien, a seven-year-old boy, is growing up in Uncle Richard's home after his parents die. With his cousin Mark he is sent to attend a military college, where he does honor. But, anyone who realizes his true identity as a son of Satan faces a bad end. Back home, he grants his support to the family food company which is preparing to ride the wave of a sudden universal shortage.
notes: Taylor goes to great lengths to give us an acceptable product. The rest are banalities. The idea that ended the first episode, "The Omen", got lost along the way.

title: Gun Belt
actors: George Montgomery, Tab Hunter, Helen Westcott, John Delmer, William Bishop, Jack Elam, Douglas Kennedy, James Millican, Hugh Sanders
description: Billy Ringo, the bravest of Tombstone's riflemen, decides to hang up his rifle and lead a normal life. The cowboy has met a young milliner and is looking forward to starting a new life. To his misfortune, his brother Matt is not of the same idea as he organizes a bank heist and tries to involve Billy as well. Matt ends up killed and the blame seems to fall on his brother who can barely escape the lynching of the crowd.
notes: A beautiful photograph and a decent script put this western a step above the routine. Chases and shootings are wasted.

title: Maniac Cop 2
actors: Robert Davi, Claudia Christian, Michael Lerner, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Robert Z'Dar, Clarence Williams III, Leo Rossi, Lou Bonacki, Paula Trickey, Charles Napier
description: Matt Cordell, a murdered police officer in Sing Sing where he was locked up after a rigged trial by the police chief himself, has risen and sows death in the city. Susan Riley, a cop-psychologist, doesn't believe it: worse for her. Teaming up with Turkey, a serial killer, Matt takes her hostage. But as he pursues his revenge plan, Matt ends up colliding with Turkey ... From a bold B movie specialist, a curious detective horror. Screenplay and direction are not looking for psychological subtleties, but aim directly at the pressing action and the most blatant spectacular effects.

title: Maniac Cop
actors: Robert Z'Dar, Tom Atkins, Bruce Campbell, Laurene Landon, Richard Roundtree, William Smith, Sheree North, Nina Arvesen, Nick Barbaro, Lou Bonacki
description: Protected by a police uniform, a strongman kills the unfortunates he meets on his way. Circumstances lead to the accusation of a department agent, hastily jailed to appease public anger. The man is slaughtered by the inmates and returns from the afterlife as a zombie to bring death and destruction.
notes: Lustig, author of the beautiful "Maniac", gives us a concentrate of blood emotions by mixing the "slasher" with the parody of the super cops of the 80s. Produced by Larry Cohen ("Baby Killer", "Final Challenge"), another important name in genre cinema. But it is not the sequel to "Maniac Cop": on the contrary, it is the exact opposite. >

title: Mannequin
actors: Andrew McCarthy, Kim Cattrall, Estelle Getty, James Spader, G.W. Bailey, Carole Davis, Steve Vinovich, Christopher Maher, Meshach Taylor, Phyllis Newman
description: After doing a thousand jobs, losing them all due to an excess of ideas, Jonathan manages to get hired at a department store. Here he comes into contact with a strange mannequin who, when they are alone, comes to life and reveals to be the reincarnation of an Egyptian princess of the pharaonic era. Jonathan, thanks to the charm of the mannequin, leads the warehouse to success and arouses the jealousy of the competitors. These first try to make him look crazy and then to destroy the mannequin: but it's all in vain. The story develops hackneyed ideas; in turn, the jokes, which could give a little salt to the farce, are not even funny: to be forgotten.

title: The Deadly Mantis
actors: Craig Stevens, Alix Talton, William Hopper, Donald Randolph, Pat Conway, Florenz Ames, Paul Smith, Phil Harvey, Floyd Simmons
description: After a series of mysterious disasters and destruction at an Arctic military base, it is discovered that a giant and ravenous mantis is haunting the region. The monstrous insect, against which Colonel Parkman hires a deadly hunt, heads for New York. Discreet, though not exciting. Old science fiction that fans always like.

title: Branded
actors: Alan Ladd, Mona Freeman, Charles Bickford, Robert Keith, Joseph Calleia, Peter Hansen, Selena Royle, Tom Tully, John Berkes
description: Choya, a young man wanted by the law, passes himself off as the son of an owner named Lavery, who was kidnapped as a child. He agrees with the kidnapper, who the boy was stolen by another bandit. The two want to get their hands on Lavery's wealth in this way. But at the most beautiful, love redeems Choya, despite the risks she will face for this reason.
notes: More psychological than action western, which provides Alan Ladd with one of his best rehearsals.

title: House of Wax
actors: Vincent Price, Phillys Kirk, Frank Lovejoy, Carolyn Jones, Paul Picerni, Roy Roberts, Angela Clarke, Paul Cavanagh, Dabbs Greer, Charles Bronson
description: Professor Jarrow (Price), owner of the wax museum, was horribly disfigured in the fire of the museum itself, which was started by one of his partners to collect the insurance. The museum reopens and the statues are more beautiful: in fact they are obtained this time by pouring hot wax on human bodies captured by Jarrow, who in turn wears a wax mask to mask the scars. A girl discovers the truth. The subject had already been used for a film in the 1930s: the new version is in color and was originally made in three dimensions. Price begins a long career in horror cinema, and in one particle is Charles Bronson (still with the surname Buchinsky).

title: Springfield Rifle
actors: Gary Cooper, Phyllis Thaxter, David Brian, Lon Chaney jr., Paul Kelly, Philip Carey, James Millican, Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Alan Hale jr.
description: Major Lex Kearny is disbarred for having abandoned to the raiders, without a fight, a convoy of horses destined for Union troops, which he had orders to escort. This allows him to infiltrate a gang of horse thieves and to discover that his own colonel is a traitor acting, in league with the raiders, in favor of the Southern enemy.
notes: A traditional western that scrupulously respects the rules of the genre, conducted by a hard-working director on an elaborate script. Extraordinary Gary Cooper.

title: The Purple Mask
actors: Tony Curtis, Colleen Miller, Dan O'Herlihy, Gene Barry, Angela Lansbury, George Dolenz, John Hoyt, Donald Randolph, Robert Cornthwaite, Stephen Bekassy, Paul Cavanagh
description: Count René de Trevières, hiding his face under a mysterious purple mask, went to Paris in 1803 to free a gentleman whom Napoleon, First Republican Consul, had arrested and sentenced to the guillotine. René manages to capture the minister of police and to have a ransom delivered in exchange for his release. Napoleon, exasperated, entrusts his trusted man, Brisquet, with the task of tracking down and arresting the Purple Mask.
notes: Modest swashbuckling film.

title: Fort Apache
actors: Henry Fonda, John Wayne, Shirley Temple, John Agar, Ward Bond, Pedro Armendariz, George O'Brien, Victor McLaglen, Anna Lee, Irene Rich, Dick Foran
description: Colonel Thursday is transferred to Fort Apache. Against the advice of his officers, who know better the mentality of the Indians, the military provokes the chief of the Apache tribe, Cochise. In the battle that follows, the entire regiment is surrounded and few manage to escape the massacre.
notes: John Ford and the soldiers, symbol of a community that despite its mistakes manages to find within itself the values ??of loyalty and solidarity. And between the harsh reality and the myth, the myth will win. At the time it was mistaken for rhetoric what is, more simply, epic.

title: Medicine Man
actors: Sean Connery, Lorraine Bracco, José Wilker, Rodolfo De Alexandre, Francisco Tsiren Tsere Rereme, Elias Monteiro Da Silva, Edinei Maria Serrio Dos Santos, Bec-Kana-Re Dos Santos Kaiapo, Angelo Barra Moreira, José Lavat
description: Robert Campbell (Sean Connery) is a scientist who has lived for years in the Amazon rainforest, in search of a remedy for cancer starting from some drugs of the tribal medicine of the Indians. Since the results do not seem satisfactory, he is joined by the pharmaceutical multinational, who finances him a young researcher (Lorraine Bracco) who, after the first squabbles, proves his worth, conquering even the heart of the gruff scientist. Meanwhile, some unscrupulous businessmen are destroying the forest (and consequently the populations that inhabit it). To save their proteges and their studies, the two go even further into the region ... The screenwriter is that of "Fleeting Moment", McTiernan is not Boorman ("The Emerald Forest") and completely relies on the pair of actors capable of holding up the film.

title: Maya
actors: Clint Walker, Jay North, I.S. Johar, Sajid Kahn, Sonia Sahni, Paidi Jairaj, Ulhas, Nana Palsikar
description: Hugh is a famous hunter who after being wounded by a tiger no longer has the courage to look in the mirror. His son Terry, who has joined him in India in the meantime, is shocked when his father kills a leopard cub that has become his favorite playmate. After running away from home, the little boy starts wandering through the jungle. He would surely be killed if he didn't meet an Indian peer, an elephant and her albino baby ...
notes: A simple film directed by a simple director and played by simple actors. Despite this, however, the honesty of intent (and form) saves the shack

title: McBain
actors: Christopher Walken, Maria Conchita Alonso, Michael Ironside, Chick Vennera, Steve James, Victor Argo, Jay Patterson, Protacio Dee
description: McBain is a prisoner of war who is saved, on the last day of the Vietnamese conflict, by a group of soldiers including Santos. Eighteen years later, Santos is killed in a coup attempt in Colombia. McBain agrees to help Santos' sister Christina. With his intervention, the drug cartel that controls power is defeated and the return of democracy is favored. Glickenhaus is a director of B movie; this is revealed also on this occasion, despite the cast of recall. On other occasions, his "recycling of second-hand films" came out better.

title: Gunslinger
actors: John Ireland, Beverly Garland, Allison Hayes, Martin Kingsley, Margaret Campbell, Bruno VeSota, Chris Alcaide, Dick Miller, George Offerman Jr.
description: Rose is suddenly widowed by Sheriff Scott. Which means for a couple of weeks before your replacement arrives, the sheriff will have to do it. The woman uses the opportunity to find her husband's killers. An original idea for a film opposed, during the seven days of production, by bad weather and other misadventures.

title: Meteor
actors: Sean Connery, Natalie Wood, Karl Malden, Brian Keith, Martin Landau, Trevor Howard, Henry Fonda, Richard Dysart, Joseph Campanella, Bo Brundin
description: American space controllers have located a comet on its way to an asteroid beam. A spaceship is sent to the area, but it is run over and destroyed. A piece of the planet Orpheus, accompanied by a group of meteorites, is heading straight for the earth. Help is sought from the Russians. General Adlon, who aimed missiles at the USSR, opposes the operation. The Soviets, for their part, have no problem cooperating and send Dr. Dubov with his assistant Tatiana. Adlon resists, the tension rises.
notes: Catastrophic and science fiction go hand in hand. The cast is little less than pharaonic; the script a bit cumbersome and the suspense holds up to a certain point. But overall, the fun is guaranteed.

title: My Little Chickadee
actors: Mae West, W.C. Fields, Joseph Calleia, Dick Foran, Ruth Donnelly, Margaret Hamilton, Donald Meek, Fuzzy Knight
description: The prosperous Flower Belle is married to Cuthbert J. Tillie who trades snake oil. The relationship between the two is on the verge of survival, because Flower does not allow her husband to consume the marriage. The woman, among other things, has already been expelled from the country where she was born because she suspects she is the lover of a masked bandit who terrorizes the community. Fortunately, there is an honest journalist who, in love with her, would like to restore her dignity.
notes: The encounter between Mae West's politically incorrect talent and W. C. Fields' ineffable genius should have produced other results. The movie isn't bad, but more was to be expected. In Italy it only arrived on TV.

title: Billy Two Hats
actors: Gregory Peck, Desi Arnaz jr., Jack Warden, Sian Barbara Allen, David Huddleston, John Pearce, Dawn Little Sky, Vincent St. Cyr, Henry Medicine Hat
description: Henry is a bandit who is paired with Billy, a young half-caste. When Billy, captured by Sheriff Arch, is about to be hanged, Henry promptly arrives to rescue him. At that point, the only hope for the two is to arrive in Mexico. Henry is injured; a certain Spencer offers himself as a guide, but, in addition to the sheriff, the Indians also get involved.
notes: Western with a beautiful setting (Kotcheff was also the director of the first "Rambo", remarkable in this respect). Written by Alan Sharp, also screenwriter of "Night Target" (Penn) and "No Mercy for Ulzana" (Aldrich).

title: Miami Supercops
actors: Terence Hill, Bud Spencer, Jackie Castellano, C.B. Seay, Rhonda Lundstead, William 'Bo' Jim, Richard Liberty, C.V. Wood Jr., Rhonda S. Lundstead, Buffy Dee
description: Doug (Terence Hill) and Steve (Bud Spencer) have been friends for a long time. The former works for the FBI, the latter quit the police because he doesn't trust superiors. One day a criminal, a former policeman, is released after a robbery whose booty had not been found. Doug, who with Steve, had arrested the man is in charge of the investigation. At first Steve refuses to cooperate in the investigation, but changes his mind after the body of the former policeman is found. With a bit of cunning and many sganassons, the two discover what has happened.
notes: American production but all-Italian troupe directed, with the left hand, by Bruno Corbucci. Spencer and Hill's success was already on the wane.

title: Best of the Best
actors: Eric Roberts, James Earl Jones, Sally Kirkland, Chris Penn
description: On the eve of an important international karate match, the American team leader faces a serious problem. At his disposal there are in fact five champions who do not have good relations with each other.
notes: The film alternates the performances of the champions with an attempt at psychological introspection. But the spectacular moments are definitely the most successful part of the film. Among the performers stand out the black James Earl Jones and the brother of Julia Roberts.

title: Arabian Nights
actors: Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu
description: In a sumptuous technicolor the adventures of the beautiful (and, for the times, disgraced) Princess Sheherezade, who a prince saves from the clutches of the evil caliph. Hollywood exoticism, now deliciously kitsch.

title: King Solomon's Mines
actors: Stewart Granger, Deborah Kerr, Richard Carlson, Hugo Haas
description: In search of an explorer who disappeared two years earlier and King Solomon's fabulous diamond mines, an expedition to the Zambari River region of Africa sets out ...
notes: Locations in true Africa, Oscar to cinematographer Robert Surtees and editor. Remake of a 1937 film, which was in turn remade in 1985.

title: Mac and Me
actors: Jade Calegory, Jonathan Ward, Lauren Stanley
description: Mac, his parents and a little sister are dumped in the United States by a space probe that accidentally took them from their planet. Mac happens to be in the family of Eric, a handicapped child, with whom he becomes a great friend. The attempt to exploit the success of "E.T." with one story it is quite evident, the result is poor in ideas and modest spectacular attractions.

title: Enemy Mine
actors: Dennis Quaid, Louis Gossett jr., Brion James, Richard Marcus
description: Let's take a big step forward in time, up to the middle of the 21st century. The terrestrial Davidge (Quaid) goes to the assault of the alien Jeriba (Gossett jr.), A "Dracon" who has entered with his own space shuttle into orbit that was not his responsibility. Both fall on the planet Fyrine IV, a ghostly environment with two suns and six moons inhabited by human carnivores. At this point, it is necessary to put aside the old grudges and move on to mutual collaboration, but even so the dangers are far from over.
notes: The story is curious, but the film lacks the magic of the author's previous film, "The Neverending Story", and did not replicate its success.

title: The Hunger
actors: Catherine Deneuve, Susan Sarandon, David Bowie, Ann Magnuson, Willem Dafoe
description: Miriam is the latest descendant of a 4,000-year-old generation of vampires. John has been her lover for three centuries and promised him eternal youth. But suddenly John begins to grow old without hope. He turns to Sarah, a famous doctor, but she can't do anything for him.
notes: Film debut of Tony Scott, Ridley's younger brother. Visually overwhelming, where the director's advertising provenance is evident, the film makes use of a pressing musical column. The wonderful Deneuve and Sarandon are accompanied by a disturbing and tragic David Bowie. The first part of the film has a dizzying charm. In the second part, the script becomes a bit rough.

title: Freeze Frame
actors: Shannen Doherty, Charles Haid, Robyn Douglass, Ryan Lambert
description: Lindsay is a 17-year-old who her father, a respected surgeon, sees well in her career at the local hospital. But she dreams of establishing herself as an assault journalist and works to do so for the school's television station. His tabloid reports shake the school and city environment, much to Dad's chagrin. However, the girl has the merit of uncovering a scandal linked to a businessman running for the office of governor. Shannon "Brenda" Doherty plays away from home, looking for credibility beyond the borders of Beverly Hills, denouncing poor athletic training even in less demanding matches. First TV viewing

title: Mission of Justice
actors: Brigitte Nielsen, Jeff Wincott, Lucas Bercovici, Matthias Hues
description: Los Angeles at night is not a children's show. Organized crime, drug dealing, the arms trade are normal. But there are those who do not give up: small groups, organized by the police and called "armies of peace", made up of private citizens skilled in martial arts. At the head of these is a woman, Rachel (Nielsen). That Brigitte Nielsen can scare any average criminal is beyond question. Whether he is also capable of acting is however questionable.

title: Seven Women
actors: Anne Bancroft, Sue Lyon, Margaret Leighton, Woody Strode, Mike Mazurki
description: Miss Cartwright left the United States (and an impossible love affair) and moved to a Chinese mission to work as a doctor. We are in 1935 and the area where the mission is located is infested with brigands that make life difficult for the population and for foreigners.
notes: It is the last film made by John Ford, sad and hopeless like many of his twilight period. Curiously for such a virile director, the protagonists are all women. The story even remembers, from a distance, a piece of "Red Shadows".

title: Delta Force 3
actors: Nick Cassavetes, Eric Douglas, Mike Norris, Matthew Penn
description: They call them Delta Force, they face desperate missions against terrorists, especially those operating in airports. Previously, the Delta Forces have confronted Islamic hardliners in Israel and drug wholesalers in Colombia; this time their task is to resolve a difficult situation that has arisen in an Arab sheikhdom.
notes: Third mediocre episode in a series that has never managed to make itself interesting. There is also Mike Norris, son of Chuck, who had played the first two episodes; with him another illustrious son, Nick Cassavetes.

title: The Missouri Breaks
actors: Marlon Brando, Jack Nicholson, Kathleen Lloyd, Randy Quaid
description: A landowner hires a famous bounty hunter, Lee Clayton, to vanquish a gang of horse-raiders. He kills all the bandits, except their leader, Tom Logan, who also has an affair with the owner's daughter. In the final battle, uncertain to the last, it is the bounty hunter who gets the worst of it, the landowner dies and his daughter and Tom each go their own way.
notes: Great cast and excellent interpretations for a story that has its roots in the epic of the American frontier, created in an unconventional and crepuscular way by Arthur Penn. The Nicholson-Brando comparison was enormous.

title: Mr. Billion
actors: Terence Hill, Valerie Perrine, Jackie Gleason, William Redfield
description: Dying old uncle Anthony leaves a billion dollars to his nephew Guido (Hill), an Italian mechanic. An avid administrator of the company who wants the colossal inheritance for himself sends the beautiful Rosy to the young man, who has arrived in the US, to seduce him and snatch a power of attorney from him. Jonathan Kaplan, a young director with a taste for rhythm ("Young warriors"), takes up the schemes of Frank Capra's comedy and fills them with fist fights, chases and hyperbolic humor, reinforcing everything with virtuosic aerial shots. For Terence Hill, in his first film as an absolute protagonist after a long association with Bud Spencer, it seemed the beginning of a career in the United States, but it was not. At his side, the beautiful and prosperous Valérie Perrine. and the excellent Jackie Gleason ("The Bully").

title: Westworld
actors: Yul Brynner, Richard Benjamin, James Brolin, Victoria Shaw
description: We are in Delos, a vacation spot for the earthlings of the near future. Divided by historical epochs and populated by suitably clad robots, it allows tourists to "live" adventures of all kinds without danger. But for Peter and John something goes wrong: the robots start to rebel and the plunge into the Old West turns into a tragic nightmare, from which it seems impossible to find a way out.
notes: Crichton is a novelist and director who awakens the most disturbing hallucinations linked to scientific progress (see "Jurassic Park"). Here he creates a western fantasy full of suspense and gimmicks, with a hypnotic Brinner.

title: World in his Arms
actors: Gregory Peck, Ann Blyth, Anthony Quinn
description: In 1850, Captain Jonathan Clark fell in love with the Russian Duchess Marina. The noblewoman, however, has numerous suitors including Prince Simeon, to whom his uncle has promised the hand of the young woman. And who is the uncle to be able to make such a promise? None other than the Tsar himself! Will Jonathan and Marina therefore have to give up their love? It is not certain, if the usual palace conspiracy sees Simeone in the front row ...
notes: Raoul Walsh shows off his craft to tell a "sentimental" adventure story. Technicolor triumphs in pure Hollywood style. Also known as "The Bostonian".

title: The Lost World
actors: Claude Rains, Michael Rennie, Jill St. John, David Hedison, Fernando Lamas
description: An expedition led by Professor George Edward Challenger travels to the Amazon to recover prehistoric fossils. Soon, however, the scientists and adventurers that compose it find themselves dealing with a very different discovery: a remote plateau populated by terrifying Jurassic monsters ...
notes: The novel _The Lost World_, written in 1912 by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (the inventor of Sherlock Holmes, so to speak) and the first of a series dedicated to the character of Professor Challenger, has given rise to a considerable number of film and television versions. Unfortunately, this one by Allen certainly does not figure among the best.

title: Monolith
actors: Bill Paxton, Lindsay Frost, John Hurt, Louis Gossett jr.
description: Tucker and Flinn, two Los Angeles police officers, accidentally discover that Villano, head of a seemingly harmless Department of Historical Research, has spotted a shapeless alien force and secretly attempts to exploit it. The operation, however, gets out of hand to the sorcerer's apprentice. Successful product in terms of story and visual effects, but poorly served by the dialogues. The star couple, played by Bill Paxton ("Tombstone") and his energetic partner Lindsay Frost, are close-knit.

title: The Mosquito Coast
actors: Harrison Ford, Helen Mirren, River Phoenix, Martha Plimpton, Conrad Roberts, Andre Gregory, Dick O'Neill, Jadrien Steele, Michael Rogers, Hilary Gordon, Rebecca Gordon, Jason Alexander, Alice Heffernan-Sneed, Tiger Haynes, William Newman
description: Allie Fox (Ford) is a skilled worker who decides to leave the United States, whose degradation he can no longer bear. He moves with his family to the Costa delle Zanzare, Guatemala, to an abandoned village. He then throws himself into the enterprise of building an enormous and useless ice machine, which he must then destroy to kill three terrorists, but causing serious pollution. Weir's film is the reconstruction of a dream of escape that turns into utopia, to the point of degenerating under the weight of its greatness. Allie Fox is an ambiguous, at times hateful character: one of the most difficult roles in Harrison Ford's career, who gets along with honor. Weir does not deny his pessimism about the impossibility of the cultural encounter between the modern and the ancient.

title: The Wild Bunch
actors: William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Ben Johnson, Jamie Sanchez
description: Pike Bishop and his gang, pursued by Dick Thornton and his cutthroats after a robbery-trap, arrive in Aguaverde in Mexico and make an agreement with Mapachi, a former criminal who commands the counter-revolutionary troops, to attack a train loaded with weapons. The blow succeeds, but then Angelo, a Mexican from Pike's gang, holds back a crate of weapons to deliver it to the revolting Indians ...
notes: Sam Peckinpah celebrates the death of the classic western. Between dust and rivers of blood (the famous and unsurpassed final massacre), slow motion and frenetic editing, on the notes of the "Golondrina", with four pistoleros led by William Holden. A masterpiece that was restored to its integrity in 1997, according to the editing and duration desired by the director (about 7 minutes more), before the cuts imposed by the production.

title: The Mummy
actors: Boris Karloff, Zita Johann, David Manners, Arthur Byron
description: Accidentally resurrected, the Egyptian priest Imothep leads an archaeological expedition with the intent of reviving the princess he is still in love with, despite several centuries having passed.
notes: Horror classic directed by Karl Freund, extraordinary director of photography for Lang, Dreyer and Murnau. The mummy character played by Karloff still retains an unsurpassed charm. Jack Pierce's make-up, who had already developed the Frankenstein mask, was extraordinary and frightening.

title: Many Rivers to Cross
actors: Robert Taylor, Eleanor Parker, Victor McLaglen
description: Bushrod Gentry (Robert Taylor) is a hunter from Kentucky, used to living in contact with nature and without too many ties. One day he meets Placida, a rather wild girl. He is a bit reluctant, but she has no doubts and, thanks to a subterfuge, manages to get married. For Bushrod married life is almost impossible, so much so that immediately after the marriage he runs away, but Placida does not give up and pursues him. A simple but enjoyable film, especially thanks to the Taylor / Parker couple. It goes without saying that in the original version of Neapolitans there is no shadow of it.

title: Navy Seals
actors: Charlie Sheen, Michael Biehn, Joanne Whalley
description: In the army of the United States of America, a special group called "Seals" is trained according to the harshest laws of selection. The men who are part of it must always be ready for anything. The group is sent to the Middle East on the trail of terrorist Ben Shaheed, and the missiles he possesses. Some vicissitudes lead them to Lebanon where a bloody clash will take place with the killing of the terrorists.
notes: In the beginning it was "That dirty dozen" then the various "Top Guns". However, the direction of Lewis Teague, better known as a horror director, is interesting.

title: Return to Oz
actors: Fairuza Balk, Nicol Williamson, Jean Marsh, Piper Laurie
description: Dorothy Gale has returned home from the fantastic world of Oz and has not yet recovered. The worried parents take her to Dr. Worley who gives her an electric shock. As a result, the clinic is on fire and Dorothy finds herself back in the world of Oz, but this time everything has changed. It's not exactly a children's movie or if it is, it's pretty scary. Without the musical numbers it doesn't even seem a distant relative of Victor Fleming's old film of 1939. Here the best things, in fact, are the bad guys.

title: Prime Evil
actors: William Beckwith, Christine Moore
description: In New York, members of the "demon monks" sect have signed a pact with the Devil. It states that every thirteen years the congregation will offer human sacrifices to the Evil One, receiving immortality for the adepts in exchange. Passable B-movie directed by a specialist of the genre.

title: Chains of Gold
actors: John Travolta, Marilu Henner, Hector Elizondo, Joey Lawrence
description: There is a lot of drugs on the streets of Miami and the best couriers are kids. Tommy (Joey Lawrence) is thirteen and eager to earn easy money. He makes contact with Carlos, the boss who controls drug trafficking, and ends up in the ring of the underworld. His only possible way to salvation is represented by Scott (John Travolta).
notes: The protagonist at the time had entered into a contract with the production company of this film, with which he had already shot "Look who's talking", which had been a success. His participation in the film, directed by Rod Holcomb, did not meet with such satisfactory results.

title: Ulzana's Raid
actors: Burt Lancaster, Bruce Davison, Jorge Luke, Richard Jaeckel
description: Ulzana, the famous Apache leader, rebelled against white power and fled the reservation with a handful of loyal warriors. The young Lieutenant De Buine, who hates violence, is sent in pursuit with a group of soldiers and an Indian guide. It is the latter who explains that the tortures imposed by the Indians on their victims are a sacred rite: through them, the strength of the vanquished is transmitted to the victor. But Ulzana is more and more alone, abandoned even by his men ...
notes: Aldrich directs a vigorous western (written by Alan Sharp), in line with the pro-Indian revisionism of the time. Passionate and with an energetic Lancaster.

title: Carson City
actors: Randolph Scott, Lucille Norman, Raymond Massey, Richard Webb
description: In 1870 the state of Nevada still does not have its own railway network, and stagecoaches are often prey to bandit attacks. Jeff Kincaid (Scott), engineer and resolute man, is commissioned to build a railway through the mountains. The work will be hindered in every way by the criminals.
notes: The conflict between the railway (symbol of progress) and farmers has been told countless times. Here, on the other hand, robbers and murderers oppose who see the profit of their criminal actions fading. A decent western.

title: A Breed Apart
actors: Rutger Hauer, Powers Boothe, Kathleen Turner
description: Walker, a famous mountaineer, is hired to steal some eggs of a very rare species of eagle from his nest, which is located on top of a mountain. The only problem is the guardian of the area (Hauer), a former Vietnam veteran with an ecological streak. Initially the two will almost make friends, but when the ranger discovers his true intentions, he will begin to hunt him down.
