notes: The setting is naturally suggestive, but the story, with its elementary environmentalist spirit, proceeds with difficulty and leaves you cold.

title: Revenge of the Ninja
actors: Sho Kosugi, Keith Vitali, Virgil Frye, Arthur Roberts
description: Cho Osaki fled Japan when a furious group of ninjas exterminated his family, except for a grandmother and son. Today he lives in America and makes a living from his Japanese imported doll shop. What he doesn't know is that dolls are the medium for a drug trade organized by his friend Braden. It is the second film in the Ninja series and is played roughly. The only one who is saved is Sho Kosugi, but only in the sequences in which he has to move his hands.

title: Moon of the Wolf
actors: David Janssen, Barbara Rush, Bradford Dillman
description: Aaron Whitaker (David Janssen), a marshland sheriff in Louisiana, investigates a series of savage assassins. The policeman begins the search believing he is dealing with a ruthless serial killer, but soon unequivocal clues convince him that he is on the trail of a werewolf. Could it be true, or is it a ruse to mislead the investigation? This TV product lacks action and suspense. The subject is based on a novel by Leslie Whitten.

title: Pursued
actors: Robert Mitchum, Teresa Wright, Judith Anderson, Dean Jagger, Alan Hale, John Rodney
description: In the feud with the Callums, only little Jed of the Rand family remains alive. Having become a man, he suffers from inexplicable nightmares and an obsession that devours him: knowing once and for all the truth about his origins. To free himself from his ghosts, he will have to go through revenge ...
notes: Western with noir atmospheres - indeed, almost "gothic" - and a marked psychoanalytic background. The hand of the great Walsh builds a little jewel of suspense, with the contribution (as well as the perfect performance by Mitchum) of the tight script by Niven Busch, the music of Max Steiner and the splendid black and white of the great James Wong Howe.

title: The Last Sunset
actors: Kirk Douglas, Rock Hudson, Dorothy Malone, Joseph Cotten
description: Mexico: Stribling, a Texas county sheriff, is on the trail of the bandit O'Malley. Both captain on the Beckinridge farm, whose wife Mary had been O'Malley's own fiancée as a young girl. The woman has a sixteen-year-old daughter, Melissa. The two men accept the host's offer to help bring a herd of cattle from Mexico to Texas.
notes: Dalton Trumbo's screenplay slips too often into literary existentialism, yet Aldrich's iron class is there, and it shows. Highlight when Joseph Cotten dies. Produced by Kirk Douglas.

title: Blood Alley
actors: John Wayne, Lauren Bacall, Anita Ekberg, Paul Fix, Joy Kim
description: The population of a Chinese village, tired of the tyrannical regime of the Communist government, decides to emigrate en masse to Hong Kong. In the risky undertaking, the exodus population is helped by an American captain, a former prisoner, who guides the ferry overloaded with people between the dangers of the sea and ... of the coast guard.
notes: Typical cold war movie. But even in 1955 it was known that the British mandate over the Asian colony was "over".

title: Old Gringo
actors: Gregory Peck, Jane Fonda, Jimmy Smits, Patricio Contreras
description: Harriet Winslow, a spinster teacher, leaves for Mexico and finds herself involved in the Pancho Villa revolution. At first intimidated, then excited by the events, she meets an old American whom everyone calls Old Gringo (Gregory Peck). Arroyo, one of the revolutionaries, falls in love with her and kills the old man who is actually the writer Ambrose Bierce. Harriet returns to America with the novelist's body.
notes: After the excellent performance of "The official story", the Argentine Puenzo tries the path of the historical-epic fresco, but with poor results. The film remains flat in its staging, unrealistic in its intentions and literary in its characters.

title: The Outrage
actors: Paul Newman, Laurence Harvey, Claire Bloom, Edward G. Robinson
description: Accused of killing a man and raping his wife, Juan Carrasco is sentenced to death. He says it was a regular duel. Some support the suicide thesis, others blame (at least morally) the wickedness of the wife and the wife finally contradicts everyone by accusing herself of the murder. Too many versions for a single crime cause despair over the possibility of finding the truth. Martin Ritt puts the subject of "Rashomon", a famous film by Akira Kurosawa, into a western. The transposition fails completely and smells a little academy. However, the actors are splendid: from Paul Newman to Edward G. Robinson.

title: Cat Chaser
actors: Peter Weller, Kelly McGillis, Charles Durning, Tomas Milian, Frederic Forrest
description: George, a Miami hotelier, goes to Santo Domingo to track down a young guerrilla who saved his life; instead he finds himself in the midst of the shady dealings of General De Boya, whose wife Mary was a flame of George himself. There is a lot of money involved that everyone would like for themselves. It doesn't take long between Mary and George for the understanding to be reborn. Old and new names in and around Hollywood for this action adventure signed by a still little known Ferrara.

title: The Shadow Riders
actors: Tom Selleck, Sam Elliott, Ben Johnson, Geoffrey Lewis, Jeff Osterhage
description: Returning from the Secession war, fought on opposite sides, two brothers discover that their family has been kidnapped; thus they set out on the trail of relatives. TV meatloaf based on a novel by Louis L'Amour. The director, son of actor Victor McLagen, a favorite of John Ford, makes use of two other "Fordians" such as Harry Carey jr. and Ben Johnson.

title: Stagecoach
actors: John Wayne, Claire Trevor, John Carradine, Thomas Mitchell
description: A stagecoach leaves from Tonto to Lordsburg. On board are a prostitute, the pregnant wife of a military man, a cheater, a swindler and an alcoholic doctor. The gunfighter Ringo joins the street. But along the way, under the attacks of the Indians, this humanity of sinners will find redemption. The officer's wife gives birth thanks to the doctor, and Ringo faces a decisive shooting with the Plummer brothers. The founding film of the modern western, and one of the classics in the history of cinema. An action film with characters that have the mythical, and a film already full of Ford's religious symbolism. Dudley Nichols' screenplay is vaguely inspired by Maupassant's "Boule de suif" (in the character of the prostitute). It was the film that John Wayne launched: his entry on the scene, with the saddle over the shoulder, is royal.

title: Firecreek
actors: James Stewart, Henry Fonda, Gary Lockwood
description: A band of adventurers, made up of ex-military demobilized after the civil war, arrives in a remote village. Since the sheriff is temporarily away, the thugs rule by committing all kinds of abuses and persecuting a young Indian girl. But, when the sheriff returns, the country rebels.
notes: A modest twilight western that tries to combine the classic soul of the American genre with certain excesses of the spaghetti vein. Fonda in the role of the villain recovers the Frank of "Once upon a time in the West", but in this case we miss Sergio Leone a lot behind the camera.

title: Certain Fury
actors: Tatum O'Neal, Irene Cara, Nicholas Campbell, Peter Fonda
description: After the roundup there is a hearing. The girls taken by the police are in front of the judge when two of them turn against the policemen and, in the ensuing confusion, two others manage to escape into the basement. I'm Scarlet, a brusque prostitute, and Tracy, a decent girl arrested by accident. At that point the hunt begins.
notes: Gyllenhaal is the director of good intentions: even the recent "The Black Heart of Paris Trout" was on the best card of the result. With "Ore 13" you don't get bored, and that's already something. Irene Cara is the lead singer of "Fame" and "What a Feelin '".

title: Fort Yuma
actors: Peter Graves, Joan Vohs, John Hudson, Joan Taylor
description: Apache Indians are besieging Fort Yuma. A caravan of unsuspecting settlers is heading towards the fort led by a white scout, Keegan, and an Indian. The contrasts between the white and the Indian are very strong, also due to Keegan's harshly racist attitude. The death of the girl, with whom the white is in love, and the approaching of the decisive confrontation with the Apaches brings together the two men who face the decisive confrontation together.
notes: Low-cost Western by Lesley Selander, one of the most prolific directors of the American B series. The pace is pressing and makes you forget the modesty of the actors.

title: Lost Horizon
actors: Ronald Colman, Jane Wyatt, Edward Everett Horton, Thomas Mitchell
description: The English consul in China tries to escape together with some compatriots, including his brother, to avoid the conflict between China and Japan. Their plane is hijacked and crashes into the mountains of Tibet: there the group accidentally discovers the mythical city of Shangri La, where people live happily. The old Lama who governs the city is dying and would like to entrust the command to the consul: but the man, pushed by his companions, tries to escape. In the end, only he survives and decides to go back. A goat's tale that is a kind of escape from history, a search for happiness and peace outside of everyday life. Based on a James Hillton novel, the film won Academy Awards for Production Design and Editing. A bad musical remake was made in 1972.

title: When Time Ran Out
actors: Paul Newman, Jacqueline Bisset, William Holden
description: An island in Hawaii is in danger of exploding due to an erupting volcano, which was also thrown into turmoil due to the drilling of the subsoil carried out by a company looking for "black gold". The first building to suffer the destructive consequences of the lava is a luxury hotel where American tourists and businessmen stay.
notes: Very modest disaster film directed by Goldstone, who did better with "Rollercoaster" (1977). Known situations, stars who do the bare minimum, cheesy special effects. As often in these cases, above all the script is missing.

title: Mackenna's Gold
actors: Gregory Peck, Omar Sharif, Telly Savalas
description: Sheriff Mackenna has found the map to reach a fabulous treasure hidden in a canyon. The Colorado gang forces him to take them to the field. A bit cumbersome Western, despite its spectacularity.

title: Gold of Seven Saints
actors: Clint Walker, Roger Moore, Chill Wills
description: Two Colorado hunters, Rainbolt and Garrett, accidentally discover a rich deposit of gold nuggets. This is the beginning of their troubles, between a bandit who assaults them with his men (and are saved by the providential intervention of a doctor), a second band of outlaws led by an old friend of Rainbolt, the murder of the doctor, the torture of Garrett to reveal the hiding of the gold, and other vicissitudes. And when everything seems to have ended for the best ... Despite some length and some excessive descriptive complacency, the film presents itself as a decent entertainment product, flavored with an ironic ending.

title: Somewhere in Time
actors: Christopher Reeve, Jane Seymour, Christopher Plummer, Teresa Wright, Bill Erwin, George Voskovec, Susan French, John Alvin, William H. Macy, Sean Hayden
description: Richard, a famous playwright, discovers that he had a burning and unfortunate passion in a previous existence, and is able to relive it by taking a leap seventy years back in time. Cracked mess written by a great science fiction writer like Richard Matheson, who here launches himself into new age stunts. Very confused Reeve.

title: Master of the World
actors: Vincent Price, Charles Bronson, Mary Webster, Henry Hull
description: In the middle of the last century an inaccessible Pennsylvania mountain has sudden eruptions and mysterious manifestations that terrify the population. A search party enters the crater and finds a tyrant who dominates the mountain with a warship sailing in the inland sea and a spaceship. Based on two novels by Giulio Verne (The master of the world and Robur the conqueror) written by Richard Matheson, the film has a taste of naive fantasy, with period scent, and amusing cinematic solutions in the use of tricks. The dark Vincent Price is the tyrannical captain, Charles Bronson the young hero.

title: Night Passage
actors: James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Elaine Stewart, Dan Duryea, Dianne Foster
description: Grant McLaine, justice of the peace, is tasked with confronting a gang of outlaws that rage across the territory by repeatedly assaulting trains. The Band also includes Grant's brother, Utica Kid. During the umpteenth robbery, the judge is wounded, but still chases the bandits, who have taken the wife of the railway director hostage. Grant joins the gang and, before the final confrontation, tries to convince his brother to change his life. Discreet "psychological" western. Initially Anthony Mann should have directed it, but he found the script too weak.

title: Oregon Passage
actors: John Ericson, Lola Albright, Edward Platt, Jon Shepodd
description: Ever since Lieutenant Niles Ord kidnapped a girl from his tribe, Little Elk, for the purpose of marrying her, the relentless Black Eagle Indian chief has no rest. The opportunity presents itself with the arrival at the fort of Major Dane, accompanied by his wife Sylvia, who ends up in the hands of the Indians.
notes: Good and bad, losers and winners, everything is very clear from the beginning to the end, in homage to the most rigid and simplified stereotypes of the genre.

title: Fort Vengeance
actors: James Craig, Rita Moreno Keith Larsen, Reginald Denny
description: Brothers Dick and Andy Ross take refuge in Canada, after the latter kills a man in a fight, and join the Redcoats police force. But Andy is a bad guy who takes advantage of his position to commit, unpunished, many serious crimes. His brother Dick, on the other hand, scrupulously fulfills his duty as a representative of the law. On the traditional lineage of many western films, both as regards the relationship between whites and aborigines and the progression of events, the film plays a lot on the Canadian setting. Pure B.

title: Planet of the Apes
actors: Charlton Heston, Linda Harrison, Roddy McDowall
description: In 3972, some astronauts who have traveled at extraordinary speed arrive on an unknown planet. Here they must work hard not to become subjects of experiments and vivisection by evolved monkeys who have replaced humans (still existing, but considered as beasts) as the dominant species of the planet ...
notes: Based on the novel by the French writer Pierre Boulle (the author of _Bridge over the river Kwai) _, the film is pervaded by a subtle sense of anguish for the future, beyond the curiosity for the singular setting. Remade in 2001 by Tim Burton.

title: Little Monsters
actors: Fred Savage, Howie Mandel, Ben Savage, Daniel Stern
description: A little boy discovers that under his bed there is a lively and mischievous monster. The two quickly become friends, but relations with the rest of the world are difficult. A bit similar to Beetlejuice, it ends up around Freddie Kruger.

title: Video Kid
actors: Fred Savage, Christian Slater, Beau Bridges, Jenny Lewis, Luke Edwards
description: Jimmy and Corey are two brothers aged nine and thirteen. After the separation of his parents, Jimmy runs away from home. Corey sets out on his research, remembering that his brother always pronounced the word California. On the way he meets Haley, a boy who helps him overcome some difficulties. When they find Jimmy, they discover that he is a video game ace. Together they leave for Los Angeles where the national championship is held. More playful than educational, but (at least for adults) it's not much fun.

title: Little Big Man
actors: Dustin Hoffman, Faye Dunaway, Martin Balsam, Chief Dan George
description: Jack Crabb grew up raised by a Cheyenne chief after a Red Indian rescued him following a raiding attack. As an adult, he tries to live in white society and ends up enlisted among Custer's soldiers; escaped after an absurd and useless massacre of Indian women and children, he takes back his uniform only to be able to kill the general, but in Little Big Horn the Sioux warriors precede him: he will be the only survivor of the battle.
notes: Great performance by Hoffman in this famous western "against", which restored to the native Indians all their dignity as a people first offended and then denigrated, but it was above all a reflection on the crisis of a nation and its founding stories. Desecrating, picaresque, but also poignant.

title: One Little Indian
actors: James Garner, Vera Miles, Jodie Foster, Clay O'Brien
description: An Indian boy who escaped the extermination of his tribe, a camel and an army corporal, who escaped a period of jail, cross the desert.
notes: Pick any animal at random, you'll find that Disney has already made a movie about it. Garner and Foster will reunite in "Maverick". She grew up and he aged a lot.

title: The Tall Stranger
actors: Joel McCrea, Virginia Mayo, Barry Kelly
description: A Northern veteran defends a caravan which he joined by chance. Played by Joel McCrea, a specialist in the genre and based on a novel by Louis L'Amour.

title: Piraña
actors: Bradford Dillman, Heather Menzies, Kevin McCarthy
description: The dr. Hoak has developed an unusual weapon: it is a new species of carnivorous fish that can live in both fresh and salt water. Paul and Maggie inadvertently spill them into a river; for the bloodthirsty fish the party begins, but the two responsible for the trouble are busy to make up for it.
notes: Scripted by director John Sayles, it is the second feature by the author of "Gremlins". Inspired by the "Shark", this is a catastrophic film, low budget, well written and made. Nervous style and excellent special effects strike rightly low, while a satirical subtext on the idiocy of the poeter flows.

title: Hurricane Smith
actors: Yvonne De Carlo, John Ireland, James Craig, Forrest Tucker
description: Having been shipwrecked, Hurricane Smith can reach an island in the South Seas with his friends, O'Hara and Brundage. The sailor who knows the hiding place of a marvelous treasure needs a ship to go and unearth it. Through a ruse he seizes the ship of Captain Raikes, a fearsome slave trader and sets sail for Australia. The three who need money to be able to hire a crew come across Gorvahlsen also in search of the treasure.
notes: Directed without jolts by Jerry Hopper with a cast below expectations in which, however, Yvonne De Carlo stands out.

title: Gun Point
actors: Audie Murphy, Joan Staley, Warren Stevens, Edgard Buchanan
description: Sheriff Chad is treacherously hit by his deputy, former Captain Holt who manages to go unnoticed, while trying to block a train awaited at the gate by a band of bandits. The robbery is successful, Holt and Chad himself return to town. Here they find a desperate situation, because the non-arrival of the gold transported on the train has sent all the banks into crisis.
notes: A rather conventional western, with some good ideas and with Audie Murphy on the boulevard of the melancholy sunset.

title: Arizona Raiders
actors: Audie Murphy, Michael Dante, Ben Cooper, Buster Crabbe
description: Of an Arizona band of outlaws, two are captured, while the others manage to escape. Captain Andrews has recourse to the collaboration of the imprisoned bandits and in the meantime sentenced to forced labor to solve the problem definitively. But even so it will be a far from simple undertaking. Heroisms, betrayals and many shootings: a western like many others.

title: Heaven with a Gun
actors: Glenn Ford, Carolyn Jones, Barbara Hershey, David Carradine
description: Jim Killian (Ford), a mature cowboy, gets into a fight with Asa Beck, a large cattle farmer who opposes sheep farmers for grazing reasons and who has a son, Cokes, bully and rogue. Killian adapts a former stable to a church and becomes a shepherd of souls preaching reconciliation and coexistence, finding many difficulties. A film with some traits of originality in the story, but of extreme simplism.

title: The Shootist
actors: John Wayne, Lauren Bacall, Bill McKinney, James Stewart, Sheree North
description: John Bernard Brooks, a famous gunfighter by now old and seriously ill, decides to face three of his bitter enemies one last time before dying. He then returns to Carson City to implement his plan, but has to deal with the local sheriff who is openly hostile to him. John will have his last duel: killed his rivals, but wounded in turn by betrayal, he dies perpetuating his own legend. Wayne resigned and also debilitated by the disease as the tired gunslinger nearing the end to celebrate the myth of the West - and the western film - and its decline. It is the last film played by the actor.

title: The Magic of Lassie
actors: James Stewart, Mickey Rooney, Stephanie Zimbalist, Michael Sharrett
description: Ten-year-old Chris and his sister Kelly live with their grandfather and dog Lassie. A landowner wants to buy his grandfather's vineyard and, faced with his refusal, blackmails the family by taking the dog away on the basis of a forged ownership document. The recipe has the usual ingredients, taken from the decades-old Lassian saga; the vibe is Disney-for-families. The only curiosity is the presence of two old stars like Rooney and especially Stewart (one of his latest appearances).

title: Shakedown
actors: Peter Weller, Sam Elliott, Patricia Charbonneau, Blanche Baker
description: Roland Dalton, a successful lawyer and betrothed to the rich and charming Gail, decides to help his ex-girlfriend Susan who has embarked on the defense of a drug dealer accused of the murder of a policeman. In reality, Roland should definitely not get involved in what is likely to become an uncomfortable and negative case for his brilliant career. But Susan is definitely pretty while Gail, despite her charm and money, is one who believes Jimy Hendrix was a heavy-metal singer.
notes: This is undoubtedly the best film made by James Glickenhaus mainly thanks to Peter Weller and Sam Elliot.

title: Poltergeist
actors: Craig T. Nelson, JoBeth Williams, Heather O'Rourke, Dominique Dunne
description: Her parents, Steve and Diane Freeling, can't help but worry when they find Carol Anne talking to herself with the device. Then she disappears, swallowed by the same TV and, from that moment, strange presences from the underworld begin to manifest themselves in the house.
notes: Monsters come out of the TV and the effect is chilling. The presence of Spielberg, screenwriter and producer, is felt, but the visionary touch, even if tamed, is of Hooper, one of the greats of '70s horror.

title: A Force of One
actors: Chuck Norris, Jennifer O'Neill, Clu Gulager, Ron O'Neal
description: A deadly new drug is spreading on the California coast. But the traffickers are defeated by a martial arts cop who has the expressionless face of Chuck Norris early in his career. The director is Paul Aaron, but, to tell the truth, nothing changes and the story has nothing original. Follow-up to "Commando Black Tigers" by Ted Post, director and producer of some successful TV series.

title: Cariboo Trail
actors: Randolph Scott, Gabby Hayes, Bill Williams, Karin Booth
description: Jim and Mike are carrying a herd to English Columbia. The former hopes to find green pastures, the latter is more attracted to the gold found in the region. At a bridge they are forced to confront the men of Walsh's gang. They both get out alive, but they lose the cattle and Mike also loses his arm, which Jim secretly blames. A completely negligible second-rate western.

title: Run for the Sun
actors: Richard Widmark, Jane Greer, Trevor Howard
description: Due to a plane crash, a writer living in Mexico and a journalist end up in the hands of a trio of former Nazi criminals hiding in the jungle.Third version, but this time in technicolor and with the screenplay by Dudley Nichols, of The Most Dangerous Game. Nothing to do with Schoesdack's original, but the story remains compelling.

title: Predator
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo, Bill Duke, Jesse Ventura, Sonny Landham, Richard Chaves, R.G. Armstrong, Shane Black, Kevin Peter Hall
description: Dutch is a former CIA agent hired for a special mission: he must free a politician kidnapped by guerrillas in the Central American jungle. The mission is accomplished, but on the way back Dutch and his men make the acquaintance of a mysterious and ferocious entity. One by one, everyone on the team falls, except Dutch.
notes: Narrative pretense for the exhibition of (good) special effects. Schwarzenegger moves at ease in this comic-book dimension, even unleashing some glimmers of irony.

title: Mother Lode
actors: Charlton Heston, Kim Basinger, Nick Mancuso
description: George Patterson went missing looking for gold in a remote region of Canada. In search of him, Jean Dupré (Mancuso) and Andrea Spalding (Basinger) come across the two old and sounded McGee twins (both played by Charlton Heston) who exploit a gold mine, the craziest of which is Silas. He does all he can to eliminate the intruders, as he has already done with Patterson. Pleasant revival of the glorious western genre. Charlton Heston is on his second and most successful directing experience, ten years after In the shadow of the pyramids, and he also enjoys playing two strongly characterized roles.

title: Abilene Town
actors: Randolph Scott, Ann Dvorak, Edgar Buchanan, Rhonda Fleming
description: New settlers against old cowboys during the Civil War. Western series for Scott in his period of maximum fortune.

title: The Omen
actors: Gregory Peck, Lee Remick, David Warner, Billie Whitelaw, Harry Stevens
description: He discovers that his adopted son is the antichrist, and tries to suppress him. There is show, but little originality. A truly remarkable suspense, excellent actors and a dull and suggestive photography. The film had three sequels, the first of which was The Curse of Damien.

title: Timbuktu
actors: Victor Mature, Yvonne De Carlo, John Dehner
description: During the Second World War, in French Sudan, a European officer appointed commander of the Timbuctou outpost is involved in the Arab nationalist rebellion. At stake are the commander of the French garrison Colonel Dufort, his wife and Conway, an American adventurer. The commander exploits his rival's passion for his wife in order to sow discord among the Arab leaders and prevent the revolt.
notes: Mediocre both the cast and the production. The film never came out in France, so as not to offend the sensitivity of the French engaged in the Algerian war.

title: Garden of Evil
actors: Gary Cooper, Richard Widmark, Susan Hayward, Cameron Mitchell
description: Fuller gets stuck at the bottom of a mine: the vault collapsed on him as he searched for gold. The wife goes to town to find help. He comes back with four animated adventurers of the most diverse purposes, but the woman uses her charm to keep the tension between them high so that no one prevails.
notes: A surprising western, directed by an "underground" master of American cinema. In this ballet of different male personalities, the one that stands out most is the woman, Susan Hayward, perhaps the only one able to counteract the wild destiny. A few hints of mèlo do not upset the dryness of the whole. Excellent protagonists Widmark and Cooper. But beware of Victor Emanuel Mendoza, who when he dies screaming his anger at the sky writes a great acting page in the cinema.

title: Allegheny Uprising
actors: John Wayne, Claire Trevor, George Sanders, Brian Donlevy
description: A colony of pioneers fights the smugglers who supply the Indians with weapons. Wayne's "serial" period Western, who is here in the company of his female "shoulder" in "Red Shadows", Claire Trevor.

title: Prince Valiant
actors: Robert Wagner, Janet Leigh, James Mason, Debra Paget
description: The young Viking prince Valiant, son of the Christian Aguar, king of Scandia, ousted by Slaigon, is sent to the court of King Arthur to become a knight. Arriving at his destination, he has to deal with duels, deceptions and evil knights and also finds time to fall in love with a princess.
notes: Very grandiloquent, and quite successful, attempt to bring to the screen the exploits of Prince Valiant, a comic drawn in 1937 by Hal Foster. Screenplay by Dudley Nischols and music by Franz Waxman.

title: The War Lord
actors: Charlton Heston, Richard Boone, Rosemary Forsyth, Guy Stockwell
description: In the eleventh century, the men of the Norman and Christian Chrisagon repel an invasion of the Celtic village by the Frisians. Chrisagon falls in love with the daughter of the Phrygian king Odins, already promised to another, kidnaps her and, loved by her, refuses to give her back to her rightful husband. Celts and Frisians, united by faith in the same pagan traditions, unite against the despotic Norman.
notes: With rhetorical excesses, Schaffer (Patton, general of steel) develops some themes in the Middle Ages that are dear to him, that of the hero in contrast with the times in which he lives and the ambiguous dialectic between civilization and barbarism.

title: Mohawk
actors: Scott Brady, Rita Gam, Lori Nelson
description: In the mid-18th century, the painter Johnathan Adams rescues the daughter of the Indian chief Elk Rosso and becomes friends with the Mohawk tribe. But there is a shady figure plotting for the Indians to take over Fort Aldel's weapons, so that Adams is forced to put his brushes aside and take action.
notes: Classic B-series western, however, quite interesting in the setting and not without some effective sequence.

title: Eve of Destruction
actors: Gregory Hines, Renée Soutendijk, Michael Greene, Kurt Fuller
description: Like a fledgling Doctor Frankenstein, scientist Eve Simmons built Eve 8, an android identical to her, which she endowed with her own memories. So when Eve 8 escapes her control and begins to sow corpses, the task of stopping her becomes difficult, especially as the android is capable of causing a nuclear disaster. Together with the inventor, Colonel Jim McQuade, an expert in counter-terrorism, deals with it.
notes: A mix of science fiction and psychological problems, which starts well but ends up keeping less than it seemed to promise. Technically fine, it suffers from some screenplay weaknesses.

title: Out for Blood
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Shari Shattuck
description: Attorney John Decker sees his wife and son killed before his eyes by a group of criminals. A martial arts expert and bent on uncovering the killers, Decker transforms into a ferocious executioner. An analyst, to whom the lawyer turns, shocked by the terrible trauma of the double murder, does not know that the man who asked for her assistance hides a double personality. his actions as a martial arts champion.

title: The Evil That Men Do
actors: Charles Bronson, Theresa Saldana, Joseph Maher
description: Holland (Bronson), a retired killer, accepts the task of killing a certain Dr. Moloch who, in the service of a corrupt South American regime, commits atrocities of all kinds. Holland leaves for Guatemala, manages to get rid of Moloch's collaborators and lure him to a mine where, however, the miners themselves, victims of Moloch themselves, will carry out their revenge. Bronson was already sixty-three at the time and had already played the part of the executioner ad nauseam. Only for the most fanatical Bronson-addicted.

title: Shadowchaser
actors: Meg Foster, Frank Zagarino, Paul Koslo, Joss Ackland, Ricco Ross
description: The story is set in the United States, in the not too distant future. The President's daughter is kidnapped by some terrorists under the orders of an android who escaped from the laboratory where it was designed and built to order by the government. The ruthless criminals demand a ransom of fifty million dollars for the release of the hostage. The group is barricaded in a hospital; the federal agents laying siege to them believe that the best person to flush them out of their shelter may be the architect who designed the building. Sci-fi pretext for a normal action detective story with no particular signs.

title: Evilspeak
actors: R. G. Armstrong, Clint Howard, Joseph Cortese, Haywood Nelson
description: Persecuted by his comrades from the military academy, a boy takes his revenge by evoking the damned soul of a Spanish priest from the Middle Ages.

title: The Next Man
actors: Sean Connery, Cornelia Sharpe, Albert Paulsen, Adolfo Celi, Marco St. John, Ted Beniades, Charles Cioffi, Salem Ludwig, Holland Taylor
description: The OPEC front risks being shattered by the initiative of some pro-Western Arab countries led by Saudi Arabia. Ryad's Foreign Minister Khalil Abdul (Connery) launches a proposal for an alliance between the Arab countries and the state of Israel at the UN. Khalil, however, has only the weapons of reason and the enlightened protection of the CIA on his side, insufficient to save him from the clutches of the "hawks", who also bring a woman of a thousand charms (Sharpe). The historical-political framework in which the love story between the protagonists takes place is of a sickly naivety. Connery, in the role of a pacifist messiah, is here reduced to the role of the "white negro" and somehow forced to renounce the disturbing interpretation of the Arab leader of The Wind and the Lion. Sarafian showed no signs of recovery after this injury.

title: Blue Heat
actors: Brian Dennehy, Joe Pantoliano, Jeff Fahey, Bill Payton
description: Police Lieutenant Frank Daly is on the trail of a drug dealer. Daly is helped by a staff of young agents. Enraged because something always goes wrong in the investigation, he searches without a warrant a meat warehouse that serves as a cover for criminals. Suspended from service, after the death of one of his aides he resigns, followed by the others. Together they will continue the investigation outside the officialdom and will conclude it with a final battle where everything will be clarified: the good ones on one side, the bad ones on the other. Predictable action detective. Brian Dennehy is likeable, but everything in this movie has been really too much seen already.

title: Something Evil
actors: Sandy Dennis, Darren McGavin, Ralph Bellamy
description: A little family buys a farm in Pennsylvania. Having taken possession of the house, however, its occupants notice the existence of strange phenomena: the house is infested with otherworldly presences who try to possess the woman and upset the life of the family.
notes: Before making his big screen debut, Spielberg worked extensively for television. Witnesses of those years remain some films including this Something Evil, a horror in which some of the fantastic elements typical of much of his subsequent cinema are already present: from Close Encounters of the III type to Poltergeist produced by him. But in the draft state.

title: When Worlds Collide
actors: Richard Derr
description: Two planets that have entered the orbit of the Earth, condemn the planet to imminent destruction. Naive science fiction produced by George Pal. Oscar for special effects, some of which still maintain a certain effectiveness today.

title: Forty Guns
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Barry Sullivan, Dean Jagger, John Ericson, Gene Barry
description: A strong-willed landowner (Barbara Stanwyck) has bribed an assistant sheriff and rules Tombstone with her forty bravadoes. A federal agent (Barry Sullivan) goes to the scene to restore law and order. Samuel Fuller confirms himself as a robust innovator by breaking up many stereotypes of cinematic storytelling, not just westerns. The formal combination of daring sequence-shots and lightning-fast dramatic solutions is remarkable, while the screenplay (signed by the director himself) overturns the canonical balance of power between the sexes. The happy ending, as happened on other occasions, however, was imposed on Fuller by the production.

title: Benji the Hunted
actors: Red Steagall, Frank Inn, Nancy Francis, Mike Francis
description: Benji, a cute little dog, swims away from a violent storm at sea and witnesses the killing of a female puma leaving four cubs. He takes charge of them and carries them safely through various dangers and from ferocious predators (a bear, a wolf, a fox), until he finds a new adoptive mother of their own kind.
notes: Fascinating landscapes of Oregon, a story that tends to move and, at the same time, to create a dramatic tension, perfectly trained animals: a well-told tale for a young audience but which also captures those far from the green age.

title: Québec
actors: Corinne Calvet, John Barrymore jr., Barbara Rush, Patric Knowles
description: In Canada of the last century the revolt against the English domination mounts. A woman, betrothed to the rebel leader and with whom she also had a son, is coveted by an English officer who makes her believe that her man has been killed. She marries the officer, then discovers the truth and takes revenge. Little drama and little conviction in this feeble historical re-enactment.

title: The Train Robbers
actors: John Wayne, Ann-Margret, Ben Johnson, Christopher George
description: Belinda Lowe (Ann-Margret), a young widow, has two problems: rehabilitating her late husband's name and returning the half million dollars in gold he had stolen and hidden in the desert. So he hires Lane (Wayne), a former captain of the Northern Army, with the promise to leave him and his gang the reward promised to those who recover the loot. Once the mission is complete, with Belinda already gone with the gold, an insurance agent explains to Lane that the girl is a skilled con artist.
notes: Wayne is overweight and has watery eyes. His comradely and obvious duets with Ben Jonhson are pure nostalgia. After all, the whole film fails to take off.

title: 3:10 to Yuma
actors: Glenn Ford, Van Heflin, Felicia Farr, Leora Dana
description: Poor and honest farmer but very skilled marksman Dan Evans has to escort the bandit Ben Waden to Yuma. But the bandits barricade him in the town, and he must be able to jump out at the last minute with the prisoner and jump into the train. Excellent western with psychological veins, built on a very tight unity of time, place and action. In the tension between the individual and the community it can remember "High Noon". Breathtaking suspence in the finale, a famous song by Frankie Lane as a leitmotif.

title: Quick
actors: Teri Polo, Martin Donovan, Jeff Fahey, Tia Carrere, Robert Davi
description: A mysterious brunette kills a gangster and his bodyguard in a Los Angeles boutique. The brunette, who is actually blonde, is called Quick (Teri Polo) and is a killer on behalf of a drug agent. Quick, however, also accepts other assignments, such as that of a mobster who wants to get rid of Herschel, a witness kept under surveillance by the FBI. But there is something that stinks and Quick instead of killing Herschel kidnaps him and takes him away.A good action movie that maybe a little bit like Nikita, but it works well on his legs, thanks also to the interpretation of Teri Polo , an almost revelation.

title: Quintet
actors: Paul Newman, Vittorio Gassman, Fernando Rey, Bibi Andersson
description: The earth is in the midst of a new glaciation; humanity is exhausted. Among those who still have energy at their disposal, a game called Quintet, which has the life of the losers at stake, is very fashionable. Essex is a hunter who agrees to play to understand what the meaning of this experience is. Cinematic meditation by Robert Altman, full of symbols and based on the very rules of the game that gives it its title. Cold film (and certainly not for its setting), which stages a sort of last act of degraded humanity, openly aiming at an involvement that is more intellectual than emotional.

title: Rage and Honor
actors: Cynthia Rothrock, Richard Norton, Terri Treas, Brian Thompson
description: Kris Fairchild (Rothroch) is a high school teacher, but her real specialty is hand-to-hand combat. Preston Michaels (Norton) is a taciturn police officer who came undercover from Australia. The two embark on a mission together and, using kicks, punches and various forbidden blows, they manage to defeat a drug kingpin and with him also the corrupt cops. The film is not much more than a series of fights, one after the other, almost at random. To be recommended only to martial arts fanatics and especially those of Rothrock who, of her genre, is a little star.

title: Tales of Terror
actors: Vincent Price, Peter Lorre, Basil Rathbone, Debra Paget
description: Three episodes from E.A. Poe and adapted by Richard Matheson. The first (Morella) tells of a daughter who takes the place of the mummified body of her dead mother; the second (The Black Cat) of a betrayed husband who walls his wife and lover alive; the third (The case of Mr. Waldemar) of a hypnotist who postpones the death of a friend with grisly results. Roger Corman, producer and director, uses his tried and tested actors in the horror genre (Vincent Price above all, present in all three episodes) for a black fun with hallucinatory and grotesque tones, sometimes (as in the case of the cat that reveals a crime) not without a subtle hint of humor.

title: Tex
actors: Matt Dillon, Meg Tilly, Emilio Estevez
description: The hard and tenacious struggle for the conquest of the serenity of Tex, a fifteen-year-old motherless and neglected by his father, more concerned about his "rodeo", of which he is the undisputed champion, than his son. Tex would like to be calm, but the conditions to which he is subject are too burdensome for him and moreover the gap between dreams and reality is still too wide to bridge. Attempt of psychological grafting on the themes of the Old Frontier.

title: Boy on a Dolphin
actors: Sophia Loren, Alan Ladd, Clifton Webb, Laurence Naismith
description: Phaedra (Sophia Loren) is a sponge fisherman in the warm seas of Greece. One day, during a dive, he finds an archaeological find that depicts a boy riding a dolphin. Phaedra then decides to go to Athens to get explanations on the object found. Here he finds Jim Calder, a young American archaeologist who is concerned with arranging the precious relic. But everything does not go smoothly, Parmalee enters the scene, a rich gentleman, who tries, promising to Phaedra lavish rewards, to take possession of the statuette. Eventually Calder manages to stop Parmalee and marries the beautiful fisherwoman.

title: Rambo III
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Marc De Jonge, Spiros Focas
description: Rambo returns to action, after Vietnam, by going to Afghanistan to free an officer who is a prisoner of the Russians occupying the country. He succeeds in his intent and takes sides with the Afghan partisans who cannot bear the domination of Soviet tanks, led by more ferocious invaders than the Nazis.
notes: Stallone repeats for the third time his character of the avenger of few words who lets firearms do the talking. And the barrels are authentically pyrotechnic in a film where international political news is a pure pretext.

title: The Rare Breed
actors: James Stewart, Maureen O'Hara, Brian Keith, Juliet Mills
description: Martha (O'Hara), an Irish widow, travels to Texas with her daughter determined to mate a strange Hereford bull to an American cow, convinced that she can produce a more resilient breed of cattle. In the adventures towards the realization of her project, the woman is helped by the rude cowboy Sam Burnett (Stewart).
notes: Far from the usual schemes, but narratively fatuous and slow, it is an almost pathetic twilight western.

title: Rancho Notorius
actors: Marlene Dietrich, Mel Ferrer, Arthur Kennedy, Gloria Henry, William Frawley, Lisa Ferraday, John Raven, Jack Elam, George Reeves, Frank Ferguson, Francis McDonald
description: Vern is in pursuit of the man who raped and killed his fiancée. Upon learning of the criminal and outlaw refuge where he has gone to hide, Vern joins him, helped by a friend. Here reigns a woman, Amber, who falls in love with Vern, who, however, will not give up on revenge. In the final showdown, Amber too will lose her life. Melodramatic and flamboyant, it takes place between baroque sets, to the sound of a song of great emotional intensity; a decidedly unusual western, which in its genre has some affinity with Johnny Guitar alone. Famous are the clashes on the set between Lang and Dietrich.

title: Mighty Joe Young
actors: Terry Moore, Ben Johnson, Robert Armstrong, Frank McHugh
description: When her father dies, young Jane is left alone on her farm in Congo with a domestic gorilla. An impresario proposes to take the animal to a US circus. The gorilla is successful, but suffers from nostalgia. Director and author of the special effects are the same as King Kong, with less impressive results. Enjoyable special effects by Willis O'Brien and his pupil Ray Harryhausen.

title: Red River
actors: John Wayne, Montgomery Clift, Joanne Dru, Walter Brennan
description: Texas, end of the Civil War. Cattle breeder Thomas Dunson has managed, at the cost of many sacrifices, to raise a huge herd. Helped by his adopted son Garth he decides to lead her beyond the Red River, where he can sell her at an affordable price. But on the way, things get complicated: Dunson is an overly tyrannical boss and Garth is unwilling to shut up. Hawsks dazzling debut in the western, with an epic film focused on the clash (mythical but also psychologically complex) between the old Wayne and the young Clift, with all the nervous sensitivity of post-war actors. The scene of the herd crossing the river is very famous.

title: Red Scorpion
actors: Dolph Lundgren, M. Emmet Walsh, Al White, Carmen Argenziano
description: Nikolaj, a brave Red Army soldier, is commissioned to eliminate the rebel leader of an African nation, but the mission fails. Taken prisoner by the natives, he was able to witness the inhumane persecutions of the Russian army against local populations. The political background of the story is the least vulgar thing about this film. Joseph Zito's direction and Lundgren's performance are even worse.

title: The Frozen Dead
actors: Dana Andrews, Anna Palk, Philip Gilbert, Karel Stepanek
description: Dr. Norberg (Andrews) keeps the hibernating bodies of some Third Reich hierarchs in his laboratory near London. When he is ordered to "thaw" them in view of a future Nazi rescue, a series of terrifying events begins that will end only thanks to the force of the thought of a girl whose head is detached from her body. Shot in England, the film is definitely on the heavy side in terms of gruesome visions, but the clumsy script by Herbert J. Leder, also producer and director, does not know how to put such a heap of horrors to good use. Too bad, because the idea was really bizarre.

title: Land of the Pharaohs
actors: Jack Hawkins, Joan Collins, Alexis Minotis, Dewey Martin
description: Cheops, a powerful Egyptian pharaoh, is having a mighty pyramid built. While receiving the kings of neighboring countries, he falls in love with the beautiful Nellifer (Joan Collins) who becomes his bride. But the woman begins to plot against him and comes to organize his murder. Her thirst for power is thwarted by the priests who, with a stratagem, get rid of her immediately after the sovereign's funeral. Kolossal in costume directed by one of the masters of American cinema. It is not among his best achievements, but it is made with a singular care for the genre, and with an eye to the madness of the story that some have called Brechtian (the comments of the supporting actors). William Faulkner is among the screenwriters, but he limited himself to supervising the dialogues. Production design by Alexandre Trauner.

title: The Wraith
actors: Charlie Sheen, Nick Cassavetes, Sherilyn Fenn, Griffin O'Neal, Clint Howard
description: Packard Walsh has a garage in an Arizona town, but he enjoys smashing cars in reckless races by trade. Packard also has another craze: he is convinced that Keri is his girlfriend, even if the girl denies it. Then one day a black Turbo Interceptor arrives from the sky (literally materializes among the cacti). It takes a while for the final showdown, but the avenger ultimately wins. It's the film with the world record for daddy children: Nick Cassavetes is John's son, Charlie Sheen is Martin's son, Griffin O'Neal is Ryan's son and Clint Howard is Ron's brother. But in this case the good blood lies, because the film is void.

title: Belle Starr
actors: Randolph Scott, Dana Andrews, Gene Tierney
description: After the American Secession War, Belle, intrepid young girl from the South, after refusing the tight court of a northern captain, falls in love with Starr, a Confederate who continues the struggle as a bandit, and marries him. But her beloved and her brother are captured by a jealous Union captain, once rejected by the beautiful girl and who has now followed in her husband's footsteps. A little fictionalized life of the most famous outlaw in the West, with a splendid Tierney.

title: The Tracker
actors: Kris Kristofferson, Scott Wilson, Mark Moses, David Huddleston
description: Noble Adams (Kristofferson) is a retired old bounty killer who gets back into business to track down a religious fanatic (Wilson) who has become an outlaw and has been mass murdering and raping minors. In the research Noble is accompanied by his son, one who has received an education, has been in college and is not very familiar with either his father or the world. Guillermin, more famous in the war genre and in detective stories, is making his television debut here with a western that is a bit too verbose, but not despicable.

title: Call of the Wild
actors: Ricky Schroder, Duncan Fraser, Gordon Tootoosis, Mia Sara
description: Buck, a beautiful German Shepherd, is stolen from his family and sold to Alaska as a sled dog in the mythical days of the gold rush. His fate inevitably crosses over with that of John Thorton, the young heir to a rich timber company who, eager to build a future without the help of his family, is attracted by the charm of the gold rush. Arriving in Alaska, John meets the irascible Charlie, an Indian with whom he befriends.
notes: One of the worst film versions of the London novel. Alan Smithee is the conventional name that is used when a director decides not to sign a film.

title: Ring of Fire II
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Maria Ford
description: Johnny (Don "the Dragon" Wilson) is an unlucky guy: he loves Julie, he gets engaged to her, accompanies her to buy the engagement ring and, just at that moment, robbers arrive in the shop. The girl is injured, Johnny sets off in pursuit of the criminals and manages to kill one. The matter seems over and the couple resume a normal life, but someone, in the gang, meditates revenge and meditates tremendously; In fact, Johnny does not end up in the crosshairs of the criminals, but his girlfriend. We see that the first Ring of Fire must have been liked by someone if Richard W. Munchkin found the money and the courage to make another one. In this second part, however, neither the kickboxing fights nor the stubbornly astonished expression of Don Wilson vainly balanced by the "pink" touch of his partner.

title: Rio Bravo
actors: John Wayne, Dean Martin, Angie Dickinson, Ricky Nelson, Walter Brennan
description: The sheriff arrests a member of the ranching family who dominates the city for murder. It is open warfare. The man with the star has an elderly aide who is joined by the former deputy, Dude, recovered from alcoholism, and the young gunslinger Colorado. Dude thus regains his dignity and the sheriff agrees to have fallen in love with the beautiful Feathers. However, the fight against the other family members and their henchmen is still long and bitter.
notes: An apparently traditional and stylized western, in which however great ideas of cinema find space: one of Hawks' masterpieces. The film dictated Angie "Miss Legs" Dickinson; rock star Ricky Nelson was Colorado.

title: Rio Conchos
actors: Richard Boone, Anthony Franciosa, Stuart Whitman, Jim Brown
description: A former Southern officer is arrested by Captain Haven for a shooting with some Indians. It turns out, however, that the gun is part of a shipment of weapons stolen from the army in a rather mysterious way. Following this lead, Captain Haven discovers that a crazed ex-Southerner officer, believing that the Secession War is not over yet, wants to sell those weapons to the Indians for them to rise up.
notes: It's an unusual western, full of weird situations and weird characters. Perhaps the best work of its director. It's a violent film, but also a sentimental one, full of chases and shootings. The psychologies of the characters are well defined.

title: Rio Lobo
actors: John Wayne, Jorge Rivero, Jennifer O'Neill, Chris Mitchum
description: During the Secession War, the Northern Colonel McNally witnesses helplessly a clever blow by the Southern troops who, commanded by Captain Cordona, steal a load of gold destined for the Northern troops. After the war is over, McNally tracks down Cordona and gets her help in identifying the traitors who allowed that strike. One is dead, the other, still alive, tyrannizes the population of Rio Lobo, allied with the brutal local sheriff.
notes: The last film made by Howard Hawks, it concludes a western triptych that began ten years earlier with "A dollar of honor" and continued in 1966 with "El Dorado". Not his best film, senile and tired, but how can you not be moved?

title: Back to the Future
actors: Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson, Crispin Glover
description: Marty meets Dr. Brown, a spirited guy who invented a fully functional time machine. As soon as Brown finishes explaining to the boy how to use the vehicle, the Libyan terrorists arrive who he has stolen the plutonium for food and kill him. Pursued in turn Marty activates the mechanism and ends straight in 1955, where he meets his parents when they are still children. A classic, now, a film that gives all the weight of Reaganian nostalgia for the 50s. Ingenious script, lively and energetic direction by Zemeckis, Spielberg production. A cult "futuristic" execution by Johnny B. Goode.

title: Return of the Jedi
actors: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
description: Luke Skywalker (Hamill) has long been battling the evil empire with his friends, including adventurer Han Solo (Ford). They are preparing for the final confrontation and Luke learns that the terrible Dart Vader, the greatest enemy of the rioters, is in fact his father. The insurrection is unsuccessful and Luke is captured by the emperor's troops who try to bring the young man to his side. But Luke does not give up, he wants to kill the tyrant and to do so he fights with his father and seriously injures him. Third and final episode of the "Star Wars" trilogy created by George Lucas: meticulously curated special effects and a story that incorporates all the traditional passages of adventure cinema.

title: Challenge to Lassie
actors: Edmund Gwenn, Donald Crisp, Geraldine Brooks, Reginald Owen
description: Lassie is far away, but her instincts bring her home in time to say goodbye to the master who has died and is about to be buried. Third film dedicated to the dog with the heart of gold; here a true story is told, brought back from the Scottish chronicles of the last century. In return, Liz Taylor is missing in the part of the owner. Only for dog-loving children.

title: Robocop
actors: Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Dan O'Herlihy, Ronny Cox
description: Junkies, rapists and murderers are rampant in a Detroit next venture. An automaton built to be an invincible guardian of order fails the test. Using the mutilated body of Agent Murphy, killed by the deadliest gang in town, another robot is built. But the machine in addition to having some physiognomic traits of the previous human nature, retains some traces of memory and therefore also the capacity for emotions.
notes: Verhoeven makes his Hollywood debut with a fairly ambitious film. If the skin of the story is that of a technological and spectacular, its core is that of a resurrection. With evident influences from comics, but also from the most advanced science fiction literature (Philip K. Dick), Verhoeven directs a hard, dizzying and, all in all, not very consoling film. Peter Weller will then star in Cronenberg's "Naked Lunch".

title: Robocop 2
actors: Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Galyn Görg, Gabriel Damon
description: The drug Nuke circulates in Detroit, created to subject the population to the will of powerful gangsters. Robocop, the robot cop with Agent Murphy's brains, takes out all the thugs he finds in his path. But the big crime bosses (among them there is also a twelve year old, Hob, sadistic and precocious), build another mechanical monster. In the final battle between the two androids, the good one wins, but the Great Old Man, supreme leader of all crime, survives.
notes: The director is no longer Paul Verhoeven, replaced by Irvin Kershner, and the charge of brutal ferocity has increased. On the other hand, all the irony has been lost.

title: Rollerball
actors: James Caan, John Houseman, Maud Adams, John Beck
description: In the world of the future, the most popular sport is the very violent rollerball. In reality it is much more than a sport, it is a form of consensus, a way to control the population. Champion for a decade was Jonathan, but the bosses have decided that he must lose by now. He, of course, is not there.
notes: One of the first sci-fi films with socio-political backgrounds to reach the general public. The "rollerball" is invented to harness the aggression of the people, and in this the future looks like ancient Rome (panem et circenses). In hindsight, many considered the film overrated: in fact, a thousand copied it.

title: Missing in Action
actors: Chuck Norris, M. Emmet Walsh, Lenore Kasdorf, James Hong
description: As an American mission to Vietnam seeks the truth about "missing in action", Colonel Braddock gets the confession of a Vietnamese general on a secret prison camp. Forced to hide temporarily in Saigon, Braddock will then be able, with a very daring action, to rescue some prisoners and to mislead the statements of the Vietnamese who denied their existence.
notes: Tailored to Chuck Norris' inexpressive virulence and in the footsteps of "Rambo", the film relies on frantic pace, action sequences. But it's Z-series action.

title: So Red the Rose
actors: Margaret Sullavan, Randolph Scott, Walter Connolly, Robert Cumming
description: The misfortunes of a wealthy southern U.S. planter family during the Civil War. The young Valette sees her brother Edward die and, after the defeat of the Confederates, she also loses contact with her cousin Duncan, with whom she is in love. However, the defeat did not destroy everything and the two young men manage to marry and return to their land to try to rebuild, at least in part, the ancient plantation. The idea was good and came four years earlier than Gone with the Wind. The result is pleasant, but economically it was a disaster.

title: Black Rose
actors: Tyrone Power, Orson Welles, Cécile Aubry
description: Two horsemen leave England and set out for China. Along the way they put themselves at the service of an adventurer who wants to take the power of the Great Khan: great battles and adventures await them. One will die, the other will find the love of the beautiful Miriam called "Black Rose".
notes: Great technicolor and great adventures, a sumptuous and good school Hollywood film.

title: Runaway
actors: Tom Selleck, Cynthia Rhodes, Gene Simmons, Kirstie Alley
description: Sergeant Ramsay is a widower and lives with his baby. He is the leader of a team whose job it is to neutralize robots when they "go mad". In the course of his work he finds himself having to face a criminal who uses robots, specially diverted, for his crimes. He kidnaps Ramsay's son to blackmail the agent. Directed and scneeggiatura by Chricton, but the tension has some major subsidence. Gene Simmons, former Kiss singer, also appears.

title: Rocky Mountain
actors: Errol Flynn, Patrice Wymore, Scott Forbes
description: At the beginning of 1865 the American Civil War seems marked for the southerners. General Lee entrusts Captain Lafe Barstow with the task of recruiting new soldiers even among the outlaws. On the way to the Rocky Mountains, however, he will also have to guard against the threatening presence of the Indians.
notes: A routine film that has the only characteristic of being the last western starring Erroll Flynn.

title: Innerspace
actors: Dennis Quaid, Martin Short, Meg Ryan, Kevin McCarthy
description: Pilot Tuck Pendelton agrees to undergo a miniaturization experiment to be injected, locked in a capsule, into the body of a rabbit. Instead, he will end up in that of a hypochondriac supermarket clerk. A group of thugs hunt down the latter to get hold of the invention in order to sell it to the highest bidder. In 1966 Viaggio hallucinante proposed a man "inside" another, but here much of the story is seen from the outside. Spielberg produces a film skillfully directed by the whimsical Joe Dante, starring the good Quaid, the no less good Short and (at the time) nice Meg Ryan.

title: The Rescue
actors: Kevin Dillon, Marc Price, Ned Vaughn, Christine Harmos
description: After the end of the Korean conflict, an American submarine with important military secrets is damaged in North Korean waters. The four officers in charge of rescuing the commander and destroying the submarine are captured by Communist troops and the American government, to avoid diplomatic incidents, washes its hands. But there are their daring children and an inevitable victory in sight. In a film like this, you don't go too far, but here we are beyond all limits of decency in terms of rhetorical emphasis, disconcerting naivety and conventionality of the dialogues. Too below the guard level.> I>

title: Savage Sam
actors: Brian Keith, Tommy Kirk, Kevin Corcoran, Dewey Martin
description: During a raid for the purpose of stealing horses, a group of Comanches Indians find themselves near a remote farm where, at that moment, there are only three children, two brothers and a friend of theirs, with a dog, named Sam. . The parents have in fact moved away and will not return before evening. Usual Disney production that replaces the adult protagonists with the trio of minors.

title: Sam Whiskey
actors: Burt Reynolds, Clint Walker, Ossie Davis, William Schallert, Woodrow Parfrey, Angie Dickinson
description: Sam Whiskey is a young cowboy looking for adventure. On his wanderings he meets a widow still in her prime who entrusts him with the task of recovering a fortune in gold bars from a river bed. Sam will then have to deliver the treasure to the state mint. To accomplish the feat, he hires a black farrier and an old inventor. Having recovered the load, between policemen and criminals, they will encounter many difficulties in concluding the mission.
notes: Paradoxical enough, the story, initially well thought out, becomes rather cumbersome in the final part. Perfectly at ease, in the role of the likeable rogue, the priceless Burt Reynolds.

title: Return to Paradise
actors: Gary Cooper, Barry Jones, Roberta Haynes, Moira MacDonald
description: Arrived on an island in the Pacific, Mr. Morgan immediately clashes with the Puritan pastor Cobet who governs the community. Things get worse when Morgan begins a relationship with a native. Based on a James A. Michener novel, the film is naturally in technicolor. Cooper goes to great lengths to make the story believable and the result isn't unpleasant.

title: Blood on the Moon
actors: Robert Mitchum, Robert Preston, Barbara Bel Geddes, Walter Brennan
description: To force John Lufton to sell him the cattle for little money, Tate Rilling hires the gunslinger Jim Garry, but he, realizing that the matter is shady, fights for Lufton. Wise constructs an original western about the ranchers-farmers conflict with many erotic and ambiguous solicitations, from noir (Mitchum, photography by Micholas Musuraca).

title: Santiago
actors: Alan Ladd, Rossana Podestà, Lloyd Nolan
description: An adventurer hired for an arms transport to Cuba in 1898 confronts bandits, Spanish artillery and an old enemy. Eventually, with a beautiful rebel, he embraces the cause of the Caribbean revolutionaries.
notes: Naive story, but at a good pace and with some emotion.

title: Dead Heat
actors: Treat Williams, Joe Piscopo, Vincent Price, Lindsay Frost
description: In the hell of the metropolis, here are two agents capable of risking the unspeakable to carry out their duty. We will see them grappling with robbers capable of resurrecting from the underworld and with cars that are hardly called demonic. If this were not enough, the two will also find themselves in the process (again for their commendable sense of duty) of being transformed into zombies. Detective in horror sauce that focuses on special effects (discreet), but is not saved from the banality of situations and dialogues. Detail for the great Price.

title: Quick Change
actors: Bill Murray, Geena Davis, Randy Quaid, Jason Robards
description: Grimm, the beautiful Phyllis and Loomis rob a bank and sneak under the nose of police chief Rotzinger. On their way to the airport, the three are also robbed, but manage to save the loot. Then they run into a foreign taxi driver, with new complications due to his imperfect English and, always chased by the police, they chase a plane among a thousand other hilarious setbacks. The film is remembered for a guessed opening and for the good cast, dominated by the effective Bill Murray (Grimm). For the rest, the story is quite messed up and the lack of comic streak is also diverted by a decidedly incongruous romantic aspect.

title: Scaramouche
actors: Stewart Granger, Janet Leigh, Mel Ferrer, Eleanor Parker
description: André Moreau, to avenge the death of a friend of his, hides in a company of comedians under the mask of Scaramouche. The Revolution rages and Scaramouche injures numerous representatives of the nobility in a duel, before finally managing to clash with the fearsome Marquis De Mayne. The most beautiful duel in the history of cinema is the culminating moment of this sumptuous and magical film, a remake of the first "Scaramouche" directed in 1923 by Rex Ingram. A classic of swashbuckling, which makes fun of itself with great panache.

title: Deadly Bet
actors: Jeff Wincott, Stephen Vincent Leigh, Charlene Tilton
description: Angelo does the nonsense of loving kickboxing and betting on matches. As if that weren't enough, once his fiancée Isabella bets with Rico and inevitably loses. For the rest of the film we witness the repentance of Angelo who stops drinking, stops gambling and eventually gets the girl back. As for his love ... Angelo has to sweat another seven shirts to get him back. The plot is the same as I play his wife ... in Las Vegas, but at least there were James Caan and Nicholas Cage. Instead here we are grappling with Jeff Wincott and Stephen Vincent Leigh. In a minor role is former boxing champion Ray "Boom Boom" Mancini.

title: Clash of the Titans
actors: Laurence Olivier, Claire Bloom, Maggie Smith, Ursula Andress, Harry Hamlin
description: Perseus was born from one of the many terrestrial loves of the god Jupiter. He is destined to become a hero. With the help of Medusa's head and thanks to Jupiter's paternal surveillance, Perseus defeats a sea monster and gets Andromeda's hand.
notes: Confusing and full of delays, he ends up losing even what little good there is from time to time (like Laurence Olivier who enjoys playing Zeus). Ray Harryhausen's princely cast and well-crafted, albeit pre-electronic, special effects are not enough to avoid the landslide.

title: The Monster Squad
actors: André Cower, Robby Kicer, Stephen Macht
description: To get hold of an ancient, precious amulet, all possible monsters meet in a small town in the United States: Dracula, Frankenstein, the Mummy, the Wolf Man and the Monster of the Black Lagoon. As the authorities groped in the dark, a team of enterprising kids defeat the monsters. Horror comedy for kids, with all the characters of classic horror, polite and stupid. The Italian title looked like "Police School".

title: The Tin Star
actors: Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins
description: A bounty hunter and a rookie sheriff against bandits. Mann is a guarantee, the two protagonists offer a remarkable duel of interpretations. Although the film is one of Mann's less personal, and Dudley Nichols' script less "mythological" than the usual scripts written by Borden Chase for the director.

title: The Mark of Zorro
actors: Tyrone Power, Basil Rathbone, J. Edward Bromberg, Linda Darnell
description: Diego de Vega (Power), son of the Spanish governor of California, returns from Madrid and discovers that during his absence a dishonest schemer has ousted his father and oppresses the population. Diego, while everyone believes him to be a spineless pleasure-seeker, hidden under the mysterious identity of the fearless Zorro, infallible swordsman, punishes the wicked and restores legality.
notes: The adventures of one of the most well-known characters in cinematic mythology are narrated by Mamoulian with great panache, and Power rages in the hero's dual personality, not making Douglas Fairbanks regret the silent version.

title: The Wild Angels
actors: Peter Fonda, Nancy Sinatra, Bruce Dern, Diane Ladd
description: Heavenly Blues (Fonda) is the leader of a gang of Wild Angels, who clash with a rival group to recover a motorcycle. The owner of the motorbike, Loser, dies and his companions, challenging the agents, decide to organize his funeral, complete with the homily of the pastor. After exhausting his forays into the universe of Allan Poe, Corman immediately puts this film in the pipeline in which the anxieties and intolerances of a group of marginalized people in perennial war with the American society of well-being and order are reflected. In the character of Peter Fonda we can already see the future "Captain America" ​​of Easy Rider.

title: The Searchers
actors: John Wayne, Jeffrey Hunter, Vera Miles, Natalie Wood, Dorothy Jordan
description: After the Secession War is over, Ethan returns home. He reunites with his brother, sister-in-law, their two daughters Debbie and Lucy and their adopted son Martin, of Indian descent. One day Reverend Clayton arrives at the farm with a group of settlers and convinces Ethan and Martin to join them to hunt down the cattle-raiding Indians. But while the men are away, the Comanches attack the farm, massacre the parents and kidnap the two girls. Lucy is found dead; Ethan searches for Debbie, along with Martin.
notes: Ideologically much more nuanced than the subject says (it testifies to the complexity of the character played by John Wayne), the film is fascinating both on the narrative and on the visual level, one of the most beautiful of Ford. A melancholy, cruel ballad about the passage of time and the crisis of the American myth.

title: Bloodsport
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres, Norman Burton
description: Warlike spirit, Frank is a military pilot and in his spare time he cultivates martial arts under the guidance of a Japanese great master. Attracted by the annual Kumi-te challenge, a ferocious and semi-illegal specialty, he travels to Hong Kong where he defeats all opponents and wins the title.
notes: Inspired by a real character, the film keeps what it promises in terms of competitive emotions, taking advantage of the presence of the protagonist. Around us it combines a love story, a conflict with the authorities and a contour of muscle sports, violence and more.

title: The Premature Burial
actors: Ray Milland, Hazel Court, Richard Ney, Heather Angel, Alan Napier
description: Guy Garrel (Ray Milland) is terrified of being buried alive. He marries Emily, daughter of his master, Dr. Gault, and has a coffin built for a possible spill. When Garrel finds out that his father has been buried while still alive, he suffers a seemingly deadly shock. Inspired only vaguely by Edgar Allan Poe, Corman creates a film that is typically his own: without great means, hypnotic rhythm, visionary surges accentuated by bright colors. Instead of the usual Vincent Price here is MIlland, who is doing very well.

title: Shaft in Africa
actors: Richard Roundtree, Vonetta McGee, Frank Finley, Neda Arneric
description: The son of an emir investigates a slave trade that takes place between Africa and France. The young man just got his hands on important clues when he is killed. His father entrusts the research and revenge to the African American detective John Shaft. He manages to board the ship that transports the poor wretches. Thanks to the help of the beautiful Jazar, Shaft arrives, among many dangers, at the heart of the organization ...
notes: Hero of blaxploitation, Shaft rises here almost to a mythical figure, making an impossible historical redemption of black people. Good idea, but management is a mediocre adventure. Last cinematic chapter before the Singleton remake.

title: Shakma
actors: Christopher Atkins, Amanda Wyss, Roddy McDowall
description: Professor Sorensen has a research center and a dangerous passion for games. One evening he locks up his young researchers in the institute together with the baboon Shakma. It is a simulation game in which the boys, with Sorensen guiding them with a walkie talkie, will have to save the "princess" Kim. But it doesn't take long to realize that it's not just a game and that Shakma is serious about it.Built on a miserable budget, the Hugh Parks and Tom Logan film is a pretty amazing horror, full of action and also nastiness. The actors are all respectable, including Baboon Typhoon, in the lead role.

title: She
actors: Sandahl Bergman, Quin Kessler, David Goss, Harrison Muller jr.
description: A planetary nuclear disaster brings back the law of the strongest and upsets the usual social rules. Male superiority is overturned, figures of female leaders emerge like She, the beautiful and daring protagonist.

title: Shenandoah
actors: James Stewart, Rosemary Forsyth, Doug McClure, Katharine Ross
description: Charlie Anderson lives happily in Virginia on his ranch with his seven children. The Secession war that troubles the United States does not shake its pacifism. The war will cause deaths among the Andersons, but eventually the survivors will find each other.
notes: Despite the presence in the cast of excellent actors and the beautiful battle shots, the action directed by Victor McLaglen's son is plagued by too many slownesses, which together with an excess of rhetoric prevent the success of this classic western.

title: Shogun
actors: Richard Chamberlain, Toshiro Mifune, Yoko Shimada
description: Blackthorne, a talented captain of the English navy, is shipwrecked in Japan. We are in the seventeenth century and the country is divided between two contenders, each of which also represents conflicting Western interests. Toronaga, who uses the support of Blackthorne, manages, after many adventures, to get the better of him and to be named Shogun, that is the warlord. Blackthorne also makes a career, but at his side there is no longer his beloved wife, who died in combat. An unsuccessful attempt of a western version of martial arts films, in which the talent of Toshiro Mifune, interpreter of the best films, is also wasted by Kurosawa.

title: For Heaven's Sake
actors: Clifton Webb, Joan Bennett, Robert Cummings, Edmund Gwenn
description: Jeff Bolton, theater director, and his wife Lydia, actress, still have no children after eight years of marriage; so Item, pure spirit, is waiting to incarnate in their designated daughter. Two angels, Carlo and Arturo, are sent to earth to make the Boltons decide. Carlo gets into trouble, but Item intercedes for him and so things get better.
notes: Specialist Setaon, with a good storyline, a brilliant script and suitable actors, made a very enjoyable fantastic comedy.

title: Silverado
actors: Kevin Costner, Kevin Kline, Scott Glenn, Danny Glover, Marvin J. McIntyre, Jeff Goldblum, Linda Hunt, Lynn Whitfield, Rosanna Arquette, Rusty Meyers, Brian Dennehy
description: Four fellow adventurers, former prisoners but nice and generous, are headed to Silverado, in the Far West: Emmett and his brother Jake, Paden and Mal, a black man. Arriving at their destination, they find that Mal's father has been killed and his land occupied by a landowner, backed by the sheriff. In addition, Emmett's brother-in-law is also killed: there is enough to trigger the reaction of our heroes. Kasdan tries to resurrect the western in the middle of the eighties, aiming to involve the younger audience. But his film, although at times compelling, has an inevitable archaeological and melancholy background.

title: Sindbad the Sailor
actors: Douglas Fairbanks jr., Maureen O'Hara, Anthony Quinn
description: In search of a fabulous treasure, Sinbad competes with an emir, a wizard and a beautiful. Exotic adventures of great charm, with a good cast and beautiful photography by George Barnes.

title: Whispering Smith
actors: Alan Ladd, Brenda Marshall
description: Smith returns from the West and finds that his fiancée Mary has married Sinclair, an old friend who like him works for the railways. Smith, who is tasked with defending the line from Indians and outlaws, discovers that Sinclair is the brain of a gang of raiders and tries to convince him to get back on track. The speeches are useless, the last word will be for the guns. Shot with a steady hand by Leslie Fenton, director and actor of British origin, it is a successful grafting of elements of the detective story on the western, the genres most congenial to the excellent dark handsome Alan Ladd.

title: Society
actors: Billy Warlock, Connie Danese, Ben Slack, Evan Rickards
description: Scion of rich bourgeois, pupil of an exclusive school, Bill is haunted by horrible nightmares. They forcibly cure him with massive doses of psychotropic drugs, but the boy is not paranoid; suffers from severe distress towards his family. Fearful of being the victim of a perverse game, Bill is afraid of everyone and distrusts the people around him. In an attempt to find an explanation for his problems, he is helped by Milo and David, two of his very dear friends. Originality is not lacking in this psycho-thriller-horror that targets the golden world of Beverly Hills and translates a ruthless political metaphor into images. Certain hesitations in the direction, especially in the first part, are compensated for in the progression of the story. It all culminates in a memorable erotic cannibal orgy.

title: Soldier Blue
actors: Candice Bergen, Peter Strauss, Donald Pleasence, John Anderson
description: Kathy, "freed" by soldiers after two years spent in a Cheyennes tribe who had kidnapped her, has learned to understand the Indians' reasons. An expedition is organized to permanently destroy the village; the mission is carried out with ferocity, despite the attempts at dialogue by the leader Lupo Piebald. A young soldier in love with Kathy refuses to follow orders and ends up in chains.
