Film that had a notable impact at the time, due to its openly pro-Indian position; also readable as a figurative denunciation of the war in Vietnam. But it is not among the best westerns of the period, even if the final massacre still has its impact today.

title: Good Cop, Bad Cop
actors: David Keith, Robert Hays, Stacy Keach, Pamela Anderson
description: Donna, the daughter of the mayor of Los Angeles, is found murdered. The police investigate, but the mayor does not give up and also instructs a former policeman named Mace to investigate. To help him in the search for the truth, Mace finds allies a prostitute and Donna's ex-boyfriend but finds himself against the police themselves who not only hinder his attempts, but in the end even tries to frame him. A routine detective story populated with predictable characters and twists already seen. Directing Prior, then, doesn't help distinguish this from other films. To report only the presence of Stacy Keach now fifty, but always in shape.

title: Frogs
actors: Ray Milland, Joan Van Ark, Sam Elliott, Adam Roarke, Judy Pace
description: A guest in the villa of the Crockett, powerful farmers in the South, Pickett, a young environmental journalist, discovers that the fortunes built by the tyrannical patriarch Jason rest on the insane spread of poisonous substances in the environment. It's too late to avoid disaster: nature rebels with a monstrous invasion of frogs ...
notes: "So bad that for many it is already a cult" says the Mereghetti dictionary. Amateur direction, absurd dialogues, characters thrown into disarray and all kinds of animals in the foreground to increase their threat. A real fun for lovers of the _eco vengeance_ trend (nature that rebels), but a real cinematic environmental disaster.

title: Black Belt
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Deirdre Imershein, Matthias Hues
description: Jack Dillon is a policeman who went on his own. Rock star Shanna contacts him to act as her bodyguard; Jack quickly discovers that the task is rather complicated: there is Shanna's former agent who has decided to take revenge by taking her out and there is a serial killer by the angelic name of John Sweet who continues to send her death messages. Sweet, by the way, is the son of a former rock star traumatized in his youth by his mother's uninhibited sexual mores. Jack Dillon, a kickboxing expert, kills rivals and makes the singer fall in love with himself. Ugly In America, they call things like exploitation and they work like this: you take the subject of a probably successful film in the works and hastily assemble a similar story so that it comes out before the most important film. This is the "poor" version of Bodyguard.

title: Talons of the Eagle
actors: Jalal Merhi, Billy Blanks, James Hong, Priscilla Barnes
description: Two agents of the Goddess have been killed and two of their colleagues are in charge of the investigation. La Dea is the official agency of the United States set up specifically to counter the increasingly rampant drug trafficking and it is precisely against a drug kingpin that the two find themselves fighting. With muscle and karate, our two heroes manage to sneak into the criminal organization. But they will find that, in order to overcome their true enemy, they will have to go as far as Hong Kong. One of the two protagonists, Jalal Merhi, a true specialist in films of this genre, is also the producer. And this is the only way for him to be able to approach a set and participate in the making of a film. Michael Kennedy, on the other hand, was chosen directly from the telephone directory.

title: The Lawless Breed
actors: Rock Hudson, Julie Adams
description: Rock Hudson is a gunslinger accused of murder; however, he acted in self-defense and is about to turn himself in when he is involved in another shooting in which he kills a sheriff. He escapes with a woman, makes him lose track and becomes a farmer, but the past chases him and he is soon tracked down. He ends up in prison. After several years he leaves and returns home where his wife and grown-up son are waiting for him.
notes: Despite the complicated story, the film stands out for a robust narrative vein.

title: Deadlock
actors: Rutger Hauer, Mimi Rogers, Joan Chen, Stephen Tobolowsky, James Remar
description: A violent and indomitable criminal is locked up in a futuristic prison (sarcastically called Holiday Village), who constantly thinks about escaping. Which will be difficult, as each prisoner has a well-welded explosive around his neck that blows his head off if he tries to get away beyond a certain distance. Of course he manages to escape, but that damn collar continues to haunt him. Combining prison and science fiction, Teague tells a story full of deaths, escapes, explosions, with sadistic warders and corrupt directors that Rutger Hauer proudly stands up to. Watchable.

title: Shocker
actors: Mitch Pileggi, Michael Murphy, Peter Berg, Jessica Craven, Camille Cooper
description: In a small town in the American province, a serial killer is arrested and sentenced. But the discharges of the electric chair, instead of killing him, download the ferocious killer in the television frequencies. From the inventor of the "mythical" Freddy Krueger another step forward in the escalation of horror. Less compact and brilliant than "Nightmare", but with an equally acute and "sociological" basic idea.

title: The Golden Blade
actors: Rock Hudson, Piper Laurie, George Macready
description: Arun, a young man from Basra, goes to Baghdad to find out who killed his father. The only clue in his possession is a medallion taken from the killers. In the fabulous city he meets Kailusa, the caliph's daughter, who falls in love with him. In Baghdad, Arun then comes into possession of a fairy sword that gives great powers to its owner. Kailusa then announces a tournament, with her hand up for grabs, confident that Arun will win, but the evil son of a minister steals his sword just before the tournament begins ...
notes: Conventional adventure film made in a papier-mâché setting. Kitsch is fun.

title: The Magic Sword
actors: Basil Rathbone, Anne Helm, Gary Lockwood
description: The evil wizard Lodak (Rathbone) has kidnapped Princess Elena and plans to feed her to a hideous two-headed dragon. To save the girl, Giorgio rushes, helped by six knights and a magical armor that his mother, the witch Sibilia, has given him. After seven dangerous tests, Giorgio frees the princess and marries her: special low-cost effects for a film that is not perfectly successful.

title: Saddle the Wind
actors: Robert Taylor, John Cassavetes, Julie London, Donald Crisp
description: Tony returns to the farm that his brother Steve has been running in his absence. The two brothers love each other but have a very different character: Tony is bossy at least as much as Steve is reasonable. So the reactions of the two towards the claims of the cowboys are different: Steve is willing to negotiate while Tony confronts them with the gun in his hand. Found guilty of murder, Tony runs away hunted by the sheriff: once joined by a group of men including Steve, he will prefer suicide to capture. It is the character of John Cassavetes (future director and here an excellent actor), to make the difference between this western and the others of the period. Screenplay by Rod Serling, smart and modern.

title: The Naked Spur
actors: James Stewart, Janet Leigh, Robert Ryan, Ralph Meeker
description: Betrayed and ruined by a woman while at war, Robert is looking for a quick way to make money and rebuild his life. With lucky companions, he pursues a killer, Ben, to earn the $ 5,000 bounty hanging over his head. But Ben sells his life dearly and involves an elderly gold digger and his girlfriend Stella in the escape. Until the end the bandit sells his skin dearly, but ...
notes: Fast pace for a rigorous, exciting and spectacular western that concedes little to the canons of the genre to play all its cards on the fight to the death, but also on the psychological contrast, between two irreducible opponents. Epic and tragic, with a great Stewart, one of Anthony Mann's classics of the golden age.

title: Witchboard
actors: Todd Allen, Tawny Kitaen, Stephen Nichols, Cathleen Wilhoite
description: During a party with friends, Brandon exhibits a tablet full of strange inscriptions, the "ouija", a kind of tool for summoning spirits. An experiment is then attempted by evoking the spirit of David. Handcrafted horror as it is not done anymore.

title: Jaws 3
actors: Dennis Quaid, Bess Armstrong, Louis Gossett jr., Simon MacCorkindale
description: The "Undersea Kingdom" is an underwater park. Visitors walk through transparent tunnels below sea level, in an enclosed space called the lagoon, to be in contact with marine flora and fauna as much as possible. On the day of the inauguration, however, a large female shark, whose cub had been captured, penetrates the aquarium, sowing destruction and panic (as if the fish were taking care of their offspring!).
notes: Third episode of the death-bearing shark that seems to be reborn every time from its ashes. Flat, yet another repeat of Spielberg's film. And the 3-D effect is also lost on television.

title: Jaws the Revenge
actors: Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest, Karen Young, Mario Van Peebles, Michael Caine
description: Ellen Brody is left the widow of her sheriff husband, who was killed while fighting a giant shark. Thirteen years have passed since then when the shark shows up on Christmas Eve killing Ellen's son, Sean. Convinced that the beast attacks her family, the woman moves to the Bahamas, but here too the shark arrives who, in an epic battle, will be faced by the woman.
notes: The saga of the sea monster started by Steven Spielberg continues. The nightmare atmospheres, the foaming of the waves and the reddening of the waters remain the indispensable ingredients. But this is the worst of the series.

title: Starflight One
actors: Lauren Hutton, Lee Majors, Hal Linden, Ray Milland
description: The hypersonic plane Starflight One is to leave for its maiden flight: California-Australia in just over two hours. In flight he is hit by the fragments of a telecommunications missile launched illegally and destroyed in flight. The plane ends up in the subgravitational zone, making it impossible to return. NASA must take care of it, among inevitable sentimental dramas, innocent victims and punished villains.
notes: Catastrophic film of the "Airport & co" trend, which seeks innovation at all costs in technological updating. His memory was lost without remission, despite Lauren Hutton in the cast and special effects of John Dykstra (Star Wars).

title: Starman
actors: Jeff Bridges, Karen Allen, Charles Martin Smith, Richard Jaeckel
description: Jenny is a widow. One night, an alien "appears" in her house who acquires the features of her deceased husband and convinces her to accompany him to a place in Arizona, where he will meet his companions. His future depends on that appointment. But the alien is chased by the army and the secret services, determined to block his escape route. For Jenny, that adventure will lead to a new life ...
notes: Carpenter tells a story with Spielbergian resonances very different from those he had accustomed us to, still managing to make it his own. Unforgettable Jeff Bridges in this role of man from the stars, modern messiah for a better future.

title: Flaming Star
actors: Elvis Presley, Barbara Eden, Steve Forrest, Dolores Del Rio
description: Sam Burton, who has married an Indian in his second marriage, does not participate in a punitive expedition against the Red Indians who have attacked a farm and the other settlers disperse his cattle. While he is retrieving him with his eldest son Clint, his wife and other son go to the Indian village to make peace. But Clint alone will survive the terrible chain of cross-vendettas. Presley is engaged in a film that offers no playful loopholes and, on the contrary, is loaded with drama. He is doing quite well, under the guidance of a specialist like Siegel.

title: Cahill U. S. Marshal
actors: John Wayne, Gary Grimes, Neville Brand, George Kennedy
description: A gruff, trigger-happy lawmaker neglects his family and teenage children, too engrossed in his duty. The boys thus become involuntary accomplices of a gang of outlaws who attack the country's bank. Innocent, they soon end up in prison and risk the gallows, but the sheriff identifies the real culprits. Before arresting them, however, he waits for his boys to understand the mistake made.
notes: Tailor-made for a stunned Wayne, the film offers a heavy moral at the expense of action.

title: Strange Invaders
actors: Paul Le Mat
description: Good parody of 1950s science fiction. A professor from New York arrives in a small town that has been secretly in the hands of aliens for years.

title: High Plains Drifter
actors: Clint Eastwood, Verna Bloom, Marianna Hill, Mitch Ryan, Jack Ging
description: A mysterious stranger arrives in Lago, California; after seeing him in action with a gun, the inhabitants of the town ask him to defend them against a gang of criminals who are about to return to take revenge on those who had reported them. Alone against a multitude, the stranger must resort to all his cunning and skill. It is the first western starring and directed by Eastwood who immediately shows his particular vision: stories of ghosts, of survivors who materialize for one last adventure.

title: Bite the Bullett
actors: Gene Hackman, Candice Bergen, James Coburn, Ben Johnson, Jan-Michael Vincent
description: In the Far West at the beginning of the century, a newspaper launched a unique competition: it will give two thousand dollars as a prize to whoever wins an endurance race on horseback for seven hundred miles. The race is joined by an unemployed cowboy, a bankrupt, a violent, a former prostitute and other singular characters. Brooks has signed one of his most convincing films: action dominates sovereign, sports adventure has a great pace and the company serves to learn more about the different souls of America. Very good, in this rather atypical western, Hackman, Ben Johnson and Candice Bergen.

title: The Stuff
actors: Michael Moriarty, Garrett Morris, Paul Sorvino, Andrea Marcovicci
description: The film has an absolutely unusual "protagonist" of which, to be as benevolent as possible, we can say that he is rather inexpressive and also rather cold. It is in fact a ... deadly alien dessert sold, who knows how, in fast food ...
notes: Singular horror film overwhelmingly turned into comedy. Shot with tones from the 1950s (cold war), it is imbued with satire from the 1980s.

title: Silver River
actors: Errol Flynn, Ann Sheridan, Thomas Mitchell
description: Former army captain, professional gamer, he becomes a boss in Silver City, but ends up succumbing to the big monopoly trusts. Nice start during the war, more predictable the rest.

title: The Last Rebel
actors: Joe Namath, Jack Elam, Woody Strode, Ty Hardin, Victoria George, Renato Romano, Marina Coffa, Annamaria Chio
description: Hollis and Graves are disbanded Southern soldiers who try to rebuild their lives after the war. When Hollis gets a reward for saving a girl, Graves steals his money and manages to turn the sheriff on Hollis as well. Will Hollis get the better of it? Remained for a long time without distribution in Italy, it then came out with a scam title that imitates a famous film with Terence Hill, even the old character actors Woody Stroode and Jack Elam, veterans of many westerns, do not save it.

title: War Drums
actors: Lex Barker, Joan Taylor, Ben Johnson
description: A group of Apaches Indians led by Mangas attack a farm in Mexico where the thieves of their horses had taken refuge. The bandits are killed and the Indians return to their lands after capturing a beautiful girl, Rita, whom Mangas falls in love with and whom he marries, rescuing her from Luke Fargo's aims. Some time later it was Fargo himself, who had become a major in the army, who forced Mangas to sign a peace treaty with the whites. A western without infamy and without praise (from the author of the Joe Palooka series) that someone wanted to read as a forerunner of the issues on tolerance between races.

title: Distant Drums
actors: Gary Cooper, Mari Aldon, Richard Webb, Arthur Hunnicutt
description: Captain Wyatt, whose wife, a beautiful Indian princess, has been killed, contemplates revenge against the rebellious Seminole Indians. After destroying a fort where Indians and smugglers kept weapons and hostages, he tries to escape the pursuers and to bring his men to safety with a forced march through the swamps.
notes: It's kind of a Burma Goal! veered western, one of Walsh's most exciting and epic films and one of Cooper's classic interpretations. The final duel underwater is beautiful.

title: Tango & Cash
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Kurt Russell, Teri Hatcher, Jack Palance
description: Two narcotics cops with opposite characters: Ray Tango (Stallone) wears a flawless double-breasted, he is bespectacled and distinguished like a yuppie; Gabe Cash (Russell) is a long-haired man in jeans and with rather hasty methods. They must work together to dismantle a drug trade, but the boss they investigate has them jailed. The two friends manage to escape from the penitentiary through the sewers. The film, directed by Russian immigrant Michalkov Konchalovskij, is pure entertainment and features two colorful characters. A lively variation on the theme of the strange pair of cops.

title: Turtle Diary
actors: Glenda Jackson, Ben Kingsley, Richard Johnson
description: A bookshop clerk and a childrens writer casually know each other for their common interest in turtles; so they get together for an "ecological" enterprise: to steal three turtles from the London Zoo to set them free in the ocean. An original and ironic ecological film, backed by the brilliant script by Harold Pinter and directed by John Irvin.

title: Tarzan in Manhattan
actors: Joe Lara, Tony Curtis, Jan-Michael Vincent, Kim Crosby
description: The little monkey Cheetah has been kidnapped by some bad guys hunting for tropical animals to sell to American laboratories where vivisection experiments are carried out. Tarzan rushes to New York to save the faithful chimpanzee: he succeeds, of course, and in addition to this he allows himself to give a good lesson to the cynical scientists who do not respect nature and animals. Star in disarmament, even Tony Curtis is involved in this anonymous short film made with very few ideas (bringing Tarzan to New York had already been done by Richard Thorpe in 1942). Yet Michael Schultz had made a promising start in the 1970s. Sin.

title: Tarzan Goes to India
actors: Jock Mahoney, Mark Dana, Simi, Leo Gordon, Feroz Khan
description: Kamara, an Indian princess, calls Tarzan: thousands of elephants risk death due to the erection of a dam, and Tarzan leaves her Africa and runs. He runs into a wild pachyderm who, guided by the boy Jai, terrorizes the area, but makes an agreement with the young man and, together, they carry out the rescue operation of the mammoth animals. Tarzan can now return to his original vines. Some new ideas and a different setting than usual are the distinctive features of an adventure that, for the rest, does not differ from the well-known.

title: Tarzan - The Ape Man
actors: Bo Derek, Richard Harris, Miles O'Keefe, John Phillip Law
description: West Africa, 1912. The rich and handsome Jane Parker is in search of her father, an explorer who hasn't given news of himself for some time. After tracking him down, Jane joins him on an expedition to the mountain where the elephant cemetery is located. They soon meet the mythical Tarzan, who kidnaps the woman.
notes: The film was made almost in the seventies of the birth of the character created by Edgar Rice Burroughs (1912); here the director makes his wife Bo the protagonist. Rich, glossy and spectacularly compelling show.

title: The Gypsy Moths
actors: Burt Lancaster, Deborah Kerr, Gene Hackman
description: Three acrobatic skydivers: Mike, Brady and young Malcolm, put on a show with their reckless jumps. Malcom hosts friends in his hometown with his uncles and Mike impresses the hostess, so much so that he ends up in bed. Mike performs in a very daring number and decides not to open the parachute; the exercise will be repeated by the rookie, before he and Brady separate.
notes: Slow, melancholy and all on the side of the losers, one of Frankenheimer's best films, with atmospheres reminiscent of the Faulkner of "Oggi si volo". Great interpretations of Lancaster and Kerr. Hackman pre- "French connection" is no exception.

title: The Raiders
actors: Robert Culp, Judi Meredith, James McMullan, Brian Keith
description: Seven Texan breeders see their herds perpetually intercepted by the Indians on the trails heading north. After unsuccessfully asking the Kansas-Pacific Railway Company to extend the line to Texas, the seven start a private war against the Company and end up facing Wild Bill Hickock, Buffalo Bill and Calamity Jane. The matter is about to take a bad turn ... They will be the very first two to make sure that everything ends up for the best. Despite the caliber of the characters, a western of little substance. It was actually a pilot film for a television series, and it shows.

title: Firewalker
actors: Chuck Norris, Louis Gossett jr., Melody Anderson, Will Sampson
description: Max Donigan and Leo Porter are two adventurers. They learn of a fabulous treasure hidden in the basement of an Aztec temple. The two, flanked by a girl, Melody, in possession of a magical dagger, set off in search. They are opposed by the natives but, after a thousand adventures, they manage to take possession of the treasure.
notes: Fourth hand history and predictable smashing developments.

title: The Terminator
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Michael Biehn, Paul Winfield, Brian Thompson, Lance Henriksen, Bess Motta, Bill Paxton
description: A terminator, a deadly human-like machine, is sent from the future to kill Sarah. The woman's only fault: her son will become the leader of the resistance led by mankind against the machines that remained masters of the world after the nuclear catastrophe. Cameron's film draws attention to the truly breathtaking rhythm and the particular effectiveness of the special effects, spectacular but also functional to the narration. Born as a small science fiction film, the film became a cult movie and launched Schwarzenegger.

title: Far Country
actors: James Stewart, Ruth Roman, Corinne Calvet, John McIntire
description: Jeff (Stewart), with Rhonda's help, brought a herd into Canada; However, he clashes with the merchant Gannon who has him arrested on a false accusation. Rhonda, who owns a nightclub, manages to get him out of jail; the population, tired of Gannon's abuses, asks Jeff to become sheriff. The man refuses, but a girl in love with him pushes him to change his mind. Mann, a director specializing in the western landscape, gives his best in this story set in the snows of the Great North. More melancholy than adventurous, with an anti-hero Stewart at the center, such a jewel.

title: Billy the Kid
actors: Robert Taylor, Brian Donlevy, Ian Hunter, Mary Howard
description: Giving up to the life of the outlaw after avenging the killing of his father, the young Billy called the Kid, is led back to the right path by his friend, Jim. But when Keating, the farmer he works for, who is also the sheriff, is killed, Billy wants to avenge him, but Jim has him locked up in prison. Remake of King Vidor's 1930 film of the same name, it is a good western, which effectively outlines the Kid's biography. In the main and tragic role, Taylor is very good, albeit a bit old for that part.

title: The Big Trees
actors: Kirk Douglas, Eve Miller, Patrice Wymore, Edgard Buchanan
description: Fallon, an unscrupulous California lumberjack trader, is trying to seize all of the woodland exploitation concessions that a recent federal law has expired. To counter his shady plans, however, there are Alicia, daughter of the old woodcutter Bixby, and Yukon, an elderly and expert trapper. The death of Bixby, of which he is unjustly accused, opens the eyes of Fallon, who later works to get the lumberjacks back in possession of their properties.
notes: Highly dramatic film supported by a cast to the height, with a Kirk Douglas in a role very suited to his characteristics.

title: Top Gun
actors: Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Anthony Edwards, Val Kilmer
description: Mitchell is a fighter pilot; he follows the training courses to enter the number of "top guns" with the stubborn determination to be worthy of the memory of his father, who fell in Vietnam. In spite of the rules, he falls in love with Charlie, a blonde instructor and his superior; moreover, he believes himself responsible for the death of his co-pilot. Great international success for this Reaganian clip that made Tom Cruise the rampant star of the forgettable 80s. Spectacular aerial sequences, of course. "Take my breath away" by Giorgio Moroder received the Oscar for best song.

title: Lassie, Come Home!
actors: Roddy McDowall, Donald Crisp, Nigel Bruce, Elsa Lanchester, Elizabeth Taylor
description: Left without money and work, a worker is forced to sell his purebred dog to the Duke of Rudling. Her son Joe is devastated at the idea of ??separation, but the bitch also doesn't take it well. In fact, twice he escapes from his new master to return to Joe. The duke, annoyed, decides to take her to Scotland, but for Lassie even the distance from Scotland to Yorkshire is nothing compared to his desire to return home. Apart from the very young Elizabeth Taylor, many other things have made this children's film famous, which has managed to make several generations of adults cry.

title: Rooster Cogburn
actors: John Wayne, Katharine Hepburn, Richard Jordan, John McIntire
description: El Grinta is a senior district commissioner that Judge Parker would like to retire for his hasty methods. The last mission is to recover a wagon loaded with explosives stolen by a gang of criminals. With El Grinta are Eula, daughter of a preacher, and a young Indian, Billy. Once again, not even a bandit arrives alive at the court, but Parker decides to reconfirm El Grinta in his role.
notes: Anonymous Western was the penultimate film made by a now sick old John Wayne.

title: Trader Horn
actors: Rod Taylor, Anne Heywood, Jean Sorel
description: Trader Horn, an English hunter, is invited by Colonel Sinclair to lead an organized expedition against the Germans who are taking over British military and commercial bases in Africa. Ugly remake of an American movie from the thirties.

title: Beyond the Stars
actors: Martin Sheen, Christian Slater, Sharon Stone, Olivia D'Abo
description: A boy dreams of becoming an astronaut and trying to carry out his project, he ends up meeting a real "man of space". This will be for him something more than a simple tool to realize his aspirations: he will teach him something about dreams and disappointments and will set him apart from a secret discovery made during his trip to the moon.
notes: Modest TV movie, curious only because it unites a reborn actor like Connery with two then unknown Slater and Connery.

title: Die Hard
actors: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, Alan Rickman, Alexander Godunov
description: Policeman John McClane lives apart from his wife, he in New York, she in Los Angeles. At Christmas he accepts her invitation to spend the holidays together. On Christmas Eve, he joins her at the party at the company headquarters, a very modern skyscraper in Los Angeles that is now empty after the employees leave. But some German terrorists burst into the palace and take those present hostage with the declared aim of obtaining the release of some political prisoners and that, undeclared but more real, of emptying the very rich vault of the multinational. Only John, finding himself by chance in a toilet, escapes their attention and it's up to him, without any outside help, to vanquish the dangerous terrorists one by one. McTiernan's film is a big toy, but also one of the most significant action-movies of the decade, an irresistible concentration of suspense. Great Willis.

title: The Tall T
actors: Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Sullivan, Arthur Hunnicut
description: A farmer, on foot due to a lost bet, finds a ride on a bus where a young lady also travels. An ambush puts the travelers at the mercy of three ruthless bandits, but the protagonist manages to save himself and the woman, after eliminating the outlaws. From a story by Elmore Leonard, Burt Kennedy writes one of the late masterpieces of Boetticher and Scott. The dialogues are very fine, but the film also applies to the old actor's sore step and the director's masterful style.

title: The Three Musketeers
actors: Gene Kelly, Lana Turner, June Allyson, Van Heflin, Vincent Price
description: The young Gascon gentleman D'Artagnan, just arrived in Paris, finds a way to fight with the king's three musketeers: Athos, Porthos and Aramis. While they are fighting a duel, Cardinal Richelieu's guards arrive and the four, having to join forces, become friends. Together they carry out exciting feats against the cardinal and thwart the plots of the perfidious Milady.
notes: One of the best cinematographic transpositions of the novel by Dumas the father, faithful to the narrative, sumptuous in the scenography, very well rhythmic in the mass scenes and in the clashes. Good proof of the whole cast. Kelly duels with dancer grace, and director Sidney choreographs the action with the confidence of a musical specialist.

title: Three Hours to Kill
actors: Dana Andrews, Donna Reed
description: A stagecoach driver accused of a crime has three hours to prove his innocence. An hour and a quarter of tight, thrilling action: the best of Serie B.

title: Tremors
actors: Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross, Reba McEntire
description: In Perfection, the ironic name of a microscopic and far from perfect inhabited center between the desert and the mountains of Nevada, some very rapid and voracious underground snakes make their terrible appearance. Blind, but sensitive to the slightest noise, the worms strike with no escape, destroying and swallowing anything. The small community is forced into an all-out battle.
notes: A beautiful horror shot all in the light of the sun with some comic vein and many references to old films of the fifties. Good cast with Kevin Bacon in the lead. Excellent special effects made by the same technicians of "Terminator".

title: Blue Thunder
actors: Roy Scheider, Warren Oates, Malcolm McDowell
description: The name "Blue Thunder" is that of a helicopter intended for metropolitan surveillance, equipped with an ultra-sophisticated control and attack technology: electronic sensors to "see" and "hear" in the most difficult conditions. However, the pilot must beware of Colonel Cochrane, his ancient adversary, who once again proves that he deserves all the contempt our hero gratifies him. From the final mega-clash the "good" naturally emerges as the winner, then choosing to sacrifice the helicopter to save the citizens' tranquility.
notes: The fnatapolitico idea is curious, but the action part lacks backbone. Screenplay by Dan O'Bannon.

title: Into the Night
actors: Jeff Goldblum, Michelle Pfeiffer, Irene Papas, Dan Aykroyd
description: At the Los Angeles airport, Diana, pursued by Iranian killers, seeks escape in the car of Okin, an engineer betrayed by his wife and suffering from insomnia. Diana has smuggled some emeralds, she does not intend to give them up and drags the astonished night owl with her in search of various friends to ask for help. At the end of a night without a moment's respite, Okin and Diana find themselves in a motel, in love and with a suitcase full of dollars. John Landis' frantic night-time raid through Los Angeles, with nonstop gags and full-on fun, in the style already proven in "The Blues Brothers". Cameos by famous directors, from Don Siegel to Jonathan Demme to David Cronenberg.

title: A Night on the Town
actors: Elisabeth Shue, Maia Brewton, Keith Coogan, Anthony Rapp
description: Hired for one evening as a babysitter by the Andersons, the young Chris finds herself nursing three young boys: Sara, Brad and Daryl. A friend's call, however, forces Chris to leave the house, taking his ... offspring with him. A good night awaits them in terrible Chicago, amidst car thieves, shady traffickers and dangers of all kinds. A not terrific little play and tailor-made for an audience of teenagers.

title: Assault on a Queen
actors: Frank Sinatra, Virna Lisi, Anthony Franciosa, Richard Conte
description: To recover an ancient treasure submerged in Florida waters, Rosa, Erik and Vic hire Mark, an experienced diver, and his collaborator Linch. Instead of the treasure, a German submarine scuttled during World War II is discovered. Also hired an excellent mechanic, Tony, the group decides to recover the U-boat to rob the Queen Mary ocean liner on the high seas, but in the middle of boarding a Coast Guard corvette intervenes. After the incredible premise, the film proceeds unsurprisingly to the end, always undecided between drama and thriller. Enjoy the Duke Ellington soundtrack.

title: Tonka
actors: Sal Mineo, Philip Carey, Jerome Courtland, Rafael Campos
description: History of the Tonka horse, first disputed between the Toro Bianco and Toro Giallo Indians and then sold to the 7th Cavalry and, finally, returned to Toro Bianco after Little Big Horn. The film is a Walt Disney production and, despite its historical background, certainly not one of the memorable ones.

title: The Last Wagon
actors: Richard Widmark, Felicia Farr, Tommy Rettig, Susan Kohner
description: A half-caste rescues a caravan attacked by Indians and drives it across the desert. A western with an evocative force that also brings up racial prejudices against mixed blood; excellent landscape photography.

title: Apache
actors: Burt Lancaster, Jean Peters, Charles Buchinsky, Ian McDonald
description: In 1886, Colonel Beck's American troops finally defeated the Indians of Geronimo, who were deported to a reservation. One of them, Massai, decides to continue the fight. Captured, he escapes and finds refuge on the farm of a Cherokee Indian who urges him to desist. Denounced by the renegade Hondo, Massai is revived but escapes again and with his partner Nanline takes refuge in the mountains, where the woman will give birth to a son.Aldrich would have wanted a less consoling ending: Hondo had to shoot Massai in the back at the moment. which he turned around hearing the cry of his son, but production requirements made things go differently. In any case, with this film, the typical Aldrich hero and a genre of cinema more favorable to Indian themes are born.

title: Day of the Evil Gun
actors: Glenn Ford, Arthur Kennedy, Harry Dean Stanton, Dean Jagger
description: Wakenfield discovers that during his absence from home his wife was kidnapped with her daughters by the Indians; moreover, Forbes, already long in love with the woman, had almost convinced her to marry him. But only Forbes joins him to look for the kidnapped women; the two will also have to face a group of renegades. Then they free them and face off in one final deadly duel.
notes: By 1968 the classic western was dead, but there were still those who ignored it. So here is a late western, at a time when Leone's spaghetti-westerns or Peckinpah's anti-westerns were popular. Too bad for Glenn Ford, completely wasted.

title: The Last Dragon
actors: Taimak, Vanity, Julius J. Carry III
description: Passionate martial arts lover falls in love with a beautiful video D.J. and finds himself having to fight a violent gang of gangsters. Fast consumer cinema, recommended for teenagers. Brief appearance of Chazz Palminteri.

title: The Last Gangster
actors: Edward G. Robinson, James Stewart, Rose Stradner, Lionel Stander
description: Joe Krozac is a gangster who went to jail for tax evasion. Meanwhile his wife, who in all good faith believed him innocent, falls in love with a journalist who reveals the truth about her husband. After serving his sentence, Joe gets out of jail with proud intentions of revenge against his wife. Robinson's role as a gangster stuck to his hands like fly paper. "Piccolo Cesare" was from '31 and already in '37 no one could take it anymore. In Italy, then, the film was released in 1953, with the result of appearing even more dated. But as obvious as the story is, the film works perfectly thanks to a very young Stewart.

title: The Howling
actors: Patrick Macnee, Dee Wallace, Belinda Balaski, John Carradine
description: Karen is a reporter on a television network. A bad day is traumatized by a frightening vision that causes her to lose her memory and mental balance. Her husband has her hospitalized in a specialized clinic, but here things are even worse because outside, in the night, mournful howls echo and inside the walls of the hospital mysterious things happen: here and there the corpses of people horribly tortured by monstrous are found. wolfweres that proliferate exponentially and threaten the whole of humanity. Series A horror created by the specialist Joe Dante, who, while operating within a strongly codified cinema and giving the right space to tricks, introduces non-trivial elements of reflection into its history. Between the lines we can read the critique of the power and fascination of the mass media, of the mania of mysticism; without ever too much rhetoric.

title: Silver Bullet
actors: Gary Busey, Everett McGill, Corey Haim, Megan Follows, Robin Groves
description: In the small provincial town, corpses are wasted. Who is the killer? A handicapped boy notices that the crimes always take place during the full moon and from this goes back to the culprit: a werewolf, that is a wolf-man sensitive to the influence of the satellite. The child in the wheelchair will also play a major role in the capture of the mysterious multi-killer. The film is quite repetitive and shows all the canonical situations of the genre; more than to its director, Daniel Attias, the film is due to the scriptwriter, the producer (Dino De Laurentiis) and the author of the special effects Carlo Rambaldi.

title: Wild Rovers
actors: William Holden, Ryan O'Neal, Karl Malden, Lynn Carlin
description: Elder Ross Bodine and young Frank Post, both cowboys on Walter Buckman's farm, fed up with their modest living, decide to rob a bank. The hit earns them thirty-six thousand dollars. With the booty they go to Mexico where they intend to start a new existence. A large group of men, including Buckman's two sons, launches on their trail.
notes: The master of comedy Edwards engages in a twilight western typical of those years. But the film was tampered with by MGM, which cut nearly half an hour of film.

title: The Time Machine
actors: Rod Taylor, Alan Young, Yvette Mimieux, Whit Bissell
description: George has always been fascinated by the "time" factor and after many attempts, he managed to develop a sophisticated device capable of making him travel into the future. On the evening of December 31, 1899, he stands at the controls of the car and in a moment he finds himself in 1917. But his fantastic journey does not end with this stage. George visits 1940, 1959 and 1966. Then, with a prodigious leap into the future, he even finds himself in 802.701 ...
notes: The novel by Herbert G. Wells from which the film was based comes out a bit battered, but the special effects (Oscar in 1960) are still enjoyable.

title: Tha Man from Laramie
actors: James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Donald Crisp, Cathy O'Donnell
description: Captain Lockhart must stop an arms trade that someone sells to the Apaches. Dave, the son of a wealthy landowner, is involved, and when the young man is killed his father puts the blame on Lockhart and tries to avenge him. But the black soul of the whole operation is Vic, Dave's lieutenant, who also tries to kill the old man, saved instead by Lockhart. A classic of the genre, almost a classic tragedy, directed by a director who is one of the greatest storytellers of the western epic and with performers who work at their best. From a novel by Louis L'Amour.

title: Invisible Man
actors: Claude Rains, Gloria Stuart, Henry Travers, William Harrigan, Una O'Connor, Forrester Harvey, Holmes Herbert, E.E. Clive, Dudley Digges
description: A scientist discovers the secret of invisibility. The potion he has injected (and which has no antidotes) also transforms him into a kind of Mr. Hyde determined to challenge the world. Unmasked by the footprints he leaves in the snow, he is hunted down by the police after a series of tragic events.
notes: Taken from the famous story by H.G. Wells and packaged with the usual skill by Whale, which does not fail to emphasize his taste for irony and lightness of writing. The director wanted Karloff in the lead role, but Universal forced him to Rains. Sequel and remake (also apocryphal) as if it were raining ...

title: Man Without a Star
actors: Kirk Douglas, Jeanne Crain, Claire Trevor, Richard Boone
description: Dempsey (Kirk Douglas) fled Texas because ranchers began surrounding pastures with barbed wire. He then goes to Wyoming and along the way he meets Jeff; the two put themselves at the service of the beautiful ranchera Reed which is trying to expropriate the small landowners in the area. Dempsey at first takes sides against them, because they have surrounded their pastures with barbed wire; but then it is decisive in the clash with Reed's men. A beautiful decadent western, in which Douglas embodies the cowboy who is intolerant of the limitations brought by cowardice and symbolized by barbed wire.

title: Hurricane
actors: Jason Robards, Mia Farrow, Max Von Sydow, Trevor Howard
description: On an island in the South Seas, a young chieftain, ambitious and enterprising, clashes with the white governor. The governor's daughter, however, is in love with the young boss and, when he ends up in prison, favors his escape. The two run away, hunted by the soldiers of the garrison. They would be recaptured if mother nature did not get involved with a terrible storm that devastates the island and annihilates all the inhabitants.
notes: Remake of John Ford's 1937 film, which becomes a massive exotic-catastrophic blockbuster.

title: Fort Dobbs
actors: Clint Walker, Virginia Mayo, Brian Keith
description: Wanted for murder, Davis manages to escape by taking refuge in the territory of the Comanches. Here he collects a woman with her child on an isolated farm and arrives at Fort Dobbs after various adventures. But the fort is half-destroyed and the arrival of the soldiers is immediately followed by that of the Indians who begin the siege. A decent western starring Brian Keith more famous on television than in cinema.

title: Ride the Man Down
actors: Brian Donlevy, Rod Cameron, Ella Raines
description: Silvia inherits a large estate and with Will, already her father's right hand man, defends it from the bandits with whom Sam, her unworthy and greedy boyfriend, has joined. Western series C, for enthusiasts only.

title: Valley of the Kings
actors: Robert Taylor, Eleanor Parker, Kurt Kasznar, Carlos Thompson, Victor Jory
description: After the death of her father, the daughter of a well-known archaeologist continues her search for evidence of the historical truth of the biblical story in the Valley of the Kings. She has to contend with sandstorms, desert raiders, and even her greedy husband. Exotic adventurous unpretentious, but lively enough.

title: Vampire Story
actors: Robert Quarry, Mariette Hartley, Roger Perry
description: The vampire Yorga resurrects from the grave near San Francisco with his court of hideous vampireesses and settles in the luxurious manson of the Mansons. Here Yorga and her group exterminate a less Cinzia family, with whom Yorga falls in love, and little Tommy himself the protagonist of gruesome adventures. Concentrated effects, supported by a soundtrack of organ music and stridi stridi.

title: The Punisher
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Louis Gossett jr., Jeroen Krabbe, Kim Miyori
description: A former police officer, believed dead by all, is actually the avenger everyone is looking for. Not that his business is totally despised: eliminating 125 gangsters in five years is still a service rendered to society. However, the police cannot help but investigate and discover that the avenger started his private war the day some bandits killed his wife and child. Based without too much imagination on a Marvel comic book character, the film makes use of the pompous and expressionless Dolph Lundgren (Ivan "You Spiezzo in two" Drago) and the solid Louis Gossett jr. (Oscar for "Officer and Gentleman").

title: Cattle King
actors: Robert Taylor, Joan Caulfield, Robert Middleton, Robert Loggia
description: The usual honest farmer who would like to live quietly in his "lonely valley", however, is confronted by a shady businessman who would like his land. The "Chisum" of the situation sends his henchmen to convince the protagonist to negotiate. He refuses and finds his girlfriend killed. Revenge takes place, and a gun will be unearthed ...
notes: Western full of stereotypes that traces the typical theme of the clash between rampant capitalism and rural tradition according to Serie B schemes. Shooting routine and discreet interpretation, especially by Taylor and the character actor Loggia. Film of the decadence of a director once considered one of the masters of comedy and melò.

title: Rose of Cimarron
actors: Mala Powers, Jack Buetel, Bill Williams, Jim Davis, Art Smith
description: A group of redskins belonging to a rebel tribe, assault a caravan of pioneers. Only a little girl survives the massacre and is picked up by Willy, son of the chief of the Sioux tribe. The girl, who is given the name of Rose of Cimarron, is raised and educated by Solitary Eagle and his partner Red Deer. The two parents are, however, murdered by a gang of outlaws. The girl sets out in search of the killers. Western film routine.

title: Reap the Wild Wind
actors: John Wayne, Ray Milland, Paulette Goddard
description: A sailing ship is shipwrecked on the coast of Florida. The shipowner instructs lawyer Sullivan to investigate the causes of the disaster and the possible responsibilities of Captain Stuart; Sullivan arranges for Stuart to be put to rest. The captain, not guilty of the shipwreck, accepts the offers of the shady lawyer Cottler, who organizes shipwrecks for profit. But something is wrong: on board the ship there is an illegal immigrant who dies in the shipwreck ...
notes: Classic seafaring adventure film, shot by a recognized specialist in spectacular dramas of all kinds such as De Mille. And for once, Wayne is being bad.

title: Vera Cruz
actors: Gary Cooper, Burt Lancaster, Cesar Romero, Denise Darcel, Sara Montiel, Ernest Borgnine, George Macready, Jack Elam, Charles Bronson
description: After the Secession War, Ben goes to Mexico where the clash between the revolutionary followers of Juarez and the regular troops under the orders of Maximilian of Austria is bloody and merciless. Meet the bandit Joe and with him try to get hold of a carriage full of gold. Stunning fresco of two men grappling with a great historical event that surpasses everyday events: large scenes en plein air, energetic stars, Aldrich baroque.

title: The Terror
actors: Boris Karloff, Jack Nicholson, Sandra Knight, Dick Miller
description: The French officer André Duvalier meets a mysterious woman whom he then recognizes in the portrait of Baron von Leppe's wife, who, however, should have been dead for many years. Duvalier learns that she was murdered by the baron: what he saw is a simulacrum resulting from a curse ...
notes: In the wake of the series inspired by the stories of Edgar Allan Poe, Corman insists on the gothic atmosphere of cursed castles, where intricate family curses roam. Old glory Boris Karloff plays Baron von Leppe; among the assistant directors is a young man who will go a long way: Francis Ford Coppola.

title: Goin' South
actors: Jack Nicholson, Mary Steenburgen, Christopher Lloyd, John Belushi
description: Henry is a bandit condemned to the gallows; a woman asks to marry him and so, according to an old law, she saves him. He looks forward to wedding joys, but she only wants to make them the worker on her farm. Western comedy with Jack Nicholson actor and director. Small appearance of John Belushi, Mexican cowboy.

title: The Way West
actors: Kirk Douglas, Robert Mitchum, Richard Widmark, Lola Albright
description: Senator Tudlock leads a pioneer caravan on its way to Oregon, but his harsh manners make him unpopular. After a festive meeting with the Indians, the tribal chief's son is found killed and Tudlock hangs the unwitting killer. Chased out of the caravan, the senator returns to join it when it comes to tackling the last obstacle.
notes: The film is spectacular, and the performers are a guarantee. However, a story lacks compactness, which one would like to unite and instead is just a messy overlapping of events.

title: Fantastic Voyage
actors: Stephen Boyd, Raquel Welch, Edmond O'Brien, Donald Pleasence
description: A scientist who has perfected the principle of miniaturization of objects and people suffers an attack and risks dying. Having entered a coma, he undergoes an operation that uses the techniques he developed. A team of scientists, with an FBI agent in tow, is miniaturized in a submarine and injected into the patient's body. Their purpose is to operate the patient from the inside, but one of the attackers is hidden within the medical team.
notes: Small science fiction jewel, with special effects of considerable impact and effectiveness for its times (in fact they won the Oscar, as well as the sets that reproduce the inside of the human body). Remade by Joe Dante: "Leap in the dark", 1989.

title: The Vikings
actors: Kirk Douglas, Tony Curtis, Ernest Borgnine, Janet Leigh
description: For a long period of the Middle Ages, the seas of Northern Europe were dominated by Vikings, Scandinavian warriors who often pushed themselves to the English coasts, sowing terror and death. From one of these raids the film begins, which unfolds between bloody battles, dethroned kings, raped queens, heirs to the throne hidden to protect them from intrigues, disputed princesses, up to a final duel. sure call, one of the best adventurous films of the 1950s. A barbaric and cruel Middle Ages, a certain exactness in the reconstruction, sanguine actors, an exciting rhythm. A little classic.

title: Videodrome
actors: James Woods, Deborah Harry, Sonja Smits, Lee Carlson
description: The director of a TV network catches a disturbing broadcast and finds himself catapulted into the nightmare.
notes: Powerful work of hallucinatory cinema, full of Macluhanian and cyberpunk suggestions. As always ahead of its time, political in the depths of the flesh. Special effects are by Academy Award winner Rick Baker.

title: Final Impact
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Mike Worth, Gary Daniels, Art Camacho
description: Nick Taylor, former kickboxing champion, sees in the young Danny Davie, the makings of the probable champion and becomes the coach. In reality, Nick sees in Danny the only one who has that capacity for concentration and willpower that will make him capable of beating the ruthless Jack Gerard, the man who, years earlier, had beaten Nick himself during a violent encounter. The film tells the adventures of some characters from the world of kickboxing, perhaps the most violent sport that exists. Training and fighting alternate with scenes from private life. Deadly boredom.

title: Villa Rides
actors: Yul Brynner, Robert Mitchum, Charles Bronson, Maria Grazia Buccella
description: The revolutionary Pancho Villa struggling with the traitor General Juerta. The revolutions seen by Hollywood are always ridiculous, but the cast is good. Peckinpah's script (who knows what it was like ...) was rewritten by Robert Towne.

title: Santee
actors: Glenn Ford, Michael Burns, Dana Wynter, Jay Silverheels, Harry Townes
description: Santee is a former sheriff and former bounty killer. He makes friends with Johnny, without knowing that the young man is the son of one of his victims and that he has decided to kill him in revenge. But things take a different turn when Santee is faced with the gang of criminals who once killed his little son. A Glenn Ford seasoned for this twilight western of good trade, but he did not leave great memories of himself. Nelson is best known for his sci-fi Black Hole.

title: Flight to Mars
actors: Cameron Mitchell, Marguerite Chapman
description: Scientists who accidentally landed on Mars find apparently hospitable inhabitants there. The leader of the extraterrestrials, however, plots behind them. Small science fiction film, very enjoyable for fans in its naivety.

title: Rollover
actors: Jane Fonda, Kris Kristofferson, Hume Cronyn
description: A petrochemical magnate is mysteriously murdered. His widow teams up with a financier who discovers an intricate plot: emissaries from Arab countries are converting all their bank deposits into gold with the intention of simultaneously withdrawing the funds and thus causing a serious economic crisis throughout the West. . Political fantasy combined with the "mélo" of a couple's story. A cartoon in which it is difficult to recognize the hand of the 70s Pakula.

title: Waco
actors: Howard Keel, Jane Russell, Brian Donlevy, Wendell Corey, Terry Moore
description: Waco, a former outlaw turned sheriff, brings law and order back to the town of Emporia. A quiet western routine.

title: Walker
actors: Ed Harris, Marlee Matlin, Richard Masur, Peter Boyle
description: In 1885, the American journalist-lawyer William Walker assembles a handful of armed men who call themselves "The Immortals", and with the money of the Yankee banker Vanderbilt goes to Nicaragua to support the dictator of the moment. Walker, however, is an idealistic reactionary, he quarrels with Vanderbilt and directly assumes power, causing an uproar. It looks like a novel but it is history, which also illuminates the relevance of relations between North and Central-South America. A deliberately irritating film, from the director of Sid and Nancy.

title: Wargames
actors: Matthew Broderick, Dabney Coleman, John Wood, Ally Sheedy
description: David (Broderick), a very young computer enthusiast, manages to connect clandestinely with various computerized networks. But what seems like just a harmless game risks turning into tragedy when one day, quite by chance, it manages to dialogue with the memory of the computer that controls and programs the nuclear defense of the United States. Convinced that he is dealing with a video game company, David launches into a confrontation that actually sets off the irreversible preparations for a new world war. Youth-science fiction apologue with a nice pacifist aftertaste, directed with good hand following a remarkable basic intuition.

title: Losin' It
actors: Tom Cruise, Jackie Earle Haley, John Stockwell, Shelley Long, John P. Navin jr., Henry Darrow
description: Aboard a flamboyant Chevy convertible, Dave, Wendell, Woody, Spider and Perlman leave for Tijuana. On the way they pick up Kathy, who goes to Mexico to get a quick divorce. At their destination, the group looks for easy emotions and finds serious trouble. To cross the border safely again, the six will need a lot of skill and luck.
notes: Yet another initiatory and "passing" American fable, where the teenage protagonists lose their virginity and at the same time discover the banality of reality behind the mythical Mexican cross-border. Not original idea and characters, Tom Cruise repeats the character of "Risky Business" for the worse.

title: Wichita
actors: Joel McCrea, Vera Miles, Lloyd Bridges, Wallace Ford, Peter Graves
description: Recently sheriff of Wichita, a rich but turbulent town, John clashes with the powerful who control its economy. The trouble is that he falls in love with the daughter of one of them.
notes: Jacque Tourneur, a director more at ease with noir atmospheres, creates a tense, non-trivial western, enriched by the presence of actors of the first magnitude. Lloyd Bridges is Jeff's father.

title: Willow
actors: Warwick Davis, Val Kilmer, Jean Marsh, Joanne Whalley
description: To escape a dire prophecy, the wicked Queen Bavmorda sends her emissaries to kill the newborn Elora Danan. Naturally, the child is rescued from death with a ruse: placed in a basket, she is left to go by the current of a river. It is picked up by a young farmer, Willow, of a peaceful breed of dwarf farmers who later works to get her rights back.
notes: Based on a subject by Lucas, the film is an adventurous fantasy classic with the unusual presence of a real dwarf in the lead role, played in a convincing way.

title: Red Sonja
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Brigitte Nielsen, Sandahl Bergman, Paul Smith
description: Sonja is the last survivor of a royal lineage exterminated by the evil Queen Gedren who extended her domain with iron and fire and thanks to the magical virtues of a green stone. Sonja is joined by Yado, a strong warrior, and a young boy, also ousted, cared for by a masochist squire, Falcon. The four, after various vicissitudes, arrive at the heart of the enemy stronghold and, after epic duels, definitively defeat their opponents.
notes: Variant on the theme of "Conan", the film mixes the canonical ingredients of fantasy with an epic-muscular background without excessive flashes of fantasy, but also without overdoing it.

title: Old Yeller
actors: Dorothy McGuire, Fess Parker, Tommy Kirk, Kevin Corcoran
description: Trevis is a little boy who lives in the countryside with his family and little brother Erlys. When Erlys finds a large dog and takes it home, Trevis is not thrilled, but quickly changes his mind when Yellow Fang saves Erlys from a bear attack. The two become inseparable to the point that even the owner of the dog, who one day shows up, doesn't have the heart to take him away and leaves him on the farm with the boys. When the dog becomes infected with rabies, the little boy will be forced to make a painful decision.
notes: At the beginning of his long and successful engagement with Disney (culminating in the direction of "Mary Poppins"), Stevenson signs this well-acted film, with a careful setting, in which the adventurous component blends with the subtlety of the notations.

title: Badman's Country
actors: George Montgomery, Buster Crabbe
description: To fight Butch Cassidy, Sheriff Pat Garret enlists the help of colleagues Wyatt Earp and Bat Masterson, and Buffalo Bill. The famous names of the western are all there. But the western is modest and a bit confusing.

title: Bandido
actors: Robert Mitchum, Ursula Thiess, Zachary Scott, Gilbert Roland
description: Three US citizens in the turbulent Mexico of Pancho Villa's revolution. Two of them are an arms dealer and his wife, but their marriage is on the brink of crisis; the third is the one who at the conclusion of the adventurous affair will pair up with the lady, who in the meantime has passed to the status of widow. But before that happens, a lot of things will happen: battles, captures, death sentences and escapes. The film uses the geographical and historical setting simply as a frame, and the rest is entirely second-hand. The interpretation of the actors is also affected by the commercial nature of the production.

title: The Beastmaster
actors: Marc Singer, Tanya Roberts, Rip Torn, John Amos, Rod Loomis
description: The valiant warrior Kaan sets out on the trail of the villains who have destroyed his village, assisted by an eagle, two ferrets and a black panther. Fantasy for Don Coscarelli after two horror stories.

title: The McMasters
actors: Burl Ives, Brock Peters, David Carradine, Nancy Kwann
description: Benjie, a black soldier enlisted in the Northern Army, returns to the southern town of Ironwood after the Civil War. The old landowner Mc Masters welcomes him as a son and takes him as a partner on his farm. Unfortunately, however, most of the citizens, who sided with the southerners during the conflict, proved hostile towards him and also towards the Mc Masters, who gave him hospitality. Benjie reacts, but things get complicated when he marries a young Red Indian. Robust storytelling and fast pace, with some forcing too much.

title: S.H.E.
actors: Omar Sharif, Fabio Testi, Cornelia Sharpe, Anita Ekberg
description: Lavinia Kean, under the pseudonym Jessica Blake, is a special mission expert for the American Intelligence Agency. In Rome he deals with an ex-boxer suspected of criminal acts. He will discover that there is an international organization which, under the cover of an Italian nobleman, even threatens the destruction of all the oil existing on Earth. Luckily, she'll take care of it. Screenwriter Richard Maibaum has written many of the James Bond films and here he has done nothing but female the secret agent. The director comes from children's television "spy stories". And it shows.

title: Death Wish 3
actors: Charles Bronson, Deborah Raffin, Ed Lauter, Martin Balsam
description: The executioner / architect Paul Kersey has returned to New York. As soon as he arrives, he is accused of murder. He is then released with a promise to help the police fight a gang of thugs. The result is that he sets a neighborhood on fire, kills the bad guy and leaves for an unknown destination. Nothing changes compared to the previous episodes. There is just an escalation in the quantity of weapons, but that is a minor detail.

title: Tresure Island
actors: Robert Newton, Bobby Driscoll, Basil Sydney, Walter Fitzgerald, Denis O'Dea
description: Little Jim is in search of treasure on pirate island led by Long John Silver, Disney's version of Stevenson's novel.

title: Crazed
actors: Laszlo Papas, Belle Mitchell, Beverly Ross, T.J. McFadden, Rigg Kennedy
description: A psychopath who is staying in a landlord is seized by an insane obsession with a girl, young and beautiful, and begins to haunt her. A worn story for a little film so sloppy as to be irritating.

title: Gulag
actors: David Keith, Malcolm McDowell, David Suchet, Warren Clarke
description: A former athletics champion participates as a telecroist at a sports meeting in Moscow. The KGB sets a trap for him, arrests him as a spy and sends him to a labor camp. Exasperated, he organizes a daring escape with three other prisoners. Uneven film, with some good sequences but too long.

title: Kickboxer
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dennis Alexio, Rochelle Ashana
description: Kurt, the brother of a kickboxing champion who was paralyzed after a fight, engages in grueling training. Objective: to beat Tong Po, the Thai champion responsible for his brother's infirmity. The company is far from easy and the path fraught with obstacles, but tenacity and determination are superior to any difficulty.
notes: Martial arts film with a protagonist reminiscent of Rocky. The result is complacent and often gratuitous violence. It is the film that launched Van Damme.

title: Winterhawk
actors: Michael Dante, Leif Erikson, Woody Strode
description: Cheyenne Winter Hawk is in charge of procuring medicine to combat smallpox. However, he runs into two criminals who steal his skins and kill some men. To get medicine, Winter Hawk kidnaps a girl and her brother. The pursuers will discover the truth and have second thoughts about which side to fight for. Furthermore, the kidnapped girl is conquered by the deep humanity of Winter Hawk.
notes: It is intended to be a tribute to the Indian race, but the result has been partially disregarded. However, it remains a dignified western, to be reported above all for the excellent sense of the landscape that one breathes.

title: Suburban Commando
actors: Hulk Hogan, Christopher Lloyd, Shelley Duvall, Larry Miner
description: We are on the quiet outskirts of any American city where the incredible suddenly happens. An extraterrestrial warrior swoops from interplanetary space, chased by none other than fierce alien bounty hunters. Shep, this is the name of the fugitive, finds refuge in the home of an anonymous couple, Charlie and Jenny Wilcox who are thus involved in the battle.
notes: The idea is to mount a comedy on a science fiction plot, focusing on the ironic presence of a wrestling star as the protagonist. An extremely odd idea: Christopher Lloyd, Shelley Duvall and some decent gags are not enough to keep the level of the film high.

title: Aces: Iron Eagle III
actors: Louis Gossett jr., Rachel McLish, Paul Freeman
description: Chappy Sinclair, a former US aviation ace, enjoys a quiet retirement running a sort of flying circus with his three friends: the Japanese Hirokoshi, the English Palmer and the German Leichman. One day Chappy learns that an old student of his died in a plane crash while transporting drugs. Chappy and his friends leave for South America where they discover a former Nazi behind the foul traffic. He is still the surly but likeable Louis Gosset jr. to play the role of the intrepid pilot. Great adventures and unlikely Rambo shootings, for the third installment of a series that looks at "Top Gun" and current affairs.

title: Joe Dakota
actors: Jock Mahoney, Luana Patten, Charles McGraw, Barbara Lawrence
description: A foreigner arrives in a village where, for venal reasons, citizens have killed an Indian friend of his. There is only the shadow of Sturges' excellent Day of Cursed, in this routine western directed by a specialist.

title: Wings of the Hawks
actors: Van Heflin, Julie Adams, Abbe Lane, George Dolenz, Noah Beery jr.
description: In 1911 a "gringo", engineer of a gold mine, becomes the target of the abuses of a Mexican colonel. He thus finds support with the revolutionaries where he meets the beautiful Raquel. Sloppy and mundane 3D production.

title: The White Buffalo
actors: Charles Bronson, Jack Warden, Kim Novak, John Carradine, Slim Pickens
description: A huge white bison roams the Black Mountains, spreading terror among hunters and Indians. The Sioux Crazy Horse chases him to avenge the death of his little girl. Wild Bill Hickox is in turn on the trail of the quadruped, in the company of his friend Charlie Zane. The paths of the Indian warrior and the white gunslinger cross a few times, before the two face the bison together.
notes: What could have been a western version of "Moby Dick" results in a film whose script focuses entirely on the adventurous aspect. The "monster" is the work of Carlo Rambaldi.

title: Hero and the Terror
actors: Chuck Norris, Jack O'Halloran, Brynn Thayer, Jeffrey Kramer
description: Nothing to say about detective O'Brien: he's a tough guy who knows his job well. Even if he's not the same since the time he managed to put Simon Moon, a multi-murderous psychopath, also known as "the Terror", in jail. Since that day O'Brien suffers from nightmares and is no longer able to sleep like he used to and, now that Simon has escaped from the criminal asylum, he risks not sleeping at all. The result is mediocre, but with Norris there is nothing to be done. He works in obtusely action roles, but never make him play a cop with inner worries. The very fact that he is capable of thinking is hardly credible.

title: Freejack
actors: Emilio Estevez, Anthony Hopkins, Mick Jagger, Rene Russo
description: Alex Furlong, a famous racing driver, dies during a race in 1991. In reality, he does not die because his body is stolen just a moment before by a gang of assassins who comes from the future. Alex wakes up in a 2009 operating room and discovers that someone is trying to use his body to feed their brain into it. Scientific progress allows it, but Alex goes to great lengths to avoid it. It was since "Performance" (1970) that Mick Jagger hadn't been in a movie. For what weird reasons did he break his fast with this? And Hopkins? For what vile motives will he have allowed himself to be persuaded to add his name to this short film?

title: White Fury
actors: Deke Anderson, Sean Holton, Douglas Harter
description: During a quiet weekend in the snow, two couples are kidnapped by a gang of sadistic thugs.
notes: Authentic Z series directed by a specialist.

title: Ambush
actors: Robert Taylor, Arlene Dahl, John Hodiak, Don Taylor
description: A woman is kidnapped by the Apaches and her sister does everything to free her along with a very brave Indian guide. A solid western directed by Sam Wood, who died the same year, shortly after finishing editing. Robert Taylor in one of two films in which he plays a Red Indian.

title: Wild Justice
actors: Roy Scheider, Patricia Millardet, Ted McGinley
description: Peter Stride is a former colonel hired by wealthy Magda Altman to track down a dangerous international terrorist: the Caliph. Things get tough quickly. First the Caliph kidnaps his daughter and then kills his best friend who helped him in the search. Peter comes to the conclusion that the Caliph is just Magda, but then comes the showdown with a final twist. Episode shortened from an American television miniseries. Full throttle guards and robbers for seen and seen adventures. Non-existent characters and childish dialogues make an operation that simply aims to fill two hours of programming on TV even more vain.

title: The Driver
actors: Ryan O'Neal, Bruce Dern, Isabelle Adjani, Ronee Blakley
description: The Driver is an ace of the wheel in the service of the underworld. The Inspector tries to frame him by blackmailing some half-notch thugs. The Player acts as a side for the Driver to avoid nasty surprises and after the blow the two have their headaches to get rid of the traitor accomplices. But then she runs away with the loot. The driver is on the ropes, but once again the police have no elements to indict him.
notes: Brilliant Walter Hill: unnamed characters; script geometrically devoted to the application of archetypes. Ryan O'Neal and Isabelle Adjani are serious one last time. We are on the verge of parody, but it is black that wins: without reservations.

title: Out for Justice
actors: Steven Seagal, William Forsythe, Jerry Orbach, Jo Champa
description: Gino Felino is from Brooklyn: contrary to many of his Italian-American friends, who have all become small or large criminals, he decided to be a policeman. But now he is quite angry about the death of his colleague Bobby Lupo. To get justice, Gino arrests the killer's sister and father, a certain Richie Madano. So he goes to find Roxanne, his girlfriend, and finds her dead. But it is by talking to Bobby's widow that Gino discovers the motive. Steven Seagal is a man of a thousand talents. He is an expert in martial arts, he is an actor and he also writes the music for the film here. He already has three films behind him and a pigtail in the same place. If only he had some expression on his face it would be perfect. Even if it is certainly not the acting that counts in these films: and from this point of view, that is the brutally spectacular one, the audience is amply satisfied. Shootings and killings, in the most brutal ways, follow one another at a rapid pace, however, taking the action to the extreme of the grotesque.

title: Repo Man
actors: Harry Dean Stanton, Emilio Estevez, Tracey Walter, Olivia Barash
description: The feats of some car recovery workers held by defaulting buyers mix with the intrigues of crazed scientists, CIA, UFO sighters and radioactivity phenomena. Surprising first work by Alex Cox, photograph by Robby Müller.

title: The Owl
actors: Adrian Paul, Erika Flores, Patricia Charbonneau, Brian Thompson
description: The Owl (Adrian Paul) looks like a real tough guy when he shows up in his flak jacket and heavily armed, but he actually has a heart of gold. When little Lisa asks him to find his father for him, he doesn't think twice about helping her. The dad in question is a biochemist, who has synthesized a new steroid with miraculous properties, and for the Owl it starts with this S.O.S. a new adventure.
notes: Which in reality was also the only one, since this pilot has never been transformed into a TV series. The character, who comes from comics, is not bad, but the direction manages to crush any ambitions. Good photography by Steve Yaconelli.

title: Pony Express
actors: Charlton Heston, Forrest Tucker, Rhonda Fleming, Jan Sterling
description: The strenuous struggle between Buffalo Bill and his friend Wild Bill Hickok, who want to activate a Pony Express service between Missouri and California, and a group of breeders who oppose it. Jerry Hopper takes up a true story, that of the birth of the Pony Express, and makes it a slightly too romanticized western. At the time the story unfolds, Buffalo Bill was between eleven and fourteen - too little even for someone as quick as he was.

title: First Blood
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Brian Dennehy, David Caruso
description: John Rambo, a Vietnam veteran, lives in search of a job and his psychic balance. After being arrested and mistreated, Rambo breaks free and escapes. Hunted by lawmakers, he quickly knocks them out. It is called the National Guard, but for the former Green Beret it's child's play to keep it in check. Eventually Rambo surrenders to his former colonel, who has come from Washington on purpose.
notes: Unlike the two sequels, the first "Rambo" is anything but a video game. Kotcheff is skilled enough to keep a story in tension that risks running out of interest quickly. Beautiful photography and a good sense of the landscape, which recalls the image of "Vietnam in one's own home". Stallone, who also collaborates on the script, manages to give credibility to the character. He would then have plenty of time to make him lose it.

title: The Last Boyscout
actors: Bruce Willis, Damon Wayans, Chelsea Field, Danielle Harris
description: As a secret agent he had saved the President but now, fallen from grace, Detective Joe Hallenbeck lives for the day and is abandoned by his wife and daughter, because he has made a mistress. In addition, the black stripper Corey, who was supposed to protect, is killed. Together with Corey's boyfriend Jimmy Dix, he sets out in search of the killers. The two thus end up on the trail of a shady businessman who will be able to unmask only after daring chases and breathtaking actions. Bruce Willis seems to have specialized in tough but easy-to-beat detective roles. And it is precisely the irony with which the story is dealt with the aspect that differentiates this film from others of the genre.

title: The War Wagon
actors: John Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Bruce Dern, Howard Keel, Keenan Wynn, Emilio Fernández
description: After unjustly serving a jail term, gunslinger Taw Jackson returns home determined to take revenge on Frank Pierce, the dishonest landowner who took away his ranch and mine. The plan is to rob a heavily guarded stagecoach transporting Pierce's gold, and to achieve this, Jackson allies himself with the killer Lomax, his former enemy, and with an Indian adventurer ...
notes: Counterpoint work between classic western and comedy, with John Wayne and Kirk Douglas ironic old lions. Kennedy likes to contaminate the genre with parody accents, and in this case the attempt has a pleasant outcome. The tragic depth of the epic of the West is very lightened, but it is felt.

title: Green Fire
actors: Stewart Granger, Grace Kelly, Paul Douglas, John Ericson, Murvyn Vye
description: Taken by a fever of wealth, he quarrels with his partners and his fiancée over an emerald mine, but in the end he gives up everything out of love. Good action sequences neutralized by boring dialogue and sentimentality.

title: Code Name: Vengeance
actors: Robert Ginty, Shannon Tweed, Cameron Mitchell, James Ryan
description: In a third world country, a group of guerrillas, led by Tabrak, kidnaps the wife and daughter of King Tabal Tasrallah. There is only one man in the world capable of fighting on equal terms with Tabrak: Munro Beeler, but it so happens that he is temporarily in prison. Promptly released by the American authorities, Beeler accepts the mission and frees the hostages. It would be nice to say that David Winters is one who is more comfortable in horror than in action cinema. But also his musical version of Dr. Jekyll and mr. Hyde with Kirk Douglas was heartbreaking. In any case, action cinema is not for him.

title: Pink Cadillac
actors: Clint Eastwood, Bernadette Peters, John Dennis Johnston
description: Tommy Novak (Eastwood), skilled bounty hunter, is tasked with picking up a certain Lou Anne (Peters) who just got out of jail on bail and then disappeared, with $ 250,000, in a pink Cadillac . The man turns her back, but things get complicated because there is a young daughter and a husband involved in action with his group of neo-Nazis. Directed by Buddy Van Horn, but in reality it is Eastwood's personality that dominates the entire film. Perhaps, if he had also signed the direction, we would have avoided some length and many platitudes.

title: Eye of the Tiger
actors: Gary Busey, Yaphet Kotto, Seymour Cassel
description: Buck Matthews returns home from jail. All that matters in his life is the love of his wife Christie and their little Jennifer. But his return soon turns into a war: a gang of bikers kill Christie in revenge and reduce Jennifer to death. From that moment on Buck seeks only his revenge together with his friend J.B. Deveraux, aide to the sheriff.
notes: Sarafian had her golden moment a long time ago with films like "White Man Go With Your God". But to make a living, however, he was really bad, forced to direct stuff like this similjustiziere of the night: an hour and a half of unpretentious action.

title: The Sea Chase
actors: John Wayne, Lana Turner, David Farrar, Lyle Bettger, Tab Hunter
description: A German freighter leaves Sydney Harbor at night for Valparaiso. At his command is Captain Karl Ehrlich, among the passengers is Elsa Keller, in love with him. The boat, an outlawed freighter, is chased by the British warship "Rockhampton" captained by Jeffrey Napier, an enemy but a great admirer of Ehrlich. But when Napier believes that some fishermen from an island have been killed on Ehrlich's orders, he swears him deadly hatred and pursues him, determined to eliminate him.
notes: Spectacular film that unravels between hatred and thirst for revenge, but which also enhances the courage and ideals of its protagonists: the classic self-respecting enemies of many war films. Wayne is German!

title: Blood Beach
actors: David Huffman, Mariana Hill, John Saxon
description: After the mysterious disappearance of some bathers from a beach, it turns out that a monstrous and voracious being is hidden under the sand. Aside from the poverty of production, it is a boring and patched-up attempt to re-propose the story of the Shark.

title: El Diablo
actors: Anthony Edwards, Louis Gossett jr., Joe Pantoliano, Robert Beltran
description: A clumsy teacher teams up with a black gunfighter to retrieve his student kidnapped by bandits. Cheerful Western with final escalation of violence, written by John Carpenter among others and shot for cable TV.

title: Bad Trip
directors: Philip J. Roth, James E. Lowry
actors: Dino Castagno, Cynthia Sheperd
