description: Seventy-two hours in the life of Tom Snelling, a man haunted by misfortunes, psychopaths and creditors. The title, however, is double-edged: even the film is a really bad trip.

title: Fortress
actors: Christopher Lambert, Loryn Locklin, Kurtwood Smith, Lincoln Kilpatrick
description: Year 2013: the second pregnancy became a crime. Captain John Brennick, however, does not control himself and his wife Karen becomes pregnant for the second time. The two are discovered and imprisoned. The prison is an upside-down skyscraper (it goes from level zero to minus thirty). All inmates are made to swallow a gastric fibrillator capable of giving horrible spasms if only a yellow line is crossed. John ends up at the wheel of torture and falls into a catatonic state. Karen is coveted by the prison director and, at least apparently, she can't say no.
notes: The subject is not really that science fiction, since there is such a law in China. The sequence in which the inmates discover the way to expel the gastric fibrillator and the fight on the catwalk are good. Lambert is also good, especially in the moments when he is catatonic, also because it comes naturally to him. Delicious Loryn Locklin. Too bad that Gordon is not as lightning-fast as his namesake Flash.

title: Walker, Texas Ranger
actors: Chuck Norris, Clarence Gilyard, Gailard Sartain
description: Cordell Walker is a Texas ranger of Indian blood. He and his colleague Jimmy Trivette investigate the mysterious death of a vet. He tried to understand the reasons for the death of cattle that afflicts the region. During a difficult investigation ...

title: The Lawnmower Man
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Mark Bringleson
description: Jobe Smith, a harmless mentally retarded, undergoes drug treatment in the laboratory. The goal is to dilate and stimulate his intelligence. The research company that exploits it does not, however, have peaceful aims; Jobe also becomes the guinea pig of an experiment that crosses an increase in aggression with the inclusion in virtual reality. From a story by Stephen King (who seems to have disowned the adaptation), a banal science fiction film, yet another variation of "Frankenstein", supported by amazing special effects.

title: The Rocketeer
actors: Billy Campbell, Alan Arkin, Jennifer Connelly, Paul Sorvino, Timothy Dalton, Jon Polito
description: In Los Angeles in 1938, a gangster hides a package in an old plane and then dies in a car accident. The package is found by pilot Cliff (Campbell) and contains a device that, worn as a backpack, allows a man to soar in the sky. The famous actor Neville Sinclair (Dalton), a Nazi spy, is interested in the invention, who goes on to kidnap Jenny (Conelly), Bill's girlfriend, in order to get hold of it. The Rocketeer is a comic strip from '81 by Dave Stevens that tries to re-read the comic strips of the thirties. Disney has put all of its talents on the production design, saving some money on writing, directing and everything in between. The protagonist couple does not create major thrills and right Dalton seems to be enjoying the role of the villain. Final proceeds for Italy: one hundred and thirty million; a sensational flop.

title: The Child
actors: Laurel Barret, Rosalie Cole, Frank Janson
description: A woman accepts the position of housekeeper in a remote region and finds herself grappling with an 11-year-old who, in revenge for her murdered mother, leads a group of zombies to kill those she believes responsible for the crime or who obstruct her

title: A Gunfight
actors: Kirk Douglas, Johnny Cash, Karen Black, Keith Carradine, Raf Vallone
description: Willy Tenneray lives in a New Mexico village with his wife, son and a reputation as a gunslinger behind him. Abe Cross arrives in the village, also no longer young, but with an illustrious past. The two would have no desire to challenge each other, but fate confronts them, forcing them to sell the spectacle of their latest duel. Typical adult western, dirty and well written, even produced by an Indian community.

title: White Fang
actors: Ethan Hawke, Klaus Maria Brandauer, Seymour Cassel
description: Young Jack Conroy arrives in the Klondike in 1898 to claim the rights to his missing father's mine. With the help of guide Alex Larson, Jack heads to the mine area through countless adventures. He stops at Gray Beaver where he meets White Fang, half dog and half wolf, ready to give him his friendship and even save his life. But, as Jack continues his journey, White Fang is taken by the cruel Beauty Smith who intends to make him a fighting animal.
notes: The film is inspired by the London novel, but White Fang only reaches the middle of the film and is never the protagonist. The protagonist is Ethan Hawke, quite bewildered.

title: Airport
actors: Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, Jacqueline Bisset, Helen Hayes
description: On the Chicago-Rome flight, there is a mad bomber who intends to blow up the plane so that his wife can collect life insurance. Commander Vernon tries in vain to dissuade him and the situation remains tense until, because of a passenger. From Arthur Hailey's bestseller, a meatloaf with a cast of stars and ex-stars (Helen Hayes won the Oscar for supporting).

title: Black Moon Rising
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Hamilton, Robert Vaughn, Bubba Smith
description: The Black Moon is a prototype car capable of reaching 500 kilometers per hour, in which Quint has hidden a hot audio cassette, stolen on behalf of tax officials.

title: The Horse Soldiers
actors: John Wayne, William Holden, Constance Towers, Althea Gibson
description: Northern Colonel Marlowe sets out to infiltrate enemy territory and sabotage Confederate supplies. Following him is Kendall, a medical officer. It soon becomes clear that the two hate each other. At a certain point they are forced to join a woman, who after hosting them was caught spying on them. During the trip we discover the reason for Marlowe's hatred for doctors: they caused the death of his wife through inexperience. Meanwhile, not only Kendall wins the esteem of the officer, but also the woman. Pure military Ford, less melancholy and profound than others, but with masterful scenes (the departure of the soldiers-children)

title: Watusi
actors: George Montgomery, Taina Elg, David Farrar, Rex Ingram
description: Harry Quartermain travels to Africa on the trail of his father who died during an ill-fated expedition in search of King Solomon's fabled mines. On the spot, Harry meets Rick Cobb, an experienced hunter and friend of his father. The two decide to organize a safari and go into the forest. After a few days of walking they discover the remains of a Protestant mission. While searching the area, Harry and Rick find some women's clothing that lead them on the trail of Erica, daughter of the missionary and prisoner of the Kaluana warriors.
notes: A skilful variation work on the delightful 1937 Gainsborough production, "King Solomon's Mines".

title: Frenchie
actors: Shelley Winters, Joel McCrea, Paul Kelly
description: She calls herself Yvonne and, from New Orleans, returns to her native village in the West to avenge the murder of her father, carried out by two bad guys when she was a child. His private warfare soon finds an affectionate ally in the sheriff.
notes: Modest and conventional western melodrama.

title: The Goonies
actors: Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Jeff Cohen, Ke Huy Quan, Anne Ramsey, Corey Feldman, Martha Plimpton, Kerri Green, John Matuszak, Robert Davi, Joe Pantoliano, Lupe Ontiveros, Mary Ellen Trainor, Steve Antin
description: A group of powerful people is buying all the houses in the Goon Docks neighborhood with clear speculative intent. A gang of neighborhood kids, the Goonies, try to fight back, but don't even know where to start. Then, one evening, while rummaging in the attic, the boys discover a yellowed Spanish map that contains precise indications on how to find an ancient treasure. The small band thus enters an abandoned chalet and from there into a labyrinth of caves. However, the boys do not know that the place is the secret base of operations of a gang of thieves headed by "Mamma Fratelli" and her two violent sons. After a thousand ups and downs, traps, underground rivers and pirate vessels, our heroes will arrive at the treasure and save the neighborhood. The film is a reinterpretation of the pirate film, smashing and funny, shot for kids but with cinephile taste (the subject is by Spielberg, who is also a producer, the screenplay by Chris Columbus). The underground scenographies are beautiful.

title: The Far Horizons
actors: Fred MacMurray, Charlton Heston, Donna Reed, Barbara Hale
description: In 1803 the United States bought Louisiana and the officers Clark and Lewis were entrusted with the exploration. In their mission the two soldiers come across a tribe of Indians at war with that of the Scioanes, the sister of whose leader is their prisoner. Clark falls in love with her, reciprocated, who decides to take her with him to Washington to marry her. But the Indian immediately realizes that this is not her world. Rudolph Maté, former cameraman for Dreyer, Lubitsch and Hitchcock, is considered one of the most interesting B-movie directors. This western is one of his most successful products, despite the sentimental component being a bit forced.

title: Charro!
actors: Elvis Presley, Ina Balin, Victor French, Barbara Werle, Salomon Sturges
description: Jess Wade, aka Charro, tries to quit the bandit profession to start an honest life, but the gang leader disagrees. Presley wasn't made for the western.

title: Pony Soldier
actors: Tyrone Power, Cameron Mitchell, Robert Horton, Thomas Gomez
description: Towards the middle of the nineteenth century the border area between the United States and Canada was subject to the raids of the Indians. Following their repeated attacks, Private Chris and Lieutenant Duncan are sent to the scene to try to persuade Brown Bear to stop his parents. After various events Duncan manages to persuade the leader to bury the hatchet and free two prisoners. But Brown Bear finds the hostility of a member of his tribe.
notes: Predictable film, with Power showman.

title: Never Cry Wolf
actors: Charles Martin Smith, Brian Dennehy, Zachary Ittimangnacq
description: In Canada, wolves are thought to threaten the last of the caribou. A biologist goes to the "white desert" of the North and discovers unexpected truths. Smiling ecological fairy tale and beautiful images of wild Alaska, directed by the director of "Black Beauty", but without too much sillyness despite the Disney production.

title: Lethal Weapon 3
actors: Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Joe Pesci, Rene Russo, Stuart Wilson, Steve Kahan, Darlene Love, Traci Wolfe, Damon Hines, Ebonie Smith, Nick Chinlund, Alan Scarfe, Delores Hall
description: In Los Angeles, black cop Roger Murtaugh (Danny Glover), a staid and respected family man, is about to happily retire. The agent he is paired with, Martin Riggs (Mel Gibson), is instead white, wild and with something wrong with his head (because of Vietnam), so much so that he has earned the nickname "Lethal Weapon". In addition to this Martin is also quite convincing when he insists on Roger to investigate a theft of illegal weapons destined to be destroyed. They are joined by Lorna Cole, a smarter and more aggressive detective than Martin and Roger are willing to believe, at least at first. After a series of chases, shootings and explosions, the culprits are framed, Martin falls in love with Lorna and Roger gives up on retirement.

title: Captain from Castile
actors: Tyrone Power, Jean Peters, Lee J. Cobb, Cesar Romero, John Sutton
description: In 1518 Pedro Vargas, a Spanish gentleman, saves a runaway slave, escapes the Inquisition, which however kills his sister, and injures Don Diego De Silva, owner of the slave, in a duel. Then follows Fernando Cortez to America. Here Don Diego reappears, who is murdered. Pedro is immediately suspected of the murder and risks hanging but, acquitted, he will follow Cortez until victory.
notes: The historical background acts as a simple support for a show in which adventure predominates. Enjoyable.

title: Gray Lady Down
actors: Charlton Heston, David Carradine, Stacy Keach, Ned Beatty
description: The Neptune atomic submarine of the "Gray Lady" class is returning to base after a successfully completed exercise outing. The crew celebrates the second officer who is about to take over command from Captain Samuelson. A Norwegian merchant ship, however, rams the Neptune which plunges to a depth of 450 meters, in a landslide area crossed by very insidious currents. Rescue operations begin (there are only 41 survivors, out of a crew of 93 men), while on board Captain Samuelson is too shocked to be efficient yet. The intervention of a tiny submarine, the Snack, piloted by its inventor, Captain Gates, and not yet tested is fundamental; there are acts of heroism, but also other victims, including Captain Gates himself. There is a rich cinemagraphic "genre" based on catastrophes which, in its best examples, ensures tension and spectacle. Unfortunately, this is not the case with this film, whose most evident flaw is that it has not been able to effectively dose its various components: the human drama of the castaways is only sketchy, the suspense is obvious, the spectacular dimension is weak and not even underwater shooting is recommended for particular vigor. The actors and their solid profession are saved by all means, but the overall balance is a bit disappointing.

title: Time After Time
actors: Malcolm McDowell, David Warner, Mary Steenburgen
description: From Victorian London, Jack the Ripper escapes to modern San Francisco using H.G. Wells' time machine. The scientist-thinker-writer pursues him to neutralize him. A film with a vague literary taste, enjoyable overall, played on the thread of the fantastic and the ironic reinterpretation of the horror genre. There is no lack of love story and moralizing closure on violence in our century.

title: Gun Fury
actors: Rock Hudson, Donna Reed, Phil Carey, Lee Marvin, Roberta Haynes, Leo Gordon
description: A woman is kidnapped by Southern outlaws after a stagecoach assault. Her boyfriend (Hudson) pursues the bandits and takes revenge. Shot in 3-D; solid, but not the best of Walsh.

title: The Lost Boys
actors: Jason Patric, Corey Haim, Dianne Wiest, Jami Gertz, Barnard Hughes, Edward Herrmann, Kiefer Sutherland, Corey Feldman, Jamison Newlander, Brooke McCarter, Billy Wirth, Alex Winter
description: Young Michael gets into trouble with a punk gang. But everyone understands, even his younger brother Sam, that they are vampires instead. The cast is very interesting, the direction a little less, but it's still a compelling juvenile horror.

title: Huckleberry Finn
actors: Jeff East, Paul Winfield, Harvey Korman, David Wayne
description: The sequel to "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" tells the escape along the Mississippi of Huck and his friend the Negro Jim, from Mrs. Douglas, who would like to "educate" him and from the drunkard father who would like to seize the treasure that Huck earned by unmasking, with Tom Sawyer, the Indian killer. Musical version of the famous novel by Mark Twain with which, however, he has little in common.

title: Tom Sawyer
actors: Johnnie Whitaker, Jeff East, Jodie Foster, Warren Oates
description: Tom Sawyer and his friend Huck Finn witnessed the crime committed by a half-blooded Indian who, however, manages to put the responsibility for the fact of blood on another. At the trial, however, Tom unmasks the culprit, but the Indian escapes. During a school trip Tom discovers the Indian's hiding place (and treasure) in a cave ...
notes: Musical version of Mark Twain's masterpiece. Among the other performers there is also a very young (and unrecognizable) Jodie Foster. A good one who guesses it

title: The Exile
actors: Douglas Fairbanks jr., Maria Montez, Paule Croset, Henry Daniell
description: Because of Cromwell's followers, Charles II flees into exile in Holland. But even there he is discovered (by the group of "round heads") and then he has nothing left but to take refuge in the countryside. Having entered the service of the innkeeper Kate, Carlo takes pleasure in life in the fields and in Kate's presence, until, after escaping yet another ambush, he learns that his homeland is demanding him again. Six years after his arrival in Hollywood, the exile Ophuls makes a film about exile, full of sequence shots, packed with dollies and with a delirious theatrical setting. A Douglas jr still struggling with his father's ghost helps him, even as a screenwriter.

title: The Lone Star
actors: Clark Gable, Ava Gardner, Lionel Barrymore, Beulah Bondi
description: In 1845, Texas was still not part of the United States Confederation. Opinions differ in the country: there are those who want annexation and those who favor independence. In such circumstances, faced with the danger of an armed conflict, the former president of the Confederation decides to make a peaceful attempt to achieve annexation. This is where adventurer David Burke (Clark Gable) steps in.
notes: The story is fictional and the characters are hardly recognizable to the European audience. The cast is, as always in these cases, top notch but fails to be fully convincing. There is also a colorized version.

title: 3 Ninjas
actors: Chad Power, Max Elliott Slade, Michael Treanor, Victor Wong
description: Rocky, Colt and Tum Tum are three Southern California kids. Their father, FBI agent Sam Douglas, is investigating a dangerous arms dealer, Hugo Snyder, but in the end who gets in the way are the three young men who are kidnapped by the bad guys. And luckily, since childhood, the three brothers have learned all the tricks on martial arts from their grandfather ... The usual film of unlistenable beatings and screams with the only variation that here the three protagonists are almost microscopic. Seeing them take down mammoth opponents with karate shots, all in all, it's not bad. Apart from that, the film does not otherwise exist.

title: Junior Bonner
actors: Steve McQueen, Robert Preston, Ida Lupino, Ben Johnson
description: Junior Bonner is the son of a former rodeo champion who now has a dream of moving to Australia in search of gold. Junior's career is also in decline; when he goes to Prescott, his hometown, his brother Curly wants to involve him in construction business but Junior is not there.
notes: Junior is the loser par excellence, privileged protagonist of Sam Peckinpah's cinema: unable to measure himself with reality but capable of moving and noble gestures. Steve McQueen and Robert Preston are extraordinary. The film is moving and beautiful.

title: The Big Circus
actors: Victor Mature, Rhonda Fleming, Peter Lorre, Red Buttons, Vincent Price
description: In order to obtain a loan, the owner (Mature) of a circus accepts the presence of the administrator (Fleming) sent by the bank. Film not very original, but which has a good fluidity of development. Worth a look at least for Peter Lorre who is a clown.

title: Beauty and the Beast
actors: George C. Scott, Trish Van Devere, Virginia McKenna, Bernard Lee
description: To save her father, a prisoner in the castle ruled by a monstrous being and guilty only of having picked a rose in his garden, a beautiful girl agrees to marry the Beast thus breaking the spell and freeing the monster-prince from a terrible curse.
notes: Television version of the famous fairy tale by Madame Leprince de Beaumont. Scott received an Emmy nomination for Best Television Actor, as did the creators of the makeup and costumes.

title: Tom Thumb
actors: Russ Tamblyn, Jessie Matthews, Peter Sellers
description: Woodcutter Jonathan and his wife Anna dream of having a child. The Queen of the Woods then gives them a child so small that he is immediately nicknamed Tom Thumb. With a deception two thieves make him steal the treasure of the country. Jonathan is blamed for the theft, but Tom Thumb will save the day.
notes: Musical version of the famous fairy tale of which he accentuates the fantastic tones. Pal was a wizard of handcrafted fantasy.

title: Northwest Passage
actors: Spencer Tracy, Robert Young, Ruth Hussey, Walter Brennan
description: Major Rogers is charged with a very dangerous mission: to reach and destroy a camp of Indians (allies of the French) who have massacred a group of English settlers. Their village is located in the intricate and impenetrable virgin forest that hides a thousand human and natural dangers. Once the mission is completed, Rogers is entrusted with the task of finding the passage to the Northwest.
notes: Spectacular and violent adventure film about a group of rough men in the harsh environment of the late 1700s American Great North. It was the first color film made by King Vidor which was to be followed by the part of the search for the Northwest Passage that was not carried out.

title: Sahara
actors: Brooke Shields, Lambert Wilson, Horst Buchholz, John Mills
description: We are in 1928: Dale Gordon participates, disguised as a man, in a dangerous rally in the desert. Among the competitors is a German who sells weapons to Arabs engaged in a war in which Dale and his faithful mechanics become involved. Taken prisoner, Dale agrees to marry the tribal chief Jaffar, madly in love with her. However, he escapes from him immediately after the wedding: only for the time to win the rally, however, then he returns. Cartoon in which everyone, from the director to the actors, take the matter lightly, in the face of the public.

title: The Blob
actors: Steve McQueen, Aneta Corseaut, Earl Rowe, Olin Howlin
description: A meteorite falls to earth, but it doesn't have a great consistency. More than anything else, it is a gelatinous mass capable of sucking up and incorporating everything it comes into contact with. An old man from a small town in the province pays for it, then the doctor who treated him and then his nurse. Meanwhile, the blob goes on unstoppable, overflowing and refractory to everything. Anything but the cold. Teenager Steve McQueen (in his third film) saves citizenship, instead of targeting them with a rifle, as he would often do later. The subject is splendid, the realization less. In short, the metaphor is worth more than all the rest.

title: The Wild North
actors: Stewart Granger, Wendell Corey, Cyd Charisse, Morgan Farley
description: Accused of murder, Jules Vincent (Granger), a Canadian fur trapper, is on the run being chased by Officer Pedley (Corey). Life in the North is tough and wolves attack in packs. This is how Pedley ends up losing his mind and it will be Vincent who will help him get home and, above all, come to his senses. At trial, Pedley's testimony will be instrumental.
notes: Adventures in the snow, avalanches, wolf attacks and river rapids. Only romantic interludes are Granger's paddles together with Cyd Charisse in an Indian role. In short, standard adventures for which it is difficult to get excited.

title: The Covered Wagon
actors: Lois Wilson, J. Warren Kerrigan, Alan Hale, Charles Ogle
description: In 1848 a caravan of pioneers moved from Westport Landing (the future Kansas City) to the lands of Oregon, three thousand kilometers to the west. The journey, adventurous and fraught with danger, is made even more dramatic by the rivalry of two men, Woodhull and Banion, for Molly. Part of the convoy turns to California in search of gold, but it is in Oregon that the story ends. The film, made with an exceptional breadth of means on the authentic places of action, is one of the recognized cornerstones of the entire western genre. Epic, historically reliable and honest even when it describes the struggle of the Indians for their land.

title: High Risk
actors: James Brolin, Cleavon Little, Lindsay Wagner, Ernest Borgnine
description: Four citizens of Los Angels are enlisted in the mercenary troops and then catapulted to Colombia, to fight against the drug traffickers led by the ferocious Serrano. After having stolen five million dollars from the latter's treasure they will come (in order): captured by the police, freed by a group of revolutionary bandits, robbed, bombed several times ...
notes: The director, Stuart Raffill, is above all an expert on children's films. Here too, in a certainly more adult setting film, fun and picaresque prevail, despite the rawness of the firefights. The script runs into several very implausible passages.

title: 5 Card Stud
actors: Dean Martin, Robert Mitchum, Inger Stevens, Roddy McDowall
description: During a game of poker, a player accused of cheating is lynched; later the other players are mysteriously killed one after the other. Curious suspense western, not one of the best directed by Hathaway.

title: From Beyond
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Barbara Crampton, Ken Foree
description: A rather ambiguous scientist and his assistant invent a machine that allows us to look into another dimension.
notes: Suspence, horrible monsters and imaginative special effects from the director of Re-Animator, an ironic specialist in the genre who is also inspired by Lovecraft here.

title: THX 1138
actors: Robert Duvall, Maggie McOmie, Donald Pleasence, Ian Wolfe
description: In a future authoritarian society, men live underground and are reduced to being a serial number. Even the differences between the sexes have been abolished, love proscribed, reproduction entrusted to laboratory techniques. So when THX 1138 falls in love with LUH 417 the authority intervenes by setting in motion all its repressive capacity to defend itself. Only one of the two "rebels" manages to escape. Excellent "negative utopia" a la Orwell; the film is aseptic, anguished and white. It is the first - but also the most subtle - work of George Lucas, the director who will become famous with "Star Wars" and yet will never be so good again.

title: Wolfen
actors: Albert Finney, Diane Venora
description: A New York detective tries to neutralize some mysterious beasts that wreak havoc on the city.
notes: A fine photograph contributes to the surreal atmosphere of the film.

title: Nomads
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Lesley-Anne Down, Anna Maria Monticelli, Mary Woronov, Adam Ant, Nina Foch
description: A man in shock and with numerous injuries is hospitalized in a hospital in Los Angeles, who dies after biting Dr. Eileen Flax who had approached to steal his words. It turns out that the man was Charles Pommier, an anthropologist who studied African and Eskimo myths. Eileen relives the last days of Charls's life discovering that he was following a gang of young punks, the incarnation of the spirits he studied. Film with a baroque and complex construction made in flashbacks, centered on the struggle between good (science) and evil (spirits). Disturbing and technically very remarkable.

title: The Iron Horse
actors: George O'Brien, Madge Bellamy, Charles Edward Bull
description: In 1862 Abraham Lincoln began construction of the railroad, which will connect the Atlantic coast to California. Nine years earlier, an engineer attempting the feat had been murdered. Among a thousand vicissitudes and after a great battle against the Indians, the project is finally completed. A John Ford not yet thirty years old raises, with his first western, a monument to the railway builders and also to President Lincoln, not without some excess of rhetoric. The film is a real "blockbuster" of great spectacular effectiveness.

title: China Seas
actors: Jean Harlow, Clark Gable, Wallace Beery, Rosalind Russell
description: Although his jealous mistress is on board, the captain of a ferry traveling between Hong Kong and Singapore is engaged to a rich widow. To get revenge, the girl gives a bandit the keys to the armory of the ship that is attacked by the pirates, who, however, are unable to seize the cargo of gold. Justice will triumph.
notes: Thwarted loves, strong passions, pirate raids in the South Seas: if we tried to define the idea of ??"classicism" in the system of genres, this film would provide an ideal synthesis. A simple but well-cooked recipe, with all the ingredients in the right place, as today we can do more and more rarely.

title: The Wrath of God
actors: Robert Mitchum, Rita Hayworth, Victor Buono, Frank Langella
description: An adventurer, an Indian girl in love with him and a priest are in league with the smuggling of alcohol in Central America. The priest has long since stopped carrying out his ministry, but the persecutions to which the religious are subjected pushes him to celebrate a mass that turns into a violent insurrection. Weird in both substance and form.

title: Bulletproof
actors: Gary Busey, Darlanne Fluegel, Henry Silva, Thalmus Rasulala
description: Frank McBain, nicknamed Bulletproof, is a former Los Angeles cop, sick of individualism. He had to abandon his post as a secret agent in the CIA following a mission in which his partner was killed. He is offered a second chance when it comes to confronting and neutralizing a dangerous group of international terrorists based in Mexico.
notes: Steve Carver is one of the many offspring of the Corman Factory. Gary Busey is a "face" that has been around for about twenty years and has never received the attention it perhaps deserved. The film, all in all, also works thanks to the effective cast.

title: Amityville 3-D
actors: Tony Roberts, Tess Harper, Robert Joy, Meg Ryan, Candy Clark
description: A journalist who does not believe in supernatural forces (during his career he has exposed several people who made people believe they have powers as a medium) decides to buy a house. The man, as a sign of defiance, goes to live with his family in the famous house in Amityville, where a man possessed by irrational forces has massacred his family. The idea is not exactly the best in fact ...
notes: Rcihard Fleischer's film is disjointed and unlikely, especially because it makes the mistake of scrambling the themes of the first two episodes badly. Excellent three-dimensional effects, visible, however, only in the cinema.

title: The Texas Rangers
actors: Fred MacMurray, Jack Oakie, Lloyd Nolan, Jean Parker
description: At the end of the last century, three bandits split up: one continues the old life of misdeeds alone, the other two, convinced that the Rangers are inflexible in their vigilance, join the corps of volunteers. One of the two is killed by the bandit, the other, who had been arrested, is freed and settles accounts with the former friend; now he can marry the daughter of his boss, whom he loves, loved in return. The transition from bandits to guardians of the law is not trivial. Solid directing in the canons of western cinema, with functional use of the landscape.

title: Firestarter
actors: Drew Barrymore, George C. Scott, David Keith, Martin Sheen
description: Little Charlie (Barrymore) is gifted with pyrokinesis, which is the ability to set fire to the mind. The secret services, who would like to use it, kill the mother and try to kidnap her, but dad Andy, also with paranormal powers, neutralizes the agents and runs away with the child. Hunted and finally captured, they are studied in military laboratories, where they pretend to have tamed themselves. But they try to escape again. Stephen King's novels do not always work well in the cinema, and this is confirmed by this film, tortuous and boring, directed by Mark Lester a year before "Commando". Too bad also for the overall interesting cast.

title: Cliffhanger
actors: Sylvester Stallone, John Lithgow, Michael Rooker, Janine Turner, Caroline Goodall
description: Traumatized by an accident in which he was unable to save a girl's life, Gabe Walker decides to do away with the mountains. However, when a plane crashes in the middle of the mountains, and he is in those parts, he cannot resist and agrees to leave in search of the survivors. He finds them immediately, but at the same time discovers that they are criminals. They take him hostage, together with another guide, to retrieve three briefcases full of dollars which, following the accident, ended up on the rocky walls and glaciers in the area. Shot halfway between Cortina and Hollywood, Harlin's film did not have the expected success. Yet there are some very impressive high-altitude footage and then there's Michael Rooker in one of his rare appearances after "Henry, Rain of Blood".

title: Unforgiven
actors: Clint Eastwood, Gene Hackman, Morgan Freeman, Richard Harris
description: A group of prostitutes wants to take revenge on two cowboys who have scarred one of them. The Kid comes forward and convinces the former gunslinger rusty from age and grief for the loss of his beloved wife William Munny. Munny's trusted friend the black Ned Logan is also added. The latter is killed and Munny beaten to death. But the killer’s soul has the upper hand, and the former gunslinger clashes with the enemy of the past ...
notes: Eastwood has made a film in which the strong themes of the western genre are praised in the cold and desperation of tragedy. This is why the film resembles a "noir" where heroes can no longer exist. Oscar for Best Picture, Direction, Gene Hacman as Supporting and Editing.

title: The Devil Doll
actors: Lionel Barrymore, Maureen O'Sullivan, Rafaela Ottiano
description: A banker who has been unjustly sentenced to many years in prison escapes. In his cell he had learned, from a mad scientist, the formula for making a substance that, when ingested, shrinks people. Disguised as an old lady, the banker opens a shop in Paris with his "toys". He actually uses them, after having hypnotized them, to take revenge on those who played a part in his sentence. One of these in effect confesses his guilt but, a raging fire in the shop also destroys the laboratory, nullifying the vengeful work. Very effective and still valid horror that manages to combine fantastic themes with scientific ones. Browing confirms himself as a master of the genre, assisted by Barrymore's luciferian lucidity.

title: The Virginian
actors: Joel McCrea, Brian Donlevy, Sonny Tufts, Barbara Britton
description: A young breeder, known as Il Virginiano, falls in love with a girl who has been called to be a teacher in a western town. The girl at first escapes his care, but in the end she gives in, and agrees to take a ride on horseback with him. During the walk, the two meet a friend of the man who is burning a stolen calf. The Virginian thus has clear proof that his friend is Campos' accomplice, a bad guy who systemically robs the farmers in the area.
notes: Modest remake of Victor Fleming's 1929 film of the same name with Gary Cooper. Pure craft.

title: The Assassin
actors: Bridget Fonda, Gabriel Byrne, Dermot Mulroney, Anne Bancroft, Harvey Keitel
description: Maggie (Fonda) is a misfit, sentenced to death. Secret agent Bob offers her safety: in exchange she must become a killer for the dirtiest operations of counterintelligence. After months of hard training and some missions, falling in love with a photographer, Maggie asks to break away from the organization but receives a new assignment that seems to go wrong.
notes: This "Nikita" remake doesn't have the odd charm of Luc Besson's work, but it's still enjoyable. In the cast, Keitel is already a great "liquidator", one year before "Pulp Fiction".

title: Innocent Blood
actors: Anthony La Paglia, Anne Parillaud, Robert Loggia, Chazz Palminteri
description: Marie (Anne Parillaud) has decided she wants to eat Italian. Marie is a vampire woman and the Italians she would like to eat are the men of the mafia, among which the boss Sal Macelli (Robert Loggia) stands out. Marie is also pretty, with her glow-in-the-dark eyes, and Sal doesn't take long to invite her over for dinner. Result: Sal bleeds to death and turns himself into a vampire. At that point the troubles begin. Landis falters, gets lost behind unpromising projects (The prince seeks a wife) then hits a short film that is already a cult. Parillaud (Nikita) is really nice. Among the minor roles try to recognize Sam Raimi, Michael Ritchie and Dario Argento.

title: Posse
actors: Mario Van Peebles, Stephen Baldwin, Charles Lane, Billy Zane, Isaac Hayes, Pam Grier
description: Take a group of buffalo soldiers, black soldiers used by the US military in the 1894 war against Spain, add the infallible gunslinger Jesse Lee (Mario Van Peebles), the white Little J, plus a few deserters and you have a posse. That is a group of bastards determined to move to Freemanville despite the opposition of their former commander, Colonel Graham. Director and actor Van Peebles continues to disappoint. Here he wanted to make the first "all black" western in the history of cinema and instead he only made any white western, casually played by black actors.

title: Under Siege
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Steven Seagal, Erika Eleniak, Gary Busey
description: A helicopter with playmate Jordan Tate and William Strannix's band is about to land on the battleship "Missouri". The occasion is the commander's birthday party, but it's an excuse. With the help of Commander Krill, in fact, Strannix takes possession of the "Missouri" and blackmails the President of the United States with the threat of nuclear devices the ship is armed with. The plan seems to work perfectly were it not for the presence of chef Casey (Seagal). Davis, ("The Fugitive"), to make a tense and convincing action film like this one, starring that granite wall by Steven Seagal is forced to make real flips.

title: Gladiator
actors: James Marshall, Cuba Gooding jr., Brian Dennehy, Cara Bono
description: Tommy Riley (Marshall), who has recently moved to a seedy neighborhood, finds himself grappling with a reality of youthful violence completely unknown to him. A former high school boxing champion, he is spotted during a street fist fight by an organizer of illegal boxing matches. To pay off the debts of his father, a gambler and alcoholic, Tommy accepts. Film of good feelings, starring one of the actors of Twin Peaks. Not exciting.

title: Pet Sematary
actors: Dale Midkiff, Fred Gwynne, Denise Crosby, Michael Lombard, Blaze Berdahl, Miko Hughes, Brad Greenquist, Stephen King
description: The new doctor, Louis Creed, has arrived in a small town in Maine. His wife, Rachel, and two children, Ellie and Gage, also move in with him. Near their house there is an ancient Indian cemetery which has the characteristic of transforming the corpses that are buried there into zombies. This happens to Curch, Ellie's kitten, and to little Gage, who is run over by a truck right on the road in front of the house. The first sequence of the truck accident shot pretty well. The novel from which the film is based bears the signature of Stephen King, also author of the screenplay. The name is a guarantee, but this time the result is rather disappointing.

title: Passenger 57
actors: Wesley Snipes, Bruce Payne, Tom Sizemore, Robert Hooks
description: John Cutter was a counterterrorism star until he witnessed his wife's death in a robbery. Today Cutter is flying to Los Angeles where he will work as head of security for an airline. On the same flight there is also the terrorist Charles Rane, duly handcuffed and escorted by a bevy of agents. Cutter starts his work one day earlier.
notes: Wesley Snipes is the star, but if the script had been less obvious the result would have been better.

title: The Sand Pebbles
actors: Steve McQueen, Richard Attenborough, Candice Bergen, Marayat Andrienne
description: The American gunboat San Pablo is anchored on the banks of the Yang-Tze. It is 1926: Chinese nationalists and communists are fighting against Western colonialism. Holman antagonizes the ship's Chinese personnel and is then wrongly found guilty of the death of a woman. Disgusted by the general situation, Holman wants to desert, but ends up dying as a hero defending the local mission.
notes: Three-hour colossal handled with confident hand and beautiful photography by Robert Wise. There is no shortage of spectacular sequences. The work of the interpreters is of good quality.

title: Showdown at Abilene
actors: Jock Mahoney, David Janssen, Martha Hyer, Lyle Bettger
description: A veteran of the Civil War, on his return he finds his girlfriend married and grudgingly accepts a post as sheriff. A restless and interesting low-cost western.

title: Cat's Eye
actors: Drew Barrymore, James Woods, Alan King, Kenneth McMillan
description: The title cat is little more than an extra in the first two of the three stories that make up the film. Here they are in line: an anti-smoking therapy that turns into a nightmare for the patient and his family; a sadistic test of audacity imposed by an old billionaire on his wife's lover: as a prize, according to him, the wife herself; in the third, she plays the lion's share, first saving her own skin, then her mistress from the monsters that haunt her. Subject and script by Stephen King, the film is part of the successful horror vein tinged with irony and uses excellent special effects. I show the cat by interpretation, but the others are also good.

title: McQ
actors: John Wayne, Eddie Albert, Diana Muldaur, Colleen Dewhurst
description: Lieutenant Parker (Wayne) goes straight to the point without paying too much attention to the forms and opinions of his superiors. When his colleague Sten Boyle is killed, he decides to abandon the police and continue his crusade alone. What he discovers is that behind the drug trafficking there are connivance in the political world and in that of the police itself. The drug shipment will eventually be scattered overboard. The plot is the usual of this type of film. What is striking is that politicians and policemen victoriously contend with the traffickers for the palm of the bad guy. Hurricane Watergate had just passed and Wayne himself must have been a little bit bitter.

title: Lion Strike
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Bobbie Phillips, Morgan Honier, Robert Costanzo
description: A doctor decides to go and spend a rest period with his little son in a mountain resort. At first everything seems to be going well: the stay is restful and mother and son end up under the "protective" wing of a charming forester which only makes their excursions more interesting. But the holiday turns into a nightmare when they are attacked by a group of killers perfectly trained in the manhunt even in winter and in the middle of the forest. "The newest race of Evil, meets the oldest race of heroes. ", said the advertisement for this film. And indeed, although unknown to most, Don "the Dragon" Wilson has been making films for a lifetime. All strictly the same and disappointing.

title: Bullwhip
actors: Rhonda Fleming, Guy Madison, James Griffith, Don Beddoe
description: Cheyenne, beautiful and independent, can only have her father's inheritance when she is married; he finds it convenient to marry a man sentenced to death, who is promised pardon only to persuade him to marry. Pleasant adventures with the beautiful, and underrated, Rhonda Fleming.

title: Sitting Bull
actors: Dale Robertson, Mary Murphy, J. Carrol Naish
description: 1876: in the Black Hills sacred to Native Americans, relations with whites become increasingly difficult. While Sitting Bull suggests patience, Crazy Horse is ready to go to war. At the fort, Major Bob Parrish understands the Indians and refuses to support the actions of the gold diggers trespassing into the hills. With Custer's return to the command post, Parrish finds himself in the minority, and his girlfriend, irritated by his fallacious career choices, decides to break the engagement. The war is now looming ...
notes: Despite being quite ahead of its time in sketching the Indians, it remains a crude cross between westerns and melos.

title: Tennessee's Partner
actors: John Payne, Ronald Reagan, Rhonda Fleming
description: A gambler and a young woman nicknamed "Duchess" run a saloon. The "Duchess" is in love with the player who one day escapes an ambush thanks to a cowboy. A solid friendship is born between the two, but it crumbles when the player discovers that the cowboy's girlfriend is a bad guy, tries (and succeeds) to divide them. Western with sentimental tones taken from a short story by Bret Harte and directed with perfect measure by an old master. Among the performers, the future American President Reagan.

title: Rapa Nui
actors: Jason Scott Lee, Esai Morales, Sandrine Holt, Zac Wallace
description: Noro, champion of the noble Long Lobes caste, wants to marry Ramana, of the submissive Short Lobes caste. The leader of the Long Lobes wants to have another huge statue erected, in addition to the existing ones, and this provokes the revolt among the enslaved Short Lobes. In the traditional contest of the "bird men" Noro will have to fight against his friend Make, a Lobo Corto, who is also in love with Ramana. Authentic places, many natives to act as extras (but the protagonists are "white"), sought-after spectacularity, many tourist sequences for yet another revival of impossible love due to social divisions, but also with an ecological message.

title: The Dark Half
actors: Timothy Hutton, Amy Madigan, Michael Rooker, Julie Harris
description: Thad Beaumont is a moderately successful teacher and writer. George Stark is the pseudonym under which Beaumont publishes a series of highly successful novels. When this is revealed, Beaumont publicly decides to do the funeral at his double. But Stark is not there and takes revenge by killing anyone he believes responsible for his demise.
notes: Romero meets Stephen King. The result isn't quite the sum of the two, but it's still good.

title: Body Snatchers
actors: Gabrielle Anwar, Meg Tilly, Christine Elise, Forest Whitaker, R. Lee Ermey, Terry Kinney
description: Marty Malone's father is a biologist for the US military. Marty is seventeen, a stepmother she can't stand and a craving to run away from Fort Daly. Also because strange things happen there: there is a major doctor on the verge of neurosis, an accident with chemicals and in addition, unseen, strange cocoons that form under the beds or on the roofs of the houses.
notes: Remake of the splendid Invasion of the Body Snatchers by Don Siegel. Gabrielle Anwar is cute, Christine Elise is deadly and Meg Tilly works, even if sometimes she is a little out of the ordinary. Full Metal Jacket "Sergeant Hartman", Lee Ermey, is a rather out-of-the-way General Platt here.

title: The Alamo
actors: John Wayne, Richard Widmark, Laurence Harvey, Frankie Avalon
description: 1836. In the ancient fortified mission of Alamo, Texas, volunteers under the command of Jim Bowie and Colonel Travis are barricaded, with David Crockett and a group of loyalists, who came from Tennessee, to defend Texas from the expansionist aims of Mexico. In front of them stand seven thousand Mexican soldiers in arms, under the orders of General Santa Ana. The fighting continues for three days before fate is fulfilled. But the heroic resistance will allow General Houston's soldiers to defeat Santa Ana and restore freedom to Texas. Hagiographic and spectacular narrative-river of a milestone episode in US history. Wayne makes his directorial debut: large landscapes and mass scenes, but also a search for the characterization of individual characters. While the western is now entering its "twilight" phase, Wayne, against the tide, takes it upon himself to resurrect the legend. The famous musical commentary is by Dimitri Tiomkin.

title: Nightmare 3
actors: Heather Langenkamp, Patricia Arquette, Robert Englund
description: The victims of the evil Freddy Krueger's nightmares join forces and, in a collective dream, defeat him. Third and, perhaps, one of the most interesting episodes of the Elm Street monster saga.

title: The Younger Brothers
actors: Wayne Morris, Janis Page, Bruce Bennett, Geraldine Brooks
description: The Younger brothers, ferocious banites get into trouble as they await amnesty to be able to return to their native Missouri. Fictional story of three famous outlaws arbitrarily related to the James in the Italian version.

title: The Keep
actors: Scott Glenn, Alberta Watson, Jürgen Prochnow, Gabriel Byrne
description: In 1941, German soldiers occupying a castle in the Carpathians meet there and collide with a supernatural evil force. Good combination of war and fantasy, directed by a future action master.

title: The Gun Runners
actors: Audie Murphy, Eddie Albert, Everett Sloane, Patricia Owens, Richard Jaeckel
description: Sam Martin with his wife Lucy lives by renting his boat (which is still paying) to tourists and fishermen who go on vacation in warm Florida. Cornered by his creditors, he is forced to accept the offer, actually rather suspicious, of a shady character who wants to be taken with his girlfriend to Cuba. He quickly reveals himself to be a dangerous arms dealer who must supply a revolutionary group. Sam then decides to intervene, even though he knows he is facing overwhelming forces. Vaguely inspired by "To have and not to have" (and its cinematgographic version Acque del Sud) it does not reach the top, remaining however a robust adventure film.

title: A Far Off Place
actors: Reese Witherspoon, Ethan Randall, Maximilian Schell, Jack Thompson
description: A commando organized by the ivory traffickers raids the Parkers' home causing a massacre. Only fourteen-year-old Nonnie and her peer Harry Wislow remain alive. The two boys' only hope of salvation is to travel 1600 miles across the Kalahari Desert to reach the only person capable of helping them: Colonel Mopani Theron. Mikael Salomon is a former cinematographer, and therefore the images in the film are all very accurate. But underneath the pictures, there isn't much to get excited about. In short, we are in the usual exotic genre where the frame is more important than the painting.

title: The Stalking Moon
actors: Gregory Peck, Eva Marie Saint, Robert Forster, Nolan Clay
description: Sam Varner (Peck) saves Sarah Carver (Saint), a white woman who escaped a massacre years ago, from the threat of the terrible Indian chief Kataua. Seasoned and a little slow Western, but with good moments and a suspense all played on the threat of a villain you never see.

title: Walker, Texas Ranger
actors: Chuck Norris, Noble Willingham, Sheree J. Wilson, Clarence Gilyard
description: A man of few words and many deeds, Cordell Walker is the modern version of a ranger, a criminal hunter of the West but with tools adapted to the times. His friend and inseparable assistant is Jimmy Trivette, a good detective who escaped from the Baltimore ghetto, the metropolis where he lived and worked to avoid trouble. Even if they seem to be able to reach him even in this remote and distant land. He is also joined by an old friend, former sheriff, C.D. Parker, now a reporter for the local newspaper.
notes: This film is the first in a series centered around a bizarre Deep West cop and his equally unusual investigative companion. For Chuck Norris it is an opportunity to revive the glories of the past with action films set in a setting that is new to him.

title: Deliverance
actors: Jon Voight, Burt Reynolds, Ronny Cox, Ned Beatty, Ed Ramey
description: Four friends, united by a passion for nature, decide to leave the chaotic city behind and spend a peaceful ecological weekend. Lewis, the leader of the group, Drew, idealistic and refined, Bobby, fat and simpleton, and Ed, shy and clumsy, go to a remote valley in the South of the United States and canoe down the river that crosses it. The outing soon turns into hell and unspoiled nature shows its most ruthless face.
notes: Boorman's fundamental theme (the conflict between nature and culture) falls into the great archetypes of American literature. The result is a great film, still shocking today. From the anthology the initial duet between the banjo and the guitar.

title: The Spoilers
actors: Anne Baxter, Jeff Chandler, Rory Calhoun, Barbara Britton
description: In the wild Yukon, two adventurers vie for property rights and mining exploitation, as well as the favors of the beauty of a saloon. Yet another version, without originality, is a novel by Rex Beach brought to the screen, among other things, in 1930 with Gary Cooper and in '42 with Dietrich and John Wayne.

actors: Roy Scheider, John Lithgow, Helen Mirren, Bob Balaban
description: An expedition made up of Soviet and American astronauts is sent into space to search for a lost spaceship and a mysterious monolith, which should contain many of the mysteries of the cosmos. They discover that Discovery, as the space shuttle is called, has broken down because the onboard computer has "gone mad". Then the mission is recalled to Earth, where a war is about to break out between the United States and the Soviet Union, but ... Attempt to follow, explanation and therefore trivialization of Kubrick's masterpiece. Hyamd is solid and nothing more.

title: Robocop 3
actors: Robert John Burke, Nancy Allen, Rip Torn, John Castle, Jill Hennessy
description: One of the poorest neighborhoods in the city is identified by a powerful Japanese holding company as a possible location for a grandiose real estate speculation operation: the futuristic Delta City should rise in its place. The company hires actual death squads to deport and kill the inhabitants. However, these organize themselves and, thanks also to the intervention of Robocop, they fight.
notes: At the third episode of the series even Robocop no longer holds up, both from a visual and narrative point of view. And then there is no longer Peter Weller's square jaw under the cyborg-cop's armor.

title: Windwalker
actors: Trevor Howard, Nick Ramus, James Remar, Serene Hedin, Dusty McCrea
description: An old Cheyenne near death recounts his long existence to save his family from his son's revenge: a twin who, after killing his mother during a Crow raid, was kidnapped when he was born and then raised in the enemy tribe. The word to the Indians in this western out of the traditional schemes, which in the original was entirely spoken in the Cheyenne and Crow languages.

title: Montana
actors: Errol Flynn, Alexis Smith, S. Z. Sakall, Douglas Kennedy
description: An Australian sheep farmer clashes with Montana cattle ranchers, who want to reserve grazing only for their herds. A modest film, with star Errol Flynn now on the avenue of sunset.

title: Devil's Doorway
actors: Robert Taylor, Louis Calhern, Paula Raymond, Marshall Thompson
description: An Indian fights bravely with the North in the American Civil War, but upon returning to Wyoming he finds himself hated and discriminated against by his former comrades. Excellent pro-Indian western, even more beautiful than the contemporary Indian Lover, marks the debut in the genre of Mann, who will be one of the greatest masters.

title: Nowhere to Run
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Rosanna Arquette, Joss Ackland, Kieran Culkin
description: Sam Gillen was left alone. It was his friend Billy who helped him escape from jail, but then Billy got shot by the police and now Sam is hiding in the woods of California. Right there lives Clydie, a widow with two children who is completely reluctant to sell her land to a speculator named Franklin. A relationship arises between the widow and the fugitive and he helps her get rid of the bad guy.
notes: Van Damme tries to get out of his "iron hands and feet" character and to do so he uses an old script by Joe Eszterhas ("Basic Instinct") directed by Robert Harmon ("The Hitcher - The Long Road of Fear"). Try it one more time, Jean-Claude.

title: The Big Land
actors: Alan Ladd, Virginia Mayo, Edmond O'Brien, Anthony Caruso
description: A group of ranchers led by Chad Morgan allies with a group of farmers and together they decide to extend the Kansas City railroad to transform the region into a larger, freer, livestock trading center. The project finds adhesions, but also ruthless adversaries.
notes: Western that tells in a simplistic way the vocation of the pioneers to progress. Ideologically, something sounds a bit false, but the western clichés are all respected and will please fans.

title: Bingo
actors: David Rasche, Cindy Williams, Robert J. Steinmiller jr.
description: The Bingo dog is a mutt collected by circus owners. But when he refuses to perform the fire jump number, he is thrown out. He becomes inseparable friend of little Chuckie after saving him from drowning. The boy and the mutt don't separate even when Chuckie moves in. It will still be the little dog who will save his life by extracting him from the flames of a fire and at the same time overcoming his phobia for fire.
notes: It is a film that takes the anthropomorphization process of animals on the screen to excess, often bordering on the typical universe of cartoons. Between parodies and some successful sequences, however, a beautiful story of friendship unfolds.

title: Army of Darkness
actors: Bruce Campbell, Embeth Davidtz, Marcus Gilbert, Bridget Fonda
description: Ash, a not too shrewd boy, a supermarket clerk, is thrown back in time to the time when Lord Arthur ruled and fought against his mysterious enemies. Ash immediately ends up in a kind of jail that is actually a pit of horrors, but he manages to get out thanks to the use of a chainsaw that he applies to his missing right arm. The only chance for Ash to return to his world is to find the "Necronomicon", a book made of human skin, which contains the right formula. The search is not easy and also involves a battle with the skeletons. Third episode of the saga started by Sam Raimi with "The house". Here some production problems make the path uncertain, but the clash with the dead (a tribute to Ray Harryhausen) is an anthology piece.

title: Universal Soldier
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dolph Lundgren, Ally Walker, Ed O'Ross
description: Sergeant Scott and Private Luc died in Vietnam in 1969. Scott actually killed Luc, but what matters is that the two were transported to the United States and, in great secrecy, cryogenized to be good later. . Several years later Scott and Luc are invincible soldiers, used for counter-terrorist operations. But Luc is always good, while Scott continues to be a murderous fanatic.

title: Extreme Prejudice
actors: Nick Nolte, Powers Boothe, Michael Ironside, Maria Conchita Alonso
description: In a country on the border with Mexico, Sheriff Jack Benteen (Nolte) has a problem with drugs. The man holding the ranks of commerce is his old childhood friend Cash Bailey. Now the two don't love each other much, especially as Jack lives with Sarita (Alonso), Bailey's ex-lover. Between the two quarrels comes Lieutenant Hackett with his army of ghosts. In fact, his men officially fell in Vietnam, Lebanon and other theaters of war. In fact, they are still alive and trained to fight the underworld.
notes: A pessimistic western in modern times that suffers from a fugitive logic script. With the exception of Nick Nolte the actors are not in part, but Hill's mastery manages to build the same show moments.

title: The Ravagers
actors: Richard Harris, Ann Turkel, Ernest Borgnine, Art Carney
description: In the world of 1991 destroyed by a catastrophe, Richard Harris wanders in search of surviving vestiges of civilization. Deadly and confused fantasy-adventure, with character actors who are almost tender.

title: Straight Shooting
actors: Harry Carey, Molly Malone, Duke Lee
description: Harry is an outlaw who is hired by some ruthless cattle ranchers to kill settlers who are dedicated to agriculture. But seeing the torment of the Sims family in front of the corpse of one of them, Ted, killed by Fremont, Harry decides to go to the other side. After killing Fremont in a bloody duel, he will lead the settlers to win the final battle with the help of a band of outlaws. This is the first in a long series of successful feature films shot by the great American director John Ford. The director was only twenty-three when he directed the film, but you can already see the great rhythmic wisdom in the action scenes and the remarkable sensitivity for the landscape, for the relationship between man and the boundless grandeur of nature.

title: Friendly Persuasion
actors: Gary Cooper, Dorothy McGuire, Anthony Perkins, Marjorie Main
description: Not even the Secession War is a sufficient reason for Jess Birdwell (Cooper), of strict Quaker observance, to renounce his principles that do not in any way admit violence. His son Josh (Perkins), on the other hand, joins the Civil Guard and his mother (McGuire) is desperate. But the head of the family, when Josh's life is at stake, is also ready to arm himself with a rifle.
notes: The film touches on topics of profound human value and develops them without ever betraying its own assumption, making use of a valuable sense of proportion, excellent direction and three famous actors in a skill competition in which everyone wins.

title: Far and Away
actors: Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Thomas Gibson, Cyril Cusack
description: Joseph Donnelly, a young Irishman with high hopes but no substance, flees to America with Shannon, a beautiful heiress with unconventional aspirations. The two love each other without declaring it to each other and for a while they live as brother and sister. Hunted by their parents and her betrothed, the two manage to crown their love and to conquer a piece of land in Oklahoma after a thousand ups and downs.
notes: The adventure of the enterprising poor man and the beautiful heiress should unfold an epic breath, but only at times does he manage to suggest it. The story is cumbersome and the pace is not quite adequate to the aspirations. In short: glossy, but a little boring.

title: Cheyenne
actors: Dennis Morgan, Bruce Bennett, Jane Wyman, Arthur Kennedy
description: A veteran gambler, he converts to justice, becomes a man of law, catches a robber and marries his woman. The film is among the less brilliant wsterns of the great Walsh, but it inspired a long television series.

title: The Sea Hawk
actors: Errol Flynn, Flora Robson, Claude Rains, Donald Crisp
description: One of the most daring English privateers of the sixteenth century, Captain Thorpe, intends to plunder the Spanish possessions in Panama with the tacit blessing of Queen Elizabeth, but is captured.
notes: Adventurous film in costume, with a compelling rhythm and sumptuous staging, with an inevitable amorous outline. In the version passed on the English screens, Queen Elizabeth gave highly patriotic speeches with allusions to current events. Based on a novel by Rafael Sabatini, the film was written by the future director Robert Rossen. The music is by Erich Wolfgang Korngold.

title: Alien 3
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Charles Dance, Lance Henriksen
description: In 2525, Ellen Ripley and little Newt were the last survivors of the alien. But the shuttle has an accident and Ripley wakes up, alone, in the desolate penal colony of Fiorina 161. And, as if that weren't enough, the deadly alien from which she managed to escape twice is still in circulation and begins to wreak havoc. of prisoners, as the Company is about to arrive ...
notes: The atmosphere changes completely compared to the other two _Alien_: the tones become dark, Ripley wanders shaved to zero. A sense of apocalypse and defeat weighs on the whole of history. Walter Hill is back among the writers, while director David Fincher, newcomer, rehearses for the next _Seven_. The operation is unusual, perhaps less successful than the previous two films, but very interesting.

title: Tron
actors: Bruce Boxleitner, Jeff Bridges, David Warner
description: A powerful company has appropriated the ideas of Flynn, inventor of electronic games. He enters the virtual world of the computer that guides society and challenges him to a deadly video game. Produced by Disney and ahead of the cyberpunk wave, it did not have the hoped-for success despite the spectacular computer animation scenes (which today appear to be true modernism).

title: Free Willy
actors: Jason James Richter, Lori Petty, Jayne Atkinson, August Schallenberg
description: Twelve-year-old Jesse doesn't get along well with adoptive parents. After a prank, he agrees to clean the tank of an aquarium he has soiled and befriends Willy, an orca that no one has ever managed to train. With him the orca performs amazing stunts, but the sinister intentions of the owner and manager of the aquarium lie in wait. In the end, Jesse finds the truest affections and the animal freedom on the open sea. A boy with many problems and a majestic and captive animal: the combination is of sure impact. The film fulfills its task of "little thing" for families, without exceeding in sillyness.

title: Dracula
actors: Bela Lugosi, Helen Chandler, David Manners, Dwight Frye, Edward Van Sloan, Frances Dade
description: Renfield is a real estate agent sent by his boss to negotiate a sale in Transylvania. His destination is the castle of Count Dracula, a mysterious character who inspires unspeakable terror to the inhabitants of the village and its surroundings. On board a ghostly carriage he reaches the castle and ends up a slave to the evil count, who has decided to move to the city of London. Here he will be stopped by Dr. Van Helsing, a vampire catcher. The legendary Bela Lugosi, already an interpreter of Dracula in the theater, moves with great emphasis in the expressionistic scenography that surrounds him. Browning effectively adapts Stoker's famous novel and relaunches the cinematic myth of the vampire.

title: Joshua Tree
actors: Dolph Lundgren, George Segal, Kristian Alfonso, Geoffrey Lewis, Michelle Phillips
description: Wellman Santee has lived for years hauling stolen cars across the Mojave Desert with friend Eddie. The last mission, however, ended badly: in a clash with the police. Eddie died, he was injured and he was arrested. At the first opportunity he manages to escape by taking a girl, Rita, who works as a policeman as a hostage. But it will be precisely his uncomfortable "prisoner" to go over to his side and give him a hand. Daring escapes, breathtaking races, reversal of the head, firefights and dramatic showdown: without giving up winks and cinephile quotes so insistent as to be almost didactic.

title: Rapid Fire
actors: Brandon Lee, Powers Boothe, Nick Mancuso, Tzi Ma
description: Jake Lo studies in college and is haunted by the memory of his father, who died heroically under a tank in Tiananmen Square. The boy is a quiet type, but he finds himself an involuntary witness to a drug trafficking. Very dangerous situation, were it not for the fact that Jake is a martial arts expert, he learned from him precisely in homage to the memory (a bit uncomfortable) of his parent. In addition, he can enlist the support of a Chicago cop, Mace Ryan. The criminals who are angry with him think they have the easy game, but they will have bread for their teeth. Low budget but well used action movie. The ingredients are the usual, the rather unlikely premises, but the result is not really to be thrown away.

title: New Frontier
actors: John Wayne, Muriel Evans
description: Rancheros "evicted" for the construction of a dam, at first they defend themselves, then they set out for other, more prosperous lands.
notes: One of the countless C westerns played by Wayne before _Red Shadows_. It has no merit, at least until the final quarter of an hour, which is worth the entire film

title: Zardoz
actors: Sean Connery, Charlotte Rampling, Sara Kestelman, John Alderton
description: Zardoz is an illusory flying stone deity thanks to which the "Immortals", ruling the violence of the "Exterminators", dominate Vortex with its population of slaves and marginalized, the only mortal beings left in the society of 2293. Until just a "exterminator" ", Zed, destroys the system with all sorts of transgressions: he succeeds in introducing himself into Zardoz and therefore into Vortex, thus giving a new start to human life according to natural cycles.
notes: Corrusco, Dionysian mythological "back to the future" written and directed by John Boorman and vigorously interpreted by Sean Connery, between exasperated symbolism and intellectual lucubrations.

title: Hook
actors: Dustin Hoffman, Robin Williams, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins
description: Peter Banning is an accomplished 40-year-old lawyer who is no longer able to devote his time to his wife Moira, nor to his children, Jack and Maggie. Returning home, Peter discovers that Captain Hook has kidnapped his children and taken them to Neverland. Thanks to the help of Tinker Bell, Banning reaches the fabulous island; here, however, there is no lack of mockery, not only by Hook, but also by his former companions, the "lost boys". Only through hard work on body and mind will Banning be the Peter Pan he once was.
notes: In search of the lost ark of adolescence, Steven Spielberg revisits the Peter Pan saga, adding some superficial polemic against yuppism. Behind the images, Disney naturally winks and strangely, the pace is not always controlled. On the other hand, splendid sets and costumes. Parts for Maggie Smith, Gwyneth Paltrow, Glenn Close.

title: The Swarm
actors: Michael Caine, Katharine Ross, Richard Widmark, Richard Chamberlain
description: After attacking and exterminating a military garrison in Texas, a swarm of killer bees from Brazil sets out on a devastating raid into the heart of the United States. The White House entrusts the task of neutralizing it to entomologist Brad Crane, who calls on the scientist Walter Krim for help. But the solution is late in coming, the bees are rampant, and the military impose remedies worse than the disease.
notes: With a cast of great appeal a plot already exploited both in the cinema and in various TV productions is "pumped" without imagination. The rudimentary dialogues and the ineffective special effects ended up determining a sensational, deserved flop at the box office.

title: Three Violent People
actors: Charlton Heston, Anne Baxter, Tom Tryon, Gilbert Roland, Forrest Tucker
description: Joe (Heston) returns home with his wife, whose past he ignores, and confronts a couple of bad guys. Good-paced Western.

title: Black Eagle
actors: Sho Kosugi, Jean-Claude Van Damme
description: CIA Special Agent Black Eagle is near Malta with her two little children, but it's not a vacation. In addition, the two children are kidnapped by agent Andrei, of the KGB. Thus the fight between the two protagonists ignites and they continue to fight each other with karate shots every time they meet. In the end, the evil Andrei blows up and Black Eagle, freed his children, returns home.
notes: A "vintage" Van Damme, when ours still had to settle for bad roles, with a final showdown to his detriment. But success was about to arrive and with that also the official admission to the category of "darlings".

title: Riding Shotgun
actors: Randolph Scott, Wayne Morris, Joan Weldon, Charles Bronson
description: Unjustly suspected of agreeing with a gang of thugs, Larry Delong has to go all out to persuade the inhabitants of Deepwater not to pursue the bandits, thus leaving the city unguarded.
notes: A routine western unexpectedly shot almost entirely indoors, which is quite unusual for the genre.

title: Apache Uprising
actors: Rory Calhoun, Corinne Calvet, John Russell
description: At the time of the Indian raids, the stagecoach serving Apache Welles must hire two gunslingers, Jim and Bill, as an armed escort. They prevent a robbery and defend the passengers from an Indian attack. A nostalgic western that stages, with the most used instruments of the genre, the eternal clash between the good and the bad.

title: Hearthquake
actors: Charlton Heston, Ava Gardner, George Kennedy, Geneviève Bujold, Lorne Greene
description: Stuart Graff is a married engineer but romantically linked to a young actress, Denise. Lou Slade is a policeman under investigation. Their lives meet on the day Los Angeles is devastated by a disastrous earthquake. Together they work to rescue but, when all have been rescued, a dam also gives way and the metropolis is submerged by the waters.
notes: Robson gave his best in his youth, first as an editor for Orson Welles and then as a director of busy films. "Terremoto" is his penultimate film: catastrophic with special visual and sound effects.

title: The Real McCoy
actors: Kim Basinger, Val Kilmer, Terence Stamp, Gailard Sartain
description: Karen McCoy, exercising the dangerous profession of bank robber, the inevitable happened: she ended up in prison and spent six years in the Athens penitentiary. Now she has come out of it, free on parole. But her situation is far from rosy: the ex-husband, in fact, who in the meantime has remarried, told their son, Patrick, that his mother is dead. As if all this wasn't enough, a certain Schmidt reappears, who needs Karen for a new shot. To convince her, he finds nothing better than to kidnap Patrick and thus blackmail her. The bank to be robbed is the famous Union Bank of Atlanta: a bank considered to be of maximum security. The fact is, Karen has a plan to violate this dollar sanctum: perfect to get in and downright unique to get out ... On paper, the Kim Basinger / Val Kilmer duo should have worked out great. She is smoothed and refurbished, but all in all she manages to divert attention from the wonders of the facelift, thanks to the effort she puts into it, with ultimately decent results. Less in part Kilmer, also because his role is sacrificed by a script (for him) as ungrateful as (for us) predictable from the first moment to the last. Gangster film with some ambition but with disastrous economic returns: a great disappointment for Russell Mulcahy, accustomed to the successes of Highlander.

title: Without Warning
actors: Jack Palance, Martin Landau, Tarah Nutter, Cameron Mitchell
description: Deep space aliens find Earth could be a wonderful game reserve. To humans, of course. The first "game" is held in an isolated mountainous region of the United States. Very disappointing, with the participation of some Hollywood veterans.

title: Never Say Die
actors: Frank Zagarino, Billy Drago, Jenny McShane, Todd Jensen
description: Reverend James is the head of a sect called "The Garden of Eden": they are in the sights of the FBI and the operation is entrusted to Lieutenant Blake, who once belonged to the same group. The operation is conducted in no uncertain terms, so much is the fear for the fanatical ideas spread by James. Death and destruction, but the reverend manages to escape. His followers cut the rope with him; in particular there is Brooke, a young and naive daughter of a general, who had entered the sect and now finds herself in the unfriendly part of the hostage. The group initially took refuge in a church; then, forced to move, after a long chase he arrives at a disarmed factory ... A television film that is cheerfully inspired by one of those rather frequent cases in the United States.

title: The Outriders
actors: Claude Jarman jr, Joel McCrea, Arlene Dahl, Barry Sullivan
description: Three Southern soldiers who escaped from a Yankee prison camp reluctantly join a band of outlaws. Robust western film series.

title: Freaks
actors: Olga Baclanova, Henry Victor, Harry Earles, Wallace Ford, Leila Hyams, Rosco Ates
description: A circus dwarf falls in love with a trapeze artist. Realizing that the admirer has become the heir to a large fortune, the woman concocts a diabolical plan to kill him. This will, however, trigger revenge on the part of the other "monsters" of the company. Browning, master of horror, instead shoots this film with extreme realism, which only in some points, almost naturally, swerves in visionary surges (the ending). A memorable and cursed masterpiece, shot with real circus freaks and, according to legend, a film-freak itself, mutilated by producer Thalberg in just over an hour.

title: Piraña 2
actors: Tricia O'Neil, Ted Richert, Steve Marachuck, Ricky Paull Goldin
description: In the bay overlooked by a large hotel, on a Caribbean island, horribly mutilated corpses are found. A scuba diving instructor begins to investigate and discovers that the bodies have been disfigured by a new species of ravenous fish with wings, the result of a secret experiment. They are, in fact, piraña who live in the wreck of a ship and who, at nightfall, go out to kill. Very low-cost debut of the future director of "Titanic", it is an anonymous film that can only be enjoyed by fans of the genre

title: Ricochet
actors: Denzel Washington, John Lithgow, Ice T, Kevin Pollak, Lindsay Wagner
description: At a carnival, black cop Nick Syles captures Earl Talbot Blake in spectacular action followed by thousands of citizens on live television. Thus, from a mere cop on patrol, Nick climbs one after the other the steps of a good career to become Attorney General. Meanwhile, Blake is pondering revenge: he manages to escape and make believe he is dead, and then ...
notes: The Australian Mulcahy directs a film that certainly does not stand out for its originality, with one hundred percent good and one bad fighting with mixed fortunes until a predictable outcome. Discreet, however, the protagonists: the effective Washington and the Luciferian Lithgow.

title: Last Action Hero
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin O'Brien, Charles Dance, F. Murray Abraham
description: Thanks to a magic ticket, little Benedict can enter the world of the film of his favorite hero, Slater (Schwarzenegger). When Benedict and Slater are in trouble, the ticket is used for the reverse journey: from fiction to reality. But here things are not going so well for the man who, in the cinema, was a real superman, and Slater decides to go back to the dimension of the illusory.
notes: The Americans didn't like it because it was "too complicated"! Instead, it is witty, very lively, self-deprecating, full of quotes for the pleasure of cinephiles. If anything, it's not a brand new idea, but even Schwarzy tries hard not to be trivial.

title: Frontier Rangers
actors: Keith Larsen, Buddy Ebsen, Don Brunett
description: Major Rogers, escaping an Indian ambush, identifies a traitor white and has him executed. Then he goes to the camp of the Black Wolf chief and challenges him to a duel. Jacques Tourneur directs a dignified collage of two television episodes. Tourneur did a lot better.

title: Halloween 5
actors: Donald Pleasence, Danielle Harris, Donald L. Shanks
description: Michael attempts to kill his young niece. Routine episode, for fans only.

title: Grayeagle
actors: Ben Johnson, Iron Eyes Cody, Lana Wood, Paul Fix, Alex Cord
description: John Colter (Ben Johnson) lives with young Beth (Lana Wood), whom he raised as his daughter. But the girl's real father is actually a famous Cheyenne chief, who is now dying and who would like a daughter next to him. So the warrior Gray Eagle is tasked with kidnapping Beth and bringing her to her dying father. Of course, the two will be chased by Colter, his trusty Indian servant and another friendly hunter. After several adventures, the girl arrives at the Cheyenne camp and finds herself in contact with a completely different reality from the one in which she has lived up to that moment. The story is just an adventurous cartoon "on the side of the Indians". All that remains is to enjoy the film for what it is, among the suggestive natural sceneries of Montana. Colter is Ben Johnson, a veteran supporting actor in great westerns (The Wild Bunch).

title: Red Tomahawk
actors: Howard Keel, John Caufield, Broderick Crawford, Scott Brady
