description: A small town is about to be attacked by the Sioux. But the Indians will have to face the fierce resistance of the population. Naive and stereotyped Western, twenty years late.

title: The Funhouse
actors: Cooper Huckabee, Miles Chapin, Largo Woodruff, Elizabeth Berridge, Shawn Carson, Jeanne Austin, Jack McDermott, William Finley
description: Amy, Buzz, Richie and Liz are friends who decide to spend an evening at an amusement park. After wandering among the various stands they are attracted by the horror tunnel where, recklessly, they decide to spend the night. They thus become involuntary witnesses to a murder, that of the fortune teller by the truculent son of the huckster. Thus begins a nightmare night in the amusement park for the boys, which will end in death for three of them.
notes: It's a classic horror movie with all the ingredients of the genre. The director plays on the theme of the freak, poised between pity and horror. Rick Baker's make-up is gorgeous as always.

title: The Guardian
actors: Jenny Seagrove, Dwier Brown, Carey Lowell, Brad Hall
description: Phil and Kate hire a babysitter for their little one. The woman, Camilla, reveals extraordinary gifts of skill and sweetness. In reality it belongs to a druidic sect dedicated to the sacrifices of children to a large tree in which the spirit of Evil dwells. In fact, the woman has already committed numerous atrocious crimes, always managing to make her traces disappear by changing her name. Disturbing film and strongly anchored to the darkest fairytale kingdom.

title: Road to Denver
actors: John Payne, Lee J. Cobb, Skip Homeier
description: An honest cowboy gets into trouble trying to help his bad brother. One of the many Republic productions to consume and forget.

title: Moby Dick
actors: Gregory Peck, Orson Welles, Richard Basehart, Leo Genn
description: Ishmael, a young sailor embarks on a whaling ship. The captain is the fanatic Ahab who is looking for a white whale, Moby Dick, to whom he owes the loss of a leg. Ahab promises a gold coin to anyone who sees the whale. During the journey the restlessness takes possession of men.
notes: From the great novel by Melville, Huston draws a powerful and austere work, where the seafaring epic mixes with the "theological" invective of man's rebellion against God. Screenplay by Ray Bradbury and splendid color photography inspired by prints. epoch. Great little piece for Orson Welles.

title: Outcast
actors: John Derek, Joan Evans, Jim Davis
description: Cowboy Jet returns to the country after a long absence to reclaim the family ranch his uncle has taken over. All predictable, with a lot of action.

title: Son of Fury
actors: Tyrone Power, Gene Tierney, George Sanders, Frances Farmer
description: We are in eighteenth-century England, the century of the Enlightenment. The noble Benjamin Blake is deprived of his inheritance by a cousin who persecutes him. Having fled to the Marquesas Islands, he makes his fortune there with pearl fishing and returns to London to get justice. Will he succeed in his intent? Who will help him?
notes: Spectacular costume romance (based on the plot of the "Earl of Momtecristo") directed by the excellent John Cromwell with a splendid Gene Tierney.

title: The Hunter
actors: Steve McQueen, Eli Wallach, Kathryn Harrold, Tracey Walter, Leval Burton, Ben Johnson
description: Ralph Thorson is a bounty hunter tasked with bringing back those who violate probation rules. Ralph is married to a teacher who is about to give him a child, but he does not want the child because the world that is about to welcome the creature is imbued with Evil, as he teaches his trade. On the trail of Ralph, in addition, there is Rocco Mason, a bandit who because of the "hunter" has done a lot of jail time ...
notes: The numerous action sequences are good, shot at great pace. As always, McQueen's acting is masterful. But the script suffers from a few too many forcing.

title: Trooper Hook
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Joel McCrea, Earl Holliman
description: A white woman is kidnapped by an Indian chief and has a son from him. Years later she is "liberated" and returned to "civilization", but people only show feelings of contempt towards her. The ex-husband, among other things, agrees to welcome her back into the house but without her half-breed son.
notes: Politically correct and covertly hypocritical Western. Whites are bad because they despise Indians, but in order not to return the woman with the redskin, the script makes him die. Of course the cast is excellent. Direction without praise and without infamy.

title: Blade Runner
actors: Harrison Ford, Sean Young, Rutger Hauer, Daryl Hannah, William J. Sanderson
description: In a swarming, immense Los Angeles located in the near future, a former police detective (Harrison Ford), who specializes in the hunting and "retreat" of rebel replicants, is called back into service to track down four, escaped from an extraterrestrial colony. This time, his life will be completely changed.
notes: After the success he had with the first "Alien", Ridley Scott returns to science fiction, however, mixing it with the noir atmospheres of the forties police. The result is fascinating: for the labyrinthine, suffocating sets, for the rough melancholy of the story, for the superb presence of Harrison Ford. The film, edited by the producers, came out according to the original version in 1991. But the production changes, for once, weren't stupid. Scott's version lacks the over voice (which is very hard boiled) and the "robbed" ending to Kubrick's "Shining". Do you want to put the (fake) happy ending of the first version? At the end of the journey undertaken by Deckard and Rachel there was not heaven on earth but the Overlook Hotel!

title: Night of the Lepus
actors: Stuart Whitman, Rory Calhoun, Janet Leigh
description: In Ajo City, in southern Arizona, an irrepressible proliferation of rabbits destroys all types of vegetation. A remedy must be found, however, avoiding side effects that could be disastrous. For this purpose, researcher Roy Bennet, aided by his wife Jerry, experiments with the dosage of injections based on antifecondative hormones. But the unexpected happens.
notes: Fanta-horror-catastrophic which, due to its singularity, has almost become a "cult".

title: Breakout
actors: Charles Bronson, Robert Duvall, John Huston, Jill Ireland, Randy Quaid, Sheree North
description: To get an innocent person out of prison, his family relies on a specialist. The first attempts fail because the wife, unaware, reveals her plans to her husband's enemies. Then, with a helicopter ...
notes: Typical action movie tailor-made for Charles Bronson, character actor promoted to lead actor by Sergio Leone. The premise of the film gives hope for a breathtaking film; which is not so true.

title: Town Tamer
actors: Dana Andrews, Terry Moore, Lon Chaney jr., Pat O'Brien, Bruce Cabot
description: A large Great Planes landowner who is building the railroad calls Rossen, a former sheriff, to restore order to the village. In fact, the band of Condor dominates you, a ruthless bandit, backed by Sheriff Ring. Rossen with great difficulty (he is also unjustly accused of murder) will be able to defeat the gang thanks to the (belated but effective) help of the repentant sheriff.

title: Sleepwalkers
actors: Brian Krause, Mädchen Amick, Alice Krige, Stephen King
description: Charles Brady and his mother Mary are "sleepwalkers" or creatures that are partly human, partly reptilian and partly feline. Their outward appearance betrays their monstrosity in nothing (but not to the eye of cats). So in sleepy little Travis, Indiana, no one at first suspects that they are responsible for so many murders. But luckily there are cats.
notes: Cats, for once in a good version, will save the world. This is the moral of Garris' film ("The Fly 2"). It is the first screenplay written by Stephen King expressly for the cinema but, apart from a few moments, it is not entirely successful.

title: Uncivilized
actors: Sandra Hess, Martin Kove, Richard Alan Hench, Kent MacLachlan
description: Kate and Neil are quietly camping in an isolated area. As fate would have it, a gang of drug traffickers went to take refuge right there, immediately after killing a policeman. Kate manages to escape, while Neil leaves his feathers there. Kate is increasingly exhausted and her end would be near if Richard didn't come to her aid. Neil looks safe, too bad Richard is the leader of the gang. For the woman hours of anguish are looming, but her spirit is not tamed: she manages to escape from her persecutors and lure them into a police trap. A low-profile film with low commercial probability, so much so that we only come out on television.
notes: The only face that could come to your mind is that of Martin Kove. He was in _Rambo 2_ and was a bad guy in a couple of _Karate Kid_.

title: The Burning Hills
actors: Natalie Wood, Tab Hunter, Skip Homeier, Eduard Franz
description: When Trace discovers the lifeless body of his brother Johnny, he immediately senses that the responsibility for the murder lies with the men of Joe Sutton, a great cattleman. Trace meets Sutton and warns him that he will go to Fort Stockwell to report what happened and what he suspects. The breeder tries to kill him, but Trace, faster than him, hits him in the chest and runs away. The manhunt by Sutton's men begins.
notes: Only Natalie Wood can push you to see this film lacking in subject and script. In short, the usual shootings and the usual horse chases.

title: Kidnapped
actors: James McArthur, Peter Finch, Bernard Lee
description: A boy who is about to inherit the family fortune is kidnapped by his evil uncle on a ship. He will be able to save himself thanks to the help of an outlaw. The film is a Disney-like reduction - without infamy and without praise - of the classic bestseller for children by Robert Louis Stevenson, the great nineteenth-century novelist casually named after the director of the film.

title: Needful Things
actors: Max Von Sydow, Ed Harris, Bonnie Bedelia, Amanda Plummer
description: In Castle Rock, the kind and helpful owner of the antique shop “Cose precious” attracts everyone's sympathy. More than money, he asks his customers for "favors"; in reality it exploits the weaknesses and secret desires of the inhabitants to subjugate people to its evil plots. Only the sheriff tries to oppose his terrible powers.
notes: From a novel by Stephen King, the undisputed master of the nightmare. The story itself is beautiful, some twists are worth the vision, Max von Sydow is a splendid Satanassus. But the direction, for a horror, is too flat.

title: Gunmen
actors: Christopher Lambert, Mario Van Peebles, Denis Leary, Patrick Stewart
description: Cole Parker is a New York agent for DEA, the federal drug agency. He is sent to a South American country to confiscate the illicit earnings of a drug dealer: the very one who, some time before, had killed his father. The operation, however, turns out to be more complicated than expected and Parker is forced to enlist the help of a convict, Dani Servigo. But the two are followed by a ruthless killer hired by traffickers. Dirty action movie with sloppiness, with chases, endless shootings, unlikely characters.

title: Hawaii
actors: Julie Andrews, Max Von Sydow, Richard Harris, Gene Hackman
description: Keoki, a Hawaiian prince raised by the Calvinists, gets missionaries sent to the islands. Reverend Abner Hale, stopped in his village, encounters various obstacles, both in traditional customs and in the brutal reactions of the sailors who see him as an enemy of the easy morals of local girls. He will eventually be removed from office, but his mission may not end. The setting is suggestive, the cast is five-star, the screenplay is signed by Dalton Trumbo; on the whole, however, this exotic-religious blockbuster does not take off.

title: The Longhorns
actors: Wild Bill Elliott, Myron Healey, Phyllis Coates, Stanford Jolley
description: Jim Kirk decides to leave with his friend Andy, to go and buy a herd. The two plan to travel to Oregon from their native Wyoming. But Andy agrees with a dangerous band of outlaws who are determined to take over the cattle. On the way out, Jim saves Andy's life during an Indian ambush. Upon returning, therefore, Andy no longer betrays his friend. Western series B for encyclopedic enthusiasts.

title: Knightrider 2000
actors: David Hasselhoff, Edward Mulhare
description: The Knightrider foundation is concerned with defense and security, but is also in the process of developing a revolutionary car. Meanwhile in the city, following the murder of the mayor, criminals are increasingly using weapons that were previously in the possession of the police and which are now officially illegal. A policewoman goes to work, together with Michael from Knightrider, to see clearly ... Semi-sci-fi action detective. The male lead, David Hasselhoff, previously blinked from comedy to adventure to drama, amassing an enviable string of trash movies. What does something mean?

title: Breakheart Pass
actors: Charles Bronson, Ben Johnson, Jill Ireland
description: The train on which Governor Fairchild, Sheriff Pearce, Reverend Peabody, Dr. Molineaux and a platoon of soldiers commanded by Major Clairmond travel - destined for Fort Humboldt, an important center for the sorting of precious metals extracted in the nearby mines - undergoes a series of mysterious attacks. A fake cheater solves the mystery, in reality a secret agent of the government in charge of foiling an arms trafficking ...
notes: Solid cast in the service of a perky Bronson, great photography, snappy and exciting action sequences. Nothing memorable, okay, but Gries staged with a sure hand, unpretentious and therefore very effectively.

title: Vibes
actors: Cyndi Lauper, Jeff Goldblum, Peter Falk, Michael Lerner
description: Harry Buscafusco's son has mysteriously disappeared in the mountains of Ecuador. To find him, Harry hires two psychics: Nick and Sylvia. The trio sets off for South America, but it quickly becomes clear that Buscafusco has no children, much less dispersed. His only hope is to get his hands on a fabulous Indian treasure ...
notes: Lowell Ganz and Babaloo Mandel are two highly respected comedy writers (including _Scappo dalla città_). Cyndi Lauper, in her first starring role, is the lead singer of _Girls Just Want to Have Fun_. Here, however, hardly anyone has fun. Also wasted the big names of the cast, from Jeff Goldblum to Peter Falk.

title: Face of a Fugitive
actors: Fred MacMurray, Lin McCarthy, Alan Baxter, James Coburn
description: Unjustly accused of murder (in reality he just committed a theft), Bill Parker builds his life in a border town. Interesting western atmosphere with melodramatic veins.

title: Cyborg Cop 2
actors: David Bradley, Morgan Hunter, Jill Pierce
description: Jack Ryan, a licensed cop, grapples with a psychopath named Jesse Starkraven, whose brother Jack killed the previous year. The battle ends in Jack's favor, but Jesse does not die, but is kidnapped by a para-government organization and transformed into a cyborg. Jesse thus becomes the perfect and invincible warrior, but the idea of ??revenge against Jack remains. I don't know who could have noticed, but a "Cyborg Cop 1" already existed. The main actor is always Bradley, the director is always Firstenberg, the basic idea is always poor and the end result is always the same: lots of action and little fun.

title: Soylent Green
actors: Charlton Heston, Edward G. Robinson, Joseph Cotten, Chuck Connors, Dick Van Patten
description: In a world starving for overpopulation, two policemen discover that a food company, Soylent, is recycling human corpses.
notes: Some forgivable inconsistency for the liveliness of the whole and some moments of real tension. Beautiful settings in a decadent nocturnal New York, excellent actors. For Edward G. Robinson, this was the last interpretation. One of the best science fiction movies of the 70s.

title: Timestalkers
actors: Klaus Kinski, Lauren Hutton, William Devane, Forrest Tucker
description: A twentieth-century professor is alarmed by a charming woman of the twenty-sixth to return with her in the eighteenth. The problem is that a scientist of the future (partner of the girl's father) has made up his mind to go back in time to assassinate an old president of the United States. But our heroes will make sure that he doesn't complete the task. Time travel movies are all a bit the same, but if the cast works it's okay. Here we have Klaus Kinski on his American TV debut and the gorgeous Lauren Hutton ("American Gigolo"). What more do you want?

title: Men of War
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Charlotte Lewis
description: A mining company interested in deposits under a remote tropical island hires seven mercenaries to iron out misunderstandings with the natives. One of the seven is called Nick Gunar (Dolph Lundgren) and the way in which the negotiations should be conducted is rather clear and hasty. But even among the men on the expedition some doubts creep in. Action movies shot for the sake of action can like and dislike. Action movies with some ecological and humanitarian undertone are completely unbearable. The inexpressive Lundgren ("Rocky IV") keeps making mistakes one film after another.

title: Cimarron
actors: Glenn Ford, Maria Schell, Anne Baxter, Arthur O'Connell
description: Towards the end of the last century, Yancey Cravat, a restless and adventurous colonizer, emigrated with his wife to Oklahoma. Here, not having occupied the land he wanted, he founds a newspaper, but then sets off in search of other emotions. He will find plenty of them, but the weight of the newspaper falls on his wife. It will always be like this, until his death, between a few short returns home and long absences.
notes: Second transposition on the screen, after the one, better, of 1930, of the homonymous novel by Edna Ferber. Perhaps the only mediocre western of an absolute master of the genre.

title: Project X
actors: Christopher George, Greta Baldwin, Henry Jones
description: In the future, the world is divided into two opposing blocs. A Western agent reveals, before he dies, that the Orientals will destroy the world. Scientists bring him back to life to avert the threat.

title: Red Garters
actors: Rosemary Clooney, Guy Mitchell, Gene Barry
description: In a small town in the West, three very quarrelsome couples go to war. It will end in a triple marriage. Fairly successful attempt at a musical-western: a little theatrical but effective.

title: Heat
actors: Burt Reynolds, Karen Young, Peter Mac Nicol
description: A Vietnam veteran who loves gambling and whiskey and makes a living by putting his martial and muscular skills to good use, ends up clashing with a gang of sadists. Disorderly rhythm and absent direction.

title: Freaked
actors: Alex Winter, Megan Ward, Randy Quaid, Brooke Shields, Keanu Reeves
description: Ricky Coogin (Winter), a TV star who has sold out to a multinational, his aide Ernie and Julie, a young ecologist, end up in a strange amusement park by accident. The attractions of the park are monstrous characters, the result of the perverse experiments of a certain Elijah C. Skuggs (Quaid) and even Ricky, Ernie and Julie will become victims of his madness. Shot with two lire and with two ideas, the film by Stern and Winter is a funny and captivating little horror. Provided that the obvious vulgarity of the whole does not bother you before the end. In a short role there is also Keanu Reeves, but you have to know how to find him.

title: Thunder in the Sun
actors: Susan Hayward, Jeff Chandler, Jacques Bergerac, Blanche Yurka, Carl Esmond
description: A caravan of Basques who emigrated from France tries to reach California. When their boss dies, his wife (disputed by the guide and brother-in-law) takes over. Extravagant western contaminated by sentimental themes.

title: Creepshow
actors: Adrienne Barbeau, Viveca Lindfors, Ted Danson, Leslie Nielsen, Stephen King
description: An old man, dead for seven years, comes out of the grave on his birthday and takes revenge on the one who killed him, that is, his daughter. Then he enjoys his cake in peace. A betrayed husband buries and drowns his wife with her lover, but then has to deal with both of them returning as zombies. A monster from the Arctic regions helps a frustrated professor get rid of his petulant wife. A cruel and miserly hygienic fanatic suffers the assault of an impressive colony of cockroaches.
notes: A very happy meeting between Stephen King (who wrote the stories) and George A. Romero, the author of the "living dead", for once with an interesting budget available. "Creepshow", in its attempt to intersect comic book aesthetics and cinematic visions, is in the end almost experimental, and reminds us that horror is the most suitable genre for similar "research" operations and for the mixture of "low" languages. . Inspired by the Ec Comics series entitled "Creepy" (we are "Uncle Tibia"), the stories maintain the macabre humor of the model, for which a sort of retaliation turns the evil on those who commit it. In the television version, however, the first episode is missing, played by Stephen King himself in the role of a yokel contaminated by a meteorite, which instead is available on videotape.

title: Warlock
actors: Henry Fonda, Anthony Quinn, Richard Widmark, Dorothy Malone, Dolores Michaels, Wallace Ford, Tom Drake, Richard Arlen, DeForest Kelley, Regis Toomey, Vaughn Taylor, Don Beddoe, Whit Bissell, Bartlett Robinson
description: The town of Warlock is at the mercy of McQuown and his gang; to get rid of this humiliation, the inhabitants ask for the help of a mercenary, Clay Blaisdell. All dressed in black, with guns with gold handles and accompanied by a lame player, he soon finds a real sheriff on his way who arrives with the intention of enforcing the law by all. A great western, full of atmosphere and ideas, based on the confrontation between the anarchist individualism that was at the basis of the race to the West and the will for order that prevailed once the pioneer communities were founded. The three protagonists are charismatic.

title: Comanche Station
actors: Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins, Skip Homeier
description: Jeff, in search of his wife kidnapped by the Comanches, frees another hostage and runs into a trio of rascals. Masterpiece and last film of the "Ranown" team: relaxed, melancholy and ferocious, a film of tired heroes, with few elements almost to abstraction, thanks also to the dry script by Burt Kennedy.

title: San Antonio
actors: Errol Flynn, Alexis Smith, Paul Kelly
description: A young Texan discovers that the owner of the most elegant haunt in San Antonio is pulling the strings of the cattle thefts affecting ranchers in his area. Typical average Warner Bros western, complete with a star and final shootout, but rather thin.

title: North Shore
actors: Matt Adler, Nina Peeples, John Philbin, Gerry Lopez, Cristina Raines
description: A guy who considers himself the greatest surfer in Arizona (landlocked US state!) Wants to test himself on the Hawaiian waves. He decides to leave when he learns that on the island they are organizing a prestigious race called "The waves of Oahu". Initially he is mocked by the other competitors who then, however, to the test of the facts ...
notes: Excellent surf shots. But honestly after a movie like "Big Wednesday" what should we expect from a film set in the world of surfers? Everything is already seen. As usual, the interpreters are completely unknown.

title: Cool World
actors: Brad Pitt, Gabriel Byrne, Kim Basinger
description: In 1945 a veteran died in an accident. A strange scientist transfers him to Cool World, the world of cartoons created by a cartoonist in prison for murder. He too ends up in Cool World and falls in love with one of his creatures. Back with her in the real world, he is about to do it big, but then it all works out. Our veteran stays at Cool World and marries the beautiful Lonette. The new male sex symbol Brad Pitt finds himself catapulted into a kind of Cartoonia that is anything but reassuring, since sex and violence are at home here. Goliardic and aggressive style, non-existent script. Basinger makes the bellona.

title: Deep Star Six
actors: Taurean Blacque, Nancy Everhard, Greg Evigan
description: Dr. Van Gelder, on behalf of the US Navy, has created an underwater base where an underwater colonization project is developed in order to increase the fauna. The project, however, hides another purpose, that is to install a missile base. The mission, made up of eleven people, including three women, comes to an end when a terrible creature comes out of an open cave with explosives and attacks the base and begins to wreak havoc.

title: Creepshow 2
actors: Tom Savini, George Kennedy, Dorothy Lamour, Lois Chiles
description: The statue of an Indian chief stands out at the entrance to Roy and Martha Spurce's drugstore. When the shop is attacked by thugs, the statue comes alive and does justice. Two couples on an off-season vacation swim in a lake and end badly. Upon returning from an extra-marital affair, a woman overwhelms a black hitchhiker with her car, runs away and continues to live in remorse. Second episode of "Creepshow", but the structure (that of the comic album) is identical to the first. The inspiration is offered by stories by Stephen King, the screenplay is by Romero (director of the first film), but then: why doesn't it work this time?

title: A Man Alone
actors: Ray Milland, Mary Murphy, Ward Bond, Raymond Burr, Arthur Space
description: Wes, a gunslinger who has already had some trouble with the law (he was accused of having carried out a robbery), risks being framed for a crime he did not commit. Curious chamber western directed and performed by Milland without great inventiveness, but trying to tackle some stereotypes of the genre on the counterattack.

title: Beau Geste
actors: Gary Cooper, Robert Preston, Ray Milland, Brian Donlevy
description: To try to prevent their adoptive mother's unscrupulous husband from stealing a very precious jewel, three orphans decide to steal it. In order not to be accused of the theft of the precious jewel they are forced to enlist in the Foreign Legion. As soon as they arrive in Morocco, the three men realize how hard military life is. On their way, in addition to ferocious Tuaregs, the newly enlisted also find a sadistic sergeant.
notes: The film had two Oscar nominations, one for Brian Donlevy and another for editing. The scene of the fort defended by corpses is famous. Great performance by Gary Cooper.

title: Ticks
actors: Ami Dolenz, Rosalind Allen, Seth Green, Alfonso Ribeiro
description: A social worker and a sociologist organize the vacation of a group of teenagers in Northern California. The guys aren't thrilled with the idea and the follow-up proves them right. As soon as they arrive in the forest they begin to be attacked by strange mutant animals capable of sucking the saliva of the unfortunates they manage to reach. Final scene with the horde of insects marching towards the boys' hut.
notes: Yet another horror variant on the perverse nature of chemical agents that produce biological mutations: in this case it is fertilizers used to grow marijuana. What is not clear is why Randel believes he is a director.

title: Johnny Reno
actors: Dana Andrews, Jane Russell, Lon Chaney jr.
description: While heading to Chanson, to reunite with his woman, Federal Sheriff Johnny Reno is shot at by two individuals: he kills one and captures the other, a certain John Conners. In town, Mayor Yez would like Conners to be handed over to the Indians because he is accused of the murder of Little Bear's son. Western cheap and almost pathetic in its lingering on stereotypes. The interpreters were all at sunset.

title: The Aviator
actors: Christopher Reeve, Rosanna Arquette, Jack Warden, Sam Wanamaker
description: Texas, 1918: Edgar Anscombe is a US Air Force flight instructor. While witnessing a rookie he is forced into a forced landing, during which the young man is killed and Edgar is wounded and forever emotionally compromised. Comforted by his boss Moravia, he meets his sixteen-year-old daughter: and thanks to another plane crash, he falls in love with her ...
notes: The feelings are shouted, the dialogues inappropriate, the conclusions (?) Left to the viewer; the landscapes - beautiful - do not redeem the wavering construction of the plot. George Miller, director of _The Man by the Snowy River_, is just the namesake of the author of the Mad Max series.

title: The Professionals
actors: Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan, Jack Palance, Claudia Cardinale
description: Rasa, a Mexican revolutionary, has kidnapped the wife of the wealthy Mr. Grant, who hires four men to free her and bring her home: Bill, an explosives expert; Harry, an Army veteran; Hans, expert on horses; Jack, a very skilled hunter at lasso throwing. The four, enticed by the reward, overcome the pitfalls of the desert and the mountains between Texas and Mexico and manage to free the woman. But, having completed the mission, they discover that hers had been a forced marriage and that, before, she had been Rasa's woman. At the origin of the film is the novel "A Mule for the Marquesa" by Frank O'Rourke, which Brooks uses as a classic western canvas for one of the most lucid political films of those years. The liberal disenchantment, the contradictions and the needs of the revolution (in a famous final speech by Lancaster that overturns the moral of Kazan's "Viva Zapata"), memorable jokes, ambiguous and complex characters and a rhythm of a great classic "dirty". Perhaps Brooks's masterpiece.

title: The Texican
actors: Audie Murphy, Broderick Crawford
description: Armed with suspicion (but not evidence) and a desire for revenge, Ringo hunts down his brother's killer. Find some allies and many enemies. Anonymous B-series western directed by a prolific specialist and played by the big boy Murphy.

title: The Ambushers
actors: Dean Martin, Senta Berger
description: The search for a missing flying saucer with its owner leads secret agent Matt to a den of totalitarian fanatics, just in time to thwart their plans.

title: On Wings of Eagles
actors: Burt Lancaster, Richard Crenna
description: American billionaire Ross Perot (himself, the presidential candidate) tries to save two of his collaborators from the Khomeini prisons of Iran. Action film that wastes even the old Lancaster.

title: Bad Dreams
actors: Jennifer Rubin, Bruce Abbott, Richard Lynch, Harris Yulin
description: Cynthia survives the collective suicide of a mad reverend and his sect. She is safe, but rather battered, so much so that she remains in a coma for thirteen years. Out of the coma, she is entrusted to a psychiatrist. Despite so many years having passed, she continues to be haunted by visions of the terrible "guru", as strange and horrible suicides begin to occur in her therapeutic group.
notes: Reagan America of the 1980s does not re-read the era of the counterculture, it simply remembers it as a nightmare. On the value of the spectacle it would be better to remain silent; psychologisms and effects galore.

title: House
actors: William Katt, George Wendt
description: Fresh from Vietnam, the abandonment of his wife and the loss of a child, Roger seeks refuge in an empty house. But there all his nightmares assail him. Effective horror with a few touches of irony.

title: Intruders
actors: Richard Crenna, Mare Winningham, Susan Blakely, Daphen Ashbrook
description: For some time the military authorities have been recording strange reports attributable to visits from other planets, but they keep the strictest confidentiality on the subject. At the same time, a psychologist from Los Angeles discovered through hypnosis that two of his patients in shock were artificially fertilized by aliens to create a "middle race". Everything will be silenced. Nothing new in this "psychological" science fiction television film, an ideal sequel to a 1970s TV movie starring Harrison Ford. Its merit, however, is to create a good suspense based more on the "not shown" than on special effects, although the production made use of excellent specialists in computer "tricks".

title: Smith!
actors: Glenn Ford, Chief Dan George, Nancy Olson, Warren Oates
description: Farmer Smith has always wanted to be on good terms with his Indian friends. Now he finds himself having to fight against prejudice and ignorance to defend one of his friends from the murder charge. Good family film, with a very human Glenn Ford and the excellent Chief Dan George who six years later, will participate in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest".

title: The Haunted
actors: Jeffrey DeMunn, Sally Kirkland, Louise Latham, Joyce Van Patten
description: A small family from Pennsylvania moves into a new home where a series of terrifying phenomena soon unfold. Between movements of objects, noises, frightening voices and so on, they must fight above all in order not to lose their mind. The film, shot for TV, deals with events that were widely dealt with in the American news and is based on the book (1988 best-seller) in which the protagonist family narrated their experience. The realization has some effectiveness.

title: Death Wish
actors: Charles Bronson, Vincent Gardenia, Hope Lange, William Redfield
description: One evening three thugs enter the house of the architect Paul Kersey, kill his wife and rape his daughter who ends up in an asylum. At that point, having also abandoned his job, Paul begins to think about getting justice for himself. His new business as a private executioner is a resounding success. Ordinary people side with him and the criminals themselves begin to fear him. Then a more stubborn policeman than others discovers his identity and convinces him to stop.
notes: It's not as bad as you normally think, and still not as bad as its sequels. Winner is good at action sequences and Bronson is not bad when he doesn't overdo it. Music by Herbie Hancock.

title: The Three Musketeers
actors: Charlie Sheen, Kiefer Sutherland, Chris O'Connell, Oliver Platt, Gabrielle Anwar
description: In 16th century France, Cardinal Richelieu dissolves the body of the Musketeers. Porthos, Aramis and Athos, to which the aspiring musketeer D'Artagnan is added, are not there. When Richelieu sends the perfidious Milady to Calais with a proposed agreement with the English enemies, the four swordsmen get in the way.
notes: Fifth version for the cinema of the novel by Dumas Padre (1844), but certainly not the happiest. Actors with the only merit of youth. A lot of movement, but few ideas. Disney produces.

title: Re-Animator 2
actors: Bruce Abbott, Claude Earl Jones, Fabiana Udenio, David Gale
description: Dr. West, with colleague Dan Cain, works in a front-line hospital in Peru during a bloody revolution. Using corpses for his experiments, he discovers a substance capable of restoring life not only to the dead, but even to individual parts of a corpse. Back in Massachusetts, the two attempt to revive Cain's dead girlfriend, whose heart has been preserved. Even with some gimmicks, the sequel to "Re-Animator" does nothing but mix the ingredients of the progenitor horror comedy, without reproducing its proper functioning. From director Brian Yuzna, who made his debut with the impressive "Society", more could be expected.

title: The Violent Men
actors: Edward G. Robinson, Barbara Stanwyck, Glenn Ford, Brian Keith, Dianne Foster
description: John Panish buys land in Texas. There the landowner Wilkinson dominates, a paralytic dominated by his wife Martha and his cousin Charles, her lover. Panish does not want to give him his properties. At the instigation of the unfaithful couple, deaths and devastation follow, until Wilkinson opens his eyes, thanks to his daughter Judith who takes him to safety from Panish after a fire ... The story progresses in spurts of wickedness and also thanks to the couple of great interpreters of the genre, Edward G. Robinson and Barbara Stanwyck, relates the film to the noir classics. It is a pity that the ethical-aesthetic moralism of the 1950s productions prevails.

title: Critters
actors: Dee Wallace, M. Emmet Walsh, Billy Green Bush, Scott Grimes
description: A group of hairy globe-looking aliens who have escaped from prison on a distant planet swoop into the Brooks family's garden in Kansas. While the Browns with their two children barricade themselves in the house, the voracious and gnawing monsters proliferate ever more threatening. Two space bounty hunters are sent to Earth to eliminate the escapees. Will they succeed?
notes: Comparing it to this simple tale, so simple as to be irritating, one authoritative critic said that "Gremlins" appears to be a masterpiece of the caliber of "War and Peace". In the US, this childhood horror has become a cult object, with three sequels to its credit.

title: Major Dundee
actors: Charlton Heston, Richard Harris, James Coburn, Warren Oates, Senta Berger
description: Major Dundee and Lieutenant Tyreen were once friends. Now the former is a Northern officer sent to New Mexico to eliminate the dangerous Indian chief Sierra Charriba, while the latter is just one of many captive Southerners. However, the situation is really tough and Dundee, in the absence of men, makes a pact of honor with the prisoners (and with Tyreen) and enlists them in the hunt for Charriba.
notes: It is hatred that drives the world forward. At least in this we recognize the hand of Peckinpah. For the rest, it cannot be said that the film is his. Production reassembled it by cutting twenty minutes. The American distribution threw away fourteen and the Italian one another nine. Probably a cursed masterpiece.

title: Station West
actors: Dick Powell, Jane Greer, Agnes Moorehead, Tom Powers, Steve Brodie
description: In a town devastated by gold fever, two soldiers who were escorting a precious cargo are killed. The investigations are entrusted to a young policeman, who goes there with the excuse of looking for work. But hospitality is not the main prerogative of citizens who in fact begin to insult him. Having emerged victorious from the diatribe, he can begin the investigations that lead him to suspect the owner of the saloon.
notes: The film is well done, but a little too predictable. The script by Frank Fenton and Winston Miller has close dialogues. There is also a colored version.

title: One Hundred Rifles
actors: Burt Reynolds, Raquel Welch, Jim Brown, Fernando Lamas, Soledad Miranda
description: Joe has just robbed a bank to get the money to buy the weapons that the Yaqui Indians will need to fight General Verdugo who is exterminating them. On Joe's trail there is also a black sheriff, but he too falls, along with Joe, into Verdugo's hands. The two are about to be shot when they are saved by the intrepid Sarita at the head of a band of Indians to which the two will join. The characters are nice, and the rhythm holds up enough ..

title: Hard Target
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Lance Henriksen, Yancy Butler
description: Chance Boudreaux, a lone sailor who is now in New Orleans, agrees to find her father who has mysteriously disappeared on behalf of a lawyer. Chance discovers that he has been eliminated by some guys who, for the simple "taste" of hunting, occasionally organize hunts in which the prey are human beings. This is not only a successful remake of a 1930s Schoedsack classic ("The Dangerous Game"), but also the American debut of Hong Kong director John Woo.

title: Blood on the Arrow
actors: Dale Robertson, Martha Hyer, Wendell Corey
description: To get the kidnapped boy back, Clint is forced to supply weapons to the Coyoteros Indians on a war footing. The golden-hearted bandit Wed Cooper, moved by Clint's wife, breaks into the Indian camp to fix everything.
notes: Naive and utterly predictable Western.

title: Good Guys Wear Black
actors: Chuck Norris, Anne Archer, James Franciscus
description: The officer (Norris) who led a commando action in North Vietnam scrambles to find out who betrayed him and his men. Yet another short film that rummages in the syndrome of the American defeat, where you badly try to graft a "martial arts" genre made in the USA. Ted Post will direct a good Vietnam film, "Lost Victories" the following year.

title: The Crow
actors: Brandon Lee, Michael Wincott, Rochelle Davis, Ernie Hudson
description: On the eve of Halloween, dark musician Eric Draven is brutally murdered with his girlfriend by a gang of drug addicts. Exactly a year later, Eric is resurrected, pale, black-clad and accompanied by a mysterious crow. Immortal, he hunts down the killers and their leader, Dollar, but the latter, thanks to his lover, an expert in occultism, puts him in difficulty.
notes: Evocative black fairytale, a skilful mix of horror, fantasy, thriller, well rhythmic, with a broken montage and a rock soundtrack. Brandon Lee died of an accident on set and some scenes were completed by entering his electronic image. Based on a comic, which later became a cult, by James O’Barr.

title: The Glass Shadow
actors: Elias Koteas, Angelina Jolie, Allen Garfield, Billy Drago, Jack Palance
description: Pinwheel Industries built Cash, a female cyborg. Her martial arts instructor Colt falls in love with her, but certain plans call for Cash to blow up. Colt escapes with his beloved. Thinking of a case of industrial espionage, Pinwheel dispatches two killers on the hunt for fugitives. But a cyborg dog rescues them and leads them to the unarmed battleship of the strange Captain Mercy. Despite the title, this B-movie has nothing to do with the "Cyborg" interpreted by Van Damme in 1989, if anything we are in the wake of "Blade Runner". In the cast, in addition to the disturbing cybernetic woman Angelina Jolie, to report the "cameo" of Jack Palance.

title: Excessive Force
actors: Thomas Ian Griffith, Lance Henriksen, James Earl Jones, Tony Todd
description: Boss Burt Young has a nasty suspicion that one of the cops who blew up a large drug purchase slipped away from the crime scene and took away the three million dollars in cash that was supposed to be used for the purchase. Of the three policemen involved in the operation, only Terry McCain remains alive who, before becoming the third corpse, decides to pay a visit to Young ... In addition to breaking a good number of arms and dislocating dozens of shoulders, this is Thomas Ian Griffith also appears as a producer and screenwriter. Too much for his frail forces. Throw away the talents of Henriksen and Jones.

title: Year of the Comet
actors: Penelope Ann Miller, Tim Daly, Louis Jourdan, Art Malik, Ian Richardson
description: Margaret is a highly experienced winemaker. When, among the bottles preserved in an ancient Scottish castle, she discovers a magnum of Lafitte vintage 1811, it is for her a remarkable personal success. She does not know yet, but her troubles will begin precisely from this success: that was in fact the year of the comet and, as everyone knows, the passage of these wandering celestial bodies always brings with it harmful influences. However, Margaret finds unexpected help in the role of the hero of the moment who leads her by the hand through the vicissitudes necessary to reach the happy ending. Between comedy and adventure, we are in the neighborhood of the lucky "In pursuit of the green stone": ordinary entertainment even if scripted by William Goldman ("Butch Cassidy" and "Misery must not die").

title: Dirty Dingus Magee
actors: Frank Sinatra, George Kennedy, Anne Jackson, Lois Nettleton
description: Dingus Magee steals $ 400 from Hoke Magee. He, appointed sheriff of Buco Stanco by the mayor Belle Knaps, owner of the local brothel, captures him, but Dingus is freed by the beautiful Indian Anna Horwater. He later gets involved in an Indian war, finds a jade chest hidden in a cemetery and gets married, but the marriage goes awry.
notes: Western between farce and adventure: a divertissement signed by Burt Kennedy with an "all star" cast but without great verve.

title: Hellbound
actors: Chuck Norris, Calvin Levels, Sheree J. Wilson, David Robb, Christopher Neame
description: King Richard the Lionheart defeats a demon sent by Satan, shattering the fearsome "scepter of command" into nine pieces. Eight centuries later, a Los Angeles detective (Norris) investigates a series of seemingly related murders, one rabbi and eight prelates killed. The investigator follows a trail that leads him to Jerusalem and the satanic plans of an archaeologist (Neame).
notes: Produced by the Israeli Cannon, more than an action film it is an indigestible mess of genres, with Chuck Norris facing the devil as we have already seen him do with the Vietcong, with karate shots. Only the diabolical Neame is saved, with professional demeanor.

title: Thunder over Arizona
actors: Skip Homeier, Christine Miller, George Macready
description: Foster, the speculator mayor, attempts to extort a mine from the Ralstons, killing the patriarch. The four sons Ralston, including a girl, barricade themselves in the galleries. To resolve the matter, Foster sends for a gunslinger, but another very different one arrives in his place. From Republic Pictures a typical, passable, B-grade western.

title: Roar
actors: Noel Marshall, Tippi Hedren, Melanie Griffith, John Marshall
description: An ethologist, Hank, has lived for years in Africa in a farm house with many wild beasts that man has raised since they were puppies and with whom he lives in harmony. One day his wife and children go to visit him but, due to a mistake, they arrive at the farm when Hank is not there and suddenly find themselves among the animals.
notes: Partly autobiographical and all shot in the family by Hedren's husband and Griffith's father. Unmemorable in itself, the film is curious precisely because it sees the two actresses mother and daughter together.

title: Broken Lance
actors: Spencer Tracy, Robert Wagner, Richard Widmark, Katy Jurado, Jean Peters
description: Matt, a farm owner, is very much loved by his son Joe, who was had by an Indian woman. He takes the blame for the clash his father had with a mine owner and goes to jail. Matt dies of an illness following yet another conflict he had with one of his legitimate children, who hate him and who would like to take his property at all costs. As they battle over the inheritance, Joe gets out of jail and leaves with the woman he loves. But a showdown awaits him.
notes: An anomalous Western, in fact a remake of Mankiewicz's "Bitter Destiny" even if the director Dmytryk insists more on the analogies with Shakespeare's "King Lear". The western context is both tragic and mythical, the family drama, dear to the author, explodes with unprecedented violence. Wonderful actors (Robert Wagner best proof; Tracy and Widmark two guarantees) and an Oscar, to Philip Yordan, for the subject.

title: Billy the Kid
actors: Johnny Mac Brown, Wallace Beery, Kay Johnson
description: Long pursuit of the relentless sheriff Pat Garrett (Wallace Beery) on the trail of the famous and young outlaw. Western of the early years of sound originally shot in 70 mm., Proposes the more traditional and idealized image of the Kid.

title: Soldier of Fortune
actors: Clark Gable, Susan Hayward, Michael Rennie, Gene Barry
description: An American reporter mysteriously disappears in Hong Kong. His wife then goes to the Asian city to find out what happened to her husband. Here the inspector following the investigation suggests that the woman seek help from an American adventurer who has been in Asia for years. The man agrees to help her and ends up falling in love with her ...
notes: Edward Dmytryk, shooting in Hong Kong, manages to create discreet atmospheres, also capturing the peculiarities of the environment. The interpreters are quite persuasive, a Clark Gable who starts at dusk but keeps his charm intact, and a Susan Hayward who goes along well with him.

title: American Ninja V
actors: David Bradley, Lee Reyes, Anne Dupont, Tadashi Yamashita
description: A big brain has developed a deadly preparation. A gangster who wants to seize it for his shady and crazy purposes blackmails the inventor by kidnapping his daughter. Joe Castle, martial arts expert, intervenes. The title is linked to a series with Michael Dudikoff, known among fans, who however does not appear in the film.

title: Jurassic Park
actors: Sam Neill, Laura Dern, Jeff Goldblum, Richard Attenborough, Ariana Richards, Joseph Mazzello
description: A multi-billionaire is preparing to inaugurate the most exciting zoo in the world: he has recreated dinosaurs by cloning on an island in the Caribbean. But while some of the guests, including two children, are visiting, a technician sabotages the security systems and the lizards combine hard and raw. When the situation is managed, the owner decides not to do anything with it. It's not Spielberg's best film, but it's a perfect show machine that marvelously harnesses state-of-the-art technologies to create visual wonders and narrative tension. A scheme that is nothing more than elementary which becomes a sophisticated attraction. From a novel by Michael Crichton.

title: Two-Fisted Tales
directors: Richard Donner, Tom Holland (II), Robert Zeme
actors: Brad Pitt, Kirk Douglas, Eric Douglas
description: The film is divided into three episodes: the first, "Showdown" (by Donner) is a western in which two cowboys are transformed into zombies. The second, "King of the Road" (by Holland) tells the horrifying deeds of a reckless car racing teddy boy. The third, "Yellow" (by Zemeckis) has been called a remake of "Paths of Glory" starring Kirk and Eric Douglas. On the exact border between horror and fantastic are these three episodes, real nightmares, similar to the universe of "At the edge of reality". The mix of genres and the claustrophobic atmospheres are the winning cards of the film, which includes some episodes of a luxurious TV series.

title: The Left Hand of God
actors: Humphrey Bogart, Gene Tierney, Lee J. Cobb, Agnes Moorehead
description: Jim Carmody, an American aviator shot down over the skies of China, is taken prisoner. When, having taken the identity of a murdered missionary, he manages to escape, he takes refuge in a mission: he will be able to save the village from destruction and, after leaving his cassock, he will also find love. The presence of Bogart is interesting and curious, at ease even in the unusual cassocks. Dmytrik had been one of the "Hollywood Ten" and, after he retracted, also made this explicitly anti-Communist film.

title: The Fly
actors: Jeff Goldblum, Geena Davis, John Getz, Leslie Carlson, Joy Boushel
description: There are two mertallo bells in Dr. Brundle's (Goldblum) laboratory. He calls them "telepods" and uses them to transport matter. At first, everyone doesn't take him seriously, including journalist Veronica Quaife (Davis). Then Brundle decides to try the new invention on himself. The result would be perfect if only one fly did not slip into the bell at the wrong time.
notes: Remake of an old film by Kurt Neumann which, in Cronenberg's hands, becomes a philosophical question on the heaviness of flesh and the lightness of flies. Unmissable, like every Cronenberg film.

title: El Mariachi
actors: Carlos Gallardo, Consuelo Gomez, Reinol Martinez, Peter Marquardt
description: Arriving in town with his guitar, the mariachi (walking storyteller of Mexican origin) finds himself in the middle of the war between the bands of Moco, owner of all the bars and all the a guitar case). For further complication, the young man falls in love with Domino, Moco's woman. Result: a massacre, which only the protagonist survives. Robert Rodriguez's sensational debut, with a very low-cost film, suggestive in the shots and with a frenzied rhythm. A narrative that makes this brazen anarchy its best gift. The director himself made a remake of it in Hollywood, "Desperado", starring Antonio Banderas.

title: The Marauders
actors: Dan Duryea, Jeff Richards
description: During the Civil War, a furious struggle for the possession of a land broke out between a builder and a ranchero replaced, after his death, by his diabolical accountant. Strange western with sinister accents: a classic and noble B-series product.

title: The Court Jester
actors: Danny Kaye, Glynis Johns, Basil Rathbone, Angela Lansbury
description: Danny Kaye, disguised as a jester, manages to dethrone a tyrannical and usurper ruler. Playful and well thought out adventures with an athletic and witty Danny Kaye.

title: White Witch Doctor
actors: Susan Hayward, Robert Mitchum, Timothy Carey, Walter Slezak
description: Elena is the widow of a doctor who specializes in equatorial diseases. Almost to continue his work, she goes to Congo as a nurse. On the journey she is escorted by a guide, Loney Douglas, who falls in love with her. Arriving in the village, Elena learns that the elderly doctor is dead; agrees to replace her and Loney stays with her. After Elena has gained the trust of the Baku king by healing his son, an unscrupulous adventurer, Loney's old acquaintance, reappears in search of gold deposits. Equatorial adventure for the Hayward-Mitchum couple, who had recently worked together in Nicholas Ray's memorable "The Daredevil". The film remains a collage of stereotypes of exotic-adventurous cinema, even if Mitchum occasionally knows how to revive it. Leon Shamroy's photography is good, while Hathaway handles the directing practices without impetus. The music is by Bernard Herrmann.

title: Iron Will
actors: Mackenzie Astin, Kevin Spacey, David Odgen Stiers, August Schellenberg
description: In 1917, 17-year-old Will Stoneman from Dakota entered the sled race on the route from Winnipeg (Canada) to St. Paul (Minnesota). With the $ 10,000 first prize he wants to save his family and farm from bankruptcy. The race is very tough and, what's more, there are also dangerous additional pitfalls. Audacity and luck: it is the classic formula of success made in the USA that Walt Disney enhances here with the usual outline of splendid landscapes. For spectators of proven innocence and a lot of good will.

title: Cabin Boy
actors: Chris Elliott, Ritch Brinkley, James Gammon, Brion James
description: Nathaniel Mayweather is a wealthy, snobbish student about to set sail for Hawaii where his father owns a hotel. For a trivial mistake, instead of boarding the right ship, Nathaniel finds himself in a filthy schooner, the "Filthy Whore", populated by a quintet of gruff sailors ready to torment him. But the worst comes when the boat approaches the island called Hell's Bucket .. Chris Elliott and Adam Resnick come from the television show "Late Night with David Letterman", a program for which Tim Burton and Denise Di Novi go crazy. That must be why they decided to produce this film. A wrong choice happens to everyone.

title: Silent Running
actors: Bruce Dern, Cliff Potts, Ron Rifkin, Jesse Vint
description: In 2002 there is no longer any green on Earth. Only in some orbiting stations do greenhouses remain active. Then they disappear from there too.
notes: The author of the special effects of "2001" directs with skill. Screenplay by Michael Cimino.

title: Fort Ti
actors: George Montgomery, Joan Vohs, Irving Bacon
description: In the 18th century, in America, during the war between the British and the French, intrigues of spies, alleged spies, fierce Rangers and helpless girls. Originally projected in 3D, Castle's film was already pretty bad at the time.

title: The Thing
actors: T.K. Carter, Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, David Clennon
description: Scientists at a research base in Alaska collect a wolfhound that their Norwegian colleagues attempted to cull. They put it in the kennel while two of them go to the Norwegian base which they find abandoned and full of corpses. They also find the remains of what looks like a flying saucer. In short, the dog is possessed by a strange force and turns into a beast. Panic spreads to the base.
notes: Remake of a 1951 Christian Nyby (and Howard Hawks) classic, a science fiction film but tainted with horror. Equipped with spectacular special effects (by Rob Bottin) it has a masterful suspense, a setting of great suggestion and remains suspended in a final of terrible uncertainty.

title: The Bounty Hunter
actors: Randolph Scott, Dolores Dorn, Ernest Borgnine
description: Three robbers are hiding in Twin Forks under the guise of honest citizens. Jim Kipp, in charge of tracking them down, manages to unmask them thanks to a clever ruse. Helps him Julia, the doctor's daughter, who will eventually join him. Discreet western that effectively mixes action, shooting and sentiment: color photography and actors are also good.

title: Shoot Out
actors: Gregory Peck, Pat Quinn, Susan Tyrrell, Robert F. Lyons, Dawn Lyn
description: Clay Lomax just got out of jail where he spent seven long years, convicted of a bank robbery. The first thing he intends to do as a free man is to take revenge on Sam Foley, the accomplice who shot him in the back and got him captured. In the seven years that Clay was in prison, Foley has instead become a big shot in another city. When he learns that Clay is on his trail he sends three killers to meet him. Clay, meanwhile, has been entrusted with a little girl who appears to be the result of an ancient relationship. In the clash with the three killers, Clay colds one, but the others kidnap the child and take refuge in Foley's house. Hathaway doesn't age well. Gregory Peck looks forward to his duties as a hero not exactly positive, but redeemed by honor.

title: Only the Valiant
actors: Gregory Peck, Ward Bond, Gig Young
description: Cavalry captain Lance goes to defend a New Mexico fort threatened by the incursions of the Apache Indians with a handful of six men chosen from among the most violent and undisciplined. Lance shows off all his skill by managing to command them and carry out their duty. A western that does not depart from the dignified standards of the time, despite the presence of Gregory Peck.

title: Timerider
actors: Fred Ward, Peter Coyote, Belinda Bauer
description: Lyle, champion of off-road motorcycles, is accidentally thrown in the Far West of 1875. Here he realizes that the reality of the last century is very similar to that of today. Small science fiction film, nice and enjoyable for fans.

title: Critters 3
actors: Aimée Brooks, John Calvin, Katherine Cortez, Leonardo DiCaprio
description: Annie (Brooks), little brother Johnny and dad are on an RV trip when they meet Josh (Di Caprio) and his hateful stepfather. They also come into contact with a Critters hunter who gives them a warning signal in case of need. And the case arises immediately, as the Critters sneak into the camper and then into the house where Annie and her family live. With two films already shot on the Critters was there really a need to make a third? With a bright career full of probable Oscars in the future, did Leonardo Di Caprio really need to fall into this film? Unfathomable questions.

title: Montana
actors: Gena Rowlands, Richard Crenna, Lea Thompson
description: A rather quarrelsome couple does not decide on the fate of the family ranch: she wants to keep it, he wants to sell it to an oil company. Classic product for TV, of modest spectacle and with declining actors.

title: Stick
actors: Burt Reynolds, Candice Bergen, George Segal, Charles Durning
description: Stick (Reynolds) just got out of jail. His intention is to rebuild a life away from the world of crime, but his friend in trouble over a drug deal, tries to involve him in the operation and in the end he succeeds. When he is killed in an ambush, Stick is forced to contend with a killer chased by a drug kingpin.
notes: Burt Reynolds builds on himself a film played with self-irony: it is what saves him because the story seems rather obvious. Some parts of the film were turned around because they were considered bankruptcy by the production and by the actor-director himself. Elmore Leonard, author of the novel from which this film is based, also collaborated on the screenplay.

title: Perfect Weapon
actors: Jeff Speakman, John Dye, Mako, James Hong, Mariska Hargitay
description: Martial arts have no secrets for Jeff, but sometimes his aggression and passion for violence, even when used without the will to do harm, have separated him from his family. When a friend is brutally killed by the Korean mafia, Jeff decides to avenge him, despite his brother Adam, a police detective, advising him not to challenge fierce and dangerous opponents for the city police themselves. Inexorable, our hero rebuilds the ranks of the gang and aims for the boss; not even Adam's injury stops him. Also because Jeff has become wise and has learned to make the most of his body.

title: Phantasm 2
actors: James LeGros, Reggie Bannister, Angus Scrimm
description: A boy fights against a being belonging to the mysterious dimension of nightmares and endowed with tremendous powers. As in the "Phantasm" of nine years earlier, the screenwriter and director Coscarelli knows the tricks that cause the shock, but he does not have the gift of consistency.

title: South of St. Louis
actors: Joel McCrea, Alexis Smith, Zachary Scott, Dorothy Malone, Douglas Kennedy, Alan Hale
description: In Texas divided and battered by the civil war between Unionists and Confederates, three friends, co-owners of a ranch, take dramatically different paths. A very decent western that abounds with action, well served by a solid cast. Color photograph by Karl Freund.

title: Child's Play 2
actors: Alex Vincent, Christine Elise, Jenny Agutter, Grace Zabriskie, Greg Germann, Gerrit Graham
description: Chucky is a good doll, unfortunately possessed by the soul of a serial killer, a certain Charles Lee Ray. Little Andy Barcaly is back from a bad adventure with Chucky, but now it's all over: the doll has been sent back to the factory to be destroyed, while Andy has gone to live with his new adoptive parents. The sequel proves it's not that easy to get rid of Chucky. Who will be able to save their skin in the end?
notes: The story does not end with this sequel, but continues in the third episode released the following year directed by another director. But in these cases, who is looking to the director?

title: Friday the 13th
actors: Betsy Palmer, Adrienne King, Harry Crosby, Robbi Morgan, Kevin Bacon
description: A group of boys and girls are setting up the Crystal Lake campsite, heedless of the curse that hangs over the place, after the tragic death, back in 1958, of the son of Mrs. Voorhess, owner of the land. It is a Friday 13, as well as a full moon night: only Alice is saved from the collective massacre, after having beheaded the "monster": the usual unsuspected character. The first episode of a series destined for numerous and ominous shots. This as a whole is still saved: the repetitive mechanism, the erotic allusions, the mix between full moon and cabala manage to obviate the total absence of narration.

title: Pentathlon
actors: Dolph Lundgren, David Soul, Renée Coleman, Roger E. Mosley
description: A year before the fall of the Berlin Wall, an East German pentathlete escapes the Marxist "paradise" and lands in the United States. He has a hard time here, but his employer helps him get back in shape. Except, there is his former coach who took it into his head to kill him and, from a Stasi agent, he turned into a neo-Nazi. The criminal plan is doomed to predictable failure. There is very little to say about this film that mixes sport, politics and espionage: no one is saved, neither Dolph Lundgren, the Ivan Drago of "Rocky IV", nor David Soul, star of the telefilm "Starsky and Hutch ".

title: The Indian Fighter
actors: Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Lon Chaney jr., Elsa Martinelli
description: After the end of the civil war, Johnny Hawks returns to the West; once hostile to the Indians, he later made peace with the tribe of Chief Red Cloud. Now he has to lead a caravan in full Sioux territory ...
notes: Matthau and Chaney jr. they are bad guys, Douglas produces and dominates, Martinelli makes her American debut.

title: Labyrinth
actors: Jennifer Connelly, David Bowie, Toby Froud, Shelley Thompson
description: Sarah is a teenager with a vivid imagination. One evening her parents entrusted her with her little brother. Impatient by the constant crying of the latter, Sarah invokes Jareth, the lord of the gnomes, to take him away. But Jareth really exists and, taking it literally, makes the little one disappear. Sarah goes in search of him, entering a world of dreams and wandering in a parallel world. Henson was the inventor of the Muppett, the script is by Terry Jones who was one of the Monty Phyton), the producer is George "Star Wars" Lucas. But the story is without rhythm and without magic, if we exclude the inventions of some puppets and some space-time displacements that restore the atmosphere of the dream.

title: Clownhouse
actors: Nathan Forrest Winters, Brian McHugh, Sam Rockwell
description: Three brothers, left alone on Friday evenings, go to the circus. Casey is the youngest; he does not have much fun, on the contrary he is afraid of the insinuating ways of clowns. Randy, the eldest of the three, teases him, but will have something to regret it. He soon realizes that little Casey was right to be terrified: someone or something terrible is hiding in the night shadows of the suburbs. Salva plays with traditional elements (children's fears, the night, creepy clown masks). It is a debut work of discreet workmanship that does not disappoint fans.

title: Predator 2
actors: Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Rubén Blades, Maria Conchita Alonso, Bill Paxton
description: Los Angeles, 1997. In the city it is everyone's war against everyone; one group, in particular, leaves behind quartered corpses, marked with voodoo symbols. The affair is dealt with by Mike Harrigan, a black policeman, who discovers and confronts a group of aliens barricaded in a slaughterhouse.
notes: Between science fiction and horror, an action film that tries to build somewhat improbable gothic atmospheres. Bungled and smashed, with some spectacular moments. Schwarzy, protagonist of the first "Predator" is not here; the hero of the moment is Danny Glover.

title: The Fly II
actors: Eric Stoltz, Daphne Zuniga, Lee Richardson, John Getz
description: Veronica, pregnant with Dr. Brundle (killed by her because he was monstrously transformed), gives birth to a child who at the age of 5 is already a sleepless and very intelligent young man. The billionaire Bartok, with shady ends, puts him to work in a laboratory to complete his father's work. But the love for the beautiful Beth disrupts the evil Bartok's plans. Apocalyptic ending with the release of the prisoner. Clumsy attempt to follow up on Cronenberg's good movie. We are light years away from the results of the first. Here the special effects win, without a shadow of direction.

title: Forced Vengeance
actors: Chuck Norris, Mary Louise Weller, Camilla Griggs, Bob Minor
description: A veteran, fresh from Vietnam, works as a security manager at a Far Eastern gambling house, with all the complications involved. Poor action-movie with American martial arts star Chuck Norris.

title: Lost Horizon
actors: Peter Finch, Liv Ullmann, Bobby Van
description: Richard does not know that he is the designated heir of a Great Lama until, fleeing with others from a country ravaged by a revolt, he is kidnapped by a community of Himalayan monks. This remake of Frank Capra's excellent "Lost Horizon" (1937) is a super colorful mess, which gets lost in excessive ranting and tedious songs.

title: The Red Pony
actors: Myrna Loy, Robert Mitchum, Peter Miles
description: Little Tom had a pony as a gift, but the horse falls ill and dies, throwing Tom into despair. Good children's film written by John Steinbeck.

title: Kansas
actors: Matt Dillon, Andrew McCarthy, Leslie Hope, Alan Toy
description: It can happen that you are wanted by the newspapers for an act of heroism and at the same time by the police for a bank robbery. It happens to Wade Corey who, on his way to New York, meets Doyle and naively gets involved in a robbery. In the next escape he takes refuge under a bridge, just in time to save the governor's daughter from drowning. Wade is a good guy, but he'll have to hide. Dillon always plays James Dean's heir. Mediocre, confusing and unoriginal script by director Stevens, for a film that adds nothing to the "on the road" mythology.

title: Four for Texas
actors: Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Anita Ekberg, Ursula Andress
description: Joe and Zack are two adventurers who fortunately came into possession of the sum of one hundred thousand dollars. Joe wants to install a gambling house on a boat. Zack deals with a shady banker to make his life difficult, but when the banker manifests his true purposes, Joe and Zack team up and manage to knock him out, thus cementing their friendship. Stellar cast (both in the couple of protagonists and in the two side bellone) for Aldrich who gives us a western not without irony. If the film never takes itself seriously and fails to reach the scatentao rhythm it set itself, there are still some enjoyable moments.

title: Young Guns II
actors: Emilio Estevez, Kiefer Sutherland, Lou Diamond Phillips, James Coburn, Christian Slater
description: 1950, New Mexico desert: a law firm reporter runs into a very old man who claims to be Billy the Kid, the boy everyone believes was killed by Pat Garrett years ago. To convince him, the octogenarian begins to tell his story: the conflict with Governor Lee Wallace, the clash with the landowner John Chisum, and so on ...
notes: Modest sequel to _Young Guns_ (which was not already essential), designed and created to grab a young audience. After all, a certain Sam Peckinpah had already told us something about the story of Billy the Kid. Definitely, of course.

title: The Intruder Within
actors: Chad Everett, Joseph Bottoms, Jennifer Warren
description: The occupants of an isolated oil rig are threatened by a fearsome primitive creature that has risen from the mysterious abyssal depths. It is a decent television production suitable for those who love to tremble, but in moderation.

title: Logan's Run
actors: Michael York, Richard Jordan, Jenny Agutter, Peter Ustinov
description: After a planetary catastrophe, a human society has been reconstituted underground where, upon reaching the age of thirty, individuals are "regenerated" (ie suppressed) with a triumphal ceremony. Dissidents suspect deception. Two of them, Logan and Jessica, manage to reach the surface.
notes: After a good start, unfortunately the film falls into schematism and predictability.

title: Satan's Cheerleaders
actors: Kerry Shermann, John Ireland, Yvonne De Carlo
description: A group of cheerleaders fall into the coils of a satanic cult. To get out of trouble, they have to draw on all their wits. A few good strokes of humor and the contribution of some old glories of cinema are all that is saved in the general flatness of the film.

title: Lionheart
actors: Eric Stoltz, Gabriel Byrne, Nicola Cowper, Dexter Fletcher
description: Richard the Lionheart has already left for the Crusades and is on the way to the Holy Sepulcher. A very young knight (Stoltz) tries to intercept him in France to be able to join him. Instead, it happens that flocks of disadvantaged and homeless kids (and moreover on the run from the evil Black Prince) join him. What was initially a solitary initiative thus becomes a small army. You wouldn't expect such an enjoyable and original film. Yet here everything works: from the subject to the choice of actors.

title: On Deadly Ground
actors: Steven Seagal, Michael Caine, Joan Chen, John C. McGinley
description: Forrest Taft is a kind of superfighter in the field of oil wells. He extinguishes one that burned in Alaska, but when the boss of the company voluntarily provokes the bursting of another well for grim speculative maneuvers, the hero fights against the wicked, evicts them (albeit in conditions of numerical and potential inferiority) and avoids an ecological disaster of enormous proportions. Seagal, producer, director and performer, becomes a crusader for ecology. His expression is always absolutely granite. The film is almost all taken for granted.

title: Street Justice
actors: Michael Ontkean, Joanna Kerns, Catherine Bach
description: A former CIA agent returns from a long, unfair, detention. A lone hero, he cleans up his corrupt city dominated by a rich and powerful family. Predictable and slow Richard Sarafian film ("White Man Go With Your God") in full decline.

title: Ghost in the Machine
actors: Karen Allen, Chris Mulkey, Ted Marcoux, Will Horneff
description: Karl Hochman, a computer shop employee, has a serious car accident and is taken to hospital under the watchful eye of a brain scanner. From a sudden electrical blackout, Hochman dies, but his spirit continues to circulate within the electronic network Datanet Corp.
notes: The starting idea, copied among other things from "In shock" by Wes Craven, was anything but evil, but the director Talalay (which is that of "Nightmare 6") proves that she does not know how to go beyond a work of pure routine. The virtual reality sequence copied from "Tron" is useless.

title: The King's Thief
actors: David Niven, Edmund Purdom, Ann Blyth, George Sanders
description: The ambitious and cruel Duke of Brampton plots against Charles II, ruler of England, over whom he exercises a great influence. In fact, the king, instigated by the perfidious adviser, banishes some nobles who are loyal to the monarchy as traitors. Among the latter there is also a young ex-officer who is forced to live as an outlaw.
notes: Mediocre swashbuckling film, which sadly wastes a good cast (there's also a young Roger Moore). It was the last film directed for MGM by modest Leonard.

title: Remote Control
actors: Kevin Dillon, Deborah Goodrich, Jennifer Tilly, Christopher Wynne
description: A video store manager and a client take on aliens who intend to take over the world with a videotape.

title: Demolition Man
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Wesley Snipes, Sandra Bullock, Nigel Hawthorne
description: In 1996, in Los Angeles, Sergeant John Spartan captures the insane and dangerous psychopath Simon Phoenix, but then has to share with him a sentence (for involuntary massacre) of seventy years in cryogenic prison. In 2032, thawed, here they are again against each other, in San Angeles, the old Los Angeles, so clean that you can't even say a bad word. Who will win? It's the same old story, set in the future instead of in the present (and again no news!). A few modest chuckles for the new civilization of obligatory respectability, and little else. Snipes is better than Stallone, but the star is the other.

title: Grand Prix
actors: James Garner, Eva Marie Saint, Yves Montand, Toshiro Mifune
description: The film opens with the spectacular collision between American driver Pete Aron and Briton Scott Stoddard, at the Formula One Grand Prix of Monte Carlo. Pete comes out unscathed, Scott will have it for several months. The fight for the world title is now an affair between Pete, the Italian Barlini and the French Sarti, but between one dramatic competition and the next, sentimental emotions are certainly not lacking. International cast and great show on the track, conventional and discounted "pink" counterpoints. Oscar for editing, sound and special effects.

title: The Mad Love
actors: Colin Clive, Peter Lorre, Frances Drake, Isabel Jewell, Ted Healy
description: A famous pianist loses his hand in an accident. A mad surgeon (Peter Lorre), in love with the unfortunate's wife, grafts a limb taken from the corpse of a criminal. The results are unexpected and shocking.
notes: Grand Guignolesco and absurd little masterpiece directed by Karl Freund, already legendary director of photography (expressionist) of Murnau and Lang. As always, Peter Lorre is a perfect criminal: he rolls his eyes uncertain, looks shy and awkward only to reveal his true soul of the character. To represent evil he was undoubtedly the most suitable interpreter.

title: The Blue Bird
actors: Shirley Temple, Johnny Russell, Gale Sondergaard
description: Little brother and sister embark on a fantastic journey in search of the little bird of happiness. For three quarters of the film they have endless adventures, until, discouraged, they return home, just in time to make the incredible discovery. The mythical bird has always been in their garden ...
notes: Based on the fairy tale "The Blue Bird" by Maurice Maeterlinck, the film recalls and attempts to exploit the success of "The Wizard of Oz", released the year before. Walter Lang deploys a dazzling technicolor for the use of a Shirley Temple no longer a child prodigy.

title: Conagher
actors: Sam Elliott, Katharine Ross, Barry Corbin, Billy Green Bush
description: A cowboy abandons his wandering life to help the widow Teale, whose husband one day left to sell cattle and never returned. Since then, the woman has been running a diligence station dangerously close to Indian territories on her own, and is also raising two children. But out there there are not only the Red Indians: in fact the bandits are always ready to take advantage of the most defenseless, at least until a noble gunslinger gets in the way ...
notes: Produced for TNT cable TV, it has a somewhat slow pace: the result is an effective western atmospheric, full of poetry and with a perfectly partially Elliott.

title: Creature
actors: Stan Ivar, Wendy Schaal, Lyman Ward, Klaus Kinski
description: A space expedition is sent on a mission to Titan, satellite of the planet Saturn, to investigate life forms that have proved fatal to a previous expedition. Upon landing on the celestial body, the astronauts make a terrifying discovery ...
notes: Science fiction in the wake of "Alien". With the participation of Klaus Kinski who shines in the grayness of the cast.

title: The Scalphunters
actors: Burt Lancaster, Ossie Davis, Telly Savalas, Shelley Winters
description: Hunter Joe Bass is stolen from the Indians all the hides he intended to sell and, in exchange, he is left with a black slave, Joseph Lee. Joe wants to take back the stolen goods, so he gives life to his personal "treasure hunt" which will be full of unexpected events and pitfalls, so much so that he will risk leaving his own skin several times.
notes: An ironic and original western. To remember the finale, with Lancaster and Savalas in the desert, and again Lancaster with Ossie Davis in the mud.

title: Cracker Jack
actors: Thomas Ian Griffith, Nastassja Kinski, Christopher Plummer
description: Jack, a Chicago cop, just escaped a bombing in which his wife and child were killed. Having entered into a depressive crisis, he goes, in the company of his brother and sister-in-law, to a tourist resort in the Rocky Mountains for a holiday. Here he has to contend with a group of mercenaries who intend to eliminate a mafia boss to steal a treasure in diamonds. Originality is banned. Between shootings, attacks, Mafia bosses in crisis of conscience, plots and massacres announced, the hero arrives as expected who also takes the opportunity to dispel the ghosts of his past. A little sorry that Nastassja Kinski got lost in these productions.

title: The Unnamable
actors: Charles King, Mark Kinsey Stephenson, Mark Parra, Alexandra Durrell
