description: Joel, Randolph and Howard, three college student friends, want to discover the secret of an old country house, abandoned for centuries. Joel enters it first, but does not come out alive. The same fate awaits two couples who take refuge unaware in the house. Finally, Randolph and Howard bravely enter the mansion and manage to neutralize the bloodthirsty "creature" that inhabits it.
notes: The film is an adaptation of a Lovecraft tale, with decidedly splatter accents. Despite the illustrious literary authorship, it does not offer memorable implications.

title: Rage
actors: Gary Daniels, Jillian McWhirter, Fiona Hutchison, Kenneth Tigar
description: A bakery was burned to the ground. The boy is contacted by a businessman, who offers him to confess the crime, promising him twenty-five thousand dollars. In reality the person responsible is the son of the latter, who acted in the grip of love madness. The boy agrees, but the matter becomes complicated because first the owner of the bakery and then his wife "confess" ... A bizarre comedy, which brings together disparate references. The cast is also rather anomalous and the director (from television, making his big screen debut) has his work cut out not to lose control of a complicated situation.

title: The Power Within
actors: Ted Jan Roberts, William Zabka, Karen Valentine
description: Stan Dryer, a normal high school student, one day meets a mysterious old man named Master Yung. Before dying, he gives him the mysterious "Ring of Power". With this jewel, Stan realizes that he has inherited from Yung magical powers that never in life would have dreamed of receiving a day as a gift. The less pleasant side of it is that now he has to contend with the evil Vonn, who owns the other twin ring. To get him, Vonn also kidnaps his girlfriend. Stan loses the ring, but still manages to get the better of and defeat the villain. Action scenes galore, filming a pure video clip style, a touch of oriental mysticism that never hurts, a comic book villain; all grafted into the usual, stereotyped American postcard high school environment. The recipe for the film is all here.

title: Prophecy
actors: Robert Foxworth, Talia Shire, Armand Assante, Richard Dysant
description: The heads of a paper mill set up in a Maine forest to store the logs cut to make paper pour a poisonous substance into the water. This substance changes the nature of the fish in the ponds, and - by eating it - the local Indians are especially victims of it. They are listed as responsible for the disasters, but the investigation conducted by a couple of their friends uncovers the truth. An ecological adventure that deals with too many themes at once; better then the twists and turns of pure action and the use of magnificent natural backgrounds.

title: The Manitou
actors: Tony Curtis, Susan Strasberg, Michael Ansara
description: The growth that appeared on Karin's neck does not hide a tumor, but a fetus. Her lover, a passionate spiritist, discovers that the girl is possessed by a centuries-old Indian demon. The ingredients are the same as the "Exorcist", the result is much less convincing.

title: Street Knight
actors: Jeff Speakman, Christopher Neame, Lewis Van Bergen, Jennifer Gatti
description: Jake hasn't recovered since, in his role as a cop, he unintentionally caused the death of a girl. Now Jake is a mechanic by trade, but the world of crime won't leave him alone. A new fight between gangs of thugs forces him to come out. He will discover that behind it all is a paramilitary organization run by a psychopath named Franklin. This is not a movie, it is an anthology of stereotypes. The result, however, is not unwatchable and Magnoli's direction is not too weak either. But if Richard Friedman (the screenwriter) had come up with at least an original idea ...

title: Nightflyers
actors: Catherine Mary Stewart, Michael Praed, John Standing
description: A professor organizes a scientific expedition to study a strange galaxy but, during the journey, the spaceship wants to eliminate its own occupants. Science fiction with psychoanalytic claims.

title: Malone
actors: Burt Reynolds, Cynthia Gibb, Scott Wilson, Cliff Robertson
description: By accident, former CIA agent Malone learns of a speculator who is violently driving away landowners in a region of Oregon. He understands that there is something big underneath: it is in fact a plot that aims to replace local politicians with others of far more undemocratic ideas. Although Malone also finds himself up against his former colleagues, he manages to foil the plot.
notes: In this western in modern clothes Burt Reynolds has the opportunity, despite the years that inevitably pass, to bring out all his determination. It is a pity that Cokliss, former author of "Il giorno della luna nera", is unable to provide a direction that goes beyond pure profession.

title: BrainWaves
actors: Tony Curtis, Keir Dullea, Suzanna Love, Vera Miles, Ryan Seitz
description: Falling into a coma after a car accident, Kaylie is reanimated by electronically transferring brain waves taken from the brain of a newly dead woman. The operation seems to be successful, but in a dream the girl begins to relive the donor's last days, thus discovering that the woman has been the victim of a murder. The deceased's mind increasingly takes control of her body, while the killer is on her trail.
notes: Here is how the old myth of Frankenstein is dusted off thanks to the miracles of electronics, the queen of modern special effects. From the director of _Tenerezza del lupo_.

title: Quiet Cool
actors: James Remar, Adam Coleman Howard, Daphne Ashbrook, Nick Cassavetes
description: A New York policeman is on the trail of an illegal marijuana grower active in the United States After a series of laborious investigations, he must leave for the West. On the trail of her man, he reaches California, but here is someone who is waiting for him with certainly not friendly intentions ...
notes: A film as stupid as its plot.

title: Breaker! Breaker!
actors: Chuck Norris, George Murdock, Terry O'Connor
description: The story begins with an intervention by the traffic police; some agents stop a young truck driver and challenge him for a series of infractions, of which the victim turns out to be innocent. The aim is only to extort money from him. He tries to escape, but they catch up with him, beat him up and make him disappear. The brother will think about playing the devil until he finds him again. Do you know the expressiveness of Chuck Norris at its best? Here he was a beginner, be warned. As for the film: action movie of the lowest rank that also claims to want to make comedy. Like an elephant in a crystal shop.

title: Testament
actors: Jane Alexander, William Devane, Ross Harris, Rebecca De Mornay
description: A day like any other in the city of Hamlin, until a blinding light marks the beginning of the atomic holocaust. The Wetherly family is made up of parents and three children: the father will never return from work. What the explosion did not do was done by radiation. People die like flies; of the Wetherly the mother and a child will remain to await the end, with courage and dignity.
notes: The documentary origins of director Lynne Littman allow her to avoid any spectacular complacency. At the same time, however, the film does not find the right narrative breath; the story remains fragmented and tainted by easy sentimentality.

title: The Deerslayer
actors: Lex Barker, Rita Moreno, Forrest Tucker
description: The adventures of a young white man raised by the Mohicans, who with his friend Cingagook and Harry, a nomadic trader, finds himself fighting against the ferocious Hurons. Taken from James Fenimore Cooper's novel "The Last of the Mohicans", but without much originality and inspiration.

title: Halloween II
actors: Donald Pleasence, Jamie Lee Curtis, Charles Cyphers
description: Mike, the Killer of the first "Halloween", although wounded by the eight gunshots fired at him by Dr. Loomis, resumes his murders. In the hunt for the killer, a boy dies in the stake of two cars, then the action is concentrated in the clinic where Michael's sister is hospitalized. The name of John Carpenter remains, director of the first episode to whom he owes his fame, but only as co-writer and author of the music, interesting in their contamination. Here the modest rookie Rosenthal directs.

title: Jubal
actors: Glenn Ford, Ernest Borgnine, Felicia Farr, Rod Steiger, Valerie French
description: Jubal is a skilled and experienced cowboy who, having won the friendship of a ranchero, becomes his right hand. But the boss's wife falls in love with him and the trouble begins. Western jealousy drama, solidly directed by a master of the genre, and with a first-rate cast.

title: Geronimo
actors: Wes Studi, Jason Patric, Gene Hackman, Robert Duvall, Matt Damon, Rodney A. Grant, Kevin Tighe, Steve Revis, Carlos Palomino, Victor Aaron
description: In 1886, now alone with thirty-five Ciricahua Apaches to fight against a few thousand light cavalrymen of the United States Army, Geronimo surrenders: "Do what you want with me." The film reconstructs the last year of the epic, desperate resistance of the Native American warriors before the surrender, in a narrative filtered through the eyes of the young Lieutenant Gatewood, fresh from West Point. "Dances with wolves" has given new life to a genre, that of the "good" Indians, which seemed now extinct, but Walter Hill's film lacks warmth in its making, too sensitive to stylistic affectation and not very exciting.

title: Heart of Darkness
actors: John Malkovich, Tim Roth, Isaach De Bankolé, James Fox
description: On behalf of a Belgian traffic and transport company, Marlow (Roth) goes up the Congo River to get to the Internal Station, the one managed by Kurtz (Malkovich). Kurtz's name, even for Marlow who is the latest addition, is like a legend. The latest news about him is vague, patchy and disturbing. Maybe it's hiding large quantities of ivory or maybe it's dead. This is the film that Orson Welles wanted to make and that Coppola instead made it calling it "Apocalypse now". Roeg adapts it for TV correctly but without big flights. Too bad because the cast promised.

title: The Breaking Point
actors: John Garfield, Patricia Neal, Phyllis Taxter, Wallace Ford
description: Harry Morgan (Garfield) makes a living in Newport, California by ferrying tourists on his boat. One day he takes a certain Hannagan to Mexico, but he disappears on arrival before paying. Without a penny, Harry doesn't know how to get home and so he agrees to illegally transport eight Chinese to the American shores. And this is only the beginning of his troubles.
notes: Second version of Hemingway's famous novel "To have and not to have" (or, if you like, remake of "Waters of the South" by Hawks). We no longer have Bogart or even Bacall who proved he can whistle and sing, but Garfield, in his latest film for Warner, is extraordinary and the direction of Curtiz is in perfect balance between the realism of the outsiders and the spirit of adventure. The ending is memorable.

title: Happy Birthday To Me
actors: Glenn Ford, Melissa Sue Anderson, Sharon Hacker, Frances Hyland
description: Virginia Wainwright studies at Crawford Academy, but it's not all in her head. After the accident in which her mother was killed, Virginia recovered from the brain trauma, but from the moment some of her schoolmates are found killed, the situation has become dire. Virginia then enlisted the help of Dr. David Faraday (Glenn Ford) with even more bloody results.
notes: If the term "craftsman" did not exist, it would have to be invented for Lee Thompson (and not just in a good way). Glenn Ford in the post "Halloween" environment is like a fish out of water. Perhaps it is for a jolt of dignity that he gets killed before the end.

title: Hard Justice
actors: David Bradley, Charles Napier, Yuji Okumoto
description: The story begins with the brave agent Nick Adams who narrowly lets the dangerous Jimmy Wong escape during a robbery. Later, after his best friend is killed during a prison investigation, Nick gets imprisoned undercover to find out about the weapons trafficking in which Wong is still involved. The clashes take place to reach a real final battle. It is a non-stop action film, held with some verve by director Greg Yaitanes. There are no stars in the cast, but cinephiles will not fail to recognize Charles Napier, effective in the role of the sadistic warden of the prison.

title: Stone Cold
actors: Brian Bosworth, Lance Henriksen, William Forsythe
description: A policeman, Joe Huff, suspended from service for insubordination, witnesses a shooting in a supermarket caused by some thugs on motorcycles. Jeff reacts and takes out the thugs. At this point the FBI forces him to infiltrate the gang where he enters the graces of the grim boss, Chains, and falls in love with Nancy, his woman. This, however, will betray him by revealing his true identity ...
notes: Unsuccessful attempt to throw former American football champion Brian Bosworth, a blonde with a square jaw but with a dull expression, into the cinema. Discreetly shoot the numerous chase sequences and endless shootings.

title: I, Madman
actors: Jenny Wright, Clayton Rohner, Randall William Cook, Stephanie Hodge
description: The insane psychopath Dr. Kessler haunts Virginia, an admirer of her horror novels. But he will be devoured by his son, a hideous creature resulting from his insane plans. Winner of the specialized festival of Avoriaz, he has all the ingredients to satisfy the lovers of the genre, but lacks particularly original ideas.

title: Wyatt Earp
actors: Kevin Costner, Dennis Quaid, Gene Hackman, Isabella Rossellini, Tom Sizemore
description: The Earps had originally been settlers. While studying law, Wyatt plans to stay in Missouri and start a family with the woman he has married and has loved since childhood. When his wife dies of typhus, his life changes forever. It is his father who shakes him from his torpor by calling him back to his duties towards his brothers. Wyatt starts a new life again. Until the famous duel at the Ok Corral in which the Earps challenge the Clanton and McLaury.
notes: It is rare to see a Hollywood movie in a big way and with big names with such modest results. A boredom equal only to the sense of uselessness and helplessness of those who have found a broken toy in their hands. Costner is also overwhelmed in the enterprise.

title: Rob Roy
actors: Liam Neeson, Jessica Lange, Tim Roth, John Hurt, Eric Stoltz
description: Rob Roy works as a livestock guard for a marquis, but decides to go on his own. He therefore asks the Marquis for a thousand pounds on loan and gets them at usurer interest. The money, however, is immediately robbed by a penniless bastard of the nobility. The debt would be canceled if Rob Roy agreed to testify against another noble, suspected of plotting for the restoration of the Stuarts. But he is not there.
notes: The background (class struggle and exchange of the elites) ends up prevailing over a character tied to traditional warrior values. Caton-Jones is Scottish, therefore sensitive to the myth of Rob Roy. His work, sometimes redundant, but always diligent, was liked overseas. In Europe less.

title: Tribute to a Bad Man
actors: James Cagney, Irene Papas, Don Dubbins, Lee Van Cleef, Stephen McNally
description: Jeremy Rodock (Cagney), a Wyoming horse breeder, hides a generous heart under his hard and vengeful rind. The girl he wants is a little hard to understand.
notes: More than the development of the story itself, the gloomy description of life in the Old West convinces. First American film for Irene Papas.

title: Message to Garcia
actors: Wallace Beery, Barbara Stanwyck, John Boles, Alan Hale, Mona Barrie
description: In 1898, during the Cuban revolt against Spain, the United States sent a secret message to the general who commands the rebels. Assorted adversities.
notes: Discreet bow of a historical fact, shot in comedy cadences with gritty stars.

title: The Shadow
actors: Alec Baldwin, John Lone, Penelope Ann Miller, Peter Boyle
description: Lamont Craston is apparently a bored New York billionaire. To tell the truth, in ancient times he had been a tyrannical Tibetan baron with magical powers, however, brought back to the right path by a holy man. Now he's moved to New York and wanders around the city at night, using his prodigious powers to right wrongs as the Shadow Man.
notes: A well-known, typed and encoded character from his previous media incarnations is picked up and fed into the special effects blender. It is one of the most used systems by Hollywood to package a product that aims for success. Too bad that in the meantime much of the verve that characterized the original from the 1930s has been lost.

title: Three Godfathers
actors: John Wayne, Pedro Armendariz, Harry Carey jr., Ward Bond
description: On the run across the desert after a hit, some outlaws come across a woman in labor who, dying, entrusts them with the newborn. The three, who became godparents, promised the woman that they would take care of the baby. In fact, they embark on a tiring and endless journey across the desert to bring the little one to the city. Two of them will die during the journey but the third will succeed.
notes: It is one of the most unusual films of the great director. It is a sort of hymn to religiosity that makes the story a parable of the nativity of Christ (the three bandits are the Magi) and of the journey an itinerary towards redemption. The film is dedicated to Harry Carey. Epic, colorful and fantastic.

title: Song of the South
actors: James Baskett, Bobby Driscoll, Luana Patten, Hattie McDaniel
description: Little Johnny meets Uncle Tom, an old black man who knows the art of storytelling. The two become friends and, to every difficulty that Johnny encounters in life, Uncle Tom responds with a story that exemplifies his moral. Produced by Walt Disney, the film is interspersed with animation clips (directed by Wilfred Jacjson) with Brother Bunny, Compare Bear and Comare Volpe, which remain the best. Oscar for best song.

title: Time cop
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Ron Silver, Mia Sara
description: It's the year 2004. Time travel has become a reality and with it a new sort of criminal has emerged. Suddenly it is possible to alter historical events, control the financial markets or even bring entire nations to ruin. So the Time Control Commission issues one simple law: no one goes back. But today someone has broken the law and Max Walker, known as Timecop, embarks on a tough manhunt, tempted to prevent his own personal tragedy: the murder of his wife. The time travel topoi are all there; but more than originality in temporal paradoxes, the action firmly managed by a professional like Hyams counts.

title: The Princess Bride
actors: Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Mandy Patinkin, Billy Crystal, Peter Falk
description: Grandfather reads to Jimmy, in bed with the flu, the fairy tale of the beautiful Princess Bottondoro, in love with her faithful servant Westley. Come and go between reality and fantasy, duels and spells. The irony and the sure hand of Reiner, who tells a metaphorical story of growth in an intelligent fairy tale, make everything truly "magical". From a William Goldman novel, adapted from the same.

title: The Sea Wolf
actors: Charles Bronson, Christopher Reeve, Catherine Mary Stewart
description: Adventure of Christopher Reeve and Catherine Mary Stuart kidnapped aboard the fishing boat commanded by a sadist Charles Bronson.
notes: Modest television adaptation of a London novel. In Michael Curtiz's beautiful 1941 film of the same name, Robinson gave one of his best performances as the crazy captain. In general, however, between the two creations there is the same difference in class and style that passes between that great gentleman of the screen that was Robinson and that Bronson chard.

title: Bad Girls
actors: Andie MacDowell, Drew Barrymore, Mary Stuart Masterson, Madeleine Stowe, James LeGros
description: Cody, Anita, Eileen and Lilly work in the same brothel. One day the sheriff disrespects Anita and Cody snorts him. Forced to flee, the four girls head to the bank where Cody keeps his life's savings. But the same idea was also had by Kid Jarret, an old flame of Cody, who has no account in his name, but has a gun. Cody does not give up and leaves with her friends in search of Jarret.
notes: The idea of ??"Bad Girls" is in itself a good one and the cast, made up of discreet actresses without the presence of prima donnas, arouses some preventive curiosity. The script, the direction and the direction of the actors are, however, disconcerting, bordering on parody.

title: The Specialist
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Sharon Stone, James Woods, Rod Steiger
description: May Munro is obsessed with avenging her parents' deaths. Death caused, when she was a child, by the Leon clan, a family of Latin American criminals headed by Joe, instigator of the murder, and by his son Tomas. May manages to convince Ray Quick, a former CIA agent specializing in explosives, to brush up on her qualities to help her out. The two carry out revenge and end up loving each other. Only Ned Trent, former colleague of Ray and now on the side of the Leon, turns out to be a tough nut to crack. Bombs and sex with "Rambo" Stallone and the sensual Sharon Stone, but the film is very obvious.

title: Super Mario Bros
actors: Bob Hoskins, John Leguizamo, Dennis Hopper, Samantha Mathis
description: Millions of years ago the fall of a meteorite opened a chasm, in which lives a world parallel to ours, where New York is now. A young paleontologist tries to stop a building speculation in order to continue digging under Manhattan. But, over there, there is the tyrant King Koopa, and it is against him that the plumber Mario Mario and his brother Luigi Mario fight.
notes: For the transition from video games to cinema Super Mario was gifted with a brother. Despite the technical skill and the amount of citations from video games, the film remains a disarming obviousness. Dennis Hopper is, of course, the villain.

title: Speed
actors: Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, Sandra Bullock, Jeff Daniels
description: There is a bomber threatening to put the city on fire. The first shot tempts him with the lift of a skyscraper, but Jack Traven, a skilled police officer, promptly intervenes to avert the massacre. Then it's the turn of a bus, packed with explosives and with a detonator that will explode if the vehicle drops below eighty miles per hour. But Traven still arrives to resolve the situation, also thanks to the help of the pretty driver.
notes: "Speed" does not leave a moment of respite to the spectator or the protagonists. The graph of narrative tension is always very high. Like the speedometer hand that must never go below that certain threshold.

title: Ride, Vaquero
actors: Robert Taylor, Ava Gardner, Howard Keel, Anthony Quinn
description: After the civil war, King Cameron and his wife settle in New Mexico and suffer the raids of groups of natives turned into bandits. Among them there is one, named Rio, which attracts the attention of Mrs. Cameron. Western without vigor, he manages to almost completely neutralize the group of stars who play him.

title: Waterworld
actors: Kevin Costner, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Dennis Hopper, Tina Majorino
description: We are in the future, the polar ice caps have melted and the earth is covered with water. The inhabitants dream of a mythical place called Dryland (dry land). The men who survived built strange islands for themselves, threatened by gangs of raiders. A lone hero fights the fierce pirate leader, the Deacon, and goes in search of a new life accompanied by a beautiful woman and a mysterious girl.
notes: Pure action, lots of irony and insightful jokes that never forget the present reality. Kevin Reynolds' work was briefly the most expensive in the history of cinema with its 175 million dollars (used for numerous underwater special effects): then came "Titanic". The photography is by Dean Semler and the music by James Newton Howard. Costner plays the unpleasant hero, but in the end he is the usual unblemished and fearless knight.

title: Judge Dredd
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Armand Assante, Diane Lane
description: In the third millennium, what remains of humanity lives barricaded in megalopolises dominated by violence. To maintain order, a caste of judges-executioners with the power of immediate execution, equipped with personalized weapons on their vocal waves. At Megacity Uno, born out of the rubble of New York, this system is complicated by corruption. But there is a judge who is capable of fighting for the Law and Justice and determined to do so: Joseph Dredd.
notes: As usual, without a glimmer of expressiveness, Stallone here embodies a hyper-technological Rambo dressed in Versace, in an all-action film that wants to recall the "Blade Runner" in the settings without succeeding. Based on a hugely popular comic in England, the film does not come out of that dimension and only works in action scenes. When, on the other hand, he pretends to make the characters speak, the ridicule explodes: the question remains whether it is voluntary or not.

title: First Knight
actors: Sean Connery, Richard Gere, Julia Ormond, Ben Cross
description: In the golden city of Camelot, the charm of the knight Lancelot disrupts the union of Guinevere and King Arthur. Surrounded by fame as an adventurer, Lancelot embodies independence and freedom. Its opposition to the figure of Arthur, symbol of wisdom and the common good, exerts a dangerous fascination on the future queen Guinevere.
notes: The dilemma of the betrothed, divided between two strong and attractive men and torn between passion and a sense of duty, is the fulcrum of the umpteenth cinematic transposition of the epic. But Zucker, a specialist in demented, makes a pompous and vulgar film.

title: Congo
actors: Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Ernie Hudson, Tim Curry, Grant Heslov
description: Monkey scholar Peter Elliot organizes a trip to Congo to bring his extraordinary gorilla back to the jungle, which has the peculiarity of talking to humans. The scholar joins an expedition sent by an American company in search of a diamond deposit. Amidst mysteries and lost cities, adventurers will discover that they are the endangered species in Congo ...
notes: The story is taken, a little too freely, from a good novel by Michael Crichton, a brilliant author, prolific and abundantly exploited by the cinema: those who had wondered why this work had never been used for the screen, not even now have been satisfied given the low level of the result. Great display of means but few found really up to the intentions:

title: Mowgli
actors: Jason Scott Lee, Lena Headey, Sam Neill, John Cleese
description: Northwest India, 1871. A caravan crossing the lush tropical forest is attacked by the ferocious tiger Shere Khan. Little Mowgli, son of the Indian guide, gets lost and is believed dead. He will grow up in the jungle with his panther friend Bagheera, the bear Baloo and a pack of wolves. In the world of animals, everything is simple and natural to deal with, even enemies. Difficulties begin when he comes back in contact with humans ...
notes: What sustains this Disney superproduction, shot on four continents, is above all the animalist element: the creatures of the jungle are magnificent, they are so tender and shine for their naturalness in the midst of a cast of slightly awkward humans (apart from the very good John Cleese in the part of Dr. Plumford). The two previous versions, the '42 one and the '67 animated one, were much more fascinating and fun. Here remain the beauty and accuracy of the scenography and a certain naive naivete that guarantees the show for families. Director Stephen Sommers, who really isn't that great, is the same director who wrote and directed "The Mummy", a huge (surprisingly) hit.

title: Man or Gun
actors: Macdonald Carey, Audrey Totter, James Craig, James Gleason, Warren Stevens
description: Everyone wants Smith's precision pistol, even at the cost of killing him. He refuses to use it except in self-defense and has to defend himself quite often, even from the advances of the rich and beautiful Fran. Series B production, with an unpretentious but rather lively plot.

title: Mortal Kombat
actors: Christopher Lambert, Linden Ashby, Talisa Soto, Trevor Goddard
description: In the realm of Outworld a tournament decides (once for each generation) the fate of the Earth. For nine generations Shang Tsung, an evil priest who feeds on the strength of rival warriors killed in combat, has ensured primacy to one of his proteges. This time two men and a woman assisted by a holy man are called to avert the danger.
notes: Quick reflexes, medieval science fiction costumes, a great display of martial arts, special effects galore; accompanied by pounding music and pseudo-philosophical amenities, waiting for the final "game over". We see that the film is based on a famous video game.

title: My Science Project
actors: John Stockwell, Danielle von Zerneck, Dennis Hopper, Fisher Stevens, Richard Masur
description: Michael Harlan is a little boy who, rummaging through materials abandoned by the army, finds something that, when properly set up, allows you to travel through time. His science teacher tries the car and comes back looking hallucinated in a cowboy outfit. Final with battle between Cleopatra, Godzilla, Neanderthals, gladiators and Nazis.
notes: The idea is nice but it gets pretty weak as the movie goes on. But Hopper is always an imposing figure and his return from the fourth dimension is still worth seeing. Jonathan Bethuel keeps the pace high and you couldn't ask for more.

title: Evolver
actors: Ethan Randall, Cassidy Rae, Nassira Nicola, Chance Quinn
description: Kyle Baxter (Randall) is one of the best players in the country of the video game "Evolver". Kyle Baxter is fourteen and can't resist the temptation to play a new robotic version of his favorite video game. The problem is that this is a special version, designed by the military to fight terrorist groups. A version programmed to win at all costs. Halfway between virtual reality and political thriller, Mark Rosman's film is actually neither. The special effects are the usual and, as for the political side, the ambitions do not go much beyond the standard of the action film.

title: Final Round
actors: Anthony DeLongis, Lorenzo Lamas, Kathleen Kinmont
description: Tyler Verdiccio is a tough guy and can't go unnoticed. Someone notices it during a fight in a bar, but the admiration is not disinterested and the consequences are unpleasant. Tyler is in fact kidnapped together with his girlfriend and taken to a former industrial complex transformed into an arena. Here he will have to fight in televised challenges for a multi-million dollar betting circuit. Lorenzo Lamas has earned a prominent place in the hypermuscular category, but the film is soporific.

title: One-Eyed Jacks
actors: Marlon Brando, Karl Malden, Pina Pellicer, Katy Jurado
description: The police surround two bandits who have carried out yet another robbery: Dad (Malden) manages to escape, Rio (Brando) is captured. Five years later, released from prison, Rio finds his former partner who has passed on the other side of the fence: he is a sheriff, he is married and has a stepdaughter, Louisa. And by seducing this young woman, Rio takes the first step on the road to her revenge.
notes: Marlon Brando splits: he is the protagonist but also the director of the film (which was to be directed by Kubrick). A narcissistic director, who exaggerates with close-ups of himself as an actor, but nevertheless creates an ambiguous, anomalous and anti-moralistic western.

title: Under Siege II
actors: Steven Seagal, Eric Bogosian, Everett McGill, Katherine Heigl, Patrick Kilpatrick
description: A former Pentagon employee, psychotic tech whiz, hijacked the Grand Continental. America's most luxurious train is now on a breathtaking ride through the Rocky Mountains. They threaten to raze Washington and the surrounding area using the satellite designed for the government by the former official before being removed from office. The lives of more than three million people are in their hands, and to "pardon" them they are asking for a billion dollars. But they haven't reckoned with ex-cook Casey Ryback ...
notes: True to tradition, Steven Seagal doesn't let a glimmer of expression cross his face for the duration of the film.

title: Casper
actors: Christina Ricci, Bill Pullman, Cathy Moriarty, Eric Idle, Garette Ratliff Henson
description: In Friendship, Maine, there is a castle which contains a treasure and which appears to be inhabited by ghosts. When the scheming Carrigan gets his hands on the property he inherited, he hires a ghost hunter to get rid of the bulky presences. Dr. Harvey then enters the castle accompanied by his daughter Kat. Waiting for them they find Casper, a kind ghost (especially with Kat) of a child who died at twelve, but also his three weird and dirty uncles: Molla, Ciccia and Puzza, who do not intend to interrupt a tradition of bullying and spite.
notes: Casper, a tender and melancholy ghost born in the 1940s, talks, shows emotions and can even earn a couple of hours of life "in the flesh" and dance a languid slow with Kat. However, the most striking part of the film is obviously the pyrotechnic, chaotic and wonderful part of the special effects, the marghingegni, the comic stunts. Look at it: the production is signed by Spielberg.

title: White Lightning
actors: Burt Reynolds, Jennifer Billingsley, Ned Beatty, Bo Hopkins, R. G. Armstrong
description: McKlusky is in prison for smuggling. He attempts to escape to avenge the killing of his brother by a corrupt sheriff. The police then make an agreement with him: they will break him out if McKlusky agrees to infiltrate the gang which also includes the corrupt sheriff, Connors, to expose him. So it happens but Connors suspects McKlusky who, only after a spectacular escape, manages to get rid of his men and crash the car with the sheriff into a lake.
notes: The tenaciously pursued theme of revenge, at the cost of all suffering, is not new to cinema. Here it is embroidered on it a little roughly and without too much vivacity.

title: Invitation to Hell
actors: Robert Urich, Joanna Cassidy, Susan Lucci
description: The myth of Faust revisited and modernized, which transforms the original alchemist into a space scientist and the Mephistopheles, who undermines his soul, into a provocative female (Lucci). Unconvincing TV movie, not up to par with other excellent direction by Wes Craven ("Nightmare").

title: Desperado
actors: Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Quentin Tarantino, Joaquim De Almeida, Steve Buscemi
description: The mariachi is a somewhat peculiar gunslinger who goes around with guns and guitar and clashes with an infamous criminal linked to Mexican drug bosses, Bucho. With the help of his best friend and an attractive girl, he manages to emerge victorious from the fight. Creating his own handful of "desperados" and leaving behind a trail of bullets and blood.
notes: After "El Mariachi" in 1992, shot by Rodriguez with little money and a lot of inventiveness, in 1995 comes "Desperado", which, however, is a remake more than a sequel: with a more substantial budget, brighter colors, more famous actors; but also, unfortunately, a much more obvious trend. Have fun, drag, but it's already seen stuff.

title: Species
actors: Ben Kingsley, Forest Whitaker, Natasha Henstridge, Michael Madsen, Alfred Molina, Marg Helgenberger, Michelle Williams
description: Twenty years have passed since a radio telescope sent information about the Earth and the DNA of human cells into space. From an unknown elsewhere a DNA sequence arrives in a terrestrial laboratory with instructions for combining it with the human one. A presumptuous scientist attempts the experiment: the result is a female creature that grows with monstrous speed. The beautiful girl is actually a hideous alien, who escapes to Los Angeles and from there prepares the extraterrestrial invasion.
notes: Genre films but with a solid structure, with a balanced cast and effective special effects without being confusing.

title: Cutthroat Island
actors: Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella, Maury Chaykin
description: Morgan is the beautiful and daring daughter of a pirate, a worthy follower of her father's footsteps. At a slave auction he buys William, a charming adventurer, with whom he sets out in search of a secret treasure buried on Cutthroad Island. The treasure map, however, is partly found on the shaved head of an old pirate, while another piece is in the possession of a dangerous filibuster. Between duels, deceptions, chases, there will also be time for love to blossom.
notes: Renny Harlin ("Cliffhanger", "Die Hard 2") stages spectacular adventures to the glory of his wife Geena Davis, with great special effects and a subtle ironic streak in the most daring stunts. However, the skirmishes are taken for granted, as is the end of the game. Pleasant for lovers of the genre and for Davis fans.

title: Jumanji
actors: Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bradley Pierce, Bonnie Hunt
description: Jumanji is a magical board game of ancient origin. Its peculiarity is that when someone starts it, their whole life is invaded until the game comes to an end: however, few have finished one, and even fewer have started a second. In 1969, Alan and Sarah come across the game and roll the dice: Alan is sucked into the surreal world of Jumanji and remains trapped there for twenty-six years. When he finally breaks free, he has to find Sarah for the game to be over ...
notes: Johnston is truly a magician in handling special effects: it is a pity that the same cannot be said of his skills as a director.

title: Tarzan, the Ape Man
actors: Johnny Weissmuller, Maureen O'Sullivan, Neil Hamilton
description: Jane Parker has reached her father in Africa who, at the head of an expedition, wants to discover the elephant cemetery. The woman is kidnapped by Tarzan, falls in love with him, but is unable to make friends with his fellow countrymen. Tarzan saves the explorers from a pygmy attack. Jane's father finally discovers the elephant graveyard and then dies. Jane then decides to stay in Africa with Tarzan.
notes: First film version of the famous character, played by swimming champion John Weissmuller. Fidelity to the original novel is weak, but the show is guaranteed; it is the birth certificate of one of the most fortunate myths of cinema.

title: One Foot in Hell
actors: Alan Ladd, Dan O'Herlihy, Don Murray, Dolores Michaels
description: Mitch Barret tried to treat his seriously ill wife, but the village pharmacist denied him a medicine that Mitch didn't have the money to pay, and the woman died. At this point, a sense of revenge against everything and everyone is triggered in the protagonist, which will lead him to become a ferocious criminal. The accurate setting and the presence of Ladd guarantee an average product

title: Strange Days
actors: Ralph Fiennes, Angela Bassett, Juliette Lewis, Tom Sizemore
description: Los Angeles, December 31, 1999. Racial and social tensions are reaching their limits. The new drug is the squid, a vector of artificial memory: a kind of cd player allows you to relive your own experiences or those of others in the most realistic way. Lenny Nero is one of the highest rated squid dealers. Coming into possession of a disk with evidence of the murder of a black leader by white cops, Lenny must decide whether to go public with what he knows.
notes: The talented Bigelow talks about a livid and disturbing world, in which tension is photographed, not invented; and evil arises from our real impulses, from a desire for emotions that overcomes voyeurism to become an unbridled appropriation of experience. The final sequence, on the party at the end of the millennium, has a remarkable visual power.

title: Fluke
actors: Matthew Modine, Eric Stoltz, Nancy Travis, Colin Willcox, Max Pomeranc
description: A car accident prematurely kills the life of a young man. The poor man is reincarnated in Fluke, a mutt with a tawny fur. Now it is a question of finding the widow and the orphan and of communicating with them. Difficult undertaking: only the boy immediately accepts the truth; the mother, on the other hand, considers the dog's behavior simply bizarre, which, among other things, proves jealous towards the friend who is "comforting" her ...
notes: Bittersweet and slightly puerile tale for cinephiles and children: a cascade of molasses played on the dog's sympathy and good feelings, with a spot montage, many "four-legged" shots and discreet special effects.

title: The Last Elephant
actors: Isabella Rossellini, John Lithgow, James Earl Jones, Tony Todd
description: Ecologist Maria Di Conti (Rossellini) is in Kenya trying to defend elephants from poachers when photographer Liz Page arrives in the area, sent there by a writer in the mood for local color. Liz witnesses a pachyderm massacre, takes pictures and then disappears. At that point the writer, Robert Carter (Lithgow), feels compelled to go find her. What he discovers is horrible.
notes: The "daughter of art" is not the only trouble with this film for television, tourist, right-thinking and false.

title: Broken Arrow
actors: John Travolta, Christian Slater, Samantha Mathis, Delroy Lindo
description: Vic and Riley are two friends, also linked by work. They are in fact expert military pilots and have been assigned a delicate mission: they have to test the B3 Stealth bomber, a new aviation vehicle with two nuclear warheads. But someone has betrayed, and the missile called "Broken Arrow" is lost. Vic and Riley are involved in blackmail, but ...
notes: Great start, with the camera that falls from the top towards the ring. It would like to be the metaphor of the film: two friends armed against each other. Yet "Broken Arrow" fails to rise above average. It wouldn't be bad if the director wasn't John Woo.

title: Wilder Napalm
actors: Debra Winger, Dennis Quaid, Arliss Howard, M. Emmet Walsh
description: The Wilder brothers and Wallace Foudroyant both had the gift of Mother Nature to stir up fire with the power of thought alone. While Wilder does not exploit this gift of his, Wallace uses it in a comic circus number: and when, after years of separation, the two reunite, their relationship ... sparks (Wallace's passion is also involved. for Wilder's wife) ...
notes: Along with the grotesque, even the fantastic genre is one of the most dangerous to face: the always lurking risk is to trivialize some idea theoretically heralding good results in the realization. As it happened with this _Triangle of fire_.

title: Critical Decision
actors: Kurt Russell, Steven Seagal, Oliver Platt, John Leguizamo
description: A 747 headed for Washington is hijacked by an Islamic terrorist. David Grant, an American intelligence officer expert in international terrorism, understands the criminal's true intent: to detonate a lethal load of nerve gas on Washington. So you have to decide whether to endanger the lives of thousands of people by landing the plane, or whether to sacrifice four hundred passengers by blowing it up. But there is a third solution: "hook up" the 747 at an altitude of eight thousand meters and secretly transfer on board a group of experts who solve the situation "in their own way" ... The saraband of incredible twists is not convincing . All in all, the older "Airport" movies were nicer. The political motivations of the terrorists are curious, crude and primitive as rarely seen in the cinema.

title: Twelve Monkeys
actors: Bruce Willis, Brad Pitt, Madeleine Stowe, Christopher Plummer, David Morse, Frank Gorshin, Joey Perillo, Lisa Gay Hamilton, Jon Seda, Christopher Meloni
description: In 2035, the survivors of mankind live in an underground world. Ninety-nine percent of the population no longer exists and the earth's surface is now uninhabitable after the terrible 1996 epidemic. As survival is increasingly precarious, a group of scientists seeks to realize the last hope: travel back in time and recover. the resources of the past to save the future.
notes: Freely inspired by Chris Marker's "La Jetée", the film takes up the tradition of the "philosophical" journey through time and through the self-destructive impulses of humanity, adding the strength of macabre laughter and a taste for paradoxical vision.

title: Star Trek: Voyager
actors: Kate Mulgrew, Robert Duncan McNeil
description: Voyager is the most modern ship in the Starfleet. Under the command of a woman, the fearless Captain Kathryn Janeway ventures adventurously into the space between mysterious worlds and populations. Pilot episode of a TV series conceived as a continuation of the classic "Star Trek".

title: Pet Sematary 2
actors: Edward Furlong, Antony Edwards, Clancy Brown, Jared Rushton, Fred Gwynne
description: After the death of his mother who was starring in a horror film, 13-year-old Geoff Matthews moves with his father from Los Angeles to the town of Ludlowe. Here the boy has problems with the bully Clyde, while instead he makes friends with the same age Drew, who hates his stepfather, Gus. And Gus, one day, kills Drew's little dog. It is the beginning of an endless series of nightmarish events.
notes: The first "Living Graveyard" was based on a Stephen King short story and it worked. We wanted to give it a follow-up, but, apart from a few marginal ideas, the results are far below those of the original film. As it often happens.

title: Pocket Money
actors: Paul Newman, Lee Marvin, Strother Martin, Wayne Rogers, Hector Elizondo
description: Jim and Leonard, two penniless dreamers, engage in a sale of calves believing they have smelled a great deal. Naive, they run into one trouble after another and eventually discover that they have worked for a cheater even more penniless than them. An example of the evolution of the western, where the place of the classic heroes is taken by more prosaic "dropouts" capable of dreaming and loving life despite every defeat.

title: Chuka
actors: Rod Taylor, Ernest Borgnine, John Mills, Luciana Paluzzi
description: Chuka, a gunslinger, escorts a stagecoach to Fort Clendennon just in time before the fort is besieged by the Indians. These will make a slaughter of the soldiers, saving only Chuka, who had helped them in the past. A psychological western attentive to the almost documentary reconstruction of the various characters.

title: The Toxic Avenger
actors: Mitchell Cohen, Andrée Maranda
description: Melvin works in a body building gym where he is systematically mocked by everyone for his physique. Then one day he throws himself out the window, falls on a toxic waste truck and becomes a superhero. Disgustingly hilarious, ironic and unwatchable.

title: The Last Outlaw
actors: Mickey Rourke, Dermot Mulroney, Ted Levine, Steve Buscemi
description: The protagonist is a southern landowner, overwhelmed by the Secession war in which he lost, at the hands of the enemies of the North, his wife and three daughters, raped and killed. To live, after the defeat, he was forced with his soldiers to become a robber. Now, escaping after a robbery becomes an opportunity to settle scores between this hard-hearted boss indifferent to the pain of others, and his own.
notes: Draft copy of Sam Peckinpah, with swerves in the trash. But with Mickey Rourke starring, you can't expect much more.

title: Chato's Land
actors: Charles Bronson, Jack Palance, James Withmore, Richard Basehart
description: We are in New Mexico, in 1873, a time and a place in which, for a "half-breed", killing a white sheriff, albeit in self-defense, means condemning oneself to persecution and flight. This is what happens to Chato (Bronson), half white and half Apache. When the pursuers attack his family, Chato thinks back, decides to face them and takes them down one by one. The Winner-Bronson duo, for once on vacation from the saga of the "executioner of the night", moves to the West and builds a film substantially identical to the others. Good craft, a good dose of violence and, thank goodness, a good cast.

title: Hackers
actors: Jonny Lee Miller, Lorraine Bracco, Angelina Jolie, Matthew Lillard
description: Zero Cool - real name Dade Murphy - is a legend among her peers. In 1988, he alone blew 1507 computers on Wall Street, creating global financial chaos. Eleven-year-old Dade Murphy has been banned from using any keyboard by the FBI. Even that of the telephone. It's been seven long years now ... Kate Libby - aka Acid Burn - owns a "rigged" laptop. When Zero Cool collides with Acid Burn, the war of the sexes moves to the hard drive. But the situation changes completely when the two combine their resources to fight "The Plague", a master of cyber sabotage hired by a giant company that uses its extraordinary genius to crush the competition.
notes: Almost a western set in the virtual world. Anonymous actors except Lorraine Bracco (and of course Angelina Jolie, but at the time very young and still almost unknown). The director had made a name for himself in Great Britain with "Backbeat", a film about the beginnings of the Beatles.

title: Montana Belle
actors: Jane Russell, George Brent, Scott Brady
description: Her husband is killed while carrying out a robbery, she is saved from lynching by the Dalton brothers who want her as a partner in their bandit enterprises. But she has the temperament of the boss. Pre-cooked and melodramatic Western, with Jane Russell. Shot in 1948, it wasn't released until four years later.

title: The Oklahoma Kid
actors: James Cagney, Humphrey Bogart, Rosemary Lane, Ward Bond
description: In the city of Tulsa, the Kincaids and the McCords clash. The old Kincaid ends up in jail with a non-existent charge that will lead him to the gallows anyway. His son vows to avenge him. Cagney is the good guy (so to speak) fighting the bad Bogart, in a stereotypical and foolish western.

title: Gleaming the Cube
actors: Christian Slater, Steven Bauer, Art Chudabala, Peter Kwong
description: Brian only thinks about skateboarding; his brother Vihn, adopted son of Vietnamese origin, is instead all study and work. When Vihn is killed, Brian is the one to discover the culprits.
notes: Good pace and discreet hold for an unusual film set in the world of skaters. The cast highlights a really good Christian Slater.

title: Rosemary's Baby
actors: John Cassavetes, Mia Farrow, Ruth Gordon, Elisha Cook
description: Guy is a theatrical actor, his wife is called Rosemary and she is expecting a baby. The neighbors, the Castevets, are very cordial, even if a little intrusive. And Rosemary is a bit apprehensive and paranoid, even if you have to understand her if she gets a little anxious in her state. Perhaps the founding film of modern horror, and perhaps Polanski's masterpiece. The (unsustainable) tension is created starting from a meticulous realism, and a bright and crowded New York becomes the place of terror par excellence, of the coexistence of ancestral fears and metropolitan phobias. The almost "minimalist" finish is shocking. Oscar to Ruth Gordon for Best Supporting Actress.

title: Kickboxer 5
actors: Mark Dacascos, James Ryan, Geoff Meed, Tony Caprari, Greg Latter
description: Kickboxing champion Matt Reeves witnesses the murder of his friend Johnny. He was killed because he did not want to join a new kickboxing association founded by a certain Mr. Neegal. Reeves does not intend to give up, but he does not have many chances, since Neegal is a man of few scruples and boundless ambitions. But our champion finds an ally, as unexpected as it is providential ...

title: Screamers
actors: Peter Weller, Roy Dupuis, Jennifer Rubin, Andrew Lauer, Charles Powell
description: Year 2078. On a remote mining planet devastated by ten years of war, scientists have created a race of self-replicating automatons called Screamers, destined to destroy all forms of enemy life. But these continued to evolve autonomously and, in the end, they chose a new mission: to erase all forms of life. Colonel Hendricksson decides to negotiate a separate peace with the forces decimated by the New Economic Bloc. But to do so he must cross a no-man's land, where the most fatal threat comes from the weapons he helped create. The film is based on Philip Dick's short story "Second Variety". His inspiration is material for a good genre film: only special effects, insistent and uninteresting, screech.

title: Poltergeist III
actors: Heather O'Rourke, Nancy Allen, Tom Skerritt, Lara Flynn Boyle
description: Carol Anne (O'Rourke) is sent by her parents to Chicago by Aunt Pat (Allen) just for a change of scenery. He suffers from hallucinations, the windows of the rooms crack as he passes, the heating stops. Between disturbing presences, sensitive dwarfs and evil forces, the situation worsens.
notes: Third episode, unfortunately directed by Gary Sherman, of the series opened by Tobe Hooper in 1982. Everything smells of refracted and unnecessarily mephitic air. The effects of H. R. Giger are no longer there either. There's Lara Flynn Boyle ("Twin Peaks"), but that's certainly not enough.

title: Dead Man
actors: Johnny Depp, Gary Farmer, John Hurt, Gabriel Byrne, Robert Mitchum
description: In the second half of the nineteenth century, the young William Blake embarks on a journey to the extreme western American frontier. Lost his way and with a bad wound, William Blake meets a very strange Indian. He believes that Blake is the late English poet of the same name. Circumstances will make Blake a wanted outlaw and murderer. The western is serious business and Jim Jarmusch presumptuously forgets about it. The result is an uneven film, certainly not up to the director's previous good performances ("Stranger than Paradise", "Daunbailò").

title: CyberTracker
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Richard Norton, Stacie Foster, John Aprea
description: Eric (Wilson) is one of Senator Dilly's (Aprea) security men, but he doesn't always agree with his boss. In particular, Dilly's idea of ??building a new police force made up of invincible and very powerful androids does not convince him: the Trackers. Eric is alone, the Trackers are many, but he is not afraid.
notes: PM Entertainment has thus produced dozens of films. P stands for Richard Pepin. M for Joseph Merhi. Entertainment is more of an omen than anything else. Don "The Dragon" Wilson is muscular, but since he appeared in "Batman Forever" he is no longer the same.

title: Buchanan Rides Alone
actors: Randolph Scott, Craig Stevens, Manuel Rojas, Barry Kelley
description: Passing through Agaytown, Buchanan saves the young Mexican Juan, who has avenged his sister offended by the evil Agay brothers, from being lynched. Then his gun puts everyone in their place, according to justice. A western so so that it becomes stronger in the end. Not the best of the Scott-Boetticher partnership.

title: Fright Night
actors: Chris Sarandon, William Ragsdale, Roddy McDowall, Amanda Bearse, Stephen Geoffreys, Jonathan Stark, Dorothy Fielding, Art Evans, Stewart Stern
description: Charley is with his girlfriend, Amy. At one point he notices something in the apartment of his new neighbor, Jerry: he, with the appearance of a vampire, is attacking a girl. Distraught, Charley informs both his mother and Amy of the matter, but is not believed. The boy, however, is not mistaken and Jerry, seeing himself discovered, tries to kill him. Amy is also in danger. But Charley has a precious, if reluctant, ally ... Yet another variation on the theme of vampirism. The film, while keeping intact the horror components typical of the genre (the transformations are spectacular), however, introduces a massive dose of irony that makes it a nice comedy-horror.

title: Cyber-Tracker 2
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Stacie Foster, Tony Burton, Jim Maniaci
description: Cyber ??Trackers are a new police force made up of indestructible androids. Those that our hero, Eric Phillips, finds himself fighting against are even more dangerous because they are programmed by a mad scientist named Carpenter. One of these, for example, with identical features to those of Eric's wife, kills the Governor of California on live television. Eric doesn't take it well.
notes: Eric may not be happy, but Don "The Dragon" Wilson can't really complain. This will be at least his fortieth film and, for someone who only knows how to lead his hands and at most emit disjointed sounds, it is not a result to be thrown away.

title: Avenging Force
actors: Michael Dudikoff, Steve James, James Booth, Allison Gereighty
description: In New Orleans, the black Larry Richards is heavily involved (supported by his entire family) in the electoral campaign: he has a great chance of being elected senator. Ex-secret agent Matt Hunter also gives him a hand. Larry, however, has enemies: a group of ruthless racist terrorists who make a massacre during a march killing even Larry's eldest son. At this point Matt and Larry go alone against the terrorists, but there will be a bloodbath. The film fits into the vein of the revenge action movie. A lonely man against terrorists fights to save his affections and ideals. The numerous sequences of violence are spectacular.

title: Ice Cream Man
actors: Clint Howard, Sandahl Bergman, Steve Garvey, Jan-Michael Vincent
description: A quiet provincial town, where everything seems to run on the rails of the daily grind. And so it is, until the ice cream van appears, so much so that a moment of innocent pleasure turns into a blood-dripping nightmare. A scream in the night, and here is the first innocent victim. The police immediately suspect the ice cream maker.
notes: It is difficult for a horror plot to be completely original and, in fact, "Tastes of Terror" sometimes recalls that of "It", Stephen King and "Stuff". However, the realization is decent and we are not faced with a real tracing.

title: Quantrill's Raiders
actors: Steve Cochran, Diane Brewster, Leo Gordon, Gale Robbins, Will Wright
description: A Southern captain has the task of destroying an arsenal in the town of Lawrence: to carry out the mission, he asks for help from the bandit William Clarke Quantrill ...
notes: A series B western, quite predictable. The previous year, Steve Cochran had interpreted _The cry_ by Michelangelo Antonioni.

title: Backlash
actors: Richard Widmark, Donna Reed, John McIntire, William Campbell
description: Jim's stepfather is given up for dead along with his four traveling companions who were ambushed by the Apache, Arizona. While Jim searches for her body, he meets a woman, Karil who, in turn, is looking for her husband's, victim of the same ambush. More than out of pity for her husband, Karil is driven by the desire to recover the $ 60,000 in gold that the man had with him. Jim and the widow, having overcome the initial distrust, continue the research together.
notes: Borden Chase's screenplay (from the novel by Frank Gruber) introduces psychoanalytic and Oedipal elements into the story, and Sturges focuses on action.

title: Raton Pass
actors: Dennis Morgan, Patricia Neal, Steve Cochran
description: To take over her husband's ranch, a woman teams up with a creditor (with whom she has an affair) and starts a war between ranchers. A western centered on the portrait of a strong and greedy woman, with melodramatic accents.

title: Highway to Hell
actors: Patrick Bergin, Kristy Swanson, Chad Lowe, Adam Storke
description: Charlie Sykes is in the car with his beautiful Rachel, when he is in a remote place called Black Canyon Road. At the gas station called Last Chance, the owner tries to explain to the boys that the road from there on is dangerous. But they don't listen, Rachel is kidnapped and from that moment Charlie has only 24 hours to take her out of hell. There isn't much to say. Apart from the fact that hell seems to be made of polystyrene, that the script loses its pieces at every moment and that Patrick Bergin ("In bed with the enemy") is not exactly a monster of sympathy, apart from all this the film lets itself be seen.

title: Enter the Ninja
actors: Franco Nero, Susan George, Sho Kosugi, Christopher George
description: Cole, an expert teacher of ninjitsu (a martial art that mixes karate, judo and hypnotism), goes to the aid of his friend Frank who, in the Philippines, is threatened by a gang of speculators. Mediocre genre film that accumulates stereotypes and clichés almost without realizing it.

title: Tom Horn
actors: Steve McQueen, Linda Evans, Richard Farnsworth
description: Wyoming ranchers, annoyed by cattle thieves, hire a gunslinger. On the advice of John Coble they turn to Tom Horn, a lone cowboy who lives in the mountains loyal to his horse and, above all, to his Winchester. Within a few months, Tom clears up the cattle raiders. Breeders, among other things, fear an intervention by the federal authority concerned that they have had to resort to the help of a bounty killer.
notes: The myths of the West at sunset and a man displaced by the end of his world. For Steve McQueen it is the latest notable interpretation. Richard Farsworth, here in the role of John Coble, is the protagonist of the beautiful "A True Story".

title: S.S.S. Snake
actors: Strother Martin, Dirk Benedict, Heather Menzies
description: A scientist invents a serum to turn humans into snakes, uses the unwitting assistant as a guinea pig for his experiments, and protects his secret with murder. The drama falls into a sinister atmosphere. A bare B-movie, but at times very effective.

title: Young Billy Young
actors: Robert Mitchum, Angie Dickinson, David Carradine, Jack Kelly
description: With Kane's help, Billy Young escapes lynching after killing a cheater in self-defense. Kane is on his way to take on the role of sheriff in a small town, and he takes Billy with him to be tried. But above all he wants to avenge his son, killed by a certain Boone: he will capture the latter's son, but Billy will free the young man and ...
notes: The cast of Kennedy's film (former writer of Budd Boetticher's best westerns) includes important names, but the story pays little attention to the psychological digging of the characters, limiting itself to a superficial, pure routine characterization.

title: Wind
actors: Stellan Skarsgård, Matthew Modine, Jennifer Grey, Cliff Robertson
description: Will Parker, a young American sailor, is one of the crew on Cliff Robertson's boat. We are in 1983 in Newport and the races that must award the prestigious America's Cup trophy are about to begin. Everyone is in agony to try to break the cycle of 130 victories for the Americans and a crew seems to be able to do it.
notes: Endless shipwreck in boredom, despite the suggestive sequences of nautical competition.

title: Lust for Gold
actors: Ida Lupino, Glenn Ford, Gig Young
description: A boy sets out in search of the gold mine his grandfather discovered in Arizona a hundred years earlier. The man had been hunted by a woman who wanted to steal the map with the location of the mine and killed her and her husband.
notes: Anomalous dramatic western told with many flashbacks that enliven the narrative.

title: Mission of Danger
actors: Keith Larsen, Tania Elg, Buddy Ebsen, Don Burnett
description: British and French colonies at war in North America. Major Rogers has a secret plan to break into the French fort in Quebec. Historical B series film.

title: The Omega Man
actors: Charlton Heston, Rosalind Cash, Anthony Zerbe, Paul Koslo
description: After a biological war, a monstrous humanity wanders in New York that can only live in darkness and that destroys everything that resembles the scientific civilization responsible for the disaster. Neville, a scientist who escaped the infection thanks to a vaccine, barricaded in his home-laboratory fighting for his life against these zombies. Then he discovers the existence of other survivors and manages to deliver them a dose of vaccine ...
notes: The plot of the film turns in a "realistic" sense the novel I Am Legend by Richard Matheson from which it is inspired, where the threat is represented by vampires. There is some drop in pace, but there is intrigue and suspense to sell.

title: Waterhole # 3
actors: James Coburn, Carroll O'Connor, Margaret Blye, Claude Akins
description: After a "hit" three bandits hide a chest full of gold in the desert. The adventurer Cole, however, kills one of the three and recovers the gold. The two survivors, who hold the witness of the theft, a cobbler hostage, go after Cole, in turn chased by the cobbler's daughter who fell in love with him. Western parodic at times funny. Blake Edwards produces.

title: 13 Ghosts
actors: Charles Herbert, Jo Morrow, Donald Woods, Martin Milner
description: On the death of the old and misanthropic Dr. Zorba, his penniless nephew Cyrus (Woods) inherits the family home. Cyrus moves in with his wife and children and discovers that the house is inhabited by a dozen ghosts. The Zorba are a little impressed and a little worried because a treasure seems to be hidden in the house and the presence of ghosts clearly does not facilitate searches. The movie is nonsense, but Castle is a gimnick genius. Only he could convince the spectators of the time to wear stupid pink goggles (which he himself distributed at the entrance) without which it would have been impossible to see the ghosts.

title: Escape from Absolom
actors: Ray Liotta, Lance Henriksen, Stuart Wilson, Kevin Dillon
description: We are in 2022, in the Absolom maximum security prison where a former Marine officer sentenced to life imprisonment for having "executed" a superior is transferred. The man tries to escape to assert his reasons, but it is an almost impossible undertaking given the particular organization of the place of punishment, the controls to which it is subjected and the conflicts between opposing groups of prisoners.
notes: Already "Criminal Law" had shown the directorial skills of Martin Campbell, confirmed in this film based on a novel by Richard Herley. In science fiction form, references to the present are transparent. Solid B series, as it once was.

title: The Mangler
actors: Robert Englund, Ted Levine, Daniel Matmor, Vanessa Pike, Lisa Morris
description: The "mangler" is a contraption that works as a clothes ironer in a laundry. It is fed by workers who are increasingly exhausted by their incessant work and harassed by their boss, a crippled half-blind. At a certain point, fatal accidents begin to occur near the infernal machinery: a policeman begins to investigate those deaths and comes to a disconcerting conclusion ...
notes: The film has rightly been called a "Dickensian-Gothic horror". Note the presence of former Freddy Krueger, Robert Englund, in the role of the sinister master, who humorously frees himself from the character who made him famous and who risked "enslaving" him.

title: American Yakuza
actors: Viggo Mortensen, Michael Nouri, Yuji Okumoto, Ryo Ishibashi
description: Nick Davis (Viggo Mortensen) has just gotten out of jail and his hopes of finding a job are limited to the most infamous areas of the city, namely those of the San Pedro docks. And so it happens, except that at the port it is easy to get involved in a settling of scores, witness a shooting, maybe save the life of an Eastern Mafia boss and then join the family, willy-nilly.
notes: Viggo Mortensen is a face to remember. He was the returning brother in "Lone Wolf", the film that marked Sean Penn's directorial debut and also appeared in "Carlito's Way" and "Red Alarm". Too bad that this by Frank Cappello is just a food film.

title: White Water Rebels
actors: Catherine Bach, James Brolin, Pepe Serna
description: A kayak enthusiast (James Brolin) and a freelance photojournalist collide with an unscrupulous businessman bent on building a dam with ruinous effects. A passable adventurous drama produced by CBS in the long wave of "A quiet weekend of fear".

title: Vengeance Valley
actors: Burt Lancaster, Robert Walker, Ray Collins
description: While running his paternal ranch, Lee Strobie, the son of a wealthy Colorado farmer, attempts to put his milk brother Owen Daybright on the right track. The latter, who is treated like a son by Arch Strobie, however, not only turns out to be a slacker, but also has an ungrateful and evil soul and will turn the relationship with his brother to a dramatic epilogue.
notes: Western drama with psychological and Oedipal overtones, played by a Lancaster in top form.

title: Last of the Redmen
actors: Jon Hall, Michael O'Shea, Evelyn Ankers
description: Two young ladies and a boy, the sons of an English general, cross the territories of North America infested with aggressive Indian tribes under escort. A noble and courageous Mohican, the only survivor of his people, acts as their defender and guide. This version of the Fenimore Cooper novel is neither the best nor the worst.

title: Powder
actors: Mary Steenburgen, Jeff Goldblum, Sean Patrick Flanery
description: A mysterious young man with very white skin and completely bald is found in the cellar of a country house. The boy, immediately nicknamed "Powder" (face powder) for the color of his skin, was born of lightning because his mother gave birth to him in the rain during a storm. Powder lived with his grandparents for twenty years, isolated and protected from the outside world. But now he has to face the rejection of the community that hates its diversity. And yes, the boy has extraordinary intelligence, is very sensitive and has paranormal powers. An easy easy moral in a film that is done pretty well and can be seen to the end.

title: Alvarez Kelly
actors: William Holden, Richard Widmark, Janice Rule
description: Alvarez Kelly is a breeder of Irish descent. During the last months of the American Secession War he must lead a herd of 2,500 to the Federal Army camp which is preparing to take over the city of Richmond. But the cattle are also tempting to the Southerners who, led by Colonel Rossiter, plan to raid the herd and for this, taking advantage of a reception, they imprison Alvarez Kelly ...
notes: Honest traditional western and a bit of a manner. It does, however, contain some spectacular sequences of the charge of the herd; and equally great actor duels between William Holden and Richard Widmark.

title: The Rock
actors: Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage, Ed Harris, David Morse, Michael Biehn, Claire Forlani, William Forsythe, Vanessa Marcil, John Spencer, John C. McGinley, Tony Todd, Bokeem Woodbine, Todd Louiso
description: A group of visitors' trip to the former Alcatraz prison turns into a nightmare when they are taken prisoner and held hostage by an organization of "rebel" Marine officers. Soldiers would be noble: they demand that the US government compensate the families of soldiers who have fallen in battle and are ignobly forgotten by the state. To neutralize them, there's an FBI super-expert chemist. As for penetrating the fortress, there is only one person who can do it: the only one who has ever managed to get out.
notes: Second film by Michael Bay ("Bad Boys"): there are so many ideas that perhaps, more than a two-hour film, two could have been released. If the explosions only partially renew the image of the genre, the presence of Connery and a slap-up script, snappy action and fun are enough to keep the audience on the rope until the end.

title: Hellfighters
actors: John Wayne, Katharine Ross, Jim Hutton, Vera Miles, Bruce Cabot
description: Chance Buckmà is a specialist in extinguishing fires in oil wells. During one of these actions he is injured and his wife (who lives apart) and the daughter whom Chance has not seen for some time are warned. Chance's young collaborator Greg falls in love with the girl and marries her, also taking over Chance's company, which feels too old by now. However, he will still be the one to make a decisive contribution when fires break out in the wells in Venezuela. It is a spectacular film, even if, in the long run, the sequences of the fires are all a bit alike, starring an aged, but never tame, John Wayne.

title: Tombstone
actors: Kurt Russell, Val Kilmer, Powers Boothe, Joanna Pacula
description: Wyatt Earp, former sheriff of Dodge City, has moved with brothers Virgil and Morgan to Tombstone where he dominates a gang of outlaws called "The Cowboys". Soon, Doc Hollyday, a gunfighter, and his woman, Kate, also join the three. When the outlaws take out the sheriff, brothers Earp and Doc take on "The Cowboys" at Ok Corral.
notes: An attempt, only partially successful, to resurrect the western genre by revisiting one of its founding myths: the Ok Corral shootings. There is a lot of shooting, but the myth, the real one, is now far away.

title: Face to Face
actors: James Mason, Gene Lockhart, Robert Preston, Marjorie Steele
description: Two-episode film. In "Mysterious Passenger" (from Conrad) the commander of a British vessel in the Pacific waters rescues a young officer from another ship. In "Pistol Shots" (by Stephen Crane) a drunkard has a habit of shooting in the city; the sheriff, unarmed, heals him. A very curious double adaptation. In the first episode, Mason's atmosphere and interpretation are enjoyable; in the second the rhythm and the picaresque tone.

title: Seminole
actors: Rock Hudson, Anthony Quinn, Barbara Hale, Lee Marvin
description: Lieutenant Caldwell arrives at Fort Klig: here he finds Revere, the childhood companion he is in love with, but not John, the friend of the time. John, the son of an Indian, has placed himself at the head of the Seminole tribe with the name of Osceola. Major Degan would like to exterminate the Indians and both Caldwell and Osceola will, to varying degrees, fall victim to his hatred of the Indians.
notes: Making one of the first westerns of his filmography, Boetticher stigmatizes militaristic drifts and starts his own personal journey within the American genre par excellence. The contribution of Russell Metty's "luxuriant" photography was decisive.

title: Cybertech P.D.
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Kari Salin, Chris Sarandon
description: Once drug trafficking was definitively defeated, international crime threw itself into the clandestine trade of virtual realities of all kinds. Chase and Phillips belong to the Cybertech team, struggling with this new, deadly phenomenon. They find an ally in Pamela, a virtual sex star, of which the boss Matthews wants to exploit the DNA to obtain clones to be put into circulation ...
notes: The intertwining of action and science fiction sinks into a tide of banality.

title: A Time for Killing
actors: Glenn Ford, George Hamilton, Inger Stevens, Paul Petersen, Timothy Carey, Dick Miller, Harrison Ford
description: The Civil War is over but, thirsty for revenge, the Confederate Captain Bentley hides the news from the soldiers who fled with him from a northern fort where they were prisoners. Moderately violent, with some rhetoric about the ugliness of war.

title: The Road Killers
actors: Christopher Lambert, Craig Sheffer, Michelle Forbes, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, David Arquette
description: Two cars traveling in the desert towards San Diego. In one, Jack with his wife and teenage daughter; in the other, his friend Glen with his son. The group meets a bloodthirsty fugitive who beats the area with three of his cronies. Glen dies immediately, in the flames, and Jack is presumed dead; the others are imprisoned in a horrid shack. But Jack (Lambert) has seven lives and his revenge will be merciless.
notes: Classic "B-movie" signed by the son of a director (Richard) who was worth more than his scion. If we pass over the improbability and forcing, the rhythm is not lacking. Lambert is not worth much, but this is nothing new.

title: Border River
actors: Joel McCrea, Yvonne De Carlo, Pedro Armendariz, Ivan Triesault
description: A major in the Confederate army wants to buy weapons from a rebel Mexican general. But he is a kind of bandit and the transaction turns into a high-tension adventure. Actors of considerable appeal for a western that, at least in part, is detached from the schemes of the genre.

title: Invaders from Mars
actors: Jimmy Hunt, Helena Carter, Arthur Franz, Leif Erickson, Hillary Brooke
description: A boy discovers that a group of Martians who have landed on planet Earth are turning some locals into robots. Among the "robots" are his father, his mother and a friend of his. But nobody believes him, except a young doctor. Together the two try to defeat the invaders by first having to fight against general skepticism.
notes: Despite the poverty of means, the film, designed for 3D and scripted by Richard Blake, stands out for its visionary style. As often happened at the time, the film was massacred in the Italian edition. Seen today it keeps its naive charm intact.

title: The Devil Bat
actors: Bela Lugosi, Suzanne Kaaren, Dave O'Brien, Guy Usher
description: A doctor with a passion for a scientist is esteemed for his kindness and seriousness by the whole community of the small town of Minnesota where he lives. One day, however, strange murders begin to happen: it turns out that it is a ferocious and gigantic bat of an unknown species to commit them. The monster is shot down, but, inexplicably, the kills continue. A journalist arrives in town to investigate.
notes: Fumettone with horror veins whose only interest lies in the presence of Bela Lugosi.

title: The Bamboo Saucer
actors: Dan Duryea, John Ericson, Lois Nettleton
description: An alien spaceship has landed in Central Asia, in Chinese territory. Anglo-American and Soviet troops are parachuted into the area to attempt to recover the secrets contained in the flying saucer. The Chinese, however, do not intend to sell what could prove to be very precious secrets for their war industry and thus intercept the commandos. A bloody battle ensues at the end of which, the only survivors, an American and a Russian flee together on the alien aircraft.
notes: It was certainly not the first time that intergalactic affairs served American cinema to warn of various "red" dangers. Before the ping pong politics (and before Tien An Men).

title: The Raid
actors: Van Heflin, Anne Bancroft, Richard Boone
description: In 1864, six Southern soldiers escape from a Union prison and take refuge in Canada, from where they will organize a revenge raid against a small town in Vermont. Lively film, well constructed and characterized. Directed by Hugo Fragonese, an Argentine-born director very skilled in low-budget action cinema, the film is based on an authentic episode in American history.

title: The Last Hard Men
actors: Charlton Heston, James Coburn, Barbara Hershey, Christopher Mitchum
description: Sheriff Sam Burgade retires after capturing the bandit Zach Crov. In the capture, Zach's wife died and the outlaw escapes to avenge her. Kidnaps Suzan, Sam's daughter; he goes on a hunt with his men, but ends up being alone with Suzan's boyfriend, Hal. It will be the two of them who will clash with Zach and his gang; Sam dies but Hal kills Zach and frees the girl. The great era of the western is about to close and it shows. Despite its "epic" intentions, the story suffers from a short-lived script; the direction is conventional despite the Peckinpah winks; the cast, however, is of a certain appeal.

title: Union Pacific
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Joel McCrea, Robert Preston, Akim Tamiroff
