description: In 1862 the construction of the railway line was started that will have to connect the Atlantic coast with the Pacific. The construction is disputed between two companies and, moreover, the operation is the subject of stock market speculation. Jeff Butler, a government agent, who has to contend with two saboteurs, is called to supervise the work. Meanwhile, Jeff falls in love with Molly, the daughter of an engineer. Together they will carry out their mission. An epic film, an adventurous and beautifully shot western. The mass scenes and the sequences of the laying of the tracks are exceptional.

title: Endangered Species
actors: Robert Urich, JoBeth Williams, Paul Dooley
description: In a county in the American West, the local sheriff and a New York detective (Robert Urich) work together to discover the source of some mysterious incidents and mutilation of cattle. At the end of the investigation it turns out that in a secret laboratory, some shady businessmen are developing a genetic alteration plan.
notes: Alan Rudolph diligently directs a pretentious fantasy thriller, with a good cast in which, in addition to Robert Urich, Peter Coyote (Roman Polanski's "Bitter Moon") stands out. Partially based on real events.

title: The African Queen
actors: Humphrey Bogart, Katharine Hepburn, Robert Morley, Peter Bull
description: World War I in Africa. A rough American adventurer and an energetic North American missionary travel together, not without contrasts, on an old boat to escape the Germans, then sink a gunboat. Striking mix of comedy and adventure, with unforgettable Bogart-Hepburn duets. The great critic James Agee is co-writer, Bogart won the Oscar. The adventurous production of the film inspired the novel "White Heart Black Hunter" and the film based on it by Clint Eastwood.

title: Chief Crazy Horse
actors: Victor Mature, Suzan Ball, John Lund, Ray Danton
description: The resistance to the arrogance of the whites, the defeat and death at the hands of a traitor, the proud Crazy Horse (Mature), leader of the Lakota Indians, who was one of the major architects of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. Fictional biography from the side of the Indians, competently directed by a specialist of the genre.

title: Switchblade Sisters
actors: Joanne Nail, Robbie Lee, Monica Gayle, Asher Brauner, Chase Newhart
description: The "Debs" are a violent gang of terrible, easy-going girls raging in their high school. When Maggie is admitted to the group, Patch, a blindfolded girl, feels threatened by the newcomer and decides to boycott her. Exploitation 70s film redistributed by Rolling Thunder, Tarantino's distribution house.

title: Gunman's Walk
actors: Van Heflin, Tab Hunter, James Darren, Kathryn Grant, Mickey Shaughnessy
description: Hackett is a wealthy and rude cattle rancher. Of the two children he has, Ed is the one he prefers also because, in brisk ways, he looks more like him. But, following in the footsteps of his father, the boy soon goes very far, sowing deaths. Hackett tries to reason with him, then he has to clash with him. Convincing western melodrama directed by a good "B-movies" director.

title: Land Raiders
actors: Telly Savalas, George Maharis, Arlene Dahl
description: Vicente, who moved from Mexico to the US, has become the very rich owner of Forge River, a sadistic persecutor of the Apaches. A brother of his, Pablo, joins him and unsuccessfully opposes his bloody follies and heavy methods of making money. Only the Indian nemesis will be able to stop Vicente.
notes: Drama in the shaky, Manichean spaghetti-western era, with arch-villain Telly Savalas.

title: Rosebud
actors: Peter O'Toole, Richard Attenborough, Cliff Gorman, Claude Dauphin
description: Sabine, the granddaughter of a very wealthy Jewish industrialist, invites four friends for a vacation on the "Rosebud" yacht, but a "Black September" commando kidnaps the women to draw public attention to the plight of Palestinians detained in Israel and on the trades of some speculators, including the owner of the yacht. A CIA agent, posing as a journalist, manages to get on the yacht.
notes: Rosebud, a mythical word for cinephiles (it is Orson Welles' sled in "Fourth Power"), is debased as the owner of a film where lack of script and narrative dispersions shine. One of the many thuds of Prmeinger as an old man.

title: Crying Freeman
actors: Mark Dacascos, Julie Condra, Masaya Kato, Rae Dawn Chong
description: Emu O'Hara accidentally witnessed the murder of a Chinese boss in San Francisco. The killer, a rather handsome and handsome young man, cried as he killed his victim, and even revealed his name, Yo. Now, according to an Asian tradition, when a killer tells a witness his name, then he will kill him. Emu flees to Vancouver, but is obsessed with the memory of Yo, which terrifies and fascinates her. She meets him again, when again she witnesses one of his execution. By now Emu is fully involved in the story of Yo, the crying killer, of whom she becomes the lover. From a famous manga comic of the 80s, an elegant and original "kung fu-movie" that winks at various precedents: from Bruce Lee to Tarantino, passing through John Woo and "The Crow". Mark Dacascos, the "Crying freeeman", has Chinese, Irish, Spanish and Japanese blood in his veins. In addition, he is champion of six combat practices.

title: The River Wild
actors: Meryl Streep, Kevin Bacon, David Strathairn
description: Gail lives in Boston: a beautiful house, an architect husband, two children and a dog, but she was born in the territories of the Wild West. It is there that he returns to spend a few days of vacation practicing his favorite sport, rafting, that is the descent of the rapids of a river on a rubber dinghy. It goes without saying that the trip, when I took on board two young boys who turn out to be runaway robbers, soon turns into a nightmare.
notes: Embroidered around the strong figure of the mother played by Meryl Streep, the film is a hallucinatory journey into a wild nature that is the mirror of that, equally wild, of men. The Streep dominates everyone for strength, courage and intensity of the looks: they are the ones that are remembered at the end of the film.

title: Wolf
actors: Jack Nicholson, Michelle Pfeiffer, James Spader, Christopher Plummer
description: Will Randall is the powerful editor of a publishing house. A young and ambitious colleague is trying (successfully) to steal his job. One evening Will runs over a wolf who bites him. From that day on, his senses became more acute and his body found an extraordinary energy (also to beat the cheating colleague). Will has turned into a werewolf. Man is a beast and the city (and the workplace) of the woods worse than those where animals live.
notes: "Wolf" is a reflection turned into gothic horror on the feral nature of man and on love which is perhaps his only antidote. Nicholson, more sly than ever, lets out a few empty jokes. Pfeiffer is always beautiful.

title: The Pathfinder
actors: George Montgomery, Helena Carter
description: We are in North America, in 1754. "Pathfinder" is a frontier man who keeps himself out of the colonial war that rages between the British and the French until he discovers that the latter instigate the Indians to fight alongside them. So he decides to offer himself to the French as a guide, but to work for the British flag. With a woman who acts as his interpreter, he will fulfill the mission and save his skin.
notes: Classic B-series product in the era of studio heyday.

title: Hour of the Gun
actors: James Garner, Jason Robards, Robert Ryan, Larry Gates
description: In Tombstone, Sheriff Wyatt Earp battles Clanton, a cattle dealer. His two brothers, Virgil and Morgan, and his friend Doc Holliday join him in the enterprise. Clanton is defeated in a duel and, in revenge, treacherously kills Earp's two brothers. Doc Holliday tries to convince his friend to give up revenge, but Earp does not stop even in the face of the danger posed by the number of men in the pay of Clanton: he forms a group of gunslingers and faces his rival in a deadly match at the Ok Corrall.
notes: Yet another version of the duel that really took place and several times subject of westerns.

title: The Wild Country
actors: Frank de Kova, Steve Forrest, Vera Miles, Ronny Howard, Jack Elam
description: After leaving their hometown Pittsburg, the Tanners settle on a dilapidated ranch in Kelly Wyo, Wyoming. With great tenacity they rebuild the house and work the land. Everyone in the house gets busy: dad Jim and mom Kate, but also sons Virgil and Andy, although still very young, give their precious help. Nature and men, however, hinder them and, after a period of drought, they collide with a neighbor who, with a dam, has blocked the flow of water to their lands.
notes: Classic western by Disney.

title: Bedlam
actors: Boris Karloff, Anna Lee, Billy House, Richard Fraser, Glen Vernon
description: In 1760 the Bedlam asylum is placed under the leadership of the sadist Sims. The latter enjoys organizing shows whose protagonists are the patients of the clinic. Nell Bowen would like to denounce it publicly, but thanks to her intrigues, Sims manages to get her banned and interned like crazy. But the sick, struck by Nell's natural grace, rebel against Sims and even end up killing him. Inspired by the tables of Hogart, a film that releases a visionary horror, interpreted with great intensity by a masterful Karloff.

title: The Nevadan
actors: Randolph Scott, Dorothy Malone, Forrest Tucker
description: A robber is imprisoned and then released to allow a sheriff to follow him and discover the gold hoard he has hidden. The plan, adventurously, succeeds, with the help of a determined girl. Solid traditional western by the versatile long-time director of "Sympathetic Canaglie" and "L'urlo dei comanches".

title: A Man Called Horse
actors: Richard Harris, Dame Judith Anderson, Jean Gascon, Manu Tupou, Shannon Williams, Corinna Tsopei
description: Sir John Morgan, hunting in Montana in the early 1800s, is captured by the Sioux (who have never seen a white man) and used as a pack animal. Morgan will prove to be a man, marry the daughter of the chieftain, pass the terrible test of courage and thus become a full-fledged warrior. He will then decide to stay with his new "brothers", indeed he will become their leader.
notes: The film offers elements of spectacular rendering, but it is even more interesting in its ethnographic aspect, as well as for the clash-encounter envisaged for the two civilizations that came into contact. Great acting performance for the protagonist, Richard Harris.

title: Renegades
actors: Evelyn Keyes, Larry Parks, Willard Parker, Edgar Buchanan
description: The only one in the family who does not practice banditry, Bill Dambrows retires to the mountains to change his life. He is arrested for aiding and abetting, but finds a defense in Dr. Martin. He falls in love with the doctor's girlfriend, he is paid, and a bloody affair ensues. Fairly crafted narrative for a story that lies entirely in the codified canons of tradition.

title: Bloodsport 2
actors: Daniel Bernhardt, Don Gibb, James Hong, Pat Morita
description: Alex is a thief who as a prisoner learns the secrets of martial arts. His teacher is the wise Sun. Alex learns that the sword he stole from a wealthy art collector is the trophy for the winner of the Kumite, the toughest martial arts tournament in the world. Now redeemed from his past life, he returns it to its rightful owner, to then conquer it regularly in combat. "Bloodsport" ("No holds barred") had the function of launching the Van Damme myth. No. 2 tries to exploit his memory, using an imitation of the now famous Belgian as the protagonist. Full throttle action; history is optional.

title: Prince of Darkness
actors: Donald Pleasence, Victor Wong, Anne Howard
description: In a Los Angeles church, a priest discovers a strange case containing a greenish liquid. According to an ancient book, the substance refers to the powers of the Evil One. Together with a team of scientists, the priest begins to study the reliquary, but, during a terrible night, everyone is hit by the spray of the liquid and consequently infected by Evil, which will bring them into contact with a nightmare, in which the Antichrist threatens humanity.
notes: Of all the films directed by Carpenter, a recognized master of new horror, this is certainly one of the most disturbing. The representation of the Antichrist is so gloomy that it assumes metaphysical connotations, close to Gnostic positions.

title: Saturn 3
actors: Kirk Douglas, Farrah Fawcett, Harvey Keitel, Douglas Lambert
description: Captain James goes to the rescue of the moon base where Major Adams and his assistant Alex work. During the journey, James is eliminated and replaced by the criminal Benson. On the basis, however, the robot Hector accuses him of murder and Adams begins to have doubts. Hector eliminates Benson, but things get complicated when the robot falls in love with Alex.
notes: Donen is an old Hollywood fox who gave his best in the fifties in comedies and musicals (his legendary "Singing in the rain"). Here his profession, a suggestive scenography and a very respectable cast help him.

title: Canyon Passage
actors: Dana Andrews, Patricia Roc, Hoagy Carmichael, Susan Hayward
description: Times of summary justice, towards the middle of the last century, in the West facing the Red Indians and with turbulence even among the pioneers. Robert does not know how to adapt to this climate of precariousness of the law, and is both witness and protagonist of dramatic conflicts resolved with more barbarism than civilization. Excellent actors and direction of the wrist for a film of robust construction.

title: Frankenstein
actors: Randy Quaid, Patrick Bergin, Fiona Gillies
description: Confident that science can not only cure disease but also overcome death, young Dr. Victor Frankstein constructs an artificial creature using a corpse stolen from the scaffold on which he grafted a new brain. The doctor manages to give life to the new creature but it turns out to be a bloodthirsty monster that soon escapes his control. The creature then escapes and swears revenge against its artificer. For Victor it is the beginning of a nightmare that will compromise his marriage to Elizabeth.
notes: Discreet television version of Mary Shelley's immortal novel. Nothing new and great, but Quaid is good at playing a monster that is a little smarter than usual.

title: Five Weeks in Ballon
actors: Red Buttons, Barbara Eden, Cedric Hardwicke, Peter Lorre
description: In 1862 a group of Englishmen organized an expedition to reach the Volta River, in Africa, aboard a balloon. Five people take part in the enterprise: an inventor, his assistant, an officer, a journalist and his girlfriend.
notes: Dignified, but somewhat colorless version of the well-known novel of the same name by Jules Verne.

title: Seventh Cavalry
actors: Randolph Scott, Barbara Hale, Jay C. Flippen
description: Captain Tom Benson, who accidentally escaped the Little Big Horn massacre, is considered a coward. He then offers himself as a volunteer to carry out a very dangerous mission: to penetrate into Indian territory and recover the body of General Custer. A low-cost action film specialist directs the star of small homemade westerns. To the delight of fans.

title: Man in the Saddle
actors: Randolph Scott, Ellen Drew, Joan Leslie, Alexander Knox
description: Owen, a small ranch owner, is unfortunate enough to have a wealthy neighbor who is overbearing and jealous of his wife, who torments him by unleashing his bravadoes on him. The violence multiplies, Owen is forced to take refuge in a lonely place with the village teacher ...

title: Night of the Comet
actors: Catherine Mary Stewart, Kelli Maroney, Robert Beltran
description: The return of a comet, the same that caused the extinction of the dinosaurs in the passage of millions of years ago, almost completely destroys humanity on Earth. Among the few survivors, two bad California girls ... Tasty low cost film, tinged with irony, which reserves some good moments of thrill.

title: Battlestar Galactica
actors: Richard Hatch, Dirk Benedict, Lorne Greene, Herb Jefferson jr
description: A spaceship collects the survivors of an endangered human colony on a distant planet, and embarks on a perilous odyssey to return to Earth. Very disappointing film in terms of ideas, with some discreet special effects in the style of "Star Wars", it takes up a segment of five episodes of a television series ("Galactica") that is already quite tasteless on the small screen.

title: Wonder Woman
actors: Lynda Carter, Cathy Lee Crosby, Kaz Garas, Ricardo Montalban
description: Wonder Woman puts her superpowers at the service of justice, recovering some very important documents stolen by an international spy as fascinating as she is cruel.
notes: After the successful television series starring Lynda Carter herself, a TV movie with a new adventure of the comic book heroine created in the 1940s.

title: Lassie
actors: Thomas Guiry, Helen Slater, Jon Tenney, Brittany Boyd, Frederic Forrest
description: When Steve Turner informs his family that he needs to move from Baltimore to his latest wife's farm in the countryside, his little daughter Laura is thrilled. Not so, however, the adolescent and rebellious son Matthew. On the road that leads them to the new house, however, they will meet the dog Lassie. Thanks largely to the company of the very intelligent animal, the family will adapt quickly to change.
notes: It is one of the most recent transpositions on the big screen in which the legendary collie is the protagonist. The result is discreet, and the director offers a fairly convincing description of a family's daily problems.

title: Marooned
actors: Gregory Peck, Richard Crenna, Gene Hackman, David Janssen
description: After five months on an orbiting station, three US astronauts are unable to return to Earth due to a failure. NASA does not want to send help to avoid risks, but a young scientist leaves alone on a shuttle to reach the station. Here, the commander tries everything to save the other two ...
notes: That John Sturges gave his best in the western and its surroundings (_Challenge all'O.K. Corral_, _The magnificent seven_) is no mystery. Here he is entrusted with the task of building suspense in a space setting that is as realistic as possible, and he performs by putting his whole craft into play.

title: Dark Star
actors: Brian Narelle, Dre Parich, Dan O'Bannon, Joe Saunders
description: In the 21st century the spaceship "Dark Star" with four crewmen on board, is involved in the search and destruction of unstable planets and stars. Between one bombing and the next, life is a monotonous edge until the moment when an alien element wreaks havoc. Plus a computer failure sets off a bomb. Doolittle then "talks" with the bomb to convince it not to explode but, when he seems to have succeeded ... Born as a university short film-essay, the film is only completed later. It is a small masterpiece of the genre created with intelligence and irony towards cinema and the American Dream.

title: Desperate Trail
actors: Sam Elliott, Linda Fiorentino, Craig Sheffer
description: Nothing seems to distract an inexorable sheriff from the decision to hand over a beautiful outlaw to the executioner. But she escapes with a kind and brave bandit. Thus began the chase.
notes: Solid well-performed television western, with some strong sequences and some surprises in the finale.

title: Day of the Badman
actors: Fred MacMurray, Joan Weldon, John Ericson
description: Four outlaws, belonging to the infamous Hayes family, arrive in a small village in the West. Their intention is to prevent the death sentence of Rud Hayes, a relative awaiting trial. For this they try to intimidate Sheriff Wiley, the jury and Judge Jim Scott himself. The citizens, terrified, would like to bow to the will of the bandits, but the sheriff disagrees. Also, Wiley's girlfriend is in love with Jim. It is a western by way and by profession, without great emotions. Incidentally, the cinemascope format is unmotivated, as the film takes place mostly indoors.

title: Treasure Island
actors: Charlton Heston, Christian Bale, Julian Glover, Christopher Lee, Oliver Reed
description: Young Jim and his mother make it by running a tavern in a coastal town. In the club a pirate is attacked and wounded and, chased away the attackers, the man - now dying - gives the two the map of his treasure, starting a great adventure: but also the pirate Long John Silver is interested in the loot, and will give the boy a lot of trouble ...
notes: Successful television production, faithful to Stevenson's immortal original text. Written and directed by Fraser C. Heston, Charlton's son (here as Long John Silver), with the great Christopher Lee and young Christian Bale. A curiosity: The sailing ship is the same as the _Gli mutinati del Bounty_.

title: The Forbidden Planet
actors: Walter Pidgeon, Anne Francis, Leslie Nielsen, Jack Kelly, Warren Stevens
description: In 2200 a space mission descends on Altair. In the whole planet, of an entire terrestrial colony only Professor Morbius and his daughter, served by the robot Robby, have survived the incursions of monstrous and mysterious entities. The astronauts begin to have some suspicions about the professor when they discover what the mysterious devices in the laboratory really are for.
notes: Classic of co-cinematographic science fiction, it is an imaginative reworking of Shakespeare's "Tempest", in a psychoanalytic key. One of the first "adult" examples of the genre, and one of the first robot characters on the screen. A small masterpiece.

title: Far From Home
actors: Mimi Rogers, Bruce Davison, Jesse Bradford, Tom Bower
description: Angus McCormick lives in Canada with dad John, who runs a transport company, and mom Katherine. Her life is peaceful, cheered up by the encounter with a stray Labrador dog who, despite Katherine's opposition, manages to take home. The animal and the boy become inseparable, and when Angus experiences a dangerous mishap at sea, it will be his four-legged friend who saves him in a daring way.
notes: The idea is among the most stereotyped that can be imagined, but the director develops it with amused measure. In the background, the splendid natural scenery of the great North American.

title: Independence Day
actors: Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Will Smith, Mary McDonnell, Robert Loggia
description: Huge "unidentified objects" appear in the sky. The methodical destruction of the great cities of the Earth begins, and all seems lost until the American president himself gets on a plane and goes to fight the aliens. Together with him a weird scientist and a brave pilot will save the planet.
notes: From the same director and producer of "Stargate", the "big movie" of 1996. Programmed, only in Italy, in 520 screens, it was preceded by a colossal hype, as are the special effects and the Americanate of the screenplay. A mammoth and smashing toy, made on purpose to break the box office and give an answer - too little ironic - to the pro-alien mysticism of Spielberg's brand.

title: Taras Bulba
actors: Yul Brynner, Tony Curtis, Christine Kaufmann, Sam Wanamaker
description: We are in the sixteenth century: the Poles, threatened by the Turks, are saved by the Cossack Taras Bulba, but then the fate of the war is reversed. Taras is saved and, far from the land of his ancestors, awaits the moment of revenge. He will also have to kill one of his sons, Andrei, who has deserted to join the girl he loves.
notes: Gogol's novel in a barely discreet visualization, with a lot of naivety. In the cast Brynner in one of his most famous roles, and Tony who manages to be a credible Cossack.

title: Nemesis 2: Nebula
actors: Sue Price, Chad Stahelski, Tina Cote, Earl White, Jahi J.J. Zuri
description: In the distant, but not too distant future, humanity is enslaved by cyborgs. But some scientists, after some important discoveries, begin to have serious hopes for the redemption of humans. They then choose a volunteer, but he, discovered by the cyborgs, has no choice but to flee into the past aboard a spaceship. Arriving in 1980, however, he still manages to find a solution to future problems.
notes: The sequel to a film that, in terms of inventiveness and science fiction imagery, did not shine very much, is a jumble of traces and clichés not even so well sewn together. Very scarce special effects. Direction fugitive.

title: Mission of Justice
actors: Jeff Wincott, Adrian Ricard, Karen Sheperd, Brigitte Nielsen
description: Kurt Harris is a former cop whose life has taught us that you shouldn't have too much hope in your fellow man. Disillusioned and embittered, he is investigating the murder of a friend undercover. The investigation brings him into contact with the world of politics: a woman, in particular, who has decided to compete in the elections for the office of mayor and who is ready for anything to reach her goal ... Power, corruption, violence, martial arts are the key words that frame the film. As is customary in these cases, the subject is only a pretext to justify the action scenes that lead to the conclusion. And to the freeing of the spectator.

title: The Puppet Masters
actors: Donald Sutherland, Eric Thal, Julie Warner, Keith David
description: An alien spaceship lands in a small town in Ohio. Sent by NASA and the Office for Scientific Intelligence, scientists Mary, Andrew and the latter's son, Sam, come running. But the extraterrestrial organism has already exited the spaceship.

title: Street Fighter
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia, Ming-Na Wen, Damian Chapa
description: A very powerful criminal has built a veritable super-technological empire and is now demanding a boat of billions in exchange for the lives of a few dozen hostages. Against him, Colonel Guile (Van Damme), of the United World forces, and a group of very trusted and skilled martial artists.
notes: That poor Raul Julia ended his career before his death with this film is a cause of great sadness. He deserved better. Based on a hugely successful video game and with characters that have become iconic, the film does not capitalize on mythology built on source material in other media and lacks both a zest for the show and intriguing character rivalries.

title: Strange Lady in Town
actors: Greer Garson, Dana Andrews, Cameron Mitchell
description: At the beginning of the twentieth century Love Simpson, beautiful and independent, brings the scandal to a small town in the South by marrying Rucker, the owner of the store where she works, much older than her and a fresh widower.
notes: Unpretentious feminine sentimental Western, but pleasant enough.

title: Princess Caraboo
actors: Phoebe Cates, Jim Broadbent, Kevin Kline, John Lithgow, Stephen Rea
description: England, 1817. Two peasants pick up a girl who does not know who she is, who does not speak English, has some coins of unknown origin and is dressed in an exotic way. Mrs. Warrel takes care of her, who saves her from prison and from the gallows (her fault is that of not speaking English) and, while the most extravagant conjectures are made about the girl, a journalist investigates ...
notes: Apart from the reconstruction of a few quite tasty period pictures, it is not clear what the purpose that the film set itself was. Denounce perilous times? Warn about unjustified bias against the "different"?

title: Iron Eagle
actors: Louis Gossett jr., Jason Gedrick, David Suchet, Tim Thomerson
description: Doug is the son of a US Air Force colonel. The boy trembles with impatience to be able to emulate his father's feats, but for now he has to be content with a flight simulator. However, he learns so well that when his parent falls into the hands of Middle Eastern terrorists, he seizes an aircraft and rushes to the rescue. Everything ends well and Doug also earns the long-awaited badges.
notes: Reaganian film of the series "top gun to the rescue", in which Sidney J. Furie gives ample proof of his technical skills during the aerial shots, breathtaking as it should be. But the story and the staging are pure routine.

title: Pin
actors: David Hewlett, Terry O'Quinn
description: Brother and sister, Leon and Ursula live alone, fond of a large wooden Pinocchio they call "Pin". But she makes a boyfriend. Leon, jealous and manifestly mad, takes action with his puppet. Robust low-budget genre film, directed by Sandor Stern, the screenwriter of "The Amityville Horror".

title: Deep Waters
actors: Jean Peters, Dana Andrews, Dean Stockwell, Cesar Romero
description: Little Donny has been orphaned since his father, a fisherman, died at sea. He is entrusted by Anna, his guardian, to a widow, in whose house he meets Edie, a fisherman who takes him with him into the sea. Anna refuses to let the boy follow in his father's footsteps in the dangerous profession of deep-sea fishing. But Donny, who has a passion for the sea in his blood, runs away to embark with Edie. A decent teen film that's more wordy than adventurous.

title: The Good Old Boys
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Sam Shepard, Sissy Spacek
description: Hewey Calloway is a mature cowboy, as proud as the land he comes from. After long wanderings, he returns to his brother Walter's farm in the endless Texas countryside. He struggles to adapt to sedentary life, also because Walter is very different from him, used as he is to the rhythms of the small town. But when it comes to taking sides against the bullying of a banker, Hewey finds in Walter a valid ally; at the same time the rude cowboy falls in love with a proud teacher.
notes: Actor Tommy Lee Jones not only stars, but makes a convincing debut as a screenwriter and director.

title: Eraser
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, James Caan, James Coburn, Vanessa Williams
description: John Kruger, a commander of the federal police, is part of the WITSEC special group, which is concerned with providing a new identity to witnesses under protection. The exceptional physical strength and intensive training he undergoes make him the best member of the group. Eraser (this is his nickname) is faced with the most demanding challenge of his career: protecting the witnesses entrusted to him by a mole, which from within his own organization constitutes a terrible threat to their safety. Arnold Schwarzenegger deceives us every now and then: he did it with "The Twins" and especially with "True Lies", where James Cameron threw him into intelligent satire (of himself, James Bond and all his emulators), without giving up super effects. But from "The Eliminator" don't expect anything that vaguely resembles "True Lies". Here Schwarzy has returned to take himself seriously and is a full-blown action man, very acrobatic and rather dull, within a plot that could not be more obvious.

title: Cellar Dweller
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Debrah Farentino, Brian Robbins, Yvonne De Carlo
description: Based on enigmatic texts and equally enigmatic figures contained in an ancient book he came into possession of, a draftsman invents a monstrous creature. The creature materializes and, for the designer, it is the end. Much later, an aspiring designer rediscovers the unfinished work of her forerunner and decides to continue it to complete it ...
notes: You know "Jumangi"? Here is the previous one, but for older readers how can we not think of the famous "Archivernice"? Nothing new, then: demons, black magic, some special effects. For enthusiasts, any recycling works.

title: The Bounty Killer
actors: Dan Duryea, Rod Cameron, Audrey Dalton
description: Willie is a peaceful man; arrived in the West in search of fortune, he falls in love with Carol, just back from an emotional misadventure. After finding work, he kills a bandit he was attacked by and collects the bounty. He then decides to become a bounty hunter, but soon his new life transforms him into another man. And in the end it leads him to ruin.
notes: B-western with an evident moral, with old actors of the silent and sonorous western, from Bronco Billy Anderson to Buster Crabbe.

title: Once a Thief
actors: Sandrine Holt, Michael Wong, Ivan Sergei, Nicholas Lea
description: Li Ann, Michael and Mac are three thieves in the pay of Hong Kong's most important godfather. Michael is also his birth son. Li Ann has decided to marry Michael, even though she is in love with Mac; the two men are both in love with her. The trio decide to escape Hong Kong with the boss's money. The ingredients of John Woo's cinema are all there, even if it is a film produced for television.

title: Twister
actors: Helen Hunt, Bill Paxton, Jami Gertz, Cary Elwes, Lois Smith
description: Jo Harding, as a child, saw her father die being sucked into a whirlwind. Some time has passed and the girl, who has meanwhile become a tornado scholar, continues her fight against the force of nature and against her husband who pursues her to get her to sign the divorce papers. Soon, however, Jo gets involved by the man to place in the heart of a tornado of exceptional size a special machine that, in homage to the "Wizard of Oz", is called Dorothy.
notes: The first part of "Twister" is boring, even for lovers of the catastrophic: about 45 minutes of descriptions of clear characters from the beginning, of sentimental bickering with an obvious outcome, of car races, to get to the core, that is the heart of the tornado. But when he gets there, Jan Da Bont doesn't deny the fame he has earned with "Speed" and, in the second part, he doesn't give himself a moment's respite.

title: Geronimo
actors: Joseph Running Fox, Michael Greyeyes, Tailinh Forest Flower
description: Chief Geronimo leads the Chiricahua Apache nation in a heroic, long and desperate guerrilla war against white arrogance.
notes: Produced by the American Cable TV TNT, as it cannot compete in the show with the contemporary film by Walter Hill, it makes historical correctness its strong point. Nominated for 5 Emmys, he won one.

title: Chain Reaction
actors: Keanu Reeves, Morgan Freeman, Joanna Cassidy, Rachel Weisz, Fred Ward
description: A young man of high hopes, mechanic and inventor, and a physicist with the right physique and a brain focused on the discovery of the century. They are being chased by the FBI, the Chicago PD and their double-cross professor. At stake is the formula for economic energy obtained from hydrogen: it does not dirty, does not stink, it is unlimited, available to everyone, free of charge. Davis ("Trap in the high seas", "The fugitive") tries again the shot he managed with the couple Ford-Lee Jones, but he holes dramatically. Hiding of charisma in the cast and, above all, in the script that leaks from all sides.

title: Alligator people
actors: Beverly Garland, Bruce Bennet, Lon Chaney jr.
description: A scientist attempts to heal the wounds of his patients by grafting a secretion of reptiles into the human skin. The result is literally monstrous: everyone undergoes mutations and goes to populate the swamps. Like a young doctor who transforms into a kind of caiman. The old "scientist" Lon Chaney in a typical 1950s B movie.

title: The Last Hunt
actors: Robert Taylor, Stewart Granger, Debra Paget, Lloyd Nolan, Russ Tamblyn
description: In Dakota, bison herds are nearly extinct due to unstoppable hunts. Charles is a bloodthirsty hunter, who also hates Indians, while Sandy is tired of the useless carnage. Sandy falls in love with an Indian captured by Charles and at one point runs away with her. Charles chases them for revenge, but in the end he will be the one to succumb in this "last hunt".
notes: A western that combines the show with a sort of ante litteram environmental awareness and a rethinking of the relationship between white men and Indians (the latter, however, is not entirely original). Good as always the direction of Brooks and captivating cast.

title: Last Man Standing
actors: Bruce Willis, Christopher Walken, Leslie Mann, Bruce Dern
description: Jericho, state of Texas, 1931. A frontier town with a rapidly declining population. The latest cowboys have given way to tweed-clad mobsters from hot Chicago. They arrive driven by the need to control the illegal liquor trade arriving from neighboring Mexico. In the city, two rival gangs, headed by Doyle and Strozzi, rule. One day a mysterious stranger arrives who calls himself Smith. He is kind, cynical and elusive, but he is perfectly aware of the evil that dominates the city ...
notes: Modern, deafening and angry Western with a gold cameo by Christopher Walken. Its weak side is the inexpressiveness of Bruce Willis.

title: Vigilante
actors: Robert Forster, Fred Williamson, Richard Bright
description: His family is attacked by a group of deviant punk killers and rapists. He (Robert Forster), from the quiet man he was, turns into a bloodthirsty avenger. The story recalls "The executioner of the night"; Lustig will then do "Mania Cop" but here he does not get out of the routine.

title: Tank Girl
actors: Lori Petty, Naomi Watts, Malcolm McDowell, Ice T, Don Harvey, Jeff Kober, Reg E. Cathey
description: The Earth in 2033 became an immense desert, controlled by the "Water and Power" department, which holds control of the water. Rebecca lives in a rebel commune with her boyfriend, Sam. It is night when the troops of the department massacre and capture the girl, sentenced to forced labor in the mine. But Rebecca, along with Jet, a woman who works as a mechanic, manages to escape in a tank truck. and learns that Sam is alive.
notes: Film based on the cult comic by Jamie Hewlett (that of Gorillaz) and Alan Martin, also published in Italy. But here the character loses the punk wickedness that distinguishes it.

title: Jericho Fever
actors: Perry King, Stephanie Zimbalist, Ramon Chavez, Peter Cirano, Ari Barak
description: Along the border between Mexico and the United States, a group of Mexican terrorists is chased by the police. What the terrorists don't know is that a terrible virus has infected them and destined them to certain death. On the other hand, two doctors are engaged in a race against time and against the very dangerous patients themselves, to intervene in time, thus preventing a catastrophic spread of the virus.
notes: Despite some references to social situations and medical issues, what really matters in the film is the action. Every element of the script is bent to it, according to an inflexible logic of genre.

title: Captains Courageous
actors: Robert Urich, Kenny Vadas, Kaj-Erik Eriksen, Robert Wisden
description: Harvey Cheyne jr., Rich and corrupt, finds the sea on his way. Fate leads him to board a fishing boat in Gloucester. It will be for him three months of very hard and dangerous life among the ocean waves, which will make him mature through dramatic and decisive experiences. From the novel by Rudyard Kipling, a version produced directly for TV.

title: Alaska
actors: Thora Birch, Vincent Kartheiser, Dirk Benedict, Charlton Heston
description: After the death of his wife, Jake decides to leave Chicago and travel with his two teenage children Jessie and Sean to a remote Alaskan village: he will transport supplies by plane to hard-to-reach areas. During one of these missions, his plane crashes into a mountain location and the two boys set off in search of him and come across a polar bear cub who has fallen into the trap set by a poacher who will immediately go after them. Charlton Heston returns to the screen directed by his son Fraser in an ecological tale that wisely exploits the beautiful landscapes of Alaska, British Columbia and Baffin Island. The story is conventional, the performers below average. In short, nothing new under the snow.

title: White Squall
actors: Jeff Bridges, Caroline Goodall, John Savage, Scott Wolf
description: 1960. The most difficult part of the course begins for thirteen students of the Ocean Academy (a sailing school). In the company of the enigmatic skipper Christopher Sheldon, the boys will have to spend a whole year at sea, sailing between the Caribbean and the South Pacific. A very hard experience, marred by a terrible accident: during a sea storm, the ship sinks causing the death of four students and the two crew members. The survivors will have to face a delicate problem: was the shipwreck caused by the commander's inexperience? A real process within the group will have to resolve the problem.

title: Daylight
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Stan Shaw, Viggo Mortensen, Sage Sylvester
description: The underwater tunnel that connects the island of Manhattan to New Jersey is traversed by a huge number of commuters every day. One evening, during rush hour, a car accident causes a devastating explosion: the tunnel turns into a hell of twisted metal while the explosions of fuel follow one another unstoppable; and this situation endangers a small number of survivors. But the danger stimulates the courage and skills of Kit Latura, one of the many prisoners in the gallery. Version of the most typical catastrophic 70s updated to the era of computer special effects. The film contains everything you would have liked to have found twenty years ago. The only exception is that the character who takes on the role of the leader is not the ordinary type who improvises himself as a hero. He is the hero par excellence, Stallone at his best.

title: Sundown
actors: David Carradine, Maxwell Caulfield, John Ireland
description: A typical American family, optimistic enough, decides to move from the East coast to the heart of the Big Country, in that West that is still partly wild. The destination chosen for the new stay, however, is a strange village surrounded by the desert that certainly does not make a good impression. The place is in fact populated by a community of vampires who try in every way to vampirize the newcomers.
notes: The story begins by aligning some original ideas that promise well, but gradually flattens out on the easier stereotypes.

title: The Glimmer Man
actors: Steven Seagal, Bob Gunton, Keenan Ivory Wayans, Brian Cox, John M. Jackson, Michelle Johnson, Stephen Tobolowsky, Peter Jason
description: An FBI agent is sent from New York to Los Angeles to investigate a maniac who kills people with the crucifixion ritual. Flanked by a local agent, the FBI man suspects that some of these crimes are not the work of the maniac, but have another matrix. The mission will unveil an international conspiracy. Steven Seagal moves less than the previous films and shows off his martial arts skills only on a couple of occasions, which also coincide with the film's most successful moments. For the rest, the plot (confused and cumbersome enough) is only an explicit cast of the leading themes of "Seven", enriched by a little surprising political fictional background.

title: Dr. Giggles
actors: Larry Drake, Holly Marie Combs, Glenn Quinn, Cliff De Young
description: Dr. Rendell takes hearts from living donors, who are naturally unwilling, to attempt a transplant on his cardiopathic wife. Discovered, he is killed by popular anger. Her eight-year-old son Evan goes mad and grows up in a mental asylum. One day, however, he escapes from the clinic and, mindful of his father's medical glories and pathologically obsessed with the new frontiers of surgery, he in turn begins to apply unique therapeutic "treatments" to a group of teenagers, naturally unwilling.
notes: Larry Drake (adult Evan) has a good stature, but the film as a whole is monotonous.

title: The Black Hole
actors: Maximilian Schell, Robert Forster, Anthony Perkins
description: Near a black hole, astronauts on a scientific mission find a space station that had long since been lost. It is directed by the megalomaniac dr. Reinhardt, who transformed his crew into robots. Served by effective special effects, this Disney production inspired by "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" is however weak in narrative solutions, and ends up disappointing.

title: Man from Del Rio
actors: Anthony Quinn, Katy Jurado, Peter Whitney, Douglas Fowley
description: Dave was given the town sheriff's star after he rebelled against the oppression of the men of Bannister, owner of the saloon. But the locals stay away from him and Dave, who has a broken wrist, is forced to fight Bannister. A western without particular merits or gaps, with some pretense of psychological analysis and some (for the times) concession to violence. Quinn, who has been of every race in the world in his career, is authentically Mexican here.

title: Babylon 5
actors: Michael O'Hare, Claudia Christian, Jerry Doyle, Mira Furlan
description: We are in the mid-23rd century and the Babylon 5 space station, a metal structure weighing two and a half million tons and located about 25 light years from planet Earth, has become a sort of free port for diplomats, players of d ' unscrupulous gambling and vagabonds. Babylon 5 represents the last hope of peace for the five most powerful races in the galaxy. Jeffrey Sinclair, the station commander, along with his men, are grappling with the mysterious seismic phenomena of the planet Epsilon 3. Despite the low budget imposed by the production, the film that combines two episodes of the television series made in the USA, "Babylon 5 ", is a suggestive example of science fiction that has, on its side, good tricks due to computer graphics.

title: From Dusk Till Dawn
actors: Harvey Keitel, George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Juliette Lewis, Salma Hayek
description: The infamous Gecko brothers, two of the most dangerous criminals in the United States, are on the run from Texas. Across the border in Mexico, the mysterious Carlos offers the two safety in exchange for a percentage of their loot. For the two brothers it is a question of escaping the trap that the police are preparing and crossing the border to get to the appointment with Carlos before daylight. It is at this point that ...
notes: Trash films among the most authentic recently appeared. An adventure punctuated by a great musical column and a very safe editing as well as studded with mockery of the clichés of Hollywood cinema and homages to the classics of the genre.

title: Escape from L.A.
actors: Kurt Russell, Stacy Keach, Steve Buscemi, Peter Fonda, Cliff Robertson
description: Fifteen years after Jena's insane exploit in New York's maximum security prison, the last anarchist soldier in the United States - again arrested by law enforcement - is forced on another mission: to travel to L.A. and intercept Utopia, the president's daughter who flirts with a Third World guerrilla. The enterprise is not easy: the "city of angels" has become a no man's land in the middle of the sea ...
notes: Sequel of _1997 - Escape from New York_, which reflects on the mystifying power of images and plays imaginatively with genres, deliberately flaunting "handcrafted" special effects. To be rediscovered, without making comparisons with the unrivaled model.

title: Courage Under Fire
actors: Denzel Washington, Meg Ryan, Lou Diamond Phillips
description: January 1991: as the fires of war erupt in the sky over Baghdad, Colonel Serling of the US infantry accidentally fired at one of his units, with the imaginable consequences. Sent home, the Pentagon tries to revive him by entrusting him with the delicate task of deciding whether or not to give a gold medal for military valor to an alleged hero, a female helicopter pilot. From the novel of the same name by Patrick Sheane Duncan, also author of the screenplay, the first "official" film on the Gulf War arrives from the United States. The occasion was interesting. But the courage remained under fire, in the middle of the desert, far from the cinema.

title: Dragonslayer
actors: Peter Mac Nicol, Caitlin Clarke, Ralph Richardson, John Allam
description: A kingdom beyond time and space is haunted by a terrible dragon that demands the sacrifice of a girl from the country every year. The unfaithful sovereign is unable to resist, and then a girl turns to a powerful wizard who dies before being able to help. His helper only manages to get the dragon to go wild. The king's daughter offers herself for the sacrifice, but ...
notes: From ancient Celtic legends, a classic escape film. From time to time the story takes on a hint of humor: if he had pressed more on the adventure pedal, the film would certainly have earned it.

title: The Lion
actors: William Holden, Trevor Howard, Capucine, Pamela Franklin
description: An American girl, Tina, lives on a game reserve in Kenya, along with her stepfather John (Holden) and her mother (Capucine), who has long since divorced Robert (Howard). The girl, living in contact with nature, slowly takes on the characteristics typical of the natives. The worried mother calls her ex-husband to beg him to take Tina to the United States. Robert, who, in the meantime, has arrived in Africa manages to convince Bullit to let the child go. A very obvious melodrama, which is raised only in some description of the environment.

title: Seven Cities of Gold
actors: Richard Egan, Anthony Quinn, Michael Rennie, Jeffrey Hunter
description: In 1789 the expedition led by Gaspar Portola from Mexico set out to conquer California. Another purpose of the mission is to found religious communities. Father Serra is entrusted with the project. Having reached, after various vicissitudes, the set goal, Portola decides to send one of the ships back to Mexico to ask for reinforcements. In the meantime, he sets out in search of the mythical cities of gold. Above average acting for a classic 1950s adventure film.

title: Hell Camp
actors: Lisa Eichahorn, Tom Skerritt, Anthony Zerbe, Robert Wightman
description: The US military authorities decide to subject a group of officers to a course, which aims to train them for survival. The tough trials are to take place in a wooded location in the Philippines. Parachuted in place, Major Casey and the youngest Katherine are captured and locked up. Unfortunately, the camp is directed by Captain Becker, a sadist and psychopath, who has taken his task so literally that he has subjected the unfortunate to unspeakable humiliation and torture. Mediocre adventure film that adds nothing to the genre, if not an accentuation of the gory side.

title: Mars Attacks!
actors: Danny DeVito, Jack Nicholson, Glenn Close, Pierce Brosnan, Natalie Portman, Lisa Marie, Annette Bening, Martin Short, Michael J. Fox, Sarah Jessica Parker, Rod Steiger, Tom Jones, Jim Brown, Lukas Haas, Pam Grier, Sylvia Sidney, Jack Black, O-Lan Jones, Christina Applegate
description: The aliens have landed on planet Earth and have chosen the United States. But, unfortunately for us and the Americans, they do not have the peaceful aspect of ET, on the contrary, they do not miss an opportunity to destroy everything they find. After all, America does not deserve a president like James Dale, whose main concern is the suit to wear for the meeting with the Martians. No less is First Lady Marsha, always obsessed with appearances and who does not want to have "those things" in the house. Even Professor Donald Kessler turns out to be a fool after all. Eventually a country kid, his goofy grandmother, and some country music will make things right.
notes: "Mars Attacks!" by Tim Burton is a great game on the naive science fiction of the 1950s (starting with the opening credits, beautiful), but also a great mockery of all our myths, our rituals and our alibis: we will not become better by not eating pig and converting to Buddhism. "The Martians - says the (stupid) professor who goes on television - are very intelligent and therefore must be peaceful". No, the Martians, who derive directly from a series of fashion stickers in the 1960s, are very intelligent, and that's it. Therefore, after a haughty look, they may only want to destroy us. We who still have Tom Jones (who appears in person and closes the film in a hilarious naturist-Disney idyll) deserve nothing else.

title: Trapper County
actors: Bo Hopkins, Don Swayze, Robert Estes, Betsy Russell
description: Bobby and Ryan are two vagabonds who live day to day playing guitar on the streets of California. Always on the lookout for adventure, they stumble upon the dreaded Luddiger clan. The meeting for the two will only be a source of trouble: in fact they will be accused of murders never committed. Film of little interest, directed by an unknown director.

title: Dante's Peak
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Jamie Reneé Smith, Jeremy Foley
description: Harry Dalton is a volcanologist in crisis after losing his wife in an accident. But when his former colleagues ask him to study seismic activity near the town of Dante's Peak, Harry doesn't feel like refusing. The town is ruled by Rachel Wando, who is about to sign a lucrative deal with a billionaire.
notes: The catastrophic is sometimes like porn, repetitive and absolutely predictable: first part, introduction of the characters (many) who will be in danger; second part, catastrophe and death of some of these characters. And that's exactly why it works; provided, of course, the premises are respected and the effects are satisfactory. "Dante's Peak", on the other hand, shoots away the best effects during the opening credits, does not make us in the least fond of its characters and reduces the effects to a lot of smoke (and almost no roast). Dialogue dripping with sweet rhetoric to the point of ridicule.

title: Blind Justice
actors: Armand Assante, Elisabeth Shue, Robert Davi, Adam Baldwin
description: San Pedro, a town near the Grand Canyon, is in the hands of a group of bandits led by Alacran. They aim at a shipment of silver guarded by a handful of soldiers. In San Pedro, Canaan happens by chance, a former soldier who became almost blind from a wound, but who, despite this, has maintained an infallible aim. A charming nurse asks him for help in freeing San Pedro from the Alacran gang. Canaan accepts, thinking of the booty.

title: She
actors: Ursula Andress, Peter Cushing, Bernard Cribbins, Soraya
description: The Englishman Leo looks like a drop of water to the Egyptian high priest Killicrates, killed two thousand years ago by Queen Ayesha. Thanks to the secret kept in the Sahara by the "sacred flame", the woman is still alive and leads Leo to fall in love with her. With two companions Leo reaches the ruins of the city of Ayesha where the sacred flame still burns ...
notes: Vaguely inspired by the myths of Atlantis, it is a product that does not differ from the more cheap peplums produced in photocopies in the 1960s. Dull adaptation of the famous fantasy novel by Henry Rider Haggard, entitled "She". The 1935 version ("The Eternal Woman") is much more successful.

title: The Final Countdown
actors: Kirk Douglas, Martin Sheen, Katharine Ross, James Farentino
description: On December 7, 1980, the American aircraft carrier Nimitz - participating in a military operation in the Pacific - is surprised by a magnetic storm. When the clear sky returns, the Nimitz resumes navigation, the captain and crew discover that the storm has made them regress over time, bringing them on the eve of the attack on Pearl Harbor ...
notes: Film inspired by one of the classic themes of science fiction literature: time travel. Excellent script and direction, good performance of the actors. But the strong point is the spectacularity rate, especially in the sequences in which ships and planes are the absolute protagonists.

title: Scanner Cop
actors: Daniel Quinn, Darlanne Fluegel, Richard Grove, Mark Rolston, Richard Lynch
description: A boy (Quinn) who, since childhood, has manifested paranormal abilities and who has developed incredible telepathic powers (he is a scanner), joins the police force. Once assigned to a ward, the man is given the task of hunting down a renegade scientist, who leads people to kill police officers. The fight proves to be tough and difficult, especially when the two scanners are armed against each other. Pierre David's debut feature, with frequent narrative lapses and here and there even logical ones, does not prove to be different from the other films in the series.

title: Howards of Virginia
actors: Martha Scott, Cary Grant, Cedric Hardwicke, Alan Marshal, Richard Carlson
description: We are in 1760, in America, during the colonial wars that saw the clashes between the inhabitants of Virginia and their oppressors. The rude and fiery farm owner (Grant), married to the aristocrat Marsha, decides to go to war. Domestic conflicts, class struggles and sentimental problems complicate the story. Acceptable film for the interpretation of Cary Grant, but which shows some flaws, especially in terms of direction.

title: Last of the Dogmen
actors: Tom Berenger, Barbara Hershey, Andrew Miller
description: Lewis Gates (Tom Berenger) hunter famous for his tracking prowess is hired to track down three dangerous escapees who have escaped into the rugged mountainous area of ??Montana. When the fugitives are found killed, Gates grapples with a mystery. Accompanied by passionate Native American anthropologist Lillian Sloane (Barbara Hershey), Gates ventures into the mountains and discovers an isolated village inhabited by a tribe of natives who escaped the massacres of white settlers a century earlier. After being captured by the Native American warriors, the two gradually begin to be accepted into the tribe, but when Sheriff Deegan leads a mountain joke on the trail of the missing, Gates and Sloane must prevent the tribe from being slaughtered a second time.

title: Demon Knight
actors: Billy Zane, William Sadler
description: The Collector (Billy Zane) is perpetually in pursuit of Brayker, a man who is able, with his powers, to stop the advance of the forces of Evil. Its power is linked to the possession of an ancient key on which many have set their eyes, including the Collector. To obtain it, the latter summons a macabre array of corpses from the afterlife to terrorize the guests of a dilapidated hotel. Thus begins a bloody battle.
notes: From a rib of the TV series "Tales from the Crypt", inspired by horror comics, a splatter that manages to sustain the balance between funny moments and terrifying moments.

title: American Kickboxer
actors: John Barrett, Keith Vitali
description: Two friends, martial arts experts, become rivals. Their once fraternal union takes a back seat to the benefit of an exasperated sporting rivalry. They will end up competing for the title of the kickboxing world champion. The Italian title is misleading: the first "Without exclusion" had Jean-Claude Van Damme in the cast, who is not here.

title: Prime Cut
actors: Lee Marvin, Gene Hackman, Sissy Spacek
description: A killer, traveling to Kansas City to collect a debt, completes his mission but at the same time frees a group of women, saving them from the local boss. To complicate the matter we bring one of the freed girls, who falls in love with the killer, and a blonde of easy virtue. The escape through the fields with the threshing machine at his heels is unforgettable.

title: Sworn to Justice
actors: Cynthia Rothrock, Tony Lo Bianco, Kurt McKinney, Brad Dourif
description: A wave of violence hit an American metropolis, the work of a gang of thugs. Among the victims of the outlaws a young woman, Janna's sister, an expert in martial arts and endowed with extrasensory faculties. Thanks to these two particular abilities Janna sets out on the trail of criminals and, with karate shots, begins the work of "cleaning". To win, however, it is necessary to find the leader of the gang who is naturally hidden in an unsuspected identity. Between one fight and another, love also makes its way.
notes: When you say "a name, a guarantee", you say it all and Cynthia Rothrock, the Van Damme in a skirt, never betrays expectations: steel muscles under a velvet skin. The only unknown: how will she have styled the blonde hair this time? Bob or curls?

title: Airborne
actors: Shane McDermott, Seth Green, Brittney Powell, Chris Conrad
description: Mitchel, a bold young Californian surfing champion, is forced to move for a few months with some relatives in Cincinnati, away from the beloved ocean waves. Here, moreover, he fails to mesh with his new schoolmates and comes into conflict with them. To "redeem himself" he has only one option: put on his roller skates and participate in the most reckless competition in the region.
notes: Usual, rhetorical apology for success understood as a violent affirmation of the individual.

title: The Shooter
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Maruschka Detmers, Assumpta Serna, Gavan O'Herlihy
description: Someone killed the Cuban ambassador to the United Nations. American officer of Czech origin Mickey Dane is given the task of traveling to Prague and capturing Simone Rosset, the alleged killer who runs a restaurant in that city. Mickey tracks her down. But the woman claims she retired from the killer business and has not left the Czech capital for the past five years.
notes: Kotcheff is one who is not afraid of anything and makes at least two chase sequences as the god of cinema commands. What do you want it to matter if the script doesn't stand up?

title: Fifty/Fifty
actors: Peter Weller, Robert Hays, Charles Martin Smith
description: A mercenary is contacted to take part, in a state of the Southeast Asian state, in the release of the legitimate president, imprisoned after a coup. Despite the intervention of a friend and the sacrifice of the woman he is in love with, he finds himself having to deal with the dictator he wanted to overthrow. Will he succeed in the enterprise?
notes: Action, pseud-commitment and lots of bangs, but little tension.

title: Surf Ninjas
actors: Ernie Reyes jr., Rob Schneider, Nicolas Cowan, Leslie Nielsen, Tone Loc
description: A free-talking dude surfing the beautiful shores of Southern California reaches a distant Asian kingdom. The purpose of his trip is to take back his throne and his prince's crown.
notes: Adventure movie that one would like to be bizarre and is just stupid. Among the performers the rapper Tone Loc.

title: The Kentuckian
actors: Burt Lancaster, Dianne Foster, John Carradine, Walter Matthau
description: Beg Eli, a widowed lumberjack, wants to move with his son from Kentucky to Texas. Beg wants to escape a feud that has been going on since time immemorial, pitting his family against another. However, during the transfer he stops in a city, where he is reached by his relentless pursuers, who try to provoke him at all costs, with a trickle of offenses and abuses and also involving him in bloody fights.
notes: Lancaster's first directing is a solidly structured western, with good and bad, a bit slow in narrative development. Film debut, in an unusual negative role, for Walter Matthau.

title: One Tough Bastard
actors: Brian Bosworth, Bruce Payne, DeJuan Guy, Jeff Kober, Lawrence Lowe
description: John North is a Marine officer whose family is slaughtered by a gang of arms traffickers in a drugstore. Recovering from the shock, he tries in vain to track down the killers, but the FBI makes him understand that his interest is not appreciated. In fact, behind the whole story, there is the hand of Karl Savak, a corrupt federal agent, who is trying to recover a shipment of high-tech weapons he promised to a drug dealer in Los Angeles.
notes: According to Lance Henriksen, the man who called John Woo a poet, Brian Bosworth is a kind of John Wayne of our time and we won't blame him.

title: Bad Boys
actors: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Téa Leoni, Tchéky Karyo, Theresa Randle
description: Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett are two black cops from the narcotics section. Max Logan and Julie Mott are two prostitutes. When Max loses his feathers, Julie remains the only person alive who can identify the men in the gang who stole a large amount of heroin. Julie is kidnapped, but Mike and Marcus are smart enough to free her.
notes: Logorrhea is the stylistic code of Will Smith's acting, perhaps because there was and is a parenthesis as a rap singer. For this he is hired and for this he cannot refrain from pronouncing from four to six words per second. In this sense, "Bad Boys" is a film that aims at the highest degree of specialization: everyone is always and only limited to what little they can do.

title: Panic in the Skies!
actors: Kate Jackson, Ed Marinaro, Erik Estrada, Maureen McCormick
description: A Boeing 747 departing from London to New York finds itself in the midst of an unexpected storm. After being struck by two lightning bolts at the same time, he remains without a guide: the two drivers, in fact, were electrocuted. The eldest flight attendant tries to enter the program that manages the flight system with a laptop.
notes: Usual disaster film with the usual plane in trouble at the center. The tension remains high for the duration of the film, the actors are all good. And for a TV movie, that's enough.

title: Three Young Texans
actors: Mitzi Gaynor, Keefe Brasselle, Jeffrey Hunter
description: The three guys in the title are actually two guys and a girl. Friends for the skin the young men and both naturally in love with the girl. She is undecided in the choice and therefore puts herself at the disposal of the one who will be able to put together a fair sum. In the ensuing struggle, there will be trouble in sight for the two boys.
notes: Naive and enjoyable western for teenagers.

title: Dark Avenger
actors: Errol Flynn, Joanne Dru, Peter Finch
description: We are during the Hundred Years War (14th century). A beautiful English noblewoman is forcibly held hostage by a French squire from Aquitaine. The Prince of Wales, disguised as a soldier of fortune, arrives at his castle. After a series of daring adventures, the villain is defeated and the lady can return to England.
notes: Errol Flynn is a swashbuckling guarantee. The film is decent.

title: Lord of Illusions
actors: Daniel von Bargen, Scott Bakula, Kevin J. Connor, Joseph Latimore
description: Nick, a character with diabilic traits and soul, is the head of a satanic sect dedicated to secret magical rites. A group of followers, however, at a certain point, kills the master to steal his secrets and hides his corpse. Thirteen (!) Years go by. The illusionist Swann, famous "magician" and magician, makes a horrible end in the course of a show which also witnesses the detective D'Amour. Swan's new widow hires D'Amour to investigate her husband's death, and the policeman soon finds himself dealing with Nick's old followers.
notes: Barker is an imaginative writer and a director of good will. But despite several ideas, this film has no charm and is not very original.

title: Lost Continent
actors: Cesar Romero, Hillary Booke, Chick Chandler
description: During an atomic propulsion experiment, a missile escapes the radio control of the operators. A plane with three officers and three scientists is sent to search the area where the missile is believed to have landed. As the plane flies over an island, all of the plane's instruments cease to function following an inexplicable magnetic storm. The plane is forced to make a crash landing. On the island, the crew learns that the missile has fallen on the top of a mountain overlooking the village, and the group of scientists, at the end of the climb, discover a fantastic world ...
notes: Science fiction film made in an era still without electronic aids and special effects.

title: The Night Flier
actors: Miguel Ferrer, Julie Entwisle, Dan Monahan, Michael H. Moss
description: Richard Dees works for the tabloid "Inside View" and, just to clarify what he thinks, he used to say: "When my wife has finished reading it, I sheath the cat cassette: she absorbs the pee which is a pleasure". The journalist is on the trail of a serial killer who sucks every drop of blood from his victims and then departs aboard a black Cessna that sows worms and plasma at will ...
notes: From the story _The Night Flyer_ by Stephen King, a decent B series horror film directed by a young rookie. The ending overturns the journalist's axiom: "Never believe what you publish, never publish what you believe in".

title: The Saint
actors: Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue, Rade Serbedzija, Henry Goodman
description: In a boarding school, a difficult and lonely child chooses to give up his name to become Simon Templar. Growing up, he becomes a cynical spy, skilled in transformism, in the pay of the highest bidder. At least until fate puts a charming English scientist in his way, who will have to approach, seduce and ... rob!
notes: In the 60s and 70s he had the face of Roger Moore. In Noyce's hands, Simon Templar takes on the guise of Val Kilmer. After a good prologue, the film lets itself be harnessed in a manneristic love story. The less convincing parts overwhelm the pretty Elisabeth Shue, while the disguises are slaughtered by a laughable dub.

title: Black Patch
actors: George Montgomery, Diane Brewster, Tom Pittman
description: An honest sheriff puts a robber in jail, even though he is his friend. An accomplice of the malefactor has the hiding place of the loot revealed, then makes him escape and kills him, placing the blame on the sheriff.

title: Crossworlds
actors: Josh Charles, Rutger Hauer, Andrea Roth, Stuart Wilson
description: Being wary of inheritances is what the young Joseph should have done when he got into trouble by an amber crystal left to him by his father. The crystal combined with the scepter of Dairachun is in fact the magic key that guarantees its owner control of all the space / time dimensions of the universe. The unsuspecting Joseph is then involved by Laura and AT, two members of the resistance against the Warlords, in a dangerous struggle for the freedom of dimensions.
notes: Oscillating between Philip K. Dick's fascinating theories of parallel universes and the jumbled time / space travel of Terry Gilliam's Time Bandits, it's actually a film with no rhyme or reason. With a patchy script and performers who seem to be saying like Bruce Chatwin "What am I doing here?", The film fails even to offer itself as an idiotic reading of the genre and it is sad to see Rutger Hauer close to retirement.

title: Solo
actors: Mario Van Peebles, William Sadler, Adrien Brody, Seidy Lopez
description: Solo is considered by all to be a perfect soldier. No type of martial art is unknown to him. He has no family or friends and, above all, he has no birth certificate. Should he be injured, he could be abandoned by his superiors without any problems. It looks like it is made of flesh and blood, but it is made of microchips and polymers and is the most advanced type of weapon out there.
notes: Take "The Magnificent Seven" (the exteriors were shot in Vera Cruz) and reduce it to a lab-built war machine. The film is for demented viewers or kids willing to mistake it for one of their video games. What pushed the nice and committed Van Peebles (even producer!) Elsewhere in this indefinable "effort" is a mystery.

title: The Badlanders
actors: Alan Ladd, Ernest Borgnine, Katy Jurado, Claire Kelly, Kent Smith
description: Two former detainees arrive in a border town, where however they are badly received. One of them proposes a deal to a local buccaneer, who tries to trick him, even going so far as to use weapons to get him out of the way. The two react and a shooting ensues ...
notes: Daves had the idea of ??remaking John Huston's masterpiece in a western key _Jungla d'asfalto_. The result is this film, which has an excellent cast and excellent direction on its side. There is no shortage of all the strong ingredients of the genre: manly feelings, courage and trigger-happy men. Under the inevitable "happy ending" a certain melancholy and a streak of pessimism emerge.

title: The Rage
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Gary Busey, Roy Scheider
description: There's something rotten inside the FBI: Dean Taggert swore it to Special Agent Nick Travis because of an action gone wrong. Now, however, a madman is circulating around: a Vietnam veteran who has built his own handsome army, sowing deaths, violence and terror. Taggert, convinced that he is not doing him a favor, chooses Nick for the delicate mission. And, not satisfied, he puts a woman next to him, capable, but without experience.
notes: The action film can be seen, thanks above all to the skill of another veteran, the Sidney J. Furie of "A Ovest di Sonora", "Entity" and "Ipcress" who, for the occasion, dusts off his entire repertoire. . Few chances, however, for the rest of the troop, where Lorenzo Lamas "stands out", who brings to mind that line of Ionesco: "All men are actors, except for some actors".

title: The Island
actors: Michael Caine, David Warner, Angela Punch McGregor
description: Have you ever heard of the infamous "Bermuda Triangle"? Well, an English reporter (Caine) is determined to solve the mystery. After numerous hardships, however, he finds himself the prisoner of a band of crazy individuals who consider themselves heirs of the ancient buccaneers who infested the Antilles.
notes: It always hurts to find a good actor's name in absolutely negligible films.

title: Fire Down Below
actors: Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum, Jack Lemmon, Herbert Lom
description: Tony and Felix are smugglers in the sea of ??the Antilles and are great friends, although they have opposite characters. The first is romantic and passionate, the second is cynical and evil. Friendship and mutual business end badly when the two fall in love with the same woman, Irina, a Polish refugee with a troubled past. Which of the two will your choice fall on?
notes: The film, which screenwriter Irvin Shaw intended to be a sort of psychological thriller in flashbacks, is instead a "common" sentimental drama that has its own strengths in the actors.

title: Con Air
actors: Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi, Rachel Ticotin
description: Con Air is an airplane that every year transports criminals who must be tried, hospitalized or transferred to other prisons. When a group of the most dangerous and well-known prisoners in the US prison system is about to be transferred to a maximum security prison, Cameron Poe, bailed out, gets a ride on the plane. Cameron is eager to see his wife again and does not want to miss his daughter's eighth birthday, but remains involved in the hijacking by Cyrus "The Virus" Grissom.
notes: Gased by the success of "The Rock", the Hollywood creators of explosive mixtures with high noise pollution, they step on the accumulation pedal. And so the bad guys become six, eight, ten; and the good ones at least two, even if marked by small shades of the heart. The result is a sort of videogame in which the categorical order is: "Smash everything you come across!". The parody by Anthony Hopkins of "The Silence of the Lambs" made by Steve Buscemi is irresistible.

title: Fuzz
actors: Burt Reynolds, Raquel Welch, Tom Skerritt, Jack Weston, James McEachin, Yul Brynner
description: After killing a policeman, a gang of killers kills, one after another, some high-ranking Boston officials. Unpredictably, a not-so-reassuring squad of cops will defeat the criminals. Interesting to see how this happens.
notes: Between irony and rhythm, a fairly original story in which comedy alternates with dramatic moments. But we are at the beginning of the 70s: there is a desire to demystify the figures of authority and to renew old clichés of classic Hollywood cinema. The screenplay is by Evan Hunter (better known as Ed McBain) who derived it from his novel

title: Desert Legion
actors: Alan Ladd, Richard Conte, Arlene Dahl, Akim Tamiroff
description: Paul Lartal is a legionnaire who survived an ambush. He manages to save himself and heal thanks to the loving daughter of the governor of Madara. But the "bad guy" also lives in the governor's palace, with whom the young Paul ends up clashing. Lively but too naive, a rather dated adventure film.

title: Forest Warrior
actors: Chuck Norris, William Sanderson, Terry Kiser, Max Gail, Roscoe Lee Browne
description: An inaccessible mountain hides a fairytale landscape in its intricate forests where time seems to have stopped. But this pristine paradise is about to be threatened by progress and speculation that wants to ruin everything. At this point, the Lords of the mountains intervene, protectors of these places for centuries, who will guide the population to regain what they thought was lost forever.
notes: Chuck Norris, directed by his brother Aaron for the occasion, is the protagonist of this work with clear ecological ideas. However, the splendid natural sceneries that form the background to the story do not manage to revive the fortunes of the film.

title: Day of the Outlaw
actors: Robert Ryan, Burl Ives, Tina Louise, Nehimiah Persoff, Jack Lambert
description: The Bhrun gang terrifies and conditions the existence of the town where Blaise, a ranch owner, lives. Who, forced to lead Bhrun and his people towards a pass, actually leads the bandits to a mountainous and inhospitable area.
notes: A series B western perhaps not too original, but with a fair proof of direction

title: The Spikes Gang
actors: Lee Marvin, Gary Grimes, Ron Howard, Charlie Martin
description: Three cowboys, influenced by Henry Spikes, decide to follow him to try their luck. After the first failed shots, the bandits die one after the other. Only Henry is saved at first, but in a firefight he is wounded and falls along the railroad tracks.

title: Scream
actors: David Arquette, Drew Barrymore, Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox
description: Sidney is faced with something that overcomes her teenage crises. In fact, her mother was murdered a year earlier, her father is always absent for work and her boyfriend Billy is pushing her to run away from home. A serial killer who has started terrorizing the city using his passion for horror films also puts himself in it. Using all his knowledge on the subject, he plays with his victims and manages to mislead the police.
notes: The film is between the joke and the exercise on fear: a child's play that immediately reveals itself as a real, bloody nightmare race. The irony eases the tension, but the great night finale is enthralling. "Theoretical" film that relaunched Craven and generated various apocryphal and non-apocryphal sequels. The principal is Harry "Fonzie" Winkler.

title: Air Force One
actors: Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Wendy Crewson
description: James Marshall, President of the United States, known for his determination to fight terrorists is holding a conference congratulating the capture of the dangerous General Radek, a dictator who terrorizes a state born from the dissolution of the Soviet empire. While the President is flying on Air Force One with his wife and daughter, the plane is hijacked by a group of terrorists loyal to General Radek.
notes: Clear model: "Delta Force" with Chuck Norris, crossed with massive doses of familiar-popular sentimentality at the "Airport" and demented touches (who knows if volunteers) at the "Craziest Plane in the World". A well thought-out action toy, unfortunately slowed down by the Teutonic grandeur of Wolfgang Petersen, who continues to be in love with U-Boats (even if of the air) and pompous state meetings. It is useless to dwell on ideological narrow-mindedness, when cinematic narrow-mindedness is so irremediable.

title: Contact
actors: Jodie Foster, Matthew McConaughey, James Woods, David Morse
description: As a child, Ellie Arroway would get up at night to listen to her shortwave radio with the hope of picking up mysterious voices.
