After her father's death she devotes herself to science, which seems to her capable of giving those answers that have always tormented her. At university, her unanswered questions prompted her to specialize in finding messages sent by extraterrestrial beings. Despite the skepticism that surrounds her, Ellie holds firm to her convictions. Until one day ...
notes: In the final part, "Contact" reveals all its splendor, thanks to the millions of dollars spent that give twenty minutes of authentic magical atmosphere up there, somewhere in the universe, where maybe you can find your loved ones walking on the beaches Florida type. The main flaw of the operation is to prepare a religious-scientific-new age cocktail without paying too much attention to measuring the ingredients. In short, the air of "Contact" is too cold, but the journey nevertheless deserves to be conducted and completed.

title: O.P. Center
actors: Harry Hamlin, Carl Weathers, Rod Steiger
description: A KGB colonel seizes a nuclear device, twenty-five times more powerful than the one used on Hiroshima during the Second World War. His intent is to obtain the largest possible sum and therefore he places the "booty" on the international market. Meanwhile in Washington, other power games and other intrigues. They too are covered by the most total secrecy. How will it end ?.
notes: Action film that unfolds in a somewhat schematic and rather predictable way. Among the performers the always good Rod Steiger.

title: Men in Black
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio
description: K. and J. are the "men in black" at the service of an unofficial but funded government agency that deals with everything related to illegal immigration of aliens to Earth. In fact, the extraterrestrials have long since arrived on our planet, they live among us and have taken on different appearances.
notes: Inspired by Lowell Cunningham's strip of the same name, the film is a game about the need for cohabitation between different races. Because after all, even men in black have a heart and are fond of the monsters with whom they have been dealing and collaborating for years. Underneath, it is also a bitter game, in which individuals can be tolerant but people cannot, and it is good to keep them in the dark. Sonnenfeld keeps a flawless pace, mixes genres well (science fiction, detective and comedy) and quotes with measure and irony. Extraordinary the aliens.

title: Captain Pirate
actors: Louis Hayward, Patricia Medina, John Sutton
description: Captain Blood has abandoned his adventurous life as a privateer on seas around the world to pursue a career as a doctor while continuing to help people in need. But one day he learns that a pirate is using his identity to commit criminal acts. Thus he gathers his old companions, arms a brig and collides with his opponent.
notes: Mid-level US production with good performers, it is a sort of ideal sequel to "Captain Blood".

title: The Lost World
actors: Jeff Goldblum, Vince Vaughn, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite
description: The dinosaurs, locked up in the "Jurassic Park" had fled causing panic. Now a group of scientists led by Dr. Malcolm, documentary maker Owen, paleontologist Harding and specialist Car are investigating what may have happened.
notes: Maybe because a sequel is expected less and less, but the second part of "Jurassic Park" is not bad. The first part is nice and compact, the second, in the city, mentions the 50s B series and is more obvious.

title: Face/Off
actors: John Travolta, Nicolas Cage, Joan Allen, Gina Gershon, Dominique Swain, Alessandro Nivola, Nick Cassavetes, Harve Presnell, Colm Feore, John Carroll Lynch, CCH Pounder, Robert Wisdom, Margaret Cho, James Denton
description: Sean Archer is an FBI agent who is confronted by Castor Troy during a police action, a dangerous terrorist in possession of a deadly bomb, and who in a previous action killed his son. One day an accident sends the terrorist into a coma and this allows Sean, thanks to a surgery, to take the form of him to try to neutralize the bomb. The criminal, however, comes out of the coma and makes the pair by settling in Archer's office ...
notes: In reality, "Face / Off" is a horror melo that uses the charm of action, the contrast between slow motion and sudden explosions of the editing, to explode all internal anger and tension. The faces split: Travolta-Archer takes that of Cage-Troy and vice versa, the life (of others) is a trap to master or a revenge to savor. Woo has an energy and strength in action that are now rare. Comparable only to what Peckinpah had thirty years ago.

title: Captain Lightfoot
actors: Rock Hudson, Barbara Rusch, Jeff Morrow, Kathleen Ryan
description: Ireland 1815: John Faherty, leader of the rebels, runs a gambling house to finance the autonomist struggle. With him is Mike, the aide to whom John, injured in a clash with the police, entrusts the task of directing the movement until his recovery. But Faherty's refuge is discovered and while John manages to escape, Mike is imprisoned. At the urging of his girlfriend, the plan is triggered to free him.
notes: Ireland is going strong in this period, cinematically speaking. But it was also a tasty dish in 1955, the year of this film seasoned by Sirk, the cook of melodramas, with skill and knowledge of twists.

title: Vamp
actors: Grace Jones, Chris Makepeace, Sandy Baron, Robert Rusler
description: Two guys, to join their college association, undertake to get a stripper for the next student party. How to find it? Of course by going to one of the clubs where the girls perform. And obviously entering the wrong one, run by vampires, and ending up in the "clutches" of a beautiful woman accustomed to sucking the blood of her clients. So one of the two students disappears and the research begins ...
notes: The trend is the one inaugurated by John Landis, with his "An American werewolf in London". Here is Grace Jones, who actually doesn't work very well as a sexy horror vamp.

title: Sudden Death
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Powers Boothe, Raymond J. Barry
description: Darren McCord is a fire officer separated from his wife and with a trauma related to a mission a few years ago. Now he is assigned to the civic arena, where a hockey match is about to take place which will also be attended by the vice president of the United States. Joshua Foss is instead a criminal who intends to kidnap the vice president to obtain a large ransom. When Foss manages to put his plan into action, McCord immediately takes action.
notes: Haven't we seen each other before? The protagonist with a trauma in the past who today can redeem himself from the accusation of cowardice. The villain who was once part of the state apparatus. Bombs placed in a stadium during the final. The hero's daughter who remains in the hands of the villain, while the police do nothing because she is made up of incapable or corrupt. Yes, we had already met.

title: Virtuosity
actors: Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Kelly Lynch, Stephen Spinella
description: We are in the future and Sid 6.7 is a unit made up of two hundred different personalities of dangerous criminals, mixed together, used to train police officers. However Sid, tired of bits and bytes, decides to leave cyberspace to devote himself to the murder of men in flesh and blood. The only one who seems to be able to face and defeat him is Parker Barnes, a former cop who ended up in jail for executing the killer of his wife and daughter.
notes: Usual clash between Good and Evil against the backdrop of a late millennium Los Angeles (we are in fact in 1999). The director is Brett Leonard who had directed "Il taglaierbe" with Pierce Brosnan.

title: Assault on Dome 4
actors: Bruce Campbell, Joseph Culp, Jocelyn Seagrave, Brion Jones
description: Life flows quietly on a small artificial planet used as a scientific laboratory and positioned in the most unknown and mysterious space. The plant is equipped with the most sophisticated equipment, but this does not prevent a group of criminals, taking advantage of the poor defensive systems, from being able to penetrate. It will be the agent Morran, who happened to be on the planet by chance, to try to save the situation.
notes: Evocative and realistic scenarios are the backdrop to this science fiction film signed by Gilbert Po. In the cast Bruce Campbell, actor favorite of Sam Raimi, and Joseph Culp seen in "Glow in the dark".

title: A Lawless Street
actors: Randolph Scott, Angela Lansbury, Jean Parker, Wallace Ford
description: In a country of the Deep West some men, rich and unscrupulous, try in every way to impose their dominance, but their aims are vigorously opposed by the sheriff, a man of goodness, but with an excellent aim. To eliminate him, a certain Dingo Brion is hired, who tries to take him out while he is at the barber shop. But the sheriff manages to get away with killing the hitman. In the meantime Town, the manager of the theater, has got in touch with a company of attotes and dancers that he intends to debut as soon as possible.
notes: From one of the masters of the American B series, a minor film pulled away even if with excellent actors. For enthusiasts only.

title: Dirty Little Billy
actors: Michael J. Pollard, Lee Purcell, Charles Aidman, Richard Evans
description: Billy the Kid, the young bandit who terrorized the Far West at the end of the nineteenth century, is at the center of this unusual biography shot almost entirely in the mud.
notes: Yet another and very tired variation on the biography of the famous bandit.

title: Cleopatra Jones
actors: Tamara Dobson, Bernie Casey, Brenda Sykes, Antonio Fargas
description: Cleopatra Jones is a beautiful mulatto, special agent in the service of the president of the United States. He must fight against Mamie, who runs a drug trade. The woman, fresh from Turkey, where she had an opium poppy plantation destroyed, lands in New York and immediately finds herself facing her bitter enemy. But our special agent also has to contend with Purdy, a dishonest cop.
notes: Action and chases in this "all black" film of absolute routine. The following year there was also a sequel entitled "Operation Golden Casino".

title: From Hell to Texas
actors: Don Murray, Diana Varsi, Chill Wills, Dennis Hopper
description: Young Lohman is unjustly accused by Hunter Boyd of killing one of his sons. To escape his revenge the boy runs away; but Hunter, with a host of men in tow, pursues him. Aided by a fellow Bradley and then by other people, Lohman is forced to kill for real. The showdown takes place during a fire in which another of Boyd's children is about to die. Lohman will be the one to throw himself into the flames to save him ...
notes: From such a master, a large fresco on the primordial impulses of man. The scenario is the fantastic one of the border.

title: Anaconda
actors: Jennifer Lopez, Ice Cube, Jon Voight, Eric Stoltz, Jonathan Hyde
description: A film crew, armed with cameras and recorders, penetrates the Amazon rainforest to make a documentary on the Shirishama Indians. Along the way, they come across Paul Sarone (Jon Voight), who is stuck aboard an unmanned boat. A solitary man, but full of charisma and completely at ease in the forest, Paul wins their friendship and does everything to persuade them to go down the river. The adventurer is engaged in his own personal and dark mission: to hunt down a fearsome twelve-meter long anaconda.
notes: It's embarrassing to see what cinema can be capable of at its worst and "Anaconda" is one of them. Conceived as a herpetological version of Spielberg's shark, "Anaconda" soon moves away from it, increasingly resembling the false documentary film of "Cannibal Holocaust" by Ruggero Deodato. The film therefore fluctuates between ridicule and boredom and it is useless to try to ennoble it with the citation of Herzog's "Fitzcarraldo", with the expedition boat accompanied on its journey on the river of the notes of Verdi's "Don Carlos".

title: Trick or Treat
actors: Marc Price, Tony Fields, Lisa Orgolin, Doug Savant, Ozzy Osbourne
description: Sammi Curr, an American rock star, dies during a fire. Eddie, who nurtures a real cult for the deceased singer, receives from a friend of his, the director of a private radio station, the matrix of the last album recorded by the rock star that will be broadcast on Halloween night. Eddie takes it home slowly spins it backwards and discovers that the tape is hiding a message that Sammi left him. For the boy begins a series of hallucinating adventures.
notes: Directorial debut for Charles Martin Smith (actor in "American Graffiti") who mixes, without too much originality, horror, comedy and music.

title: Bengal Brigade
actors: Rock Hudson, Arlene Dahl, Dan O'Herlihy, Ursula Thiess
description: A battalion of English soldiers falls into the ambush that is set by the rebels. The Court-Martial blames the defeat on Captain Claybourne, who is demoted. Though innocent, Claybourne breaks off his engagement with Vivian, the daughter of Colonel Morrow, and decides to stay in India as a bourgeois. When he discovers that Rajah Karam is plotting against the British, he tries to thwart the plans of the conspirators.
notes: Rock Hudson appears awkward in a pompous and almost ridiculous film. He directs with little conviction Laszlo Benedek author, in the same year, of "The wild".

title: K 2
actors: Michael Biehn, Matt Craven, Hiroshi Fujioka, Annie Grindlay
description: Taylor and Harold are great climbers and great friends. During an expedition, they meet a man whose intent is to reach the summit of K2, the second highest peak in the world but the first for climbing difficulties. The two join him and face the most difficult undertaking of their life. However, both aspire to the lead role, and a deep rivalry will develop between them, which will jeopardize the success of the expedition.
notes: Inconsistent as an intertwining and unsatisfactory as an environmental yield.

title: Damnation Alley
actors: Jan-Michael Vincent, George Peppard, Dominique Sanda
description: The outbreak of World War III, triggered by a sudden launch of missiles with nuclear warheads against the largest cities in the United States, had dire consequences. The Earth, largely radioactive, has shifted from its axis and has become semi-desert and now uninhabitable. Among the few survivors of the catastrophe are Air Force Major Sam Denton and three of his men who, leaving the bunker where they are locked up, go in search of other potential survivors.
notes: The script is too thin despite a respectable international cast.

title: White Feather
actors: Robert Wagner, Debra Paget, John Lund, Jeffrey Hunter
description: The Washington government begins negotiations with the leaders of the Indian tribes occupying the territory of the state of Wyoming to induce them to evacuate. The intention of the government is to sell it to the gold diggers and, for this purpose, a young surveyor is sent. While the chiefs of most tribes would prefer war to accepting a treaty, Old Cheyenne leader Broken Hand proves against it. Routine Western, with a cast of well-known faces.

title: Pagemaster
actors: Macaulay Culkin, Christopher Lloyd, Ed Begley jr., Mel Harris
description: Richard Tyler is a little boy who is afraid of everything, he is also afraid to go up to the little house that dad Alan built for him on the tree in the garden. Surprised by a violent storm while on his way to buy nails with his super-equipped bicycle, to avoid trouble he enters a huge library. Here the librarian, Mr. Dewey, gives him a card that ends up turning him into a cartoon. In this new state he meets Pagemaster, lord of the library, who invites him to face three tests, to get out of it.
notes: Joe Johnston ("Jumanji") directs the part with real actors, while Maurice Hunt is reserved to direct the cartoon film. The result, however, is weak on both fronts.

title: Volcano
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Anne Heche, Don Cheadle, Keith David
description: In the middle of Los Angeles an underground volcano suddenly explodes causing destruction and death in Hollywood. Mike Roark (Jones) must coordinate the effort of the firefighters and national guard to prevent the massive lava flow engulfing the city. Helping him is Amy Barnes (Heche), a seismology engineer.
notes: Sure, the special effects are amazing and pyrotechnic, Jones has grit and in a couple of scenes the tension builds. Still, "Vulcan" doesn't work all the way. Probably the fault of a dilated action that lacks real strengths and, certainly, of a script that develops (once again) on the slender physiognomies and on the repetitive rhythms typical of the show.

title: The Horsemen
actors: Omar Sharif, Leigh Taylor-Young, Jack Palance, Peter Jeffrey
description: The best horsemen of Afghanistan arrive in Kabul to take part in the "Royal Burkask", a traditional competition that consists of fighting, on horseback and armed with a whip, the carcass of a kid. Take part in the race Uraz, son of the chieftain Tursen, determined to emulate the exploits of his father, multiple winner of the competition. But the young man falls badly and breaks his leg. To redeem himself in the eyes of his father, Uraz decides to return to his tribe through a rough road. Based on a screenplay by Dalton Trumbo, it is a curious hard and melancholy adventure film, very 70s.

title: Titanic
actors: Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates, Gloria Stuart, Frances Fisher, Bill Paxton, Danny Nucci, Victor Garber, Bernard Hill
description: A crew tries to recover a diamond from the wreck of the Titanic, and goes to the only survivor. Flashback. Rose is a young aristocrat who travels in the first class of the Titanic, while Jack is a handsome, penniless painter who sails crammed into third class. The two will no longer be able to leave and challenge social conventions to the last. Meanwhile the Titanic sinks.
notes: Blue and red mark a heartfelt and majestic film that reaches the spirit (of time, of people, of ambitions) through an unbridled love for physicality. Cameron has a rightfully mythical sense of tragedy and a deeply human sense of his times. The last 90 minutes are built with a magnificent, underground surge of tension. The love story that acts as a leitmotif (the most fragile link in the film) reflects the social and human tensions that were the background to the tragedy. And Kate Winslet's character dominates, dubious, sensual and absolute protagonist.

title: Event Horizon
actors: Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson
description: The "Event Horizon" spaceship, which functions like a black hole, generating a powerful space-time deformation with its propeller, disappears during the maiden voyage, only to reappear seven years later near Neptune. However, there is no longer any sign of life, and the crew of the "Lewis & Clark" must investigate what happened in there. The spaceship, in its journey through the dark side of the universe, has become an organism capable of materializing the most atrocious fears and nightmares.
notes: A story that plays with dèjà vu themes and atmospheres from "The Shining" and "Alien" (in addition to the "Forbidden Planet" and "Solaris"), and when it fails to keep up the suspense, Richard's masterful visual effects come to the rescue. Yuricich.

title: The Revengers
actors: William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Woody Strode, Susan Hayward
description: John Benedict, former captain of the northern army, is determined to avenge the death of his wife and four children killed by Tarp, a ferocious bandit. The outlaw with a group of whites and comaches hides in Pueblo Plata, a ruined city in the mountains of Mexico. To carry out his revenge John with the excuse of offering them a job, he takes from a prison, you are among the most cruel and heinous criminals. The seven men attack Tarp's gang, but Tarp manages to escape.
notes: Daniel Mann wastes an excellent cast with sloppy directing. With this film Susan Hayward bids farewell to the scenes.

title: The Jackal
actors: Bruce Willis, Richard Gere, Sidney Poitier, Diane Venora
description: A criminal organization hires a killer to eliminate the American First Lady.
notes: "What's her name?" Richard Gere asks Diane Venora. "Koslova". "And in name?" «Major ...»: the best line of the film, a remake (certainly inferior) of _The day of the jackal_ by Fred Zinnemann.

title: Frank and Jesse
actors: Dana Wheeler Nicholson, Rob Lowe, Bill Paxton, Randy Travis, Maria Pitillo
description: Back home after the terrible experience of the civil war, brothers Frank and Jessie James see their younger brother killed by a railroad agent who had been paid for the sale of the family land. Faced with the indifference of the Northerners, who support the interests of the via ferrata, Jessie decides to do justice for herself. Together with Frank and the Younger brothers, he forms a band of rebels who oppose the atrocities committed by Union soldiers. Their assaults provoke the harsh reaction of the Nordists, who hire the private investigator Pinkerton to track them down. The hunt for the latter will turn into a deadly war.

title: Mercenary
actors: Olivier Gruner, John Ritter, Robert Culp, Ed Lauter, Michael Zelniker
description: To settle the score with Vassili Borfchenko, an international terrorist who accidentally killed his wife in an attack, the wealthy businessman Jonas Ambler hires the mercenary Carl Hawk May, former captain of the special assault troops. The wanted man is a former Red Army officer who, after the collapse of the USSR, gathered the men of his squad of elite soldiers, transforming the latter into a combat unit in the service of the highest bidder. His lair is located in a Middle Eastern country: and it is that Ambler and May disembark here, determined to break into the Borfchenko base by any means ...

title: Destry
actors: Audie Murphy, Maru Blanchard, Thomas Mitchell
description: Joe Bailey is the sheriff of a typical village in the West. One bad day Joe is killed in Decker's saloon, the village boss. In place of Bailey the drunkard Ray Barnaby is appointed who appoints the young Tom Destry as his deputy, reluctant to use weapons. Decker has his eye on Shinner's farm. By cheating him in the game, Decker seizes his lands, but when Shinner locks himself in his house weapons in hand, Destry must intervene.
notes: Quite anomalous for the times, this discreet western focuses its cards on the contrast between legality and brute violence.

title: Magic in the Water
actors: Mark Harmon, Joshua Jackson, Harley Jane Kozak, Sarah Wayne
description: Did you know that Nessie, the very famous Scottish Loch Ness monster, has a relative in America? If the answer is no "Magic in the lake" shows you that you are ignorant because a Canadian village on the shores of a lake is making a fortune with Orky, a species of water dragon that everyone talks about, but that no one has ever seen and that in any case attracts crowded area of ??tuiristi. What nobody has been able to do, on the other hand, happens to a family in Seattle, a father and two children, who are temporarily in an emotional crisis. Precisely the encounter with the good aquatic snake will give all the right stimuli to see reality under another aspect.
notes: For simple souls, but with good special effects.

title: The Postman
actors: Kevin Costner, Will Patton, Olivia Williams, James Russo
description: In 2013 the world is an arid expanse due to a nuclear war. The survivors live barricaded inside the forts, because outside there is an army of brutal warriors (the Holnists) led by a former yuppie self-proclaimed dictator. Fortunately, there is also a lonely wanderer around who first turns into "hero by chance".
notes: Western sceneries from the new frontier, horses galloping in the prairies, open skies like John Ford and bad Scespirians. The anthem, bordering on anarchy, had all the credentials to please Americans above all. Instead, Costner's moralism, still in debt for "Waterworld", is hackneyed and the adventure is never engaging. He wanted to go against the grain, but ends up being conventional, bland and pathetic.

title: Alien Resurrection
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Winona Ryder, Dominique Pinon, Brad Dourif
description: Two hundred years have passed and a difficult cloning experiment is being successfully completed on the spaceship Auriga. Clone 8, or the new Ripley, is not only alive and kicking, but in the operation she had an abortion that separated her from the alien fetus she carried inside. But there's something weird Ripley doesn't remember anything from her past and she's gotten worse and there's a scientist conducting weird experiments.
notes: Jeunet, although openly disinterested in the action part of the film (which is in fact the weakest), found himself at home in the technological-crumbling tunnels of the Auriga space base, among the unsuccessful clones, the laboratory monsters, in the alien nursery "implanted" in humans. The film is marked by its very black sense of the grotesque and, of course, by the dominant presence of Sigourney Weaver, a heroine returned from the realm of the dead, now "changed", withered and gloomy, capable of an almost carnal relationship with the alien (who, after all, it is flesh of his flesh). Her obstinacy to protect humanity (she who is no longer human) almost consigns her to tragedy.

title: Relic
actors: Penelope Ann Miller, Tom Sizemore, Linda Hunt
description: In the meanders of the Chicago Museum of Natural History, a frightening creature from Brazil wanders, the result of magical rituals and genetic experiments that feeds on human hypothalamus. The multiform monster manifests itself in all its voracity during a party given inside the Museum during a black out. But an enterprising scientist and a portly, superstitious, animal-rights policeman take matters into their own hands.
notes: It is halfway between "The X Files" and the catastrophic, but it has neither the enveloping atmosphere of the former, nor the devastating spectacle of the latter. On the other hand, it is cunning and simplistic enough not to irritate anyone. Penelope Ann Miller and Tom Sizemore are nice, normal, and hasty enough to keep up a story without mystery. Director Peter Hyams did better, and worse.

title: Sky Riders
actors: James Coburn, Susannah York, Robert Culp, Charles Aznavour
description: A group of terrorists kidnap the wife of an American industrialist and her two children in Athens. The place where the abductees are hidden is an abandoned monastery, built on top of a mountain and heavily guarded. The only way to reach it without making noise is to use hang gliders. Action movie from the era of the "Wild Goose" and "Where Eagles Dare". Fracassone, macho and so far-fetched as to seem ironic.

title: Drive
actors: Kadeem Hardison, Mark Dacascos, John Pyper-Ferguson
description: San Francisco: on an unspecified day in the not too distant future, the mysterious Toby Wong disembarks from a ship coming from Hong Kong. Toby is escaping from the emissaries of the powerful Leung Corporation and, as soon as he disembarks, he is immediately followed by a group of thugs led by the icy Vic Madison. Involved, despite himself, in the chase, the drunkard Malik finds himself inextricably linked to Wong. With him she will have to try to defend herself from Madison's violence and from the obscure maneuvers hatched by Mr. Lu, head of the Leung Corporation. Malik will not be long in discovering the reason for so much fury towards Toby.

title: Starship Troopers
actors: Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards, Michael Ironside, Dina Meyer
description: In the not too distant future, our planet will fight a terrible battle against an alien race of giant insects. But let's take a step back, when the war had not yet broken out and Johnny Rico, out of high school, decided to enlist in the space infantry. Just on the eve of the invasion of the astromonsters ...
notes: Fifties Hollywood science fiction revisited by Paul Verhoeven, this time more ironic than usual. Cast consisting of Big Jim and Barbie-like actors, all treated with considerable acidity. The fake news programs are memorable, a symptom of "American" idiocy destined to dominate the world.

title: Spawn
actors: Melinda Clark, Martin Sheen, Theresa Randle, Michael Jai White, John Leguizamo
description: Five years after being murdered by American intelligence colleagues, Al Simmons makes a pact with the devil to return to earth and see Wanda, the woman of his life. Al is resurrected in the guise of Spawn, a knight of darkness with a disfigured face with the task of leading the devil's army in the destruction of the human race.
notes: Based on the comic of the same name designed by Todd McFarlane, the frilm vaguely resembles "The Crow", a cult film also derived from a comic strip. But it completely lacks that dark atmosphere that was the winning feature of "The Crow", replaced by a riot of digital effects. Among the performers, a Martin Sheen has become a caricature of himself.

title: Transformation
actors: Anthony Barnao, Michael C. Hennessy, Lisa Langlois, Patrick Macnee
description: An intergalactic pilot tries to block the spread of a deadly virus that could lead to the destruction of all life in the Universe.
notes: Jay Kamen's film belongs more to that kind of films than to the science fiction genre that mix the least worst science fiction and horror. It is better not to talk about the actors, as well as the direction. Real cinema is, fortunately, something else.

title: Gattaca
actors: Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman, Jude Law, Gore Vidal, Xander Berkeley, Jayne Brook, Elias Koteas, Maya Rudolph, Una Damon, Elizabeth Dennehy, Blair Underwood, Mason Gamble, Vincent Nielson, Chad Christ, William Lee Scott
description: In the near future, Vincent is determined to rebel against his genetic fate which condemns him to a bleak and dreamless life. Since he was a child he discovered that he was different, from the day he learned that the world he lives in is dominated by beings conceived in test tubes. This species also includes his brother Anton who possesses the genes of success and an iron health. Quite the opposite of Vincent which is the typical example of genetic inferiority.
notes: The fascinating film written and directed by the young Niccol plays on the differences between "valid" and "invalid", with Ethan Hawke who dreams of impossible astral shores and social emancipations that can only be reached through "fiscal" fraud and psychophysical mutations. The icy and Hitchcokian Uma Thurman discovers the trick, but decides to love the boy anyway, also because passion really broke out on the convict set.

title: Drango
actors: Jeff Chandler, Joanne Dru, Julie London, Donald Crisp
description: After the Civil War, a northern major is sent by the military government to a small town in the South, where he fought during the conflict. Its task is to help the population to re-establish, where possible, the bases of civil coexistence. The open hostility and hatred of the citizens, who have not forgotten the suffering inflicted on them, make the major's peace mission extremely difficult. A man, who openly sided with the northerners and killed in self-defense, is lynched, despite promises of a fair trial.

title: Souls at Sea
actors: Gary Cooper, George Raft, Frances Dee, Henry Wilcoxon
description: Towards the middle of the nineteenth century, an English sailor fought with all his might against slavery, declared illegal by the British crown, out of a humanitarian spirit. For this he is hired by the secret services who entrust him with the mission of intercepting a large cargo en route to America. On the ship he meets a girl, with whom he falls in love, the sister of an officer involved in traffic. Due to a misunderstanding he ends up on trial, but the happy end is only postponed.
notes: Dear, good old Hollywood, with its stars of perpetual charm, the races on the seas, a rhythm to the story that never misses a beat and many good luxury craftsmen behind the camera.

title: Sphere
actors: Dustin Hoffman, Sharon Stone, Peter Coyote, Samuel L. Jackson
description: A psychologist, a biologist and a brilliant mathematician are sent to the bottom of the sea to investigate a vessel covered with centenary corals. The boat was responsible for the breaking of a submarine cable that suddenly comes back to the surface. Inside the wreck, which is later discovered to come from an alien planet, an enigmatic sphere is found that exerts an inexplicable attraction on the components of the expedition.
notes: . Sewn together by Crichton's intelligence and scientific plausibility (rewritten by Paul Attanasio) and resting on the shoulders of a group of actors who manage to never lose their sense of proportion, a solid example of sceince-fiction. Its 133 minutes run smoothly, despite the fact that it takes place in a literally "sealed" environment. Beautiful underwater sequences of jellyfish and eggs, "humanistic" ending (which recalls, with an equal and opposite movement, that of "Excalibur").

title: Escape from New York
actors: Kurt Russell, Lee Van Cleef, Ernest Borgnine, Donald Pleasence, Harry Dean Stanton, Adrienne Barbeau
description: In the very near future the entire city of New York, now ungovernable and prey to metropolitan gangs of bandits, is transformed into a huge prison from which no one can escape. But it happens that the presidential plane, hijacked by a group of terrorists, crashes on the city. Saved by a special capsule, the first citizen of America is taken hostage by the gang of the "Duke" who, in exchange, asks for his freedom. The police then infiltrate Jena Plinski, who must complete her mission in just 24 hours.
notes: From an action film and thriller specialist like Carpenter you expect exactly what the film proposes: breathtaking pace, great emotions, apocalyptic vision. A classic of modern science fiction.

title: Tarzan's Peril
actors: Lex Barker, Virginia Huston, George Macready, Douglas Fowley
description: Radijeck, a shady slave and arms dealer, is arrested following Tarzan's intervention, but the prisoner, taking advantage of the police commissioner's absence, manages to escape. With a load of weapons Radijeck, with the complicity of two partners, gets in touch with the Yorango tribe who is willing to do business with him.
notes: Tarzan's first adventure filmed in Africa (to be precise in Kenya). Filming took place in the winter and the trained monkeys brought from Hollywood were unable to move due to the cold so the parts about Citah were cut.

title: Treasure Island
actors: Wallace Beery, Jackie Cooper, Lewis Stone, Lionel Barrymore
description: Dying Captain Bones gives Jim Hawkins a map with directions to where Captain Flint's treasure is buried. Little Jim leaves with the Hispaniola to reach the remote island, but as soon as he disembarks he has to deal with a group of pirates commanded by Long John Silver.
notes: One of the best transpositions of Robert Louis Stevenson's novel. Great interpretation by Wallace Beery. There is a colorized version.

title: Conquest of Cochise
actors: John Hodiak, Robert Stack, Joy Page, Rico Alaniz, Fortunio Bonanova
description: Cochise, chief of a tribe of Apaches, realizes the futility of the struggles and negotiates with Major Burke, commander of the US troops, to reach the longed-for peace agreement. The nations close to the Comanches, on the other hand, are against any kind of agreement and decide to attack the whites. During the attack, a white woman is killed and her husband takes it into his head to avenge her by shooting at Cochise and his squaw. Series B Wetsern from a horror specialist.

title: Spaced Invaders
actors: Ariana Richards, Douglas Barr, Royal Dano, Gregg Berger
description: Five extraterrestrials are traveling in their spaceship in the depths of space. Their secret destination is the third planet of the star called "sun"; their equally secret mission to conquer the planet. For this purpose, the five "UFOs" land on Earth, right in the vicinity of a quiet town in the United States (who knows why the "Martians" never land in Central Asia or Oceania). Here lives a lively little girl who accidentally comes into contact with the "invaders" who, however, instead of completing the mission, begin to combine all colors. This being the case, the child understands that for our sake (but above all for theirs) it is better to send them back to the sender.

title: Buffalo Bill
actors: Joel McCrea, Maureen O'Hara, Linda Darnell, Anthony Quinn
description: In the firmament of the heroes of the American Westerrn epic, a prominent place undoubtedly belongs to William Frederick Cody, better known as Buffalo Bill for his well-known skills in hunting bison. With modern eyes, his massacres of large cattle appear to be useless slaughters that have put the species at risk of extinction, but at the time (late nineteenth century) ecology was still to be invented. Here then is the blond and scalp Cody to guide the army in the Indian wars and then organize a big circus with a western theme. In private life here is his turbulent relations with his wife (who always forgives him) and with President Grant who instead sends him to ruin.

title: Cannon for Cordoba
actors: George Peppard, Giovanna Ralli, Raf Vallone, Pete Duel
description: Hector Cordoba, a Mexican bandit who usually raids the border towns between Mexico and the United States, is actively sought by the police of both countries. After all attempts to bring him to justice have failed, the Americans instruct Captain Red Douglas to storm the base where the outlaw is hiding. The officer gets help from three soldiers, a Mexican lieutenant and Leonora, a former lover of Cordoba. But once they arrive at their destination, the girl betrays the Americans and informs Cordoba of their intentions ...
notes: An anomalous Western with a detective twist, not of excellent stature but of good strength.

title: DNA
actors: Jürgen Prochnow, Mark Dacascos, Claire Sommers, Robin McKee
description: A group of scientists on an expedition to Borneo finds the remains of a mysterious creature and decides to bring it back to life through DNA. One of them has in fact developed a system that allows you to derive the code through what remains of the bones. The experiment is successful and the scientist who developed the system decides to sell the creature to those who can offer more.
notes: Even a bad film can always maintain its dignity when it tries to tell something; but when we see a movie like this, embarrassing "Predator" rip-off, with a sprinkle of "Jurassic Park" and a wink at Indiana Jones, that shred of dignity has evaporated. Even the special effects, edited by the esteemed professionals of KNB EFX, are wrecked together with a plot already seen and the actors.

title: Pursuit of Honor
actors: Don Johnson, Craig Sheffer, Gabrielle Anwar, Rod Steiger
description: In the mid-thirties the United States was oppressed by a serious economic crisis and the armed forces were also affected by the economic problems that afflict the country. General McArthur in the mood to cut the excessive costs burdening his unit decides to have the excess horses killed. Lieutenant Marsh and Major Libbey disagree and begin an escape across Montana to try and rescue the herd. A TV movie in the classic rural tradition, it is partly saved for the good cast.

title: Double Team
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Dennis Rodman, Paul Freeman, Mickey Rourke
description: Jack is one of the best counterintelligence agents, but he is tired of his profession and has decided to retire to lead a more peaceful existence. In the course of his last mission he misses the mark and in a moment all his certainties suddenly collapse. As punishment he is sent to the Colony, a kind of special team made up of people too dangerous to move and too precious to be killed.
notes: Like John Woo and Ringo Lam, Tsui Hark, a first-rate director and producer, also comes to Hollywood. The subject sways between the seductions of the 1960s TV series "The prisoner" in the first part and those of "Chen's scream terrifies even the West" in the second; but Tsui's directing emphasis fails to sustain a decidedly poor and predictable script.

title: Deep Impact
actors: Robert Duvall, Téa Leoni, Morgan Freeman, Elijah Wood, Vanessa Redgrave
description: Leo has recently joined his high school astronomers club when he makes a dramatic discovery with his small telescope: a comet is on a collision course with Earth. When Jenny, an ambitious journalist, is confronted with the embarrassed responses of a former minister, she believes she has unearthed a pink scandal. But he soon realizes that life on Earth is running out of time.
notes: Between "Independence Day" and "The Day After", the second feature film of Kathryn Bigelow's "granddaughter", Mimi Leder (sponsored by Spielberg), adds nothing to the doomsday scenarios that Hollywood has unleashed in the turn-of-the-millennium.

title: Deep Rising
actors: Treat Williams, Famke Janssen, Anthony Heald, Kevin J. O'Connor, Wes Studi
description: From the unfathomable depths of the South China Sea, hideous creatures emerge that attack and feed on the passengers of the Argonautica, a luxury cruise ship. The voracious sea snakes have besieged every deck, every chamber and transformed the ship into a floating chamber of horrors. To help the ship threatened by a group of terrorists, there is the Saipan. When they dock their boat at the Argonautica and get on board they discover that the boat has become a ghost boat.
notes: After "Titanic" and "Sfera" here are the horrors of "Deep Rising", at low cost and with a lot of open ending.

title: The Macomber Affair
actors: Gregory Peck, Joan Bennett, Robert Preston, Reginald Denny
description: A young American married couple arrives in Africa to take part in a safari. On the spot the two engage the best local hunter and with him begin their adventure. The husband wishes to redeem himself with an act of courage in the eyes of his wife, who does not consider him manly enough.
notes: Taken from the first of Hemingway's "49 tales", the film diverges from the plot of the book in the ending, which is less bitter here. Although not very original, it is a fairly direct and interpreted work.

title: Mimic
actors: Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Alexander Goodwin, Giancarlo Giannini, Josh Brolin
description: An old urban legend told of an albino alligator in the sewer and ravines of the New York subway. Exactly what happens, this time seriously, in the subway that is filled with gigantic insects created by a genetic experiment. The responsible is a scientist (Mira Sorvino) who, with a variously assorted "heroic patrol" has to fight with the ravenous cockroaches, whose main power is that of mimicry.
notes: If the "denied" motherhood of the protagonist (she "gave birth" to the beasts in the laboratory and, almost as a retaliation, she cannot have children) makes so much Aliens (but with less intensity), most of the twists are a bit obvious . but the atmosphere works. And then Guillermo Del Toro uses Rob Bottin's sickening monsters to fill the scene.

title: Rose Hill
actors: Jennifer Garner, Tristan Tait, Zak Orth, Jennifer D. Sams, Justin Chambers
description: In pioneer America, four orphaned brothers form a gang that thrives on wits. One day they steal a wagon to rob it, but inside they find a baby in swaddling clothes. Adam, the eldest, would like to get rid of the tender bundle as he dreams of going West in search of fortune, but the others manage to change his mind.
notes: Even if the Disney brand is missing we are not far from it. Good workmanship, good pace, high professionalism and ... little substance.

title: Gambler from Natchez
actors: Dale Robertson, Debra Paget, Thomas Gomez
description: Vance Colby and arrives in New Orleans where a friend awaits him who should lead him to his father, a famous player. But too many things happen on the way and when Vance arrives at the hotel, he finds his father dead. He begins to carry out investigations that are very tiring.
notes: This film is a real pearl necklace, thanks to which Levin puts the interminable adventures of this character one after the other.

title: Nightwatch
actors: Ewan McGregor, Nick Nolte, Patricia Arquette, Josh Brolin
description: To make ends meet, young law student Martin takes a part-time job as a night watchman in a morgue. But, unfortunately for him, he chose the wrong moment: in fact a serial killer is terrorizing the city; and even more frightening are the clues that continually lead back to him ...
notes: In 1994, the Danish Bornedal directed the same film (in Italy: The Night Watchman) and had an exaggerated notoriety, winning some festival specialized in horror-thrillers. Despite Miramax's money and Steven Soderbergh's collaboration on the script, this remake is a faded photocopy of it.

title: Stagecoach
actors: Ann-Margret, Bing Crosby, Van Heflin
description: A stagecoach, crowded with an extravagant and heterogeneous fauna, crosses Wyoming and is attacked by the Indians. Of course ours are doing badly, but of course something will happen ...
notes: Boring and useless remake of "Red Shadows", John Ford's masterpiece, updated to the cruelest times. Not only is it not even comparable to Ford's film, but it is not Douglas's best western either. The actors (including Crosby in his latest film) aren't exactly bad though.

title: Rainbow
actors: Bob Hoskins, Dan Aykroyd, Willie Lavendahl, Saul Rubinek, Jacob Tierney
description: Mike, a kid from Washington, thinks he can climb the rainbow like a bridge. After a storm he convinces two of his friends to follow him in an attempt to make his dream come true. Chasing the magical reverberation, the three find themselves far from home where, however, finally, one of them manages to take some gold pieces from the rainbow. From that moment on, however, the colors of nature begin to fade ...
notes: Beautiful fairy tale for young and old with two old comedy foxes who have a lot of fun putting on the clever story. The special effects are good and well functional for the purpose.

title: Fallen
actors: Denzel Washington, Donald Sutherland, John Goodman
description: In suburban, nondescript Philadelphia, Detective John Hobbes finds himself facing the devil. It all begins with the execution of Edgard Reese, a serial killer arrested by Hobbes, but in his body actually lives Azazel, a demon able to move freely from one body to another. Having abandoned the now useless body of Reese, the devil mocks Hobbes to the sound of murders and riddles and through a dizzying journey of bodily possessions, haunts him in the deepest affections and tries to discredit him in the eyes of the people.

title: Mr. Stitch
actors: Rutger Hauer, Will Wheaton, Romland Wafford, Nia Peeples
description: Dr. Archibald Rus is the head of a government science agency. His work consists in the experimentation of a surgical system capable of recreating a man made up of parts of eighty different bodies. Lazarus, this is the creature's name, should have neither a will nor a memory; instead he is shocked every night by the horrendous images of the deaths suffered by the owners of the bodies used in his creation.
notes: Second film as director of Roger Avary, screenwriter with Quentin Tarantino of "Pulp Fiction". A television horror, which cannot therefore exceed too much, however well directed.

title: Two Came Back
actors: Melissa Joan Hart, Jon Pennell, Jonathan Brandis, David Gail
description: Susan Clarkson is a twenty-one year old American who, as an expert in sailing boats, decides to change her life. She therefore accepts the skipper assignment that is offered to her: she has to take a boat with five passengers from San Diego to Vancouver. But a miscalculation pushes the boat into the middle of a storm of extraordinary proportions. The crew, the neurotic captain and the passengers run the risk of dying ...
notes: The film is based on a true story, but this of course does not give any guarantee of film quality. Exploiting disasters for cinematic purposes is a hit that very few have succeeded.

title: Blast
actors: Rutger Hauer, Linden Ashby, Andrew Divoff, Kimberly Warren
description: In the London headquarters of the United Nations, some terrorists have captured hostages. While the special team led by Colonel Max Leo tried to save them, an explosion occurred which allowed the commando leader to escape. Obviously there are many victims and among them also Colonel Leo. The attack in Atlanta was similar, during the celebration for the start of the Olympic Games.
notes: Terrorism, especially if international, seems to have solved some problems for US screenwriters. With the cold war over, an enemy continued to serve ... Rutger Hauer, in the role of the colonel, is less convincing than usual.

title: Into the Badlands
actors: Bruce Dern, Mariel Hemingway, Helen Hunt, Andrew Robinson, Dylan McDermott
description: Barston is a bounty hunter who hunts down the unstoppable criminal Red Roundtree. In the course of his search Barston comes across McComas, another thug hunted by Sheriff Starett. Barston lets McComas go and hides in a small border town where he meets and falls in love with Blossom, the saloon girl. The two, both alone and desperate, live a short season of love, but then ...

title: First Strike
actors: Jackie Chan, Jackson Lou, Chen Chun Wu, Bill Tung
description: Jackie is a Hong Kong policeman who is hired by the CIA and a Russian spy organization to track down a stolen nuclear warhead in Ukraine. Our hero thus finds himself having to follow the trail of a corrupt CIA agent and it will be because of him that he will end up in jail on a murder charge. At this point to save his skin he must show all his skills as a fighter.
notes: Even if his name is changed in the Italian and foreign versions, it is still him: the policeman of the successful Hong Kong saga "Police Story", now in its fourth chapter (in Italy we have only seen the third: "Supercop"). He is, of course, Jackie Chan, a strange cross between Terence Hill and Bruce Lee, in the breach for almost thirty years, an Asian star who does not like Hollywood, prefers to direct himself or be directed by the trusted Stanley Tong, strictly without a stunt double (not to be lose, once again, the credits with the wrong takes). A fun Bondian variation, to be enjoyed with tons of popcorn.

title: Bulletproof
actors: Damon Wayans, Adam Sandler, James Caan, Jeep Swenson
description: Moses is a petty car thief who has decided to supplement his income by working for a major drug dealer. When the chance of a lifetime presents itself, he doesn't hesitate to involve Keats, his best friend. But in the midst of buying and selling a large load, it turns out that Keats is an undercover police officer. In the ensuing shooting, Moses unintentionally hits his accomplice ...
notes: If you shoot at random in an action film, _Bulletproof_ hits the mark: a meaningless story, striking for the jumble of scattered genres: comedy, adventure, even a ridiculous attempt to rattle off pearls about friendship.

title: The Command
actors: Guy Madison, Joan Weldon, James Whitmore
description: A U.S. Army cavalry regiment must escort a convoy of pioneers to the inhospitable Indian-dominated lands of Wyoming. When the commander falls ill, the responsibility for the operation passes to the medical officer who, in addition to the hostility and ambushes of the Indians, must face an epidemic of smallpox. As he works among the settlers' wagons he meets the orphan Martha, with whom he falls in love. The decisive confrontation with the Indians, however, is imminent ...
notes: When the Native Americans were still ugly, dirty and bad it took very little to create a story of the old Froniera made up of men all in one piece, heroic orphans and a beautiful "ours come" in the finale!

title: The Mighty Ducks
actors: Emilio Estevez, Michael Tucker, Jan Rubes, Kathryn Erbe, Garette Ratliff Henson
description: The Mighty Ducks are a hockey team, led by Gordon Bombay. In Los Angeles during the junior world championships of this tough and violent sport, the coach who should support his players, is instead distracted by the offers of a professional team with the foreseeable consequences for the Mighty.
notes: In the beginning it was a film called "Fabric of Champions", of which this is the sequel. Here only ethical-sporting banalities remained. This did not prevent the third stage, "A team at full ice", from being completed.

title: Hombre
actors: Paul Newman, Fredric March, Richard Boone, Diane Cilento
description: A white man who grew up among the Indians finds himself traveling with other characters, including a federal agent with his wife and a bandit. The latter, intent on robbing the agent with the complicity of other outlaws, is however defeated by the white Indian. Taking the agent's wife hostage, the bandits try to force the passengers to leave the shack where they found refuge after the attempted robbery. Nobody feels like facing them openly, but ...
notes: Western pro-Indian director and liberal actor. Brave Newman, Ritt puts on a beautiful screenplay by the noir writer Elmore Leonard with great skill.

title: Gunfight in Abilene
actors: Bobby Darin, Emily Banks, Leslie Nielsen, Don Galloway
description: Abilene, Kansas, would be a quiet town if it weren't for the long-standing dispute between farmers and ranchers. The latter, led by the shady Grant Everest, have taken over much of the land with the connivance of the corrupt Sheriff Slade. At one point, Kale Wayne returns to town, a veteran of the Civil War, a former friend of Grant who stole the girl from him.
notes: The classic ingredients are dosed with a sense of rhythm. The western, however, has already passed its golden age and this too can be felt in a certain mechanical nature of the staging.

title: Vampire at Midnight
actors: Jason Williams, Lesley Milne, Robert Random
description: A famous psychiatrist, specialist in treatment with the hypnosis method, has gone so far in his research that, through the trance system on patients, he has committed a now numerous series of heinous crimes. He would continue to kill undisturbed were it not that a policeman, directly involved in a murder, begins to have suspicions about him ...
notes: The actualization of the vampire theme hardly works.

title: The Iroquis Trail
actors: George Montgomery, Brenda Marshall, Glenn Langan
description: In the mid-18th century, the British and French waged a no-holds-barred war in the North American colony. Tom, a young English sergeant, is the victim of this incorrect fight, who is killed by two Indians who are actually French spies and who accuse Tom of treason.
notes: Mediocre drama with a "historical" background.

title: The Challenge
actors: Scott Glenn, Toshiro Mifune, Shoge Shimada, Donna Kei Benz, Calvin Young
description: Two Japanese brothers are fighting each other to the death because each claims possession of the family's sacred swords, which belonged to their ancestor, a famous samurai. At one point, an American adventurer is involved in their conflict who ...
notes: Frankenheimer has certainly done better. This is one of the anonymous films he directed, with some zest for action, when he was in low luck. Among the writers, director John Sayles.

title: Species II
actors: Michael Madsen, Natasha Henstridge, George Dzundza
description: Eve is a clone of Sil, the human part and the biomechanical alien part protagonist of the first episode, manipulated in order to mitigate her alien personality. The danger comes from two of the three crew members of the Excursion that conquered Mars, infected with the same alien organisms that designed Sil. Biologist Baker and Press Lennox must prevent the alien male from creating offspring.
notes: Contrary to what happens for the sequels, this time the result is more flattering than the previous one, by virtue of an irony that makes fun of the United States and its "grandeur" already in the first sequence where the spaceship Excursion is covered by advertising writings. But our heart beats for Eve, not only for the grace of her human forms (thanks to Natasha Henstridge), but even more for the painful role of guinea pig battered by merciless humans.

title: Kull The Conqueror
actors: Kevin Sorbo, Tia Carrere, Thomas Ian Griffith, Litefoot, Roy Brocksmith
description: The brave Kull is a former slave who becomes king of the kingdom of Valusia, winning the affection of the people, the slaves and the beautiful Zareta, slave and fortune teller. But those who aspired to succeed the old king unite against him and do not hesitate to summon the feared and fascinating witch Akivasha from the underworld.
notes: This film curiously fits (fifteen years later) into the groove traced by "Conan the Barbarian" with which it shares creator Robert E. Howard. For lovers of the genre, a dignified film, with a vaguely seductive medieval staging.

title: Double Dragon
actors: Mark Dacascos, Scott Wolf, Robert Patrick, Julia Nickson-Soul, Alyssa Milano
description: The Los Angeles of 2027 destroyed by a tsunami and partially submerged by the waters, is at the mercy of criminal gangs. The most aggressive is that of Koga Shuko, who in order to conquer absolute power must recover part of a medallion, owned by Satori. The latter is the protector of Billy and Jimmy Lee, martial arts champions, the only ones able to counter the project.
notes: From a famous video game James Yukich, a director specializing in video clips, has made an action movie that mixes martial arts with a disaster film. In an apocalyptic landscape shaken by a hostile nature, between agnitions of tragedy and continuous fighting, the eternal struggle between good and evil with a politically correct outline; guess who will win?

title: Campfire Tales
directors: David Semel, Martin Kunert, Matt Cooper
actors: Jimmy Marsden, Amy Smart, Jay R. Ferguson, Jennifer MacDonald
description: To kill time and above all the fear caused by a serial killer called Willy The Hook who is sowing panic in the area, the presumed survivors, to take courage, take turns telling stories which in turn are read in the newspapers or heard by some guy. . And so there is the couple on their honeymoon who, on the desert road to Las Vegas, run into a herd of hungry and angry werewolves. Then it is the turn of Amanda, a girl who is about to turn twelve, intercepted via the Internet by a pedophile and threateningly in danger. Finally he stumbles upon a broken-down motorcyclist who has stopped in the classic "last house on the left" inhabited by a pack shocked by a brutal act of blood that took place in the house a long time ago.
notes: From the parts of "Scream" and "I know what you did" (but the film is dated 1996) and assembled by three directors, the obvious redeems itself in a surprisingly "Kieslowskian" ending. Note the names of Jennifer MacDonald and Jimmy Marsden in the notebook.

title: Fighting Mad
actors: Peter Fonda, Lynn Lowry, Philip Carey, Scott Glenn
description: A group of speculators decides to seize the lands of some peasants. One of them (Fonda), saddened by the death of a friend of his killed by businessmen, rebels and takes up a bow and arrow. The result is a massacre involving both speculators and other farmers.
notes: Smooth, unscrupulous and complex: on one side the good guys, on the other the bastards. In addition to Corman, producer, there is the hand of the model Charles Bronson. A rather violent film that uses all means to keep the viewer's attention awake. Demme seems to enjoy going over the top and tries to delve into the psychologies of the characters in the precipitate of events.

title: A Day of Fury
actors: Dale Robertson, Jock Mahoney, Mara Corday, Carl Benton Reid
description: Even though Jagade saved the sheriff who had to celebrate a wedding on that day, the town is worried about his presence. Judge Mac Lean intervenes and asks the sheriff to expel the gunman from the town. But the sheriff's gratitude prevents him from carrying out the judge's order. A lot of trouble ensues.
notes: Late serial western. Almost a relic.

title: Tidal Wave no Escape
actors: Corbin Bernsen, Julianne Phillps, Gregg Henry
description: Suddenly the coasts of various countries bordering the Pacific Ocean are devastated by immense tidal waves that obviously sow destruction and death. John Ward, a young scientist who has retired to live on the Caliphonia coast, is consulted. Disturbing his hypothesis: the waves would be caused by underground nuclear explosions.
notes: Terror comes from the sea again this time, obviously with the help of man. Even in this case, however, reality has dangerously surpassed fantasy. And that doesn't speak in favor of the film.

title: Hard Rain
actors: Morgan Freeman, Christian Slater, Minnie Driver, Ed Asner
description: In a remote town in the United States it has been raining for days and the nearby river has already broken its banks. However, new and heavier developments are expected and so two security guards are entrusted with the task of raking up the money from the banks in the area before it becomes waste paper. The rumors run: a gang of robbers wants those damned three million dollars, whatever the cost. Meanwhile, the water rises and the armored van runs aground.
notes: Carpenter's humid and discreetly amoral action movie would become something of a remake of "District 13," but honest Salomon is at the helm and so you swim within fairly conventional perimeters. The news is mostly about the script (Freeman, for example, being the "bad guy"). Curiosity is a sequence reminiscent of the "Titanic" in which Kate Winslet breaks the handcuffs around DiCaprio's wrists with an ax: here the roles are reversed and the weapon of salvation is a gun.

title: The Patriot
actors: L. Q. Jones, Steven Seagal, Gailard Sartain, Camilla Belle, Whitney Yellow Robe
description: On a farm in the mountains of Montana, Floyd Chilsom set up a pro-Nazi militia. Dr. Wesley, an epidemiologist who had worked for the government, is a neighbor of his who preferred to be a medical doctor. When Chilsom and his people, surrounded by the FBI, pretending to surrender, infect the region with a deadly virus stolen from a government laboratory, the doctor must return to his old business to eradicate the epidemic. Surrounded by majestic nature, the character played by Steven Seagal develops an interesting political position: in favor of the American Indians.
notes: Surrounded by majestic nature, the character played by Steven Seagal develops an interesting political position: in favor of the American Indians.

title: Dead Men Walk
actors: George Zucco, Mary Carlisle, Nedrick Young, Dwight Frye
description: Between the two Clayton brothers there has never been good blood also because one is an esteemed doctor while the other is a perverse man dedicated to studies and practices of black magic. One day the first, exasperated by the wickedness of the second, gets rid of it by killing him. But when he goes to his study with the intent of destroying his manuscripts and his books, he sees with terror the ghost of his brother rises before him and reveals to him that he is a vampire. C-series horror, a blast for fans of funny junk.

title: Decision at Sundown
actors: Randolph Scott, John Carroll, Karen Steele, Noah Beery, Valerie French
description: For several years Bart has been hunting Tate, a shady individual who has made his wife lose her mind until she dies of a broken heart. Bart wants to avenge his life partner and does everything to find out where the man is hiding. Quite by chance he learns that the man is hiding in the small town of Sundown and that thanks to his friends he has become a prominent character. There is nothing left for Bart to do but face it ... A cheap, bitter and disenchanted Western, the third in the legendary "Ranown" series.

title: Knock Off
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Rob Schneider, Lela Rochon, Michael Wong
description: From Moscow a ruthless terrorist group swoops into Hong Kong and is ready to blackmail the world with microbombs inserted into dolls and jeans buttons. There is, of course, the FBI, under the guise of a partner in a counterfeiter of Western products and a beautiful black woman who passes herself off as a finance steward.
notes: Okay, Tsui Hark is one of the most important living filmmakers, he launched a whole generation of masters, he gave away masterpieces like "Once upon a time in China" and "The blade", but this film is just modest. You save a couple of spectacular sequences directed with the skill that everyone knows.

title: Armageddon
actors: Bruce Willis, Liv Tyler, Ben Affleck, Billy Bob Thornton, Will Patton
description: An asteroid the size of the state of Texas is heading towards Earth at the speed of 22,000 miles per hour. NASA director Dan Truman has no choice: he must set up and send a crew into space to try to thwart the threat. The mission is entrusted to Harry S. Stamper, who together with his men must land on the asteroid, pierce its surface and place a nuclear bomb.
notes: A bad film, not so much for its cinematic inconsistency and total lack of irony, but because it sums up the philosophy of the latest blockbusters: accumulation of action scenes and that's it. Result: boredom.

title: Lethal Weapon 4
actors: Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Rene Russo, Joe Pesci, Jet Li, Chris Rock
description: A freighter filled with Chinese crammed like beasts in the hold of a ship gives Murtaugh the opportunity to free the slaves that the Chinese mafia smuggled into the United States. Agent Riggs, who is about to become a father, helps him in his business.
notes: As the launch slogan says: "The team is complete". In fact, you don't change. Or almost: since 1987 (year of the first "Lethal Weapon"), the only difference is the greater space given to almost sit-com characters. The only flagship is the great Jet Li (Li Lin Jie), Hong Kong actor five times Wu Shu champion who eats the "lethal weapon" and his partner in one bite.

title: Drum Beat
actors: Alan Ladd, Audrey Dalton, Robert Keithk, Charles Bronson
description: The young but experienced Johnny MacKay is entrusted with a difficult negotiation with a rebellious Indian tribe. On the diligence that takes him to the West, he deepens his knowledge of Nancy, with whom he falls in love. A renegade white, who has put himself at the head of a gang of Indian raiders, makes it difficult to negotiate and Johnny even risks dying. Then, finally, he comes face to face with the rebel leader ...
notes: After "The Indian Lover", another Daves film to critically tackle the problem of the natives. Breathtaking direction, as always, and an almost melancholy pathos.

title: The Gun Hawk
actors: Rory Calhoun, Rod Cameron, Ruta Lee, John Litel
description: Wanted by the sheriff and mortally wounded, the outlaw Madden does not want to die in a bed so he forces a friend, who owes him his life, to fight in a duel with him. Only in this way - he says - will he feel like dying like a real man. The friend though ...
notes: Unusual subject for a twilight and melancholy western.

title: Wishmaster
actors: Tammy Lauren, Andrew Divoff, Tony Todd, Kane Hodder, Robert Englund
description: A legend tells that during the creation of the world fear and terror were incarnated in a creature called Djin, a demon capable of transforming human beings into the worst forms of life and to fulfill the most hidden desires. Today: in a city port a worker drops a crate and the Djin comes to life again.
notes: Despite the presence of Wes Craven as executive producer, the film has little to do with the master of horror. The visual and narrative references rather make one think of Clive Barker's nightmares: everything works, without great flights, for two thirds of the film, but the ending plunges into an insult to the intelligence of the spectators.

title: City of Angels
actors: Nicolas Cage, Meg Ryan, Andre Braugher, Colm Feore, Dennis Franz
description: Seth is a restless angel on duty in Los Angeles, where he meets Dr. Maggie Rice, distraught after the death of a patient. Although Seth is there to assist the dying man, he feels drawn to Maggie and works hard to help her overcome her crisis. But he falls in love with her.
notes: New Age & Millennialism: everything contributes to the (re) call to arms of the guardian angels. Hollywood makes its contribution by re-reading one of the cult of European cinephiles, "The sky above Berlin" by Wim Wenders. As in "Ghost", suggestive scenes alternate with falls into the void and ridicule. But the film has its own intangible atmosphere.

title: Scream 2
actors: Jada Pinkett Smith, Neve Campbell, Elise Neal, Liev Schreiber, Courteney Cox
description: Sid to forget the murders that had upset the town of Woodsboro moves to Windsor college. But just when the film "Stab", based on the story of the Woodsboro serial killer, is about to be screened, the murders start again.
notes: Craven and Kevin Williamson create another saraband in which "Scream", "Scream 2" and "Stab" (the film about the film within the film) are mixed in a precise self-referential mechanism. To avoid the usual question about the quality of the sequels, a tasty opportunity for debate even among the students on campus, they decided to favor irony rather than the discourse on gender and perception that gave substance to "Scream", without however giving up the parade. of stars and stars borrowed from television serials.

title: Godzilla
actors: Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo, Hank Azaria, Kevin Dunn
description: A beast of enormous size, awakened by nuclear tests, heads to the island of Manhattan with the intention of destroying it. A scientist, a reporter, a cameraman and an enigmatic agent of the French secret services take the field. Chirac's nuclear experiments have indeed awakened none other than Godzilla.
notes: Restyling of a 50s myth, _Godzilla_, a giant lizard born from the horrors of Hiroshima in 1954. _Gojira_ was naive, he moved in jerks, but he responded to genuine and pressing fears. Emmerich completely loses this authenticity and makes a boring movie.

title: The Yellow Mountain
actors: Lex Barker, Mala Powers
description: Andy Martin, recently arrived in the town of Goldfield, and Pete Menlo, owner of a saloon and a mine, are friends despite previous disagreements. They both fall in love with Silvana.
notes: Western without infamy and without praise as they did in the fifties, when the genre was still in vogue and all directors, sooner or later, tried their hand at it.

title: Altered States
actors: William Hurt, Blair Brown, Bob Balaban, Charles Haid, Drew Barrymore
description: Eddie, a young scientist, helped by two colleagues studies the results of a test which some students have been subjected to. They immersed themselves alone and in the dark in a tub full of salt water until they lost consciousness. Their hope is to recover sensations belonging to the beginnings of human life; Eddie feels the need to experiment on himself with the test.
notes: The film, based on a Paddy Chayefsky novel, was started by Arthur Penn and finished by Ken Russell. In the final version, special effects are rampant and some visionary surges redeem the didactic assumption.

title: The Swordsman
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Claire Stansfield, Michael Champion, Nicholas Pasco
description: Police officer and expert swordsman Andrew is assigned by his superiors to the protection program of Julie Wilkins, an archaeologist and curator of a prestigious museum, the only witness to the theft of the legendary sword that belonged to Alexander the Great. Andrew is haunted by a recurring dream: two men who are dueling in a historic place. In the place where he trains he meets Stratos, the creator of a fencing competition that predicts the death of one of the contenders. Man seems to be the key to both the visions and the disappearance of the great leader's sword.
notes: Lorenzo Lamas highlights all his athletic skills in this film of not great value.

title: Small Soldiers
actors: Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary, Dick Miller, David Cross, Jay Mohr
description: The Gorgonites were once warriors. Today they are pacifist toys threatened by the Elite Commandos, convinced militarist puppets, especially now that a microchip stolen from some Army software has transformed them into perfect war machines. It happens, therefore, that the life of an Ohio town is turned upside down by the arrival of a batch of toys that should revolutionize the market.
notes: Spielberg's Dreamworks and Universal joined forces for this film. Not that the result is to be counted among the best, but the metaphor of the anthropomorphic puppets offers a couple of memorable sequences: the quote of the helicopters from "Apocalypse Now" and the disturbing moment of the disfigured Barbie. Between Disney's neo-myths ("Toy Story") and literary legends ("Gulliver"), "Small Soldiers" tries to renew the imagination: it doesn't have the strength of a Spielberg, yet it moves.

title: Blood Frenzy
actors: Wendy Macdonald, Lisa Loring, John Clark, Hank Garrett, John Montero
description: Seven close friends decide to take a vacation, but even before realizing where they are, the group falls into terror. In fact, a mysterious serial killer sows slaughtered corpses everywhere and soon the seven protagonists have to fight for their lives.
notes: Discounted horror film that turns eerily towards the splatter side. Only for strong palates.

title: Night of the Warrior
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Robin Antin, Mike Ballew, Andre Rosey Brown
description: Miles paid his dues to justice for setting up in the back of the dancing club that runs a ring where illegal kickboxing matches are held. When he gets out of prison he refuses to cooperate with some unscrupulous people who are trying to organize the illegal fighting. But the mafia forces him to continue, threatening his mother, killing his ex girlfriend Joy and taking his new girlfriend hostage. Miles is forced to fight to protect himself and those close to him.
notes: Lorenzo Lamas gives the face and above all the body to the usual character who has to try to get by against the usual bad guys.

title: Dawn of the Dead
actors: David Emge, Ken Foree, Scott Reiniger, Gaylen Ross, Tom Savini
description: The undead have invaded the United States and terror is rampant. Four brave, two soldiers, one white and one black, two officials of a television network, a woman and a man, are trying to escape in a helicopter. The shortage of fuel, however, forces them to land on the roof of a huge supermarket, unaware that zombies are hiding there too. While the living dead, who eat human flesh, try to overwhelm them, the four manage to create a refuge inside the supermarket. Will it be enough?
notes: The film, an ideal follow-up to "Night of the Living Dead", is a hallucinatory political metaphor with some touches of macabre humor. Produced by Dario Argento, the Italian edition is very different from the American one. Tricks by Tom Savini.

title: Comanche
actors: Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Linda Cristal, Nestor Paiva
description: In 1875 the Comanches tribe encamped along the border between Mexico and the United States, under the leadership of the Indian chief Quanah Parker, stormed Cerro Tello, a small Mexican town. Having entered the village, they kill all the inhabitants and take their women hostage. Among them is Margherita, who saw her parents, rich Spanish aristocrats, killed. On returning to the camp, the Indians encounter a detachment of cavalrymen.
notes: Discreet western with spectacular mass scenes, directed by a non-genius specialist.

title: X-Files The Movie
actors: Gillian Anderson, David Duchovny, John Neville, Martin Landau
description: Thirty-five thousand years ago a group of stonemen awakened a bloodthirsty creature imprisoned in a cave surrounded by ice with the heat of their torches. Today in the same cave disappears first a boy, then four firefighters who have been called. As the authorities try to hide what happened, Dana Scully and Fox Mulder begin their investigation.
notes: Directed by Rob Bowman, who has 23 episodes of the television serial to his credit, the film is a big-screen puntatona, with one of the most blatantly open endings in the history of cinema. Soundtrack that Sting and Bjork, Noel Gallagher and the Cure can afford, but which - despite the theme (among other old men) - finds it hard to infect, to thicken arcane and enigmas. Only for teleaficionados.

title: What Dreams May Come
actors: Robin Williams, Cuba Gooding jr., Annabella Sciorra, Max Von Sydow
description: Chris and Annie have a beautiful home, two jobs that satisfy them, a son and a daughter. In short, everything seems to be going well. Then a chain of tragedies ensues: both boys die in a car accident, Annie commits suicide, Chris can't rest. The man in turn loses his life in an accident and finds himself in Paradise, where he would like to track down his children and his wife ...
notes: Without a doubt, one of the worst films of the end of the millennium. A concentrate of New Age molasses with suffocating special effects. Too bad for Annabella Sciorra, who didn't deserve to be involved in such stuff.

title: The Big Hit
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Lou Diamond Phillips, Christina Applegate, Avery Brooks
description: Melvin is young, sensitive, cute, orphaned and in need of affection. His job is thankless, in fact he is a serial killer for the Paris boss and has a solid reputation for efficiency. But his two girlfriends are increasingly in need of money, so he has to take an extra job from colleague Cisco which involves kidnapping the daughter of a Japanese industrialist. For Melvin "angel face" serious troubles begin ...
notes: The Hong Kong diaspora continues and after John Woo and Jackie Chan this time it's up to Che-Kirk Wong to show us his mastery, on which Wesley Snipes (producer) and John Woo (executive producer) have also bet. Action, thriller and sentimental comedy are intertwined in a blending of genres conducted at supersonic speed The film can be remembered even for a couple of moments of comedy and offers cinephiles a tasty series of imitations.

title: Frankenstein Unbound
actors: John Hurt, Raul Julia, Bridget Fonda, Nick Brimble, Catherine Corman
description: We are in Los Angeles in 2013 and during an experiment on the implosion of matter, an American scientist finds himself in Switzerland in 1817 where he meets Dr. Frankenstein. Later he meets Mary Shelley who reveals to him that the facts told in her book are based on real events.
notes: Corman, an expert in low-budget horror and fantastic cinema, after almost twenty years of absence from the set returns to the myth of the Creature of Frankenstein based on the novel "Frankenstein Unbound" by Brian Aldiss. Refined, complex, "theoretical".

title: Lancer Spy
actors: Dolores Del Rio, George Sanders, Peter Lorre, Joseph Schildkraut
description: During the First World War an aristocratic lieutenant of the German Imperial Guard is taken prisoner by the Anglo-Americans. The Allied Command sets out in search of a lieutenant's double. After a long search, a British Navy lieutenant is found who looks strikingly like the prisoner. Variation on the theme of the double, with a good cast and the charm of the old genre cinema.

title: The Mask of Zorro
actors: Antonio Banderas, Anthony Hopkins, Catherine Zeta-Jones
