description: Twenty years have passed since Don Diego De La Vega under the pseudonym of Zorro fought in Mexico against Spanish oppression. Now, after a long time in prison, he must choose a successor to fight Don Rafael Montero, the powerful former Spanish governor who caused Don Diego to lose his freedom. When the bandit Alejandro Murrieta appears on the horizon, Don Diego realizes that he can be the avenger he has been waiting for.
notes: The film was to be directed by Spielberg himself (who, however, produces) with Andy Garcia as the "fox"; and Robert Rodriguez had started shooting it, escaped (or kicked out?) from the set after a few days. It ended up in the hands of Bondian Martin Campbell ("Goldeneye") who, humbly, made himself available to a very athletic Banderas and the usual immense Hopkins. Swarms, sexy moods, slivers of western spaghetti and the bright colors of Mexico.

title: The Finest Hour
actors: Rob Lowe, Gale Hansen, Tracy Griffith, Eb Lottimer, Baruch Dror
description: Mazzoli and Hammer, two soldiers enlisted in the navy, end up becoming good friends during the (very hard) training course they have to undergo to become part of the Navy Seals special corps. But a woman stands between the two of them and tries to divide them. The outbreak of the Gulf War will find them side by side again.
notes: The film attempts to glorify the "Desert Storm" operation. Unfortunately, the action scenes that should represent the juice of films of this genre are missing.

title: Lost in Space
actors: William Hurt, Mimi Rogers, Gary Oldman, Matt LeBlanc, Heather Graham, Lacey Chabert, Jack Johnson
description: The spaceship Jupiter 2, under the command of Major Don West, leaves for Alpha Prime, the only planet capable of hosting human beings in the entire galaxy. During the voyage, the spacecraft is sabotaged by Dr. Zacharias Smith, intent on making the project fail. When the Jupiter deviates from her course, the Robinson family, housed on board, must work as a team to save the day.
notes: In September 1965, CBS aired the first episode of "Lost in Space", a fun science fiction sitcom. The film version fails to recover the wholesome madness of the TV model.

title: Canadian Pacific
actors: Randolph Scott, Jane Wyatt, J. Carrol Naish, Robert Barrat
description: On behalf of the builders of the great North American railway, Tom Andrews explores a virgin territory inhabited by red Indians and studies its terrain. If on the one hand the construction of the railway will be very useful to the inhabitants of the region, on the other hand it will reduce the hefty earnings of the speculators who hold the monopoly of trade. One of them, Dick, benefiting from the ignorance of the Indians tries to boycott the construction of the railway. Tom, warned in time by an Indian in love with him, manages to foil a first attack, but, later on treacherously attacked, he is wounded.

title: Passe from Hell
actors: Audie Murphy, John Saxon
description: Paradise, as the word itself says, is a quiet town in the West where harmony and tranquility reign. But one day a gang of outlaws just escaped from the penitentiary arrives, made up of four bandits already sentenced to death for an endless series of crimes. In short, the outlaws rob the bank, kill the sheriff, kill some other citizens and, not yet happy, kidnap a girl to cover her escape.
notes: Absolutely routine, predictable and professional Western.

title: Child's Play 3
actors: Andrew Robinson, Dakin Matthews, Justin Whalin, Perrey Reeves
description: It's been eight years since Andy was terrified of Chucky, the harmless doll unfortunately possessed by the soul of serial killer, Charles Lee Ray. Now the boy who was placed in a foster family has grown up, he is sixteen and is attending a military school. Meanwhile, the Play Pals Toy Company decides to put Chucky back into production again. For the new model, the company decided to use the materials of which the previous doll was made. On the trail of Andy, Chucky ends up in the hands of a little boy and that's where the soul of Charles Lee Ray decides to hide ...

title: The Wolf Man
actors: Lon Chaney jr., Evelyn Ankers, Claude Rains, Maria Ouspenskaya
description: A young gentleman meets a girl to whom he feels irresistibly attracted. While they are conversing amiably their talk falls on werewolves and the strange disease called lycanthropy. One evening the young man, the girl and a friend of theirs decide to go to a nomad camp to have the future predicted. At one point the friend disappears and at the same time the two hear a scream coming from the woods. A werewolf is terrorizing the city ...
notes: A classic horror film written by Curt Siodmak and produced by the legendary Universal. Lon Chaney Jr., son of art, will remain forever linked to this role.

title: Urban Legend
actors: Jared Leto, Alicia Witt, Rebecca Gayheart, Brad Dourif, Joshua Jackson
description: A girl, on her way back to college after a short vacation, is beheaded in her car. It is only the beginning of a long series of chilling murders of a psychopath who enjoys putting into practice the hottest urban legends, thus decimating the population of the university campus.
notes: Typical "slasher" born and raised along the lines of the much more successful "Scream". Tame scares, dutiful appearances (Robert Englund "is" Freddy Krueger) and too many familiar moments. Only the first sequence gives a good shot of suspense ... The rest is déjà vu.

title: The Siege
actors: Bruce Willis, Denzel Washington, Annette Bening, Graeme Revell
description: A bus explodes in Brooklyn: thus begins the campaign of terror that Islamic fundamentalists have declared to the Americans. Coping with escalating violence are Anthony 'Hub' Hubbard, head of the FBI's Counterterrorism Task Force, and General William Devereaux, a cautious and thoughtful military man who knows how to deal with the enemy. The two can count on the help of Elise, a CIA agent who has infiltrated the Arab-American community.
notes: The political-geographical assumption of the film is that Brooklyn could become a neighborhood of Beirut and the United States the battleground of the fringes of Arab terrorism. The attacks on the World Trade Center and Oklahoma City forever undermined the idea of ??national invulnerability and shaped a new enemy after the Cold War was over. Crafted with skill, but discontinuous and predictable, the film gives way and flattens out after the first forty minutes.

title: Alien Nation
actors: James Caan, Mandy Patinkin, Terence Stamp, Kevin Major, Brian Thompson, Peter Jason, Leslie Bevis, Conrad Dunn, Jeff Kober, Brian Thompson
description: A large number of aliens capable of adapting to human life have been transported from another planet to Earth in a large spaceship. Equipped with special qualities, they do not struggle to fit into the daily life of humans even if some are viewed with much contempt by earthlings. One night, during a robbery, police sergeant Matthew Sykes sees his closest friend killed by aliens. To find out the perpetrators of the murder and, above all, the motive, he begins the investigation, naturally with the help of another alien.
notes: Unusual film capable of mixing thriller and science fiction, with clear intentions of allegory of the melting pot. Two TV series of the same title have been made from it.

title: This Island Earth
actors: Jeff Morrow, Rex Reason, Faith Domergue, Russell Johnson
description: The scientist Cal Meachan comes into contact in a completely mysterious way with some unknown colleagues who invite him to go to an equally unknown research center where he works in secret on enriched uranium. Here, the scientist and his colleague Ruth, who followed him on the journey, meet Exeter, envoy of the supreme government of Metaluna, a planet with serious energy supply problems due to a struggle with the inhabitants of another planet. The two attempt to escape but are blocked by the Exeter spaceship.
notes: Science fiction as it was fashionable in the 1950s, with an extra tragic streak and a tension that never subsides. A classic of the genre.

title: The Fiercest Heart
actors: Stuart Whitman, Juliet Prowse, Ken Scott, Raymond Massey
description: A British garrison soldier stationed in South Africa is flogged for disrespecting a superior's wife. Under the cover of darkness he manages to escape from prison together with his two cellmates. Taking refuge in a hut in the open countryside, the three attend a meeting of Boers, who are about to leave the territory under English rule. The Boers, albeit reluctant, agree to welcome in their ranks the three fugitives who will prove to be good fighters.
notes: George Sherman, who specializes in westerns, transposes the themes dear to the genre to Africa with little success.

title: Them!
actors: James Whitmore, Edmund Gwenn, Joan Welden, James Arness
description: Due to an atomic explosion, a colony of ants was subjected to very strong and deadly radiation. The consequence is an incredible transformation: the insects become gigantic and begin to sow panic first in New Mexico and then in Los Angeles. Here the decisive battle takes place, set in an oppressive scenario: the metropolitan sewers.
notes: One of the science fiction classics of the 1950s, based on a compelling and tight script. In that period the danger always came from other worlds (or from other political systems); Douglas has the merit of imagining that the risks come from within and, therefore, from the depths of the Earth.

title: Payback
actors: Mel Gibson, Gregg Henry, Maria Bello, Bill Duke, Deborah Kara Unger, Lucy Liu, David Paymer
description: Porter, a professional thief with a pragmatic philosophy, is on the hunt for those seventy thousand dollars that his ex-wife and a cheating partner stole from him after a robbery against a group of Chinese. But the habit of cheating the neighbor is not even scratched by a terrible ambush from which Porter comes out with his head held high.
notes: The charm of this other remake (the originals, from the famous story "The Hunter" by Richard Stark, are called "Without a moment of respite" and "The last contract") lies in its ironic and resigned air, not surprisingly crossed by a strange Mel Gibson who pays homage to Steve McQueen. Debut in the direction of the screenwriter, among others, of "L. A. Confidential".

title: Maximum Risk
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Natasha Henstridge, Jean-Hugues Anglade, Stéphane Audran
description: Alain is a private detective living in Nice. Michail a Russian who emigrated to New York who works for the mafia. When the latter ends his existence riddled with blows on the pavement of a road in the Midi, the former rushes to the place and discovers that he is his twin brother, a twin whose existence he was totally unaware of. At this point Alain takes the first plane to the States. Will he be able to reconstruct his brother's past (and therefore also his own)? Above all, will he be able to escape the assassins who want him to end up like Michail?
notes: Van Damme had already exploited the theme of the double in "Double impact" and will take it up again in the next film also directed by poor Ringo Lam (one of the masters of Hong Kong action, wasted here), "The Replicant".

title: Tomahawk
actors: Yvonne De Carlo, Van Heflin, Preston Foster, Jack Oakie, Rock Hudson
description: The explorer Jim participates in a meeting between some Sioux leaders and representatives of the USA. The man explains to the commander of the troops the reasons of the natives, who are not satisfied with the construction of a fort nearby, but among the Indians there are the killers of his brother.
notes: Discreet western with good actors.

title: Resurrection
actors: Ellen Burstyn, Sam Shepard, Richard Farnsworth, Roberts Blossom
description: A woman given up for dead by doctors suddenly comes back to life with exceptional healing powers that she uses to do good to people. The surprise in the scientific world is so great that the woman is besieged by newspapers and televisions all over the world.
notes: An underrated film that knows how to use a delicate story with grace and that knows how to fully exploit the qualities of Ellen Burstyn. Next to her is the playwright and actor Sam Shepard. The subject is taken from a book by Lewis John Carlino, writer and director.

title: Guinevere
actors: Sheryl Lee, Noah Wyle, Sean Patrick Flanery, Brid Brennan
description: Queen Geneva is torn between her passion for the young and heroic Lancelot and her devotion to King Arthur, her legitimate husband and sovereign. He saved Camelot, the queen's homeland, from the dark plots of the priestess and sorceress Morgana. Guinevere finds herself forced to repress her feelings towards Lancelot and to work together with the wizard Merlin to try to bring peace to his kingdom. But Morgana is always lurking ...
notes: The saga of King Arthur reduced to films for American television is really ridiculous, if then even the performers are of a poor level, the omelette is done.

title: Money Train
actors: Wesley Snipes, Woody Harrelson, Jennifer Lopez, Robert Blake
description: The money train circulates in the bowels of the New York subway: it is a small armored convoy, protected by special agents that goes around the various ticket offices, taking the day's proceeds. The desire to take over the convoy with all its contents is the fixed idea of ??Charlie, an inveterate and rather unfortunate player who has contracted a debt with a gang. Charlie is an agent assigned to act as decoy at the stations to stop any thugs. But when Charlie is fired the idea of ??stopping that train becomes a real obsession for him. A not too breathtaking thriller, with gritty performers.

title: Best of the Badmen
actors: Robert Ryan, Claire Trevor, Robert Preston, Jack Buetel, Walter Brennan
description: After the civil war, some groups of Confederates went into hiding by joining the outlaws. To cleanse the country of these gangs, the federal government sends army units against them. One of these is commanded by Major Jeff Clanton who, after hunting down the infamous Quantrell gang for some time, manages to force it to surrender. The major promises captured outlaws to let them free, as long as they swear to respect the new constitution. But this vMatthew Fowler would like to have the outlaws convicted for cashing in on the hefty bounty. Quasi-B-series Western, with good actors and more dialogue than action.

title: Star in the Dust
actors: John Agar, Mamie Van Doren, Richard Boom
description: Sam Hall committed three murders on behalf of a group of cattle ranchers, led by banker George Ballard. For this reason he is imprisoned, tried and sentenced to death. Of course the breeders want to prevent the execution and organize an escape. Which succeeds but fails: Hall is caught and put back in prison by the sheriff. Meanwhile, Hall's evil disposition appears to everyone, including his principals: no one, in any case, will regret his death.
notes: An artisanal product that is memorable only in the appearance, in the role of a cowboy, of a very young Clint Eastwood.

title: Phase IV
actors: Nigel Davenport, Lynne Frederick, Michael Murphy, Helen Horton
description: An invasion of killer ants is bringing death and destruction to Arizona. Trying to counter their advance is a scientist, who, in a futuristic station, tries to study the deadly genetic combination that created them. But the destructive force of nature is unstoppable ...
notes: The "king" of cinematic design Saul Bass (author of the graphics for many opening titles by Hitchcock and Preminger), here in his first feature film, proves he knows how to do it, with a careful direction focused on man's great fear of nature. Do not miss the beautiful documentary inserts signed by Ken Middleton.

title: The Matrix
actors: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving
description: Neo is convinced that there are two very distinct realities: one represented by the existence we lead every day, the other hidden and not accessible to everyone. Neo intends to uncover the truth about the Matrix - something people don't want to talk about, a mysterious and unknown entity wielding sinister power over its very existence. But what is the Matrix? Neo thinks that the only man who can answer his questions is Morpheus, a strange character whose strange episodes are told. But it will be the meeting with Trinity to reveal the mystery of the Matrix.
notes: The charm of this optical fiber musical is in the ingenious mix of genres and styles, of atmospheres and moods: John Woo, Bruce Lee, a bit of Bruckheimer's Touch, manga comics, Asimov and Gibson, special effects that reset the albeit a recent phantasmagoric past. And above all in the radical, socio-Cartesian doubt that it instills in the viewer: might we not already be all in a "Matrix"?

title: The Craft
actors: Fairuza Balk, Robin Tunney, Neve Campbell, Rachel True
description: Sarah, Nancy, Bonnie and Rochelle are four students from Los Angeles. All grappling with the daily problems typical of their age, they are unleashed when they discover that they possess supernatural powers: they will begin to use them without limits, each to take revenge on those who have done it or are making it suffer and to fulfill wishes kept in the depths of their hearts. . But it won't last long ...
notes: Beyond the four protagonists and a not very original story lies the light and precise direction of Fleming _ (Friends for fun, friends for sex_ and _The girls of the white house) _. It's definitely not enough, but it's still better than nothing.

title: Virus
actors: Jamie Lee Curtis, William Baldwin, Donald Sutherland
description: Taken by surprise by a terrible typhoon in the South Pacific, the tugboat Sea Star loses its steel cargo and risks sinking. The seven men of the crew manage to lead the now out of use boat to a relatively quiet place. Suddenly they notice a huge Russian research ship, adrift and apparently abandoned. But a terrible alien force is hiding in the Russian ship ...
notes: An inexhaustible déjà vu experience for science fiction lovers. Taken from a mediocre comic book by Chuck Pfarrer and directed by the newcomer Bruno, a special effects technician, the film involves great actors in a shipwreck, but also annoys for the dated portrait reserved for the Russians, treacherous and warmongers as in McCarthyism.

title: Jack Frost
actors: Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Mark Addy, Joseph Cross
description: Jack Frost is doing everything to make his life dream come true: to break through after years of hard work in the music business. His passion has a hard counterpart to bear, staying away from his wife Gabby and his son Charlie. Jack to be forgiven by his son decides to build a snowman with him that can keep Charlie company during his many absences. Time passes, Christmas arrives and Jack who is about to go home to his family is the victim of a serious accident and dies. A year passes, Charlie decides to build another snowman, decorates it with his dad's clothes and thanks to a magical harmonic gift from Jack, the snowman comes to life.
notes: The cinema again tackles the theme of life beyond life and set aside reincarnations, ghostly apparitions and digital paradises, this time the deceased returns to the world of the living through a snowman. So expect good feelings in industrial quantities and prepare your handkerchiefs, even if the film manages to avoid overly dull tones: the special effects that make the snowman the real protagonist of a story that in the United States have been a great success at the box office and which was to be directed by Sam Raimi.

title: Ride a Crooked Trail
actors: Walter Matthau, Audie Murphy, Gia Scala
description: Joe Maybe, an outlaw, arrives in the town of Little Rock posing as a defender of the law. Its real target, however, is the local bank. After getting hired as a sheriff's assistant, Joe meets Tessa, a Creole girl who knows her true identity, but manages to convince her not to betray him. In return, he will pretend to be her husband. Ruining his plans is the arrival in town of Teeler, a bandit who wants to rob his own bank.
notes: A western like many others, packaged with a certain care and well interpreted. Matthau was not yet cast as a brilliant actor.

title: The Nesting
actors: John Carradine, Gloria Grahame, Robin Groves
description: A writer of gothic novels is drawn to a large, apparently uninhabited Victorian-era house. Obviously the house is far from uninhabited. Inside you will find the most imaginative and evil creatures protagonists of his stories.
notes: In the 1980s when splatters and severed heads were the order of the day in horror film scripts, few examples of good cinema were seen (Sam Raimi's "The House" (1983) is one of the few examples). This "La casa de sorcery" is certainly no better than the others.

title: Satellite in the Sky
actors: Kieron Moore, Lois Maxwell, Bryan Forbes, Don Wolfit
description: The Stardust spaceship throws an atomic bomb into space during a nuclear test: only that the device, instead of drifting in the cosmos, begins to follow the trajectory of the convoy, endangering the life of the crew and the very safety of the planet. Land. The only way out: to cause the bomb to explode before it's too late ...
notes: Science fiction with discreet use of means. The special effects are handled by Wally Veevars, the same as in Stanley Kubrick's _2001_. Cinemascope (will it be respected in television shows?) Fascinates, but the plot is coarse. Actress Lois Maxwell is the legendary Moneypenny of the 007 films.

title: Stranded
actors: Ione Skye, Joe Morton, Maureen O'Sullivan, Susan Barnes
description: A group of aliens land in an area of ??North Carolina and take a girl and her grandmother hostage. Besieged on their farm together with the disturbing extraterrestrial presences, the two women are rescued by a black sheriff and some local boys, who are not very tolerant of African Americans. But the union will make strength, even if the real danger remains prejudice.
notes: Curious science fiction film that hides an attention to the social reality of the deep South of the United States. Not everything goes smoothly and the presence of aliens is too often reduced to a pretext.

title: Flipper
actors: Paul Hogan, Elijah Wood, Isaac Hayes, Chelsea Field
description: Little Sandy (Elijah Wood), on vacation in Florida with his eccentric uncle Porter (Paul Hogan), becomes friends with the dolphin Flipper and a girl of his age. With their help, he will be able to ward off pollution in the bay threatened by an evil industrialist. Ecologist fairytale with the protagonist of "Crocodile Dundee".
notes: The film tries to repeat the extraordinary public success of "Free Willy". Good feelings and a few winks at the sugary "Bredford Family" drama. The monumental Isaac Hayes is a famous soul musician who recycled into the cinema. With a sequel.

title: Toy Soldiers
actors: Sean Astin, Will Wheaton, Keith Coogan, Louis Gossett jr.
description: The pupils of a military school live under the strict rules of barracks life. Training is tough for these young cadets, who live a very different life from that of their "middle-class" peers. A group of Colombian terrorists, making a mistake they will not realize in the end, decides to take these little soldiers hostage.
notes: Goofy rambetti movie with an ex- "Goonie" and the inevitable Gossett Jr.

title: Trucks
actors: Timothy Busfield, Brenda Bakke, Brendan Fletcher
description: Ray after the death of his wife killed by a stray bullet, takes refuge with his son Logan and an old friend of his father in Lunar, a remote area of ??the American countryside, a traditional sighting place for extraterrestrials. Here he decides to open a refreshment post and a petrol station where all the passing truck drivers stop. Hope, fresh from a bad marriage experience, runs a motel in the same area and organizes excursions in the surrounding area for tourists. Hope and Ray become good friends and struggle to rebuild a new life. The tranquility of Lunar, however, is upset by the aliens, occult forces and literally crazy trucks that overwhelm everything and everyone.

title: Nico the Unicorn
actors: Kevin Zegers, Anne Archer, Larry Day, Michael Ontkean
description: A sad and lonely child, unable to relate to the surrounding world, invents a magical dimension within which to escape. In this fantastic land, the little protagonist meets a unicorn, who becomes his best friend and gives him back the joy of living.
notes: Discreet fairy tale for television.

title: Trilogy of Terror II
actors: Lysette Anthony, Matt Clark, Geraint Wyn Davies, Geoffrey Lewis
description: Three horror stories: in the first a woman and her lover are killed by her husband. In the second, an elderly mother makes a pact with the devil to resurrect her dead son. In the last one, a Zuni fetish is awakened from its sleep and begins to sow death. Second chapter of a trilogy directed by Curtis in 1975. The hallmark of this series B horror is the Zuni puppet, which in the first episode ended up in the oven. Compared to the model, the performers are anonymous and there is a more televised atmosphere.

title: Tales from the Crypt
directors: Walter Hill, Robert Zemeckis, Richard Do
actors: William Sadler, Larry Drake, Joe Pantoliano
description: Three episodes inspired by the horror comics of the E.C. Comics. In the first, an unemployed executioner decides to continue self-employment. In the second, a serial killer disguises himself as Santa Claus and celebrates by sowing death. In the third, a man has a feline gland transplanted and acquires nine lives.
notes: Television product (also released on the screens) that continues in the contamination between comics and cinema started by George Romero with "Creepshow", also taken from the glorious comics of William Gaines. The limits of the format do not mortify the aesthetic result but the special effects are inferior to those of Tom Savini. Not to be confused with "Tales from the Crypt", also taken from the gaines comics and directed twenty years earlier by Freddie Francis.

title: The Mephisto Waltz
actors: Alan Alda, Jacqueline Bisset, Curt Jurgens
description: A mediocre pianist finds the easiest way to success and increase his talent. A nice pact with Satan through his emissary Roxanne, daughter of a great musician who recently passed away. The pianist's wife senses that something evil is happening to her husband and goes to counterattack.
notes: The plot is incredibly confusing. At a certain point it is no longer clear who is embodied in whom and how many characters decide to sacrifice themselves to the devil. Which is, as is known, a woman. Wendkos, however, does not hold back in terms of scares and at least the atmosphere is the right one. Gorgeous Jacqueline Bisset.

title: Diamondbacks
actors: Miles O'Keefe, Eb Lottimer, Chris Mitchum
description: Missoula in Montana is a famous city for two reasons: David Lynch was born there and nothing ever happens there. But one bad day a far-right militia calling itself "the diamondbacks" decides to come out after years of practicing in secret. The militia attacks a federal center and takes an aeronautical engineer hostage working on a major telecommunications-related project. The terrorist leader forces the technician to take control of a space satellite that is about to be launched into orbit. The first to be in danger are the crew members at this point.

title: Wanda Nevada
actors: Peter Fonda, Brooke Shields, Fiona Lewis
description: Nevada is still wild, but a couple of adventurous poker players still decide to brave the hostile environment in order to reach the Grand Canyon. Because there, between the rapids and inlets of the river, there is gold.
notes: The film is actually modest. However, he is the only one that Fonda father and Fonda son have filmed together. Since they haven't spoken to each other for years (Henry didn't forgive Peter for being "left"), _Wanda Nevada_ thus represents a moment of reconciliation between the old lion and the offspring of _Easy Rider_. Fonda Jr. as a director did better in '71 with _The Return of Harry Collings_.

title: Milo
actors: Asher Metchik, Vincent Schiavelli, Jennifer Jostyn, Antonio Fargas
description: In a small provincial town, four girls witness the ferocious murder of a girl of the same age by Milo, a young man who disappears immediately after the crime. They find him on the bank of a river and his father Jeeder, coroner of the community, certifies his death. Sixteen years later the four girls have not been able to forget the experience, they live with nightmares and continue to see the girl torn apart by Milo. But the nightmare is about to turn into reality, because the killer comes out of nowhere to hit the protagonists. He begins to torture them psychologically then moves on to de facto ways. But is the resurrected serial killer a ghost or a man of flesh and blood?
notes: Horror night with guaranteed scares. The genre is the "slasher", a sub-theme of the thriller style "Friday the 13th" and "Scream", with homicidal maniac at work and terrified girls from start to finish. One of the protagonists, Antonio Fargas, is the unforgettable Huggy Bear from the telefilm "Starsky & Hutch".

title: Legionnaire
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje
description: Alain is a boxer who has to flee Marseille for stalking the wife of the local boss and for refusing to sell a match. We are in the 1920s, and his only chance of escape is recruiting into the Foreign Legion; in Morocco between the harsh discipline of the legion and the bloody attacks of the Berber tribes, Alain finally comes to terms with his past.
notes: For once Van Damme abandons the worn out clothes of the kickboxeur at any cost and the result is definitely positive. Peter MacDonald's film proves to be a little surprise. In this story of action, passion and betrayal, what is most striking is the high directorial class of MacDonald, who masters the sequence shot with almost Altmanian mastery and who demonstrates a great ease even with the spectacular war scenes. Surrounded by all this luxury, even the aton Van Damme manages to make a good figure, without giving up on his hands, an activity that still remains his best virtue.

title: Behind Enemy Lines
actors: Thomas Ian Griffith, Chris Mulkey, Mark Carlton
description: In an Israeli prison, Palestinian Issam and Israeli Uri fight together against the abuses of the prison regime and a corrupt guard. Between rawness and emotion, a remarkable Israeli production, significant above all from the civil point of view, but also directed with a sure hand.

title: Undercurrent
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Frank Vincent, Brenda Strong, Philip Anthony
description: The anguish and problems, even family ones, of the pilot colonel Paul Tibbets who, at the end of the Second World War, was charged with the material execution of the secret project that led to the launch of the first atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Hiroshima. The bombing caused a real massacre and forced the Japanese to surrender, but in the foreground in the film is the conscience drama of Tibbets.
notes: Trivial drama in which it seems that the only victim of the Hiroshima tragedy is the American officer who is the protagonist of the film.

title: The Leopard Man
actors: Dennis O'Keefe, Margo, Jean Brooks, Isabel Jewell, James Bell
description: A cabaret singer comes out on stage with a leopard on a leash. The feline escapes and assaults a girl. From that moment on, two other brutal attacks take place, but the protagonist and her manager do not believe at all to be the fault of the beast.
notes: Third and last film made by the couple Lewton-Tourneur after "The kiss of the panther" and "I walked with a zombie". Another atmospheric horror that ranges in metaphysical fear and places men in front of the phobia of their dark (and bestial) side. Loosely inspired by the novel "Black Alibi" by Cornell Woolrich. A jewel of tension.

title: Progeny
actors: Arnold Vosloo, Jillian McWikther, Brad Dourif
description: Sherry is unable to have children and her husband Craig becomes convinced that she is sterile. One day, however, the girl discovers she is pregnant. For the couple it is joy again, but something in the ultrasound scans is not working. The fetus looks misshapen, and Sherry remembers having a terrifying nightmare in which she was fertilized by aliens.
notes: Latest film by Brian Yuzna, director of "Society" and "Re-Animator 2". A sort of "Rosemary's Baby" in a science fiction version (aliens instead of the devil), which plays on the terror caused by gynecological practices and the "pain" of birth. For horror lovers, a film not to be missed.

title: Barb Wire
actors: Pamela Anderson, Xander Berkeley, Udo Kier, Temuera Morrison, Steve Railsback, Victoria Rowell
description: In an oppressive near future, heroine Barb Wire rescues a girl who holds the antidote to AIDS. Moscia science fiction based on an American comic, with the Baywatch lifeguard.

title: Fall Time
actors: Mickey Rourke, Sheryl Lee, Stephen Baldwin, Jason London
description: American Midwest: Three friends in the mood for jokes organize a fake bank robbery, just to see the effect it has. It goes wrong, because a gang of real robbers chose the same day and time to storm the same bank. The three boys are thus taken as hostages by the fleeing criminals.
notes: Film of the ephemeral "pulp" trend, the one born and spread after Tarantino's first successes. Torture scenes a la "Mister Blonde", surreal dialogues and an unmade Mickey Rourke and already the lord of forced labor. For those who love action cinema (even if at times grotesque), there is still fun.

title: Children of the Corn
actors: Linda Hamilton, Peter Horton, John Franklin, R. G. Armstrong
description: A doctor traveling with his girlfriend gets lost in a distant Midwestern countryside and reaches a country inhabited only by teenagers. Soon the two unfortunates discover why there are no adults: they have all been massacred and sacrificed to the god of wheat.
notes: Based on a good story by Stephen King but trivialized by the "horror serial" aesthetics that concede little to the violence and macabre suspense, so disliked by the American censors. The written text is much scarier but some moments of the film still convey the sense of uneasiness evoked by the writer from Maine.

title: Wing Commander
actors: Freddie Prinze jr, Saffron Burrows, Tchéky Karyo, Matt Lillard
description: In 2654 the Kilrathi launch a powerful attack on the Terrestrial Confederation and manage to destroy the Pegasus outpost by seizing a sophisticated hyperspace navigation system. The spaceship Tiger Claw and its commander, the son of a pilot and a Pilgrim, descendant of galactic explorers with incredible powers, must slow down the march of the terrible Kilrathi to allow the Earth to organize its defenses.
notes: Love, action, spy story and the flavor of a literary science fiction reminiscent of Asimov and Henlein, make "Wing Commander" an enjoyable film that focuses more on humans than on invading aliens. Inside the Tiger Claw the viewer recognizes themes and atmospheres that lead him from "Star Trek" to "Starship Troopers", especially as regards life on board with its camaraderie, jealousies and love stories.

title: Galgameth
actors: Stephen Macht, Johna Stewart-Bowden, Devin Oatway, Time Winters
description: Prince Davin mourns the death of his father killed by his most evil enemy El El. The young man's copious tears fall on a statuette given to him by his parent. Suddenly, as if by magic, the simulacrum comes to life and turns into a faithful and excellent friend. Galgameth, this is the name that the young prince gives to his friend, he feeds on metal and grows dramatically day after day. But things in Prince Davin's reign are not going well: assassinations, coup attempts and a fierce band of usurpers try to drive the new ruler out of his lands. Fortunately, Davin has Galgameth on his side who soon becomes his new ally. Thanks to his generous and, above all, precious help Davin will be able to drive out he hates him and to regain the throne that has been usurped from him.
notes: Children's film that exploits multiple legends and relies on the sense of adventure that so fascinates kids all over the world. The theme of friendship and fraternal collaboration is at the center of the film starring unknown actors.

title: The Peacekeeper
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Roy Scheider, Montel Williams
description: Douglas Murphy, a mercenary often used by the CIA for the most dangerous missions, is abandoned by his superiors to his fate. But the soldier is saved, returns to America and decides to hit Washington with a nuclear warhead. However, he did not deal with "the peacemaker", another mercenary, however, lined up on the right side.
notes: It's really a shame to see Roy Scheider employed (badly) in such boorish productions. A very low-level film, in which irony and an adventurous spirit disappear.

title: In God's Hands
actors: Patrick Shane Dorian, Matt George, Matty Liu, Shaun Tomson
description: Mickey, Shane and Keoni want at all costs to become one with the sea, in a sort of ritual mating with nature. To be able to meet waves never ridden by anyone and experience the ecstasy of conquest, they embark on a ship bound for the coasts of Madagascar, Mexico, Bali and Hawaii.
notes: The references of the film by Zalman King, author of "Wild Orchid" and "The Delta of Venus", are clear: "Big Wednesday", "Point Break" ... But King's new exploit has incredible ambitions, to starting from the original title, "In the hands of God", involuntarily comic if you try to follow the philosophical and religious remnants of the screenplay. The result is a grueling new age video clip similar to an exotic moving postcard.

title: The Mummy
actors: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo
description: In 1719 a. C. in Thebes in Egypt a forbidden love is born between the high priest Imhotep and the pharaoh's lover. The girl kills herself out of desperation and the priest lets himself go to desperate gestures, arousing the wrath of the gods. The deities inflict a terrible sentence on him: being buried alive in the city of Hamunaptra. 1923: Rick O'Connell, a young legionnaire, Evelyn, a librarian, and Jonathan, her brother, are in search of Imhotep's fabulous treasure. They arouse the Mummy's wrath by causing her to awaken.
notes: More adventure than horror, more smiles than shivers, with lots of winks, not only to the Spielberg saga and Raimi, but also to the exotic cinematic adventures of the Thirties, to the dynamism of Errol Flynn.

title: The Thirteenth Floor
actors: Vincent D'Onofrio, Gretchen Mol, Armin Mueller-Stahl, Craig Bierko
description: On the thirteenth floor of a skyscraper where a large corporation is based, Douglas and Hannon pushed virtual technology to the maximum by rebuilding Los Angeles in 1937. When Douglas wakes up in a daze, he discovers a bloody shirt and Hannon's corpse in the back room. of a pub. Called to recognize the body in the coroner's 'morgue', the suspicions fall on him. But is he the real culprit and, above all, why doesn't he remember anything?
notes: The Emmerich brothers (producers-creators) enjoy disrupting what is allowed and inserting traps as if they were "driving on a playstation": if you are at the video (game) you can also have fun trying to understand at what "level" you are. has arrived.

title: Wild Wild West
actors: Kevin Kline, Will Smith, Kenneth Branagh, Salma Hayek
description: Special government agents James and Artemus are sent on the trail of the evil Dr. Arliss Loveless. He is devising a plan to assassinate the President of the United States with the help of a monstrously sized armed vehicle called the Tarantula.
notes: The film is an emblematic example of what marketing dictates reads more than the will of authors and performers (the film has been reassembled, cut and sweetened). "Theft" against a television series (which lasted in the USA from '65 to '70: 122 episodes here condensed as a gigantic promo) has no narrative to support it, and it clings exclusively to Will Smith's verve. Kline mimics Jack Lemmon's "Some Like It Hot" (once again), Salma Hayek is sacrificed, and Branagh wanders around in a hellish machine (entirely computer created) without conviction.

title: Nemesis
actors: Olivier Gruner, Brion James, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Tim Thomerson
description: Usual near future, usual futuristic metropolis gutted by crime and chaos. A group of terrorists decides to exploit the situation to subvert the social order. But he hasn't come to terms with Alex, the LAPD's best "man", half human, half cyborg.
notes: Albert Pyun is a prolific author of B movies in this case committed to remaking "Robocop". Modest means, some good action sequences but terrifying staging. Actor Brion James, a level character actor (the unforgettable Leon from "Blade Runner"), passed away just a few weeks ago.

title: The Base
actors: Mark Dacascos, Tim Abel, Paula Trickey, Noah Blake, Dwayne Macopson
description: An officer is wounded while in Fort Tilman. For this reason, the Pentagon, in an attempt to clarify the subject, sends a military man to investigate. The lucky one who is assigned the task is Major John Murphy who enters the fort by taking the name of John Dalton. During an inspection Murphy / Dalton discovers a shipment of drugs hidden in a truck. Investigations begin ...
notes: Mark L. Lester ("Commando") directs an all-action film that spares no scenes of violence. Mark Dacascos and the beautiful and sensual Paula Trickey thinks about saving the shack: keep an eye on her.

title: Yellow Sky
actors: Richard Widmark, Anne Baxter, Gregory Peck
description: A group of former soldiers turned bandits arrive in a mining village where they are greeted by the only two inhabitants, an old gold digger and his grandson. The "ghost" country is the scene of the clash between the two leaders of the group, Dude and James, who have very different ideas on how to continue (and especially "if" to continue) the criminal activity.
notes: Understated western inspired by Shakespeare's "Tempest". A tragic explosion that lends itself well to the classic iconography of the western. Widmark's test is truly superb, while Peck's is more tarnished. Remade in '66 by Robert Webb, with the title of "Six guns for six carrion".

title: Zulu Dawn
actors: Burt Lancaster, Peter O'Toole, Simon Ward, Denholm Elliott
description: Year of grace 1878: the English soldiers, regimented and loyal to formal discipline, in order not to break ranks sprawling, let themselves be massacred in an ambush set by the warriors of the Zulu tribe, backward in terms of strategy but certainly more alert in tactics. The massacre creates complications for the settlement operations of the colonizers.
notes: The title seems to be that of a horror: instead Hickox's film tells, pompously, a fact that really happened. Exoticism for families in the panoramic vision of Africa, with a very high-sounding cast. Ideal prequel to Cy Enfield's _Zulu_ (1964).

title: Airspeed
actors: Elisha Cuthbert, Joe Mantegna, Lynne Adams, Jason Cavalier
description: A 13-year-old girl, the daughter of a very wealthy American businessman, leaves on her father's private plane. During a storm, lightning strikes the plane, killing the pilot and injuring the rest of the crew. The girl, terrified, finds herself alone to face the dramatic situation. It will attempt a crash landing, piloted from the ground by the control tower.
notes: TV movie anything but original but at least with a right dose of suspense. Those who suffer from air sickness should abstain. Recommended, however, for those who, as a child, wanted to be a pilot or astronaut.

title: Hard Bounty
actors: Matt McCoy, Kelly LeBrock, Rochelle Swanson, John Terlesky
description: After spending quiet years, Martin Kanning decides to get into trouble by buying the most important saloon in the city; over time, he realizes that the girls of the restaurant (one of whom, Donnie, strikes him for his attractiveness) have a relationship with customers that goes beyond the usual welcome. Soon the man will have to come to terms with the unscrupulous owner of a railway that is being built in the area: but when he kills one of his employees, Martin - who in the meantime has joined with Donnie - tries to do justice ...
notes: Mediocre attempt to "revive" the western with sexy injections.

title: Thunder in Paradise
actors: Hulk Hogan, Carol Alt, Felicity Waterman, Sam J. Jones, Chris Lemmon
description: Megan, the beautiful girl who owns the Paradise Beach Hotel has two days to find a husband. The woman inherited the hotel from her father, but according to a will clause, if within a year of her parent's death she does not marry, her uncle Edward will become the rightful owner of the hotel. Meanwhile, Spence, burdened by debt, does not know how to cope with the dire situation. Although the two hate each other to death, they decide to arrange a marriage of convenience to try to solve each other's problems. But to jeopardize their plan, David Kilmer, a dangerous criminal, gets in the way.

title: Scar City
actors: Stephen Baldwin, Chazz Palminteri, Tia Carrere, Michael Rispoli
description: John Track is a young and enterprising policeman, who is transferred to a special corps. The agent soon realizes that his new unit is made up of unscrupulous policemen. During a raid on a gangster's home, John's team kills everyone in the house. John finds Candy, one of the callers, and runs away with her. Pulled off and very predictable action movie.

title: The Hallyday Brand
actors: Joseph Cotten, Viveca Lindfors, Betsy Blair, Ward Bond
description: Daniel, Dan's eldest son, a despotic cattle owner and sheriff, does not get along with his father's authoritarian and despotic methods. In the family environment, the atmosphere becomes even more tense when Dan discovers that Marta, Daniel's sister, has fallen in love with a half-caste who reciprocates his love. The man, opposed to the relationship, does not want a black man to enter his family and does everything to prevent the union between the two.
notes: Small B series masterpiece directed by a top class director. A western almost entirely shot indoors, full of visual metaphors and nuances.

title: Cyborg
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Deborah Richter, Vincent Klyn
description: The Earth has just emerged from a nuclear apocalypse and gangs of thugs roam everywhere trying to get hold of everything they need to survive. A fierce cyborg fights against these fearsome gangs who kill, steal and enjoy raging on the weakest people. The guerrilla soon becomes without quarter and will see our hero engaged in a close battle. Who will be able to win?
notes: Albert Pyun is a cult director for the new generations and Van Damme, here in the lead role, brings his entire repertoire as a consummate actor into play. The result is not exactly excellent, but the film still has a certain tension.

title: Grey Owl
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Annie Galipeau, Graham Greene, Nathaniel Arcand
description: Archie, an English trapper born in Hastings and transplanted to Canada, is a man of the woods who lives by hunting fur animals and selling beaver skins. One day he has a shock: the animals are the children of Manitou, why kill them? The man converts to the environmental cause, is mistaken for an Indian, since he calls himself Gray Owl, and begins to preach respect for nature in front of Western tourists.
notes: Richard Attenborough's film is really a film for tourists, a brochure full of beautiful new age expressions and radical chic environmentalism. Cinema not even talking about it: even the incredible scenarios of Canada are mortified by a pompous but never vibrant direction.

title: Doctor Dolittle
actors: Rex Harrison, Anthony Newley, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough
description: Doctor Dolittle, tired of treating men, devotes himself to animals, whose language he knows thoroughly because he is properly instructed by the Polynesian parrot. One day his friend Pennalunga sends the doctor from Tibet a fabulous two-headed animal that Dolittle intends to show in a circus. With the money earned, the doctor wants to arm a ship and set out in search of the mythical Gastropodone. For helping the seal Sofia to reach her husband, Dolittle ends up in court where he is mistaken for insane.
notes: A fairy tale with singing interludes, ruined, as usual, by dubbing. Oscar for best song and visual effects.

title: Evil Dead 2
actors: Bruce Campbell, Sarah Berry, Dan Hicks, Kassie DePaiva
description: A group of boys decide to spend the weekend in a remote cottage in the forest. Within the walls of the house they find the ancient book of the dead: by reciting a magic formula they awaken an ancient demon who, of course, is not very happy. Carnage ensues, at the speed of light.
notes: A sequel produced by Dino De Laurentiis of "La casa", the film with which Sam Raimi made his debut. The handcrafted aspect of the model is replaced by special effects, always at the service of the author's unbridled imagination. More than a horror, a splatter cartoon that constantly mentions the masters of animation: from Tex Avery to Chuck Jones.

title: Fled
actors: Laurence Fishburne, Stephen Baldwin, Salma Hayek
description: Two prisoners who have never loved each other madly manage to escape and go into hiding in the countryside of Georgia. One is white and one is black, one is a hacker, the other a pusher. They would like to take different paths but they cannot, because a chain binds them together. On their trail half a body of state police and also the Cuban mafia. It will not be a pleasure trip.
notes: Remake of "Mud Wall", Stanley Kramer's beautiful film all about creeping racism. In this case, we do not go beyond a modest packaging, which winks at the younger audience, winking at a thousand other films of the genre.

title: World Without End
actors: Hugh Marlowe, Rod Taylor, Nancy Gates
description: A spaceship leaves the Earth heading for Mars but at a certain point finds itself with the engine in failure. Adrift in Space, it breaks through the barrier of time and ends up on the Earth of the future, in 2058. The astronauts must defend themselves from the inhabitants, whom terrible radiations have transformed into monsters. In fact, the Earth looks like a near-coming Middle Ages, upset by the atomic war.
notes: Serie B science fiction without particular attractions but ahead of its time as regards the underlying theme. Despite some ingenuity, a pioneering film after all.

title: Communion
actors: Christopher Walken, Lindsay Crouse, Holly Fields
description: Whitley Strieber goes with her family and some friends on vacation to her forest home. One night the various members of the party realize that something strange is happening above them, and an idea begins to flash in their minds in Whitley and his companions: if they were in the presence of "close proximity of the third kind" phenomena? Curiosity killed the cat, and Whitley finds herself in up to neck trouble with the aliens.
notes: A start to the "X-Files" for this very well done Tv movie. Great Walken and also decent "low budget" special effects. Don't expect "Star Wars" spaceships, however ...

title: Moby Dick
actors: Patrick Stewart, Gregory Peck, Henry Thomas
description: Ismael, a young man seeking adventure, arrives in Nantucket to find work on a whaling ship. Ismael becomes friends with a Polynesian harpooner, and together they embark on the Pequod, the boat of the legendary Captain Ahab. Little is known about the latter, but a terrible white whale is said to have stolen his leg.
notes: Based on the novel by Melville, with a cameo by Gregory Peck, star of the great John Huston film, it is a very modest version for TV.

title: Riot
actors: Gary Daniels, Sugar Ray Leonard, Paige Rowland, Patrick Kilpatrick
description: December 24, 1999. It is Christmas Eve, the last of the millennium. The city is in turmoil. Gang of criminals wreak havoc. The situation explodes when the daughter of a British ambassador is kidnapped by a gang of thugs. The task is entrusted to Special Agent Shane Alcott. To find it, he puts the city to fire and sword, while the tension in the ghetto neighborhoods rises more and more dangerously.
notes: Sugar Ray Leonard is the famous boxer who hung up his gloves. Wasted Gary Daniels on such a poor production. The echoes of riot that dot the film (and the original title, "Riot", means "riot") would obviously remind us of the 1992 Los Angeles riots, which broke out after the Rodney King case.

title: Dragonheart
actors: Dennis Quaid, Dina Meyer, David Thewlis, Julie Christie, Pete Postlethwaite, Brian Thompson, Jason Isaacs, Lee Oakes
description: A knight of fortune, specialized in the fight against dragons and the like, puts himself at the service of the highest bidder in England in the year one thousand. The usual tyrant sows death and destruction, and fears the last dragon who survived the slaughters of yesteryear. Our knight sets out on the trail of the fire-breathing beast with unfriendly intentions, then becomes his friend and ally. Together they will try to defeat the despot.
notes: Imaginative adventure film embellished with special effects, which allow the dragon to "live" seriously. In the original version his voice is by Sean Connery, in Italian by Gigi Proietti.

title: Desert Hawk
actors: Yvonne De Carlo, Richard Greene, George Macready
description: The Desert Eagle is an undercover adventurer very similar to Zorro. Except that in reality his name is Omar and he lives in the Middle East, precisely in Tehran. The caliph of the city extinguishes the people until they are reduced to poverty, and the Eagle decides to blackmail them by kidnapping Sherazade, his betrothed. However, he discovers that the girl is by no means an accomplice of the despot, and indeed takes sides in the adventurer's struggle. Together with her, the Eagle manages to defeat the caliph and avert war with Baghdad.
notes: Adventurous melodrama that respects all the clichés of the "swashbuckling" genre. Excellent De Carlo in one of his most ... exotic roles.

title: Johnny 2.0
actors: Jeff Fahey, Michael Ironside, Tahnee Welch, John Neville, Michael Rhoades
description: In a futuristic world (year of grace 2013) Johnny 2.0, clone of a brilliant scientist, is sent back in time to try to capture his creator. With the help of Nikki, a terrorist, the cyborg will instead discover the dark and disconcerting truth behind her creation.
notes: Cybermovie with an existential aftertaste, a little old-fashioned (between the replicants of "Blade Runner" and "Terminator") and not excellent workmanship. The production denounces the limits of the television film, but the B movie faces of the protagonists are quite convincing. Gorgeous Tahnee Welch and excellent Ironside in the habitual role of the villain.

title: Way of a Gaucho
actors: Rory Calhoun, Gene Tierney, Richard Bone, Hugh Marlowe
description: Argentina, late last century, Martin is a proud gaucho who grew up with Miguel. One day Martin kills a man who had dared to offend his friend and is arrested for this. The murderer, following Miguel's advice, enlisted in the army, but intolerant of discipline, deserted. Surprised by a squad of guards, he is led back to his battalion where he is subjected to inhuman punishment.

title: Gulliver's Travel
actors: Ted Danson, Omar Sharif, Peter O'Toole, Edward Fox, Mary Steenburgen
description: Confused and excited, Gulliver returns to London and tells his fellow citizens the incredible story of his travels. Everyone refuses to believe his words. Considered mad, he is locked up in an asylum by Dr. Bates, the man who in his absence had taken over his house and his profession and who, for several years, had tried to convince Gulliver's wife that he was dead in order to induce her to marry him. Gulliver, tries in every way to overcome the disbelief and skepticism of his family and friends. Decent television adaptation in two episodes, with the effects of the firm Henson (that of the Muppett) and Isabelle Huppert dubbing a horse with a French accent.

title: Storm
actors: Luke Perry, Martin Sheen, Robert Knott, David Moses, Marc McClure
description: A secret experiment, aimed at creating a deadly new weapon, causes an accident that changes the weather conditions over Los Angeles. A large cyclone threatens the Californian megalopolis. Alarmed, the inhabitants prepare to flee, while confusion reigns supreme. Fortunately, a meteorologist tries by all means to save the city with the help of a brave jet pilot.
notes: Classic B-series movie with mid-level special effects. Renée Estevez is Martin Sheen's granddaughter.

title: Escape From Zahrain
actors: Yul Brynner, Sal Mineo, Madlyn Rhue, Jack Warden, James Mason
description: In a Middle Eastern state, tyrannized by a sultan, the resistance is led by the energetic Sharif, who is currently in jail awaiting the death sentence. The news of his possible transfer to another prison alerts his faithful who, thanks to a lightning-fast action, manage to free him. Houston, an American adventurer, who is on the side of the rebels and who plans a plan to expatriate Sharif, is also involved in the shooting. Having seized an ambulance from an oil company, he manages to escape with Sharif into the desert.
notes: Modest adventure film with a first-rate cast.

title: The Illustrated Man
actors: Rod Steiger, Claire Bloom, Robert Drivas, Don Dubbins, Jason Evers
description: Will, a boy who wants to go to California by means of luck, meets Karl, a guy who forces him to listen to his story. Clown in a circus, the man got tattooed by a woman, who had completely subjugated him, some strange figures all over his body. Will also feels attracted to those incomprehensible figures and without realizing it, dwelling on some of them, he finds himself transported to a distant and terrifying future.
notes: Jack Smight takes the subject from a Ray Bradbury story and manages to pack a convincing film, which never lets the tension go down.

title: The Terminal Man
actors: George Segal, Joan Hackett, Richard A. Dysart, Jill Clayburgh
description: Benson, electronic technician, enthusiastic robot builder, is struck by a brain disease that leads him to attack those around him. In a short time the man attacks his wife and kills two people. He then undergoes a delicate brain surgery to reduce these violent attacks. But instead Benson turns into a kind of cybernetic, violent and murderous Frankenstein.
notes: Good reduction of a Michael Crichton novel and good example of a sci-fi thriller.

title: Grizzly Falls
actors: Bryan Brown, Daniel Clark, Richard Harris, Oliver Tobias
description: Tyrone is a hunter who has got his hands on a brood of teddy bears. The man, however, did not take into account the obstinacy of the mother bear who decided to bring her cubs back to the forest. The animal wanders around his home and, in revenge, kidnaps Tyrone's son. Fearing the worst, the hunter sets out on the trail of the bear, determined to take revenge for the insult he has suffered. The animal, on the other hand, proved to be a capable and loving companion towards the boy.
notes: Shot on the outskirts of Vancouver for economic reasons, the film does not stray from the usual television movies. It certainly makes use of a breathtaking landscape and the sympathy of the interpreters.

title: Tornado!
actors: L. Q. Jones, Shannon Sturges, Ernie Hudson, Bruce Campbell
description: Samantha Callen is invited by the National Accounting Office in Byron, Texas to challenge Dr. Branson's research project, engaged in the study of tornadoes. The scientist has created Patti, a machine capable of detecting all useful information on tornadoes and allowing him to prevent the enormous disasters caused by them. Samantha is determined to follow orders, but examining Dr. Branson's work she realizes its usefulness, especially when a tornado strikes Byron. During his mission he meets Jake, passionate about these natural phenomena and falls in love with them.

title: End of Days
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Gabriel Byrne, Kevin Pollak, Robin Tunney
description: For ex-cop Jericho Cane, his work alongside fellow Chicago is a dull routine of monotonous patrols and surveillance. One day, however, he is dragged, in spite of himself, into a dangerous game with a woman: Christine, a young predestined and haunted by recurring nightmares. The woman is the unconscious object of desire of a man who apparently appears to be a normal person, but, in reality, is the supreme force of Evil and who would like to mate with her to generate the Antichrist.
notes: Anthology dialogues of the perfect shameless screenwriter, a visionary priest who has the burden of calling himself Thomas Aquinas, the most powerful peeing devil of the super, Schwarzy crucified. Need to add more?

title: Blade
actors: Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff, Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright
description: Unbeknownst to everyone, vampires have slowly introduced themselves to various levels of society and act in finance and politics. Together Blade and Abraham embark on a bloody crusade to defeat them and free the city from their creepy grip. With the help of Abraham, Blade, half man, half vampire, uncovers the diabolical secret of their leader, Deacon Frost, who is preparing for the day when he will take over all vampires to take over the world.
notes: Based on the comic by Mark Wolfman, very well written by David S. Goyer ("Dark City"), embellished with make-up by Greg Cannom ("Dracula" by Coppola), produced / performed by Wesley Snipes, notable martial artist, " Blade "tries to create, through the outbursts of" blaxploitation ", a B series of" reformist "fantasy cinema in the" Matrix "style. With more honesty towards the genre and less theoretical resourcefulness. But the director does not grasp the ideas offered by the script, does not value the characters and "runs away" on the fights by cheating with the viewer. Technique is not enough if the plastic sense of form and action is completely missing.

title: The 13th Warrior
actors: Antonio Banderas, Vladimir Kulich, Dennis Storhøi, Daniel Southern
description: Ahmed Ibn Fahdlan was born in the city of Baghdad which, in 922, represents the cradle of civilization. The courtier falls in love with the sultan's woman and as punishment is sent along with his mentor Melchisidek as an emissary to the Viking population. Here he discovers that they are seriously threatened by a tribe of cannibals and that he is the elusive thirteenth warrior the Vikings are waiting for.
notes: From Michael Crichton's book "Death Eaters" McTiernan and Crichton himself (producer) have made a film that is sometimes funny but not very exciting. It seems that on the set the director clashed with the novelist-producer. Smothered by a deluxe Hollywood packaging and a fashion "mud" aesthetic, the film never finds its way to the barbaric heart of cinema.

title: Haunting
actors: Liam Neeson, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Lili Taylor, Owen Wilson
description: Doctor Marrow, fascinated by what is said about Hill House, under the pretext of conducting scientific research on sleep disorders, gathers three young people in the house. Theo, an apparently self-confident researcher, Nell who proves to have particular psychic skills and the cynical Luke who does not believe in the experiments that the doctor is conducting. When ghosts begin to peep, terror spares no one.
notes: This film by Jan De Bont owes a lot to Roger Corman (which owes very little to Robert Wise's beautiful "Gli possati", if not the subject, inspired by the same novel). But Corman worked with stylization and profound irony and a disturbing vision of the subterranean things of the world in his films. Instead, De Bont works with spectacular emphasis and deep silky ghosts, footprints of bloody feet and a huge evil presence that seems to come out of "Fantasia". The special effects eat the soul of the film and turn it into a dizzying bandwagon.

title: Ride Lonesome
actors: Randolph Scott, Karen Steele, Lee Van Cleef, James Coburn
description: An unscrupulous outlaw kills a former sheriff's wife. Which does not remain idle and kidnaps the brother of the bandit, hoping to be able to use him as bait. During his journey, the former sheriff meets a widow and two fugitives who want to bring the prisoner to justice in order to obtain an amnesty.
notes: Splendid B-series western, dusty and rough like the expressionless face of the monolithic Randolph Scott. In its own way, a masterpiece of the genre for its dry style of script (by Burt Kennedy). And as if that weren't good enough on its own, "The Tree of Vengeance" also marks the debut of James Coburn.

title: Westbound
actors: Randolph Scott, Virginia Mayo, Karen Steele
description: As the Civil War ensues, a northern officer is given a particularly dangerous assignment. He must cross enemy lines to transport a shipment of California gold to his headquarters. Of course, the Confederates won't make his life easy.
notes: Western all action by the great Budd Boetticher. Without his usual screenwriter Burt Kennedy, the director skims the plot more as a function of the adventure. In addition to fetish actor Randolph Scott, Karen Scott, who is also the filmmaker's wife, also returns. But the real surprise is Virginia Mayo!

title: Rush Hour
actors: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Tom Wilkinson, Tzi Ma, Ken Leung, Chris Penn
description: Lee, an unyielding and busy officer, is the pride of the Royal Hong Kong Police Force. His favorite pupil is the eleven-year-old daughter of the Chinese consul, but the girl, traveling to the United States, is kidnapped. So the consul sends him there to try to get his hands on the thugs. The FBI, with little intentions of investigative meddling, assigns the case to Detective James Carter who, when he finds out what his role is to keep Lee away from the case, goes on a rampage.
notes: The best is always expected from an action movie with Jackie Chan. And instead the director can't even keep up with "Lethal Weapon 4", the representation is so dull.

title: Jamaica Run
actors: Ray Milland, Arlene Dahl, Wendell Corey, Patric Knowles, Laura Elliott
description: The Dilling family, a mother and two grown-up children, live in Villa Alta, an extensive landed property on the coast of Jamaica. The estate belonged to their ancestor John who put it up for sale, but the documents proving it ended up in the bottom of the sea with him. An unscrupulous businessman contacts Jenny and Robert, two descendants of the alleged buyer, and convinces them to do some research to find the cash box with the documents. But one day Robert is found dead and Jenny risks drowning in a cave ...
notes: The subject and the direction are not very convincing and the presence of Ray Milland fails to revive the film.

title: Inner Sanctum 2
actors: Michael Nouri, Jennifer Reed, Margaux Hemingway
description: After killing her husband in an excess of self-defense, a woman lives in the throes of the worst nightmares. The deceased returns from the afterlife to kill her, or at least she believes she can. Meanwhile, the protagonist's relatives try to make her look crazy ...
notes: The film is a disaster, but it may well find its admirers. Because there are authentically cult moments: the protagonist in a cemetery dancing with her dead husband, as well as scenes of necrophilia in large quantities (probably reduced by the television version). If this is a "number 2", let's imagine _Inner Sanctum_ 1!

title: Fort Worth
actors: Randolph Scott, David Brian, Phyllis Thaxter, Helena Carter
description: Ned Britt, a former gunfighter who turned to journalism, travels with his partner Ben to Texas to start a newspaper. During the journey Ned meets Flora who convinces him to go to Forth Worth, where Blair, Ned's old friend and old boyfriend of the girl, lives. In Fort Worth, however, the gang of the outlaw Claranger rages and the protagonist is asked to stay to protect the peaceful inhabitants.
notes: Western of series B with the idol of the "lower" part of the vein. Nothing special, but an interesting atmosphere and a remarkable storytelling speed.

title: It
actors: Tim Curry, John Ritter, Annette O'Toole, Tim Reid, Richard Masur
description: Derry, Maine. The town is devastated by strange deaths and disappearances. A group of friends decide to form a gang to eradicate the reason for so much evil, a black monster who lives in the sewers. But there is another monster that stagnates in the country, it is the one "evoked" by the wickedness and meanness of men.
notes: Stephen King's river novel, perhaps his literary masterpiece, with the great invention of the clown. The TV version certainly doesn't hold its own, but Tommy Lee Wallace, a former Carpenter's collaborator, still made a decent drama.

title: The Curse
actors: Wil Wheaton, Claude Akins, Malcolm Danare, Cooper Huckabee
description: Nathan tries to run his farm as best he can. A real estate agent is trying to buy most of the farms in the area, including the Hayes, in hopes that the Tennessee authorities will choose the city as the location for the new playground. One night, during a terrible storm, an unidentified shiny object strikes down on the Hayes' farm and brings with it a terrible curse for the members of the entire community. The object is a meteorite which, after dissolving in the ground, contaminates it. Soon fruit and livestock fill with larvae and some members of the family become bloated, drooling mutants. But two of the farmer's sons who avoided meteor contamination seek help.
notes: Based on a short story by H. P. Lovecraft, the film is shot flat and leaves no room for imagination.

title: Bicentennial Man
actors: Robin Williams, Sam Neill, Oliver Platt, Hallie Kate Eisenberg
description: Richard Martin decides to give himself a gift: a brand new NDR-114 robot that his youngest daughter, who mistook him for an android, renames Andrew. But Andrew is not an android, but a robot bought to perform the humblest tasks: cooking, cleaning, looking after children and playing with them. But an accident caused by Richard's youngest daughter prompts the whole family to treat him like a human being. And for his part, Andrew also begins to have almost human feelings.
notes: Based on the story of the same name and the novel "The Positronic Man", it tells the 200 years of life of a robot who learns to think and feel like a man. But 200 years is too long even for filmmakers.

title: The Proud Ones
actors: Robert Ryan, Virginia Mayo, Jeffrey Hunter, Robert Middleton
description: Cass, expelled from Keyton for killing a certain Enderson, is appointed sheriff of Cattle, a town in the West in full expansion. There he meets Ted, son of the man he killed long ago. Trusting certain rumors, the boy believes that his father was killed by treason and does not give credit to the words of Cass who claims otherwise. But Ted can't help but intervene when the sheriff is threatened with death while in the gambling den set up by Barret.
notes: The film is appreciated for its good action scenes. Ryan gives a nice characterization of his character.

title: Fly Away Home
actors: Jeff Daniels, Anna Paquin, Dana Delany, Terry Kinney, Holter Graham
description: Amy is a 13-year-old girl with an unbridled passion for animals. To drive from Canada to Florida, a flock of ducklings learns to drive a flying toy that their father built for them. The cute birds were left without a mother and took little Amy to heart. The journey will present considerable difficulties but Amy, gifted with remarkable courage, will do all she can to complete the feat.
notes: Adventures for kids based on Bill Lishman's autobiography and shot by Carroll Ballard ("Black Stallion" and "Wind"). In Italy the film was sponsored by Legambiente.

title: Thrashin'
actors: Sherilyn Fenn, Josh Brolin, Beau Brown, Michael Balzary (Flea)
description: A group of boys, known by everyone as the Valley Boys and who roam the neighborhood with skateboards, collide with a punk gang. Leading the former is Corey Webster, while Tommy Hook leads the latter. The two groups compete for the supremacy of the territory. The real problems begin when Corey falls in love with Tommy's sister, who has arrived from Indiana. The decisive battle between the two gangs takes place on a hill used by skaters for their evolutions and called L.A. Massacre.
notes: Youthful film not the worst, supported by the music and the rhythm of the direction. Among the performers Michael Balzary, better known as Flea, bassist of the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

title: Sleepy Hollow
actors: Johnny Depp, Christina Ricci, Christopher Walken, Miranda Richardson, Michael Gambon, Casper Van Dien, Ian McDiarmid, Michael Gough
description: Ichabod Crane, an investigator in 1799 New York, is sent to the small town of Sleepy Hollow. Here is a headless horseman who, at night, comes out of hell and goes around cutting off the heads of citizens. In his hunt for the knight Ichabod he can count on the help of Katrina and the young Masbeth, fatherless.
notes: From a short story by Washington Irving, Tim Burton constructs his eerie and ironic horror. A horror that follows Hammer's iconography and narrative scraps. Over everything dominates the fairytale sense of Burton, who knows how to joke with his nightmares but also build thrilling scenes, such as the one in which the knight comes out of the bowels of the earth through the trunk of the tree that has taken root on his grave.

title: Back in Business
actors: Brian Bosworth, Joe Torry, Dara Tomanovich, Brion Jones, Alan Scarfe
description: Joe Elkhart, engaged in a secret operation on behalf of the FBI, was a policeman before being set up and having his badge collected. The official purpose of the mission he is taking part in is to defeat a drug trafficking organization. In reality, the real target of the action is a group of corrupt cops. Among them there are also those who had framed him and therefore Joe will be forced to sell his life dearly.
notes: To be an action movie there is very little. If you then add a Brian Bosworth to the limit of his acting possibilities, you understand what film it is.

title: Three Kings
actors: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube, Spike Jonze
description: A patrol of three soldiers decides to get their hands on a treasure well hidden by the Iraqis. This is the mythical gold that Saddam Hussein stole from Kuwait and which is now hidden in who knows what corner of the country. The frantic hunt allows them to discover the less glorious sides of Operation "Storm in the Desert".
notes: Almost an essay on the evolution of cinematic syntax after the sunset of slow motion editing. Fast, fun and well acted: lovers of the genre will not be disappointed. Instead, it is very ambiguous in the message. Harnessed in the mesh of "politically correct", Russell pretends to point the finger at the dirty war and the army, then makes it clear that the Americans may well be scoundrels but remain the only defenders of freedom.

title: The Deadly Trackers
actors: Richard Harris, Rod Taylor, Al Lettieri, Neville Brand, William Smith
description: Frank Brend and his gang land a heist in the Santa Rosa village bank and to escape capture by local sheriff John Riata, they kill his wife and son. John, a man who hates to use weapons, this time takes it into his head to look for the killers. But the feds are also on their trail. Meanwhile, one after another, the members of the gang are knocked out.
notes: Very modest work that does not rise even with the angry interpretation of Richard Harris.

title: Lake Placid
actors: Bridget Fonda, Bill Pullman, Oliver Platt, Brendan Gleeson
description: A group of investigators arrive on the shores of a Maine lake to investigate clues relating to a mysterious incident. A paleontologist is involved in the research, following the discovery of a gigantic tooth that seems to be of prehistoric origin. Rich and eccentric mythology expert Professor Cyr convinces the team of scientists to capture and study whatever life forms they find.
notes: Characters almost from comics try their hand at the creature of the abyss, but basically everyone has an ecological soul and despite the danger they want the monster's salvation. It's an unassuming film with the flavor of old B-grade cinema, the one loved by American teenagers in the 1950s and 1960s matinees. A little naïve it is more reminiscent of "The Monster of the Black Lagoon" than "The Shark", even if the reptile is the work of Stan Winston, creator of the dinosaurs of "Jurassic Park" and "The Lost World".

title: Tall Man Riding
actors: Randolph Scott, Dorothy Malone, Peggie Castle, John Dehner
description: After a long absence Larry Madden decides to return to his native village determined to take revenge on the father of his girlfriend Corinna, who has always opposed their union. Meanwhile, the girl got married and Larry, without knowing it, saves her husband's life and kills one of the attackers. Corinna's husband is blamed for the murder of the bandit, who cannot even count on Larry's testimony, at the mercy of the bandits.
notes: Western series B of the 50s with the absolute star of the trend and a breathtaking female presence, Dorothy Malone.

title: The Tall Texan
actors: Lee J. Cobb, Lloyd Bridges, Marie Windsor, Luther Adler
description: A wagon carrying six people is attacked by a gang of Indians on the trail of a runaway Indian accused of murder by his tribe. The six repel the attack, but remain without their means of transport. In the meantime, they learn that a rich gold deposit exists near an Indian cemetery and, helped by the sought-after fugitive, they manage to locate it. The place, however, is controlled by the Indians with whom it is necessary to come to terms.
notes: Definitely good starting point although the characters are sketchy and unlikely. Lloyd Bridges as Jeff's father.

title: The Spiral Road
actors: Rock Hudson, Gena Rowlands, Burl Ives, Geoffrey Keen
description: A young Belgian doctor decides to leave with his wife for the island of Java. As soon as he arrived on the spot he notices the painful hygienic conditions in which the population lives. The doctor is convinced that the only religion that can save man is science. So when a tropical epidemic breaks out first and then leprosy, he goes to great lengths to help the sick. However, when a sorcerer openly challenges him, he is forced to change his mind.
notes: The film, a little too verbose, is based on a novel by Jan de Hartog. Gena Rowlands, at the beginning of her career, is already proving good.

title: Fever Lake
actors: Corey Haim, Stan Adams, Cynthia Baker, Lindsey Brooke
description: Summer of 1966, the schools are over and a group of young people on vacation travels around the United States in search of a place to spend the long-awaited holidays in peace. After wandering around for a long time, and not being able to find a quiet place, they decide to head to Fever Lake. Arriving there they have the bad idea of ??renting an old Victorian house. Within the walls there are tremendous supernatural forces. A truly unforgettable holiday begins for them.
notes: Nothing new in this television movie, non-existent directing and below average actors.

title: Legion
