actors: Parker Stevenson, Terry Farrell, Corey Feldman, Rick Springfield
description: In the not too distant future, General Fleming, who commands a group of special forces, needs a suicide squad to assault a distant enemy base. The choice falls on a group of former life prisoners led by Lieutenant Aldrich and Officer Doyle, a woman who has been given a last chance at redemption. The legion includes Seigal, an electronic wizard, Poe, a beast always ready to fight, Karlsson, a celibate engineer, Ryan, an explosives expert, an unpredictable drug addict Cutter, Goodie, a taciturn killer and Jones, a doctor who blindly believes in mission.

title: Madron
actors: Richard Boone, Leslie Caron, Paul Smith, Gabi Amrani
description: Fortunately surviving the assault of the Comanches tribe, while she was heading to Santa Fé with a sister to found a mission, Sister Maria Elena runs into Madron. The man is hunted by Sam Red, because, to avenge his family, he killed his wife. Madrov, pitied by Sister Maria Elena, who risks becoming a victim of the Indians or some bandit, offers to accompany her. On the way Madrov meets Angel, an old friend of his, who is forced to sacrifice to save his skin and that of the nun.
notes: There is no shortage of adventures and shootings in this Jerry Hopper film.

title: Love and a .45
actors: Renée Zellweger, Gil Bellows, Rory Cochrane, Peter Fonda
description: Watty and Starlene are two in love with the hobby of robbery. Everything goes smoothly until they are forced to use weapons: two corpses are enough to put the police and the underworld on their trail. As if that weren't enough, the media exploit their fame by turning them into two heroes ...
notes: Have you heard this story before? Is it identical to that of "Natural Born Killers"? You're not completely wrong, but if you are a pulp lover, wait until you change the channel. Rhythm and tension are right, Renée Zellweger deserves a peek and a delirious Peter Fonda camero as a doting hippie will leave you speechless.

title: The Time Shifters
actors: Casper Van Dien, Catherine Oxenberg, Martin Sheen
description: Tom Merrick, a journalist who won a major award, has now found a job in a newspaper. The reporter is always looking for a scoop to take him one step further in his new job. One day, while he is preparing an article, he discovers that in all the great disasters of the twentieth century, from the sinking of the Titanic to the explosion of the Hindenburg, the same man has always been around. The next morning while he is waiting to board an airliner he thinks he recognizes the man among the passengers. Tom also notices that two strange agents who appear to have traveled through time are following him.

title: Bordello of Blood
actors: Chris Sarandon, Dennis Miller, Erika Eleniak, Angie Everhart
description: The preacher Jimmy Current is a really nice guy. He has found a way to control vampires, monsters and other damned souls and has seen fit to build a real "brothel" for all sinners. But inside the macabre palace, Katherine's brother also disappears, who does not give up and leaves together with Rafe Guttman on the trail of the priest.
notes: "Bordello of Blood" is part of the HBO horror series "Tales from the Crypt". Fun is guaranteed, but the parodic tones dilute the suspense. Whoopi Goldberg appears in an uncredited cameo.

title: Shark Attack
actors: Casper Van Dien, Ernie Hudson, Jenny McShane, Cordell McQueen
description: An American professor of marine biology, suspicious of the death of one of his researchers and the increase in attacks on humans by sharks, leaves for Africa to investigate. The sister of the deceased accompanies him. Together, they discover the plot of a pharmaceutical company that breeds terrible sharks as guinea pigs for a drug.
notes: Quite spectacular film definitely inspired by the blockbuster "Deep Blue", which told a similar story. A curiosity: there are really many who argue that from the adrenaline of the sharks it is possible to obtain a useful medicine for cells affected by cancer.

title: The Land Unknown
actors: Jock Mahoney, Shawn Smith, Henry Brandon, William Reynolds
description: A group of American scientists while exploring Antarctica aboard a helicopter is forced by a storm to land in a foggy area. Alan, the leader of the expedition, ascertains that the terrain is volcanic in nature and that the area is inhabited by prehistoric monsters. Using the helicopter's engine, the explorers are able to keep away the monsters that attack them and manage to land. A journalist who is part of the group is kidnapped by a man dressed in furs.
notes: Small, fascinating example of 1950s American science fiction. Great professionalism, naive but fun special effects.

title: Final Descent
actors: Robert Urich, Annette O'Toole, Jim Byrnes
description: A passenger plane is involved in a mid-flight collision just after take off. The damage suffered forces the aircraft to continue at high altitude, where there is a risk that the aircraft will break in two. Engaged in a desperate attempt to bring the plane and passengers back to the ground, the commander must at the same time deal with the flight controller, who has a personal grudge against him. And with the co-pilot, a girl to whom he is romantically linked, as well as with the manufacturer of the aircraft, whose indications on the behavior to be followed in an emergency situation are not ethically justifiable ...

title: The Car
actors: James Brolin, Kathleen Lloyd, Ronny Cox
description: In the quiet Californian countryside, a black out-of-production model is spotted one day, apparently without a driver and of an unknown brand. The car whizzes through the streets of the cities and kills anyone who comes within range. Someone tries to stop her, but the mechanical monster turns out to be animated by a demonic entity.
notes: A theme that already fascinated the writer Richard Matheson (and that Stephen King will passionate about), that of the murderous mechanical means. Not surprisingly, Silverstein's film mentions "Duel", which was based precisely on a story by Matheson. Professional packaging but suspense to look for with the lantern.

title: The Last Outpost
actors: Ronald Reagan, Rhonda Fleming, Bruce Bennett
description: After the Civil War, some small units of the Southern army refuse to surrender and continue to fight with guerrilla actions. One of these gangs, commanded by Major Dick, operates in the vicinity of Fort Point keeping the population on constant alert. Dawson, a wealthy merchant in the area, proposes to the colonel who commands inside the fort, that he try to make a deal with the Indians against the rebels. Dawson, who in the meantime has received a sharp no from the colonel, writes to Washington for satisfaction.
notes: Noticeable war scenes and a Ronald Reagan from the heyday.

title: Warlock
actors: Julian Sands, Lori Singer, Richard E. Grant
description: A powerful and evil sorcerer who raged in 1600s New England is resurrected by an evil force in Los Angeles in the 1980s. The "warlock" must discover where "the witches' bible" is hidden, an arcane text that holds the secret of the name of the Almighty. A hunter on a mission on behalf of God arrives on his trail from the sixteenth century ...
notes: Horror, fantasy and more than a wink to _Highlander_ in this film from the director of _Lake Placid_. The bill is televised, the story is not bad, but Julian Sands in the role of the sorcerer is (as he often happens) ridiculous ...

title: Superfly
actors: Ron O'Neal, Carl Lee, Sheila Frazier, Julius Harris, Charles McGregor
description: A Harlem drug dealer called Superfly, and his partner Eddie, are fed up with the "street" life they lead. This is why they decide to engineer the bang that can fix them forever. Unfortunately, the corrupt cops of the black quarter don't stand by the window and watch ...
notes: Stracult of blaxploitation, the B series made to measure for African Americans. Directed by the son of the director of "Shaft", set to music by the genius Curtis Mayfield, a small classic of its kind. The newspapers of the time criticized him a lot for the profession of the hero, drug dealer without remorse.

title: Icebreaker
actors: Sean Astin, Bruce Campbell, Stacy Keach, Suzanne Turner
description: A serious threat looms over Killington ski resort, one of the most renowned in the United States. The evil Greig, leader of a group of terrorists, takes some tourists hostage and hides them in a secret place. To keep them company, a not very nice nuclear warhead stolen from an army arsenal. On the trail of the terrorists, a mountain rescue officer, Matt Foster. Who engages in a fight against time also to free his girlfriend, locked up with the other hostages.
notes: A high-adrenalin-fueled TV movie that has its strong point in the mountain setting.

title: Death Machine
actors: Brad Dourif, Ely Pouget, William Hootkins, John Sharian
description: Jack has invented a fighting machine with destructive functions and which hides a human component. The realization of his project involved the killing of many people. The death machine soon springs into action and sows death and destruction among the enemies of the perfidious inventor.

title: Man's Best Friend
actors: Ally Sheedy, Lance Henriksen, Robert Costanzo, John Cassini
description: On the surface, Max looks like a big dog like the others, perhaps even more affectionate. In reality he has undergone a genetic experiment and one day he transforms: from "man's best friend", he becomes his worst nightmare and tears apart everything that moves. Other than Beethoven: Max's idol is called Cujo!
notes: In fact, the film closely resembles that of Lewis Teague, based on the story by Stephen King (_Cujo_, in fact). Lafia, a serial horror craftsman (_The murderer doll 2_), makes a film that keeps what it promises but never goes into the unexpected. However great Lance Henriksen.

title: Whatever It Takes
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Fred Williamson
description: Neil De Marco and his partner Dave try to boycott the illegal steroid trade. They work undercover in the world of body building and gyms. To try to make contact with the man they believe is responsible for the traffic, Dave and Neil must prove their worth by facing more than one deadly danger.

title: The Avenging Angel
actors: Tom Berenger, Charlton Heston, James Coburn, Kevin Tighe
description: Utah, 1850. The "Mormon" state is experiencing a moment of profound crisis. Mormons and "Gentiles" (ie Christians) have long been at loggerheads over the division of land. One of the leaders of the religious community, considered a kind of prophet, preaches peaceful coexistence, but a gang of murderers condemns him to death. In his defense, however, a very skilled gunslinger.
notes: A curious western for television directed by a usually vulgar director (he made _An unconventional weapon_), which perhaps finds a congenial dimension on the small screen. Cast of old glories of the Frontier imagination.

title: Simon Sez
actors: Dennis Rodman, Dane Cook, Ricky Harris, John Pinette
description: Simon is a handsome Interpol agent who loves to roam around on his motorcycle wrapped in an impeccable yellow and black overalls, engaged in breathtaking shadowing conducted thanks to the technological devilry of the Micro and Macro faithful (who operate, always dressed as friars, in a central camouflaged inside a convent). When an old colleague asks him to help him in a kidnapping case linked to an arms trafficking concocted by the evil Ashton, Simon does not hold back ...
notes: Tedious to death: in the rare moments of smashing action, the poor slumbering spectator risks waking up. Picturesque Rodman is a former NBA champion.

title: Phantoms
actors: Ben Affleck, Peter O'Toole, Rose McGowan, Joanna Going
description: The inhabitants of a mountain village all disappear one bad day, sucked into a demonic entity known as "the ancient enemy", Chaos. A sheriff and a journalist, a former Oxford professor considered somewhat heretical by the academic world) seek a painless way to save humanity from the end (with the help of the army and two unfortunate maidens).
notes: Directed by serial horror craftsman Joe Chappelle, "Phantoms" is actually a film by Dean R. Koontz, the poor man's Stephen King. A bad story and a bad film with little suspense, a routine staging and a certain sloppiness of the performers.

title: Stigmata
actors: Patricia Arquette, Gabriel Byrne, Jonathan Pryce
description: A young atheist hairdresser from Pittsburgh discovers with terror and pain that she has the stigmata, a divine sign of holiness reserved for a select few. The signs of the passion of Christ on her body are caused by an ancient rosary gift from the mother, and attract the attention of an investigating priest sent by the Vatican, who ascertains that the woman is the terminal of an entity that dictates to her in Aramaic a gospel already known and destined by the Church to oblivion, because it completely rewrites its history.
notes: Exciting and engaging, Wainwright's film recovers a tension of the apocalyptic clash between "sacred" and "demonic" reminiscent of "The Exorcist" and "The Omen".

title: King Cobra
actors: Pat Morita, Scott Brandon, Erik Estrada, Casey Fallo, Hoyt Axton
description: Seth, a snake of the "king cobra" race, considered particularly dangerous and lethal, is genetically altered to become gigantic. He targets a group of teenagers and yokels with the intention of making them his daily hearty meal.
notes: Typical "straight to video" product, ie intended for the cassette market. Ultra hidden situations, a photocopy of the soundtrack of "The Jaws", a low budget production with some special special effects. Funny the appearance of Erik Estrada in a version at least ... extravagant. Anyway, cheering for the snake.

title: Forever Mosketeers
actors: Michael Dudikoff, L. Mayhrs
description: The "American warrior" recycles himself this time in the shoes of an unlikely modern musketeer. Together with him, three nice Gascons who, in addition to knowing how to use steel perfectly, know the rudiments of kung-fu by finger.
notes: Nothing to do with Dumas, despite allusions. A curious operation, thwarted by the television staging.

title: Midnight Man
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, James Lew, Mako, Eric Pierpoint, James Shigeta
description: John Kang, a quiet and respected policeman with no particular crickets in his head, accidentally finds himself at the center of a case that other colleagues are following. In reality, someone, who considers him naive and "passive", is trying to skillfully frame him. But Kang does not let himself be taken aback and will have the opportunity to prove that he is a mastiff ...
notes: What does Lorenzo Lamas have in common with Van Damme? A certain propensity for martial arts and absolute inexpressiveness. The first, then, particularly loves to wander around on a motorcycle ... Action TV movie without particular qualities. Those who love the genre, however, take a seat.

title: Disturbing Behaviour
actors: James Marsden, Katie Holmes, Nick Stahl, Steve Railsback
description: Steve moves with his family from Chicago to a seaside town following the tragic death of his older brother. At the local high school he makes friends with Gavin and discovers that the rigid social hierarchy, at the top of which are the Blue Ribbons, model children but prone to violence. Gavin reveals his hypothesis to Steve: the model kids are the result of an experiment by the school doctor.
notes: A classic horror school setting that draws heavily from the stereotypes of the genre. The evident resistance of the performers to their job does not help the film to take off.

title: Supernova
actors: Angela Bassett, James Spader, Robert Forster, Lou Diamond Philips
description: On Nightingale 229, a rescue vessel on a mission, a request for help arrives from a planet that is beyond the great space-time leap. The spaceship on its way finds a wreck containing an alien artifact with evil powers and the body of a survivor. The object and the missing person, once in the passenger compartment, create situations of tension.
notes: Walter Hill, who signs himself as Thomas Lee for a disagreement with the production, loves to contaminate genres: in this case mélo, science fiction and pure thriller. The direction is functional to a story that metabolizes (with intelligence) fragments of "Alien" "Solaris" and "2001: a space odyssey". Unfortunately, the problems during the editing phase (with Francis Coppola taking over as supervisor) made some of the dialogues disconnected and the visual effects not entirely completed (the film was finished in a hurry, with evident listlessness). blockbuster from the icy packaging, the impurities of "Supernova" end up shining with their own light.

title: Bats
actors: Lou Diamond Philips, Dina Meyer, Carlos Jacott
description: In Gallup, Texas, a doctor and her aide try to find out what happened to the bats in that area. They come at night, screaming, to strike and kill human beings. Harmless creatures are transformed into ruthless killers due to a demented genetic experiment and in a dramatic race against time their lair must be found.
notes: With "Bats" bats are once again the protagonists, but here we are on the side of splatter and (discreet) special effects, in a trend that recalls that of the genetic degeneration of animal species, which from the 1950s onwards has never ceased. to have a small but significant success.

title: Final Destination
actors: Devon Sawa, Ali Larter, Kerr Smith, Kristen Cloke, Daniel Roebuck
description: New York Airport. After having grasped more and more dire omens, the young Alex, leaving for Paris with the school, "sees" even the plane crash in which everyone will die. He hurries off the departing plane and saves himself together with the five people who, for various reasons, have remained on the ground with him. But this is nothing: because the survivors begin to die in increasingly twisted and brutal accidents.
notes: Moving in the vicinity of the "Sixth Sense", one of the directors of "The X Files" and "Millennium" has grafted the myth of Cassandra on the narrative logic of the slasher, for which the question is no longer: "Who is the killer?" but "How will the next one die?"

title: Bride of Chucky
actors: Jennifer Tilly, Alexis Arquette, Nick Stabile
description: Tiffany, the ex-girlfriend of Charles Lee Ray who moved, thanks to black magic, into a Chucky (a doll), after ten years finds the remains of the doll and thanks to magic, brings it back to life. Tiffany hopes that Chucky wants to marry her, but the doll kills her and transfers her soul into a doll dressed as a bride. Despite the quarrels and betrayals, the two lovers have a common purpose: to find two bodies to welcome them and the amulet capable of carrying out reincarnation.
notes: Directed by Hong Kong director Ronny Yu for his first American film, the Chucky saga shows some cracks, despite an appreciable irony and a swooning Meg Tilly.

title: Space Cowboys
actors: Clint Eastwood, Tommy Lee Jones, Donald Sutherland, James Garner
description: The birth of NASA in 1958 excludes four brilliant and reckless test pilots of the Dedalus team from the new space programs. But time is never lost. The failure of a Russian satellite, Ikon, and the need to put an expert team back together to put it back in the correct geostational orbit, find them grappling with the trifles of the present.
notes: Eastwood directs with a light and affectionate hand, plays sideways with the other three performers, svisions on a solid model of narrative composure. His is a cinema that does not need to metabolize video games or advertisements. The poignant "Fly Me to the Moon" is worth at least a hundred raps and a "mature movie" can have the same freshness as a "teen movie".

title: Scream 3
actors: Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, Parker Posey, David Arquette
description: Hollywood. After the first ritual murder, so as not to lose the habit we find ourselves on the set of the film in the movie "Stab 3", which should tell the real events (?) That happened in the first "Scream". Except that the usual crazy killer, following the suggestions of the script, kills the actors one by one, even if his aim is once again to get to Sidney.
notes: Without Kevin Williamson (who wrote the first two films), Craven has a free hand and insists much less on references to the classics; moreover, he "frees" Sidney, himself and the spectator from the monster in a finally original way.

title: Fire Down Below
actors: Steven Seagal, Marg Helgenberger, Stephen Lang, Brad Hunt
description: Incredible amounts of toxic substances are buried in the hilly areas of Kentucky. Responsible for this havoc is the unscrupulous opportunist Orin Hammer. The shady individual is the head of a real criminal organization. Environmentalist Jack Taggart declares war on him. Hammer and his gang are also suspected of murder. They were in fact responsible for the murder of a former colleague of Jack. If no one tries to stop them, the entire natural heritage of the American state will be completely destroyed.
notes: Steven Seagal as the environmentalist is really ridiculous.

title: Stealth Fighter
actors: Ice T, Costas Mandylor, Erika Eleniak, Ernie Hudson
description: Owen Turner, a US Army pilot, fakes his own death and goes into business with an arms dealer from South America who has managed to get his hands on a nuclear-powered submarine. Arriving in the Philippines, he steals a fighter from a naval base with which he intends to destroy various military posts located around the globe. Ryan Mitchell, a former colleague of Turner's, knows him well enough to predict his next moves and is recruited to thwart his plans ...
notes: The filmography of Tracy Marrow known as Ice-T, now more actor than rapper, is literally stuffed with "action" like this, shot in photocopy.

title: Fortress 2: Re-Entry
actors: Christopher Lambert, Pam Grier, Aidan Rea, David Roberson
description: Ten years have passed: the director of Men-Tel, Teller, is on the trail of Brennick and his family who have found refuge in the countryside. Captured once again, John Brennick is locked up in a new escape-proof prison called Skycell from which escape is difficult, almost impossible.
notes: This very modest sequel starts from the same assumptions as the first but succeeds in the very difficult task of disregarding them one by one. The most chilling thing is the direction of Geoff Murphy, who also directed a fair fanta-movie like "The Silent Land". For the "Fortezza 2", however, he seems to have been inspired by the series "Supercar".

title: Romeo Must Die
actors: Jet Li, Delroy Lindo, Aaliyah, Russell Wong, Isaiah Washington
description: Two traditionally enemy families, one of Asians and one of Italian Americans, compete in a no-holds-barred war for control of the Port of Oakland. But when Po, the son of the Asian warlord, is killed, the confrontation becomes far more dangerous than anyone could have imagined. Po's older brother Han, a former cop, sets out in search of the truth.
notes: If you forget certain chilling scenes (x-rays of breaking bones) and let yourself be carried away by the Jet Li phenomenon, the 115 minutes of the show go by in a flash. Certainly a more prudent use of the Chinese star would not hurt US action cinema.

title: Gone in 60 Seconds
actors: Nicolas Cage, Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Delroy Lindo, Robert Duvall, Scott Caan, Vinnie Jones, James Duval, Christopher Eccleston, Timothy Olyphant
description: Randall "Memphis" Raines has long since retired as a car thief, but after a disturbing visit from an old friend, he realizes there is not much left for him to do but get back on the road. He has to steal a car to save the life of his brother who has done something wrong. In 40 hours he and his team, including Sara "Sway" Wayland, must steal 50 luxury cars.
notes: Title and story are taken from "Rollercar, 60 seconds and go!", Directed in 1974 by H. B. Halicki, director / stunt who died in 1989 while shooting the sequel to his film. Unlike Halicki, Sena does not take risks and sets up a story that, despite the title, is just a sprawling gymnastic up and down the streets of California.

title: Battlefield Earth
actors: John Travolta, Forest Whitaker, Kim Coates, Barry Pepper
description: In the year 3000 there are no cities or towns on Earth and man is an endangered species. A millennium earlier, the evil Psychlos aliens swooped down from space on our planet and wiped out our entire defense system in nine minutes. Now a handful of humans are enslaved and forced to mine for minerals to survive. One of the most powerful characters in the new Earth is Teri, a Psychlo in charge of the security forces. What he doesn't know is that there is a human who wants to undermine his plan.
notes: The layout, sets, editing, weaving, effects and visual stimuli are as sparkling as a science fiction anthology from Reader's Digest.

title: The Cell
actors: Jennifer Lopez, Vince Vaughn, Vincent D'Onofrio, Marianne Jean-Baptiste
description: Catherine Deane is a psychologist who is experimenting with a new therapy: entering another person's unconscious and living the experiences that take place in his brain. Thanks to this technique, Catherine was able to save a child from a coma and brought him back to life and to his parents. When a serial killer falls into a coma, while one of his victims is imprisoned in a small, hidden cell full of traps, FBI agent Peter Novak turns to her in an attempt to save the life of the predestined victim.
notes: Sample of images and movements and effects of a supreme advertiser, "The Cell" is also a sample of citations, first of all visual but also cinematographic and literary. It refers to "The Silence of the Lambs", but with parapsychology and science fiction to cheat the genre.

title: Mission to Mars
actors: Gary Sinise, Tim Robbins, Don Cheadle, Kim Delaney, Elise Neal, Connie Nielsen
description: It is June 19, 2020 and the crew of a spaceship is leaving the earth to reach Mars. When the mission has landed on the red planet, Commander Luke Graham realizes that something threatening is approaching them. The astrononauts have time to send a message and then disappear into thin air. The world space station quickly sets up a rescue mission.
notes: A spectacular film, with special effects, without losing sight of the "common" humanity of its characters, but which "wraps" in a Spielberg-like ending. Great the "whirlpool" on Mars and the approach in space. But above all, a lush greenhouse and a rock without gravity remain in the memory.

title: Russkies
actors: Whip Hubley, Joaquin Phoenix, Peter Billingsley, Stefan DeSalle
description: A Russian sailor is shipwrecked on the Florida coast. Three American kids rescue him. Mischa, who has never left the Soviet Union and has a natural distrust of Americans, feels uneasy. But when the ice breaks the three will help him get safe.
notes: Discreet adventure film.

title: They Rode West
actors: Robert Francis, Donna Reed, May Wynn, Philip Carey, Onslow Stevens
description: Sward is a friendly doctor of the Red Indians who treats them when a malaria epidemic spreads in their camp. The doctor must also counter Captain Black's policy of ferocious hostility. Between skirmishes with Lauren, the colonel's daughter, Sward tries to persuade the Kiowa tribe not to attack the fort where the Americans are locked up. It will be during a difficult operation carried out on the son of the Indian chief who was injured in a firefight that the Indians will understand that it is not worthwhile to attack.
notes: Modest western that adds nothing new to the genre.

title: The Wrong Man
actors: Rosanna Arquette, Kevin Anderson, John Lithgow
description: Poor Alex Walker would very much like to continue living his quiet life but Mexico, you know, is the land where anything can happen. He is there for work, only he gets involved in a serious crime and the police are convinced that he is the culprit. He will have to escape from the federales, and he will not escape alone ...
notes: Action comedy directed by a veteran like Jim McBride ("At the last breath", "The Informant"), who for the occasion shows all the streotypes of the adventurous road movie.

title: Sister Sister
actors: Eric Stoltz, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Judith Ivey
description: Two sisters live in that motel near the Louisiana swamp and make ends meet by giving travelers food and sleep. One of the two, however, shows signs of imbalance: in the past in fact it has suffered terrible violence, and now some ghosts show up again. But will they be just "ghosts"? Meanwhile, the dead are flocking.
notes: Bill Condon, the director of the second "Candyman" and above all of "Demons & Gods", tries his hand at a B movie not to be thrown away, in evident debt of oxygen with many classics of the genre (Tobe Hooper in primis). For enthusiasts.

title: Ride with the Devil
actors: Tobey Maguire, Skeet Urich, Jewel, Jeffrey Wright, Jonathan Rhys Meyers
description: Civil War. While fighting at the front, the Bushwhackers, sympathizers of the Confederates who remained in the territories of the Union, participated in a guerrilla war in the northern rear lines along the border between Kansas and Missouri. It is in one of these commandos that Jake Roedel, the son of a poor German emigrant and Jack Bull Chiles, the son of a plantation owner, give their best as gunslingers by carrying out lightning-fast raids against the Northerners. Soon the two mavericks will join Black John's gang.
notes: What a Taiwanese filmmaker does on the set of a western is irrelevant. Ang Lee proves to be a "professional" with a decent craft, with few revolutionary ideas. He is interested in sentimental implications, and also in this film he tries to concentrate on the love games of the young children of the South, stimulated by the lively Jewel. But in Italy the film arrived scissored by about twenty minutes (after the US flop) and probably the torments of the heart were affected. A little better the coté of genre, with rides and shootings. Disappointing the performers (with the exception of Jonathan Rhys Meyers), with faces too "clean" to be true. If Wild Bill Hickok (nordist) had met some "irregular" like this, they would have had a bad quarter of an hour. The last one.

title: Hollow Man
actors: Kevin Bacon, Elisabeth Shue, Josh Brolin, Kim Dickens, William Devane
description: For the United States Army, Dr. Sebastian Cain is doing experiments. His studies are aimed at discovering a serum capable of making invisible. After trying the discovery on animals Sebastian thinks that the time has come to test the effectiveness of the serum on his own person. The results are astounding. The scientist who has become invisible also begins to undergo a dangerous change of character.
notes: Dutchman Paul Verhoeven dusts off a classic science fiction figure. As he continues to be a bit frustrated by his situation as a former author in the service of Hollywood, the good Paul tries the philosophical-intellectual interpretation. But the goal he had set himself completely fails.

title: Deadly Outbreak
actors: Jeff Speakman, Ron Silver, Rochelle Swanson, Jack Adalist
description: A terrorist commando led by Colonel Baron has taken over an Israeli laboratory where biochemical devices are developed. Baron's aim is to get his hands on a new secret weapon designed by Dr. Levin. Dutton Hatfield, of the American Embassy, ??is in charge of backing her up.

title: Frequency
actors: Dennis Quaid, Jim Caviezel, Elizabeth Mitchell, Noah Emmerich
description: John would gladly erase the events that occurred on October 12, 1969 when his father, a heroic firefighter, lost his life in the Bruxton fire. Since then, John has dreamed of being able to go back in time and avoid that bad death for his parent. Now thanks to a radio he might be able to get in touch with the past.
notes: "Frequency" has the flavor of those films of yesteryear, fantastic without special effects, with B movie faces, fallen stars (Quaid), eternal promises (Caviezel), and a team game that makes the story solid and pleasant. The epilogue is cloying, but we get over it. Hoblit (director of "Hill Street Day and Night") likes to work on the characters, with the camera at eye level. All things that make him nice to us.

title: Bionic Ever After?
actors: Lindsay Wagner, Anne Lockhart, Lee Majors, Richard Anderson, Martin E. Brooks
description: The marriage between Steve Austin and Jaime Sommers is put in serious danger by the fact that the bionic woman has contracted a terrible virus.
notes: The protagonists of the television series "La donna bionica" are back, which aired in America from January 1976 to September 1978, first on the ABC and Nbc television stations.

title: The Art of War
actors: Wesley Snipes, Anne Archer, Maury Chaykin, Donald Sutherland
description: Neil Shaw is an American agent who has the task of uncovering and disrupting an international conspiracy that aims to destroy the United Nations on the eve of the historic summit with China. The murder of some Chinese political refugees for whom Shaw is blamed forces him to go underground.
notes: The late Bondian spy film updates to the new geopolitics in a somewhat confusing way. Anyway, the excuse is good for hybridizing 007 and Hong Kong action and for showing a parade of oriental beauties. The hybridization remains on paper, the construction and staging are a bit unfair, but the film is as smashing and self-deprecating as required. Sutherland is the UN secretary, the final with the barrels is at the UN.

title: If You Believe
actors: Ally Walker, Tom Amandes, Hayden Panettiere, Meredith Mc Geachie
description: The young Susan Stone works as a director in an important publishing house but is not at all satisfied; work takes up most of the day and she has ended up forgetting the small and big joys that life offers her. One day, returning home, she finds little Suzie waiting for her ... In reality the little girl is Susan herself, who has the task of making the adult woman regain the desire to love, the desire to be together with loved ones and to think again of all that life can still offer you truly beautiful ...
notes: A too-obvious television movie.

title: City Beneath the Sea
actors: Stuart Whitman, Robert Wagner, Robert Colbert, Whit Bissell
description: In the 21st century, a group of settlers settled in a very modern underwater city called Pacifica. This condition of theirs, however, exposes them to considerable psychological pressure, amplifying mutual rivalries. In the cast of this TV movie also some old glories such as Joseph Cotten, Richard Basehart and Edward G. Robinson.

title: Redhead From Wyoming
actors: Maureen O'Hara, Alexander Scourby, Alex Nicol, Jack Kelly
description: In Wyoming, conflicts between the area's numerous ranchers are commonplace. A speculator tries to take advantage of the situation: but a sheriff thwarts his plots and in the end he will succeed, brilliantly assisted by a saloon dancer already a lover of the shady individual. The film is only for redhead O'Hara. Not to be confused with a film of the same name (in Italian) of ten years earlier with Loretta Young.

title: The 6th Day
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Tony Goldwyn, Michael Rapaport, Sarah Wynter
description: In every shopping center it is possible to clone small pets that are no longer there and you can share the joys and laziness at home with a caring and busty virtual girl. Replicants and digital projections sweeten death and loneliness. Only the cloning of human beings, while technically possible, is prohibited by law. But a villain billionaire aided by a scientist, makes illegal experiments in a secret laboratory between urns with cocoons of bodies immersed in a primordial soup. The double of Alan Gibson is born from their workshop, ordinary family man, pilot and owner of some helicopters. Man's identity, affections and life are stolen.
notes: Roger Spottiswoode is engulfed, confused, between action, thriller and science fiction. What would become such a topical subject in the hands of David Cronenberg.

title: Lost Souls
actors: Winona Ryder, Ben Chaplin, Sarah Wynter, Philip Baker Hall
description: Escaped from a dark and tormented past thanks to her faith and the intervention of Father Lareaux, Maya has been snatched from the clutches of the devil. The priest encouraged her to follow a group of priests who are convinced that Satan will enter the body of a human being. Then one day Maya meets Peter, a best-selling author who is convinced that the Prince of Evil does not exist; their fates are intertwined when they participate in an exorcism authorized by the Church ...
notes: Kaminski's film (Oscar for the photography of _Schindler's List_ and _Save the soldier Ryan_) attempts to rise from genre cinema with a photograph (of course) very well-kept and refined, with excesses of soft focus and slow motion, falling into the opposite defect of mannerism (almost inevitable defect of every new director of photography in direction) Horror becomes less stringent, unraveled in an overflowing and counter-productive elegance.

title: Red River Range
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune, Louise Brooks, Anthony Marsh
description: A mysterious gang steals shipments of gold from a mine. A cowboy, Stony Books, to try to save the fruit of the miners' labor proposes to transport the precious cargo by plane. The bandits do not give up, they seize the airplane. Luckily Stony intervenes ...
notes: Sherman directs 31-year-old John Wayne.

title: The Killer Elite
actors: James Caan, Robert Duvall, Burt Young, Gig Young
description: A killer who works for an agency linked to the CIA is betrayed and made sick by his best friend, who is also a colleague. Animated by a strong desire for revenge, the man faces a difficult physical recovery and restores himself thanks to the application in martial arts. Arrived at the showdown, he will discover that betrayal and lying are now a system.
notes: Usual problems with production for the great Sam Peckinpah. This is not one of his most personal films (Caan loves it a lot though), however the very first part and ending in the boat graveyard are excellent.

title: The President's Man
actors: Chuck Norris, Ralph Waite, Marla Adams, Dylan Neal, Stuart Whitman
description: Joshua McCord is a longtime secret service agent, struggling with the training of a younger element to replace him. However, when the First Lady is kidnapped by a mysterious gang of terrorists, she will have to throw herself headlong into a new and dangerous undertaking.
notes: When Chuck Norris is involved, you can't really go wrong: whether he plays the role of the "Walker Texas Ranger" or - as on this occasion - of an intrepid special agent, the ingredients of the recipe do not vary, to the delight of a public that obviously prefers not to rack their brains too much to distinguish the good from the bad.

title: The Bandit Queen
actors: Barton McLane, Barbara Britton, Philip Reed, Willard Parker
description: Southern California gold rush is at its peak. A band of cruel seekers kills Montalbo and his wife, strenuous champions of the resistance, in the presence of Lola. The girl, driven by a feeling of vengeance, gathers Mexicans around her and leads the punitive expeditions. Zorro's daughter, as Lola calls herself, becomes the terror of all the bandits in the area.
notes: William A. Berke was an old Hollywood craftsman. He was able to turn out four films a year. As often happens, quantity is not synonymous with quality. Not even this film of his escapes the rule.

title: Dracula 2000
actors: Gerard Butler, Christopher Plummer, Jonny Lee Miller, Jeri Ryan
description: A gang of super-technological thieves to try to score a sensational blow penetrates the basement where works of inestimable value should be kept. Instead, the thieves find themselves in front of a coffin containing the remains of Count Dracula. Released after a century of imprisonment, the king of the night finds himself catapulted into modern-day New Orleans and grappling with the temptations and, above all, the chaos of the twentieth century.
notes: The executive producer is Wes Craven. The director, Patrick Lussier, former editor of Craven, is a rookie, the music is a mixture of heavy metal and hard rock, the screenwriter, Joel Soisson, is a specialist in the genre and the old scriptwriter, Bram Stoker, is a genius. The professional references of this latest variation on Dracula would seem exemplary. The film is disastrous. The actors hired for this type of film are not usually asked for a particular skill in putting on costumes and making a few grimaces (pain, fear, dismay, ferocity), the willing of "Dracula's Legacy" are inconsistent. The aspiring actresses, rejected by some audition for the centerfold of "Playboy", are bad and the only decent one is Christopher Plummer.

title: Proof of Life
actors: Meg Ryan, Russell Crowe, David Morse, David Caruso
description: Peter Bowman, chief engineer who is directing the construction of a dam in Tecala, is kidnapped by an armed group fighting the central government. When the kidnappers discover his identity, they demand a ransom of three million dollars. Alice, Peter's wife left to herself, must ask Terry for help, a man who negotiates the release of the hostages by trade. With each passing day the situation becomes more and more complex also because Alice discovers that she has feelings for Terry.
notes: Taylor Hackford was born a documentary maker and knows Latin America well. But he obviously didn't know Russell Crowe and Meg Ryan. The love story between the two stars, born on the set, "stole" the film, at least in the eyes of the public: all to see Sally and the gladiator who are serious, and who cares about the harsh denunciation of the role of multinationals Use in the "backyard", as in Washington they call South America? Another ambiguous complaint: why are South Americans all mustachioed, treacherous and sweaty? The sexiest scenes have been cut. But Meg Ryan doesn't take much to ruin everything even as an actress: her close-ups, all grimaces and little faces, are devastating in a drama. Crowe instead has the physique of the role and not surprisingly everything works better when he is on stage alone. Action and adrenaline are guaranteed, except when the two fall in love: the fake one (of the plot) and the real one (of the set).

title: Seminole Uprising
actors: George Montgomery, Karin Booth, William Fawcett
description: Near the Rio Grande the Indians of Black Hawk have come out of their reserve and are spreading terror. Lieutenant Cam Elliot, a half-breed serving in the army, is sent to Fort Clark to mediate with Black Hawk. During the journey, the officer who is accompanied by a friend is attacked by the Red Indians. The two are saved by the providential intervention of a squad of soldiers led by sergeant Zanoba. Cam and Dudley, his rival in love, are given the task of attacking the Indians.
notes: Modest work by Earl Bellamy.

title: Wind River
actors: Blake Heron, A Martinez, Joshua Jackson, Russell Means
description: Nick Wilson, a young farmer, is convinced by Moragoni, a warrior belonging to the shoshone, to go and live in the tribe of chief Washakie, as Anuba, the shaman mother, has dreamed that a white boy will save their people. Nick's life among the Shoshone, after initial difficulties, proceeds calmly under the guidance of Moragoni, who helps the boy to enter the world of the Indians. During a battle against the Crow, however, Moragoni dies, and the boy is forced to fend for himself. Meanwhile, Nick's brother Sylvester has set out in search of her.

title: No Way Back
actors: Russell Crowe, Helen Slater, Etsushi Toyokawa, Michael Lerner
description: The life of FBI special agent Zack Grant is turned upside down by his wife's untimely death, caused by the after-effects of childbirth. The tragic experience also negatively affects Zack's career. His superiors, however, offer him one last chance for redemption by entrusting him with an important mission: to vanquish a powerful Japanese mafia organization. Zack instructs one of his agents, a new conscript, to infiltrate, but the situation gets out of hand when he discovers that his underling is collaborating with the Yakuza.
notes: The film stars a Russell Crowe who has not yet reached international fame.

title: The Newton Boys
actors: Matthew McConaughey, Ethan Hawke, Skeet Ulrich, Vincent D'Onofrio, Julianna Margulies, Dwight Yoakam, Chloe Webb
description: At the dawn of the twentieth century, the Newton brothers, greedy for glory and dollars, decided to overcome the myth of the Jesse James gang, the most famous bandit in the South West, by innovating the "robbery & similar" branch. There are four of them, sons of the South, rebels, Gascons and Don Juan. In a short time, over eighty sensational shots scored while dreaming of the grand slam.
notes: From the director of Before Dawn and Waking Life, an action comedy tinged with western twilight but a little uncertain and prolix in its gait. Too farcical the definition of the characters.

title: Red Sun Rising
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Mako
description: A Tokyo policeman, despite the contrary opinion of his superiors, decides to temporarily move to Los Angeles. He believes that a hitman from the Yakuza, his mortal enemy who has escaped capture several times, has taken refuge in the City of Angels.
notes: Shameless action movie that curiously shows some of Takeshi Kitano's "Brother" locations.

title: Kiwi Safari
actors: Meg Foster, Andrea Thompson, John Doubleday, Megan Nicol
description: Mary Ann and Sandy are about to make their dream come true: an adventurous expedition through the New Zealand rainforest. In their expectations there are wonderful scenarios and populations that are reputed to be particularly welcoming. It will be a fascinating but also very tiring experience.

title: The Faculty
actors: Jordana Brewster, Clea DuVall, Famke Janssen, Piper Laurie
description: In the corridors of Herrington High School there are all kinds of people, loners, top class and athletes. In short, the usual kids who have problems not only with their parents, but also with their teachers. The students soon realize that an alien infection is taking over their teachers. Rebelling will be very hard ...
notes: Typical Williamson-style cinephile concentrate who wrote it: a lot of classic science fiction (from "The Invasion of the Body Snatchers" onwards) and some late reflection on the "body", as in the glorious Eighties of New Horror. Superfine editing by Rodriguez himself ("From sunset to dawn"), very special effects by Kurtzman, Nicotero and Berger, imitators of Tom Savini, always a guarantee. Zero intellectual ambitions, one hundred fun.

title: Hired to Kill
actors: Brian Thompson, Oliver Reed, Barbara Niven, José Ferrer, George Kennedy, Penelope Reed, Kim Lonsdale
description: A mercenary hired by a political organization recruits some models for a fashion show that will take place in Cyprus. In reality, it is a question of freeing a prisoner, and the "fashion show" - a designer and five models - is only the cover of the operation. The local guerrillas lend a hand and the mission is successful, but at this point it turns out that someone wants to eliminate the members of the group. The idea of ??the fashion show with a completely different purpose is quite original, but it constitutes the greatest value of the film. Which is not badly done, but which offers no other important elements: a decent job and nothing else
notes: Cast of old glories on vacation for the classic product without infamy and without praise.

title: Exit Wounds
actors: Steven Seagal, DMX, Anthony Anderson, Bille Duke, Isaiah Washington
description: We are in Detroit and an overly angry and taciturn cop is punished and sent to a district at risk. Fifty kilos of heroin disappear and the easy-fisted detective suspects that some colleagues are involved in the dirty business. He will fight, beyond the law, to the last move, with the help of Latrell Walker, internet genius and with a brother in jail.
notes: The pirouettes, kicks and blows (this is in a film in which the dialogue scenes are banal connections in a plot built on a frenetic progression of pure "action"), are broken up into deliberately confused images as if to mask the lost Steven Seagal's agility that needs neither asking nor acting.

title: Firestorm
actors: Howie Long, Scott Glenn, William Forsythe, Suzy Amis
description: Firefighter Jesse Graves takes on the task of rescuing colleagues stranded in a forest fire. Or at least that's what he believes: in fact, in fact, the alleged firefighters are nothing more than a group of fugitives led by Earl Shaye, a criminal who takes advantage of the flames artfully set by his lawyer to take possession of an enormous sum of money.
notes: Someone called him a perfect example of an involuntary comedian, and there is undoubtedly something true. Certainly Semler's film is not the most significant title in the honored career of Scott Glenn, one of the toughest "tough guys" in American cinema.

title: Viper
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Frankie Thorn, Hank Cheyne, Joe Son
description: Travis Blackstone, a former policeman, was sent to prison because he destroyed the evidence of his brother's guilt. Now, he is free again but Rhonda, his ex and currently partner of his brother Franklin, informs him that he is in trouble again because he has a debt of five million dollars. Travis leaves her to try to bring help to his brother. His partner Lindee, jealous, thinking he left her for Rhonda, puts killers on his heels.
notes: Tibor Takács, director of "Don't Open That Gate" and "Don't Open That Gate 2" and "Bats" proves to be at ease even when it comes to shooting action movies.

title: Chill Factor
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Skeet Ulrich, Peter Firth, David Paymer, Hudson Leick
description: The military experiences a very powerful defoliant, but the results are catastrophic and the person responsible, Colonel Brynner, is arrested. After serving his sentence, he wants to get his hands on the substance (a blue jelly called "Elvis", which must be kept at -50 degrees) to sell it for war purposes: he will have to deal with two guys who have accidentally come into possession of it .. .
notes: The traps hatched by the writers are many and even imaginative, but more from videogames than from movies. Unbearable the jokes of the two protagonists, who wink, roll their eyes and make "yohoo" giving themselves five per hundred minutes in a row.

title: Valentine
actors: Denise Richards, David Boreanaz, Marley Shelton, Jessica Capshaw
description: During a Valentine's Day party, a shy and ugly boy is rejected by five of his companions and subjected to a water balloon of sangria by the other boys. Thirteen years later, the five girls find themselves on the eve of another Valentine's Day with a masked psychopath threatening their lives. Is it a rejected lover or is it perhaps the posthumous revenge of the peer who was pilloried years earlier?
notes: The script, taken from a book by Tom Savage, is a slender vine on which five "starlets" in search of fortune and a loser in a mask who tries to make a verse to the Luciferian Michael Myers of "Halloween".

title: The Mummy Returns
actors: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr, Patricia Velasquez, Dwayne Johnson, Freddie Boath
description: Ten years have passed. Rick and Evelyn are married and have Alex, a delightful eight-year-old who inherited a sense of adventure and a fascination for ancient civilizations from his parents. Meanwhile, a new threat is about to emerge in the Sahara desert. The Scorpion King, a proud warrior, is about to be awakened from his eternal slumber. To counter his advent, there are those who think of resurrecting Imhotep, the only one able to counter the Scorpion King. But there are those who recruited Rick and Evelyn to avoid the terrible confrontation.
notes: Pure Cinema Multiplèx, popcorn and chips, thunder and lightning for a good one hundred and twenty minutes, non-existent dialogues, interpersonal relationships as in the times of Michelangelo Antonioni.

title: Firetrap
actors: Dean Cain, Mel Harris, Dale Godboldo, Richard Tyson, Vanessa Angel
description: Max Hooper, successful burglar, has decided to change his life but cannot give up one last blow: thanks to his informants, Hooper has in fact learned that a company has developed a new generation chip, whose prototype could be sold at a very high price. Passing off as a firefighter, Hooper attempts to break through the security system of the building where the chip is kept: however, a disappointed and unhappy employee actually sets the building on fire, forcing Hooper to transform into a real firefighter to save their own life and that of other trapped people.

title: Omega Doom
actors: Rutger Hauer, Shannon Whirry, Norbert Weisser, Tina Cote
description: After the conquest of Earth by an army of robots, the few surviving humans are forced to live in the bush. The new masters fear a revival of the earthlings, to avoid which a frantic search for a secret weapons depot is underway. One of the androids enters a town where a sort of civil war is taking place between his fellow men, and while trying to restore peace between the two factions he discovers a strange attraction within himself ...
notes: Unfortunately, the "replicant" Rutger Hauer belongs to the club of those who, after a memorable role and little else, have settled on the comfortable shores of the world.

title: Mean Guns
actors: Christopher Lambert, Ice T, Michael Halsey, Tina Cote
description: A gangster compiles a list of about a hundred people guilty of "out of order" and, instead of eliminating them, he enjoys locking them up in a sort of security prison, letting them slaughter each other. The three survivors will receive a prize of 10 million dollars ...
notes: Nothing new under the "action movie" sun.

title: Arthur's Quest
actors: Arye Gross, Alexandra Paul, Catherine Oxenberg, Zach Galligan
description: The black knights led by the evil sorceress Morgana defeat King Pendragon's army and conquer England. Through a space-time passage, Merlin hides the little Arthur, son of Pendragon and heir to the throne, in modern America ...
notes: A curious "family" adventure.

title: Candyman
actors: Virginia Madsen, Tony Todd, Kasi Lemmons, Vanessa Williams
description: Helen, a researcher at a department of the University of Illinois, is surprised to see how deeply rooted the myth of the legendary Candyman, a black man who committed heinous crimes, is in her students. Determined to dispel this legend, the woman goes to Chicago in the company of her assistant. The two find themselves in the infamous area of ​​Cabrini Green in a dilapidated building inhabited by blacks in poverty. It was in this neighborhood that a brilliant black portraitist fell in love with the young woman he was portraying a century earlier.
notes: The film is based on "The Forbidden", a short story by Clive Barker. Enveloping music by Philip Glass.

title: New World Disorder
actors: Rutger Hauer, Andrew McCarthy, Tara Fitzgerald, Hari Dhillon
description: Some Silicon Valley scholars develop a super defense program for computers, but a gang of criminal hackers eliminates them and tries to steal the codes, which end up in the hands of the unscrupulous detective David Marx. He teams up with computer expert Kris Paddock to track down the bandit leader, Kurt Bishop, who hasn't given up on taking over the program. And when Bishop kidnaps Kris, he will experience at his own expense why Marx earned the nickname "The Coroner".
notes: Unfortunately it is the same old story, which the high-tech setting tries in vain to update. For poor Hauer there are no more words.

title: The Base II
actors: Antonio Sabato jr, James Remar, Duane Davis, Melissa Lewis
description: Colonel Strauss is an officer who does not allow room for mediation. For him, the US military is a receptacle for slackers. And the military court is a coven of superficial. Thus, he set up his own team, with which he administers his "justice", liquidating the soldiers who escaped the sentences of the military court. He hasn't reckoned with Sergeant John Murphy, tasked with infiltrating the squad to neutralize her. Antonio Sabato jr., Son of one of the tough faces of Italian cinema of the seventies, follows in his father's footsteps. Under the direction of Mark Lester, adrenaline-pumping action movie specialist.

title: Bridge of Dragons
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Valerie Chow, Gary Hudson
description: In the course of a violent power war in Japan, the seemingly cold and emotionless killer Warchyld faces a conflict of conscience for the first time and refuses to kill a completely defenseless man. Noting Warchyld's reluctance to carry out the order received, his boss unleashes a no-holds-barred fight.
notes: For those who do not remember, the Swedes Dolph Lundgren is the one who, in the shorts of the grim Soviet boxer Ivan Drago, threatens poor Rocky with the epochal joke "I spie you in two!" in the fourth episode of the series. Here he is again on track in this action movie equal to a thousand others.

title: Tarantula
actors: John Agar, Mara Corday, Leo G. Carroll, Nestor Paiva
description: Doctor Gerald Deemer has developed the formula of a special ultra-nutritious food, but has not dealt with the unexpected: in addition to causing irreversible damage in the body and mind of humans, the experiments give rise to the immeasurable growth of a tarantula, which - transformed into a huge and repellent monster - escapes from the laboratory terrorizing the entire state of Arizona ...
notes: Arnold's film, "little master" of low-budget cinema, is the perfect paradigm of the best B-movie: taut, no frills, enriched by handcrafted but successful special effects. In the finale, in a minor role, Clint Eastwood is also seen.

title: Follow the River
actors: Sheryl Lee, Ellen Burstyn, Eric Schweig, Tim Guinee, Renée O'Connor
description: As the war between Red Indians and European settlers rages, a white woman named Mary Ingles is captured by the Shawnee tribe. Led to their camp, Mary meets a companion in misfortune, the Dutch Gretel: together they will try to escape, entering the most dangerous lands of Virginia.

title: Diplomatic Siege
actors: Peter Weller, Tom Berenger, Daryl Hannah, Adrian Pintea
description: American agent Steve Mitchell is sent to Bucharest to neutralize a bomb located inside his country's embassy. To his surprise, Steve discovers that he is joined in this position by Erica Long, his former colleague and ex-girlfriend. The risks increase when a commando of Serbian terrorists attacks the embassy and takes the entire staff hostage. While Erica and Steve manage to escape, the man's 14-year-old son remains in the hands of the criminals.
notes: A good cast does not save a film that should make tension its trump card.

title: Replicant
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Michael Rooker, Ian Robison, Catherine Dent
description: The police are trying to catch a dangerous, violent and ruthless serial killer who is terrorizing the city. Two scientists coordinated by the police come up with an idea: to create a clone to team up with two agents and be able to predict their moves.
notes: Five years after "Maximun Risk", Ringo Lam, one of the masters of the Hong Kong action movie, throws himself back into the clutches of Jean-Claude Van Damme, who gives him an unlikely "vehicle". The film is softer than expected, without even the breathtaking beginning and ending that might be expected. Even the flashback and slow-motion baroque appearances seem like a parody of a style.

title: The Danger Zone
actors: Jamie Ferreira, Kriss Braxton, Teresa Truesdale, Mickey Elders
description: Heading to Las Vegas to take part in a singing competition, six girls are stranded in their car and are forced to walk towards a city they see in the distance. Obviously they cannot know that there is a gang of motorcyclists and drug traffickers ...
notes: Originality in minimal doses.

title: Octopus
actors: Jay Harrington, Ravil Isyanov, David Beecroft, Carolyn Lowery
description: To reach the place where he will be tried, a terrorist is boarded on a submarine. During the voyage, the vessel must cross the "Devil's Eye", a stretch of sea in which several ships have disappeared: and it is here that the crew is attacked by a prehistoric octopus ...

title: The Plainsman
actors: Don Murray, Guy Stockwell, Abby Dalton, Leslie Nielsen
description: Wild Bill Hickok is attacked by the Red Indians and is saved only thanks to the intervention of his old friend Black Bison. During the attack he realizes that the Indians have firearms recently supplied to the Unionist army.
notes: Weak remake of Cecil B. DeMille's "Conquest of the West".

title: The Cimarron Kid
actors: Audie Murphy, Yvette Duguay, Beverly Tyler, John Hudson
description: Kid was arrested for helping Dalton gang bandits. Released, the cowboy is unjustly blamed for a robbery committed by Dalton's men. Kid, upon the death of the gang leader, joins the outlaws. Boetticher's first western, master of the B movie. Good performance from Murphy.

title: Hooper
actors: Burt Reynolds, Jan-Michael Vincent, Brian Keith, Sally Field
description: Sonny Hooper has been the undisputed king of stunt performers who are busy on sets in Hollywood for several years. Sonny has long lived with Gwen, daughter of the elderly stunt Jocko. Ski, a very brave young man is determined to take his place away. For Sonny it's not a great time because, with a sore back, he is forced to undergo medical treatment. Driven by pride, he makes a proposal to Max, his friend and production manager: to fly over a hundred meters with a machine prepared for the occasion.
notes: Hal Needham pays homage to the most dangerous profession in the film world. Brian Keith is Elder Jocko.

title: Evolution
actors: David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Dan Aykroyd
description: A disgraced scientist and a geologist discover in a meteorite the essence that regulated evolution on (and on) Earth. The rock unleashes mutant monsters that alarm the governor of the state and the usual stupid military. A beautiful doctor also enters the scene: she will be the one to help the two men of science in their rescue.
notes: Reitman thinks of 1950s science fiction, but does not realize that the tastes of Generation X (Files) have changed. Fracassone, full of banal, exaggeratedly scatological gimmicks, the film doesn't even manage to disguise its real raison d'etre: to advertise a famous brand of shampoo.

title: Winchester '73
actors: James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea, Stephen McNally
description: Lonely Lin McAdam arrives in Dodge City to participate in a shooting competition whose stakes are the prized shotgun of the title. His main opponent is Dutch Brown, towards whom Lin has an inexplicable hatred. McAdam wins, but the Winchester is stolen from him and has since gone through different hands. Lin does not give up, however, and in the end it will also shed light on the reasons for the hatred that opposes him to Dutch.
notes: Sparse, essential, full of psychological and even biblical resonances: Mann shoots one of the most innovative and decisive westerns in the history of cinema, embellished with the splendid black and white of William Daniels and a gigantic Stewart.

title: Point Blank
actors: Mickey Rourke, Michael Wright, Frederic Forrest, Danny Trejo
description: Seven life sentences sentenced to the gas chamber are loaded onto a bus to be transported to the place where the execution will be held. But they will never reach their destination: in fact, one of the criminals, the insane and ruthless Howard, has prepared a diabolical escape plan. The coup succeeds and the group takes refuge in a shopping center, dictating their requests to the authorities in order to leave the country. Former policeman Rudy Ray, brother of one of Howard's accomplices, finds himself involved in the affair despite himself ...
notes: If Rourke had been given a dollar for every wrong film, he would be a millionaire today.

title: Seconds
actors: Rock Hudson, Salome Jens, John Randolph, Jeff Corey, Murray Hamilton
description: Tony, a wealthy businessman deeply disappointed in his life, is surrounded by a powerful organization which - in exchange for a generous legacy - proposes to him the transformation of his personality. Tony thus becomes a beautiful painter and perfectly inserted in the Californian context of "artists" and "models". Soon, however, the ghosts of the past return ...
notes: Once he accepts the basic unrealism (the ugly and mediocre businessman turns into Rock Hudson!), He plunges into a nightmare with disturbing "political" implications. A great film, which is paired with _Go and kill_ among Frankenheimer's cult. Beautiful black and white photograph by James Wong Howe.

title: Demolition High
actors: Corey Haim, Alan Thicke, Dick Van Patten, Jeff Kober
description: A group of terrorists, led by the bloodthirsty Luther, takes college students hostage in California. As soon as he arrives from New York, Lenny finds the opportunity to make up for the misunderstandings of teachers and classmates by courageously leading the rescue and helping the authorities to restore order.

title: Pillars of the Sky
actors: Jeff Chandler, Dorothy Malone, Ward Bond, Keith Andes
description: The construction of a fort and a road on the territories sacred to the Indians provokes the rebellion of the Indians. Ignoring the advice of Sergeant Emmett, Colonel Stedlow implements the established plans. Waiting for him at the gate was the Indian chief Kamiakin.
notes: Undoubtedly spectacular qualities for a minor western.

title: Shark Attack 2
actors: Thorsten Kaye, Nikita Ager, Daniel Alexander, Danny Keogh
description: Hawaii: Marine biologist Nick West discovers that a few white sharks, made particularly ferocious by an experiment, have been missing during a transfer, and he teams up with Australian veteran Roy and beautiful Samantha to restore tranquility to the coasts.
notes: "Jaws" increasingly toothless.

title: Operation Dumbo Drop
actors: Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary, Doug E. Doug
description: During the Vietnam War, the Ho Chi Minh army kills in retaliation the sacred elephant of a village used by the Americans as a base of support. But an important party is approaching and so Captain Sam Cahill sets out on a very special mission: to find another elephant and get it to the village in time.
notes: Nice adventure movie.

title: Driven
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Burt Reynolds, Kip Pardue, Estella Warren, Gina Gershon
description: Driver Joe Tanto is recalled by his team leader Carl Henry: he had left the circuits to grow as a man but the smell of petrol in the pits smells of victory, and is irresistible. His job is to wean a budding champion.
notes: Stallone takes care of the script (which cries out for revenge so bad it is) and entrusts the direction to his friend Renny Harlin, the spiritual father of all Hollywood "shooters". The staging of "Driven" tries to hide its inconsistency with speed. There are two "sculptural" situations destined for the anthology of the worst: a race at three hundred per hour in the city center and an accident in the rain with an impossible timing.

title: Nadja
actors: Elina Löwensohn, Peter Fonda, Suzy Amis, Martin Donovan
description: New York City: On the occasion of their father's wake, members of a family of contemporary and post-modern vampires try to quell the conflicts that divide them. In the meantime, however, Dr. van Helsing and his niece are on their trail ...
notes: Stylized reinterpretation of a myth as ancient as the world; David Lynch is the executive producer.

title: Strangeland
actors: Dee Snider, Kevin Gage, Elizabeth Peña, Linda Cardellini, Amal Rhoe
description: Two girls, Genevieve and Tiana spend all their free time in front of the computer. While chatting, they meet Captain Howdy, a high school student eager to meet girls. When Genevieve, invited to a party by the mysterious interlocutor, never returns home, Tiana and Detective Gage begin to have doubts. The girl has stumbled upon a ferocious killer who chooses his victims by chatting on the computer.
notes: Z-series splatter effects, a script that doesn't stand up, are 86 minutes of boredom and the only funny thing is Englund's bacon who, naked as a worm, this time experimenting with the role of victim.

title: Jurassic Park III
actors: Sam Neill, William H. Macy, Téa Leoni, Laura Dern, Alessandro Nivola
description: An adventurer and his wife persuade paleontologist Alan Grant, seeking funds to study the intelligence of velociraptors, and four other fellow travelers to take a tour aboard a plane to Isla Sorna. The island, once home to the famous prehistoric park, has been transformed into a perfect environment for the growth and development of dinosaurs. When the seven, victims of an accident, are stranded on the island, Dr. Grant realizes the true intentions of the adventurer and his wife.
notes: Joe Johnston, put behind the wheel by executive producer Steven Spielberg, gets away in less than 90 minutes, clears all the Crichton côté of the saga and churns out pure adventure.

title: The Claim
actors: Milla Jovovich, Peter Mullan, Wes Bentley, Sarah Polley, Nastassja Kinski
description: We are in 1869 in a small village immersed in the snow of the Sierra Nevada. The life of the village is turned upside down by the return of Dillon who, twenty years earlier, had sold his wife Elena and daughter Hope in exchange for a certificate of ownership of a gold mine. Meanwhile, Elena fell in love with Dalglish who was charged with tracing the route of the new railway. The former partner returns to court her.
notes: An operation that is only at times suggestive (the setting is rich), saved in extremis by an intoned acting choir where the Scotsman Mullan gives acting lessons to the young Bentley, and where three women (Kinski, Polley and Jovovich) insure against boredom .

title: Planet of the Apes
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Helena Bonham Carter, Tim Roth, Michael Clarke Duncan
description: Space 2029. Astronaut Leo Davidson should leave the chimpanzees alone with the task of probing the mysteries of the cosmos. Instead, in full galactic storm, he follows the fate of a primate by throwing himself into the unknown and, sinking in time to a distant future, on an unknown planet, surrounded by intelligent apes and enslaved men. It will be he, with the help of an enlightened chimpanzee, Ari, to organize the Resistance of mankind.
notes: Tim Burton's highly anticipated remake of one of the science fiction classics such as "Planet of the Apes" by Franklin J. Schaffner (1968). Although then, if you think about it, "remake" is a big word. Burton, in fact, takes inspiration from the original novel by Pierre Boule, with the intention of creating a symbolic phantasmagoria congenial to his own poetry. The humanity of animals and the bestiality of men, diversity as a symptom of "other" sensitivity, the planet of the apes as a new world to be imagined and recreated on the screen. Right here the film seems to creak: this "of the monkeys" is a world that is not surprising, it lets itself be absorbed by conventional visions, of a science fiction perhaps out of date (few special effects) but certainly far from the impact that the filmmaker has accustomed us to. The lack of a hypnotic context (not necessarily gothic or cartoonistic: every Burton film, after all, knows how to renew its imagination) makes everything else insipid, because in the end, adventure is exactly as you expect it to be.

title: Session 9
actors: Peter Mullan, David Caruso, Stephen Gevedon, Josh Lucas
description: Human suffering, experiments, the pain of the sick, possession, abuse permeate the air and walls of an old abandoned psychiatric hospital near Boston. A team of five workers from Hazmat Elimination Co. wins the contract for some works (to be completed in a few days), preliminary to the renovation of the asylum. The stress of the deadline, psychological weaknesses and unsolved problems of the five protagonists accentuate the vulnerability of the team and trigger the horror.
notes: Between disturbing architectures and mental labyrinths, Brad Anderson and his cast of actors (Peter Mullan's performance is excellent) build a dense and highly effective suspense, stimulating the emotional and intellectual side of the genre. An excellent example of "old style" horror that handles madness, places and bodies with competence.

title: Swordfish
actors: John Travolta, Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry, Don Cheadle
description: Released from jail after two years, expert hacker Stanley Jobson finds himself in decidedly bad waters, also separated from his little daughter Holly (in custody of his ex-wife). So when the ambiguous but "patriotic" Gabriel Shear and his gorgeous partner-lover Ginger offer him an astronomical sum to help them carry out a sophisticated computer scam, Stanley can't help but accept ...
notes: Sena and producer-bomb engineer Joel Silver made the film inspired by 1960s adventure cinema, with highly spectacular "explosive" sequences. Captivating Travolta, the Berry fainting.

title: Galaxy Quest
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman, Tim Allen, Tony Shalhoub, Sam Rockwell, Daryl Mitchell
description: Eighteen years after the television series "Galaxy Quest" ended, the five actors who played it - Jason Nesmith, Gwen DeMarco, Alexander Dane, Tommy Webber and Fred Kwan - continue to appear in public in situations such as science fiction conventions or openings. of shopping centers. The unexciting routine is interrupted when the Termians, extraterrestrials from the Klaatu galaxy, kidnap them and transport them to their planet. The aim: to obtain from the former stars - mistaken for real heroes - a help to defeat the enemy armies, led by the fearsome General Sarris ...
notes: The idea isn't bad, and the cast is luxurious.

title: Pit Stop
actors: Richard Davalos, Brian Donlevy, Ellen Burstyn, Sid Haig
description: Grant Willard, ambitious team boss, hires young driver Rick Bowman to help him break through in a new competition called "figure eight". The efforts of the two are thwarted by a fierce and unscrupulous rival, Hawk Sidney.
notes: Typical product of the famous Roger Corman "factory".

title: Saskatchewan
actors: Hugh O'Brian, Alan Ladd, Shelley Winters, Robert Douglas, J. Carroll Naish
description: Returning from a patrol tour in the Canadian mountains, Lieutenant O'Rourke comes across the remains of a burning caravan and Grace Markey, the only survivor of the massacre. The attack is the work of the Sioux, who after the victory over General Custer have crossed over and are about to convince the local Crow tribe to ally with them. O'Rourke, who was raised by the Crow, attempts to blow the deal while protecting Grace from the snares of the shady Sheriff Smith.
notes: As a great professional, Walsh uses Canada's beautiful natural landscapes as the backdrop for a story that enhances the peaceful coexistence of whites and reds.

title: Burnt Offerings
actors: Karen Black, Oliver Reed, Burgess Meredith, Bette Davis, Lee Harcourt Montgomery
description: The Rolfs think they had a brilliant idea: to go on vacation to a menacing, "Addams" style house (or worse, Bates motel). They do not know that the gothic mansion ready to welcome them feeds on the tenants to "rejuvenate itself".
notes: Theirs will be a memorable adventure. Horror "all star" which at the time had some success, and is also quite considered by the horror film community. More than twenty years later, however, it demonstrates its limits, especially in conventional staging, even if some nice twist ensures genuine fright.

title: The Prophecy II
actors: Christopher Walken, Jennifer Beals, Brittany Murphy, Russell Wong
description: Did you believe that Heaven would no longer run the risk of becoming hell? Well, you were wrong, because the Archangel Gabriel - envious of God's love for men - is still determined to unleash (and win) his war. So he returns to Earth with a specific will: to kill Valerie, who carries the one who will save mankind in her womb ...
notes: Second episode of the saga on the war of angels (the rebellious ones against those faithful to the Lord) after the remarkable and imaginative _The last prophecy_. Walken plays and has fun, but the story seems too much that of _Terminator_ to reserve any real surprises.

title: A Knight's Tale
actors: Heath Ledger, Mark Addy, Rufus Sewell, Shannyn Sossamon, Alan Tudyk
description: Squire William would like to take a step forward and become a knight. The opportunity presents itself to him when he accidentally meets a man who in exchange for clothes and food gives him documents that can make him pass as a noble. So on the death of the knight he serves William takes his place and fights in the tournament for the beautiful Jocelyn.
notes: Armor, knightly tournaments, court banquets, courtly love with various licenses, heirs to the throne, a talented writer, Chaucer, ruined by a passion for the game and noble girls. It would seem the return of a vein, but no one has more faith in the adventure with helmet and armor. The European challenge tour is the romance of old rodeo and the pragmatism of the tennis circus. Brian Helgeland, screenwriter of "LA Confidential" and dull director of "Payback" and "Conspiracy Hypothesis" for his excursion into the Middle Ages is accompanied by a pressing soundtrack (among others, Queen, Eric Clapton and AC / DC) without having the courage or the imagination to twist the plot towards a pop-rock musical, he manipulates, in some scenes, the make-up and costumes as if he wanted to take the characters to the disco and stops at the door. A series of indecisions that are reflected in the unmotivated 132 minutes of a film in which the strong moments (the tournaments) weaken in the repetition of images and the clash of weapons.

title: Martin
actors: John Amplas, Lincoln Maazel, Elayne Nadeau, Christine Forrest
description: Martin joins his cousin Tata Cuda's family in a small town near Pittsburgh. During the train ride he bleeds and kills a girl. Tata welcomes him coldly: he is convinced that his nephew is a vampire. Martin indirectly seeks help, but the desire to kill is stronger than him. Meanwhile, the uncle gears up to kill the alleged nosferatu.
notes: Great film from the director of "Night of the Living Dead". Unfortunately, this is the Italian version, with the fake music of the Goblins and a different montage. The fascination of an apparently horror story remains, demonstrating how real monsters kill with the weapon of prejudice.

title: A Christmas Carol
actors: Patrick Stewart, Richard E. Grant, Ian McNeice, Joel Grey
description: It's Christmas Eve. Scrooge is alone in his office. He hears a noise and sees the spirit of ex-partner Jacob Marley. Marley blames Scrooge for the pain he caused his neighbor and informs him that three spirits will visit him: "The ghost of Christmas past", "the ghost of Christmas present" and "the ghost of Christmas to come".

title: Knockaround Guys
actors: Barry Pepper, Vin Diesel, John Malkovich, Dennis Hopper, Andrew Davoli, Seth Green, Arthur J. Nascarella
