description: A gangster's misunderstood son convinces his uncle to get involved in family affairs. Together with a gang of friends, unlikely criminals, the scion loses his classic bag full of dollars in a small town in Montana. A corrupt sheriff who has enough fur on his stomach to deal with budding bandits retrieves it. Until the real ones arrive from the city ...
notes: "Pulp Fiction" producer Lawrence Bender christens "The Player" screenwriters Brian Koppelman and David Levien, making their debut behind the camera. The result is dignified: "Dangerous Companies" is a not particularly innovative gangster movie but certainly well studied in the plot and with a convincing focus on the generational clash between criminals or aspiring criminals. For this reason, defects burn more, first of all the speculated use of Vin Diesel, which the screenplay (or perhaps who knows, the cuts to the editing) has made a secondary figure. Even the ending, almost a less pulpy citation than the shooting of "The hyenas", is hasty, however, if you think about the dramatic potential of the twist that overturns the story.

title: Angel Town
actors: Olivier Gruner, Theresa Saldana, Frank Aragon, Mark Dacascos
description: Kickboxer Jacques leaves Paris and finds himself in the suburbs of Los Angeles. He plans to get his engineering degree, but finds himself coaching college team athletes. He will have to face the small local underworld. They will be blows to everyone.
notes: Small role for Mark "Crying Freeman" Dacascos.

title: Ocean Tribe
actors: Vaughn Roberts, Gregg Rainwater, Robert Caso, Troy Fazio
description: Bob once only cared about surfing: now, at just 25 years of age, doctors have diagnosed him with end-stage cancer and are only giving him a few months to survive. The news shakes the lives of some of the boy's adventurers like an earthquake: Schwartz, an undisciplined doctor; Noah, worried about impending fatherhood; Lance, who pursues the mirage of an acting career; Jeb, just released after yet another arrest for drug possession. Together again, the four seize an old station wagon and "free" Bob from the hospital, determined to give him one last raid on the Mexican waves ...

title: The Outlaw
actors: Jack Beutel, Jane Russell, Thomas Mitchell, Walter Huston
description: Doc Holliday accuses the very young bandit Billy the Kid of stealing his horse, but the sympathy he feels for the boy prevails; and when Billy is injured by killing a man in a fight, he rescues him from arrest by the new sheriff Pat Garrett and finds refuge in his lover's Rio hut. Over time, however, passion breaks out between Billy and the woman ...
notes: Started by Hawks, the film then passed into the hands of billionaire Hughes, who imposed his flame (the increased Russell) as the protagonist. Impossible, in any case, not to notice the obvious - albeit hidden - homosexual implications of the relationship between Doc and Billy.

title: Collateral Damage
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francesca Neri, Elias Koteas, John Leguizamo
description: Gordon, fire chief, is parking his car in the building where his wife and son are waiting for him. But a tremendous explosion destroys his family. Claudio "Il lupo" Perrini, a ruthless terrorist, is blamed for the attack. Since the authorities have no plans to track down and punish the culprit, Gordon decides to go after him.
notes: Asking respect for bon ton, politically correct or ideologically moderate in certain action-movies is naive. Expecting a more compelling, less predictable plot, interpreted with more incisiveness than a bad comic, on the other hand, is a legitimate claim.

title: Thir13en Ghosts
actors: Tony Shalhoub, Embeth Davidtz, F. Murray Abraham, Matthew Lillard
description: Jean, who died in a tragic accident, left her husband Arthur and children Kathy and Bobby in absolute misery. One day, Arthur inherits a strange house made of glass and steel from his uncle Cyrus. Exploring the various rooms, the new owner and the boys do not believe their eyes: the three do not know that the house hides a dark secret ...
notes: The most sophisticated, popular and thrilling Hollywood cinema (Robert Zemeckis and Joel Silver are among the producers) looks - with affection, admiration and a certain respect - at the workshop of the artisans of the glorious and longed-for B series. to which homage is paid is that of William Castle, director and impresario del terror, producer of _Rosemary's Baby_, already author of a _13 Ghosts_ in 1960. In this first work by Steve Beck, the level of the cast and acting, in which jokes that would like to be witty and those that betray the party game aspect (of terror) work more than fear. The house, with its mechanisms designed on demonic instigation and fed by thirteen Barkerian ghosts, is the true protagonist of the film. A "documentary", at times repetitive, about an expensive scenography and about some non-digital ghosts, more tantalizing than humans in flesh and blood.

title: Knightriders
actors: Ed Harris, Gary Lahti, Tom Savini, Amy Ingersoll, Patricia Tallman
description: Following Arthur's example, King Billy travels the United States with a community of contemporary "knights". In place of the trusty steeds there are the Harley Davidson, with which the brave compete to a duel in the squares and at the fairs of the countries. But this "circus" is tempting to someone, and dollars risk corrupting the indomitable soul of some subject ...
notes: Combining two ideological opposites such as traditionalism (nostalgic return to the Myth) and progressivism (the enemy to beat is Reaganian hedonism), Romero makes one of his most "free" and beautiful films. The spectator of the duels eating the sandwich is a certain Stephen King ...

title: Sweepers
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Bruce Payne, Claire Stansfield, Ian Roberts
description: Christian Erickson is the leader of a team of men who specialize in clearing mined areas. After the tragic death of his son, Erickson loses track and returns to war-torn Angola: it is here that he meets Michelle Wyatt, another expert in explosives who hires him for a dangerous mission aimed at vanquishing a group of international terrorists.
notes: It is written Dolph Lundgren but is pronounced Ivan "you in two" Drago, unforgotten (?) Deuteragonist of Sly Stallone in "Rocky IV". His expressiveness is equal to that of a mine, but asking him for more would be useless.

title: Two Flags West
actors: Joseph Cotten, Linda Darnell, Jeff Chandler, Noah Beery jr.
description: As the Civil War rages, Lincoln offers the Confederate prisoners freedom. The pact he makes with them is clear, the former inmates have to fight the Indians. Colonel Clay Tucker accepts the proposal and with his men goes to a fort whose command is entrusted to Major Kenniston. Elena, widow of the officer's brother, is a guest of the outpost. Clay falls in love with her but she just wants to get away from the Frontier. When a convoy of wagons, escorted by Tucker, leaves the fort, Elena sneaks in. They will be forced to turn back to face the Indians.
notes: Rather conventional film directed by Robert Wise.

title: Fugitive Rage
actors: Wendy Schumacher, Jay Richardson, Shauna O'Brien, Tim Abell
description: Former policewoman Tara McCormick is arrested for the attempted murder of drug kingpin Tommy Stompanato. In prison, the woman befriends an inmate named Josie Williams; shortly thereafter, a government agent offers her a second chance to take out Tommy in exchange for her freedom. Tara accepts, and the hunt begins ...

title: Rollerball
actors: Chris Klein, Jean Reno, LL Cool J, Rebecca Romijn
description: Year of Grace, 2005. Jonathan Cross is the most popular rollerball champion a violent evolution of skating hockey. Together with Marcus Ridley, his childhood friend and the beautiful Aurora, he sets the crowds on fire with passion and earns tons of money. Jonathan realizes too late that Alexi Petrovic, the inventor of the game, makes up matches so that the dead man always escapes. Doing so is sure to spark interest in the public and bettors.
notes: Poor John McTiernan has seen the film upset in post production, so you don't understand anything about characters and situations. The pitiful packaging, with funfair pyrotechnic effects, however, is also his fault.

title: The Time Machine
actors: Guy Pearce, Jeremy Irons, Samantha Mumba, Phyllida Law
description: New York, 1899. Alexander, a brilliant scientist and inventor, falls in love with Emma. One evening while they are in Central Park they are attacked by a thief. During the collusion Emma is fatally wounded and the intervention of the rescuers is of no use. From that day Alexander has been committed to building a time machine that can change the course of events. Thanks to the device, the scientist will find himself catapulted into the future.
notes: The film is nice and funny: an adventure for kids that will not displease the grown-ups, especially those who remember _The man who lived in the future_, 1960 and in general the science fiction of the 50s also mentioned in the exquisitely "retro" digital effects.

title: The Exorcist
actors: Ellen Burstyn, Max Von Sydow, Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Lee J. Cobb
description: Twelve-year-old Regan MacNeil, daughter of the well-known actress Chris, begins to show unusual signs of imbalance: violent noises come from her room, becomes hysterical and is tormented by terrifying dreams. On top of that, a director friend of the family is found dead after being alone with her. The doctors who are treating her declare themselves powerless in the face of the very strange manifestations of Regan, going so far as to hypothesize that the girl is "possessed" by external forces. Her mother is also convinced of this, who calls a priest to visit her: but when the religious becomes a victim of the Evil One who dwells in Regan's body, he must have recourse to a real exorcist, who engages in an epic night of battle with the devil.
notes: Upon its release in 1973, the film immediately became a blockbuster and aroused heated debate: theologically very correct, however, it was criticized for the excessive realism of the sequences of possession, judged extreme by some and ridiculous by others. The story, scripted by William Peter Blatty from one of his novels, is a very strong narrative crescendo, staged according to the typical canons of "detection"; numerous controversies, however, were provoked by the scatological language used by the devil in the course of his "epiphanies". The construction of the suspense is also determined by the musical column, dominated by the disturbing theme taken from "Tubular Bells" by Mike Oldfield. The film had eight nominations, but only won two Oscars (script and sound).

title: Attila
actors: Gerard Butler, Powers Boothe, Simmone Mackinnon, Tim Curry, Reg Rogers
description: His childhood was certainly not easy: an orphan at a very young age, Attila had to fight hard to answer the call of a destiny that wanted him to be a great warrior and valiant leader. In his unbridled ambition, the throne of the Huns was only the first step towards the conquest of the world: this dream, however, could not fail to break in the face of the excessive power of the Roman Empire, which Attila threatened in its foundations convinced as his people were entitled to a supremacy sanctioned by divine law. In one sense or another, however, the Hun ruler remains one of the great protagonists of his time.

title: The Rage: Carrie 2
actors: Emily Bergl, Jason London, Dylan Bruno, Amy Irving, Mena Suvari, J. Smith-Cameron
description: Over twenty years earlier, Carrie White consumed her revenge against her schoolmates, guilty of cruelly humiliating her. Today Sue Snell, one of the few survivors of that massacre perpetrated by telekinesis, works as a social worker at a high school and is particularly dedicated to Rachel, a "problematic" student. Coincidentally, this young woman also has the ability to move objects at a distance, and that a group of bullies are planning to make fun of her. Rachel and Carrie, however, are more connected than you think ...
notes: Faint semi-sequel to De Palma's film with Sissy Spacek (1976).

title: The Scorpion King
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Kelly Hu, Michael Clarke Duncan, Steven Brand, Sherri Howard, Bernard Hill, Grant Heslov, Peter Facinelli
description: Memnon, a tyrant determined to eliminate all the nomadic populations of the desert, holds the city of Gomorrah with an iron fist. The nomadic tribes who escaped the slaughter try to regroup to defeat the hated enemy. To counter him they hire Mathayus who, having entered the enemy camp, finds himself having to fight with Cassandra, a young and charming witch. Unable to kill her, he flees with her into the desert.
notes: Filmed by Chuck Russell, in pure recycling economy, with improvised sets and exteriors, the very modest and very gymnastic film is a bit of a catch of the television era, a bit of "Age of Empires", a bit of a follower of the "sandaloni".

title: Soul Survivors
actors: Casey Affleck, Wes Bentley, Melissa Sagemiller, Angela Featherstone, Eliza Dushku
description: Cassie, Sean and their friends Matt and Annabel are having a fight in the car. A moment of distraction is enough to cause an accident. Of the four he has the worst Sean who dies instantly. Matt, still shaken by the tragedy, gives up entering Harvard because he somehow feels guilty of his friend's death. Cassie is also very upset about what happened. The situation worsens when Sean begins to appear to him.
notes: Situations are often on the edge of ridicule, especially those that should focus more on suspense or even on metaphysical symbolism. And the coup de grace is the ending that provides the stupidest possible explanation for the mysteries that underpin the film.

title: The One
actors: Jet Li, Carla Gugino, Delroy Lindo, Jason Statham, Dylan Bruno
description: Police officer Yulaw is forced to engage in a truly relentless fight against another himself who lives in a parallel dimension. The policeman is determined to eliminate his double in order to take possession of his forces as well and thus become the absolute being. In fact, it is enough to interrupt the flow between the various doubles to assume a superhuman strength. Agents Roedecker and Funsch try to prevent this from happening.
notes: Directed by James Wong, director of "Final destination", here is a bland science fiction film starring Jet Li, a Chinese star who is sadly wasting his talent. The film does not even ensure the fun of the action scenes.

title: Wild Bill
actors: Jeff Bridges, Ellen Barkin, David Arquette, John Hurt, Diane Lane, Keith Carradine
description: The famous James Butler Hickok, known throughout the West as "Wild Bill", has to face an unexpected cat to peel: in fact, the young Jack McCall, who has sworn to kill him to wash the shame suffered, has set himself on his trail by his mother Susannah. The woman's life had been destroyed after Bill's abandonment, and Jack intends to do justice: the hero's descending parable and his passion for opium could facilitate the aspiring avenger's task ...
notes: After "Geronimo", Hill remains close to the myths of the Frontier addressing them with a vaguely "seventies" look, abounding in flashbacks and nostalgic notations.

title: Black Dog
actors: Patrick Swayze, Randy Travis, Meat Loaf, Gabriel Casseus
description: Truck driver Jack Crews, jailed for dozing off at the wheel and causing an accident, has returned home, but is so much in debt that he has to agree to drive an articulated truck again. When the truck is attacked by the men of Red's gang, Jack realizes he is carrying a load of weapons: to force him to deliver it, Red kidnaps his wife and daughter ...
notes: The title refers to a legend in vogue among American truck drivers: that of a black dog that causes disasters with its appearance. Chases and punches are wasted, but those looking for something more would be disappointed.

title: The Last Frontier
actors: Victor Mature, Guy Madison, Robert Preston, Anne Bancroft
description: Assaulted by Red Indians and robbed of everything, Jed Cooper and his two fur-hunters buddies enlist as guides at a remote outpost in the Oregon forests. Determined to take a less dangerous life, Jed sets his sights on Corinna, the beautiful wife of Colonel Marston, commander of one of the forts in the area.

title: The Forsaken
actors: Kerr Smith, Brendan Fehr, Izabella Miko, Johnathon Schaech
description: Sean, a trailer editor for a production company specializing in horror movie parodies, is catching up with his sister who is getting married in Florida. During the journey he takes two hitchhikers aboard his luxury car: Nick and Megan, a girl in shock who wanders non-stop. Nick confesses to Sean that the area is infested with vampires and that Megan is their victim. Our two heroes will have to fight against the creatures of the night.
notes: Nothing new under the sun. A horror so-so, that you drink it all in one gulp without making a lot of noise: it does not irritate, it also amuses you, but it is not marked on the notebook.

title: The Spring
actors: Kyle MacLachlan, Alison Eastwood, George Eads, Joseph Cross
description: While rafting on a river with his son Nick, Dennis Conway accidentally discovers a spring with magical powers, a veritable "fountain of eternal youth". Obviously, the inhabitants of the place are anything but inclined to share the prodigy they have with the rest of the world, and in fact, on the spot they try to get rid of the intruder: but later - convinced by doctor Sophie Weston, who fell in love with (reciprocated) Dennis - they offer him a profitable opportunity to say the least. The strange community, however, hides other secrets, a dark and evil side that concerns its older members ...

title: Flying Virus
actors: Rutger Hauer, Gabrielle Anwar, Mark Adair-Rios
description: Inside the Amazon rainforest, inscrutable secrets are hidden. Dr. Stephen North has devoted more than ten years of his life to discovering them. In the course of his research, North has developed medicines that cause terrible mutations in insects ...
notes: Catastrophic old fashioned, however, made with television style.

title: The Phantom
actors: Billy Zane, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Treat Williams, Kristy Swanson
description: Phantom is an immortal hero (in the sense that his myth has been handed down for generations) whose mission is to fight against all forms of human cruelty and injustice. Thus he finds himself having to prevent a criminal from taking possession of the legendary skulls of Touganda, capable of giving superhuman strength. To fight against the supervillain, the masked executioner leaves his native Africa to go to New York.
notes: From the famous comic created by Lee Falk (Mandrake's father), an underrated adventure film, perhaps naive but funny. After the flop in the States it was never released in theaters in Italy. Among the executive producers, also Joe Dante.

title: Impostor
actors: Tim Guinee, Tony Shalhoub, Madeleine Stowe, Vincent D'Onofrio, Gary Sinise
description: 2075. Terrestrial colonies that have settled in space are constantly attacked by extraterrestrials. A government agent is working to develop a weapon that can defeat them. At the head of the project is the scientist Spencer who from one day to the next finds himself imprisoned with the accusation of being an alien who has taken the physical appearance of a human being.
notes: Gary Fleder is a decent filmmaker and manages to draw a pretty convincing visual grid. Instead, his staging of this Dick story is very indecisive, deficient, confused. Throughout the film, he does not find a point of view (right or wrong, but clear).

title: The Stunt Man
actors: Peter O'Toole, Steve Railsback, Barbara Hershey, Chuck Bail
description: A singular metacinematographic reflection, a small movie classic in the cinema: a runaway thief ends up on a film set, where a director on the verge of paranoia (O'Toole) hires him as a double.
notes: Frantic editing and directorial pulse as in the most classic of action films, but shaken by unpredictable changes of register and by continuous confusions between fiction and reality. Surprising and certainly original.

title: The Black Room
actors: Boris Karloff, Marian Marsh, Robert Allen, Thurston Hall
description: Extraordinary interpretation of Boris Karloff here in the double part of two twin brothers who live in a castle, upon which the danger of a millennial curse lies. Among dense fogs, twisted trees, disturbing apparitions, rooms and corridors of a manor that hides a terrible secret, the film unfolds all the paraphernalia of the best 1930s gothic.

title: Robinson Crusoe
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Sean Brosnan, Ian Hart, William Takaku
description: Robinson Crusoe, an English sailor en route to the South Seas, is shipwrecked on a desert island. The first moments are particularly hard, but the years pass and the adaptability of the lone castaway improves.
notes: Discreet and faithful transposition of Defoe's story, with a bearded Pierce "007" Brosnan and Ian Hart as the writer.

title: Atomic Twister
actors: Mark Paul Gosselaar, Paul Barrett, Corbin Bersen, Johnny Blick
description: A series of tornadoes hit a nuclear power plant in the state of Tennessee. Of course it is Saturday and the staff has been reduced for the weekend. Only Corinne Maguire, the shift chief, remained to guard. The situation is rapidly deteriorating, so much so that the generator and many control instruments no longer respond to commands. Corinne is forced to declare a state of alarm.
notes: Tv movie directed with television hand by Bill Corcoran. It goes without saying that Mark-Paul Gosselaar is detective John Clark jr. in the TV show "New York Police Departement".

title: When the Legends Die
actors: Richard Widmark, Frederic Forrest, Luana Anders, Vito Scotti
description: A rodeo champion on the avenue of sunset befriends a red man who is forced to come to terms with the world of whites in spite of himself. Two lives that deal with their own failure and a film that tells the epic of the vanquished with participation, singing the end of the western legend.
notes: The director, producer of "Piccolo grande uomo", films the life of the cowboy, recounting its most squalid aspects and its pathetic aspects.

title: Wild in the Street
actors: Christopher Jones, Shelley Winters, Diane Varsi, Hal Holbrook
description: A very young singer, an idol of adolescents, wants to become President of the United States: after lowering the minimum age for voting to fourteen, he unleashes a no holds barred war on all people guilty of having become "adults".
notes: Cheap satire, raw workmanship, some original ideas.

title: Death Trap
actors: Neville Brand, Mel Ferrer, Stuart Whitman, William Finley, Carolyn Jones, Marilyn Burns, Roberta Collins, Kyle Richards, Robert Englund, Crystin Sinclaire, Janus Blythe, Betty Cole
description: Judd is an old psychopath who lives in Louisiana near a swamp. He owns a dilapidated motel and has a passion for blood: to kill his victims he pushes them into the jaws of a crocodile.
notes: Cultured and aware horror, behind which many of the neuroses and phobias of America in the late 1970s can be read in filigree. Nocturnal and claustrophobic, with some really nice sequences.

title: Rage at Dawn
actors: Randolph Scott, Forrest Tucker, J. Carrol Naish, Mala Powers
description: Two secret agents to unmask the wrongdoings of a gang of criminals who operate undisturbed, under the cover of sheriffs and corrupt magistrates, in Indiana, organize the assault on a train. Captured, they are imprisoned and executed without the possibility of defense.
notes: Western produced by Rko based on a McCoy book. The elements of the detective story redeem him from the genre he attends badly.

title: Dakota Incident
actors: Linda Darnell, Dale Robertson, John Lund, Ward Bond
description: Assault on the stagecoach. Indians shoot showers of arrows at a mismatched group of white civilians in the shelter of a stagecoach: a woman with an unclear past, a bank robber and a politician.
notes: Clone films, but not very convinced, of the western genre, of the _Ombre rossa_ series. It always works.

title: The Strange Door
actors: Charles Laughton, Boris Karloff, Michael Pate
description: Alan is a mad count who has kept his brother locked up in a castle cell for twenty years, guilty of marrying the woman he was in love with. Not content with the torture made to suffer his brother, the count forces the niece daughter of that brother to marry a little good, to imprison them in turn. The servant takes over to resolve the situation, freeing everyone.
notes: From Stevenson with terror, a horror in the hands of a novice Pevney.

title: The Ox-Bow Incident
actors: Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Anthony Quinn, Henry Morgan
description: In a small Nevada village, three men are wrongly accused of stealing cows. Without giving them the opportunity to defend themselves and despite the opposition of two cowboys, the three alleged thieves are executed on the gallows. The next day it turns out that they were innocent.
notes: In 1943 Wellman created the neo-western in one fell swoop by sewing the stylistic codes of what would be defined as the realist western around a story of intolerance. Based on a short story by Walter Van Tilburg, scripted by Lamar Trotti, with the exteriors shot in the studio due to production cuts, this film is a relentless and cruel account of the Umanian psychology on the borders of the frontier.

title: You Can't Win'Em All
actors: Tony Curtis, Charles Bronson, Michèle Mercier, Patrick Magee
description: Turkey, 1920s: while a tough war rages between revolutionaries and the sultan's faithful, two Americans try to sell weapons while living a conflicted friendship ...
notes: Minor film for the Curtis-Bronson couple, which thanks to the combination of two very different types could give more surprises.

title: Death Race 2000
actors: David Carradine, Sylvester Stallone, Simone Griffeth, Mary Woronov
description: In the futuristic and dystopian America of the 2000s, a coast-to-coast race is organized in which the winner is whoever has hit the largest number of passers-by.
notes: Cult movie of fantasy-sociology cinema conditioned by the 'cold' climate of those years, produced by Roger Corman, with a sequel I gladiators of the year 3000.

title: Minority Report
actors: Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max Von Sydow, Kathryn Morris, Patrick Kilpatrick, Jessica Capshaw, Richard Coca, Keith Campbell, Kirk B.R. Woller, Klea Scott, Frank Grillo, Anna Maria Horsford, Sarah Simmons
description: Washington, 2054. Applying a new technology, the murder has been eliminated: in fact the police (thanks to three young visionaries considered infallible called "Pre-Cogs", who are able to see images that reveal the time, place and other details of the crimes that are about to happen) can foresee the future and punish the guilty before the crimes are committed. Commander John Anderton is part of the intervention department in charge of arresting potential criminals: but when the arrest order is triggered for him too (to prevent him from killing a complete stranger in the next 36 hours), he is forced to prove his innocence and escape his own department led by his eternal rival Danny Witwer, who wants to eliminate him. Sneaking under the radar of the most technologically advanced city, where every individual is monitored 24/7, John must prove that the Pre-Cogs can be wrong ...
notes: A bizarre mix of ancient and near future, between the "things to come" that probably already exist in the research laboratories and the sinuous gardens of the witches where flowers surround you or the aseptic "amniotic" pool in which the Pre-Cogs dream. But the most subtle contrast woven by the film is that between the explicit narration in the key of a sci-fi thriller and a painful and almost "suicidal" reflection on the theme of vision. Screenplay by Scott Frank and Jon Cohen, based on the short story of the same name by Philip K. Dick, published in 1956.

title: Signs
actors: Mel Gibson, Joaquin Phoenix, Rory Culkin, Abigail Breslin, Cherry Jones, M. Night Shyamalan
description: Pastor Graham Hess lost his faith after his wife died. With his two children Bo and Morgan and his younger brother Merrill, he lives on a farm in Pennsylvania located in the middle of a vast cornfield. Suddenly gigantic and disturbing circles (the so-called "crop circles") appear on the ground, which push Hess to look for what really lies behind the inexplicable phenomenon ...
notes: Shyamalan's fifth feature film is a composite and eccentric film, in which the author seems to follow his own paths of maturation, research and evolution rather than worrying about offering us a linear interpretation of the story. In fact, taking only as a starting point (by his explicit admission) the strong suggestion of crop circles, Shyamalan crosses backwards through the territory of science fiction: from the mystical-poetic impact of the encounter with the aliens of Spielberg's _Close Encounters of the Third Kind_ to violent tension in Romero's films, up to Siegel's _The Invasion of the Body Snatchers_ and other examples from the 1950s. Perhaps it is Siegel's film (and perhaps Hitchcock's _The Birds_) that has deeply influenced the Indian-born director the most. In the end, under the many levels of interpretation (often contradictory, sometimes simplistic), a remarkable fresco of "American Gothic" emerges: a mixture of Calvinism, pop ingenuity, isolationism and "social disease" nowadays difficult to find in a film admittedly of kind.

title: Men in Black II
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle
description: The strange couple of federal agents who fight alien and illegal immigration to Earth return. Unfortunately one of the two, Kay (Jones) has lost his memory, a not insignificant inconvenience since he was the one who held information crucial for the safety of the planet.
notes: The sequel to "Men in Black" is a very blunt space halberd, with no decent idea to be one, with a TV show duration (less than an hour and a half). Barry Sonnenfeld masks widespread embarrassment by mocking Tim Burton (Danny Elfman's score helps him) but "Mars Attacks!" it was really something else entirely.

title: xXx
actors: Vin Diesel, Samuel L. Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas
description: Xander Cage, a young specialist in extreme sports, is recruited by the US government for a special mission. His job is to gather information about an organization that is planning the destruction of the world, under the leadership of the fearsome Yorgi.
notes: The most truzzo film of recent years is all built on the physicality of Vin Diesel who has a fundamental characteristic in order not to be detested: irony. Rob Cohen has a lot of work and in the unbearable pounding of the decibels he manages to insert some pretty good action sequences (above all, avalanche snowboarding). He would be a great candidate for directing a 007.

title: Panic
actors: Kristanna Loken, Sanyogita Bhave, John Bishop, Boti Ann Bliss
description: Three plane crashes in a few days on the eve of July 4th: the United States flew in the panic of another attack, behind which Pakistani terrorists would hide. The only one who disagrees is Neil McCabe, a computer expert who is convinced that it is technological terrorism: the person responsible would be a computer wizard ...

title: Gale Force
actors: Treat Williams, Michael Dudikoff, Paul Logan, Renee Ridgeley
description: Sam, a Los Angeles detective, takes part in a reality TV show: along with three other contestants he must hunt for a treasure (10 million dollars in cash) hidden on a wild island. to spoil the show is Jared, at the head of a militia armed to the teeth, who lands on the island to get his hands on the loot. An easy task, but only apparently: because the timid Sam and his improvised comrades in arms manage to prevent the group from leaving the island with the treasure, and then nature gets involved, unleashing a hurricane that risks making a square clean of all.

title: Texas Rangers
actors: Jordan Brower, Rachael Leigh Cook, James Van Der Beek, Dylan McDermott, Alfred Molina
description: Second half of the nineteenth century: the law is an opinion for the inhabitants of the state of Texas. To ensure order and justice, a special body is created, the Texas Rangers. At the head of the armed group is Leander McNelly, a brave man who fights to put an end to the abuses of John King and his gang of outlaws.
notes: That of the Texan rangers is a western myth very popular in American cinema (a film for everyone: King Vidor's The Knights of Texas_, from 1936). Last good comes Miner with a history of super good rangers and super villain bandits. Nothing infamous, centuries ago the Monogram or the Republic would have produced it.

title: Re-Animator
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Bruce Abbott, Barbara Crampton, Robert Sampson
description: A medical student invents a serum to resurrect the dead. But the corpses come back to life for the purpose of killing.
notes: Gordon's directorial debut, who began his film career with one of the most violent and revolting films of the 1980s, with no regard for anyone: a worthy heir to Romero. A joy. From a story by H.P. Lovecraft. Considered a cult movie by fans of the horror genre.

title: Anne of The Indies
actors: Jean Peters, Debra Paget, Louis Jourdan, Herbert Marshall
description: Anna, to avenge her brother's death, embarks on a pirate ship. Nicknamed Captain Providence, she falls in love with a French pirate paid by the British to hand her over to the authorities.
notes: Duels and battles, love triumphs in the end: classic adventure film made with craftsmanship.

title: Rio Grande
actors: Claude Jarman jr, John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Ben Johnson
description: Colonel Kirby Yorke, at war with the Indians, is joined at the camp by his wife who did not leave him many years earlier and also finds his son, a recruit who has just arrived at the camp, at his feet.
notes: Concluding chapter of the military cavalry trilogy that began with "The Massacre at Fort Apache" and "The Knights of the North West". Minor work by Ford, light and unambitious.

title: The Hired Hand
actors: Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Verna Bloom, Robert Pratt, Severn Darden
description: After seven years of traveling the West, Harry Collings returns to the family farm in California. His intention is to stay, but his wife Hannah sees him leave with his friend Arch to avenge young Dan, killed by McVey's gang ...
notes: Peter "Captain America" ??Fonda's first direction is an anomalous (and perhaps too ambitious) western that, at least in spirit, traces the themes and atmospheres of _Easy Rider_, from two years earlier: the search for freedom, the sense of travel, the love of adventure. The photography by Vilmos Zsigmond is splendid; the film was restored and redistributed in 2001, thirty years after its release.

title: Apache Drums
actors: Stephen McNally, Coleen Gray, Willard Parker, James Griffith
description: In a village in the west, at the end of the nineteenth century, the professional player Sam Leeds is chased away by the sheriff because he is accused of moral disorder. When Sam returns to the village he tries to warn the population that the Apaches are preparing to launch an attack, but no one pays him any attention. The Indians will descend on the plain and the clash will be bloody.
notes: Flamboyant western that marks the high point in Fregonese's career.

title: The Mark of Zorro
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Marguerite De La Motte, Noah Beery, Robert McKim
description: Behind the respectable face of Don Diego de la Vega hides a masked avenger, who takes action to defend the reasons of the weak: the powerful governor Alvarado tyrannizes California, harassing the poor people. Zorro, a skilled swordsman, defeats his henchmen, wins the applause of the people and wins the beauty of the country.
notes: First version, rather modest, of the novel by Johnston McCulley, scripted by Fairbanks himself under a pseudonym.

title: Fire on the Amazon
actors: Sandra Bullock, Craig Sheffer, Juan Fernandez, Eduardo Cesti
description: In Bolivia, landowners are destroying the rainforest. And Santos, a supporter of the alliance with the natives to protest, is murdered. An American photojournalist investigates with Alyssa, a collaborator of Santos, also involving the Indios.
notes: Sandra Bullock in environmental version pre "Speed".

title: Seven Men From Now
actors: Randolph Scott, Gail Russell, Lee Marvin, Walter Reed, John Larch
description: Sheriff Stride seeks revenge: seven knights have robbed his country and killed his wife. He sets out on the trail of the fugitives until in the desert, after escaping an Indian attack, he comes face to face with the leader of the criminals.
notes: A great western, perhaps one of Boetticher's best: masterful use of bodies and spaces, the tragic core of western mythology. Screenplay by Burt Kennedy.

title: The Boogeyman
actors: Suzanna Love, Ron James, John Carradine, Nicholas Love, Raymond Boyden
description: Sixties: brother and sister plan the murder of their mother's lover, but their secret is caught in a mirror. Twenty years later, the two are haunted by the ghosts of the past: he has remained mute, she suffers from terrifying nightmares . But evil frees itself from the mirror, and goes in search of revenge.

title: Steel
actors: Shaquille O'Neal, Annabeth Gish, Richard Roundtree, Judd Nelson
description: John Henry Irons designs weapons. He works on a hypothesis that knocks out enemies harmlessly, but is sabotaged. Irons, disgusted, quits his job and decides to use his knowledge to stop the criminals from using the weapons of his creation.
notes: New proof of actor (?) For "Shaq", ace of the NBA.

title: Top Dog
actors: Chuck Norris, Carmine Caridi, Michele Lamar Richards, Clyde Kusatsu
description: Jake Wilder, a tough cop, wants to shed light on the death of his old friend and colleague Lou Swanson, who was killed while investigating some explosive attacks on a San Diego residential complex. To assist Jake there is a somewhat particular partner: a German shepherd named Reno ...
notes: Strictly for Norris fans.

title: The Whip Hand
actors: Raymond Burr, Olive Carey, Edgar Barrier, Otto Waldis
description: Arriving in a small town during a fishing vacation, reporter Steve Loomis finds that all the fish in the area have mysteriously died. Suspicious of the restlessness and hostility of the inhabitants, he decides to investigate some strange "scientists" who have recently settled in the vicinity ...
notes: Good proof of a master of the B-movie.

title: Night of the Ghouls
actors: Criswell, Duke Moore, Tor Johnson
description: Dr. Acula tries to dupe fools by organizing false séances in a "cursed" house. Unfortunately for him, the tenants of the house are real ghosts, who will take their revenge by making them take a one-way tour of the underworld ...
notes: This _Bride of the Monster_ pseudo-sequel (but according to some it is a derivation of _Plan 9_) reveals Ed Wood's total lack of talent. So why is it a must-see film? Because Ed - aka "the worst director in history" - believed himself to be a genius with disarming sincerity, and because his films are so unwittingly ridiculous that they entertain a lot.

title: Lovers Lane
actors: Diedre Kilgore, Carter Roy, Brian Allemand
description: A scandal breaks out in a provincial town when the relationship between the sheriff's wife and the husband of a nurse comes to the surface. Shortly after, the two are murdered: ten years later, local teenagers - including the children of the victims - are terrified by a maniac armed with a hook ...
notes: A mid-level "slasher".

title: Captain Kidd
actors: Charles Laughton, Randolph Scott, Reginald Owen, John Carradine
description: Fictional story of Captain Kidd, called to escort a cargo of gold to England. The officer chooses to mutiny and declares war on the royal navy, with all the consequences of the case.
notes: Adventurous swashbuckling film shot in natural locations and with considerable use of means.

title: Demon Knight
actors: William Sadler, Billy Zane, John Kassir, Jada Pinkett Smith, CCH Pounder
description: Brayker possesses the last of seven ancient keys (which guarded the blood of Christ) which enables him to stop the advance of the forces of Evil. The prodigious object is coveted by many: among these is the perfidious "Collector" who, in order to obtain it and thus be able to make the universe fall into chaos, accuses Brayker of having stolen his key and reports him to the police. I don't pay, he summons a host of corpses from the Hereafter ...
notes: Third film (co) directed by former cinematographer Spike Lee, based on a successful series of splatter comics. Discreet balance between funny and terrifying moments.

title: Contagion
actors: Bruce Boxleitner, Megan Gallagher, Lin Shaye, Dan Lauria
description: Wounded in the neck during an attack, US President Martin Howard discovers that he was hit by a capsule containing a lethal virus. The very delicate case is entrusted to the prestigious virologist Diane Landis, but time is running out ...
notes: A very discounted attempt to exhume a disused sub-genre.

title: Venomous
actors: Treat Williams, Mary Page Keller, Hannes Jaenicke, Anthony John Denison
description: In a secret laboratory in the desert, a United States Army science unit is developing a new species of snake that carries a deadly venom. A gang of terrorists, in an attempt to get hold of the new weapon, destroys the structure and ends up freeing the reptiles, but without being able to take it. Many years later, an earthquake brings to light the descendants of those snakes, which in the meantime have evolved and become even more lethal. The creatures swoop en masse on a town and the victims are not counted so much that to stop the invasion the military plans a carpet bombing.

title: Undisputed
actors: Fisher Stevens, Jon Seda, Peter Falk, Wesley Snipes, Ving Rhames
description: George, heavyweight champion known as "Iceman", is jailed - according to him unfairly - on rape charges: he does not accept that he cannot defend the crown and his record of victories. In the penitentiary where he is transferred he meets Monroe, a light heavyweight who wonders if one day he will be able to fight him in the ring ...
notes: Contrary to Hill's debut film _The Hero of the Road_, the context is no longer that of America in search of hope, but a closed world where the outcasts survive. In the midst of this disarrayed humanity rapping _God Bless America_, the camera moves frantically, amplifying the tensions.

title: Christy: The Movie
actors: Lauren Lee Smith, Diane Ladd, James Waterston, Stewart Finlay-McLennan
description: We are in 1912: Christy Huddleston, a girl full of ideals, abandons her quiet life to accept a job as a teacher in a small school in Cutter Gap, a town located in the mountains of Tennessee ...
notes: An honest TV movie, based on Catherine Marshall's best-seller of the same name.

title: Crazy Horse
actors: Michael Greyeyes, Peter Horton, Nathaniel Arcand, August Schellenberg
description: Crazy Horse was a key figure in Native American history. Sioux leader Oglala allied himself with the Cheyenne after marrying a squaw of that tribe. Its role is important in the resistance of the Indians to the expansion of the whites. He was responsible for Custer's death at the Battle of Little Big Horn.
notes: Tv movie shot in South Dakota.

title: Frailty
actors: Blake King , Matthew  O'Leary, Powers Boothe, Matthew McConaughey, Bill Paxton
description: The state of Texas is experiencing a period of genuine terror due to the bloody deeds of a serial killer who calls himself "The Hand of God". One evening, a certain Fenton Meiks introduces himself to the FBI claiming to know the identity of the criminal: it would be his brother Adam, who is about to commit suicide. As the federal agents go to the "Rose Garden", Fenton tells them how it all began, more than twenty years ago ...
notes: A soundly ambiguous, complex film, susceptible to multiple interpretations, even contrasting ones, but always suggestive. Thanks to a script (by Brent Hanley) that is not perfect but layered, never rigid or one-sided.

title: Eight Legged Freaks
actors: David Arquette, Kari Wuhrer, Scott Terra, Scarlett Johansson
description: Small spiders contaminated with toxic products grow out of all proportion and soon spread terror in a small mining town. Resistance against eight-legged invaders is entrusted to engineer Chris McCormick and Sheriff Sam Parker.
notes: Suspended between tension and humor, the film rather than the classics of science fiction of yesteryear would like to recall the spirit, already cinephile itself, of the first Joe Dante. But without pretensions, without sociological imagination. The funniest part are the spiders chasing the motorcycles in the desert, like in a hybrid between various strands of the former B series.

title: Gargantua
actors: Adam Baldwin, Emile Hirsch, Julie Carmen, Bobby Hosea, Doug Penty
description: Jack Ellway, a marine biologist, leaves with his son Brandon for the Pacific island of Malau. Here he will have to study the effects of an earthquake on the different forms of life in that area. A series of drowning misterises occur during his research, and when Brandon encounters an extraordinarily large baby amphibian of an unknown species, it is clear that there is a new species of marine "giants". When their presence becomes numerically important, the army is on time with its "strategists". Their plan? A nice seafood salad ...

title: The Brotherhood
actors: Josh Hammond, Nathan Watkins, Bradley Stryker, Elizabeth Bruderman
description: Dan and Chris, freshmen and roommates at a small California college, make friends. The idea of ??joining one of the university brotherhoods does not appeal to them very much: especially when it comes to the "Doma", a group of rather sinister-looking young men led by the bloodless Devin. But then the beautiful Megan invites them to a party and ...

title: Gunfighter
actors: Robert Carradine, Martin Sheen, Will Hutchins, Chris Lybbert, Louis Schwiebert
description: The down-and-out singer known as "Kid" enters an apparently abandoned saloon at night, where he meets a mysterious character who calls himself "the Stranger". Intrigued by the latter's unusual black leather gloves, the Kid asks to know more: thus begins the story of Hopalong Cassidy, one of the fastest guns in the West, and his arch rival, the shadowy and black-clad Tex. .
notes: The surname is one of the important ones: Chris is in fact descended from one of the noblest Hollywood lineages, grandson of Francis Ford and brother of Nicolas Cage. Here he retraces Leonian traces, with not exactly memorable results.

title: U.S. Seals II
actors: Michael Worth, Damian Chapa, Kate Connor, Karen Kim
description: In addition to being close friends, Casey Sheppard and Frank Ratliff both serve in the famous Navy Seals corps. Their disposition, however, is very different: if Sheppard is loyal and disciplined, the same cannot be said for Ratliff, who after a dramatic accident disappears to re-emerge years later in the pay of international terrorism ...

title: Two for Texas
actors: Kris Kristofferson, Scott Bairstow, Irene Bedard, Tom Skerritt, Peter Coyote
description: 1836: Two prisoners, Hugh Allison and Son Holland, escape from a Louisiana penal colony after killing a ferocious Cajun tormentor. Followed by the dead man's brother, Hugh and Son arrive in Texas, where they enlist as volunteers in the army of the "irregular" who fight against the Mexicans of General Santa Anna ...
notes: A reinterpretation of the siege of the Alamo and the birth of an American nation through an epic novel by James Lee Burke, _Two for Texas_, published in Italy by Meridiano Zero. This television translation is not to be despised, especially for the intense presence of Kris Kristofferson.

title: Critters 4
actors: Don Keith Opper, Anders Hove, Angela Bassett, Paul Whitthorne
description: Shortly before destroying the last two Critters eggs, Charlie learns that the extinction of the breed is considered illegal. Then, due to a misunderstanding, Charlie gets lost in space, and only after several years is he found by Rick and his men. Intrigued, Rick opens the egg box: there is new work for Charlie ...

title: Critical Mass
actors: Treat Williams, Lori Loughlin, Udo Kier, Blake Clark, Jack Betts
description: Officer Mike Jeffers must escort a truck loaded with toxic materials to a secret location in the Mojave Desert. But what looks like a routine task ends up getting damned complicated after the onslaught of the terrorist commando headed by the mysterious Sampson ...
notes: Trivia in its pure state.

title: The Four Feathers
actors: Heath Ledger, Wes Bentley, Kate Hudson, Djimon Hounsou
description: England, 1884. On the eve of his departure for Sudan where he should fight the Madhi rebels, Harry, an officer of the British Empire, leaves the army and returns home. His father deserates him and three of his friends, including Lieutenant Jack Durrance and his fiancée Ethne Eustace send him four white feathers that symbolize cowardice. When Harry receives the news that Jack and his regiment have fallen into the hands of the rebels, he leaves to join his friends.
notes: Shekhar Kapur (author with an intense and not restrained style) brings to the surface the condemnation of colonialism, the legitimacy of the irreconcilable philosophies to which peoples and cultures refer.

title: The Hidden 2
actors: Raphael Sbarge, Michael Welden, Kate Hodge
description: An alien disguised as a government agent lands on earth to investigate a companion who had previously arrived on planet Earth and mysteriously disappeared. He will discover that an ancient alien civilization, hibernating for millennia, is finally awakening and threatening to destroy the cosmos.
notes: Z series science fiction.

title: Wagons East
actors: John Candy, Richard Lewis, Ellen Greene, John C. McGinley
description: The lack of prospects pushes the inhabitants of Prosperity, a village in the heart of the United States, to abandon their homes: it will be the foreigner James H. Harlow to convince them - unlike all the other pioneers - to head east.
notes: Last, far from memorable film starring John Candy.

title: Star Trek. Nemesis
actors: Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner, LeVar Burton, Michael Dorn
description: As the crew of the Enterprise prepares to celebrate the wedding of Deanna Troi and William Riker, a sudden call from Starfleet forces the ship to go to Romulus for an unexpected diplomatic mission: in fact, after a long enmity, the Romulans they have decided to open peace negotiations. Upon reaching their destination, however, Picard and his men are faced with a threat that could lead to the destruction of the Earth ...
notes: The special effects alternate plausible sequences with not too sophisticated videogame effects: yet, the consolidated skill of the cast manages to not wreck the film in the black hole of indifference.

title: Love Me Tender
actors: Richard Egan, Debra Paget, Elvis Presley, Robert Middleton
description: The southern brothers Reno, not knowing that the Secession war is over, attack a northern convoy. Having become aware of the situation and not knowing who to deliver the loot to, they decide to divide it up. They will get into a lot of trouble.
notes: Beautiful songs sung by Elvis ("Love Me Tender" and "Poor Boy").

title: The Lost World
actors: Patrick Bergin, Jayne Heitmeyer, Julian Casey, David Nerman
description: 1930s. After a tumultuous reunion, the Royal Geografic Society sends four adventurers in search of the lost world: a mythical hidden region where the long-extinct dinosaurs are said to be. Our heroes will face mythical adventures.
notes: Yet another version of Arthur Conan Doyle's novel.

title: Zits
actors: Danielle Duclos, Janson Kristofer, Cameron Johann
description: Determined to lend a hand to a blind teacher, the gang of Hoggy and Oskar look for a way to get the money they need. At a certain point, the right idea comes up, even if a little crazy: to get hold of some state secrets and sell them at a high price! Just like in the cinema ...
notes: Ramshackle but fun enough.

title: Hondo
actors: John Wayne, Geraldine Page, Ward Bond, Michael Pate, James Arness
description: New Mexico, 1874: Hondo Lane, a tough-skinned cavalry courier, takes the fate of Angie Lowe and her son Johnny to heart. One day, near the Lowe ranch, Lane is attacked by Angie's ex-husband and is forced to kill him ...
notes: Solid and "democratic" enough, with an intense Wayne.

title: Angel and the Badman
actors: John Wayne, Gail Russell, Harry Carey, Bruce Cabot, Irene Rich
description: The Worth Quaker family welcomes gunfighter Quirt, who was wounded in a shooting. During his stay he falls in love with the rescuers' daughter. He will be forced to choose whether to return to life as an outlaw and take revenge on those who tried to kill him, or live with his beloved woman by accepting the rules of his world.
notes: "Psychological" Western to be re-evaluated for several reasons: the first is the intense test of the Duke, also a producer. The second is for the theme of "non-violence", an almost impracticable lifestyle choice in a still barbaric world like that of the Far West. Had it been directed by Boetticher or Anthony Mann, it would have been a masterpiece.

title: Redemption
actors: Don 'The Dragon' Wilson, Chris Penn, James Russo, Sam J. Jones
description: Officer John Sato, leader of a Los Angeles police assault team, is held responsible for the death of a colleague in the course of an action. Expelled from the body and disgraced, John goes to the employ of the gangster Tony Leggio ...
notes: "For fans only": the others carefully keep away.

title: The Spanish Main
actors: Paul Henreid, Maureen O'Hara, Walter Slezak, Binnie Barnes
description: Shipwrecked on the Spanish island of Cartagena, the Dutch captain van Horn and his crew are condemned to the gallows, but they manage to escape and commit themselves to piracy by capturing Francisca, girlfriend of the corrupt governor Don Alvarado ...
notes: Great public success for the (not exceptional) first Rko film shot in Technicolor.

title: Possessed
actors: Timothy Dalton, Henry Czerny, Christopher Plummer, Piper Laurie
description: 1949: the war traumas deeply affected Father Bowdern, a Jesuit and veteran of the Second World War. While administering his pastoral activity in a parish in St. Louis, the priest is struck by the case concerning the young Robbie, who in addition to bearing some strange and mysterious signs on his body appears under the influence of a spirit of otherworldly origin. Robbie's family believes that the boy is possessed by the devil: an opinion shared by Father Bowdern himself, who after having asked and obtained the consent of the competent authorities in the Vatican, undertakes the long and painful process of exorcizing the Evil One.

title: Solaris
actors: George Clooney, Natascha McElhone, Jeremy Davies
description: Psychologist Chris Kelvin must investigate what happened to the Prometheus space station, orbiting the planet Solaris, which for six months has cut off all communication with the Earth. Upon arriving, Kelvin discovers that the commander has mysteriously died and that the crew is prey to unexplained events ...
notes: While, in 1971, Tarkovsky - with his dilated times and his infinite terrestrial, spatial and mental landscapes - was able to make us penetrate into the coils of Solaris, immersing us in the amniotic fluid of our past and future, Soderbergh succeeds at best in mimic a sense of guilt, to languish on a memory.

title: Target Earth
actors: Christopher Meloni, Marcia Cross, John C. McGinley, Melinda Culea
description: Detective Sam is not resigned to the disappearance of his wife Beth four years ago. Tammy, a six-year-old daughter of Karen, a single mother, also disappears while playing in the backyard. Sam accidentally finds her unconscious. The little girl writes incomprehensible symbols and letters.

title: The Hulk
actors: Eric Bana, Jennifer Connelly, Sam Elliott, Josh Lucas, Nick Nolte
description: During an experiment, physicist Bruce Banner is struck by deadly gamma rays that modify his genetic tissue, transforming him, whenever he gets angry, into a green monster. From this moment on he is forced to flee as the army is on his trail that would like to use him as a weapon. Men, for their part, reject him as he is a mutant who cannot control his fits of anger. Only the daughter of the general who is after him (already in love with Dr. Banner) seems to care about the poor outcast.
notes: Ang Lee's filmography does not admit similarities and similarities between one film and another and this tiger and dragon agility allows him to tell the story of the Hulk and his alter ego, Bruce Banner (Eric Bana). A multiplication of points of view that reproduces the geometries of comic albums and digs deep and theoretical furrows on the problem of transposition. Hulk is a double film that suffers from some length precisely because of this double track along which it runs in the footsteps of the melancholy Hulk and stops to underline the anguish and the "lack" that hides behind the superpowers of a man of science, rational and primitive, brutal and full of tenderness, like a sentimental jade-green King Kong, for his colleague (a wonderful Jennifer Connelly, very good in the original version). A monster that shrinks out of love.

title: The Matrix Reloaded
actors: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving, Monica Bellucci, Lambert Wilson
description: Neo and the rebel leaders have approximately 72 hours before 250,000 probes discover Zion and destroy it along with its inhabitants. Meanwhile, Neo must decide how to save Trinity from a dark fate that he continues to see in his dreams ...
notes: The second chapter of the saga re-proposes the usual mixture of Japanese martial arts and "anime" - with a dressing of mysticism, apocalyptic millennialism, sci-fi narrative suggestions - and a very "à la page" visual approach (who would not want to wear black tunics or minimalist leather rompers or the poor or ethnic fake rags of the inhabitants of Zion?). In reality, _Matrix_ must be taken for what it is: a very well-made and equally fashionable toy, which at a narrative and visual level takes hold of all the pre-existing literary and cinematographic science fiction, recomposing it and reassembling it with a great sense of rhythm and extraordinary action sequences (the one on the highway, for example, or Neo's dream about Trinity). If we accept the fact that Matrix is ??not the Bible for the third millennium, which won't help us make our choices, we will also accept its very rare human thrills and the vaguely "plasticized" effect of the whole. As an entertainment, it is a top notch product.

title: Kill Bill: vol. 1
actors: Uma Thurman, David Carradine, Daryl Hannah, Michael Madsen, Lucy Liu, Vivica A. Fox, Julie Dreyfus, Chiaki Kuriyama, Shin'ichi Chiba, Chia-hui Liu, Michael Parks, Michael Bowen, Jun Kunimura
description: The gang of Bill, a boss of the mala, raids the church where the wedding of the ruthless killer Black Mamba is being celebrated, who is expecting a child and is determined to retire from the profession. The toll of the ambush is four victims, with the bride - hit in the head by a bullet - dying at the foot of the altar. Coming out of a coma after five years, Black Mamba simply becomes "the Bride" and is willing to do anything to take revenge. Wearing Bruce Lee's legendary yellow jumpsuit and armed with katanas, she sets out in search of Bill and his assassins, three women and a man who call themselves "Deadly Viper Assassination Squad" ...
notes: There is a philosophical depth in the dynamics of bodies, in the recovery of a lost plasticity that is grafted into a representation where space is fundamental, and within which are the androgynous female figures (mothers-daughters-brides-lovers-children) a enclose man and woman, I and Id, Yin and Yang: mixed and transversal like the forms of the hundred genres that then come together in one, that of a cinema that is possible only if it is accepted as writing chaos (at least in appearance). The woman as genesis and conflict, life and death: only in volume 2 will we be able to realize if the evolution of the "Bride" will go in one direction rather than another.

title: Child's Play
actors: Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent, Brad Dourif
description: Mortally wounded during a firefight with the police, serial killer Charles Lee Ray uses a voodoo spell to transfer his soul into a doll named Chucky: which, given to little Andy Barclay for his birthday, immediately begins to kill. . However, Charles's spirit has no intention of being trapped forever in the body of the new host: the only way out is to transmigrate into the first human being to whom he will reveal his true identity, which - as you can imagine - puts Andy in mortal danger.
notes: Discreet "pilot" of a series that reached its fifth chapter in 1998.

title: Python
actors: Robert Englund, Casper Van Dien, Frayne Rosanoff, William Zabka
description: John returns to New Haven to help his mother run the metalworking factory. Meanwhile, a military truck in which snakes were traveling, has an accident near the town. The reptiles, escaped from the vehicle and come into contact with the factory's acids, sow death.

title: The Hunted
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Benicio Del Toro, Connie Nielsen, Jenna Boyd
description: Oregon: Aaron Hallam, former Special Forces member, has fallen into a murderous obsession. Taking refuge in the forest, he chooses hunters as his victims, killing them preferably with sidearms. To track him down, the FBI turns to the only one who could stop him: L.T. Bonham, his former trainer. Initially L.T. He refuses the assignment, but when he realizes that it could be one of his former students he feels compelled to accept and decides to face Aaron openly ...
notes: Working on the screenplay signed by the English brothers David and Peter Griffiths and by Art Monterastelli, Friedkin moves the two protagonists with his usual skill: the manhunt has always been the heart of his cinema. However, every action is truncated within a few minutes, as if the characters were in a hurry to arrive on that "Highway 61" where Abraham will sacrifice Isaac (the homonymous song by Dylan is quoted in the opening), as if today's cinema does not allow more "times" than that of the '70s. In _The Hunted_ there are _A quiet weekend of fear_, _The Hunter_ and _Rambo_. In place of paranoia, there is fear; not America that distrusts itself, but America that barricades itself at home. All mixed in a kaleidoscope of psychological and narrative degree close to zero. A "skin" film, iconographically built on myths (the photography by Caleb Deschanel is suggestive). Take it or leave it: legends rest in peace, better isolate yourself among the wolves.

title: Dreamcatcher
actors: Morgan Freeman, Tom Sizemore, Thomas Jane, Jason Lee, Damian Lewis
description: Jonesy, Henry, Pete and Beaver have known each other since childhood. As children they saved a child named Duddits: this heroic act endowed each of them with supernatural powers and united them in a profound way. Once they become adults, the powers become more of a burden than a gift: and when an accident threatens to kill one of them, the four realize that the episode is somehow linked to the past and to the figure of Duddits ...
notes: The first half hour promises very well, on the trail of the cruel and enchanted atmospheres that Rob Reiner had been able to grasp in _Stand by Me_ and with the precipitous descent into a nightmare at _Misery must not die_ (again by Reiner). Too bad that the rest of the film - which lasts more than two hours - is literally "devoured" by the tale of the alien invasion.

title: High Noon
actors: Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges, Thomas Mitchell
description: Willy resigns from his post as sheriff on the day of his wedding to Amy, a Quaker girl with whom he has always been in love. When he learns that a dangerous outlaw is about to return to the city on the midday train, he feels compelled to take back the star and confront him. But the citizens he tries to protect, frightened, deny him the help and so Willy will have to manage alone.
notes: Fred Zinnemann, is inspired by the short story _The Tin Star_ by John Cunningham, and directs a film in which the time in which the action takes place coincides with the actual minutes. Four Oscars (lead actor, editor, music and best song) and many remakes.

title: Texas Lady
actors: Claudette Colbert, Barry Sullivan, Gregory Walcott, Ray Collins, James Bell
description: Inherited ownership of the local newspaper, Prudence arrives in a secluded Texas town. The two individuals who dictate the law in the area, however, show that they do not like the liberal spirit of the woman, who can nevertheless count on the unexpected help of a gambler ...
notes: Whelan's latest film, active since the dawn of sound.

title: Double Take
actors: Eddie Griffin, Orlando Jones, Edward Herrmann, Gary Grubbs
description: Daryl Chase deals with banking investments, but is framed for the murder of two policemen, which occurred after the discovery of irregularities in a client's account. To escape the police, the man exchanges his identity with that of Freddy Tiffany: but who is he really?
notes: Series B action-comedy with too many ambitions.

title: WW3
actors: Timothy Hutton, Lane Smith, David Aaron Baker, Hrant Alianak
description: After the sudden death, due to the same symptoms, of passengers on a cruise ship and spectators of a baseball match, federal agents Sullivan and Chang open an investigation and discover that the cause of the massacre is a bacteriological weapon. that a group of terrorists wants to use to sow death ...

title: Surviving the Game
actors: Ice T, Charles S. Dutton, Rutger Hauer, Gary Busey, F. Murray Abraham
description: Plot in preparation

title: White Zombies
actors: Bela Lugosi, Madge Bellamy, Robert Frazer, Brandon Hurst
description: Falling in love with the beautiful Madeleine, the rich Beaumont convinces the young woman and her betrothed to celebrate the wedding in his villa in Haiti. To get Madeleine, Beaumont turns to the sorcerer Legendre, who transforms the girl into a zombie with his voodoo practices. Beaumont tries to rebel against Legendre to get Madeleine back alive, but by then it will be too late.
notes: In the US, a horror classic, it is considered the first zombie film in the history of cinema. Its strengths are above all the interpretation of Bela Lugosi, and his legendary close-ups with the spirited gaze, the settings and certain atmospheres that refer directly to German expressionism.

title: Tall in the Saddle
actors: John Wayne, Ella Raines, Audrey Long, George 'Gabby' Hayes
description: Arriving in an isolated valley, a young adventurer ends up involved in the personal war of two women who compete for a piece of land. Falling in love with the weakest and most honest, he supports her in the fight.

title: The Order
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Charlton Heston, Sofia Milos, Brian Thompson
description: Rudy Cafmeyer is an art thief. Whether he steals treasures from the Angolan jungle or steals the jewels of the Russian mafia in Moscow, Rudy is used to living on a tightrope. He then plays on his grounds when he receives a phone call from his father, a famous archaeologist, who is in big trouble in Israel. Having rushed to Tel Aviv, Rudy finds himself involved in a manhunt. At stake there is not only the safety of the parent, but of the whole world, threatened by a dangerous sect.
notes: Exotic fantasy adventures for Van Damme whose monolithic interpretation does not acquire depth in the "esoteric" context

title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
actors: Paul Walker, Tyrese Gibson, Eva Mendes, Cole Hauser, Ludacris, Michael Ealy, Devon Aoki, Amaury Nolasco
description: Former cop Brian O'Conner agrees to help his old partner Roman Pierce carry a batch of dirty money on behalf of criminal boss Carter Verone, who runs an import-export firm in Florida as a cover business. In reality, in this way, Brian continues his cover work alongside agent Monica Fuentes, who infiltrated the organization to try to dismantle it ...
notes: Singleton is good, but he is wasted on such productions. However, the multiracial aspect of the operation is interesting, given that the three protagonists seem to have been chosen on purpose to involve an ethnically diverse audience.

title: Creature
actors: Craig T. Nelson, Kim Cattrall, Colm Feore, Cress Williams, Michael Reilly
description: After losing his brother, Simon Chase focuses his studies on sharks hoping to find a cure for the disease in their DNA. On a Caribbean island, formerly the site of a military base, a female specimen begins to follow, but when one of the inhabitants is massacred, the community blames her shark ...

title: SpaceCamp
actors: Kate Capshaw, Tate Donovan, Kelly Preston, Lea Thompson, Joaquin Phoenix
description: Andie, a NASA instructor who has never participated in a mission in space, must train four 18-year-olds who participate in a study session sponsored by the space agency. It happens that due to an accident the space shuttle in which they are working takes off.
notes: Amiable mockery of space flights.

title: Top of the World
actors: Peter Weller, Dennis Hopper, Tia Carrere, David Alan Grier
description: A former cop, Ray Mercer, just released from prison after being convicted of stealing $ 40,000 from the coffers of his police district, is called to Las Vegas by his ex-wife. Do you want me not to get into some trouble? In fact, involved in the robbery of a casino, he realizes that the owner of the club and his assistant are in league with the bandits ... Is it time for the former policeman to redeem himself?
notes: Routine action movie, animated by an interesting cast, on which Dennis Hopper stands out as the "dirty" owner of the casino.

title: Blue Crush
actors: Kate Bosworth, Matthew Davis, Michelle Rodriguez, Sanoe Lake, Mika Boorem
description: Anne Marie is a passionate surfer who lives in a beach hut with two friends and her rebellious sister. He is preparing for an important competition: every day he wakes up before dawn and goes out with the board to train. But his balance is tested when he meets Matt, a handsome soccer player ...
notes: The portrait of the "Hawaii of the poor" that revolves around the world of tourists is very banal. The direction instead tries to flex its muscles, and drowns precisely in the sequences that were wanted more spectacular, those of the big waves: all accelerated on the computer, rigged for editing, they are an example of how not to shoot an action sequence.

title: Arrowhead
actors: Charlton Heston, Jack Palance, Katy Jurado, Brian Keith, Milburn Stone
description: Ed Bannon, chief of guides at Fort Clark, Texas, miraculously escapes an ambush by an Apache tribe. Later, the officer is removed because he is considered an obstacle to the "tolerant" policy of the army, which would like to move all the Apaches in the area to a reservation in Florida. When Toriano, son of the tribal chief, returns after attending a school in the east of the country, Bannon becomes increasingly suspicious ...
notes: Very tough Western, with unusual violence for that period. Difficult to see on TV, it deserves to be recovered; Heston and Palance give the best of themselves as two bitter enemies.

title: Cradle 2 the Grave
actors: Kelly Hu, Jet Li, DMX, Anthony Anderson, Tom Arnold, Mark Dacascos, Gabrielle Union
description: Ling, a dangerous criminal, kidnaps Vanessa, the daughter of Tony Fait, a notorious thief. In exchange for his release, a batch of black diamonds is demanded that Fait's gang has just stolen. The man is then forced to ally with the policeman Su to save his little daughter. The couple sets off a devastating race against time, where exploits, fights and chases are beyond imagination.
notes: The director Bartkowiak is less exhibitionist here than in the previous _Romeo must die_ and limits himself to managing everything without trying big things. Jet Li sets the pace a bit; the fight scenes are few and sparse.

title: Scorcher
actors: Mark Dacascos, Rutger Hauer, John Rhys-Davies, Mark Rolston, Tamara Davies, Mark Rolston, Thomas F. Duffy, Sam Lloyd
description: Despite the huge safety measures, the irreparable thing happened in a nuclear power plant, and the accident had apocalyptic consequences: uncontrolled earthquake and volcanic movements devastate Southern California. To prevent the long wave of the frightening phenomenon endanger the entire planet, a very serious decision is made: evacuate and destroy the city of Los Angeles! An authentic "mission impossible", entrusted to a panel of experts led by Ryan Beckett ...
notes: The "fighter" Dacascos (that of _Crying Freeman_) and the repeat offender Hauer in a film so full of clichés that it is even funny.

title: Jumping Ship
actors: Joey Lawrence, Andrew Lawrence, Matthew Lawrence, Susan Walters
description: Michael and his cousin Tommy charter a luxury yacht on which they hope to have an unforgettable vacation. But their dreams of grandeur are shattered when they discover that the boat is a tub. And that's not all. Attacked by modern-day pirates, the two are forced to land on a desert island.

title: Teenage Monster
actors: Anne Gwynne, Gloria Castillo, Stuart Wade, Gil Perkins, Stephen Parker

title: Six Black Horses
actors: Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea, Joan O'Brien, Bob Steele, Roy Barcroft
description: Ben and Frank are hired by the mysterious Kelly to escort her home through Indian territory. Along the way, Kelly offers Ben the entire agreed fee in exchange for the life of Frank, who had previously killed her husband ...
notes: Written by specialist Burt Kennedy, collaborator - among others - of Budd Boetticher.

title: Deadly Swarm
actors: Shane Brolly, Kaarina Aufranc, Pepe Serna, Roger Nevares, Freddy Soto
description: A swarm of killer bees dramatically disrupts life in a quiet town. A journalist and a scholar try to understand what triggered the aggression of the insects ...
notes: The director's only merit was being an assistant in the production of Ron Howard's _Fire killer_.

title: The Westerner
actors: Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Doris Davenport, Fred Stone
description: After the end of the Civil War, legions of pioneers - herders and farmers - pushed further and further west, colonizing vast territories. But the two groups have conflicting interests, and the conflict is often bitter. Self-invested in the authority of "man of the law", herdsman Roy Bean presides over summary trials against cattle thieves, who invariably end up hanged. But even Bean has a weakness (a passion for actress Lily Langtry), and adventurer Cole Hardin will be able to use it to his advantage ...
notes: Wyler for his part tells a story that John Huston will resume in _The man with the seven halters_ (1972).

title: Beneath Loch Ness
actors: Patrick Bergin, Lysette Anthony, Brian Wimmer, Lysa Apostle
description: Taking over from his late colleague Gus Eagen, the American paleontologist Case Howell continues his research on the presence of creatures descended from marine dinosaurs in the waters of Loch Ness, in Scotland. Howell, determined but with an intractable character, often and willingly clashes with the other members of the scientific expedition, already at loggerheads both with the coast guard and with the equally suspicious local population. And when a diver and some fishermen die inexplicably in the lake, the situation worsens ...
notes: Yet another variation - technological but completely inessential - on the eternal riddle of "Nessie".

title: Princess of Thieves
actors: Keira Knightley, Stuart Wilson, Jonathan Hyde, Stephen Moyer
description: Gwyn, daughter of Robin Hood, takes the place of her father in the defense of the weakest when her parent is captured by Giovanni. Philip, son of Riccardo, heir to the throne after his father's death and too frightened to claim his due, has fled to France. Will Gwyn be able to track him down and free his father?

title: Black River
actors: Jay Mohr, Susan Bain, Paul Batten, Patricia Drake, Lisa Edelstein
description: A Hollywood screenwriter, Bo Aikens, arrives in the quaint town of Black River to rediscover lost inspiration. The carefree stay, thanks also to the relationship that Bo has woven with Laura, really seems to start under the best auspices. Too bad Black River hides a terrible secret.
notes: From a story by Dean Koontz.

title: Below
actors: Bruce Greenwood, Olivia Williams, Holt McCallany, Scott Foley, Jason Flemyng
description: The USS Tiger Shark, submarine of the Second World War, after having wandered for a long time in the waters of the Atlantic in search of German submarines, heads home. At the end of the long and tiring mission, the crew is ordered to take on board three survivors of a British hospital ship that has been sunk. Among them there is also a nurse and this worries the crew because, according to the legend, a woman aboard a submarine brings bad luck. And so it happens: the submarine is no longer able to return to the surface and the survival of men is at risk due to the lack of oxygen.
notes: After the excellent _The Arrival_ and _Pitch Black_, Twohy (which debuted with an unrecognized and ugly television fantasy, _Timescape_) is confirmed as a good guarantee for science fiction and horror. On a multi-handed script (including _¼'s Aronofsky - Il theorem delirio_ and horrible _Requiem for a Dream_), _Below_ recharges itself continuously, with an unbeatable rhythm and an intelligent suspense, able to use all the mechanisms of this kind with logic of respect that make it clear that stereotypes, if understood "from the inside" without cinephile articulations, can still make good cinema. The phantom scare will also be derivative, but it works better than in similar, more celebrated products. And the ending doesn't disappoint.

title: Prince Charming
actors: Sean Maguire, Martin Short, Michael Boisvert, Christina Applegate, Billy Connolly, Bernadette Peters
description: An extra-marital escapade of Prince John costs dear both to him and to his usual companion in adventure: the two find themselves transformed into as many frogs, and so they will have to remain for eternity. Unless a girl agrees to first kiss and then marry the unfortunate prince-batrach ...

title: Global Effect
actors: Daniel Bernhardt, Mädchen Amick, Joel West, Arnold Vosloo
description: Africa is devastated by an epidemic that causes thousands of victims every day. The scientific community understands little and the only clue as to a possible antidote has ended up in the hands of a group of terrorists. Who are going to have to pay very dearly for it ...
notes: Little short film with the "mummy" Arnold Vosloo.

title: A Man Apart
actors: Vin Diesel, Larenz Tate, Timothy Olyphant, Jacqueline Obradors, Geno Silva
description: Policeman Sean Vetter and his partner work to stem drug trafficking along the US-Mexico border.
