They manage to arrest the head of the Baja Cartel, who is promptly replaced by a shady character called Diablo. He kidnaps Vetter's wife, who uses all the expedients at his disposal to destroy Diablo. It will stop at nothing, moving dangerously on the border between justice and lawlessness, even if this creates conflicts with the police unit to which it belongs.
notes: The film is completely obvious and no one (producer, director, screenwriters and actors) does anything more or different.

title: Destination Moon
actors: John Archer, Warner Anderson, Tom Powers, Dick Wesson

title: Equilibrium
actors: Christian Bale, Emily Watson, Taye Diggs, Dominic Purcell, Sean Bean, Christian Kahrmann, John Keogh, William Fichtner
description: Peace reigns in Libria. The rules governing the library system are very simple: those who are happy are arrested, those who cry are punishable by justice. Reading a book or contemplating a painting is considered a crime, and if you don't take Pozium - the medicine imposed by the state - on a daily basis, capital punishment is expected. Senior government official John Preston has always believed in these rules, but one day he skips his daily dose of Pozium, discovers a world of incredible sensations and decides it's time to fight for freedom ...
notes: Enjoyable, in spite of the predictability and the copiousness / quotations: book fires and mega-screens as in _Fahrenheit 451_, megacities and backlit interiors as in _Blade Runner_ and above all continuous winks at the Dickian vulgate and at the counter-utopias of films like _Gattaca_ or _Matrix_ (from martial arts to clothing, even to the poster).

title: Robot Monster
actors: George Nader, Claudia Barrett, Selena Royle, John Mylong, Gregory Moffett

title: Sabretooth
actors: David Keith, Vanessa Angel, John Rhys-Davies, Jenna Gering
description: By manipulating the DNA extracted from some fossil finds, the unscrupulous scientists Catherine and Anthony manage to obtain a specimen of prehistoric mammal, one of the most ferocious predators ever to appear in nature: the saber-toothed tiger. More than academic recognition, the two aspire to the predictable high earnings associated with the discovery. Despite all the precautions, however, the irreparable happens: an accident during transport to a laboratory located in the mountains allows the frightening feline to escape and to mortally assault a group of hikers ...
notes: Originality below the guard level.

title: Inferno
actors: Jeff Fahey, Janet Gunn, Richard Danielson, Greta Danielle Newgren
description: Due to a phenomenon due to solar combustion, a heat cap of volcanic origin has invaded the earth's atmosphere. While the last hour is about to strike for the planet, survival becomes the one and only priority: the stories of a teacher, a surgeon, a couple of lovers intertwine ...

title: The Darkling
actors: Aidan Gillen, Nina Siemaszko, Lisa Linde, F. Murray Abraham
description: The life of Jeff, a passionate motor chef, and his family runs smoothly until the day he, his wife and daughter meet Bruno Rubin. Everyone in town thinks that the very rich man has relations with dark forces. Jeff doesn't take these rumors seriously at first, but he'll have to change his mind.

title: Deep Core
actors: Harty Van Gorkum, Craig Sheffer, Wil Wheaton, James Russo
description: Industrialist Alan finances research to develop a machine that is capable of penetrating all types of terrain. Brian, the inventor of the vehicle, realizing its danger destroys it. A few years later Alan tries again, but will be forced to agree with Brian.
notes: Silly science fiction story.

title: Destry Rides Again
actors: Marlene Dietrich, James Stewart, Mischa Auer, Charles Winninger
description: When the cheater Kent kills the "man of the law", the mayor - who is tangled up with him - assigns the star to the drunkard Dimsdale, thinking he can handle him: but the new sheriff hires the meek and unarmed Tom Destry jr as deputy. . Although a pacifist, Destry will be able to restore order to the town.
notes: Based on a novel by Max Brand, the film is a pleasant _western comedy_ that manages to balance the witty and funny part with the more melodramatic moments. A cast of stars enriches the film: James Stewart outstanding in the role of Tom Destry and, for the first time in a western, the shining Marlene in the role of singer Frenchy. Excellent Winninger as a drunken sheriff.

title: The Arrival
actors: Charlie Sheen, Lindsay Crouse, Teri Polo, Phyllis Applegate
description: After receiving a signal from space via radio, an astronomer contacts the sender. The scientist - who has joined the Seti, a program that scours the universe in search of alien presences - is working with a meteorologist. But, one day, the two seem to pick up other traces ...

title: Pulse
actors: Joey Lawrence, Cliff De Young, Roxanne Hart, Matthew Lawrence
description: A wave of electricity that seems to have its own intelligence moves from house to house through the cables of the electricity grid, sowing destruction, terror and death: David an eleven-year-old boy and his father are also victims, trapped without apparent path exit ...
notes: The starting idea is discreet and the special effects are good: in the long run, however, everything falls apart miserably despite the director having collaborated with George Lucas (he co-directed the short film _Herbie_, 1966 and edited the documentary _The Emperor_, 1967 by Lucas himself).

title: Final Destination 2
actors: A.J. Cook, Ali Larter, Michael Landes, Jonathan Cherry, Sarah Carter
description: Clear Rivers, the sole survivor of the flight 180 accident, lives locked up, of her own free will, within the walls of a psychiatric hospital. She is terrified of Death coming to claim her, as she did with all her friends, and perhaps she is right. Meanwhile, Kimberly Corman, intent on spending a weekend out of town, helplessly witnesses a terrible accident, but it could be just a vision or a warning ...
notes: _Final Destination 2_ is far better than the previous one. More serious (which does not mean without irony), more fun, more gory. Unstoppable, it has been a long time since we witnessed a product of a major that sank its feet in the splatter with such impetuousness: the murders spray blood like fountains, the bodies of the victims are tortured, blasted, sliced ??with a taste that fans will like as a manna. But it's neither gloomy nor leaden, rather it's like a cartoon.

title: Bulletproof Monk
actors: Chow Yun-fat, Seann William Scott, Jaime King, Karel Roden, Victoria Smurfit
description: For sixty years a mysterious unnamed monk has wandered the world to protect a precious manuscript, but now it's time to find a replacement who can continue his mission ...
notes: Inspired by a comic from the Flypaper Press of the late 90s, modified with an infinite number of quotes, seductions and contaminations that have made it a potentially reproducible hybrid. The attempt to create something new was only partially successful, suffocated by an excessive amount of ingredients that sometimes do not bind together; and the stupid smile exhibited by Chow Yun-fat does not help either, who likens him to the worst Jackie Chan.

title: The Viking Sagas
actors: Ralf Moeller, Ingibjörg Stefánsdóttir, Sven-Ole Thorsen, Thorir Waagfjörd, Hinrik Olafson
description: To stop the family feuds that were tearing them apart, the Vikings move from Norway to Iceland, where, however, the rivalry between Kjartan and the usurper Ketil breaks out. The first will have to face his deadly enemy, aided by the old warrior Gunnar, in defense of his land and to avenge the death of his father.
notes: Rude and brutal reinterpretation of the Nordic sagas, directed by the prestigious director of photography, former collaborator, among others, of Martin Scorsese. In the film, the contrast is posed between a fighter with morality and bloodthirsty warriors without any scruple, all seasoned therefore with inserts of gratuitous violence with a strong graphic impact.

title: Out for a Kill
actors: Steven Seagal, Michelle Goh, Corey Johnson, Kata Dobó, Kevin Dunn
description: Archaeologist Robert Burns is sent to China to direct major excavations. Here he finds himself involved, in spite of himself, in a grandiose drug trade. The Chinese mafia in fact uses the finds to hide huge quantities of drugs and thus cross the border without arousing suspicion. Burns tries to report the trafficking, but his assistant is killed and he is charged with the murder. When Robert kills his wife, the situation becomes terribly complicated.
notes: Time also passes for Steven Seagal who in the action scenes has been replaced by a double. For the rest, nothing new under the sun.

title: They
actors: Laura Regan, Marc Blucas, Ethan Embry, Dagmara Dominczyk, Jon Abrahams
description: After witnessing a terrifying event as a child, Julia Land, a graduate in psychology, returns to be tormented by nightmares as around her the people who have lived the same experience mysteriously begin to disappear. Julia has to face the return of the monsters alone because neither her boyfriend nor her psychologist's help can help her.
notes: The film has the flaws of the target it is aimed at: sweetened, phoned, and with monsters that lack charm and mythical power, even if sometimes it jumps in the chair. The best part, however, is the last quarter of an hour, with an unexpected ending and ready-to-go sequel, and a long urban nightmare sequence: getting trapped in the subway after closing time. An example of how US cinema continues to anticipate small and large catastrophes (here, it is the New York blackout), almost on the edge of jinx.

title: Star Wars
actors: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher, Peter Cushing, Alec Guinness
description: The despotic Lord Darth Vader has waged war on a galactic empire. Princess Leia Organa, representative of the rebels, is his prisoner but she has managed to steal the plans of the Death Star, Lord Vader's space base that can disintegrate an entire planet. Elder General Obi-Wan Kenobi and young Luke Skywalker free Princess Leia and then lead the attack on the Death Star.
notes: An adventure that skillfully mixes the flavors of the western, myths of chivalry and horror. Great means, a lot of imagination and technological prodigies for a realization that has left a mark in American cinema, reworking myths and fantasies from the inside, and paving the way for the cinema of the following decades, Oscar for the soundtrack (very famous, by John Williams) , the scenography, the costumes, the editing, the sound and of course the special effects. Followed by _The Empire Strikes Again_ (1980) and _The Return of the Jedi_ (1983), produced by Lucas and directed by Irvin Kershner and Richard Marquand respectively. In 1999 "Star Wars - The Phantom Menace" finally arrived, the first episode of a trilogy that tells the preamble of the 1977 film. _Una new hope_ is the remastered and restored version of _Star Wars_, released twenty years later together with two successive episodes. Great success with the public but also some criticism from fans, who in the few minutes added did not like the "softening" of Lucas.

title: The Jayhawkers!
actors: Jeff Chandler, Nicole Maurey, Henry Silva, Fess Parker, Herbert Rudley
description: Civil War. The escaped Cam driven by the desire for revenge (the Northerners killed his wife), accepts the task of hunting down an outlaw responsible for the murder. But Cam, oblivious to his intentions, joins his gang that intends to take over Kansas.
notes: Interesting western.

title: The Jack Bull
actors: L. Q. Jones, John Cusack, John Goodman, John Savage, Miranda Otto
description: Myril, a horse breeder tired of the harassment of the owner of a nearby ranch, asks the law to do justice by condemning the violence. It will not be successful and will therefore choose to close the account personally.
notes: Beautiful film for television produced by Hbo: screenwriter Dick Cusack (John's father) and director John Badham overturn the myth of the western, presenting us a gray world (also in photography), with a fragile and just hero, but called to accountable for all his actions. A western of this level hadn't been seen for some time, even in theaters.

title: Cabin Fever
actors: Jordan Ladd, Rider Strong, James DeBello, Cerina Vincent, Joey Kern
description: Five friends go on vacation together in a remote mountain cabin. One of them contracts a mysterious disease that literally devours him: the others soon get sick too, and little by little the true personality of each one emerges ...
notes: If the first part passes without almost anything happening, in the midst of a sea of ??often silly chatter, the second is an orgy of flowing blood and of flesh that is undone, politically incorrect, between infections, viruses and nudity. It may seem strange, but despite being an anarchy that has already had the opportunity to express itself thirty years earlier, it has not lost an ounce of its explosive capacity. And luckily, Roth also knows that a little irony never hurts. The look of the executive producer David Lynch (who has a person of "his" staff among the credits: Angelo Badalamenti to the music) is very explicit: for example in the disturbing figure on the veranda and in the character of the policeman, treated as if they were splinters from his works . Cinema that does not pretend to say anything about contemporaneity: only a "product", but of a good category.

title: Empire Strike Back
actors: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
description: Despite the destruction of the planet of the Death Star, the imperial troops have taken over Yavin again. The rebels have taken refuge on the ice planet, but are still forced to flee. Han Solo leaves the pursuers, while Luke travels to the planet of Dogabah to find the "Force". In an attempt to free Leila and friends, she later meets Darth Vader, who turns out to be her father.
notes: Re-edition for the twentieth anniversary of the trilogy: digitally remastered audio and video but very few unreleased sequences that do not touch the narrative development but improve the special effects of the time.

title: Return of Jedi
actors: Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher, Billy Dee Williams
description: Luke Skywalker and Ian Solo are preparing for the final battle against the Empire but Luke has learned that the terrible Darth Vader, the greatest enemy of the rioters, is in fact his father. The insurrection is unsuccessful and Luke is captured by the emperor's troops, who tries to bring the young man to his side.
notes: Third (or rather sixth) and last episode of the saga conceived by George Lucas. For the twentieth anniversary, the entire trilogy has been restored and digitally remastered with the addition of unreleased sequences. In this case, a fun ballet in the palace of Jabba the Hut, new images of the "creature" of the sand and a finale full of scenes of the celebrations for the victory over the Empire.

title: Armstrong
actors: Frank Zagarino, Kimberley Kates, Charles Napier, Joe Lara, Justin Carroll
description: On vacation in Moscow with his friend Bob and his wife Susan, the former "Navy Seal" Rod Armstrong discovers that the two work for the American secret services and that they are in the Russian capital to clear up a trafficking in stolen atomic weapons , intended for terrorist groups. And when Bob is killed ...
notes: Any comment would be superfluous.

title: Cutaway
actors: Stephen Baldwin, Tom Berenger, Dennis Rodman, Maxine Bahns
description: Victor, an elite police officer, carries out undercover missions to bring drug traffickers to justice. The precious merchandise arrives in Florida from the Bahamas thanks to a gang of "sky surfers". They parachute down on Miami carrying illegal substances. Victor infiltrates them.

title: The Virginian
actors: Bill Pullman, Diane Lane, John Savage, Colm Feore, Harris Yulin
description: A mysterious man known by the nickname "The Virginian" meets the teacher Molly, falls in love and plans a future life with her. The man looking for a job finds him at the Shiloh ranch where bullying reigns. His sense of justice will lead him to clash with unscrupulous individuals.

title: Ticker
actors: Steven Seagal, Dennis Hopper, Tom Sizemore, Jaime Pressly
description: San Francisco: Detective Ray Nettles and his partner Art "Fuzzy" Rice have to contend with the dangerous terror gang led by Swan. After the arrest of the beautiful scientist Claire Manning, who is part of the gang, Swan demands her release and to obtain him threatens to the bitter end bomb attacks throughout the city. Nettles therefore turns to Frank Glass, expert in explosives ...
notes: Legitimately in the running for the coveted title of worst director in the world, Hawaiian Pyun earns points in the standings thanks to this literally unwatchable film, with Seagal surpassing himself in terms of woodiness and inexpressiveness.

title: The Rats
actors: Mädchen Amick, Vincent Spano, Shawn Michael Howard, Daveigh Chase
description: New York: Some people are hospitalized with a severe infection after being attacked and bitten by rats. Susan Costello, the manager of a department store in which one of these cases has occurred, requests the intervention of the expert rodent Jack Carver: in the meantime, however, the invasion is expanding out of all proportion ...

title: The Mummy's Hand
actors: Dick Foran, Peggy Moran, Wallace Ford, Eduardo Cianelli

title: The Mummy's Tomb
actors: Lon Chaney jr., Dick Foran, John Hubbard, Elyse Knox, George Zucco

title: Purgatory
actors: Eric Roberts, Sam Shepard, Randy Quaid, Peter Stormare, Brad Rowe
description: A gang of thugs, led by Jack Britton, known as Blackjack, invades the isolated and mysterious town of Refuge, where it receives a peaceful welcome. But who are the apparently placid and peaceful inhabitants of the village, and what is their mission? Britton and his family soon discover that Refuge is the door to purgatory ...
notes: It's been a long time since Uli Edel made his big screen debut with _Christiana F. - We the boys of the Berlin zoo_. Looking at this paranormal western it seems that time has done more damage to the director than anything else. Screenplay by Gordon T. Dawson (_I want Garcia's head_).

title: Freddy vs. Jason
actors: Robert Englund, Ken Kirzinger, Monica Keena, Jason Ritter, Kelly Rowland
description: Waking up in hell, Jason is enraged to discover that his precious mask has been stolen by none other than Freddy Krueger. Who, in order to return to the world of the living from which he was definitively expelled, tries to enter Jason's dreams, with the intent of exterminating the descendants of the inhabitants of Elm Street. But Jason disagrees ...
notes: Very influenced by comics (as well as full of quotes, from Hitchcock to Cronenberg to Disney), Yu's film holds up well - narratively and visually - when it moves in the dreamlike universe, where a sadistic-surreal imprint reigns like Clive Barker. The adolescent parts are more banal and now depleted.

title: Bad Boys II
actors: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Jordi Mollà, Gabrielle Union, Peter Stormare, Joe Pantoliano
description: Miami narcotics team detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett are on a task force to stem the spread of ecstasy in the city. Unintentionally, they discover a grandiose conspiracy involving a ruthless drug lord, willing to kill anyone who intrudes on his plans to control all drug trafficking. To complicate the situation comes Syd, Marcus's sister and undercover agent of the drug team.
notes: In other times, it would have been a harmless C-series short film, ironic and quick. With producer Bruckheimer's estrogen, it becomes a kind of bewildering blockbuster, inexplicably lasting two and a half hours and piling up chases with thirty crashed cars or slow motion scenes of a bullet piercing Martin Lawrence's buttock.

title: Leprechaun 2
actors: Warwick Davis, Charlie Heath, Shevonne Durkin, Adam Biesk
description: After a thousand years, an evil creature called Leprechaun decides to take a wife, but without success. A millennium later he tries again, kills people left and right and kidnaps young Bridget: Cody, the girl's boyfriend, intervenes, but killing a Leprechaun is a difficult task ...
notes: A film that, more than fear, inspires compassion.

title: Con Express
actors: Sean Patrick Flanery, Arnold Vosloo, Ursula Karven, Eyal Podell, David Lea
description: Brooks, a secret agent of counter-terrorism, receives a tip that reveals the arrival by sea of ??a shipment of chemical weapons. Investigating, he discovers that Simeonov, a well-known Russian terrorist, is behind this clandestine operation. Brooks assembles a team and travels with them to the port area to avert the danger. Following a terrible firefight, the criminal is arrested. However, during the move to Washington, he manages to escape and, together with other terrorists, organizes a new, terrible attack ...
notes: A television film devoid of ideas, based simply on a series of firefights as an end in itself. Not at all engaging.

title: Habit
actors: Larry Fessenden, Meredith Snaider, Aaron Beall, Patricia Coleman

title: Sabrina, Down Under
actors: Melissa Joan Hart, Scott Michaelson, Tara Charendoff, Rachel Anderson, Lindsay Sloane
description: The witch Sabrina has landed with her friend Gwen in Australia to study marine biology and local "fauna". Committed to saving the last sirens from extinction, the girl meets a handsome newt, Barnaby, who has fallen ill due to pollution. Sabrina tries to save him and his sister the mermaid Fin.

title: Cat Ballou
actors: Nat King Cole, Jane Fonda, Lee Marvin, Michael Callan, Stubby Kaye
description: Returning to her native village of Wolf City, Wyoming, after graduating from school, Catherine "Cat" Ballou discovers that her father Frankie is in the crosshairs of a company that wants to take over her land. And when Frankie leaves his skin at the hands of Tim Strawn, a ruthless artificial-nosed killer, Cat reunites a messed-up gang and sets out to seek revenge ...
notes: A very dated western parody kept afloat by the glamor of La Fonda and the verve of Marvin, here in an unusual double role awarded with an Oscar. Curious but no more the singing curtains by Nat "King" Cole and Stubby Kaye, who comment on the story like a Greek choir.

title: The Villain
actors: Kirk Douglas, Ann-Margret, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Paul Lynde

title: Leprechaun 3
actors: Warwick Davis, John Gatins, Lee Armstrong, Caroline Williams
description: Transformed into a statuette but accidentally "awakened" by the careless (and unfortunate) owner of a pawnshop in Las Vegas, the evil Leprechaun tries to recover at any cost a magical gold coin that ended up in the hands of the unsuspecting student Scott .. .
notes: The saga of the hideous and greedy creature continues, but the level remains low.

title: S.W.A.T
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Colin Farrell, Jeremy Renner, Michelle Rodriguez, LL Cool J, Josh Charles
description: Agents Jim and Brian are kicked out of the S.W.A.T., special unit to which they belong, due to a decision made during a hostage robbery. As Brian quits his job, Jim agrees to be demoted, hoping to one day redeem himself. The opportunity arises when the squad commander is tasked with training five agents for a new S.W.A.T. The group goes into action to arrest a French drug kingpin.
notes: Inspired by the well-known TV series of the 70s, the film required the actors a preparatory training similar to that of their characters.

title: Crash Point Zero
actors: Treat Williams, Julie St. Claire, Susan Blakely, Sean Kanan, John Beck
description: Maurice Hunter and his daughter Nadia discover in Siberia, a legendary death ray invented by Nicola Tesla (sic). They try to return to America to deliver it to the CIA but the plane is hijacked and a struggle for survival begins.
notes: Fearsome collage of scraps of other films on the snow.

title: Tears of the Sun
actors: Bruce Willis, Monica Bellucci, Cole Hauser, Eamonn Walker, Johnny Messner
description: A.K. Waters, commander of a US Navy special team, is sent on a mission to the Nigerian jungle to rescue Dr. Lena Kendricks. The woman is willing to leave the country only on condition that the seventy refugees who are with her are also taken away.
notes: We are not spared any predicted and predictable stereotype, from the sunsets to the musicone (by Hans Zimmer and to think we once esteemed him), from the key sequences (the massacre in the village) to the villains. The American actor only acts with the folds of his eyes and mouth (and that's not a compliment).

title: The Shooting
actors: Will Hutchins, Millie Perkins, Jack Nicholson, Warren Oates, Charles Eastman
description: An enigmatic and mysterious woman pays two men to guide her in the desert. In reality, his aim is to kill the brother of one of his guides. To do so, he also hires a killer and the small group will move towards a hallucinated and unusual ending.
notes: A low-cost western that hides a psychological drama structure behind the coordinates of the genre, and that is tinged with unexpected tragic shades. It went unnoticed at the time of its release and was slowly rediscovered and re-evaluated. The ending is still unsettling today. A young Jack Nicholson in the role of the killer.

title: The Undead
actors: Pamela Duncan, Richard Garland, Allison Hayes, Mel Welles

title: Teenage Cave Man
actors: Robert Vaughn, Leslie E. Bradley, Frank de Kova, Marshall Bradford

title: Clockstoppers
actors: Jesse Bradford, Paula Garcés, Robin Thomas, French Stewart, Billy Mayo
description: Zak is a teenager like many others, who wants to buy a car and conquer Francesca, the beautiful schoolmate. His life changes when, together with the girl, he finds a clock able to stop time among the old objects of his inventor father. Initially the two have fun with the wonderful trinket, but soon find themselves having to escape from a shady figure intent on using the clock to ... dominate the world.
notes: Adventure for teenagers of the most obvious. The direction of Frakes, coming from _Star Trek: Next Generation_ (played William Ryker) and not very convincing even in that venue is not an added value.

title: Sea Devils
actors: Yvonne De Carlo, Rock Hudson, Maxwell Reed, Denis O'Dea
description: The war between Spain and England is raging: we are in 1800 and in the English Channel (the strait) the fishermen of the small island of Guernesey, the sparrow hawks, take advantage of the hostilities between the two countries to prosper with the smuggling of cognac. One of the smugglers saves a beautiful English spy from French captivity in charge of stealing information on the movements of the Napoleonic troops and falls in love with her.
notes: Loosely inspired by Victor Hugo's The Workers of the Sea, the film mixes adventure and melodrama with good results.

title: Alien
actors: Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt, Harry Dean Stanton, Veronica Cartwright
description: Following the imprudent exploration of an abandoned spaceship, a monstrous being is introduced aboard the space freighter Nostromo who wreaks havoc on the crew. Of the seven people that make it up, at the end only Ripley and her cat remain: she will throw the creature back into the void of space and return safely to Earth. _Alien_ in the restored and digitally remastered version, with unpublished scenes and some scenes from the first version "filed" with imperceptible cuts, it is confirmed, a very remarkable film. Of the added images (a fight between Lambert and Ripley, a shot of the Alien hanging from chains before an attack), the most notable is Ripley's discovery of the "nest" with the remains of Brett and Dallas.

title: Hollywood Homicide
actors: Harrison Ford, Josh Hartnett, Lena Olin, Bruce Greenwood, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Landau
description: Joe Gavilan and Kasey Calden, two detectives from the Los Angeles homicide squad, are investigating the murder of members of an up-and-coming rap group during a concert. In all likelihood, the instigator of the massacre is Sartain, a well-known producer of hip hop music, already suspected in the past of the murder of some artists who had tried to dissolve the contract with his record label ...
notes: Shelton, already a specialist in the sports sub-genre, directs something that looks like an "action movie", a film about a heterogeneous couple of detectives, a comedy, a tribute to the world of entertainment. In the end, however, it is just a flan.

title: Durango Kids
actors: Taylor Root, Austin Nichols, Brendon Ryan Barrett, Curtis Williams, Caitlin Lara Barrett
description: Spencer, a young boy with a passion for the West, convinces some of his friends that there is a hidden treasure in an old mine near a thriving town at the time of the gold rush. At the end of the school year, instead of leaving for the holidays, Spencer and his friends secretly organize the expedition.

title: The Shu
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Michael Bailey Smith, Marnie Alton
description: Kyle LeBlanc is an American who works in Russia, his wife is killed but the murderer is acquitted for lack of evidence. Kyle then becomes executioner and ends up in jail for his revenge. For Le Blanc it is a new hell: the warder manager organizes bets on fighting to the death between inmates.
notes: Last American effort by Ringo Lam, cult director of the Hong Kong new wave known above all for _City on Fire_ model of _Le Iene_. Here he directs Van Damme and does his best to create a harsh atmosphere and a dark "prison movie", too bad the script doesn't care about other characters besides the protagonist and you run into several clichés.

title: American Outlaws
actors: Colin Farrell, Scott Caan, Ali Larter, Gabriel Macht, Gregory Smith
description: Plundered by a corrupt Missouri railroad tycoon, some rancheros join forces and begin robbing banks to get back what is rightfully theirs. Leading the group's revenge is a farmer from the Civil War, a young man destined to become a true legend of the West: Jesse James ...
notes: Yet another and tired reinterpretation of one of the myths of the Frontier, which claims to update the western by purifying it of its intrinsic violence and sprinkling it with do-gooders and claims in a "no global" style. The result is flat and televised, and the heroic bandit looks like a reassuring teen idol.

title: Nico the Unicorn
actors: Kevin Zegers, Anne Archer, Larry Day, Michael Ontkean
description: Billy Hastings, a child unable to relate to the surrounding world, invents a magical dimension within which to escape. In this fantastic land, the little protagonist meets a unicorn, which gives him back the joy of living. Fairy tale taken from a children's book.

title: The Dentist
actors: Corbin Bernsen, Linda Hoffman, Michael Stadvec, Ken Foree
description: Allan is a dentist with a seemingly perfect life: an established profession, a beautiful wife and no worries. But when he finds out that the woman is cheating on him, his revenge will be terrible ...
notes: Stereotypical characters and non-existent suspense where real torture is inflicted on the eyes of the spectators.

title: Street Trash
actors: Mike Lackey, Bill Chepil, Marc Sferrazza, Jane Arakawa, Nicole Potter
description: A liquor shopkeeper sells a liquor called "viper" to the homeless people in the neighborhood. It is actually a toxic liquid that dissolves the organs of the unfortunate.

title: Carrie
actors: Angela Bettis, Patricia Clarkson, Rena Sofer, Kandyse McClure
description: The very shy student Carrie White is mercilessly targeted by the jokes - often quite cruel - of her classmates. Who, however, are unaware that Carrie is endowed with extraordinary telekinetic faculties, thanks to which she is able to move bodies of any size with the power of thought alone. During the prom, two rather unpleasant young people organize a particularly hateful joke against the girl: this unleashes her anger, and the episode turns into tragedy ...
notes: The character born from the pen of Stephen King and already brought to the screen in 1976 by Brian De Palma returns. Despite the television origin, the product is not to be thrown away.

title: Killjoy
actors: Angel Vargas, Dee Dee Austin, Arthur Burghardt, Jamal Grimes

title: Mutiny
actors: Mark Stevens, Angela Lansbury, Patric Knowles, Gene Evans
description: 1812: James Marshall, captain of the Yankee ship Concord, must beware of rebel officer Ben Waldridge, apparently passed to the British. In reality, however, Waldridge's real target is the cargo of gold stowed in the Concord ...
notes: Having re-emerged from the ordeal of the "black lists", Dmytryk conducts with skill but without particular jolts.

title: Hellraiser: Inferno
actors: Craig Sheffer, Nicholas Turturro, James Remar, Doug Bradley
description: Thorne is a great cop but he has a drug problem. When assigned the murder case of a disfigured former partner of his, Thorne becomes obsessed with a small cubic box found at the crime scene. After a night spent with a prostitute, the policeman opens the cube: events begin to take a bad turn.
notes: Fifth sequel in the slasher series _Hellraiser_ directly to the video. Director Derrickson prefers to abandon the more exaggerated splatter, the trademark of the previous chapters, in favor of greater psychological introspection. Some thrills fade away. For the fifth time the terrible Pinhead is played by Doug Bradley.

title: Paycheck
actors: Ben Affleck, Aaron Eckhart, Uma Thurman, Paul Giamatti, Joe Morton, Peter Friedman
description: Internationally renowned genius who develops top secret projects for companies, at the end of each assignment Michael Jennings undergoes a memory wipe so that he cannot divulge professional secrets. When he realizes that his own employers are hunting him to kill him, unable to defend himself as he does not remember his past, Michael relies on scientist Rachel, the woman he has worked with and has loved for the past three years. ...
notes: It seems that Woo wants to enjoy the California sun, making use of years of honorable career: glimpses of the style for which he was rightly famous burst here and there in a landscape dominated by Ben Affleck's inexpressiveness. Everything flows quite monotonous and predictable: perhaps the first to regret it will be Philip K. Dick, to whom we owe the original novel, who had been able to foresee the future but did not live long enough to witness the fulfillment of his own prophecies.

title: Earth vs. the Spider
actors: Dan Aykroyd, Devon Gummersall, Amelia Heinle, Theresa Russell
description: Quentin, a shy avid comic reader, is experimentally injected with a serum that is supposed to transfer some spider skills to humans. The boy acquires extraordinary strength, which allows him to fight criminals and to live out his superhero dreams. However, the serum has engendered a progressive mutation and the strength grows until it becomes uncontrollable. The transformation also causes ever-increasing pain and hunger and drives Quentin crazy, and he develops spider legs and glands to emit venom and cobwebs. Inspector Jack Grillo will try to stop the creature, now out of control ...

title: Diary of a Madman
actors: Vincent Price, Nancy Kovack, Chris Warfield, Elaine Devry, Ian Wolfe

title: Terror House
actors: Linda Gillen, Arthur Space, John Neilson, Mary Jackson, Michael Macready
description: Regina is a college student who discovers she has won a vacation at the Red Wolf Inn. Even before communicating the good news to her parents, the owners of the inn send a means of transport to get her to the place, where she is in the company of two young women and an elderly couple. The hotel is magnificent but one of the guests disappears without a trace.

title: Masterminds
actors: Vincent Kartheiser, Katie Stuart, Patrick Stewart, Brenda Fricker
description: Ozzie, sixteen, is a computer genius. Expelled from school for his stunts (virtual and otherwise), he returns secretly to send the internal network into a tailspin. While in the building, however, the institute's security expert, hired to block Ozzy's cyber offensives, reveals his true intentions: to kidnap 10 students and ask for a millionaire ransom.
notes: Embarrassing staging by the director of _Battaglia per la Terra_, which, among other things, is out of time (this kind of film was a classic of the 80s). It's just a pity that the good Patrick Stewart also ended up in the trap.

title: Derailed
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Tomas Arana, Laura Harring, Susan Gibney
description: Jacques Kristoff, a special agent of the US government, is assigned to protect the Russian biologist Galina Konstantin. When some terrorists, determined to kidnap the scientist, seize the train on which the two are traveling, Kristoff will have to do his best to put the bad guys in a position to do no harm, before they can get their hands on the high-tech biological weapons that Galina brings with her ...
notes: To the delight of his fans, the strong Belgian granite does not deviate an inch from its everlasting cliché. Others can console themselves with the Lynchian Harring (_Mulholland Drive_).

title: These Thousands Hill
actors: Don Murray, Lee Remick, Patricia Owens, Richard Egan, Stuart Whitman
description: The wolf hunter Lat Evans wants to become the owner of a farm: thanks to the savings of the prostitute Callie, who has fallen in love with him, he manages to make his dream come true. After a few years, Lat - who became a senator - forgets about Callie and marries Joyce, only to repent ...
notes: From a novel by Alfred B. Guthrie jr. (who is writing with Alfred Hayes), Fleischer draws a western full of interesting ideas, even if the director of _The hyenas of Chicago_ and _Viaggio hallucinante_ has certainly done better. Discreet the protagonist Murray, splendid Remick (not yet twenty-four at the time) in the role of Callie.

title: The Dunwich Horror
actors: Sandra Dee, Sam Jaffe, Dean Stockwell, Donna Baccala, Ed Begley, Joanne Moore Jordan, Talia Shire, Michael Fox, Jason Wingreen
description: Wilbur Whateley (Dean Stockwell) goes to Miskatonic Univerisity to be able to borrow and consult the original edition of the Necronomicon, the famous black magic text. Here he meets Nancy (Sandre Dee), an attractive young student, who ends up falling into the clutches of man, whose intentions and true nature are somewhat suspect.

title: Taza, Son of Cochise
actors: Rock Hudson, Barbara Rush, Gregg Palmer, Bart Roberts, Jeff Chandler

title: Run for the Money
actors: Christian Slater, Val Kilmer, Sara Downing, Vincent Laresca
description: Former inmate Thomas Taylor, who has found a new dimension by becoming a paramedic, can't resist the temptation to land a million-dollar robbery. When Thomas and his accomplice strike, they realize that the money is stamped with indelible ink. Things get complicated when Mark Cornell, an FBI agent with a passion for opera, gets on their trail ...
notes: Antonijevic moves away from the good performance of _Savior_ and directs an "action" that borders on the ridiculous. Embarrassing dialogues and too banal script.

title: Devil Winds
actors: Joe Lando, Nicole Eggert, Peter Graham-Gaudreau, Erica Parker
description: Pete Jensen is a brilliant and ambitious meteorologist, specializing in the study of natural catastrophic phenomena. Until one of these destroys his life: a gigantic tornado hits his house and, while his daughter is saved by a miracle, his wife is killed. Shaken by the tragedy, Jensen walks away and throws himself headlong into work neglecting the child. Years later he finally returns to his small town in Oklahoma where he meets his friend and colleague Brooker. A new storm of frightening proportions is about to hit the area: for them and the enterprising reporter Julia Merrow a fight against time begins to try to save the inhabitants from imminent danger.

title: Jeeper Creepers 2
actors: Ray Wise, Jonathan Breck, Garikayi Mutambirwa, Eric Nenninger, Marieh Delfino
description: Returning from a league game, a bus full of basketball players, cheerleaders and coaches is attacked by The Creeper. It is a winged beast that appears every 23 years to feed non-stop human beings for 23 days in order to regenerate. When night falls, the terrified group of young athletes must contend with their fears and prejudices and join in a hopeless fight against the horrible creature.
notes: Salva, after the first chapter, increases homoerotic ardor and pushes relational tensions on the pedal. The result is a troubled picture of a country, which has not yet managed to eliminate racist waste and gender disturbances.

title: The Rundown
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Seann William Scott, Rosario Dawson, Christopher Walken, Ewen Bremner, Jon Gries
description: A man instructs Beck, a guy accustomed to recovering what is asked of him by any means, to bring home his son Travis, who has long since gone on a trip to Brazil. However, the mission turns out to be more difficult than expected, not only because the boy has no intention of returning, but also because there are a couple of complications: Mariana, a young local who knows the mysteries of the jungle, and Hatcher, a tyrant. madman who uses the jungle and its inhabitants to make his fortune ... Without making any claims, the film succeeds in its intent of mixing action and comedy in a funny collage with engaging stunt sequences.

title: Open Range
actors: Robert Duvall, Kevin Costner, Annette Bening, Michael Gambon, Michael Jeter, Diego Luna
description: Charley Waite, Boss Spearman, "Button" and Mose Harrison are on the run from their past: the only place where they feel truly free is the boundless plains of the West, where nature dictates the law. Champions of just causes, the four cowboys try to avoid violence: but a frontier town ruled by fear and tyranny will change their lives and force them into action ...
notes: A film that delights in its slowness, its pauses on the details of the scenes and the script, the rain that wets the prairies, the hats, the men and the herds, the mud that sticks to the boots and soils the deeds of a people with a short history. A people who at the cinema do not have the memory to sing chivalrous deeds or to write epic poems and which looks up, towards the great sky, or in front of itself towards unexplored borders. The West of Costner is inhabited by wolves, by Indians, by the last cowboys (who can also be ruthless). A land where no man can tell another man what to do: Ford and Mann, Boetticher and Hawks have explained it well.

title: Federal Protection
actors: Armand Assante, Angela Featherstone, Dina Meyer, David Lipper
description: Frankie Carbone, a thug serving a Chicago Cosa Nostra boss, is pinched by the feds and agrees to testify against his boss. From that moment his life changes radically: the FBI gives him a new identity, from now on he will be called Howard Akers, and finds him an apartment in a residential area. The man befriends Leigh, his neighbor. She is married to Denny who cheats on her with Bootsie, Leigh's sister. The story gets complicated when Bootsie and Denny, having learned of Howard's true identity, will try to collect the bounty that the mafia boss has placed on his head.

title: In the Shadows
actors: Matthew Modine, James Caan, Joey Lauren Adams, Lillo Brancato jr., Cuba Gooding jr.
description: A stuntman is accidentally killed on a film set. His uncle, a criminal from New York, sends the infallible hitman Eric O’Byrne to eliminate the stunt coordinator, Lance, who is considered to be responsible for the death. But Eric is fascinated by the adrenaline-pumping world of stunt performers and becomes part of it; in addition, he ends up falling in love with Clarissa, the daughter of the man she has to kill. The situation is further complicated when he discovers that the dead man had hidden a drug consignment, on whose trail some criminals have set out ...
notes: The cast is definitely of a good standard: much less the final result of this "action" set in the universe of stuntmen.

title: The Foreigner
actors: Steven Seagal, Max Ryan, Harry Van Gorkum, Jeffrey Pierce
description: Contacted by a mysterious interlocutor, former government agent Jonathan Cold agrees to transport a package whose contents remain top secret from France to Germany. However, it must be something very important, since all hell breaks loose to get hold of it: political corruption, betrayals, bloody deaths. Broken from all experiences, Cold knows perfectly well that the only way to save his skin is to stay out of the game: but it won't be easy ...
notes: The usual, unchanging film with Seagal. Also in 2003, director Oblowitz directed the rocky actor (?) In the equally mediocre _The Avenger_.

title: Pinocchio's Revenge
actors: Rosalind Allen, Candace McKenzie, Brittany Alyse Smith, Lewis Van Bergen, Todd Allen
description: Lawyer Jennifer must defend a child serial killer who was caught hiding a victim's body. Along with the body was found a puppet with the features of Pinocchio who, according to the murderer, is the bearer of a curse. Jennifer has the unfortunate idea of ??taking the puppet home.

title: Hidalgo
actors: Viggo Mortensen, Zuleikha Robinson, Omar Sharif, Louise Lombard, Said Taghmaoui
description: Frank T. Hopkins, one of the greatest horseback riders in America, becomes a legend when with his mustang Hidalgo he fights with the best Arab horses and riders. The man is in fact invited to participate in the "Ocean of Fire", a grueling 3,000-mile race across the desert.
notes: Hopkins, played by the woody (but likeable) Viggo Mortensen, wants to be one of those shadowy adventure novel heroes; he keeps a secret "in his blood" that will save his life at the end of the race and above all is complementary to the true protagonist of the story, Hidalgo, a splendid "red Indian" mustang. _Oceano di fuoco_ is a harmless divertissement, touristic and oleographic like a Bertolucci in the desert, naive in digging out references from a cinephile past (Sheikh Omar Sharif is already an imaginary in himself), but also engaging when he returns to the zero degree adventure.

title: The River's Edge
actors: Ray Milland, Anthony Quinn, Debra Paget, Byron Foulger
description: After clearing out a bank, Nardo Denning heads to the Mexican border. To orient himself in the mountains, however, he needs the help of an expert guide: he finds her in the Ben Cameron ranchero, who forces him to escort him. But Ben is married to Margaret, who had once been Nardo's woman, and fleeing into the mountains the ancient passion re-emerges, inevitably putting the two men in conflict.
notes: One of the latest films from veteran Dwan. A contemporary western setting, a low-budget Cinemascope, with a very macho Anthony Quinn and Ray Milland in the unusual role of the bad guy.

title: Dawn of the Dead
actors: Sarah Polley, Ving Rhames, Jake Weber, Mekhi Phifer, Ty Burrell
description: Driven by an insatiable hunger for human flesh, zombies roam menacing, ready to pounce on the few survivors. Ana Clark, who has escaped from her home in Wisconsin, joins Kenneth, a stoic police officer, Michael, a shy electronics salesman, and André, a tough guy used to everything, with his pregnant wife. The five find refuge in an abandoned shopping center, which turns into a fortress ...
notes: The film "does its job" with honesty and good craft: it doesn't throw it into a joke, but it doesn't forget humor; he never relaxes the tension, he knows how to use clichés without trivializing them, he does not philosophize but neither consoles.

title: Kill Bill: vol. 2
actors: Uma Thurman, David Carradine, Daryl Hannah, Michael Madsen, Sonny Chiba, Vivica A. Fox, Ambrosia Kelley, Michael Parks, James Parks, Lucy Liu, Julie Dreyfus, Bo Svenson, Chiaki Kuriyama, Chia-hui Liu, Samuel L. Jackson, Sid Haig, Larry Bishop, Claire Smithies, Clark Middleton
description: The "Bride" continues to carry out her revenge: after killing the first two ex-classmates on the list, Vernita Green and O-Ren Ishii, she sets out on the trail of Elle Driver and Budd, leaving Bill for the last. But the situation becomes complicated when the "Bride" learns that her daughter, whom she thought dead, has survived the massacre of the church ...
notes: "Volume 2" is also stylistically freed from the comic book hyperrealism that cloaked the first chapter. Camera sometimes by hand, grainy photography, an image quality that changes according to the narrative register. Clear references (Lucio Fulci of _Fear in the city of the living dead_, Sergio Leone a go go, the productions of the Shaw Brothers ...) but basically secondary, simple ideas for immersion in an imaginary that is now only his, of Tarantino. Who, in "volume 1", had reiterated the two-dimensionality of his characters, moved by a cartoon violence that is finally contradicted - and denied - in this second film, where there is much less blood and much less action, but much more ache. It's love. _Kill Bill - vol. 2_ is a great love story. As in _Jackie Brown_, love is what defines individuals by tearing them away from their (in) cinematic consistency (remember Robert Forster, who goes out of focus the moment his beloved Pam Grier walks away?). Only this time passion has to do with revenge: so people don't blur them, but transfigure them into a tragic mask.

title: The Missing
actors: Cate Blanchett, Tommy Lee Jones, Evan Rachel Wood, Jenna Boyd, Aaron Eckhart, Val Kilmer
description: Wild West. Maggie has to work hard to support her two daughters: teenager Lilly and little Dot. Jones, the woman's father, has returned home after spending twenty years with the Apaches, but Maggie, who suffered from being abandoned by him as a child, rejects him. When a band of renegade whites and indians led by an evil wizard kidnaps Lilly, Maggie is forced to ask for her help.
notes: Howard designs an ostentatiously classic direction, knows how to deal with the prairies and makes use of two perfect actors like Blachett and Lee Jones. But he is too shy, he does not choose between realism, epos and psychologies.

title: Love and a Bullet
actors: Anthony 'Treach' Criss, Kent Masters King, Charles Guardino
description: While preparing to carry out his latest task - the elimination of the beautiful and naive Cynda, the boss's girlfriend -, Malik, a professional killer, reflects on his "work" choices and on the destiny from which he can no longer escape. Torn between a "sense of duty" and a newfound humanity, Malik discovers that the only way out is a dangerous final confrontation with men as tough and perhaps harder than him.
notes: Originality is certainly not on the menu, but taken for what it is (a television product that landed on some American screens) the Kants & Ramsey film delivers what it promises: gunfights, gang language and a gentleman murdering protagonist.

title: Van Helsing
actors: Hugh Jackman, Kate Beckinsale, Richard Roxburgh, David Wenham, Silvia Colloca, Will Kemp, Elena Anaya
description: The famous monster hunter Van Helsing travels to Transylvania on behalf of a secret society in order to kill Count Dracula. Anna will help him, who wants to destroy the vampire to erase the curse that hangs over his family. But Van Helsing also has to contend with Frankenstein and the Wolf Man ...
notes: Everything - myths, anxieties, legends - is mixed in the special effects blender: the emotion is eliminated, the suggestions of low cost are regretted. The only found (so to speak): the little friar with his amazing inventions of death, a sort of Bondian Q ante litteram. It seems to be in the parody of _Frankenstein junior _...

title: The Borrower
actors: Rae Dawn Chong, Don Gordon, Tom Towles, Antonio Fargas
description: An alien, condemned by his fellows to live in the worst place in the galaxy together with the worst race of all creation, is thrown to Earth. After a while the extraterrestrial loses his head and finds himself in the unpleasant condition of having to borrow it from others. Detectives Diane Pierce and Charles Krieger set out on the trail of the head-cutter maniac.
notes: Rae Dawn Chong is the one who was with Schwarzenegger in _Commando_. She's cute and can do tough roles too. John McNaughton is not cute, but his debut film ("Henry, Rain of Blood") was hard. This is much less so.

title: Overland Telegraph
actors: George Nader, Hugh Beaumont, Tim Holt, Richard Martin, Gail Davis
description: The construction of a new telegraph line would have deleterious effects for the trader Paul Manning, who in fact makes an agreement with the criminals led by Brad Roberts to sabotage it. Tim Holt and his buddy Chito Rafferty investigate, but ...
notes: Western lace-up routine for the prolific Selander, specialized in the genre.

title: They Crawl
actors: Daniel Cosgrove, Tamara Davies, Mickey Rourke, Ken Lerner
description: Autopsies on two corpses lead to a disturbing revelation: both bodies have no internal organs. Agents Ted Gage and Gina O'Bannon discover a connection to the bizarre sect headed by Tiny Frakes, responsible for unleashing a terrible horde of mutant cockroaches ...
notes: Pure Series B.

title: Laserblast
actors: Kim Milford, Cheryl Smith, Gianni Russo, Ron Masak, Dennis Burkley

title: Carnival of Souls
actors: Bobbie Phillips, Shawnee Smith, Larry Miller, Paul Johansson
description: Alex was shocked by Louis Seagram's brutal rape and murder of her mother, who committed the crime disguised as a clown. Many years pass, and Alex seems to see Louis again threatening her dressed up in the same costume ...
notes: Modest remake of a 1962 film of the same name. Produced by Wes Craven.

title: Carnosaur
actors: Diane Ladd, Raphael Sbarge, Jennifer Runyon, Ned Bellamy, Harrison Page

title: Witchblade
actors: Yancy Butler, Conrad Dunn, Anthony Cistaro, David Chokachi
description: Sara Pezzini, a New York police detective, has only one purpose in life: to bring to justice Tommy Gallo, responsible for the deaths of his father, his best friend and his own partner. While on the trail of Gallus, the woman comes into possession of the "Witchblade", a prodigious glove (which is said to have belonged to Joan of Arc) capable of deflecting bullets, drawing sharp blades and compacting itself into a small bracelet. Using this deadly weapon, Sara will try to put the hated antagonist with his back to the wall.
notes: Boring and very sloppy cinematic version of Mark Silvestri's comics.

title: The Cat in the Hat
actors: Mike Myers, Dakota Fanning, Spencer Breslin, Alec Baldwin, Kelly Preston
description: Sally and Conrad, left alone at home with their goldfish, are bored: it's raining outside and they don't know how to pass the time. Suddenly a strange character knocks on the door: a talking cat who drags them on a series of fun adventures.
notes: The baby actors are magnificent and the adults, apart from Myers who unleashed his taste for grotesque characters, experience these contractual commitments as a vacation from methods, schools and techniques. Alec Baldwin, crude, vain, self-righteous, is hilarious. The film thrives on gimmicks and disconnected scenes, but it is better than many fragile scripts without rhyme or reason. Goldfish deserves a place in the fantasy of contemporary cinema.

title: Torque
actors: Martin Henderson, Ice Cube, Monet Mazur, Matt Schulze, Max Beesley
description: Motorcyclist Cary Ford is unjustly accused of murdering another biker. The man is hunted not only by the law, but also by the gang to which the victim belonged, who wants to take revenge. To survive, Ford must track down the real killer.
notes: A film of this type, all played on the likelihood of the actions and the skill of the stuntmen, loses a lot from the display of digital. If anything, the effects should be hidden, believed to be true. But when from the beginning the whole film is as colorful as a cartoon and as fast as a playstation, whatever the protagonists do we no longer believe it.

title: Jason X
actors: Kane Hodder, Lexa Doig, Chuck Campbell, Lisa Ryder, Peter Mensah
description: XXV century. The Earth has long since been habitable and humans have moved into space. A colony receives two cryogenically stored bodies and thaws them. But one of the two is from serial killer Jason Voorhees ...
notes: The slasher is renewed as it can and slips on some avoidable sloppiness (for example, in 2500 and broken they dress like us: a little more fantasy, come on!), But this time the slaughter is more fun than usual. It will be for a couple of cute gimmicks (like the crumbling head) and it will be because the director Jason Isaac, student of David Cronenberg (present in a tasty role) does not want to overdo it.

title: The Alamo
actors: Billy Bob Thornton, Jason Patric, Patrick Wilson, Dennis Quaid, Emilio Echevarria
description: Texas, 1836. One hundred and eighty-nine Texan civilians who believed in the future of their state, led by Colonels William Travis, Jim Bowie and the legendary Davy Crockett, occupied Fort Alamo. For twelve days they resisted the five thousand soldiers of General Antonio López de Santa Ana. A fierce battle ensued that saw the occupiers succumb. Six weeks later, General Sam Houston redeemed their demise.
notes: Boring and colorless staging of over two hours of an important episode in American history that was repeatedly brought to the screen. Remember _The Battle of the Alamo_ by and with John Wayne and _Alamo_ by Frank Lloyd.

title: Timeline
actors: Paul Walker, Frances O'Connor, Gerard Butler, Lambert Wilson, Billy Connolly
description: In the Dordogne, some archaeologists are trying to unearth the ruins of a 14th century castle. For Professor Edward Johnston, the head of the project, it is the fulfillment of a lifelong dream: but things fall apart when the students realize that Johnson has been thrown back in time, ending up in the midst of a feudal battle between the French and English ...
notes: The film demonstrates its strength: first of all in the sure hand of the old craftsman Donner; then in the script which - although predictable in some junctions - reveals the usual and reassuring tale with a happy ending that never seems to go out of fashion.

title: Stranded
actors: Ice T, Michael Dudikoff, Hannes Jaenicke, Paul Michael Robinson
description: The Russian space station Avma, in orbit around the Earth, falls into failure. The Shuttle Atlantis team goes into action to avert the risk of a collision that would cause a huge catastrophe, but the shuttle is hit by a meteor shower and finds itself adrift in the cosmos ...
notes: Yet another "Z movie" of the infamous Ray.

title: Ella Enchanted
actors: Anne Hathaway, Hugh Dancy, Cary Elwes, Vivica A. Fox, Joanna Lumley, Minnie Driver
description: At the birth of Ella, the fairy Lucinda gives her obedience as a gift. But over time, that dowry becomes a kind of curse, because the girl cannot refuse to fulfill what is asked of her and is often at the mercy of unscrupulous individuals. To try to regain control of her life, Ella will have to traverse a realm full of orcs, giants, evil stepsisters and talking books ...
notes: Harmless fairy tale made to measure to enhance the soap and water charm of Hathaway (_Pretty Princess_, but also _The Secrets of Brokeback Mountain_). In the original edition, the narrator is Eric Idle, formerly of Monty Python.

title: Madhouse
actors: Joshua Leonard, Jordan Ladd, Lance Henriksen, Leslie Jordan, Natasha Lyonne
description: A young psychiatrist hides secrets about the mental health faculty where he works.

title: Walking Tall
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Johnny Knoxville, Neal McDonough, Kristen Wilson, Ashley Scott
description: After retiring from the Army Special Forces, Chris Vaughn decides to return to the small town he came from to start a new life. When he arrives, however, he realizes that things have gotten considerably worse: drugs, corruption and crime are rampant. At the head of these shady trades is an old acquaintance of Chris: his former schoolmate and rival Jay Hamilton ...
notes: In the midst of a "pre-emptive war" climate, the United States finds a new hero: The Rock, a former wrestler who aspires to take Schwarzenegger's place in the muscular imagination. The film is vulgar and obvious, but at home it was a success.

title: Sideshow
actors: Jamie Martz, Michael Amos, Scott Clark, Jessica Keenan, Phil Fondacaro

title: Zarkorr! The Invader
actors: Rhys Pugh, Mark Hamilton, Eileen Wesson, Ron Barnes, R. Allan Bexton

title: Catwoman
actors: Halle Berry, Benjamin Bratt, Sharon Stone, Lambert Wilson, Frances Conroy
description: Patience Prince, shy and sensitive artist, works as a designer in a cosmetic products company. One day, by chance, she discovers a terrible secret regarding a new anti-aging product that is about to be released on the market and should therefore be eliminated. He manages to save himself thanks to the qualities that distinguish his second nature as a cat ...
notes: The film will be remembered for the fetish onesie and the sadomasochistic whip of the Berry, for the clashes and the "blows" between the Stone and the woman cat. It will be forgotten as a mediocre attempt to draw a pop-feline-feminist icon.

title: Fallout
actors: Teri Ann Linn, Frank Zagarino, Daniel Baldwin, Hannes Jaenicke, Scott Valentine, John Reilly
description: To repair the computer on board of a Russian-American spacecraft orbiting the Earth, computer experts Amanda McCord and Previ Fedorov are boarded on a shuttle: along the way, however, Fedorov turns out to be a dangerous terrorist ...
notes: Anachronistic cold war tones for a poorly directed and worse acted short film.

title: Krocodylus
actors: Dax Miller, Matt Borlenghi, Katie Fischer, Joel West, Duncan Regehr
description: With more guts than brains, Bog and Zack want to experience the thrill of circling their surfboards after spilling blood in the water to attract sharks. But while the videoreporter Cecily is filming their exploits, a huge and ferocious crocodile arrives: save who can ...
notes: A festival of cheap horrors.

title: Adam & Evil
actors: Sean Arnfinson, Lynsey Brothers, Erica Cerra, Clayton Champagne

title: Leprechaun
actors: Warwick Davis, Jennifer Aniston, Ken Olandt, Mark Holton
description: In Ireland, Dan O'Grady finds the gold of the "leprechaun", a sort of evil wood elf. Back home, the man locks the creature in the cellar and tries to burn it, but he dies of a heart attack; ten years later, J.D. and his daughter Tory buy Dan's house, unaware of what is hiding there ...
notes: First episode of an endless horror-gothic series.

title: Amazing Stories
directors: Steven Spielberg, Robert Zemeckis, William Dear
actors: Kevin Costner, Kiefer Sutherland, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Stuart Masterson

title: Hell Asylum
actors: Debra Mayer, Tanya Dempsey, Joe Estevez, Stacey Scowley

title: I, Robot
actors: Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan, Alan Tudyk, James Cromwell, Bruce Greenwood
description: 2035: robots have become a normal household appliance, present in every home. But after the death of their inventor, Dr. Lanning, Detective Spooner begins to investigate and discovers that his doubts are well founded: robots can pose a serious threat to the human race ...
notes: The film lends itself to a mini-reflection that has four main entrance doors. The first gives access to the room in which Hollywood summer blockbusters, even when they are inspired by quality literary sources (in this case the stories of Isaac Asimov), are to be evaluated as robotic products-texts. The second takes us to the area where films are rewarding when viewed with the same eyes as a documentary on advances in special effects technology. The third leads into the narrow vestibule where the correlation between plots and dialogues is the material of a creative neo-science fiction. The fourth opens up into the dark cellar where the bodies disappear: after that of the set and that of the actors, we witness the eclipse of the body of the director and director. If you don't want to open one of these four doors (there could be more or less), the film can be liquidated on impulse, or you can wait until 2035 to analyze it as a fossil of a vintage cinematic fantasy.

title: Annie Oakley
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Preston Foster, Melvyn Douglas, Moroni Olsen
description: Young shooter Annie Oakley is hired for the Buffalo Bill western show. To tutor her is the champion Toby Walker, with whom a professional rivalry begins, destined to turn into something more intimate.

title: House IV
actors: Terri Treas, William Katt, Scott Burkholder, Denny Dillon, Melissa Clayton

title: Second Nature
actors: Alec Baldwin, Powers Boothe, Louise Lombard, Philip Jackson
description: The only survivor of the plane crash that destroyed his family, Paul Kane cannot get over the shock that prevents him from remembering his life before the tragedy. Little by little, after a facial plastic surgery and rehabilitation therapy, Paul realizes that he is a killer in the service of the government agency headed by a certain Kelton Reed. However, until he has completely shed light on the past (solving, among other things, the mystery linked to the word "Chilly Willy" tattooed inside a lip), Kane proves that he is not even able to distinguish between friends and enemies. ...

title: Hideous!
actors: Michael Citriniti, Rhonda Griffin, Mel Johnson jr., Jacqueline Lovell
description: A man supervising the sewage system finds a deformed fetus underground. The strange "creature" is sold to a trafficker who gives it to a collector. On the way home, the collector is robbed of the "precious" purchase from a rival. With the help of a private detective, the robbed along with the trafficker and her secretary penetrates the thief's castle, where, in the meantime, the deformed fetus, endowed with extraordinary abilities, has managed not only to animate, but even to animate the others. fetuses present in the thief's collection.
notes: The film has interesting ideas but is lacking in tension.

title: Blacula
actors: William Marshall, Vonetta McGee, Denise Nichols, Thalmus Rasulala
description: 1780: After visiting Count Dracula, the African prince Mamuwalde transforms himself into the vampire Blacula. Almost two centuries later, in 1972, two collectors buy an antique trunk and transport it to Los Angeles: back free, the bloodthirsty noble sows panic in the city and wins the love of Tina, or the reincarnation of the one who once was was his wife with the name of Luva. But a friend of Tina's, Doctor Gordon Thomas, discovers Blacula's true nature and starts hunting him ...
notes: Modern version of the story of the most famous of the "undead", produced by the glorious Aip by Samuel Z. Arkoff.

title: Foxy Brown
actors: Pam Grier, Antonio Fargas, Peter Brown, Terry Carter, Katherine Loder
description: Plot in preparation

title: Face of Terror
actors: Ricky Schroder, Paulina Gálvez, Sergi Mateu, Abel Folk, Eric Balfour
description: Nick, a Los Angeles police officer, travels to Barcelona on the trail of his missing sister while she was pursuing the dream of becoming a model. Following a thorough investigation, the man discovers that his sister has come into contact with terrorists who use American girls as suicide bombers.
notes: Fiacco action movie.

title: The Furies
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Walter Huston, Judith Anderson, Wendell Corey, Gilbert Roland
description: Tom, a violent self-made man with an authoritarian character, managed to get hold of vast plots of land out of nowhere. He lives on the ranch "Le furie" with his daughter Vance who resembles him in his despotic disposition. The girl falls in love with the banker Rip, but is deeply disappointed when he gets paid by old Tom to give up on her. After a while Tom brings Flo, an unscrupulous adventurer with him from town, whom he intends to marry. An all-out struggle begins between father and daughter.
notes: Walter Huston and Barbara Stanwyck, respectively in the roles of Tom and Vance, give life to a diatribe with a Freudian aftertaste.

title: Donnie Darko
actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Patrick Swayze, Drew Barrymore, Jena Malone, Mary McDonnell, Holmes Osborne, Daveigh Chase, James Duval, Noah Wyle, Beth Grant, Seth Rogen, Katharine Ross, Lisa K. Wyatt, Jolene Purdy
description: October 1988. After escaping a terrifying and bizarre accident, Donnie Darko, an American teenager, realizes what it means to be alive and in love and consequently discovers his potential to alter time and destiny with the help of Frank, a giant rabbit. and monstrous. Is it just imagination?
notes: More than Weir or Gilliam (cited by the director as influences) Kelly recalls the Lynch of _Twin Peaks_, from the restless carts, to the small slow motion, to the bizarre and inexplicable characters that appear in the shots. Of course Kelly is not Lynch and the film really puts too much meat on the stove. But it's quirky and sincere enough to make it interesting.

title: Air Rage
actors: Ice T, Cyril O'Reilly, Rick Cramer, Kimberly Oja, Alexandra Raines
description: Found guilty of heinous war crimes, Marine Colonel Skikes is sentenced to life in military prison. His loyalists, however, manage to make him escape, and with him at the head they hijack a plane to obtain a strong ransom. There is work for Matt Marshall and his counterterrorism unit ...
notes: Fred Olen Ray, a brand a guarantee: according to the annals, our company would have signed - both in its own name and with a plethora of pseudonyms - the beauty of 93 films from 1971 to 2006! Seven in 2001 alone, one of which is this _Air Rage_: and the reader will forgive us, if at this point we have run out of space for further comments ...

title: Evil Never Dies
actors: Thomas Gisbon, Katherine Heigl, Simon Bossell, John Waters (III)
description: After his wife is killed by serial killer William Charles Lee, police detective Mark Ryan goes into a depression which forces him to quit his job and serve as a private guard in college. Some time later, a series of sexually motivated murders take place which resemble, in the modus operandi, those committed by Lee. The police think it is impossible that it is Lee, as he was executed. But Ryan is sure it's him and that's why he involves policewoman Eve in her hunt for revived Lee.
notes: Modest television film directed by Uli Edel which had debuted with _Christiana F. - We the boys of the Berlin zoo_.

title: Fake-Out
actors: Pia Zadora, Telly Savalas, Desi Arnaz jr., Larry Storch, G. Wesley Stevens
description: Bobbie Warren, a Las Vegas nightclub singer, compromises with the local mob and ends up in the jail. Trained by previous experience, she agrees to testify - or so she says - and is placed in the custody of agents Clint Morgan and O.W. Thurston ...
notes: Very feeble "action" with comedy overtones.

title: The Black Swan
actors: Tyrone Power, Maureen O'Hara, Laird Cregar, Thomas Mitchell
description: Appointed governor of Jamaica, the infamous pirate Henry Morgan entrusts the young Jamie Waring with the task of defeating a frond of former rebel colleagues into whose hands Lady Margaret, the daughter of his predecessor, has fallen ...
notes: Power is expressionless as usual, but there is no shortage of fun. Oscar for photography by Leon Shamroy.

title: The Santa Clause 2
actors: David Krumholtz, Tim Allen, Elizabeth Mitchell, Judge Reinhold, Eric Lloyd

title: Rapid Exchange
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Lance Henriksen, Aviva Gale, Matt O'Toole
description: A band of daring air bandits devises a risky plan: to seize a Boeing 747 en route to Europe, on which also travel the beauty of 250 million dollars. But with such a lot of money involved, the outlaws themselves are starting to wonder if they can really trust each other ...

title: National Treasure
actors: Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Justin Bartha, Sean Bean, Jon Voight, Harvey Keitel
description: Benjamin Franklin Gates is the latest descendant of a family for six generations engaged in the search for the treasure of the Templars, war booty of the founding fathers of the United States. Benjamin, having learned that the map is hidden on the back of the Declaration of Independence, has to deal with those who would like to get hold of the precious document. He then devises a plan in which technology wizard Riley and Abigail, director of the Washington National Archives collaborate.
notes: The rhythm is fast-paced, the characters are pure narrative functions (Justin Bartha is a good shoulder), the editing is not boring, the music is migraine.

title: The Dinosaur Hunter
actors: Alison Pill, Bill Switzer, Simon MacCorkindale, Christopher Plummer
description: Julia who lives on a Canadian farm with her brother Daniel meets Jack, an archaeologist looking for dinosaur bones. His dream is to find the complete skeleton of a prehistoric animal. Julia and Daniel, involved in his search, have to deal with Hump intent on stealing the artifacts found by Jack.

title: Intruder
actors: Elizabeth Cox, Renée Estevez, Dan Hicks, David Byrnes, Sam Raimi

title: Don Quixote
actors: John Lithgow, Bob Hoskins, Isabella Rossellini, Vanessa Williams
description: An avid devourer of ancient adventurous texts, Alonso Quixada decides one day to transform himself into a knight-errant with the name of Don Quixote de la Mancha. Chosen as squire the fellow citizen Sancho Panza, he will travel the dusty streets of Spain to conquer the glory and the heart of Dulcinea del Toboso, the Beauty among the Beauties ...

title: Day of the Dead
actors: Lori Cardillo, Terry Alexander, Joseph Pilato, Jarlath Conroy

title: Ladder 49
actors: Joaquin Phoenix, John Travolta, Jacinda Barrett, Robert Patrick, Morris Chestnut
description: Firefighter Jack Morrison, after rescuing a man imprisoned inside a burning building, is also trapped. Waiting for his friend and fire chief, Mike Kennedy to rescue him, he retraces his entire life: from when he realized his dream by joining Squad 49, to when he met the girl who would become his wife, to the decision to start a family ...
notes: John Travolta carves out a background role and the final moving celebration of the category in contemporary society. The direction, entrusted to Jay Russell, privileges the familiar / sentimental side to the dramatic / spectacular one that reserves few emotions, with an alternation between flashbacks and present action, all in all flat and with brachycardic rhythms.

title: Halloween
actors: Jamie Lee Curtis, Donald Pleasence, Nancy Loomis, Tony Moran, P.J. Soles, Charles Cyphers, Kyle Richards, Brian Andrews, John Michael Graham, Nancy Stephens
description: Haddonfield, Illinois, 1963: On a cold Halloween night, six-year-old Michael Myers brutally kills his older sister. The child is thus locked up in the asylum of Smith's Grove, where Dr. Sam Loomis seems to be the only one to notice his luciferian nature. And when fifteen years later, still on the eve of Halloween, Michael breaks out of the institute, Loomis knows that something terrifying is about to happen ...
notes: Carpenter realizes the progenitor - "sequelized" and imitated - of a new course of horror. First-person shooting forces us to identify with Michael, and that's no small insight.

title: Legend of the Lost
actors: John Wayne, Sophia Loren, Rossano Brazzi, Kurt Kasznar, Sonia Moser
description: When his father disappears in the Sahara desert under mysterious circumstances, the rich and young Paul Bonnard decides to go after him. Thus he reaches Timbuktu where he meets the cynical John and the beautiful Dita. The two accompany him among the ruins of an ancient city, where Paul discovers the treasure for which his parent was killed, but also the evidence of his debauchery. He will end up going mad and turning against his traveling companions.
notes: Very weak and tedious, one of Henry Hathaway's worst adventurous films, with a bewildered John Wayne and an endless string of daring and melodramatic events in the desert that often touch involuntary comedy. Useless.

title: Maniac
actors: Joe Spinell, Caroline Munro, Gail Lawrence, Kelly Piper, Rita Montone
description: Frank Zito is a middle-aged man who lives in solitude in a New York neighborhood. In reality he is a schizophrenic killer who commits the most heinous murders at night: he assaults young couples and prostitutes by scalping unfortunate women, then placing it on mannequins he keeps at home.
notes: The film directed by William Lustig is a thriller that does not spare scenes of considerable gory and sadism. In the succession of violence, the director manages to fuel the suspense of the viewer by making him identify with the thoughts and disturbing neuroses of the killer (Joe Spinell), neglecting the aspect of police investigations. Special effects and makeup by Tom Savini, here also an actor.

title: Vertical Limit
actors: Chris O'Donnell, Bill Paxton, Robin Tunney, Scott Glenn
description: A group of climbers is facing a wall. Suddenly the patatrac happens: they all remain in the balance, and one of them - father of the other two - sacrifices himself for the offspring. We meet the two brothers years later: the girl insists on climbing and is about to face K2, the boy has given himself more prudently to nature photography. But when she gets in trouble, do you bet he'll challenge the planet's second mountain to save her little sister and honor her father's memory?
notes: Martin Campbell signs everything with one eye on the digital effects and the other on the reasonable check cashed at the end of the shoot.

title: Dementia 13
actors: William Campbell, Luana Anders, Bart Patton, Mary Mitchell
description: The Halloran nobles find themselves at their imposing and ancient Irish mansion in memory of Kathleen, a child who drowned eight years before but seems to have found no peace: in fact, missing dolls re-emerge from the pond, at the bottom of which a tombstone is placed. An ax-wielding maniac mercilessly strikes anyone who tries to solve the mystery ...
notes: Produced at a low cost by Roger Corman, Coppola's second feature film sees itself with an inconsistent screenplay, a pure pretext for suspenseful and bloodthirsty sequences. However, a Gothic staging emerges, not without elegance and surreal touches.

title: Western Union
actors: Randolph Scott, Robert Young, Virginia Gilmore, Dean Jagger

title: 3 Bad Men
actors: J. Farrell MacDonald, George O'Brien, Olive Borden, Tom Santschi

title: The Black Watch
actors: Victor McLaglen, Myrna Loy, Roy D'Arcy, Pat Somerset, David Rollins

title: Constantine
actors: Shia LaBeouf, Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz, Djimon Hounsou, Max Baker, Tilda Swinton
description: Detective John Constantine, returning from hell, teams up with policewoman Angela Dodson to solve the mysterious suicide of the woman's twin. The investigation leads them into a world populated by demons and angels ...
notes: The film that finds in Keanu Reeves a not incisive protagonist starts very well with a direction that breaks away from the lack of originality of the general assumption, with successful visual effects, with the right atmosphere of metaphysical detection, with good chromatisms. At the close of the first act, the plot becomes less interesting, some of the secondary characters remain narrative spots, the harmony between Reeves and Rachel Weisz is canceled and, above all, the scheme cracks with the appearance of enigmatic celestial creatures and pensive devils .

title: Blade: Trinity
