actors: Wesley Snipes, Kris Kristofferson, Dominic Purcell, Jessica Biel, Parker Posey, Ryan Reynolds
description: The vampire hunter Blade and his mentor Whister set out on the trail of the fearsome vampire Drake, with extraordinary powers that allow him to face even the light of day ...
notes: The author renounces the epic of the character, no longer tragic, almost a simple wrestling wrestler, grinning and vacuous. Atrocious disappointment because Wesley Snipes is a prepared and intelligent actor, and Blade, the one in the first two films, remains one of the best fantasy inventions and the best comic transpositions ever.

title: Monster!
actors: M. Emmet Walsh, Tobias Mehler, Brendan Cowell, Jennifer Congram, Ashley Gavin, Angela Keep
description: Discharged from the psychiatric clinic where his obsession with the imminent invasion of monstrous beings had brought him, the former horror star Lloyd Reeves returns to the town where he lives. Here, however, during a "scary" film festival, his prophecies come true, and one of the creatures on the screen materializes and sows terror ...

title: Cursed
actors: Jesse Eisenberg, Christina Ricci, Joshua Jackson, Portia De Rossi, Shannon Elizabeth, Derek Mears, Nick Offerman
description: Los Angeles. Jimmi and Ellie, orphaned after an accident, realize they have acquired supernatural powers. When they begin to investigate the incident, they realize they have been attacked by a werewolf and must fight to survive its curse.
notes: Sort of a makeover of _I Was a Teenage Werewolf_ in the hills of Hollywood today, the new Wes Craven is less terrible than they described it but on the other hand still far from the glory days of the master of New Horror. Enjoyable the first part, let's say until the party in the pub-wax museum, especially for the digressions that see the young (and good) Jesse Eisenberg as protagonist. On the other hand, the entire final part is devastating, flat and digitized also from an aesthetic point of view.

title: After the Sunset
actors: Pierce Brosnan, Salma Hayek, Woody Harrelson, Don Cheadle, Naomie Harris, Chris Penn
description: Max Burdett and Lola Cirillo, professional thieves, after a last millionaire heist take refuge in the Bahamas to enjoy the fruits of their thefts. But federal agent Stan Lloyd, who has been chasing them for eight years, discovers that the two are plotting a new and astonishing blow: the stakes, this time, will be a very precious diamond ...
notes: In the delicate balance between action and comedy, the first works decidedly better than the second: which, compressed between the cries of Hayek and a slightly uncomfortable Harrelson in comic clothes, is weak and tears a few laughter without conviction. Brosnan's performance is also mediocre.

title: The Paradise Virus
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Melody Thomas Scott, Ralf Moeller, David Millbern

title: Hangman's Knot
actors: Claude Jarman jr, Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Frank Faylen

title: Valerie
actors: Sterling Hayden, Anita Ekberg, Anthony Steel, Pete Walker

title: The Hills Have Eyes
actors: Susan Lanier, Robert Houston, Martin Speer, Dee Wallace, Michael Berryman

title: Bet Your Life
actors: Sean Carrigan, Corinne Van Ryck de Groot, Billy Zane, Jeanne Bauer
description: Cornered by some dodgy guys, Sonny Briggs proposes a bet: nothing more natural, given that we're in Las Vegas ... If he can stay alive for twenty-four hours Sonny will have his skin safe and so risks, decides to sneak away to Cleveland ...

title: Run of the Arrow
actors: Rod Steiger, Sara Montiel, Brian Keith, Ralph Meeker, Charles Bronson
description: Unable to accept the defeat he remedied in the American Civil War, Irish-born Confederate soldier O'Meara (Rod Steiger) decides to head west and start a new life among the Sioux Indian tribes. After undergoing a ritual called "the torture of the arrow", O'Meara is accepted by the Sioux, of whom he marries a young woman. However, his new identity will be severely tested when, following the conflict that breaks out between the Sioux and the troops of the Northern army, he will have to decide which side to take.

title: Cyborg 2087
actors: Michael Rennie, Wendell Corey, Eduard Franz, Karen Steele

title: The Ape Man
actors: Bela Lugosi, Louise Currie, Wallace Ford, Henry Hall, Minerva Urecal
description: By crowning his bizarre experiments, the insane Dr. James Brewster - assisted by assistant George Randall - has achieved a result that is nothing short of astonishing: he has in fact managed to transform himself into a hairy ape-man. But now an antidote needs to be found, and Brewster believes that only an injection of "fresh" spinal fluid, extracted from a living human being, can do the job. But since Randall refuses to undergo the blood draw, Brewster is forced to find other "donors" ...
notes: Although messed up, one of the most "passable" films among the nearly three hundred credited to the fearsome Beaudine.

title: Blood Feast
actors: Thomas Wood, Mal Arnold, Connie Mason, Lyn Bolton, Scott H. Hall
description: Fuad Ramses, an Egyptian restaurateur with hypnotic powers, kills young girls to perform an occult rite to the goddess Ishtar. The maniac decides to kill the beautiful Suzette Fremont to carry out the final stage of his ritual, but Detective Pete Thornton and Police Chief Frank follow his trail.

title: Monte Walsh
actors: Lee Marvin, Jeanne Moreau, Jack Palance, Mitchel Ryan, Michael Conrad, Eric Christmas

title: The Klansman
actors: O. J. Simpson, Richard Burton, Lee Marvin, Cameron Mitchell, Luciana Paluzzi, Lola Falana, Linda Evans, David Huddleston

title: The Lonely Man
actors: Jack Palance, Anthony Perkins, Elaine Aiken, Neville Brand, Robert Middleton, Elisha Cook jr., Lee Van Cleef, Claude Akins

title: Beau Geste
actors: Guy Stockwell, Doug McClure, Leslie Nielsen, Telly Savalas
description: The American Beau allows him to be blamed for a crime he has not committed and, to escape conviction, he enlisted in the Foreign Legion. Beau, nicknamed Geste, just arrived at Fort Zinderneuf, is suspected of having sent a threatening letter to Sergeant Dagineau, the tyrannical instructor of the department to which he was assigned. The sergeant mistreats the American, who gains understanding of the fort's inept commander. Beau Geste, joined by his brother John, will find himself in a position to save Dagineau's life during an assault by the Tuareg.
notes: Third passable version of Percival's Christopher Wren novel.

title: The Rawhide Years
actors: Tony Curtis, Colleen Miller, Arthur Kennedy, William Demarest

title: Honky Tonk Freeway
actors: Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D'Angelo, William Devane, Geraldine Page, Jessica Tandy

title: Day the World Ended
actors: Richard Denning, Lori Nelson, Adele Jergens, Touch Connors

title: Born to the West
actors: Johnny Mac Brown, James Craig, Marsha Hunt, John Wayne, Monte Blue, John Patterson

title: Landslide
actors: Vincent Spano, Alexandra Paul, Luke Eberl, Jaime Gomez
description: Mark Decker, recently separated from his wife, moves with his son to a new residential complex owned by his father-in-law. Due to the tremors generated by the explosives used in a nearby construction site, a gigantic landslide takes place that hits the complex causing it to collapse. Mark Decker, his son, father-in-law and most of the apartment occupants are trapped in the rubble and are desperately trying to find an exit. Outside, meanwhile, Emma, ??Mark's wife, helped by their friend Danny, tries to free her loved ones and discovers that the avalanche was not caused by a simple accident ...

title: Maiden Voyage
actors: Casper Van Dien, Peter Elliott, Christopher Stollery, Danielle Cormack
description: Kyle Considine, a former police officer, is a consultant for a security company. His boss, Trevor, entrusts him with the task of taking care of the security service of a cruise ship. Since the assignment doesn't seem too demanding or dangerous, Kyle brings with him the 16-year-old son with whom he has had a stormy relationship since his divorce from his wife. As soon as the ship sails, however, a group of ferocious terrorists, captained by Damien, take the ship's three hundred passengers hostage and demand fifteen million dollars in exchange for their release. But they did the math without our man ...

title: Four Faces West
actors: Joel McCrea, Frances Dee, Charles Bickford, William Conrad

title: Crash Landing
actors: Brandon Barash, John Beck, Robert Clotworthy, John J. Dalesandro
description: Expelled from the army ten years earlier (accused of causing a plane crash), Roger Masters makes ends meet by piloting a charter that transports tourists to Hawaii. The routine is interrupted when some mercenaries attack his aircraft, determined to kidnap the daughter of the owner of the company ...

title: Phantasm
actors: Angus Scrimm, Reggie Bannister, Michael Baldwin, Bill Thornbury

title: The Phantom Planet
actors: Dean Fredericks, Coleen Gray, Tony Dexter, Francis X. Bushman

title: War of the Worlds
actors: Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Tim Robbins, Miranda Otto
description: After a long time, divorced Ray Ferrier is about to spend a weekend with children Robbie and Rachel. Suddenly, however, a strange device emerges from the ground and incinerates everything it encounters: it is the beginning of the attack of the aliens on Earth. In general panic, Ray tries to save his children ...
notes: The first part - with the spectacular structure of the conflict, the crescendo of fear, insecurity and death, the apocalyptic visions, the close succession of accidents and catastrophes - is more interesting, compelling and "cinematic" than the other core of the story: the discomfort of a father who does not know how to be paternal, authoritative and reassuring.

title: Into the Sun
actors: Steven Seagal, Matthew Davis, Takao Osawa, Eddie George, William Atherton
description: A group of yakuza assassinated the mayor of Tokyo. CIA agent Travis Hunter, raised in Japan by an ex-yakuza and half-brother of the killed politician, is sent to investigate the incident. He finds himself facing a war between the old guard of the organized crime of the Rising Sun and the unscrupulous "young rampant" led by the insane Kuroda, who has entered into an alliance with the Chinese mafia for the worldwide drug trade.
notes: A film rather devoid of action (and even the little that is there certainly does not leave its mark) that will disappoint even lovers of the genre and fans of the rocky Seagal.

title: Stealth
actors: Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel, Jamie Foxx, Sam Shepard, Richard Roxburgh, Joe Morton
description: In the not too distant future, aviation developed a fighter jet piloted by artificial intelligence. The jet was placed on an aircraft carrier in the Pacific to "learn" combat maneuvers from the pilots on board. But when the computer develops its own thought, men must find a way to stop it before the war starts ...
notes: The Cohen of _The Fast and the Furious_ and _xXx_ does not contradict himself and packs yet another adrenaline-filled and decerebrated "popcorn movie": this time, however, even the public has deserted. Embarrassing that the talking computer of the plane aspires to refer to the Kubrickian Hal 9000.

title: Into the Blue
actors: Paul Walker, Jessica Alba, Scott Caan, Ashley Scott, Josh Brolin, James Frain
description: Bahamas. Four young scuba divers find a wreck that is said to contain great treasure. But once they reach their destination, they discover another and more sinister mystery. The four pledge not to reveal what they know, but the stakes put their loyalty to the test. All the more so when they themselves turn into prey.
notes: From a teen movie and marine filming expert like John Stockwell (Blue Crush) it was more than legitimate to expect good underwater scenes and an atmosphere at the right seaside temperature a balanced dose of adventure and bullying (the duo between Walker and Scott Caan works) , son of James, as well as the villain of the day, Josh Brolin, is the son of another well-known James). A brilliant promotional film of free diving, a sub discipline to be practiced without a wetsuit. And in fact the athletic and tanned and in love bodies of Jessica Alba and Paul Walker, the beauty of "Fast and Furious", are above all.

title: The Island
actors: Ewan McGregor, Scarlett Johansson, Djimon Hounsou, Sean Bean, Steve Buscemi, Michael Clarke Duncan
description: Mid 21st century. Lincoln Six-Echo resides in a seemingly utopian place and like everyone else he hopes to be chosen to be sent to the Island, the last unspoiled spot on the planet. But when he discovers that he and the other inhabitants are only human clones with the aim of providing "spare parts" to their counterparts, he embarks on a daring escape in the company of the beautiful Jordan Two-Delta ...
notes: Leaving aside the incongruity of some characters and narrative junctions, what the film lacks is the right balance between the parts. After a start full of promises with the introduction of very interesting ethical, narrative and visual cues, in the second part Bay lets itself be carried away by an infinite sequence of useless pursuits, denying itself the pleasure of exploring perhaps more inaccessible but more fascinating routes such as for example a real confrontation between humans and agnates.

title: Dark Command
actors: John Wayne, Claire Trevor, Walter Pidgeon, Roy Rogers, George 'Gabby' Gays
description: Defeated by Texan cowboy Bob Seton in both the race for the position of sheriff and in the race for the heart of the beautiful Mary McCloud, Will Cantrell gives up the profession of teacher and takes advantage of the outbreak of the Civil War to form a gang of renegades, apparently affiliated with the Southerners but in reality devoted to robberies and raids. Refreshed by the new situation, the rivalry between Cantrell and Seton will end up going on for a long time ...
notes: Despite the cuts imposed by the Republic, which greatly irritated Walsh, the film - based on a novel by W.R. Burnett and inspired by the exploits of the infamous William Quantrill - remains on dignified levels.

title: Five Come Back
actors: Joseph Calleia, Chester Morris, Lucille Ball, John Carradine, Charles Aubrey Smith
description: The "Silver Queen" plane is forced to land in the cannibal-infested jungle. The aircraft can resume the journey with only five people. To have to choose the survivors will be the life prisoner Vasquez.
notes: The unity of place and action allows Farrow to create a moral apologue with this narrative archetype.

title: Motocross Kids
actors: Lorenzo Lamas, Alana Austin, Bobby Preston, Brandon Alexander, Jerry Asher
description: Some bad guys on their roaring two-wheels terrify Callie and her friends, who are motocross fans. The girl's father, the instructor Evan Hanson (with the help of the friendly chimpanzee Cody) will take care of defeating them ...
notes: Renegade's long-time Lamas remains in the saddle (on a motorcycle), but the film is of a disheartening poverty.

title: King Kong
actors: Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody, Jamie Bell, Kyle Chandler, Andy Serkis, Evan Parke, Colin Hanks, John Sumner, Lobo Chan, Thomas Kretschmann
description: 1930s: Director Carl Denham moves to the Skull Islands, near Sumatra, to shoot a documentary. Arriving there, the crew discover the King Kong gorilla, who lives in a jungle where some prehistoric creatures have been protected and hidden for millions of years. When Kong meets the beautiful Ann Darrow, he succumbs to her charm and ends up being captured and transported to New York, where he is locked up in a cage and exhibited to the crowd. But then...
notes: Jackson makes us tremble, jump, horrify, move and even laugh, evoking the mortal clash between civilization and nature, between cinema and its impossible materialization.

title: Sergeants 3
actors: Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Peter Lawford, Sammy Davis jr., Joey Bishop, Henry Silva, Ruta Lee

title: King of the Pecos
actors: John Wayne, Muriel Evans, Cy Kendall, Jack Clifford, Arthur Aylesworth
description: John Claybor is the son of a landowner who was orphaned when his father was killed, along with his wife, by an unscrupulous farmer intent on taking over their ranch. Growing up, John studies a way to avenge the killing of his parents. Failing to frame the killer with legal methods, he will gather around him a gang of gunslingers and do justice for himself.
notes: Among the B-series westerns of the 1930s with John Wayne, this is one of the best. The opening scene has an impact: seminal and engaging, it convinces us to follow this story of revenge. Wayne effectively delineates his character's ambivalence, torn between compliance with the law and the need for revenge.

title: Four Brothers
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Tyrese Gibson, Andre Benjamin, Garrett Hedlund, Fionnula Flanagan
description: Bobby, Angel, Jeremiah and Jack are adoptive siblings, each with a radically different existence from the others. When their foster mother is killed in a robbery, the four reunite to find the culprit ...
notes: John Singleton, after the remake of _Shaft_, continues on the path of the action blockbuster designed especially for the African American public, and this time it hits the mark, at least in terms of box office. That he is a talented director is out of the question. This is demonstrated by some purely adrenaline-fueled sequences, such as the Fort Apache-like shooting at the four brothers' house and the showdown between the boss of the bad guys and Mark Wahlberg in the "desert" of snow and ice. Too bad he relies on the easy and tangled script by David Elliot and Paul Lovett, overloaded with unlikely moments (above all, the siege of the corrupt cop and Tyrese with its incredible epilogue). Of the old militancy, that is when he dreamed of a radical cinema, Singleton retains few things, just the amusing hint of the union of gangsters. The rest, honestly, is business as usual.

title: Casanova
actors: Heath Ledger, Jeremy Irons, Charlie Cox, Lena Olin, Sienna Miller, Stephen Greif
description: Casanova falls in love with the beautiful Venetian Francesca, who rejects him. While the Inquisition is on his trail to arrest him, Casanova tries in every way to approach Francesca ...
notes: The 1950s air of the film evokes more _The Adventures of Giacomo Casanova_ di Steno than Fellini's obscure eighteenth century. After his "authorial" beginnings (_My life on all fours, _Happy birthday Mr. Grape_), Hallström has unfortunately got stuck in the recent "European-flavored" Hollywood cinema, which is a far more deadly trap than Hollywood escape cinema. So he takes himself a little too seriously, failing to be light and have fun all the way.

title: Chain of Command
actors: Michael Dudikoff, Todd Curtis, Keren Tishman, R. Lee Ermey, Steve Greenstein

title: Evil Eyes
actors: Adam Baldwin, Udo Kier, Mark Sheppard, Jennifer Gates, Kristin Lorenz

title: Dark Water
actors: Jennifer Connelly, John C. Reilly, Tim Roth, Dougray Scott, Pete Postlethwaite
description: Following a tough legal battle over custody of her daughter, Dahlia moves in with her baby in a new home. But here her problems are not over: the young woman must in fact deal with mysterious and dark noises, a strange leak of dark water from the ceiling and the ghosts of the previous owners ...
notes: The direction is rigorous, and he has the courage to take his time (it is therefore very far from boxed horror); the gaze on the metropolis as a prison of the spirit is very convincing; and Jennifer Connelly gives an excellent performance as an actress. _Dark Water_ reworks the Japanese original with a good contextual conscience.

title: The Gunfighter
actors: Gregory Peck, Helen Westcott, Millard Mitchell, Jean Parker, Karl Malden

title: Rocketship X-M
actors: Lloyd Bridges, Osa Massen, John Emery, Noah Beery jr., Hugh O'Brian

title: Solarbabies
actors: Richard Jordan, Jami Gertz, Jason Patric, Lukas Haas, Charles Durning, Adrian Pasdar
description: A nuclear war has dried up the oceans and the Earth has become a desert planet whose most precious resource, water, is managed by the multinational E-Protecorate. The corporation removes children from their families and trains them for war and sport in orphanages. But one day little Daniel finds a magical extraterrestrial sphere that grants his every wish. Thus begins a glowing flight to freedom ...
notes: A lot of productive effort just to copy _Mad Max? _ Well yes, nothing new under the sun of the apocalypse, including sets, make-up and wigs. Sure, the young Gibson didn't have a magic sphere, but a touch of originality never hurts ...

title: Geronimo
actors: Armando Silvestre, Chuck Connors, Kamala Devi, Pat Conway
description: 1883. To try to continue the fight against the whites, the Indian chief Geronimo, in command of his apaches, takes refuge in Mexico. In the meantime, the United States Congress opens an investigation thanks to which the rights of the Indians are recognized.
notes: Western series B on the side of the Indians, embellished with beautiful photography by Alex Phillips. The film, however, went down in history (so to speak) for the somewhat over the top, but at the time much appreciated test, by Chuck Connors, when it was not so rare for white actors, even of a certain fame, to interpret Native American roles, even historically existed.

title: Project Viper
actors: Patrick Muldoon, Theresa Russell, Curtis Armstrong, Joe Avalon
description: A new form of life called "Viper", developed in the laboratory and constituted by the fusion between human DNA and microchip, must be transported to Mars to continue the experimentation. To this end, NASA trains a team of specialists and sends it into orbit: but the "thing" - similar to a sort of snail - turns out to be starved of human flesh and exterminates the entire crew. The delicate situation requires the intervention of special agent Mike Connors and doctor Nancy Burnham, "inventor" of the deadly creature: which, however, does not seem to be the only one in circulation ...
notes: Nothing new under the sun of "science-fiction".

title: Submerged
actors: Steven Seagal, Christine Adams, William Hope, Nick Brimble, Alison King
description: Military Chris Kody is released from the prison he is in and re-aggregated to his old team, tasked with capturing a scientist who has developed a diabolical psychic control system capable of transforming anyone into a ruthless killer ...
notes: A film tailor-made for Seagal, that is, null in all respects.

title: The Legend of Zorro
actors: Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Giovanna Zacarías, Raúl Méndez, Adrian Alonso, Nick Chinlund
description: Alejandro and Elena have a ten-year-old son, Joaquin. When California, on the verge of becoming the 31st state of the Union, is threatened by an evil plot hatched by unscrupulous landowners and businessmen, Alejandro does not hesitate to don the mask of Zorro to foil their intent despite that means. jeopardize the safety of his family.
notes: The hero created in 1919 by Johnston McCulley has seen, endured and overcome many, but this time he can't make it. Overwhelmed by the action "relapse" of director Martin Campbell (the same as the most successful _The Mask of Zorro_) is, in many scenes, a very agitated 007 masked. Disoriented by the screenplay's chain accelerations (by Orci and Kurtzman, good for _Alias_, not _The Island_) he is more of a seasoned acrobat than an ironic executioner. The alchemy between Banderas and Zeta-Jones is a pale memory. Blockbuster contracts aren't equipped for miracles.

title: Millennium
actors: Kris Kristofferson, Cheryl Ladd, Daniel J. Travanti, Robert Joy
description: Investigating the causes of an air disaster, Detective Bill Smith discovers that some individuals from the future are involved in the affair, determined to avert the irreparable ecological catastrophe to which the Earth seems destined ...
notes: From a novel by John Varley, a film attributable to the "committed" science fiction trend.

title: Crack In the World
actors: Dana Andrews, Janette Scott, Kieron Moore, Alexander Knox, Peter Damon

title: Panic in Year Zero!
actors: Ray Milland, Jean Hagen, Frankie Avalon, Mary Mitchel, Joan Freeman

title: Serenity
actors: Nathan Fillion, Gina Torres, Alan Tudyk, Morena Baccarin, Adam Baldwin, Summer Glau, Jewel Staite, Sean Maher
description: Captain Malcolm Reynolds and his team of mercenaries travel across the galaxy in the Serenity spacecraft in search of lucrative gigs. When Doctor Simon Tam and his sister River come aboard, learning of secrets that should have remained so, the crew of the Serenity must begin a tough battle for survival ...

title: The Proud Rebel
actors: Alan Ladd, Olivia de Havilland, Dean Jagger, Cecil Kellaway, John Carradine, Harry Dean Stanton, Henry Hull

title: Foxfire
actors: Barton McLane, Jane Russell, Jeff Chandler, Dan Duryea, Mara Corday

title: The Hunting Party
actors: Gene Hackman, Oliver Reed, Candice Bergen, Simon Oakland
description: Frank, leader of a gang of outlaws, would like to learn to read and write and for this reason he kidnaps Melissa, a young teacher wife of Brandt, rich and degenerate ranchero. He, reached by the news of the kidnapping while some friends are traveling on a hunting trip during which long-range rifles and telescopes are tested, begins the search for the kidnappers. Meanwhile, Melissa, several times protected by Frank from the assaults of the other members of the gang, falls in love with him. The two attempt to save themselves by reaching the border and trying to escape Brandt's hunt.
notes: Violent and rather crude Western.

title: Saw II
actors: Donnie Wahlberg, Dina Meyer, Shawnee Smith, Tobin Bell, Franky G, Glenn Plummer
description: Jigsaw, ruthless killer, has returned to strike. But this time, Detective Eric Mason managed to find out where the riddler is hiding. But the raid on the monster's lair is only the beginning of a new nightmare involving eight people and Mason himself ...
notes: Bousman writes and directs with one eye on the mechanical citation of '90s horror (how much damage _Scream_ did!) And another on the troubled imagination of the times (the poster with the severed fingers evoked the Twin Towers for perspective). With its sadism, _Saw 2_ is far from harmless. You can appreciate it as long as you don't ignore it.

title: Sniper 2
actors: Tom Berenger, Bokeem Woodbine, Erika Marozsán, Tamás Puskás
description: Thomas Beckett, a former Marine sniper who had been on a mission to Panama to try to stop drug trafficking, is this time instructed by the US government to hit a Serbian general accused of instigating and directing an ethnic cleansing operation against the Muslims. His partner in this mission will be a death row inmate who, thanks to this post, could earn his freedom.
notes: Tom Berenger returns as Thomas Beckett in this sequel to _One Shot One Kill. The direction this time is by Craig R. Baxley, TV movie specialist.

title: A Lust to Kill
actors: Jim Davis, Don Megowan, Allison Hayes, Sandra Giles
description: Taking advantage of the permission to attend the funeral of his brother, killed by the men of the law, a convict - using a weapon passed to him by his girlfriend - takes advantage of it to escape: as soon as he is free, he rushes on the trail of his former accomplices, whom he considers responsible for the death brother ...
notes: A rather obvious "B-western".

title: Best of the Best 2
actors: Eric Roberts, Phillip Rhee, Chris Penn, Edan Gross, Ralf Moeller, Patrick Kilpatrick
description: In a clandestine fighting arena, Travis Brickley is killed after losing a martial arts duel to Brakus. Walter Grady, son of Travis' best friend, decides to avenge his death by challenging Brakus ...
notes: Nothing more than a series of kicks, punches and hasty rhetoric.

title: Seed of Chucky
actors: Jennifer Tilly, Redman, Hannah Spearritt, John Waters, Keith-Lee Castle

title: Silent Warnings
actors: Stephen Baldwin, A.J. Buckley, Billy Zane, Callie De Fabry, David O'Donnell
description: After the accidental death of her cousin Joe, Layne Vossimer, who has just graduated in electrical engineering, joins his girlfriend and four friends to visit and clean up the farm he inherited in the open countryside. The group of boys reach the location where the building is located and here they meet Bill, a local sheriff and old friend of Joe who is also mourning Joe's death. When the five arrive near the farm, they discover some mysterious and strange signs appearing in the wheat fields. At first they believe that this is a joke of the locals. When Iris disappears, the rest of the group realizes that there is a serious threat hovering over that place.

title: Oklahoma!
actors: Gordon MacRae, Gloria Grahame, Gene Nelson, Charlotte Greenwood

title: The Real Glory
actors: Gary Cooper, David Niven, Andrea Leeds, Reginald Owen, Broderick Crawford

title: Nevada Smith
actors: Steve McQueen, Karl Malden, Brian Keith, Arthur Kennedy
description: Nevada witnesses helplessly the brutal killing of their parents, an Indian woman and a white man, at the hands of three money-hungry men. Alone in the world now, the only thing left to him is to find the killers and execute them. Taken under the wing by an arms dealer, Nevada is instructed to become a perfect killer and comes to deceive and rob innocents, increasingly blinded by the thirst for revenge.

title: Underworld Evolution
actors: Kate Beckinsale, Scott Speedman, Tony Curran, Derek Jacobi, Bill Nighy, Steven Mackintosh
description: Selene and Michael, after the events of the first film, are on the run, in search of the origins of their lineage. Meanwhile Marcus (Vampire) has awakened and is determined to free his brother William (Werewolf) from his centuries-old imprisonment ...
notes: The class conflict between bloodsuckers (aristocrats) and werewolves (brutes and slaves) of the previous episode fades; on the other hand, the gore, the gothic atmospheres, the digital one increase. Shot with too many references to the aesthetics of video games, the film is pleasant if taken as the zero degree of adventure. Incredibly beautiful Kate Beckinsale, protagonist of an "evolution" in an erotic key.

title: Bird of Paradise
actors: Dolores Del Rio, Joel McCrea, John Halliday, Bert Roach

title: Son of Dracula
actors: Lon Chaney jr., Robert Paige, Louise Allbritton, Evelyn Ankers

title: Dallas
actors: Gary Cooper, Ruth Roman, Steve Cochran, Raymond Massey

title: Aeon Flux
actors: Charlize Theron, Marton Csokas, Jonny Lee Miller, Sophie Okonedo, Frances McDormand, Pete Postlethwaite
description: 2411: after a virus exterminates 90% of the human race, the survivors find themselves living in Bregna, a city subject to the dictatorship of the Goodchild family. In a world where everything seems to work perfectly, Aeon Flux, at the head of a group of anarchists, struggles to prove that reality is deceptive and seeks revenge for the extermination of his family at the hands of government agents ...
notes: Theron was missing a role as a sci-fi heroine: the opportunity comes from this MTV production, which takes the idea from a pre-existing animated series (by Peter Chung) and scripted by Phil Hay and Matt Manfredi. A thin weave, a carryover neo-humanism (how far away _Gattaca _...), but an original scenic setting, inspired by Bauhaus architecture and design.

title: Hostel
actors: Jay Hernandez, Derek Richardson, Eythor Gudjonsson, Barbara Nedeljakova, Jan Vlasák, Jana Kaderabkova
description: Two American boys and an Icelandic, traveling to the old continent, are looking for strong adventures. They then decide to go to Slovakia, where the most "uninhibited" girls seem to be. In fact, the three do not struggle to find what they are looking for, but when they wake up they find themselves involved in a terrifying situation.
notes: How do you approach _Hostel_? With some reasonable doubts but with the knowledge that Eli Roth is not looking for easy solutions. Is there therefore no hope for the executioners and above all for the victims? The answer remains in midair, and perhaps in this ambiguity that forces you to ask questions, lies the political value of the film.

title: The Maze
actors: Richard Carlson, Veronica Hurst, Katherine Emery, Michael Pate

title: Santa Fe Stampede
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune, June Martel
description: Plot in preparation

title: Three Texas Steers
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune, Carole Landis

title: Wyoming Outlaw
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Raymond Hatton, Donald Barry
description: Plot in preparation

title: Comanche Territory
actors: Maureen O'Hara, Macdonald Carey, Will Geer, Charles Drake

title: Lone Hand
actors: Joel McCrea, Barbara Hale, Alex Nicol, Charles Drake, Jimmy Hunt

title: War Arrow
actors: Maureen O'Hara, Jeff Chandler, John McIntire, Suzan Ball

title: Johnny Dark
actors: Tony Curtis, Piper Laurie, Don Taylor, Paul Kelly, Ilka Chase
description: Johnny Dark, a young engineer from Fielding Motor, has created a new car that Mr. Fielding, the owner, doesn't want to make. Only when for reasons of prestige, the company is forced to create something new, Mr. Fielding authorizes the construction of the car designed by Johnny. But it is immediately put aside, although it presents itself very well and reveals excellent qualities. But Mr. Fielding's resistances are overcome thanks to the will of Johnny and the owner's beautiful niece, Lisa ...

title: Reprisal!
actors: Guy Madison, Felicia Farr, Kathryn Grant, Michael Pate

title: The Hard Man
actors: Guy Madison, Valerie French, Lorne Greene, Barry Atwater

title: The Desperadoes
actors: Randolph Scott, Glenn Ford, Claire Trevor, Evelyn Keyes, Edgar Buchanan, Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Raymond Walburn, Porter Hall, Bernard Nedell, Joan Woodbury
description: Steve Upton (Randolph Scott) is the sheriff of a small town in Utah who receives a visit from Cheyenne Rogers (Glenn Ford), his old friend who was once an outlaw but got back on track with Upton's help. However, just as Cheyenne Rogers is in town, the bank is robbed and suspicions obviously fall on him. However, Upton is convinced of his friend's innocence and helps him escape from prison. Together the two will set out on the trail of the real culprits.

title: Plunder of the Sun
actors: Glenn Ford, Diana Lynn, Patricia Medina, Francis L. Sullivan

title: Final Destination 3
actors: Mary Elizabeth Winstead, Ryan Merriman, Kris Lemche, Amanda Crew, Alexz Johnson
description: While celebrating graduation at a playground, Wendy has the premonition that a terrible roller coaster accident will cause people on board to die. He manages to convince his friend Kevin and a few others to get out and shortly after, on time, disaster strikes. But death is hard to escape and, one by one, survivors start dying in terrifying ways. Wendy and Kevin try to figure out how they can save themselves ...
notes: The director and creator of the first chapter is back but the formula was already repetitive in the first film, imagine the third. Some deaths, however, are creative enough to be of interest to lovers of the genre.

title: You'll Find Out
actors: Peter Lorre, Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Kay Kyser, Dennis O'Keefe

title: Eight Below
actors: Paul Walker, Jason Biggs, Bruce Greenwood, Moon Bloodgood, Gerard Plunkett
description: During an expedition to Antarctica, three explorers are forced to abandon their sled dogs - six Siberian huskies and two Eskimo wolves - to escape to safety. The animals will have to face a thousand dangers before rescuers set out in search of them ...

title: Five Guns West
actors: John Lund, Dorothy Malone, Mike Connors, R. Wright Campbell
description: Plot in preparation

title: Not of This Earth
actors: Paul Birch, Beverly Garland, Morgan Jones, William Roerick

title: The Wasp Woman
actors: Susan Cabot, Anthony Eisley, Barboura Morris, William Roerick
description: The queen of cosmetic researchers develops and tests a wasp enzyme capable of rejuvenating the skin. At night, however, it turns into a giant wasp thirsty for human blood ...
notes: The Corman factory as it can be stereotyped: absurd story, low budget and amused fun.

title: Last Woman on Earth
actors: Betsy Jones-Moreland, Antony Carbone, Robert Towne
description: Harold Gern, a successful industrialist, is on vacation in Puerto Rico with his wife Evelyn and Martin, his friend and lawyer. During a boat trip the three decide to do some diving. When they emerge they realize with horror that they are unable to breathe without the help of oxygen cylinders. A catastrophe has killed all humans and Harold, Martin and Evelyn discover they are the only three survivors.
notes: With the maximum economy of means, a simple story and few characters, Roger Corman makes a film in which tension and mystery are the masters. Among many questions that keep the attention alive, everything is suspended until the last. Screenplay by Robert Towne.

title: Macabre
actors: William Prince, Jim Backus, Christine White, Jacqueline Scott

title: The Americano
actors: Glenn Ford, Frank Lovejoy, Cesar Romero, Ursula Thiess

title: The Old Dark House
actors: Tom Poston, Robert Morley, Janette Scott, Joyce Grenfell
description: Tom, a traveling salesman who trades in American cars, arrives one evening at Femm Castle in Wales to deliver one. Tom finds his client Caspar dead in a trap door in the manor, but that's not the only, shall we say, strange thing he discovers. The surprise is great when he gets to know the other members of the family, including the sisters of the deceased Morgana and Cecily. But the troubles for him are not over because other cruel crimes are committed in the old castle.
notes: Remake of the film of the same name directed by James Whale in 1932. Back then the actors were called Boris Karloff, Melvyn Douglas and Charles Laughton. Production is Columbia, Hammer and Castle.

title: Strait-Jacket
actors: Joan Crawford, Diane Baker, Leif Erickson, Howard St. John
description: Lucy is discharged from the psychiatric clinic where she had been locked up for tearing apart her husband and his mistress with an ax. Waiting for her in the house of her brother and his wife who have decided to host her, she finds her daughter Carol who, at the time, was a child. That natural relationship of affection is re-established between mother and daughter, which is disturbed by Lucy's nightmares. The situation worsens when the corpses of a doctor and a farmer are found and it turns out that they were killed in the same way as the murders committed twenty years earlier.
notes: Castle resolutely shoots a film based on a story by Robert Bloch.

title: The Night Walker
actors: Robert Taylor, Barbara Stanwyck, Judi Meredith, Hayden Rorke

title: A Wrinkle in Time
actors: Katie Stuart, David Dorfman, Gregory Smith, Kate Nelligan, Alfre Woodard, Alison Elliott
description: Meg and Charles set out in search of their father, who disappeared during an experiment he was working on for the government. Calvin and three extravagant ladies named Which, Who and Whatsit help them. The sextet is involved in an expedition that will reserve amazing adventures ...

title: The Fog
actors: Tom Welling, Selma Blair, DeRay Davis, Kenneth Welsh, Maggie Grace
description: A secluded town on the northern coast of California is shrouded in thick mist rising from the sea: ghosts of a bloodstained past are hiding, now seeking revenge ...
notes: In this remake of Carpenter's film, everything unravels smoothly, with no connection between the facts: zero tension, tautological and involuntarily self-suggestive dialogues (catchphrase: "What's going on?" "I don't know !!!"), none of the performers (including _Smallville_'s Superman, and a black actor inevitably reduced to speck) has a shred of credibility. And even the computer fog is less effective than the original one.

title: Southland Tales
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Seann William Scott, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Justin Timberlake, Bai Ling, Miranda Richardson, Mandy Moore, Kevin Smith
description: July 4, 2008: a nuclear attack shocks America. In California, an energy generator alters the Earth's rotation. An action star, a porn star and twins try to stem the damage ...

title: The Beast
actors: William Petersen, Karen Sillas, Charles Martin Smith, Ronald Guttman
description: The small coastal community of Graves Point is devastated by the tragic and inexplicable disappearance of a young couple at sea. After some inspections, Dr. Talley - a marine biologist - believes that he has found the mystery solved: a very rare and enormous squid would wander in the depths ...

title: The Cutter
actors: Chuck Norris, Joanna Pacula, Daniel Bernhardt, Bernie Kopell
description: A private detective investigates the disappearance of a well-known diamond expert, kidnapped on the orders of a Nazi criminal.

title: Poseidon
actors: Kurt Russell, Josh Lucas, Richard Dreyfuss, Jacinda Barrett, Emmy Rossum, Mike Vogel, Mia Maestro
description: On New Year's Eve, while the passengers are celebrating, a 50-meter tidal wave hits the luxurious Poseidon ship and capsizes it. The survivors, led by Dylan and Robert, try to escape ...
notes: Wolfgang Petersen said he took his cue from _The Adventure of Poseidon_ by Roland Neame (founder, in 1972, of the "catastrophic"), to write a new screenplay, with contemporary characters. And that the story of Poseidon is the story of these characters. This demonstrates that contemporaneity, especially cinematic, is far flatter and duller than the past. In fact, Petersen's film, with means that Neame's did not even dream of, works well, especially in the first part, on a spectacular and "anxious" level. Too bad the characters are less interesting than those embarked on any _Love Boat_.

title: The Omen
actors: Liev Schreiber, Julia Stiles, Seamus Davey-Fitzpatrick, Mia Farrow, David Thewlis
description: The son of an American diplomat is born dead. On the advice of Father Spiletto and unaware of his wife, the newborn is replaced by Damien, a child born the same night, whose mother died in childbirth. Around the little one, however, an increasing number of disturbing facts occur: it is in fact the long prophesied Antichrist ...
notes: Farrow, a Satanist nanny, winks at the possessed imagination of which she was the absolute star, but you really never get excited. Professional packaging, a bit like a TV show, raised only by the remarkable performance of the actors: above all Liev Schreiber in the sinister role of the diplomat.

title: Meltdown
actors: Casper Van Dien, Venus Terzo, Stefanie von Pfetten, Amanda Crew
description: Despite the warnings of the scientist Nathan, a dangerous experiment continues that leads to the explosion of an asteroid, of which the main fragment heads towards the Earth. Although it can be diverted, the asteroid is so close to the sun that it causes increased global warming and an apocalyptic situation on Earth. In this climate, Nathan offers his sister Carly and boyfriend Tom the chance to go with a couple of loved ones to a weather station in the Arctic.

title: Homicidal
actors: Glenn Corbett, Patricia Breslin, Eugenie Leontovich, Alan Bunce

title: Mr. Sardonicus
actors: Oskar Homolka, Ronald Lewis, Audrey Dalton, Guy Rolfe
description: Sardonicus has his face covered with a mask that hides his frozen face in a grin of death. Maude, Baron's wife, sends a letter to her former flame, Dr. Richard, the only one who seems to be able to solve the problem. The doctor discovers why Sardonicus has that deadly grin: he was digging his father's grave in search of a winning lottery ticket, and when he saw the corpse, the muscles in his face froze leaving him looking like a living skull. . Using Maude as blackmail, Sardonicus forces Richard to attempt radical intervention to restore his face to normal, but ...
notes: Good horror of the king of B movies.

title: Robin Hood
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Wallace Beery, Sam De Grasse, Enid Bennett, Paul Dickey, William Lowery

title: The Three Musketeers
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Léon Barry, George Siegmann, Eugene Pallette

title: The Iron Mask
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Marguerite De La Motte, Belle Bennett

title: The Restless Breed
actors: Scott Brady, Anne Bancroft, Jay C. Flippen, Jim Davis

title: Rough Riders
actors: Tom Berenger, Sam Elliott, Gary Busey, Brad Johnson

title: Tarzan and His Mate
actors: Johnny Weissmuller, Maureen O'Sullivan, Neil Hamilton, Paul Cavanagh

title: The Black Pirate
actors: Douglas Fairbanks, Billie Dove, Tempe Pigott, Donald Crisp
description: A young nobleman dreams of avenging the death of his father, who was killed in a pirate attack. To fine-tune his plan, he manages to infiltrate the pirate gang, posing as one of them. But things get complicated when the pirates capture a ship on which there is a girl whom he wishes to save from the clutches of his own companions.

title: Mortuary
actors: Dan Byrd, Denise Crosby, Stephanie Patton, Alexandra Adi
description: After her husband's death, Ms. Doyle moves to California with her two children. Together they take over the management of the Fowler brothers' funeral home, soon discovering - and at their own expense - that something lurks near their new home ...
notes: It doesn't even start badly, this _The Keeper_: which works as long as Hooper can manage a suspense made of nothing, that is, played on the suspicious and terrified looks of the inhabitants or on the silent voids that surround the mansion. When the horror is highlighted, however, the "low budget" nature of the production takes its course, and everything becomes a "I wish but I cannot".

title: Secondhand Lions
actors: Michael Caine, Robert Duvall, Haley Joel Osment, Kyra Sedgwick

title: Militia
actors: Dean Cain, Jennifer Beals, Frederic Forrest, Stacy Keach, John Beck
description: Special Agent Ethan Carter must infiltrate the subversive "Brotherhood of Liberty" militia, a far-right paramilitary organization that wants to overthrow the US government and impose a new world order. The dangerous group, led by TV presenter George Armstrong, has come into possession of three missiles with enormous destructive potential and threaten the life of the American President. Alongside Carter, in addition to the charming recruit Julia Sanders, is former Special Agent Fain, a shadow of the protagonist's past ...

title: Ultraviolet
actors: Milla Jovovich, Cameron Bright, Nick Chinlund, Sebastien Andrieu, William Fichtner, Ida Martin
description: Late 21st century. Humanity has been decimated by an error in bio-genetic experimentation: instead of creating super-soldiers, the virus has transformed people into bloodsucking, vampires who in turn spread the disease. Violet, a splendid vampire who has contracted the virus, must protect Six, a boy who possesses the secret for the salvation of humanity: in fact, the cure for all Bloodsucking flows in her blood.
notes: The film is made up of a series of interminable fights set in an aesthetic that oscillates between the glacial commercial of a trendy amaro and the bar video game. The bodies of the actors portrayed on the computer so as to be similar to the abundant digital animations. A pinball machine, a pixelated imaginary where the cinema is not clear where it is, certainly not in the story and much less in the staging. Milla is good, we know, we have always supported her; but if you throw it away with such crap you can only say that it has a great future behind it.

title: Underclassman
actors: Kelly Hu, Nick Cannon, Adrian Young, Art Bonilla, Bart McCarthy, Ian Gomez
description: After the mysterious death of a school newspaper assault reporter, the LAPD captain sends bicycle officer Tracy "Tre" Stokes on an investigative mission. "Tre" goes undercover in the school (an exclusive private high school attended by high society students) and immediately gets into trouble with the principal: but he discovers that the boy's death is linked to a recent series of car thefts in turn part of a bigger deal that also involves drug trafficking ...
notes: Flat and predictable script: It's not with movies like these that Nick Cannon can aspire to the title again Eddie Murphy.

title: Komodo vs. Cobra
actors: Michelle Borth, Jerri Manthey, Glori-Anne Gilbert, Ryan McTavish
description: On a remote Pacific island, the US government is conducting a series of top-secret tests on the effect that are capable of causing highly radioactive rays. But something is wrong and the experiment soon turns into a tragedy. A Komodo monitor and a king cobra, subjected to radiation, grow out of all proportion and, once the laboratory is destroyed, wreak havoc on the entire island. No one is able to stop their destructive force and the fight between the two gigantic beasts will be no holds barred.
notes: Pure trash shot on an island in Hawaii.

title: Color Me Blood Red
actors: Gordon Oas-Heim, Candi Conder, Elyn Warner, Pat Lee, Jerome Eden
description: An eccentric artist, Adam Sorg, finds the right color in human blood to paint his pictures. After using his own, he decides to procure the raw material by carrying out a series of heinous murders.

title: The Gore Gore Girls
actors: Frank Kress, Amy Farrell, Hedda Lubin, Henny Youngman
description: Detective Abraham Gentry investigates the crimes of some topless bar dancers. After a roundup of imaginative murders, Gentry unmasks the serial killer.

title: Mimic 2
actors: Alix Koromzay, Bruno Campos, Will Estes, Gaven Eugene Lucas
description: Entomologist Remy, a biology teacher in New York, is suspected by police detective Klaski of being the "black widow" serial killer. Soon, however, elements emerge that reveal how the killer is actually a monstrous mutant insect, capable of assuming human features ...

title: Deuces Wild
actors: Stephen Dorff, Brad Renfro, Fairuza Balk, Matt Dillon, Ronnie Marmo, Shamus Murphy, Alex City, James Franco
description: In 1950s New York, dominated by gang wars, Leon and Bobby have lost a brother to an overdose and are now fighting to keep drugs out of their neighborhood, along with the Deuces gang. To hinder the plans come the rivals Vipers, determined to export shady trades out of their territory: the clash between gangs will be inevitable.
notes: Despite the good cast of young actors, the film suffers from an artificiality that makes it not very credible: the reconstruction of New York half a century ago is lacking in depth and the dialogues sound fake. Life and fiction are tragically confused in the fate of Brad Renfro, who died in 2008, aged just 25, from a heroin overdose.

title: The Three Outlaws
actors: Neville Brand, Alan Hale, Bruce Bennett, Jeanne Carmen
description: Ready to leave their criminal lives, America's three greatest wanted men - Butch Cassidy, the Sundance Kid and Bill Carver - rob a last train and leave for Mexico. In retaliation, the bank where they deposit the money is robbed by El Gallo, a local thug. The three, on the verge of bankruptcy and at risk of deportation, thus make a new series of shots, designed in the style of El Gallo. An American detective arrives in search of the three and gets the help of El Gallo himself ...
notes: Typical 1950s "low budget" western, with little psychology but a lot of action: enjoyable at times.

title: A Thunder of Drums
actors: Richard Boone, George Hamilton, Luana Patten, Charles Bronson
description: Lieutenant McQuade is having trouble with the cavalry commander. The situation becomes complicated when he discovers that his old flame is now engaged to the captain.
notes: A subdued western that, however, manages to shine thanks to the excellent cast, above all Boone, and the precise direction of Joseph N. Newman.

title: 976-EVIL
actors: Stephen Geoffreys, Jim Metzler, Sandy Dennis, Robert Picardo

title: Pathfinder
actors: Karl Urban, Jay Tavare, Nathaniel Arcand, Wayne Baker
description: The only survivor of the shipwreck of a Viking expedition that came to raid the American coasts, a young man is adopted by a tribe of natives: nicknamed "Ghost" for his pale complexion, he grows up among them and becomes a brave warrior, making available of his new family his military skills. But when the Vikings return to wreak havoc among the peaceful people of the Wampanoag, he'll have to choose which people he really belongs to ...
notes: Patinated epic, full of slow motion and toned colors, steeped in mechanically stacked stereotypes. Remake of "The Ice Archer" (by Norwegian Nils Gaup) screaming for revenge.

title: The Last Command
actors: Sterling Hayden, Anna Maria Alberghetti, Richard Carlson, Ernest Borgnine, J.Carroll Nash, Ben Cooper
description: In the Alamo fortress, besieged by Mexican forces, Jim Bowie, along with other legendary heroes of the Texas War of Independence such as Davy Crockett and William Barret Travis, organizes the Texan resistance and falls fighting to the last.

title: Fright Night Part 2
actors: Roddy McDowall, Julie Carmen, William Ragdale, Jonathan Gries

title: Picture Mommy Dead
actors: Don Ameche, Martha Hyer, Susan Gordon, Zsa Zsa Gabor, Signe Hasso

title: The Kid from Texas
actors: Audie Murphy, Gale Storm, Albert Dekker, Shepperd Strudwick
description: Bill is a very young Texas cowboy who, after killing a man who insulted his mother, is forced to flee. He finds refuge with a breeder, Roger, who becomes a close friend to him. Unfortunately, Roger is killed by competing breeders. Bill then vows to take revenge.

title: The Buccaneer
actors: Franciska Gaal, Akim Tamiroff, Margot Grahame

title: Scream for Help
actors: Rachel Kelly, David Brooks, Marie Masters, Lolita Lorre, Rocco Sisto

title: Arizona Bushwhackers
actors: Howard Keel, Yvonne De Carlo, John Ireland, Scott Brady, Brian Donlevyn Marilyn Maxwell

title: Bloody Birthday
actors: Julie Brown, Lory Lethin, José Ferrer, Susan Strasberg, Melinda Cordell

title: Cattle Empire
actors: Joel McCrea, Gloria Talbot, Don Haggerty, Phyllis Coates

title: Swashbuckler
actors: Robert Shaw, Geneviève Bujold, James Earl Jones, Peter Boyle
description: At the limit due to the pressure of the tyrannical governor Lord Durand, the people of Kingstone, Jamaica, are stirred up in revolt by Captain Ned Linch, who has landed with his crew of pirates to save his right hand, Nick. Durand's response is not long in coming: the arrest of Sir James Barnet pushes Jane, the daughter of the nobleman, to seek help from the pirate.

title: Fort Utah
actors: John Ireland, Virginia Mayo, Scott Brady, John Russell

title: Passage West
actors: John Payne, Dennis O'Keefe, Arleen Wheelan, Frank Faylen
description: In 1863, after escaping, six inmates led by assassin Pete Black attack a pioneer caravan led by preacher Jacob Karns. Tensions and difficulties build as travelers traverse the dry and desolate landscape that will lead them to California.

title: Three Musketeers
actors: John Wayne, Ruth Hall, Noah Beery, Francis X. Bushman jr.

title: Frankenstein - 1970
actors: Boris Karloff, Jana Lund, Tom Duggan, Charlotte Austin, Norbert Schiller

title: Eddie Macon's Run
actors: John Schneider, Kirk Douglas, Lee Purcell, Tom Noonan, John Goodman
description: Convicted of an unspoken crime, a man escapes from prison and aims to cross the border into Mexico. A detective hunts him relentlessly.

title: Black Horse Canyon
actors: Joel McCrea, Mari Blanchard, Race Gentry, Murvyn Vye

title: Genghis Khan
actors: Omar Sharif, Stephen Boyd, James Mason, Eli Wallach, François Dorleac, Telly Savalas

title: House of Dracula
actors: John Carradine, Lon Chaney jr., Martha O'Driscoll, Lionel Atwill

title: Empire of the Ants
actors: Joan Collins, John David Carson, Tom Fadden, Robert Lansing

title: Johnny Concho
actors: Frank Sinatra, Keenan Wynn, William Conrad, Claude Akins

title: Young Fury
actors: Rory Calhoun, Virginia Mayo, Lon Chaney jr., John Agar
description: A group of juvenile delinquents is holding the city of Dawson in check with their misdeeds. The cowardly sheriff is unable to handle the situation and Clint, the father of the gang leader, is forced to intervene. Clint is a former notorious gunslinger, who returns to take up arms once again for a confrontation that hides dramatic family reasons.

title: Malaya
actors: Spencer Tracy, James Stewart, Valentina Cortese, Gilbert Roland

title: Seakiller
actors: Dayton Ka'ne, Robert Atamu, Bob Spiegel, Kathleen Swan
description: An orphan lives in Polynesia and has a shark as a friend. He wants to give his sweetheart a precious pearl but others want that jewel.
notes: From the novel Ti-Koyo and his shark by Clement Richer.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
actors: Michael Sacks, Valerine Perrine, Ron Leibman, Eugene Roche;Sharon Gans
description: Present, past and future of Billy Pilgrim, WWII veteran.
notes: Overrated (it won the Jury Prize at Cannes) film transposition (inevitably superficial) of the classic sci-fi by Kurt Vonnegut. However, Bach's music interpreted by Glenn Gould is memorable.

title: More Dead Than Alive
actors: Clint Walker, Vincent Price, Anne Francis, Paul Hampton
description: Gunman Cain gets out of jail after serving 18 years. He finds no work, then is hired to play himself in a traveling show. Even love arrives but old enemies reappear.

title: Boa vs. Python
actors: David Hewlett, Jaime Bergman, Kirk B.R. Woller
description: During the transport - organized by an ambitious businessman - of a giant python, the animal escapes from custody and begins to leave behind a chain of human victims. A federal agent and a scientist plan to counter him with an equally monstrous "modified" boa constrictor in the laboratory ...

title: The Maverick Queen
actors: Barbara Stanwyck, Barry Sullivan, Scott Brady, Mary Murphy
description: Lucy Lee is an outlaw who controls the livestock market and falls in love with a federal agent who has infiltrated the gang with the aim of vanquishing it. One of the outlaws, jealous of the situation, tries to take her out. When she discovers her lover's true identity, she surrenders herself and allows him to arrest the entire gang ...

title: Swamp Thing
actors: Adrienne Barbeau, Louis Jourdan, Ray Wise, David Hess, Dick Durock, Nannette Brown, Nicholas Worth, Don Knight, Al Ruban, Ben Bates, Mimi Craven, Karen Price
description: Locked up in the laboratory, in the hidden bowels of a swamp, Dr. Alec Holland is trying to create a new species halfway between the animal and plant world, capable of thriving even in the most difficult conditions. After experimenting with the chemical formula on himself, the young scientist transforms into a hideous creature. He protects the colleague he was once in love with from the villain who would like to take over the formula.
notes: Inspired by a DC comic by Wein and Wrigthson, an absurd horror that Wes Craven tries to give a little irony. Nothing to do with the more mature and famous version of the character, signed by Alan Moore, who took it in hand only later, from 1984.

title: Fighting Back
actors: Tom Skerritt, Michael Sarrazin, Yaphet Kotto, Patti Lupone
description: John D'Angelo has a shop in a bad neighborhood in Philadelphia. When his pregnant wife is the victim of an accident that causes her to lose her child, he decides to form a fierce group of vigilantes who do not look at anyone: politicians, policemen and criminals. Black leader Ivanhoe Washington fears the racial backlash of John's project, however. Between the two, the policeman Vince Morelli tries to bring back the reason.
notes: The effort to offer a plurality of points of view is soon defused by the Manichean portrait of those who live on the streets. The result is yet another clone of the "Executioner of the night".

title: Frankenfish
actors: Tory Kittles, K.D. Aubert, China Chow, Matthew Rauch
description: When a man's body is found horribly mutilated in the middle of a Louisiana swamp, the police decide to entrust investigator Sam Rivers with the investigation of the murder, who decides to enlist the help of biologist Mary Callahan. The two reach the stilt house on which the victim lived and discover that terrifying and huge genetically modified fish - and belonging to a rich and sadistic hunter - are exterminating the people who populate the marsh. While Sam and Mary try their best to survive, Jack arrives and together with his team will try to hunt down the monsters.

title: Black Dawn
actors: Steven Seagal, Tamara Davies, John Pyper-Ferguson, Julian Stone
description: A former CIA agent and nuclear weapons expert, Jonathan Cold gets involved in a conspiracy. His enemy is Donovan, who wants to blow up Los Angeles. With the help of Amanda Stillwell, his former student, Cold tries to thwart the threat: the two will discover, however, a terrible secret concerning CIA agents and members of the government ...
notes: The script is obvious, and the actors' interpretations do not help: the only novelty is that for the first thirty minutes it is not clear whether the protagonist is on the side of the good or the bad. B series explosions and rhetoric in large quantities for an "action" to forget.

title: Blood Diner
actors: Rick Burks, Carl Crew, Roger Dauer, LaNette La France, Lisa Guggenheim

title: Robot Jox
actors: Gary Graham, Anne-Marie Johnson, Paul Koslo, Robert Sampson, Hilary Mason
description: In an unspecified future, two opposing factions compete for the richest territories on Earth through fierce duels between gigantic robots. Achilles, the hero of the "Market", and Alexander, the undefeated and bloodthirsty champion of the "Confederacy", compete for the conquest of Alaska while the people enjoy watching the fight live on TV.
notes: Stuart Gordon mixes giant robots from manga style _Mazinga_, Greek mythology and _Rollerball_. The result is a low-cost live action, entirely shot in Rome, which is pure and enjoyable sci-fi divertissement. It will also be a B Movie for fans of the genre but it's definitely more honest and hilarious than expensive _Transformers_ sideshow.

title: California Passage
actors: Forrest Tucker, Adele Mara, Estelita Rodriguez, Jim Davis

title: Sierra Baron
actors: Brian Keith, Rick Jackson, Rita Gam, Mala Powers, Lewis Allan

title: The Black Sleep
actors: Lon Chaney jr., Basil Rathbone, Akim Tamiroff, John Carradine, Bela Lugosi, Tor Johnson

title: To Die For
actors: Brendan Hughes, Amanda Wyss, Scott Jacoby, Steve Bond

title: The Hills Have Eyes
actors: Aaron Stanford, Kathleen Quinlan, Vinessa Shaw, Emilie de Ravin, Ted Levine, Billy Drago
description: For his wedding anniversary, police detective "Big Bob" Carter asks the whole family to go to California. With greater or lesser enthusiasm, his wife Ethel and three children (Brenda, Bobby and Lynn, the latter with husband Doug and their newborn daughter) accept. After a detour, the Carters find themselves in a desert area and are attacked by strange bloodthirsty creatures ...
notes: In this remake of Wes Craven's film of the same name (1977), the few ideas are watered down in a pedantic and, in the long run, even boring gaze. The technical contributions are good: but for Aja the move to post-High Voltage Hollywood is a bitter disappointment.

title: Bound by Honor
actors: Damian Chapa, Jesse Borrego, Benjamin Bratt, Enrique Castillo, Delroy Lindo
description: Half brothers Paco and Cruz and cousin Miklo in 1972 are part of a Los Angeles gang known as the Vatos Locos. Their existence is marked by violent crime and drugs until their fates take different paths: Miklo ends up in San Quentin prison, Cruz becomes an exceptional artist but addicted to heroin and Paco, ironically, becomes a policeman.

title: See No Evil
actors: Glen Jacobs, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Steven Vidler
description: Some young people from a juvenile prison have to serve the community by cleaning up the derelict Blackwell Hotel: they ignore, however, that Jacob Goodnight, a psychopath who starts hunting them, takes refuge there ...
notes: Dark comes from the soft-core of the Eighties (his, for example, the semicult series _New Wave Hookers_), and it shows: the staging is as it was at that time, all flash-cut and sudden accelerations. It has evidently fallen a bit behind, even in gender ideology. The film, in fact, is of superfine nonsense, so trite in its assumption and development that it is almost tenderness.

title: Tumbleweed
actors: Audie Murphy, Lori Nelson, Chill Wills, Roy Roberts, Russell Johnson
description: Prode young man is suspected of excessive friendship with the Red Indians who give a lot of trouble to the pale faces. He risks being lynched, but his innocence will be recognized.

title: Pulse
actors: Kristen Bell, Ian Somerhalder, Christina Milian, Rick Gonzalez
description: A group of university students begins to investigate a mysterious and inexplicable signal that a fellow hacker has picked up while surfing. A sort of telematic virus thus begins to spread and infect anyone who comes into contact with it: the boys are the only ones who can be able to stop it ...
notes: The US remake of _Kairo_ by Kiyoshi Kurosawa loses by the way the allusion to superstitions and the cultural sphere, but partly retains the anguish of the original. The tension has something authentic, the digital effects do not overload the vision; and even if the story is declined as if it were one of the many "urban legends", in the end it is fun.

actors: Beau Bridges, Kim Delaney, Fred Ward, Dule Hill, Michael Adamthwaite
description: The west coast of the United States and Canada was devastated by a very violent earthquake, so much so that it recorded a magnitude of 10.5 degrees on the Richter scale. However, it is not just a powerful earthquake, but an anomalous earthquake that has two very distant epicenters. To give a scientific explanation is called Dr. Samantha Hill, who also provides the president of the United States with a strategy to stop the tremors. In fact, the earthquake did not stop even after having caused a large part of the coastal strip to collapse into the ocean, and the continuous aftershocks threaten to generate a tsunami ...

title: Today You Die
actors: Steven Seagal, Sarah Buxton, Nick Mancuso, Robert Miano
description: Harlan Banks is a sort of modern Robin Hood: he works with highly technological tools and "steals" from the rich to "give" to the poor. But when his latest heist goes wrong and ends in tragedy, the man flees to Las Vegas. There, his girlfriend Jada awaits him and persuades him to find a real honest job. And so he drives an armored car on behalf of the shady Max. But one day Harlan, while driving the vehicle, finds himself involved in a chase on the Strip, which ends in a shooting and the capture of the new driver from part of the police. Harlan will manage to escape and will track down Max who framed him.

title: Epoch
actors: David Keith, Ryan O'Neal, Stephanie Niznik, Raul Julia-Levy, Brian Thompson
description: A group of scientists is trying to understand the reasons why all electronic equipment on the globe is in a state of failure, after a huge stone monolith that crashed on Earth millions of years ago resurfaced in China. Mason Rand, a specialist in armaments, and the beautiful doctor Kasia Czaban, scientific adviser to the president of the United States, go to Chinese territory to investigate: they will soon discover that the presence of the monolith endangers the entire planet, since it is in reality of a machine in possession of the secrets of evolution and human DNA. A fight against time begins to save the world ...

title: 99 River Street
actors: John Payne, Evelyn Keyes, Brad Dexter, Frank Faylen, Peggie Castle

title: The Hand
actors: Michael Caine, Andrea Marcovicci, Bruce McGill, Viveca Lindfors

title: The Dead Pit
actors: Jeremy Slate, Cheryl Lawson, Danny Gochnauer, Stephen Gregory Foster

title: Deadly Blessing
actors: Michael Berryman, Maren Jensen, Susan Buckner, Sharon Stone, Ernest Borgnine, Lois Nettleton

title: Running Free
actors: Chase Moore, Jan Decleir, Arie Verveen, Maria Geelboi

title: Gone in 60 Seconds
actors: H.B. Halicki, Marion Busia, James McIntyre, George Cole
description: Insurer Maindrian Pace and his team lead a double life: in one they are honest businessmen, in the other they are reckless car thieves. The trouble begins when a South American drug lord pays Pace to steal 48 cars in one week. Maximum time for each theft, just one minute.
notes: Cult of the car action genre, it contains one of the most spectacular chases ever in the history of cinema: as many as 93 cars destroyed in 40 minutes. Produced, written, directed and starring by director and stuntman H.B. Halicki, who died in an accident while filming the sequel. In 2000 Dominic Sena made an unwatchable remake, _Out in 60 seconds_, with Nicolas Cage and Angelina Jolie.

title: Tourist Trap
actors: Chuck Connors, Jocelyn Jone, Robin Sherwood, Tanya Roberts
description: A group of young people are taking a trip out of town. Everything seems to go smoothly until they have a problem with their vehicle. One of the boys goes for help, but after a few hours he still isn't back. The rest decide to go and look for him. In a house not far from the place where they were, they meet the eccentric and kind Mr. Slausen, who invites them to spend the night with him in a place that looks like an old mannequin museum.

title: The Food of the Gods
actors: Marjoe Gortner, Pamela Franklin, Ralph Meeker, Ida Lupino

title: New Alcatraz
actors: Dean Cain, Elizabeth Lackley, Mark Sheppard, Dean Biasucci, Craig Wasson
description: The construction of a prison underground in Antarctica is almost complete, and the first inmates are already in the super prison. The excavations encounter a strange formation but they decide to proceed, awakening an ancient and deadly snake-like creature ...
notes: Indigestible crossing of a typical "prison movie" with _Alien_ and _Anaconda_.

title: Bubble Boy
actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Swoosie Kurtz, Marley Shelton, Danny Trejo, John Carroll Lynch, Verne Troyer
description: A boy is born with no immune system and must live in a plastic bubble in his bedroom.
notes: Remake of _The Boy in the Plastic Bubble_ from 1976 with a very young John Travolta. The director changes and the level of the first film is not maintained. Hint of a road movie. Useless sentimentality.

title: Crossfire Trail
actors: Tom Selleck, Mark Harmon, Brad Johnson, Barry Corbin, Christian Kane, Virginia Madsen, David O'Hara, Wilford Brimley
description: Rafe Covington, a charismatic wanderer, promises a dying man that he will keep an eye on his wife and his property: he travels to Wyoming, where he puts together a gang of gunslingers including Joe Gill, an expert guide, Rock Mullaney, an Irish simaptic, and JT Langston, a good-natured cook. Ann Rodney, the widow Covington has sworn to protect, is confused and basically has no reason to trust the man; she is also involved in a relationship with the violent and Bruce Barkow, a wealthy saloon owner. Inevitably the conflict erupts between Barkow and Covington, each aided by their trusted cronies ...

title: The Strangler
actors: Victor Buono, David McLean, Diane Sayer, Davey Davison
description: A man, traumatized by excessive maternal affection, is the unsuspected author of numerous crimes. To put the police on his trail are some revelations of the girl that he secretly loves the killer is eliminated in extremis, just when he is about to make her - who refused to marry him - yet another victim.

title: Extreme Honor
actors: Dan Andersen, Michael Ironside, Olivier Gruner, Michael Madsen
description: John Kennedy Brascoe is a Navy S.E.A.L. who, following a CIA operation that ended badly, is falsely accused of treason by one of his comrades. Forced into retirement to avoid trial, he finds himself in serious financial trouble when his son's cancer threatens to enter its terminal stage. The millionaire Baker offers a mountain of money to the man who manages to break into a high security fortress, and John is forced to accept the challenge, flanked by some scammers. He will end up confronting those responsible for his own fall from grace.
notes: Trivial action movie, with very little action, aimed at the home video market.

title: Bullfighter
actors: Michelle Forbes, Olivier Martinez, Michael Parks, Jared Harris, Willem Dafoe, Domenica Cameron-Scorsese
description: Jack is a wanderer whose continuous wandering from one place to another often leads him to accompany himself to curious and interesting people and who, despite his passion for bullfights, leads a peaceful existence after all.

title: Lady in the Water
actors: Paul Giamatti, Bryce Dallas Howard, Jeffrey Wright, Cindy Cheung, M. Night Shyamalan, Freddy Rodriguez
description: Cleveland Heep, caretaker of a housing estate, rescues what he believes to be a young woman from the pool. Little by little he realizes that the girl is actually a fairy-tale creature who is trying to return to his world. Cleveland, with the help of some tenants, goes to great lengths to protect her new friend from the evil creatures who want to stop her ...
notes: It is the realistic microcosm of the residence where the story unfolds to be unlikely, with each character too evidently studied at the table (ridiculous the exoticism of the two Chinese) to be credible for the purposes of the narrative. If Shyamalan wanted to tell us about a cross-section of humanity that is becoming monstrous, he does so through an elementary and even awkward vision. If there were no convincing proof of the protagonist Paul Giamatti, we would have to ask ourselves how to take such a short film seriously.

title: Snakes on a Plane
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Julianna Margulies, Nathan Phillips, Rachel Blanchard, Flex Alexander, Bruce James
description: Federal agent Nelville Flynn is tasked with escorting a certain Sean Jones to Los Angeles, the only witness to a murder committed by Eddie Kim, a dangerous underworld boss. Despite all safety measures being taken, during the flight a multitude of poisonous snakes are released on board the plane with the aim of killing the dangerous witness ...
notes: At times the film manages to surprise, because the comedy element allows Ellis to make fun of film genres and destroy stereotypes with irony. Attention, however, is bound to drop after a few minutes.

title: Landspeed
actors: Billy Zane, Ray Wise, Pamela Gidley, Scott Wiper, Val Lauren
description: Utah, 1972. A fireball whizzes by at supersonic speed across a huge and desolate expanse of land. Due to an irreparable mistake, it catches fire and disintegrates. Twenty years later, two teams are fighting to break the land speed record, which is to exceed the unattainable 1000mph. The designer of one of the two teams is Linda, the daughter of the driver who died in 1972, while the rival racing car is driven by Michael, the son of the engineer who designed the car that went up in flames. Now, facing the ghosts of the past, the two boys face off in a no holds barred fight, where only the winner can go down in history ...

title: Island of the Dead
actors: Talisa Soto, Bruce Ramsay, Malcolm McDowell, Steffen Wink

title: Twitches
actors: Tia Mowry-Hardrict, Tamera Mowry, Kristen Wilson, Patrick Fabian
description: Twin witches Camryn and Alex, separated at birth, reunited after 21 years and saved their magical kingdom from evil and dark power. Now they try to make up for lost time and get to know each other better, perfecting their magic together and developing their powers ...

title: Cattle Drive
actors: Joel McCrea, Dean Stockwell, Chill Wills, Leon Ames, Henry Brandon

title: The Mod Squad
actors: Claire Danes, Omar Epps, Giovanni Ribisi, Dennis Farina, Josh Brolin, Michael Lerner
description: Police Captain Greer needs volunteers for a suicide mission: to frame a terrible gang of drug traffickers. He opts for three young misfits, sentenced to a long term of imprisonment in a stinking penitentiary: Julie, accused of assault, Pete, author of a robbery, and Lino, in prison for arson. The team manages to infiltrate the gang, but a death trap awaits them.
notes: Seldom has the choice of actors been more unhappy. In particular, Giovanni Ribisi seems completely inadequate in the hard part. A disconcerting interweaving of banality and absence of pathos. Fortunately, it never came out in Italy.

title: The Omega Code
actors: Casper Van Dien, Michael York, Catherine Oxenberg, Michael Ironside
description: Gillen Lane has written a successful book called _The Omega Code_, which interprets a series of prophecies drawn from a numerical code hidden in the pages of the Bible. Approached by billionaire Stone Alexander, Lane agrees to collaborate on a megalomaniac project to bring peace to the world. Stone's plan met with initial success, obtaining from the leaders the establishment of a global government of which Stone himself is put in charge. But Lane realizes that the tycoon is actually trying to bring about the biblical apocalypse by taking on the role of the Antichrist!
notes: In 2001, a sequel was made entitled _Megiddo_.

title: Tarzan Finds a Son!
actors: Maureen O'Sullivan, Johnny Weissmuller, Johnny Sheffield, Ian Hunter

title: Yankee Pasha
actors: Jeff Chandler, Rhonda Fleming, Mamie Van Doren, Lee J. Cobb, Bart Roberts
description: In 1800, highlander Jason Starbuck arrives in Salem, Massachusetts, armed with furs to sell and dreams to fulfill. Soon, he falls in love with Roxana, who breaks off her father's previous engagement and leaves for France to wait for Jason. However, the ship she travels on is attacked by pirates and, taken hostage, Roxana finds herself sold as a slave in Morocco. Jason will follow her there trying to enter the Sultan's sympathies to locate and save her.

title: Saddle Tramp
actors: Joel McCrea, Wanda Hendrix, John Russell, John McIntire

title: Siege at Red River
actors: Van Johnson, Joanne Dru, Richard Boone, Milburn Stone

title: Dark Eyes of London
actors: Bela Lugosi, Hugh Williams, Greta Gynt, Edmon Ryan, Wilfred Walter

title: Killers from Space
actors: Peter Graves, Barbara Bestar, Steve Pendleton, James Seay

title: Zoom
actors: Tim Allen, Courteney Cox, Chevy Chase, Kate Mara, Michael Cassidy, Spencer Breslin, Ryan Newman, Kevin Zegers
description: Jack Shepard is a former superhero who is contacted when a new threat looms on Earth: he will have to take on the role of Captain Zoom again to train a new generation of "colleagues". With the help of Dr. Holloway, four super students are chosen, all with great power but not the ability to manage it. The training will be tough ...
notes: The film is an adaptation, by Adam Rifkin and David Berenbaum, of Jason Lethcoe's "graphic novel". The problem is that it lacks originality, drawing now from _Sky High - School of superpowers_, now from _X-Men_. The special effects are also quite indifferent.

title: Walk the Proud Land
actors: Audie Murphy, Anne Bancroft, Pat Crowley, Charles Drake
description: 1874. John Philip Clum, a young Quaker appointed Indian agent to a tribe, arrives in San Carlos, Arizona. Its task is to seek a new approach to peace with local Apache Indians based on respect for autonomy, rather than military intervention. Clum has to face the suspicions and suspicions of the white settlers, the army and the Indians themselves, especially the chief Geronimo. An Indian widow, Tianay, falls in love with him and his wife wants to leave him ...

title: Apache Rifles
actors: L. Q. Jones, Audie Murphy, Michael Dante, John Archer
description: Arizona, 1879.
