The young cavalry officer Jeff Stanton has the task of capturing Apaches who have escaped from the reservation, also because they are tired of seeing gold diggers plunder their territory. Stanton has no sympathy for the natives, but he meets half-breed Dawn Gillis and falls in love with her. The girl is also courted by Red Hawk ...

title: Badman's Territory
actors: Randolph Scott, Ann Richards, Lawrence Tierney, Ray Collins, Steve Brodie
description: In search of his brother Mark Rowley arrives in the town of Quinto, run by the corrupt Sheriff Hamtpon ...
notes: The first chapter of the Badmen saga puts too much meat on the fire, and the rest must be seen with the over-the-top spirit of a pulp western tale.

title: Count Yorga, Vampire
actors: Robert Quarry, Roger Perry, Michael Murphy, Michael Macready

title: Man in the Shadow?
actors: Jeff Chandler, Orson Welles, Colleen Miller, Barbara Lawrence
description: Sheriff Ben Sadler is on the trail of the culprit in the merciless murder of a Mexican farmhand. The mighty Virgil Renchler, owner of the 'Golden Empire', one of the largest properties in the county, attempts to convince the sheriff to downsize and cover up the case. The sheriff, however, is determined to follow the course of justice even if all the clues seem to lead to Virgil. But what could have been the motive?

title: The Grudge 2
actors: Sarah Michelle Gellar, Amber Tamblyn, Edison Chen, Arielle Kebbel, Jennifer Beals, Joanna Cassidy
description: In Tokyo, Aubrey Davis is struck by the same curse that her sister Karen suffered. The deadly supernatural force also acts in a sunny American college and a gloomy Chicago ...
notes: Second American episode of the saga that the director began in 2002 in Japan with _Ju-on: Rancore_, then continued with _Rancore 2_. The three episodes (the best part is the first, in Chicago) in which the film is speciously articulated are quite well known, indebted to both Japanese and Western horror. The effect scenes still work, supported by Shimizu's refined visual system.

title: The Toolbox Murders
actors: Cameron Mitchell, Nicolas Beauvy, Aneta Corsaut, Tim Donnelly, Wesley Eure, Pamelyn Ferdin, Evelyn Guerrero, Kelly Nichols

title: The Sign of Zorro
actors: Guy Williams, Henry Calvin, Gene Sheldon, Britt Lomond

title: Cowboy Up
actors: Kiefer Sutherland, Marcus Thomas, Daryl Hannah, Molly Ringwald
description: Two brothers who compete in the rodeo circuit, in different categories, grew up in the shadow of their champion father. The elder despises the man who has become a drunkard, while the younger continues to see him as a model for sports skills. The younger brother is injured in a race, but does not give up and continues to compete at the risk of his life, ending up even more seriously injured.
notes: Released directly on DVD also in the USA, where the passion for rodeos interests much more than us. The production values ??are not to be thrown away, from photography in the presence of Kiefer Sutherland and Daryl Hannah, but the melodrama is terribly obvious.

title: Blue Demon
actors: Dedee Pfeiffer, Randall Batinkoff, Danny Woodburn, Jeff Fahey

title: Journey to Shiloh
actors: James Caan, Michael Sarrazin, Brenda Scott, Don Stroud, Paul Petersen

title: The Exterminator
actors: Robert Ginty, Christopher George, Samanha Eggar, Steve James

title: Tamara
actors: Jenna Dewan, Katie Stuart, Chad Faust, Bryan Clark, Melissa Elias, Gil Hacohen
description: Tamara is a shy and ugly young woman who endures a repulsive father and the jokes of her cool classmates by virtue of her impossible love for the English teacher, to conquer whom she is willing to resort to witchcraft. Her mates use this crush to lure her to a motel, but things go wrong and she dies ... only to be reborn as a mind-controlling sex bomb bent on revenge.
notes: Almost a reprise of _Carrie_, but unable to disturb: it concedes little to "gore" and even less to sex; and as soon as Tamara is reborn, the protagonist takes the form of a much more "reassuring" girl.

title: The Fabulous Texan
actors: John Carroll, Catherine McLeod, William Elliott, Albert Dekker

title: Deja vu
actors: Denzel Washington, Paula Patton, Val Kilmer, Jim Caviezel, Adam Goldberg, Bruce Greenwood
description: Doug Carlin is an FBI agent assigned to the case of a terrorist attack that blew up a ferry boat and killed hundreds of people. The same day, Claire Kuchever, a young woman who Doug feels he has already known, is murdered. To discover the culprits, he is recruited by a secret department which, with state-of-the-art technological means, has managed to create a system to review events from the past live. Doug discovers that the device works like a time machine, allowing him to interfere with events; then begins a personal investigation, back in the days, to foil the attack and save Claire.
notes: The idea could have its own why but Tony Scott is not the brother Ridley and it shows. It does not know how to contain itself, so much so that it also falls into the temporal paradox. Unforgivable.

title: Hills of Home
actors: Edmund Gwenn, Janet Leigh, Rhys Williams, Tom Drake, Donald Crisp
description: Doctor William MacLure, a doctor from a small village in Scotland, interprets his profession as a mission, cultivating the dream of seeing it continued by a young doctor who shares his ideals and enthusiasm with him. Tammas Milton, son of a shepherd and owner of the dog Lassie, seems to be the right person. MacLure sends him to study medicine at his own expense at the University of Edinburgh. However, the young man's educational and professional path proved to be particularly difficult, also due to his father's hostility ...
notes: Fourth feature film that includes the dog Lassie among its protagonists. It is probably the least successful of all.

title: The Marksman
actors: Wesley Snipes, Emma Samms, William Hope, Anthony Warren, Peter Youngblood Hills, Ryan McCluskey, Warren Derosa, Dan Badarau, Serge Soric
description: A group of Chechen rebels occupy a thermonuclear facility and threaten to blow it up at any moment. To prevent the catastrophe, the US government hires Painter, a brave Special Forces agent, placing him in charge of a highly specialized counter-terrorist commando ...

title: Lost Treasure
actors: Stephen Baldwin, Nicollette Sheridan, Coby Ryan McLaughin
description: Investigating a stolen painting, Detective McBride comes into possession of a map and learns - thanks to his brother, an expert cartographer - that he indicates the site where the lost treasure of Christopher Columbus is buried: the discovery, however, also attracts some criminals, willing to everything to take possession of the fabulous riches ...

title: Generation X
actors: Suzanne Davis, Matt Frewer, Finola Hughes, Amarilis, Heather McComb
description: Based on the famous Marvel comic, Generation X tells the (mis) adventures of a group of young mutants with superpowers. Feared and hated by the people for being "different", the boys are welcomed into a special institution, where their teachers are themselves mutants: a telepath - Emma Frost - and Sean Cassidy, an Irishman who can emit a super powerful sound. But things get complicated when an old rival of Emma Frost, a mad scientist, finds out what happens in that special school and thinks of killing two birds with one stone: kidnap the boys and take out the old rival.

title: Apocalypto
actors: Rudy Youngblood, Dalia Hernandez, Jonathan Brewer, Morris Birdyellowhead
description: Jaguar's Paw lives quietly in his village taking care of hunting, as his father did before him and as his children will do when he is gone. Suddenly his existence is turned upside down by the arrival of another tribe that sows death and takes the survivors prisoner. In order to save his wife and children, Jaguar's Paw overcomes fear and fights against everyone.
notes: Unlike The Passion of the Christ, this Gibson film is primarily an adventure film. Studded with "classic places" it has more narrative affinities with Braveheart than with The Passion. As for the Yucatec Maya (subtitled) spoken by the whole cast, it really works, with its timeless and authentic sound, as the glue of the story.

title: The Guardian
actors: Kevin Costner, Ashton Kutcher, Sela Ward, Melissa Sagemiller, Adam Peña, Joe Arquette
description: Survivor of a terrifying storm, Ben Randall - sea rescue officer - is sent to teach in a school that trains the best recruits: and it is here that he forms a friendship with the young Jake Fischer ...
notes: By now it seems that Automavision, the computerized "random" system used by Lars von Trier for _Il grande capo_, is the only real direction of a certain conspicuous block of Hollywood "mainstream" cinema; not to mention the writing, which most of the time is pure manual for school desks. Here is the perfect example, and in its theoretical way, of the "classicist" drift of the American blockbuster.

title: Blood Diamond
actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Djimon Hounsou, Jennifer Connelly, Arnold Vosloo, Antony Coleman
description: Sierra Leone, 1990s: Danny Archer, a former mercenary from Zimbabwe, and Solomon Vandy, a fisherman from Mende, search for a rare pink diamond. Journalist Maddy Bowen contacts Archer for an investigation into "blood diamonds", and all three embark on a perilous journey through rebel-controlled territory ...
notes: Beyond the political aspect, the contents and the strong commitment of the film, the almost two and a half hours hold up the pace. In addition, the characters are multifaceted: the mercenary has a modernly ambiguous outline, and the journalist is shrewd enough to avoid demagogic traps.

title: The Covenant
actors: Laura Ramsey, Sebastian Stan, Taylor Kitsch, Chace Crawford, Toby Hemingway
description: Strange facts happen at the Spenser Academy, a boarding school for the offspring of the most important dynasties in the region. Four students, descendants of the first families who settled in the colony of Ipswich in the early 1600s, have inherited extraordinary powers from their ancestors: they must learn to manage their faculties and fight against an evil force, also trying not to reveal the secret that their families have been hiding for centuries ...
notes: Basically, a Z-movie with money: but _Voodoo Academy_, in comparison, is porn and even exciting. See it at your own risk: and don't think you will have fun.

title: Santa Fe Trail
actors: Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Raymond Massey, Ronald Reagan
description: Cavalry commander Jeb Stuart, before the Civil War, has a love affair with Kit and battles the slave rights activist: the legendary John Brown. At the outbreak of the war he will become general of the Confederate Army.
notes: At the time it was a huge box office success, also due to the solid Flynn-de Havilland duo, but today it is an almost forgotten western. It renders the pre-conflict tension well but the ideological perspective is repulsive: abolitionists as terrorists, slave owners as model citizens and the slaves themselves who seem either crazy or stupid.

title: Sub Zero
actors: Costas Mandylor, Linden Ashby, Alistair Bell, Gloria Lynn Berg
description: A group of Russian terrorists manages to infiltrate a United Nations surveillance station. They leave no survivors and steal the control system of a satellite weapon from _Goldeneye_. The terrorists' plane is shot down but the device crashes on top of K2! A countdown to the activation of the bomb was also triggered. John Deckert, an expert climber, is contacted by the UN to put together a team of experts and intervene before it is too late.
notes: Z-movie straight to video director Wynorski does his usual mediocre job. The scenarios are not bad but they are not enough.

title: Hercules
actors: Paul Telfer, Elizabeth Perkins, Sean Astin, Kim Coates, Timothy Dalton, Leelee Sobieski, Kristian Schmid
description: Son of the god Zeus and a priestess of Hera, Hercules grows up against the anger of the mother of the gods. His naivety leads him to be easily manipulated by the malevolence of Hera and his followers, who push him to kill Megara's three children. To obtain the forgiveness of the gods, Hercules will have to undergo six incredible labors.

title: Saw III
actors: Tobin Bell, Shawnee Smith, Angus MacFadyen, Bahar Soomekh, Donnie Wahlberg
description: Dr. Lynn is kidnapped and locked in a room by Jigsaw, the "Riddler", and faithful Amanda. The tumor ravaging Jigsaw progresses, and Lynn is tasked with keeping the Riddler alive until her new victim, Jeff, has finished one of her games ...
notes: There is little to do, the still short _Saw_ series is among the most original and (for fans) exciting genre "brands" of recent times. The only ones who have been able to "work" on; the only ones who have continually reinvented themselves, to say and look at something else (ve). Faint of heart and easily impressionable refrain: sadism is at times unbearable.

title: Ghost Rider
actors: Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes, Peter Fonda, Raquel Alessi, Wes Bentley, Sam Elliott
description: Johnny Blaze is a motorcycle stuntman: one day he sells his soul to the devil and agrees to host a vengeful angel in exchange for the safety of his true love. To regain his spiritual essence, he must counteract none other than Mephistopheles' son, Blackheart ...
notes: If you are "tamarri inside", _Ghost Rider_ is your movie. The story of the motorcyclist - introduced by the same singer of the exploits of the _Grande Lebowski_, Sam Elliott - could be written on a postage stamp: pact with the devil, loss of soul, attempt to win it back by fighting. Nicolas Cage rigged as Mino Reitano is at his worst: impossible to resist.

title: Virtual Storm
actors: Nick Cornish, Vanessa Marcil, Adrian Paul, Bai Ling
description: An avant-garde weather system directs two hurricanes against the United States. Fault of a hacker. Or maybe not.
notes: Difficult to stage digital intrigues in virtual territories, especially with laughable budgets like in this case and in the absence of illuminating talent.

title: Stay Alive
actors: Jon Foster, Samaire Armstrong, Frankie Muniz, Jimmi Simpson
description: The terrible death of a young man could be linked to an "online" video game. That's what his friends discover: whoever dies in the game dies in real life. The only option is to challenge the ruthless Bloody Countess ...
notes: A tired and anemic horror, without a single idea that can arouse the torpor; even the setting in New Orleans is thrown away. The youngsters who play with the wrong game, getting sucked into it to the point of ending their real life with a "game over", put hives. After the first sequence, which can also give hope, it is a bustle of pre-cooked stuff. In comparison, Doom is a masterpiece.

title: Bridge to Terabithia
actors: Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Robert Patrick, Zooey Deschanel, Bailee Madison
description: Jesse loves to paint, but both his family and his schoolmates make fun of him. When he meets Leslie, the two imagine an enchanted forest where they can take refuge from reality.
notes: The director Gabor Csupo, coming from animation, seems more interested in the fantasies in the woods than in the characters, outlined with banality and deprived of the self-destructive harshness of the original text. We could have been around _The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys_ for the mixture of imagination and tragedy, but the fantasies of the two are just an opportunity for technically well-made scenes but with an often cloying result.

title: Shooter
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Rhona Mitra, Danny Glover, Ned Beatty, Elias Koteas, Rade Serbedzija, Michael Peña
description: Bob Lee Swagger is a former US Army sharpshooter who retired following a mission gone awry in which civilians died, and who agreed to return to serve his homeland to thwart an assassination attempt on the President. The assignment, however, is a trap that hides dark games of power, and Swagger turns into a target: he is in fact accused of being a terrorist, and thus begins a terrible manhunt ...
notes: The action scenes are well orchestrated, and Fuqua returns to being the "professional" we have respected since Training Day. Wahlberg has the right physique for the role, but is too closely reminiscent of Bourne Identity's Matt Damon.

title: The Reaping
actors: Hilary Swank, David Morrissey, AnnaSophia Robb, Stephen Rea
description: In a small Louisiana town called Haven, strange facts occur that seem related to the ten plagues of Egypt. Katherine Winter, an expert in paranormal phenomena and a former Catholic missionary who lost her faith following the tragic death of her family, is sent to investigate: she soon realizes that it is not possible to formulate a scientific explanation for what happened. .
notes: Hopkins, a director who often throws it on testosterone, is not convincing, especially due to a screenplay full of clichés and a direction that focuses entirely on special effects. Too bad to have wasted the presence of such a thoroughbred actress as Hilary Swank.

title: The Marine
actors: John Cena, Robert Patrick, Kelly Carlson, Anthony Ray Parker, Abigail Bianca
description: John Triton is a Marine who fought in Iraq and returns home after being discharged against his will.He soon finds himself back in action when his wife is kidnapped by some runaway diamond thieves, led by a merciless criminal. John chases them through South Carolina to find his beloved partner ...
notes: The film that marks the film debut of wrestling wrestler John Cena looks like an "action" from the 1980s: it's full of guns, punches, explosions, skidding cars and even crocodiles. The leader of the criminals is Robert Patrick, the former T-1000 from _Terminator 2_.

title: Ocean's Thirteen
actors: George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Ellen Barkin, Al Pacino, Elliott Gould, Andy Garcia, Bernie Mac
description: When Rueben Tishkoff is tricked by a Las Vegas tycoon, he turns to his friend Danny Ocean, who promptly puts the gang back together to raid the new and pharaonic casino "The Bank". To make the revenge tastier, Danny decides to strike right on opening day, making sure that players at all tables win ...
notes: The stellar cast of previous films returns, including "villain" Terry Benedict from the first episode as a new ally. The opponent to beat is also a real star: Al Pacino. That said, not much remains to be added: the stars are having fun and (less than them) the public as well.

title: Jenifer
actors: Steven Weber, Carrie Fleming, Branda James, Harris Allan
description: A policeman saves a young woman who is about to be massacred by a guy: her name is Jenifer, she has a wonderful body and a scary face. The detective takes her home, where the girl freaks out: he tears the cat to pieces, makes his wife and son run away and finally seduces the man, who enters a vortex of perdition ...
notes: The ending is very easy to guess, and it is usually irritating - when it comes to Argento - the excessive suspension of credulity that the script demands. However _Jenifer_ is the best thing our has achieved in the last two decades: horror and involvement are finally well balanced. Episode of the series _Masters of Horror_.

title: Turistas
actors: Josh Duhamel, Melissa George, Olivia Wilde, Beau Garrett, Desmond Askew
description: A group of young and enterprising travelers on vacation in Brazil find themselves in a remote town after an accident involving the bus they were traveling on. Initially they think they have ended up in an earthly paradise, but little by little they begin to mysteriously disappear ...
notes: If in the first part one is afflicted by the usual idiotic characters destined for slaughter, then the product becomes quick, dry and bloody. In the journey to Brazilian hell, more than the sociological reasons for the villain - a sort of new Dr. Moreau - the pure genre works. With its retro taste it surprises the showdown under water, almost from _007_ of yesteryear.

title: Deer Woman
actors: Cinthia Moura, Brian Benben, Anthony Griffith, Don Thompson, Alex Zahara
description: A psychically degraded detective investigates the enigmatic death of a truck driver apparently trampled by an animal, perhaps a deer. With the help of a patrol officer, but against the will of his superiors, the cop follows the esoteric trail: according to an old Indian legend, a mysterious "woman-deer" seduces men and then kills them ...
notes: In the "horror-comedy" style dear to Landis, with explicit references to _An American werewolf in London_, a funny episode of the _Masters of Horror_ series. We could have expected something more from the director, but the protagonist Cinthia Moura is breathtaking.

title: Teenage Caveman
actors: Andrew Keegan, Tara Subkoff, Tiffany Limos, Stephen Jasso
description: In a post-apocalyptic future, the Earth is almost back to the Stone Age and the clans are dominated by religious fanatics. To save his girlfriend from ritual rape, David kills his own father, a kind of messiah. The rest of the clan now wants his skin, but the boy's friends (who had learned to read in "Penthouse") run away with him. Along the way, the group gets rid of all inhibitions: between drugs, sex and alcohol they get to know two mutants, equally lascivious, and to face new outbursts of violence ...
notes: The provocative director of Kids and Ken Park remakes the homonymous (original) film by Roger Corman (1958).

title: A Good Night To Die
actors: Michael Rapaport, Gary Stretch, Seymour Cassel, Deborah Harry

title: Fallen
actors: Paul Wesley, Alex Ferris, Fernanda Andrade, Sharon Canovas, Diego Klattenhoff
description: Aaron, the son of adoptive parents, on his eighteenth birthday discovers that he is not a boy like everyone else, but that he belongs to the lineage of the Nephilim, or those who were born from the encounter between the fallen angels, the same ones that God expelled from the Heaven and human women. According to an ancient prophecy, all the Nephilim are destined to perish at the hands of the Mighty, warriors sent by the Creator with the sole purpose of eliminating the dangerous lineage. An ancient prophecy, however, says that the birth of a redeeming angel will save the Fallen from their fate. And Aaron might just be the one the Neifilim have been waiting for for centuries ...

title: Hostel: Part II
actors: Jay Hernandez, Lauren German, Heather Matarazzo, Roger Bart, Bijou Phillips, Edwige Fenech
description: Beth, Lorna and Whitney, three young Americans who attend an art school in Rome, are invited by a classmate to spend a weekend in Slovakia. When they arrive at the hostel where they are staying, they realize that their trip is about to turn into a nightmare.
notes: Hostel was savory and lucid (and anything but executioner); Hostel Part II is dumb and crass. Eli Roth has nothing more to say, and what little is carried over, of disarming flatness and dangerous indifference. Even the avid reapers of extreme gore risk drought.

title: Transformers
actors: Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Tyrese Gibson, Rachael Taylor, Jon Voight, John Turturro
description: Two enemy alien races capable of transformation, the Autobots and the Decepticons, leave their planet, Cyberton, and arrive on Earth in search of new forms of energy. They mingle with the inhabitants, transforming themselves into the most common vehicles, aircraft or boats, but the battle for control of the planet is not long in unleashing, with dramatic consequences for mankind ...
notes: Culturally speaking, _Transformers_ comes to terms with a generational past that was fertile with unforgettable books and films: therefore it is less harmless, sterile and (simply) toy than the noise and special effects might suggest.

title: Primeval
actors: Dominic Purcell, Orlando Jones, Brooke Langton, Jürgen Prochnow, Gideon Emery
description: In the jungle, a huge crocodile threatens local tribes. From the United States, producer Tim Freeman and cameraman Steven Johnson arrive in South Africa to make a documentary about the terrible creature and try to capture it: they still don't know what awaits them ...
notes: The crocodile Gustave as a product of the centripetal violence of society - which cannibalizes itself - would not even be an evil idea: but the film cannot be watched, among unpresentable performers, the usual bold specks, digital effects ripples and some creampie " splatter ". The Australian _Dark Age_ was quite another thing.

title: Catacombs
actors: Cabral Ibaka, Shannyn Sossamon, Cain Manoli, Ashleigh Rains, Pink
description: An American tourist on vacation in Paris is invited to a rave party in the city's catacombs. A police raid soon puts an end to the party and the girl, separated from her friends, finds herself wandering among tombs and tunnels. Drunk and inexperienced, she does not realize that someone is hunting her, and that the threat could come from the realm of the dead.
notes: The fantasy of such a horror is exclusively ignorant, touristy, hegemonic, colonialist, racist, narrow-minded, reactionary, burly, anachronistic, hysterical, whining. All wonderful qualities that are found in the protagonist. Blood is scarce and dubbing sucks; on the other hand, there are many visual-sound shots.

title: Tom and Huck
actors: JonathanTaylor Thomas, Brad Renfro, Eric Schweig, Amy Wright
description: Young Tom Sawyer witnesses a murder, and together with his illiterate friend Huck Finn tries - among a thousand adventures - to exonerate a drunkard unjustly accused of the crime.
notes: This version with cool actors does the novel a disservice. Stephen Sommers, screenwriter here, had already started doing damage.

title: Wicked Little Things
actors: Lori Heuring, Scout Taylor-Compton, Chloë Grace Moretz, Ben Cross, Craig Vye, Martin McDougall, Helia Grekova
description: After being widowed, Ms. Tunny moves with her two children to a small town in Pennsylvania, where she is bequeathed a home. He does not know that in the surrounding woods there is a band of zombie children, who died a hundred years earlier in mysterious circumstances and rightly seeking revenge ...
notes: Nothing new under the sun, please, but the New England vibe is dark enough to ensure a couple of genuine thrills. And what's more, the idea of ??the little living dead is not bad, even if the ending is a bit obvious. Released by After Dark Horrofest in the "8 Films to Die For" package.

title: Reeker
actors: Devon Gummersall, Scott Whyte, Arielle Kebbel, Eric Mabius
description: Five leisure students are stranded in a deserted gas station. They try not to panic, but when they start seeing visions of mutilated travelers, they realize their survival is in danger.
notes: Directed by Dave Payne - not that it's a guarantee - and everything good about this slasher movie is consumed within two minutes, those preceding the opening credits.

title: Supernova
actors: Luke Perry, Tia Carrere, Peter Fonda, Clemency Burton-Hill, Emma Samms, Jessica Brooks
description: World-renowned astrophysicist Dr. Christopher Richardson discovers that the Earth is about to be obliterated by the birth of a supernova. The scientist is taken to the "Phoenix facility", a catastrophe shelter; meanwhile, serial killer Grant - driven by a thirst for revenge - escapes from prison and goes in search of Brooke, Christopher's wife and key witness to his arrest. The events intertwine and the events precipitate ...
notes: The presence of Luke Perry as the protagonist should already be an alarm bell about the mediocrity of the product. The plot does not help to quell suspicions, transforming them into certainties.

title: Martin
actors: John Amplas, Lincoln Maazel, Tom Savini, Forrest Romero
description: Martin is a young man of 18 who claims to have lived through 84 years. His cousin Tata Cuda believes he is a deeply evil vampire. When Martin moves in with him in a small town in Pennsylvania, his cousin decides that if he has evidence of even one vampirism incident he will destroy the young man. But Martin's urges are difficult to control and when he falls in love with a housewife will he manage not to bite her on the neck?
notes: Romero starts from a horror plot but, while not lacking some gore sequences, he actually realizes a refined work on the characters and a critical reflection within the same genre.

title: Chocolate
actors: Henry Thomas, Lucie Laurier, Stacy Grant
description: Jamie, perpetually on a diet, works in a laboratory where artificial food flavors are produced. After eating chocolate, in contravention of his diet, he realizes that he has come into mental contact with a mysterious woman, of whom he feels all the sensations. The reason for this connection is naturally unsettling ...
notes: Episode of the first series of _Masters of Horror_ made by Mick Garris, who is also the creator of the television production (already in the pipeline for a third season). Unfortunately, as a director, Garris continues not to scratch, limiting himself to making a routine horror.

title: Planet Terror
actors: Freddy Rodriguez, Rose McGowan, Quentin Tarantino, Josh Brolin, Marley Shelton, Jeff Fahey, Michael Biehn, Bruce Willis, Naveen Andrews, Rebel Rodriguez, Stacy Ferguson, Nicky Katt, Electra Avellan, Elise Avellan, Tom Savini
description: A biological experiment, in which the United States military is involved, has turned people into zombies: now it's up to a handful of survivors - including the beautiful dancer Cherry Darling - to stop the infection or at least find a way out. ..
notes: Pure genre cinema, which conveys a rebellious ideology through a system of visual signs and writing in a way that is totally free from rhetorical predominance. The moral, in _Planet Terror_, is clear: the outcasts are the true workforce of the contemporary world, capable of rebuilding an entire civilization from its foundations. Twin film of _Grindhouse - Death Proof_ by Tarantino.

title: Rush Hour 3
actors: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Max Von Sydow, Roman Polanski
description: LAPD Detective Carter and Hong Kong Chief Inspector Lee are once again "forced" to join forces to defeat a Triad boss hiding in Paris.
notes: The European set provides a further element to the globalized mix of the series, for which the Hong Kong action and the distant echo of the blaxploitation are joined by that of the polar, indeed the recent smashing chase films like _Taxxi_ (explicitly plagiarized). The whole row puerile and relatively harmless, between chases and verbal gags. Strange in the cast are the appearances of Max von Sydow and Roman Polanski, directly from another planet.

title: Enchanted
actors: Amy Adams, Patrick Dempsey, James Marsden, Susan Sarandon, Timothy Spall, Idina Menzel, Rachel Covey
description: Giselle is a princess who is expelled from the magical world of Cartoonia by an evil queen and thus ends up projected in today's New York: here she will be forced to confront a completely different reality and will change many of her points of view, including - above all - the one about love ...
notes: Disney brand "Panettone", with more irony and inventiveness than usual: amused in quoting and mocking the fairytale imagery of the parent company, which, however, does not come out demolished but rather reinforced by a clever modernization. However, a honeyed underlying moralism remains, but the balance between writing for children and cinephilia for adults is well calibrated.The film has achieved a huge success with audiences, earning around 340 million dollars worldwide, against an estimated budget. around 85 million and earned three Oscar nominations for three songs, all with music by Alan Menken and lyrics by Stephen Schwartz.

title: The Invasion
actors: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig, Jeremy Northam, Veronica Cartwright, Jackson Bond, Jeffrey Wright
description: A spaceship crashes on the Earth's surface, and a mysterious virus escapes, infecting the human population. The bacterium triggers a process of transformation in contaminated individuals, which psychiatrist Carol and colleague Ben discover are activated during sleep.
notes: This fourth film version of Jack Finney's novel _The Body Snatcher_, is perhaps the most faithful to the underlying paradox: given that as men we are still dominated by instincts, harmony and brotherhood are "inhuman". But the production is tattered, makes continuity errors and doesn't give depth to the characters.

actors: John Cusack, Samuel L. Jackson, Mary McCormack, Tony Shalhoub
description: After the death of his daughter Katie, Mike specialized in publishing books that expose supernatural events. When he receives the invitation to visit the cursed room 1408 of the Dolphin Hotel in New York, he does not hesitate to go there to deceive this legend too, but the reality is much more terrible than he was willing to believe ...
notes: Up to now, the Swede Mikael Håfström hasn't hit many, but here he hits the target: Stephen King's spirit and vision of the world, and that of the show, very effective, never pulled away, well written, with a couple of notable ideas and sometimes genuinely scary.

title: 3:10 to Yuma
actors: Russell Crowe, Christian Bale, Logan Lerman, Peter Fonda, Ben Foster, Alan Tudyk, Vinessa Shaw, Dallas Roberts, Luce Rains, Gretchen Mol
description: Dan Evans is a cattle rancher in misery, Ben Wade is an outlaw. The bandit is captured and must be taken to Yuma prison to be hanged: Evans, to pay his debts, agrees to be part of the escort ...
notes: Taken from a "pulp novel" by Elmore Leonard, already at the base of one of the ten most beautiful westerns in history, it is curious only for the different conception of the protagonist Evans, here fragile and with a wooden leg (but then he runs almost like a hare ...). Uselessly wordy and baroque, at times it seems a parody of spaghetti westerns. Self-defeating the wink at Fuller and unbearably dilated the ending.

title: Next
actors: Nicolas Cage, Julianne Moore, Jessica Biel, Thomas Kretschmann, Tory Kittles, Peter Falk
description: Cris Johnson has the power to predict the near future, and for this he is persecuted by the government who wants to steal the functioning of this ability. To escape him, Cris assumes the identity of Frank Cadillac, and moves to Las Vegas where he works as a magician. But his skills are needed to foil a terrorist plot ...
notes: The starting point is a short story by Philip K. Dick, The Golden Man, written in the 1950s, but the themes of fate and the hunted mutant are well known and have given better results (Minority Report, just to stay with Dick). The only two reasons to see Next are therefore Julianne Moore, always gorgeous, and a cameo by Peter Falk, adorable but tainted with a New Millennium Hollywood-style anti-smoking joke.

title: Beowulf
actors: Ray Winstone, Angelina Jolie, Anthony Hopkins, Crispin Glover, Robin Wright, John Malkovich
description: The reign of King Hrothgar is threatened by Grendel, a creature who devours men. The allied prince Beowulf rushes to his aid and soon discovers that the monster, protected by a spell, is not scratched by weapons. The hero fights him with his bare hands, and kills him, unleashing the wrath of Grendel's terrible mother.
notes: It is not difficult to praise it, just point the lens on the theoretical question of motion capture: the digital applied to the human, the final victory of the human over the digital (or vice versa?). Nor, on the other hand, is it easy to dismiss it: because here and there an idea or even only (only?) An image that arouses from torpor peeps out. Zemeckis seems to put in his own, only the final sequence is enough, beautiful.

title: Willard
actors: Bruce Davison, Elsa Lanchester, Ernest Borgnine, Sandra Locke, Michael Dante
description: Willard is a misfit, one who is always made fun of by his workmates, and is marginalized within the company founded by his own father. For friends he has only two rats that he lovingly treats: Ben and Socrates., Which like all rodents, quickly produce a large number of offspring. When one of the mice is killed by his colleagues, his anger reaches its limit. However, the rats themselves will take action, transformed into horrible and perfect killers.

title: Mysterious Island
actors: Patrick Stewart, Kyle MacLachlan, Vinnie Jones, Gabrielle Anwar, Omar Gooding
description: During the American Civil War, a hot air balloon from Richmond ends up stranded on an unknown island where a band of dangerous pirates are hiding. The survivors, aided by Captain Nemo, find themselves forced to face the dangers of the island - not least some giant reptiles - and to discover its secrets ...

title: The Kingdom
actors: Jamie Foxx, Chris Cooper, Jennifer Garner, Jason Bateman, Jeremy Piven, Kyle Chandler
description: A terrorist attack in Riyadh creates a diplomatic incident: although local authorities are very unwilling to American intervention, FBI special agent Ronald Fleury leaves for Saudi Arabia with a group chosen to try to capture the bomber. ..
notes: Berg's fourth feature has the effectiveness of a big-grained blockbuster; and in political matters it only apparently favors the alliance between different cultures and religions in the hunt for those who shed blood, while in reality it celebrates US interventionism as an indispensable solution. Produced by Michael Mann, he is superficially influenced by it.

title: Dead Silence
actors: Ryan Kwanten, Amber Valletta, Donnie Wahlberg, Michael Fairman
description: A woman named Lisa is horribly killed in her home shortly after receiving a package containing a puppet, the type used by ventriloquists. The suspect is her husband Jamie, who works to find out the truth about Lisa's death and clear himself. To do this he must return to Ravens Fair, the town where he was born, and stir in the murky past of the community, which in the 1940s summarily executed and buried together with all its puppets a ventriloquist, accused of killing a little boy. ...
notes: A predictable and contrived horror, which unsuccessfully resorts to some tricks of the kind to try to arouse some fear.

title: The Golden Compass
actors: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig, Eva Green, Dakota Blue Richards, Jim Carter, Sam Elliott
description: A host of an English college, 11-year-old Lyra is an enterprising child who has a "daimon", an animal spirit who is always by her side. When some kids disappear, Lyra sets off with the beautiful Mrs. Coulter for the Arctic, to a place populated by fantastic and fearsome creatures.
notes: After the heaviness of Narnia and Terabithia, here is a funny fantasy, narratively complex but honest (in the sense that you do not get lost among hundreds of references understandable only to initiates). An adventure to the edge of the world, following a witchy and charming Kidman at ease with this unusual evil aura.

title: Cerberus
actors: Greg Evigan, Garret Sato, Bogdan Uritescu, Gabi Andronache, C. Victor Brynner, Florin Busuioc, Chuck Caudill Jr., Michael Cory Davis, Alina Dutá, Brent Florence
description: Bucharest: Attila's armor is stolen from the National Museum of Antiquities, and Radu - the head of the institute - is killed; in New York, the news of Radu's death is communicated by agent Adams to Dr. Raines, his old friend. The thieves think that the inscriptions on the armor can lead them to the sword of Mars, challenging Cerberus who is its keeper: the weapon, in fact, would make its owner invincible. Back in Romania, Raines becomes involved in the affair ...
notes: Halfway between horror and the "spy story", a low budget film that does not convince for the inconsistency of the plot. The special effects are scarce and disappointing.

title: Cherry Falls
actors: Brittany Murphy, Jay Mohr, Michael Biehn, Jesse Bradford, Candy Clark, Amanda Anka, Joe Inscoe, Gabriel Mann, Natalie Ramsey, Douglas Spain
description: herry Falls is a quiet Virginia town where a serial killer started shooting. The killer follows a specific criterion: the victims are all teenagers, attend George Washington High School and are virgins. When the students realize the danger, they try to save themselves with a big party in which to lose their virginity ...
notes: Reversal of the habits of the "slasher", where the less promiscuous girls are saved, the film is tinged with a black comedy: the numerous cuts suffered, however, make it both not very violent as horror and not as caustic as satire. A missed cult, but still interesting.

title: A.I. Assault
actors: Joe Lando, Michael Dorn, Alexandra Paul, Joshua Cox, Roark Critchlow, Hudson Leick, Robert Picardo, Jay Richardson, George Takei, Tim Thomerson
description: A plane carrying a cargo of top secret military robots falls on a desert island in the Pacific Ocean. A team of Navy Seals is forced to find the droids and shut them down before their intelligence becomes the source of an unprecedented attack.

title: Double Bang
actors: William Baldwin, Richard Portnow, Adam Baldwin, Christian Camargo, John Capodice, Suzanne Carney, Michael Ray Clark, Una Damon, Erich Martin Hicks, Loren Lazerine
description: Billy Brennan's corrupt colleague, a NYPD officer, is found dead. Billy dives into an unscrupulous vigilante mission, interrogates criminals and pits gangs against each other. During the investigation he runs into Brenda, the girlfriend of an informant who a killer wants dead.

title: I Am Legend
actors: Will Smith, Alice Braga, Charlie Tahan, Salli Richardson, Willow Smith, Darrell Foster, April Grace, Dash Mihok, Joanna Numata, Samuel Glen
description: A terrifying virus, originally born out of cancer research and "got out of hand" by researchers, turns people into rabid animals, ruthless and inhuman monsters, similar to vampires. In New York City, the only one who has not been infected is Robert Neville, who together with his dog Sam wages his lonely and desperate battle against the vampire gangs, in an attempt to survive and find a cure ...
notes: From the novel of the same name (1954) by the American writer Richard Matheson, which inspired - more or less directly - a conspicuous series of cinematographic works: from Ubaldo Ragona's Last Man on Earth (1964) to The Night of the Living Dead ( 1968) by George A. Romero and _28 Days Later_ (2002) by Danny Boyle. Lawrence tells a good story about a city without eyes that desperately seeks its own image and the alienating loneliness of a man: unfortunately, however, the film does not fully assume its responsibilities, and abdicates the consoling mysticism of those who have no better arguments.

title: Halloween
actors: Tyler Mane, Malcolm McDowell, Brad Dourif, Daeg Faerch, Sheri Moon Zombie, William Forsythe, Richard Lynch, Udo Kier, Clint Howard, Danny Trejo, Scout Taylor-Compton, Danielle Harris, Kristina Klebe, Ken Foree, Lew Temple, Jenny Gregg Stewart, Hanna Hall, Bill Moseley, Leslie Easterbrook, Dee Wallace, Sybil Danning, Sid Haig, Daniel Roebuck
description: After being imprisoned for 17 long years in an asylum and receiving the (useless) care of Dr. Sam Loomis, Michael Myers - now an adult and still very dangerous - escapes and immediately heads to his hometown, Haddonfield in Illinois, where he wants to find his little sister. Anyone who crosses his path risks his life ...
notes: Rob Zombie puts his hand to the myth and gives his best by telling the origin of Evil, which coincides for Michael Myers with an innate and astonished sadism well cultivated within the walls of the house. The final part is furious and devouring, and reconfirms the impressive talent of the author of _La casa del diavolo_.

title: The Mist
actors: Thomas Jane, Marcia Gay Harden, Laurie Holden, Alexa Davalos, William Sadler, Andre Braugher, Toby Jones, Jeffrey DeMunn, Frances Sternhagen, Nathan Gamble
description: A violent storm hits a small town in Maine: the next morning, a strange fog envelops the whole area. The phenomenon holds supermarket shoppers captive, including David Drayton and his five-year-old son. The mysterious cries that are heard coming from the thick blanket soon reveal the presence of terrible creatures from another dimension. And while all hell breaks loose, the group barricaded in the shop tries to survive ...
notes: From the point of view of horror mechanics it's the usual stuff: scares on command and a routine staging. However, the central part in the supermarket makes your skin crawl. Based on a short story by Stephen King.

title: Dinosaurus!
actors: Ward Ramsey, Paul Lukather, Kristina Hanson, Alan Roberts, Fred Engelberg, Wayne C. Treadway, Luci Blaine, Howard Dayton, Jack Younger, James Logan
description: Plot in preparation

title: Dance of the Dead
actors: Jonathan Tucker, Jessica Lowndes, Robert Englund, Ryan McDonald, Marilyn Norry
description: In a post-atomic future, Jessica - an impatient teen-ager with an overprotective mother - falls in love with a drug addict biker whom she lets herself be taken to a strange place, the Doom Room, where a shady figure revives the corpses of nuclear war and makes them. dance for an audience of human wrecks ...
notes: Discreet episode of the _Masters of Horror_ series directed by Tobe Hooper with quotes (even) from Collodi's _Pinocchio_. In reality, however, it is taken from a story by Richard Matheson (written by his son) and updated to the phobias of post 9/11. Participation of Robert Englund, increasingly speckish.

title: Cloverfield
actors: Lizzy Caplan, Jessica Lucas, Michael Stahl-David, T.J. Miller, Mike Vogel, Odette Annable
description: New York: Five young people organize a farewell party for a friend who is about to leave the city. Suddenly the lights go out and the earth begins to shake: it is only the beginning of a series of disasters caused by the attack of a mysterious creature. The boys will wander around the metropolis with a video camera documenting their attempt at survival ...
notes: Shot _Blair Witch Project_ style, featuring a Godzilla-like monster and played on YouTube's fashionable post-September 11 paranoia. It doesn't reflect on the voracity of the medium and puts a strain on credibility, but the show and the tension often work.

title: Jumper
actors: Hayden Christensen, Jamie Bell, Samuel L. Jackson, Rachel Bilson, Diane Lane, Tom Hulce, Michael Rooker, Sean Baek, Katie Boland, Nathalie Cox
description: David, a 15-year-old boy, discovers he has the ability to teleport anywhere he wants. Having run away from home, he does not hesitate to use his power to carry out criminal acts. After years of robbing banks and casinos and moving undisturbed from one place to another on the globe, David finds himself face to face with someone who knows his secret: it is the Paladins, who for centuries have persecuted and killed the "jumpers", believed to be aberrant creatures that challenge the omnipotence of God. So the time comes for David to fight for his own life and that of the people he loves.
notes: The idea is so fascinating that it even survives the poor elaboration made by David Goyer and his collaborators. Even Liman, who at least knows how to orchestrate fireworks and keep characters of a certain depth on the field, seems disoriented, as if he didn't have enough material at his disposal.

title: Darklight
actors: Shiri Appleby, Richard Burgi, John de Lancie, David Hewlett, Ross Manarchy, Richard Gnolfo, George R. Sheffey
description: A young woman with no memory lives as a shop assistant, but her existence is completely turned upside down when she discovers she is the incarnation of Lilith, Adam's first wife, punished by God. Unbeknownst to her, her blood was stolen and used by a scientist. mad to create abominations that now only she can fight ...

title: Shallow Ground
actors: Timothy V. Murphy, Stan Kirsch, Lindsey Stoddart, Patty McCormack, Rocky Marquette, Natalie Avital, Chris Hendrie, Tara Killian, Myron Natwick, Steve Eastin
description: A young man wanders completely naked in a wood, with a bloodstained knife in his hand; nearby, a police station is about to close its doors. After finding the boy, the sheriff sets off in search of another girl who is still lost in the bush and has been tied to a tree, a prisoner of a psychopath. Thus begins a long chain of murders and revenge ...
notes: An independent product, written without psychological complications and conceived as a supernatural slasher. The blood runs profusely but the script is more confusing than disturbing and gets lost along the way.

title: Star Trek
actors: Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Winona Ryder, Zoë Saldana, Karl Urban, Bruce Greenwood, John Cho, Leonard Nimoy, Simon Pegg, Jennifer Morrison, Chris Hemsworth, Anton Yelchin, Ben Cross, Rachel Nichols
description: Yet another adventure of Captain Kirk and the Enterprise, this time in a prequel to the Classic Series, with the meeting between young Kirk (Chris Pine) and Spock (Zachary Quinto) at the time of attending the Academy at the center of the narrative.

title: Saw IV
actors: Tobin Bell, Costas Mandylor, Scott Patterson, Betsy Russell, Lyriq Bent, Athena Karkanis, Justin Louis, Simon Reynolds, Donnie Wahlberg, Angus MacFadyen
description: After the deaths of the Riddler and his aide Amanda, Special Agents Strahm and Perez help Detective Hoffman investigate the death of the dangerous serial killer. Meanwhile, someone kidnaps Riggs, the commander of the SWAT team. The man is forced to participate in a series of games and traps that seem to have been born from the mind of the Riddler.
notes: High hemoglobin rate, ferocity, claustrophobia and sadism. In this sense, Jigsaw's accounts all add up. The screenplay makes the usual unforgivable mistake of explaining what shouldn't be explained, but the transparency of the playstation holds up well against the (too much) written word. That everything has already been seen, of course, is an integral part of the game.

title: Dolls
actors: Ian Patrick Williams, Carolyn Purdy-Gordon, Carrie Lorraine, Guy Rolfe, Hilary Mason, Bunty Bailey, Cassie Stuart, Stephen Lee
description: A family finds themselves in the midst of a storm during a trip and finds refuge in a country house whose owners build truly "special" dolls: a collection of devilish objects with which the family will have to compete.

title: Alien Apocalypse
actors: Bruce Campbell, Renée O'Connor, Remington Franklin, Michael Cory Davis, Peter Jason, Neda Sokolovska, Vladimir Kolev, Valentin Giasbeily, Velizar Binev, Dimiter Kuzov
description: Dr. Ivan Wood and three other astronauts return to earth after a 40-year journey. Upon landing they find the decimated population and under the iron heel of the aliens. The invaders have conquered the earth to collect wood, which they resell on their planet where it has astronomical value. Humans have been enslaved and forced to harvest timber, but Wood assembles a group of rebels and begins the battle for planet Earth.
notes: Unlike many other apocalyptic and serious TV-Movies, this one does not lack irony, thanks to a script full of jokes and the presence of the irresistible Bruce Campbell.

title: The Dentist 2
actors: Corbin Bernsen, Jillian McWhirter, Jeff Doucette, Susanne Wright, Jim Antonio, Lee Dawson, Wendy Robie, Ralph Martin, Clint Howard, Linda Hoffman
description: Dr. Feinstone, who in the first film had slaughtered the mouths of many girls, escapes from the asylum and hides in a Midwestern town, where he kills the local dentist and takes his place. The inhabitants, not all properly balanced, will soon discover how much better it is for them not to have cavities ...
notes: Sequel to one of Brian Yuzna's best films, successful precisely because it relies on the most elementary of fears: the one that each of us can experience when going to the doctor for teeth cleaning. In the sequel, you are a little more prepared for fright, which reduces the effect: but for those who like it, there is a lot of fun.

title: Joshua
actors: Jacob Kogan, Sam Rockwell, Vera Farmiga, Celia Weston, Dallas Roberts, Michael McKean, Nancy Giles, Linda Larkin, Alex Draper, Stephanie Roth Haberle
description: Brad and Abby are a New York couple who have a life that flows smoothly and smoothly: they have a beautiful home, a nine-year-old boy - Joshua - who is a delight and gives them a lot of satisfaction and now a new daughter, too. However, it is the arrival of the little girl that generates a bit of disturbance. Like all children Joshua feels displaced, unsure of his parents' affection and struggling with what appears to be a great crisis of jealousy. What seems like a normal growth problem, however, manifests itself as something much more serious and nothing seems to be the same anymore: it is mainly because of Joshua, whose soul hides darkness that is becoming more and more disturbing. To the abyss.
notes: Despite the reinterpretation of the classic places of terror, the tension does not stand up to the inconsistency of the characters. They lack credibility, and lacking is also a red thread. Here the skeins are of all colors, and are very cheated. We understood the reference to the Damien of _The Omen_, and the other to the hysteria of modern life. But between psychiatric drugs, Egyptian gods and Satan, we are still here to ask ourselves where the problem lies.

title: Wanted
actors: James McAvoy, Angelina Jolie, Morgan Freeman, Terence Stamp, Thomas Kretschmann, Kristen Hager, Marc Warren, Common, David O'Hara, Konstantin Khabensky
description: Wesley Gibson is a lazy young man with a modest job and no ambition. Suddenly the beautiful and reckless Fox enters his life and puts him in contact with a secret society of criminals, the "Brotherhood". Wesley discovers that he has powers inherited from his father, a prominent member of a secret society and for this killed. The boy begins a training that awakens the dormant skills in him. But he will soon be faced with the need to choose his own destiny.
notes: From the graphic novel by Scotsman Mark Millar, it does not scratch, does not strike, does not enjoy. Even the action, which takes up two thirds of the long duration between slowdowns and accelerations, more boring than anything else.

title: The Last Mimzy
actors: Rhiannon Leigh Wryn, Chris O'Neil, Rainn Wilson, Joely Richardson, Timothy Hutton, Kathryn Hahn, Michael Clarke Duncan, Kirsten Williamson, Irene Snow, Marc Musso
description: One day, playing on the beach, Emma and Noah find a strange box with some curious objects, including stones and a rabbit. The two children begin to play with it, discovering its mysterious powers: the stones rotate creating energy fields and the bunny talks to Emma. It is the beginning of a fantastic and even a little dangerous adventure ...
notes: You can breathe a nostalgic air, a little 80s, to the _E.T._ or _Explorers_. Situations and atmospheres are much less reassuring than in Disney films, even if there is no lack of superficial and slightly cloying passages. However, much worse is usually offered to children.

title: The Hard Easy
actors: Henry Thomas, David Boreanaz, Vera Farmiga, Bruce Dern, Peter Weller, Nick Lachey, Elimu Nelson, Gary Busey, Rae Allen, Heather Arrelano
description: Paul and Roger do not know each other, but they are in the same problem: they are full of debt and have little time to pay it. Both are given the opportunity to join a different gang of thieves, for a heist that will solve all their problems. It seems like an easy robbery, so much so that the two gangs attempt it at the same time, ending up face to face ...
notes: Usual robbery film that doesn't go through, but for rather unpublished reasons. Unfortunately the twists are phoned and the resolution does not shine. The whole thing is weighed down by _Angel_'s Boreanaz, and not sufficiently lifted by veterans Gary Busey, Peter Weller and Bruce Dern in small roles.

title: Fear of Flying
actors: Craig Sheffer, Jennifer Beals, Tom Berenger, Jeffrey Nordling, Jay Brazeau, Daryl Shuttleworth, Paul Jarrett, Andrew Kavadas, Chilton Crane, Peter Kelamis
description: A group of terrorists manages to evade the security systems and board a scheduled flight. Among the passengers there are some people who took part in a course to try to overcome the fear of flying. As soon as the armed handpiece reveals its true intentions, the crew and tourists panic and the situation worsens: a young aeronautical engineer - helped by the beautiful Jessica, one of the course participants - tries to make a guided emergency landing. by Syke, a control tower attendant ...
notes: The film isn't great, but it has good suspense and a decent cast.

title: Shoot 'Em Up
actors: Clive Owen, Paul Giamatti, Monica Bellucci, Stephen McHattie, Greg Bryk, Daniel Pilon, Sidney Mende-Gibson, Lucas Mende-Gibson, Kaylyn Yellowlees, Ramona Pringle
description: Hunted by dangerous hit men, a young woman dies in a shooting after giving birth to a child. Involved in the fight, Smith takes care of the little boy by entrusting him to a prostitute named DQ. Soon, however, the man finds himself on his heels with the ruthless killers led by Hertz, who have decided to do anything to eliminate the infant ...
notes: After four minutes of film there are already twelve dead. At the end of the "countdown" there are about a hundred, one of which was made dry by shooting with his fingers. Among unbearable amenities, the conceptual peaks of "shooters" are celebrated. Between Tarantino and Besson, thinking of comics and videogame rhythms.

title: Speed Racer
actors: Emile Hirsch, Christina Ricci, Matthew Fox, Susan Sarandon, John Goodman, Scott Porter, Hiroyuki Sanada, Richard Roundtree, Christian Oliver, Rain
description: Speed ??Racer is a talented rally driver whose dream is to win the race in which his older brother Rex lost his life. Flattered by an offer from the powerful Royalton, he is tempted to accept but prefers to trust the family mechanic team. The multinational goes through incorrect maneuvers to crush opponents, but Speed ??also finds some unexpected allies, such as the enigmatic Racer X ...
notes: The return behind the camera of the directors of Matrix is ??the experiment of a cinema show that ceases to be… cinema. But beyond the ontological issues, the result is thundering to the point of stupidity and boredom. Based on a Japanese cartoon from 1967.

title: Altered
actors: Misty Rosas, Paul McCarthy-Boyington, Brad William Henke, Michael C. Williams, Adam Kaufman, Catherine Mangan, James Gammon, Joe Unger, Klaus Heesch
description: Three men were abducted by aliens when they were still boys. They suffered several humiliating abuses and, of course, no one believed their story, adding further humiliation. Now they reunite to return to where they were kidnapped, in the vain hope of capturing an alien. When they spot and grab one, it doesn't seem real to them first. The enthusiasm, however, gives way to the fear of an extraterrestrial retaliation and they take refuge with a friend, in turn a victim of the aliens. But things are not what they seem ...
notes: Still improvised actors and badly lit scenes in the new mess of one of the authors of _The Blair Witch Project_.

title: Grandma's House
actors: Eric Foster, Kim Valentine, Len Lesser, Ida Lee, Brinke Stevens, Michael Robinson, Craig Yerman, David Donham, Joan-Carol Bensen, Angela O'Neill
description: Rimsti without parents after the death of his father (his mother had passed away years earlier), the teenager Lynn and her little brother David go to live with their grandparents, on a farm near a vast orange grove. During the bus ride a mysterious woman stands in the middle of the road and almost ends up run over; the same lady reappears near the farm during the night. David witnesses his murder by his grandfather, who then takes the body to the cellar, where the child follows him but ends up being discovered ...
notes: On paper it may appear full of mysteries, dream sequences and twists, but in reality it is only patched up at least badly.

title: The Eye
actors: Jessica Alba, Rade Serbedzija, Parker Posey, Alessandro Nivola, Fernanda Romero, Rachel Ticotin, Obba Babatundé, Danny Mora, Chloë Grace Moretz, Brett Haworth
description: Sidney Wells is a famous violinist who has been blind since the age of five. Sister Helen, who has always felt responsible for her blindness, however, has a cornea transplant planned for her which should give her back the use of her eyes. The operation seems to be successful, but the girl begins to see dead people everywhere. What is worse is that the clearer the view becomes, the more monstrosity of the visions increases. Who did Sidney's new corneas belong to?
notes: Remake of Hong Kong's _The Eye_ by the Pang brothers, it makes extensive use of digital for gruesome appearances. Able to satisfy undemanding palates, however, it does not shine for inventiveness.

title: Schizoid
actors: Klaus Kinski, Marianna Hill, Craig Wasson, Donna Wilkes, Richard Herd, Christopher Lloyd, Joe Regalbuto, Flo Gerrish, Kiva Lawrence, Fredric Cook
description: Julie, a reporter who runs the advice column, begins receiving anonymous death threats. Meanwhile, the women in his therapy group are stabbed, one by one, by an unknown assailant. Is there a connection?
notes: Leading the "group therapy" is the sketchy psychiatrist Klaus Kinski, and this alone would be enough to imagine the development of the plot. The film is a mediocre killer of the 80s, at the time rather admired by fans of the genre for the abundance of "gore" effects. Revised today, it is a jumble of psychoanalytic clichés weighed down by the proof of an overly gigantic protagonist.

title: Nim's Island
actors: Jodie Foster, Abigail Breslin, Gerard Butler, Christopher Baker, Peter Callan, Michael Carman, Rhonda Doyle, Morgan Griffin, Maddison Joyce, Sean Keenan
description: Alexandra is a famous children's book writer, specializing in adventurous and breathtaking stories. However, she is not happy: in fact she lives alone and confined in the house, tormented by her insecurity and her fears, and she relates to the outside only through the computer. A "flush out" is the message of a little fan who writes a heartfelt request for help: her father has in fact disappeared mysteriously on the island where he lived with her. Alexandra thus decides to face the world for the first time, discovering how much real adventure - and how much wonder - there is in the reality from which she was fleeing ...
notes: Based on the book of the same name by Wendy Orr and Kerry Millard, an adventure for the little ones with an island - breathtakingly beautiful - that winks at that of _Lost_. If little Nim is flawless, the great actors - Butler and Foster - are out of place and oversized: loaded and never sober, unable to bring characters to the screen that can touch our souls as those in fairy tales do.

title: House of the Dead 2
actors: Emmanuelle Vaugier, Ed Quinn, Sticky Fingaz, Steve Monroe, Victoria Pratt, James Parks, Dan Southworth, Billy Brown, Nadine Velazquez, Ellie Cornell
description: At the University of Guesta Verde, a professor carries out the insane project of bringing the dead back to life by killing unsuspecting students for his experiments. When the campus is invaded by undead creatures, the government sends special forces and a research team - consisting of Dr. Morgan and Lt. Ellis - to locate the first zombie and try to end the carnage. The group, in constant danger of life, also has the minutes counted because, at the end of the mission, the area will be bombed and completely destroyed. It will not be easy for the team to fulfill their task and survive ...

title: Fool's Gold
actors: Matthew McConaughey, Kate Hudson, Donald Sutherland, Alexis Dziena, Ewen Bremner, Ray Winstone, Kevin Hart, Malcolm-Jamal Warner, Brian Hooks, David Roberts
description: Ben "Finn" Finnegan is obsessed with a fixed idea: to find the legendary and priceless "dowry of the queen", lost at sea in 1715. He has dedicated his entire life to this purpose, to the point of ruining his marriage with Tess. . But just as the latter is making a living working on billionaire Nigel Honeycutt's mega-yacht, Ben finds an important clue and convinces Nigel to get on board. But Moe, the former "teacher" of Ben, gets on their trail ...
notes: The idea is simple: brush up on the classic adventure comedy and update it. But all, unfortunately, is resolved in a mere exercise in style out of time: good-natured, a little tedious and essentially useless.

title: P2
actors: Rachel Nichols, Wes Bentley, Philip Akin, Stephanie Moore, Miranda Edwards, Paul Sun-Hyung Lee, Grace Lynn Kung, Bathsheba Garnett, Philip Williams, Arnold Pinnock
description: It's Christmas Eve: Angela Bridges, an ambitious young career woman, is preparing to finally join her family for the celebrations; but, arriving in the garage, she notices that the car does not start. When Thomas, a security officer, kindly offers her help, she accepts with some reservations: she will find herself stuck in the basement with a man who is anything but reliable ...
notes: Short inspiration and videogame dynamics to tell a blood red Christmas. A fight for survival with no holds barred but above all without twists, between the cold of the neon lights and the grainy images of the surveillance cameras.

title: Seraphim Falls
actors: Liam Neeson, Pierce Brosnan, Michael Wincott, Xander Berkeley, Ed Lauter, Tom Noonan, Kevin J. O'Connor, John Robinson, Anjelica Huston, Angie Harmon
description: Gideon travels alone in the Rocky Mountains in the wake of the American Civil War. Wounded and hunted by a group of men led by Carver, he skilfully evades his pursuers, resulting in a manhunt across deserts and prairies. Old grudges and stories from the past erupt in the inevitable face-to-face between Gideon and Carver.
notes: A bloody and bloody western, where no one forgets and it is difficult to say who is good and who is bad. The first part, of ferocious chase between snow-capped mountains and without mercy, is better than the second, with excessive metaphysical ambitions in a desert populated by strange characters.

title: Son of the Dragon
actors: David Carradine, John Reardon, Desiree Ann Siahaan, Rupert Graves, Theresa Lee
description: He calls himself the Devil Boy and is a cunning thief who loves adventure and steals to feed Shanghai's street children. The exciting new venture she and her trusty companion Bird set out to do is to steal the royal family's treasure. To succeed in his aim, he presents himself at court pretending to be a prince who has come to ask for the hand of Li Wei, the governor's daughter. But conquering the beautiful princess will not be easy, because she will have to face tough tests in competition with a high-ranking suitor, the prince of the North, who does not hesitate to use pitfalls to get rid of his rival ...

title: Death Race
actors: Jason Statham, Joan Allen, Tyrese Gibson, Ian McShane, Jacob Vargas, Robert LaSardo, Max Ryan, Natalie Martinez, Janaya Stephens, Frederick Koehler
description: Three-time speedway champion Jensen Ames is now an expert in the art of survival in the wasteland that has become America. And just when he thinks he has turned, he is indicted for a crime he did not commit. However, his jailer offers him a chance that could prevent him from rotting in a cell. He will have to participate in a last tremendous three-day race between criminals willing to do anything to earn their freedom, aboard cars rigged with all kinds of devilry.
notes: A nominal only remake of the classic Year 2000 Death Race produced by Roger Corman and directed by Paul Bartel, Paul W. S. Anderson's film is something of an Interceptor behind bars. The first automotive film after Speed ​​Racer, it recovers the physicality of crashing sheets trying to preserve the political appeal of the original. Between post-apocalyptic B movie and video game, Death Race is Anderson's first film that resembles cinema (albeit elementary).

title: Desolation Canyon
actors: Patrick Duffy, Stacy Keach, David Rees Snell, Kenny Johnson, Kelly Overton, Courtney Gains, Victor Browne, A Martinez, Cubbie Kile, Michael Patrick McGill
description: Kendrick is an old gunslinger who retired near the remote Desolation Canyon with his young Mexican wife Alejandra. Peace is shattered by the visit of his friend sheriff Tomas, who informs him of the actions of the ferocious Press Reynolds gang: the neighboring villages are set on fire ...

title: The Strangers
actors: Liv Tyler, Scott Speedman, Sterling Beaumon, Peter Clayton-Luce, Glenn Howerton, Laura Margolis, Gemma Ward, Kip Weeks
description: A young couple spends a vacation in an isolated house and is terrorized by three unknown masked attackers.
notes: Written and directed by a newcomer with a sure hand, and starring a regenerated Liv Tyler, it is an interesting variation on the theme of "slasher". The strength of the film lies in the title's strangers, the silent visitors who bring terror into the cottage. The mystery and the original dynamics between the characters make it an atypical and concise horror.

title: Dracula III. Legacy
actors: Jason Scott Lee, Jason London, Roy Scheider, Rutger Hauer, Diane Neal, Alexandra Wescourt, Stephen Billington, Claudiu Bleont, Serban Celea, Ioana Ginghina
description: After escaping Luke and Uffizi, Dracula has lost track of him. Five years after that episode, the hunters finally decided to face him in his homeland, Romania. Luke wants to save Elizabeth, while Uffizi wants to eliminate the father of the bloodsuckers once and for all ...
notes: Third episode of the saga produced by Sam Raimi and started with _Dracula’s Legacy_. All films are directed by Patrick Lussier, but the second and third segments were made directly for the home video market. The last chapter is definitely the worst and the only novelty is Rutger Hauer in the role of Dracula, but it's just sad.

title: Prom Night
actors: Brittany Snow, Scott Porter, Jessica Stroup, Dana Davis, Collins Pennie, Kelly Blatz, James Ransone, Brianne Davis, Kellan Lutz, Mary Mara
description: Donna is a senior high school student recovering from a terrible tragedy she survived. She looks forward to prom day, and when it arrives, surrounded by her best friends, she feels safe from the horrors of her past for the first time. But when the evening turns to terror, there is only one person who can be responsible ... a man she thought was gone forever.
notes: Scraping the bin of the slasher genre, here comes a remake of Don't Enter That House (by Paul Lynch) from 1980: serial stuff and a Gossip Girl cut.

title: McLintock!
actors: John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Patrick Wayne, Stefanie Powers, Jack Kruschen, Chill Wills, Yvonne De Carlo, Jerry Van Dyke, Edgar Buchanan, Bruce Cabot
description: George Washington McLintock is an esteemed Texas rancher who has lived in solitude on his ranch since his wife left him accusing him of adultery. Tired of looking after everything by himself, he hires a cook - a beautiful widow - and agrees to welcome the woman's two children. But Mrs. McLintock is about to swoop down on the ranch determined to get a divorce and custody of her daughter Becky, who is about to return from college ...
notes: A sort of comedy in a western style, the film showcases a seasoned pair of protagonists, capable of handling squabbles. Not so, however, the director, a loyal Wayne: a more concise editing would have helped, and instead ...

title: Simon Says
actors: Crispin Glover, Margo Harshman, Greg Cipes, Carrie Finklea, Kelly Vitz, Artie Baxter, Lori Lively, Bruce Glover, Erica Hubbard, Blake Lively
description: Kate, Riff, Zack, Vicky and Ashley are a diverse group of teen-ager friends. They organize a trip in a tent to have a good time away from everyone and on the street they hear, from the two guardians of a cemetery, the story of two twins, one "slow" and the other bad. In the nearby town they meet Simon and Riff teases him, only to disappear when the boys have camped in an isolated area. Here Simon's twin Stanley plays college hunt with a series of elaborate traps.
notes: Typical horror-killing teen-ager, predictable in all respects except for the killer contraptions, including a catapult used to throw sharp axes!

title: Mortuary
actors: Mary Beth McDonough, David Wallace, Bill Paxton, Lynda Day George, Christopher George, Curt Ayers, Bill Conklin, Donna Garrett, Greg Kaye, Denis Mandel
description: Plot in preparation

title: Satan's Sadists
actors: Russ Tamblyn, Scott Brady, John 'Bud' Cardos, Robert Dix, Gary Kent, Greydon Clark, Kent Taylor, Regina Carrol, Jacqueline Cole, William Bonner
description: Plot in preparation

title: The Wolf Man
actors: Emily Blunt, Anthony Hopkins, Benicio Del Toro, Hugo Weaving, Catherine Balavage, Richard James, Aimee McGoldrick, Michael Cronin, Stuart St. Paul, Robert Roman Ratajczak
description: Lawrence Talbot returns to the family estate after his brother goes missing. Calling him was Gwen Conliffe, girlfriend of the deceased, who begs him to help her in the search, also because a bloodthirsty murderer has recently caused some deaths in the country. Although returning to his father's house is painful for him, Talbot is dedicated to finding his brother. He will have to collide with something whose existence he never even imagined.
notes: Totally unsuitable is Del Toro to cover the part. Disoriented, he never seems to believe it. A shame, because Emily Blunt looks good and Anthony Hopkins is strangely fit, as has rarely happened to him in recent years.

title: Sniper 3
actors: Tom Berenger, Byron Mann, John Doman, Denis Arndt, Troy Winbush, Jeannetta Arnette, William Duffy, Nophand Boonyai, Dom Hetrakul, Govit Vattanakun
description: Marksman Thomas Beckett is hired by the American secret services to eliminate a major international drug trafficker and terrorist. This is Paul Finnegan, his old friend who he believed died years earlier in Vietnam. Thus he discovers that the real objective of the mission is another.

title: The Signal
directors: David Bruckner, Jacob Gentry, Dan Bush
actors: Anessa Ramsey, Sahr Ngaujah, AJ Bowen, Matthew Stanton, Suehyla El-Attar, Justin Welborn, Cheri Christian, Scott Poythress, Christopher Thomas, Lindsey Garrett, Chad McKnight
description: In Terminus, where Ben and his mistress Mya live, a radio signal takes over all electrical devices, driving anyone who comes into contact with them crazy. It's chaos: As the trail of violence and death lengthens, Ben, miraculously escaping the radiation, sets out on a desperate search for Mya.

title: Boogeyman 2
actors: Danielle Savre, Matt Cohen, Chrissy Griffith, Michael Graziadei, Mae Whitman, Renée O'Connor, Tobin Bell, Johnny Simmons, David Gallagher, Lesli Margherita
description: Laura Porter has long been plagued by a phobia that has as its object the ancient fear of the black man: a terror that comes from having witnessed the brutal murder of her parents. The woman voluntarily goes to a clinic for mental disorders in order to undergo therapy, hoping to overcome and erase her problem: however, she will come across situations in comparison to which her phobias are absolutely sustainable and even desirable ...
notes: Fantasy hides and replicates a script that has already been seen thousands of times, namely that of the beauty in danger and the evil monster that haunts her. The use of blue light is incessant to the point of boredom.

title: Furnace
actors: Michael Paré, Kelly Stables, Muffy Bolding, Cam Chaney, Richard Cowl, Spencer Gray, L. Michele Hester, Victoria Hester, Taylor Kinney, Frank Knapp Jr., Tom Sizemore
description: Detective Michael Turner is investigating the mysterious deaths occurring in and around a maximum security prison. But what seemed like an investigation into strange cases of alleged suicide turns into a fierce battle against the inexplicable.

title: Toolbox Murders
actors: Angela Bettis, Brent Roam, Marco Rodriguez, Rance Howard, Juliet Landau, Adam Gierasch, Greg Travis, Christopher Doyle, Adam Weisman, Christina Venuti
description: Plot in preparation

title: Vampires vs. Zombies
actors: Bonny Giroux, C.S. Munro, Maritama Carlson, Brinke Stevens, Peter Ruginis, Melanie Crystal, Erica Carroll, Roy Tupper, Rob Carpenter, Jon Scheffer
description: Plot in preparation

title: Creek
actors: Dominic Purcell, Henry Cavill, Michael Fassbender, Emma Booth, Rainer Winkelvoss, Shea Whigham, Gerard McSorley, Winter Ave Zoli, Florin Piersic Jr., Matthew Benson
description: Plot in preparation

title: Hell Ride
actors: Larry Bishop, Dennis Hopper, Michael Madsen, Vinnie Jones, Eric Balfour, Kanin J. Howell, Michael Beach, Cassandra Hepburn, Leonor Varela, Laura Cayouette
description: Plot in preparation

title: City of Ember
actors: Bill Murray, Tim Robbins, Saoirse Ronan, Martin Landau, Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Mary Kay Place, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Harry Treadaway, Liz Smith
description: For generations, the people of the city of Ember lived in peace and prosperity underground thanks to the immense generator that provided abundant light. Unfortunately, however, the powerful machine had an expiration date and after 200 years its generous activity has come to an end. It will be up to Lina and Doom, two teenagers, to face the blackout that is about to condemn their extraordinary city, in a race against time destined to unravel the ancient mystery of the foundation and to help their fellow citizens to escape from the darkness that is about to close on them.
notes: Based on the novel of the same name by Jeanne DuPrau, Ember. The Mystery of the City of Light is an adventure for children, with mysterious maps, puzzles, vast dungeons and a healthy sense of wonder (even at the cost of unlikely solutions). If the adults are lost in games of power and greed, crushed by disillusionment or intoxicated by mystical fantasies, it remains for the two young people to seek an escape from the city, whose energy generator is unraveling. A fairytale structure made with grace and wrapped in an original and wonderful place.

title: The Spirit
actors: Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L. Jackson, Eva Mendes, Jaime King, Gabriel Macht, Paz Vega, Stana Katic, Johnny Simmons, Sarah Paulson, Dan Lauria
description: The story of a former policeman (Gabriel Macht) who mysteriously returns from the dead in the guise of The Spirit to fight crime in the depths of Central City. However, his sworn enemy Octopus (Samuel L. Jackson) has a very different plan: to wipe out the city and fulfill his mad dream of immortality. The result is a relentless fight to defeat the killer, chasing him through the macabre scenarios of Central City. Meanwhile, the masked hero is faced with a bevy of beautiful women intent on seducing him, now loving him, now killing him: from Ellen Dolan (Sarah Paulson), the girl next door with caustic intelligence, to Silken Floss (Scarlett Johansson), the intriguing secretary, attractive and icy, passing through Plaster Of Paris (Paz Vega), the murderous French nightclub dancer, Lorelei (Jaime King), the ghost mermaid, and Morgenstern (Stana Katic), a young and sexy policewoman. Without forgetting Sand Saref (Eva Mendes), the jewel thief with very dangerous curves: her true, only love, which has now become ruthless and unscrupulous.
notes: Miller in The Spirit takes little more than a handful of names from Eisner's strip of the same name (which dates back to 1940), and instead continues to play with his own Sin City, in a slightly more cartoonish version with CGI passages worthy of Speed ??Racer, but frozen by the chromatic games already seen that tire after two minutes.
