It is not just a question of treason towards Eisner: it is the entire plot set up by Miller that bundles situations and characters together as in a catalog without rhyme or reason, and the same goes for the quotationist jokes. Among characters who are constantly resurrected, the only thing that remains dead in The Spirit is cinema.

title: War
actors: Devon Aoki, Jet Li, Jason Statham, John Lone, Luis Guzmán, Saul Rubinek, Ryo Ishibashi, Sung Kang, Mathew St. Patrick, Nadine Velazquez
description: Jack Crawford is a brave and enterprising FBI agent who, distraught by the death of a colleague and friend, takes action to obtain a personal revenge against the perpetrator - a killer called Rogue - and the perpetrators of the murder, who belong to the Japanese mafia. However, the same criminal organization is traversed within it by a series of betrayals and crises and, as the investigation continues, the situation worsens.
notes: Lonely and rebellious anti-heroes as tradition dictates, but bored and out of place on the screen. In the end, despite some theatrical hits, it is the usual action film in which there is very little action. And the show also comes down to a couple of short sequences. The times of _Yazuka_ by the late Sydney Pollack, an example of the Western taste to reproduce an Orient consistent with the mythology of the Yakuza-eiga, are far away.

title: V: The Final Battle
actors: Michael Durrell, Robert Englund, Faye Grant, Jane Badler, Richard Herd
description: Resistance fighters Juliet Parrish and Mike Donovan lead a band of humans in an attempt to discredit the aliens and reveal their very peaceful nature to the world: they will have their chance at a banquet attended by John, the Supreme Commander of the Visitors ...
notes: It starts from the end of the series, but with more action.

title: Man with the Gun
actors: Robert Mitchum, Jan Sterling, Karen Sharpe, Henry Hull, Emile Meyer, John Lupton, Barbara Lawrence, Ted De Corsia, Leo Gordon, James Westerfield
description: Clint Tollinger is a taciturn gunslinger who is hired by the sheriffs when the situation in the city gets too rough. He travels to the border town Sheridan City to win back his wife who left him three years ago, Nelly Bain. She is now in business but the city is corrupted by the fat and bullying Dade Holman. The city council decides to hire Clint, but his methods will raise many doubts.
notes: The directorial and screenwriting debut of the co-founder of the Mercury Theater, then assistant to Orson Welles on the set of some of his masterpieces, is a solid western, graced by a Mitchum in splendid form.

title: Land of the Lost
actors: Will Ferrell, Anna Friel, Danny McBride, Jorma Taccone, Pollyanna McIntosh, Mousa Kraish, Michael Papajohn, Landon Ashworth, Shane Baumel, Douglas Tait
description: During an expedition, paleontologist Rick Marshall is sucked into a space-time vortex along with his assistant and their macho guide. The vortex throws them into an alternate universe where the trio befriends a primate named Chaka who will become their only companion and ally in a hostile world populated by dinosaurs and other fantastic creatures, from which it will be really difficult to return.
notes: Taken from a TV series from the 70s, Land of the Lost appears as an out of time operation and perhaps for this reason it was a flop in the States. In fact, the film tries to recover those flashes of light of the cinema of the 50s between Richard Fleischer and Henry Levin and demonstrates how Silberling, after that little experimental masterpiece called 10 things about us, still has the courage to take risks.

title: Path of Destruction
actors: Danica McKellar, David Keith, Chris Pratt, Stephen Furst, Franklin Dennis Jones, Richard Wharton, Ryan Spike Dauner, Michael Cory Davis, Griff Furst, Jeff Rank
description: An oil platform explodes and sinks in the middle of the Black Sea: the case is filed as a terrorist attack. Meanwhile, a series of environmental disasters begin to overwhelm Europe, causing the destruction of Rome and Paris. A young reporter begins to investigate and, together with the meteorologist who supports her, comes to discover the true cause of the devastation: on board the platform, experiments were underway on a particularly aggressive virus (generated thanks to nanotechnology) which, due to explosion, it escaped human control, broke free in the earth's stratosphere and upset the climatic equilibrium ...

title: The Tripper
actors: David Arquette, Richmond Arquette, Courteney Cox, China Crawford, Paz de la Huerta, Alan Draven, Norwood Fisher, Ben Gardiner, Rocky George, Balthazar Getty
description: Plot in preparation

title: Shutter
actors: Joshua Jackson, Rachael Taylor, Megumi Okina, David Denman, John Hensley, Maya Hazen, James Kyson Lee, Yoshiko Miyazaki, Kei Yamamoto, Daisy Betts
description: A real disaster strikes the newlywed couple Eric and Jane, while they are in Japan. First they run over a young woman in the middle of the street, then, later on, they realize that her body has disappeared. Unfortunately not his spirit: his "ghost" begins to appear in the background of the photos taken by the couple, and very soon begins to manifest itself in gruesome forms. When the girl's spirit begins to take shape, it's up to Jane and Eric to discover her secret and put an end to the deadly obsession. This secret, however, may prove even more dangerous to them than the murderous ghost.
notes: A Japanese director for the American remake of a Thai film. Result of rare poverty, wherever (geographically) you look at it. Darkroom dark mystery, skeletons with wigs and skeletons in the closet. Horror-thriller performed at the minimum wage. Forbidden, without reason, to children under 14, but not recommended for everyone.

title: Bad Channels
actors: Robert Factor, Martha Quinn, Aaron Lustig, Michael Huddleston, Roumel Reaux, Paul Hipp, Rodney Ueno, Sonny Carl Davis, Charlie Spradling, Steve Tietsort

title: Devour
actors: Jensen Ackles, Shannyn Sossamon, Dominique Swain, William Sadler, Teach Grant, Martin Cummins, Rob Stewart, R. Nelson Brown, Wanda Cannon, Jenn Griffin
description: In the sleepy town of Cheever Lake, 21-year-old Jake Gray spends his time dabbling with the computer. One day he is drawn by friends Conrad and Dakota in a strange online game called "The Path", which causes him disturbing visions of brutal violence and murder. What was supposed to be just an innocent hobby soon turns into a waking nightmare: Jake begins to confuse reality with hallucinations, as his friends die one after another around him. According to Jake it is all the fault of the game, which seems to have a mysterious connection with the forces of the evil one and, determined to discover the truth, begins to investigate the deaths of the other boys.

title: Headspace
actors: Olivia Hussey, William Atherton, Sean Young, Mark Margolis, Larry Fessenden, Erick Kastel, Dee Wallace, Udo Kier, Christopher Denham, Karen Anderson
description: Plot in preparation

title: Feast
actors: Balthazar Getty, Henry Rollins, Navi Rawat, Judah Friedlander, Josh Zuckerman, Jason Mewes, Jenny Wade, Krista Allen, Clu Gulager, Anthony 'Treach' Criss
description: Plot in preparation

title: 10.5: Apocalypse
actors: Kim Delaney, Melissa Sue Anderson, Tyrone Benskin
description: An earthquake of enormous proportions threatens to turn the American landscape into a pile of rubble. Seismologist Samantha Hill announces a danger: even more serious: two large nuclear reactors are about to be destroyed. Only one man can save billions of lives: the scientist who predicted the disaster years earlier ...

title: Quarantine
actors: Jennifer Carpenter, Johnathon Schaech, Jay Hernandez, Columbus Short, Marin Hinkle, Rade Serbedzija, Greg Germann, Steve Harris, Joey King, Denis O'Hare
description: TV reporter Angela Vidal, and her cameraman, are given the task of spending a night with the Los Angeles fire brigade. Following a seemingly routine call, they go to an apartment building, where they discover that a woman has been infected with "something" unidentifiable. The entire building is thus quarantined. It will be the recordings of the journalistic team to reveal what really happened.
notes: Remake of the 2007 Spanish horror [REC], but with a longer introductory part, a more banal ending and much less cynicism in describing the tenants, who in the original exchanged ferocious and politically incorrect accusations.

title: Mirrors
actors: Kiefer Sutherland, Paula Patton, Amy Smart, Cameron Boyce, Erica Gluck, Mary Beth Peil, John Shrapnel, Jason Flemyng, Tim Ahern, Julian Glover
description: Ben Carson is an ex-NYC cop who was forced to abandon his career for accidentally killing a co-worker. From that moment his life plunged into neurosis and alcoholism, dragging his family into the crisis as well. He finds a job as a janitor in a department store devastated by a terrible fire that is waiting to be rebuilt. But as he carries out his work he begins to be tormented by the visions that appear in a mirror of the dilapidated structure: echoes of the past disaster that slowly invade his existence, dragging him into a struggle for his mental and physical salvation.
notes: A remake of 2003's South Korean horror Into the Mirror, it breaks away from the usual oriental ghosts by introducing the testosterone of action, but the cold-mixed ingredients do not blend properly. There remains the feeling of a commercial operation built as an addition, with a dull Kiefer Sutherland and a very tired air.

title: Max Payne
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Mila Kunis, Beau Bridges, Ludacris, Amaury Nolasco, Chris O'Donnell, Joel Gordon, Kate Burton, Rico Simonini, Ted Atherton
description: Max Payne is a NYPD cop. One day he returns home to find his wife and child murdered by a group of drug addicts high on a new synthetic drug called Valkyr. After three years of working on the case, Max and his best friend Alex have managed to infiltrate to find the real people responsible for the traffic but everything starts to go wrong: Alex is killed and Max accused of his murder. Wanted by the police but determined to avenge his family, Max Payne will stop at nothing to find out the truth.
notes: A relatively simple story and a series of cinematic references, from noir atmospheres to action quotes between John Woo and the Matrix, made Max Payne the perfect videogame for a film adaptation. So much so that the writer thought he could limit himself to summarizing it or a little more. Wahlberg is functional to the part, while Kurylenko is barely seen and Kunis has no way of letting the character breathe. Finally, the villain played by Amaury Nolasco, the Sucre of Prison Break, goes bankrupt.

title: Outlander
actors: Jim Caviezel, Sophia Myles, Jack Huston, Ron Perlman, John Hurt, John Beale, Katie Bergin, Matt Cooke, Aidan Devine, Drakaina
description: A ship advances in the waves. Carries the remains of King Halgar, a valiant Viking leader. None of his successors possess the same courage as his, neither his son Wiglif, nor his brother Rothgar, crowned king. And the fate of his people will be upset by the arrival of a mysterious spaceship that has landed near the village. On board are Kainan, a warrior from Outland, and Moorwen, a terrifying killer monster.
notes: Howard McCain leads the story with panache and prevents the hyper-fast editing from confusing the action, thus preventing the protagonists from being reduced to caricatures. The only flaw of Outlander is the very florilege of echoes and citations that partially neutralizes the twists of the story.

title: Conspiracy
actors: Val Kilmer, Gary Cole, Jennifer Esposito, Jay Jablonski, Greg Serano, Stacy Marie Warden, Christopher Gehrman, Bob Rumnock, Scott Burkett, Rene Mousseux
description: Sergeant MacPherson - a veteran of the already long war in Iraq, returned to his homeland because he was injured during an operation - goes to Arizona to visit his old friend and comrade in arms Miguel Silva, also repatriated, who has long insisted to convince him to visit him. Once he arrives at his destination, however, MacPherson discovers that Silva has disappeared and that the locals even claim that he never existed. Inevitable for him to investigate, to try to understand what is underneath ...
notes: Marcus (also screenwriter, with Debra Sullivan) updates the plot and themes of John Sturges' _Giorno cursed_ (1955): but Kilmer is not Spencer Tracy, and everything else fits.

title: Night Angel
actors: Isa Jank, Linden Ashby, Debra Feuer, Helen Martin, Karen Black, Doug Jones, Gary Hudson, Sam Hennings, Tedra Gabriel, Ben Ryan Ganger
description: Plot in preparation

title: Pressure
actors: Kerr Smith, Lochlyn Munro, Angela Featherstone, Adrien Dorval, Donnelly Rhodes, Michelle Harrison, David Neale, Simon Longmore, Nicole Oliver, John B. Destry
description: Two traveling students remain involved in a shooting in a small town in the southern United States despite themselves. From that moment, although not directly involved in the firefight, they are persecuted by the local police, made up of fascist rednecks halfway between the sergeant of "Full Metal Jacket" and the persecutors of "A quiet weekend of fear".
notes: Low-grade film that relentlessly exploits the stereotypes of the genre, based on a modest script. The protagonist Kerr Smith, a rather well-known face of American television drama, was in the cast of "Csi. New York". Lochlyn Munro was instead seen in "Smallville".

title: Night of the Demons
actors: Alvin Alexis, Allison Barron, Lance Fenton, Billy Gallo, Hal Havins, Cathy Podewell, Linnea Quigley, Philip Tanzini, Jill Terashita, Harold Ayer
description: Nine boys and the more mature Ms. Quigley decide to spend a night at the Hull house, once home to a smokehouse and now abandoned. Angela, who delights in magic, proposes a ritual to see the previous life of one of them through a mirror, which however explodes revealing the figure of a monster. The girl will explain that the house is possessed, and not haunted, because inside there are demons, but not spirits of the dead. The demons, however, take control of Angela herself and the slaughter begins.
notes: Ridiculous plot and characters that are pure stereotypes didn't stop this film from generating two sequels.

title: Twilight
actors: Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner, Billy Burke, Peter Facinelli, Elizabeth Reaser, Nikki Reed, Ashley Greene, Jackson Rathbone, Kellan Lutz
description: Bella is an ordinary girl, not very attracted to what fascinates the world of her peers. Recently moved to live with her father in a small town in the remote American province, she is bored and little interested in her surroundings. Suddenly, however, a new acquaintance enters his life: it is Edward Cullen, a boy who has an extraordinary and at the same time elusive behavior. Bella is attracted to him, even if she feels rejected by him. In reality, Edward's behavior has specific reasons: he is in fact a vampire, who belongs to a family of "converted" and integrated vampires. And he fears that the attraction that becomes stronger and stronger between them could lead him to temptations from which he has always stayed away. But there are also other dangers.
notes: Based on Stephenie Meyer's bestsellers (over 5 million copies sold), Hardwicke's film is already a cultural phenomenon. Kristen Stewart (formerly seen in Into The Wild) crosses this cold-colored film like a ball of fire, around which the streams of appetite of an entire vampire family revolve. Sexual desire and that of devouring the prey are one and the film sways between the sweetness of abandoning oneself to instinct and the heroic practice of control.

title: Salem's Lot
actors: Rob Lowe, Andre Braugher, Donald Sutherland, Samantha Mathis, Robert Mammone, Dan Byrd, Rutger Hauer, James Cromwell, Andy Anderson, Robert Grubb
description: To write a book, struggling author Ben Mears returns to Jerusalem's Lot, the town of his childhood. Here some inhabitants have disappeared, and Ben suspects that the antiquarian is hiding something: in fact the man - as well as his business partner - is actually a vampire who satisfies his thirst at night ...

title: The Burrowers
actors: Karl Geary, Jocelin Donahue, Clancy Brown, Stan Burd, David Busse, Trip Davis, Steph Delgado, Seraphine DeYoung, Brighid Fleming, Chris Grabher
description: Plot in preparation

title: Never Back Down
actors: Sean Faris, Djimon Hounsou, Amber Heard, Cam Gigandet, Evan Peters, Leslie Hope, Wyatt Smith, Affion Crockett, Neil Brown Jr., Lauren Leech
description: After his father dies in a car accident, Jake Tyler moves with his mother and little brother to Florida, Orlando. There he falls in love with Baja Miller, a classmate of his, but her boyfriend, head of a local gang, never misses an opportunity to mistreat him. Jake, who has some knowledge of martial arts and some videos of his fights uploaded to YouTube, decides to enroll in the course of Jean Roque, master of MMA, a mix of various martial arts, which helps him improve his level and teaches him to be less impulsive. The capetto insists on provocations and will challenge him in the school wrestling championship.
notes: A film-cast this Never Back Down, which made us feel old and rethink the previous one with Ralph Macchio as a masterpiece. Here, to be the best you have to beat the best. Strictly rich and physically fit. Plastic film, full of bouncy beauties, punches and kicks that never really hurt. Bland as a dish without salt.

title: The Hamiltons
actors: Cory Knauf, Samuel Child, Joseph McKelheer, MacKenzie Firgens, Rebekah Hoyle, Brittany Daniel, Al Liner, Jena Hunt, Tara Glass, Larry Laverty
description: David, Wendall, Darlene and Francis are four brothers forced to reinvent themselves after their parents die. Francis, the youngest, spends a lot of time filming everything around him and it is thanks to his shots that we discover what is hiding in the cellar of the house: his brothers have the macabre habit of killing men and women to feed them. to a mysterious creature locked up there. Francis would like to ask for help, but rebelling won't be easy.
notes: Shot digitally, with a hand-held camera, a low budget horror with confused ideas, the slow pace, a high rate of predictability, the propensity for easy disgust and the inability to build tension. The icing on the cake, a cast with canine acting.

title: Right at Your Door
actors: Mary McCormack, Rory Cochrane, Tony Perez, Scotty Noyd Jr., Max Kasch, Jon Huertas, Will McCormack, Emeka Nnadi, Marisol Ramirez, Hector Luis Bustamante
description: Brad and Lexi are a couple like any other, who wake up any day in Los Angeles. She goes to work, he stays at home to take care of some housework. And at that moment the radio gave terrible news: the city was hit by a chemical bomb that releases a deadly toxic gas. Brad runs to find Lexi, but the police force him to return. He then barricades himself in the house, plugging every crevice to avoid contamination, and when he's done, he sees Lexi coming. Will it have been contaminated? Will love take over fear and he will open the door for her?

title: Appaloosa
actors: Viggo Mortensen, Ed Harris, Renée Zellweger, Jeremy Irons, Robert Jauregui, Timothy V. Murphy, Luce Rains, James Tarwater, Boyd Kestner, Gabriel Marantz, Benjamin Rosenshein
description: The story of two friends who, in the west at the end of the 19th century, are hired to protect a lawless town that has ended up in the hands of a renegade ranchero. The arrival of an attractive widow, however, throws their plans upside down ...
notes: Appaloosa, the name of an equine breed and a New Mexico city, seems to have all the ingredients for a classic western, including directing medium and long shots, close-ups and staid editing. And instead Harris gives us elements and quotes (Leone and Eastwood, but also and above all Hawks and Ford) to subvert the genre, in which real men never take themselves seriously and in which the bad guys (Jeremy Irons, villain gigione) do not they are doomed to defeat.

title: War, Inc.
actors: John Cusack, Hilary Duff, Marisa Tomei, Joan Cusack, Dan Aykroyd, Sergej Trifunovic, Ned Bellamy, John McLaughlin, Montel Williams, Ben Kingsley
description: With the aim of taking advantage of the opportunities that come from the war, the board of directors of an American company - which has "occupied" a fictional country called Turaqistan - hires a killer to kill a Middle Eastern figure linked to oil, who could represent an obstacle to the monopoly of the US lobby. The assassin, however, gradually loses sight of the target and everything seems compromised ...
notes: Political satire with farcical connotations, whose intention is to imitate the sharp irony of Kubrick's Doctor Strangelove. Promises are not kept, and good Cusack fails to save the film.

title: Chopping Mall
actors: Kelli Maroney, Tony O'Dell, Russell Todd, Karrie Emerson, Barbara Crampton, Nick Segal, John Terlesky, Suzee Slater, Paul Bartel, Mary Woronov
description: Some guys who work in a large shopping center decide to organize a night party in one of the departments. They then wait hidden for the closure to jump out, but some robots that are supposed to operate as night guards "go crazy" and turn into deadly machines. The unfortunates just have to defend themselves with what they find at hand on the various shelves, hoping to be able to resist until the following morning.

title: Living & Dying
actors: Edward Furlong, Tom Zembrod, Michael Madsen, Bai Ling, Maurice Ripke, Arnold Vosloo, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jordana Spiro, Robin McGee, Yelda Reynaud
description: Sam and the beautiful oriental Nadia organize, together with two accomplices, a bank robbery. Things take a sharp turn when the robbers find themselves besieged by the police and, taking refuge in a Mexican restaurant across the street, take the patrons as hostages. However, things get out of hand and the bandits in turn end up hostages of a couple of ruthless killers. Swat also intervenes to resolve the situation, but a great deal of confusion results.
notes: Finished in the mesh of the video market, this film is just another, worn, variation on the theme of _Le iene_ by Tarantino.

title: The Uninvited
actors: Marguerite Moreau, Brittany Curran, Colin Hay, Donna W. Scott, Jillian Bach, Michael Emanuel, Zia Harris, Phalana Tiller, Linda Larson, Marion Kelly
description: A nightmare that comes from a young woman's past takes the new forms of a bizarre phobia that leads her into violent panic attacks in the presence of too open spaces and from which she can only escape by leaning against the nearest wall. phobia becoming a kind of psychological survivor, one day, suddenly, her house becomes the spiritual battlefield of the evil forces that take to the field every night to torture her. If faith is the essence of things that cannot be seen, fear is the evidence of those that are seen.

title: Squirm
actors: Don Scardino, Patricia Pearcy, R.A. Dow, Jean Sullivan, Peter MacLean, Fran Higgins, William Newman, Barbara Quinn, Carl Dagenhart, Angel Sande
description: In a quiet Georgia fishing village, a power line accident discharges a huge amount of volts into the ground near a fishing worm farm. This has unforeseen and terrible consequences, because the worms - made mad and ferocious by electricity - suddenly become aggressive and ravenous, turning into real death machines.

title: The Unborn
actors: Odette Annable, Gary Oldman, Cam Gigandet, Meagan Good, Jane Alexander, Idris Elba, Rhys Coiro, Carla Gugino, James Remar, C.S. Lee, Rachel Brosnahan
description: Casey Beldon is an eighteen-year-old girl who has a life marked by resentment towards her mother, who abandoned her when she was still a child. But when a "dybbuk" - a figure in the Hebrew floklore representing the spirit of a wandering dead - begins to persecute her, assuming the appearance of a boy who died in the Auschwitz extermination camp, her psychic balance is even more compromised. The help of her boyfriend and that of her best friend do not seem to be enough and the girl is forced to turn to a specialist in the paranormal, Sendak. It is through this path that he will discover what horrible curse lurks behind his problems, both recent and deeper ones.
notes: Take The Grudge. Sprinkle some of The Changeling on it (Peter Medak's, not Eastwood's). Then season with the Exorcist and add a pinch of Omen. Review it in the memory of some decent Clive Barker (the monsters of Hellraiser and Cabal) and you will have The Never Born, a title that could very well sum up the “ontological” condition of Goyer's film. A frustrated and frustrating bignamino.

title: Fanboys
actors: Sam Huntington, Chris Marquette, Dan Fogler, Jay Baruchel, Kristen Bell, Thom Bishops, Charlie B. Brown, Ernest Cline, David Denman, Hugh Elliot, William Shatner
description: In 1998, Eric, Windows, Hutch and Zoe are a group of friends who share, like many others, a passion for science fiction and in particular for the Star Wars saga. There are only a few months left until the release of the famous Episode I in theaters, and their expectation is spasmodic, despite having already grown up. But when they realize that their friend Linus, who had been away from the group for a while, is terminally ill with cancer and will most likely not be able to arrive alive at the film's release date, they make a crazy decision. Storming Gorge Lucas' "Skywlaker Ranch" and stealing the working copy of the film that is kept there so they can show it for their friend before the disease gets the better of them. Thus begins a more than adventurous journey towards "the fort" of the great director.

title: Species III
actors: Sunny Mabrey, Robin Dunne, Robert Knepper, Natasha Henstridge
description: Believed dead, Eve is transported in a military ambulance. During the journey, before being killed by a hybrid, she gives birth to a girl who is kidnapped by Doctor Abbot. In a couple of days the baby girl grows to adulthood, becoming a gorgeous young woman named Sara. Abbot would like to develop perfect DNA using Sara's eggs and, thanks to this discovery, win the Nobel Prize. He summons one of his students, Dean, to assist him in the experiment. But while Sara fails to find the right man to mate with to give birth to the perfect being, a group of fallacious and evil alien hybrids go to great lengths to reproduce with her and make their species survive.

title: Nightmares
actors: Emilio Estevez, Lance Henriksen, Veronica Cartwright, Cristina Raines, Richard Masur, Joe Lambie, Anthony James, Clare Nono, Raleigh Bond, Robert Phelps, Dixie Lynn Royce, Lee Ving, Mariclare Costello
description: Four episodes: a woman goes shopping at night, blissfully ignoring the presence of a fugitive killer; a computer genius' obsession with a video game leads him to the shocking discovery that reality is not what he thought; a disillusioned priest leaves the city and realizes he is being chased by a mysterious black pick-up; family members discover that the problem with mice is more serious than they thought.
notes: The four segments, directed by television director Joseph Sargent, do not shine for originality but are dignified, without much bloodshed but all characterized by a passable final revelation.

title: Gamer
actors: Gerard Butler, Terry Crews, John Leguizamo, Milo Ventimiglia, Michael C. Hall, Zoe Bell, Aaron Yoo, Alison Lohman, Ludacris, Logan Lerman
description: In a not so distant future where some humans can control the actions of other humans, prisoners in a prison are maneuvered by hundreds of players of Slayers, an online video game, and forced to fight each other live, under their eyes. of millions of viewers. This is until a star prisoner of the game tries to regain his independence, escaping the control of the players and other prisoners, to get directly to the creator and dismantle the inhuman and cruel game platform forever.
notes: Crank's duo Neveldine and Taylor raises the bar and blends adrenaline with dystopian science fiction. The future is akin to The World of Replicants, but what was sweetened there can be found tenfold in Gamer. The taste for extreme situations, bordering on pornography, makes it a grim but explosive film, destined to burst in the face of the action movie audience.

title: Avatar
actors: Sam Worthington, Zoë Saldana, Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang, Giovanni Ribisi, Michelle Rodriguez, Laz Alonso, Joel Moore, CCH Pounder, Wes Studi
description: Jake Sully is a former marine disabled in battle, who is sent to the planet Pandora, 44 light years from Earth, on an exploration mission. The atmosphere on the site is unbreathable, so avatars have been created, piloted from within the human base and identical to the population of the Na'vi, the humanoids who live on Pandora. However, the mission is not guided only by the thirst for knowledge: on Pandora there are in fact precious reserves of energy, necessary for the Earth, brought to its knees by an ecological catastrophe. The natives, however, are not there and rebel against colonization: Jake's task, through his avatar, will be to be able to get to know them and find out how to be accepted by them and then subdue them. But exploration opens up new perspectives ...
notes: Cameron develops an eternal theme in a spectacular but also brutal epic, far from the toy Hollywood of Transformers and G.I.-Joe, starting with Dr. Grace (Sigourney Weaver) who asks for a goddamn cigarette to the many fallen in the final battle. The battle in the heart of nature lies between the bombing of Apocalypse Now and the charges of the Lord of the Rings as the construction of beautiful worlds annihilates the Star Wars prequels. Avatar moves the frontiers of cinema, transmigrating the gaze from two dimensions to the immersion of stereoscopy.

actors: John Cusack, Amanda Peet, Thandie Newton, Woody Harrelson, Danny Glover, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Oliver Platt, Chin Han, Beatrice Rosen, Jimi Mistry
description: The fateful date of December 21, 2012 has now arrived and the feared mysterious event announced by the Mayan calendar - the end of the 4 eras - catastrophically comes true.
notes: It is not that we expected a fine directorial work and refined psychological sketches, neither from Emmerich nor from the catastrophic genre, but 2012 also disappoints from a spectacular point of view. The introduction takes (and wastes) a lot of time to clarify the bizarre assumption of the film, namely: the planet is overheating from the inside, as if it had been cooked in the microwave. Anyone expecting some fascinating research on Mayan mythology and prophecies will be left with a dry mouth.

title: The Octagon
actors: Chuck Norris, Karen Carlson, Lee Van Cleef, Art Hindle, Carol Bagdasarian, Tadashi Yamashita, Kim Lankford, Larry D. Mann, Kurt Grayson, Richard Norton
description: Scott is a martial arts expert forced to live with painful memories that incessantly come back to the surface, first of all the death of a companion during a dangerous mission. When hired as a bodyguard by a wealthy and beautiful girl, Scott discovers that the criminals he must protect her from are dealing with the tragedy that haunts him ...
notes: A bizarre plot, which mixes ninja and international terrorism, providing Norris and other combat experts with the pretext for a substantial dose of action. A good kung fu movie, of its above-average genre, backed up by a rhythmic soundtrack.

title: Hero Wanted
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Ray Liotta, Norman Reedus, Kim Coates, Tommy Flanagan, Jean Smart, Christa Campbell
description: After saving a little girl's life during a fire, garbage man Liam has become an important and well-known character. But the quarter of an hour of fame passes quickly: and when he realizes that everyone has forgotten about him, he decides to stage a fake bank robbery in order to play the part of the hero again. Unfortunately, however, this time nothing goes according to plan and Liam finds himself the victim of a ruthless game. Deceived, cheated and blinded by the desire for revenge, he now has only one goal: to punish those who betrayed him, without any mercy, and is willing to do anything to succeed in his intent ...
notes: Ordinary administration.

title: Friday the 13th
actors: Jared Padalecki, Danielle Panabaker, Amanda Righetti, Travis Van Winkle, Derek Mears, Aaron Yoo, Arlen Escarpeta, Julianna Guill, Willa Ford, Ryan Hansen
description: Whitney, Clay, Mike, Jenna and Trent, along with other young friends go to explore a famous place: Camp Crystal Lake, the place made famous by the original film in the series on Friday the 13th. predictably turns into a nightmare: because Jason, in his hockey mask, is really close ...
notes: Since the original was not enough, it could only be improved. But no. The patina of torpor typical of the seventies slasher that slipped between a tit and a slaughtering becomes boredom and that's it. Then very little blood flows.

title: Moondance Alexander
actors: Kay Panabaker, Don Johnson, Lori Loughlin, James Best, Sasha Cohen, Whitney Sloan, Joe Norman Shaw, Mimi Gianopulos, Aedan Tomney, Landon Liboiron
description: Moondance Alexander is a lively little provincial girl who lives with an eccentric mother. At the beginning of yet another boring summer, one day he meets Checkers, a pony who has escaped from a farm. Once the pony is returned, Moondance is convinced that she has great qualities as a jumper and asks the owner (Don Johnson) to hire her as a groom and teach her to jump obstacles in order to participate in a great competition held in the county during the summer: an adventure that will lead her to win numerous races and to defeat the skepticism of her companions.

title: Knowing
actors: Nicolas Cage, Rose Byrne, Chandler Canterbury, Ben Mendelsohn, Terry Camilleri, Adrienne Pickering, Nadia Townsend, Liam Hemsworth, Sally Anne Arnott, Danielle Carter
description: Professor John Koestler participates in his school in the "exhumation" of a capsule in which, fifty years earlier, some students had buried their messages for the future. But what happens to his son is a really strange message: just sequences of numbers. Analyzing it Ted realizes that they contain precise predictions of the disasters that have occurred in the last 50 years and of 3 that have yet to happen.
notes: The epilogue is the only truly remarkable thing (almost at the level, including the line, of the ending of _Gattaca_) of a fairly mediocre film, where even the special effects leave something to be desired (which, being Hollywood, is news) .

title: Switchblade Sisters
actors: Robbie Lee, Joanne Nail, Monica Gayle, Asher Brauner, Chase Newhart, Marlene Clark, Kitty Bruce, Janice Karman, Don Stark, Don Marino
description: Plot in preparation

title: Urban Justice
actors: Steven Seagal, Eddie Griffin, Carmen Serano, Cory Hart, Liezl Carstens, Kirk B.R. Woller, Mary Evans, Al Staggs, Jade Yorker, Jermaine Washington
description: When his son, a young police officer, is killed in cold blood during a gang shootout, Simon Ballister decides to shed some light on the incident. So he returns to his old neighborhood where he starts asking uncomfortable questions. It doesn't take long for his violent interrogations to annoy evil boss Armand. The latter unleashes his gang against him, but Simon is ready to do anything to know the identity and motives of the killers. Not everything is as linear as it appears, and behind what appears to be an "accident", Ballister uncovers a conspiracy involving unsuspected names.

title: Zombie Strippers
actors: Jenna Jameson, Robert Englund, Roxy Saint, Penny Drake, Whitney Anderson, Jennifer Holland, Shamron Moore, Jeannette Sousa, Carmit Levité, John Hawkes
description: In the near future, President Bush is elected for the fourth time and, with his vice-president Arnold Schwarzenegger, he launches into multiple wars. In order to replace the considerable losses in the ranks of soldiers sent to war, the government is studying a virus capable of reanimating the dead. During the trials held in Nebraska, however, something goes wrong and the military is ordered to eliminate the zombies generated by the spread of the virus, including a group of strippers infected by a soldier.

title: Bride of the Monster
actors: Bela Lugosi, Tor Johnson, Tony McCoy, Loretta King, Harvey B. Dunn, George Becwar, Paul Marco, Don Nagel, Bud Osborne, John Warren
description: Doctor Eric Vornoff (Bela Lugosi) is experimenting with nuclear energy, secretly from everyone, in order to create a small army of mutant monsters under his orders. Journalist Janet Lawton begins investigating the character and his research, as does the police. Meanwhile, a kind of professional monster hunter, Professor Strowski (Becwar), works to persuade Vornoff to cease his experiments and return to his homeland.

title: The Hard Corps
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Razaaq Adoti, Vivica A. Fox, Peter Bryant, Ron Bottitta, Viv Leacock, Adrian Holmes, Mark Griffin, Ron Selmour, Aaron Au
description: Phillip Sauvage is an American soldier suffering from post-traumatic stress syndrome, due to his time spent at the front in Iraq and Afghanistan. Together with his former officer Clarence Bowden, he follows Wayne Barclay, a brilliant businessman with a past as a boxing champion, as his bodyguard. Rap tycoon Terrell Singletery has an unfinished business with the latter, who ended up behind bars precisely because of the former boxer and now released from prison. Worried about this, Wayne's sister Tamara hires Sauvage to protect her brother - but it won't be an easy task, especially when Bowden is killed ...
notes: The usual Van Damme.

title: Thinner
actors: Robert John Burke, Joe Mantegna, Lucinda Jenney, Michael Constantine, Kari Wuhrer, Bethany Joy Galeotti, Time Winters, Howard Erskine, Terrence Garmey, Randy Jurgensen
description: A judge, under the influence of a gypsy curse, begins to progressively lose weight. The thing becomes serious to the point that the man is forced to resort to his knowledge in the world of the underworld to try to contact the woman and get her to remove the subtle that is condemning him.
notes: From a story by Stephen King.

title: Fast & Furious
actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez, Jordana Brewster, Laz Alonso, Gal Gadot, John Ortiz, Sung Kang, Kofi Natei, Wilmer Calderon
description: After the eastern interlude, Fast & Furious returns to Los Angeles, where agent Brian Conner is once again paired with Dom Toretto, just out of prison, to face a common enemy: a heroin trafficker. To do so, they will have to infiltrate and mingle with his men, on an adventure that will take them to Mexico. Very quickly.
notes: If your favorite pastime is competing to see who eats the most sausages and drinks the most beer, if your oracle is a distributor and your female models are the girls of Hazzard (also for the look) Fast & Furious is the Easter egg ideal. Otherwise, a small car is better, with which to go healthy and far.

title: Pelts
actors: Meat Loaf, John Saxon, Ellen Ewusie, Link Baker
description: Furrier Jake Feldman is obsessed with Shana, an attractive stripper. When he procures raccoon skins of excellent quality with the intention of making a coat for the woman, he ignores that the material he is using is cursed: anyone who comes into contact with it faces a tragic fate ...
notes: The synthesis plays in favor of the film, and Argento packs an episode of the second series of _Masters of Horror_ that keeps you in tension from start to finish. The blood drips copiously, but the characterization of the characters and an evident animal rights stance do not remain in the background, with an ad hoc soundtrack.

title: Alice in Wonderland
actors: Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Anne Hathaway, Michael Sheen, Helena Bonham Carter, Alan Rickman, Crispin Glover, Christopher Lee, Eleanor Tomlinson, Matt Lucas, Geraldine James, Frances de la Tour, Eleanor Gecks, Michael Gough, Imelda Staunton
description: Alice is a seventeen-year-old who refuses an arranged marriage and dreams of becoming an industry captain. Fleeing the party where it was supposed to be presented in society, she finds herself in a very strange world, populated by fantastic creatures. There he will find the always late white rabbit, the mad hatter, the white queen and the red one.
notes: Burton reinterprets the character of Lewis Carroll by presenting a more adult version and appeals to all the phantasmagoric paraphernalia of his cinema, with the inevitable feeling of déjà vu. _Alice in Wonderland_ seems to favor Disney production more (with a fake 3D) than the director and fails to distil the true essence of the original.

title: Brooklyn's Finest
actors: Richard Gere, Ethan Hawke, Don Cheadle, Wesley Snipes, Jesse Williams, Ellen Barkin, Lili Taylor, Wade Allain-Marcus, Jas Anderson, Nicoye Banks, James Thomas Bligh, Diana Bologna, Robert John Burke, Raquel Castro
description: Tango (Don Cheadle) is an undercover agent who has a difficult choice ahead of him. Sal (Hawke) is a detective and a father of a family, but he is also tempted by the easy solutions to solve anyway serious problems. Eddie (Gere) is close to retirement and has lost his attachment to the badge for years now. Destiny will make the roads of these three policemen converge in a place that represents the final landing point of three different paths.

title: Family
actors: George Wendt, John B. Scott, Meredith Monroe, Matt Keeslar
description: When the Fullers, young newlyweds, move to a charming town, they plan to leave behind a painful past: their baby has recently died and they just want to start over. Too bad their new neighbor Harold Thompson, seemingly kind and hospitable, is actually a psychopath and soon sets his sights on the two newcomers ...
notes: Landis shows once again his unmistakable talent for mixing fear and laughter: _Family_ is as much a horror film as a caustic satire on the values ??of the "middle class" family. The actors provide masterful proof.

title: The Rum Diary
actors: Johnny Depp, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Rispoli, Amber Heard, Richard Jenkins, Giovanni Ribisi, Amaury Nolasco, Marshall Bell, Bill Smitrovich, Julian Holloway, Karen Austin, Bruno Irizarry, Enzo Cilenti, Aaron Lustig
description: Paul Kemp (Johnny Depp), freelance journalist, lives in the Caribbean, writes for a newspaper in crisis and associates with a number of disreputable characters devoted to nihilism and self-destruction. The moment is critical and perhaps the time has come for Paul to strive for something better and more reassuring.
notes: Situations between the grotesque (complete with digital hallucinatory sequences) and the comic, without the screenplay caring too much about the logical links or the added value of the setting of the facts, taken from the semiautobiographical book by the "gonzo" journalism writer Hunter S Thompson. As a producer, Depp brought Bruce Robinson back behind the camera 20 years after his last directing, but his ramshackle diary needed less rum and more passion.

title: Warrior Angels
actors: Charlotte Avery, Nick Brading, Rutger Hauer, Molly Culver, Kristina Kaubryte, Sander Kolosov, Vaidotas Martinaitis, Joanna Pacula, Geoff Parish, Greg Scopino
description: In the 12th century, upon returning to her homeland after a bloody crusade, a female warrior named Elizabeth discovers that her home has been attacked and destroyed while her son Peter has been kidnapped by the tyrant Grekkor. Moved by anger and the strength of desperation, she decides to form a small army to undertake a dangerous mission against the enemy army. However, the local population, frightened, refuses to help Elizabeth ...
notes: Indigestible meatloaf composed of overly chewed ingredients: swords, armor, good warriors and barbarians are told without anything new. Could not miss Rutger Hauer, in the role of the villain on duty.

title: Sounds Like
actors: Chris Bauer, Matty Finochio, Laura Margolis, Grant Elliott
description: Larry Pearce is a stern employee of a telephone company devastated by the recent disappearance of his son due to a rare brain disease. The pain somehow sharpened his hearing in an extraordinary way: Larry is able to distinctly perceive a conversation even hundreds of meters away. But the "gift" begins to affect his mental integrity, and the man will choose a violent way to silence the voices that persecute him ...
notes: _Masters of Horror Episode 2_: Anderson doesn't look for the easy fright, handling the paranoia of a society that surrounds itself with noise with the incisive touch of who, first of all, knows how to tell a story.

title: Vampire Bats
actors: Lucy Lawless, Dylan Neal, Liam Waite, Timothy Bottoms, Craig Ferguson, Brett Butler, Tony Plana, Jessica Stroup, Jerrod Paige, Arnie Pantoja
description: Two students, Eden and Aaron, are charged with the murder of a friend, with whom they spent the night in the middle of the woods. Doctor Maddy Reardon, a biology teacher, believes their innocence and finds the bite marks of strange vampire bats on the boy's body ...

title: Frankenstein
actors: Michael Madsen, Vincent Perez, Thomas Kretschmann
description: In New Orleans, Victor Helios has managed to refine the technique of cryogenesis (the freezing of human beings) in the laboratory by forming a small army of supermen and placing them in all levels of society and key positions with the aim of being able to conquer the world. However, there are those who oppose it, acting for obscure reasons and purposes.

title: The V Word
actors: Arjay Smith, Branden Nadon, Michael Ironside, Lynda Boyd, Jodelle Ferland
description: Kerry and Justin are two friends who, one night, decide to explore a morgue. Entering with the intention of observing some corpses, they find themselves in front of much more than they had asked for: a vampire who, interrupted during his meal, throws himself on the two nosy youngsters and bites them. When they realize they have been infected, children have to choose between death and a new lease on life ...
notes: Despite the directorial effort to go beyond the spatters of blood - which remain an integral part of the vision -, the sociological subtext only emerges at intervals. The overall result is entertainment: a triumph of horrid and demonic that leaves you breathless.

title: Backwoods
actors: Haylie Duff, Ryan Merriman, Mimi Michaels, Craig Zimmermann, Roshawn Franklin, Willow Geer, John Hemphill, Jonathan Chase, Eric Larkin, Mick Lea
description: While camping in Jasper Park, Northern California, an engaged couple is targeted by a group of strangers. He is killed, while the girl is kidnapped and taken to some sort of underground shelter. A couple of months later, Johnny Dash, manager of a video game company, invites his collaborators to a paintball competition in Jasper Park, with the aim of improving the company's performance. During the night, the employees feel observed: the next morning, they will have to realize that the game has turned into a real battle for survival, in a hostile territory inhabited by murderous maniacs ...

title: The Visitation
actors: Martin Donovan, Edward Furlong, Kelly Lynch, Randy Travis, Richard Tyson, Ellen Geer, Joe Unger, Priscilla Barnes, Noah Segan, James Horan
description: Father Travis lost his faith when his beloved wife was murdered and the criminals were not punished. Suddenly his town becomes the scene of many portentous events: the son of the veterinarian Morgan Elliot survives a terrible car accident without reporting even a scratch, the dog of Travis himself is resurrected after being buried, a paraplegic returns to walk, a sick person of cancer heals inexplicably ... In all cases there are three mysterious men dressed in black. The situation takes a strange turn when the unknown Brandon Nichols claims to be Jesus Christ, and the local people support him ...

title: The Black Cat
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Elyse Levesque, Aron Tager, Eric Keenleyside
description: Philadelphia, 1840: Writer Edgar Allan Poe is in the throes of a desperate creative crisis, trying to drown in alcohol. As he struggles to give birth to a story, money is scarce and his wife Virginia's black cat haunts him. Will it destroy his life or inspire his most famous tale?
notes: Jeffrey Combs is a perfect Edgar Allan Poe, so much so that we forget he's there, inside the costume. In this episode of "Masters of Horror_ - season 2", Gordon restores the flavor of an era by dyeing it black enough to still feel real. More than the horror and the shed blood, it is the descent into the underworld of the mind that keeps you tense.

title: The Washingtonians
actors: Johnathon Schaech, Venus Terzo, Myron Natwick, Duncan Fraser
description: After his grandmother's funeral, Mike discovers an old letter hidden behind a portrait of George Washington in the cellar. Signed by the "father of the nation", the letter contains a declaration of cannibalism. While trying to ascertain its veracity, Mike comes across the sect of the "Washingtonians", an ancient secret society of anthropophages ...
notes: The attempt to resurrect the horror genre from the descending parable of recycling would also be appreciable. But the idea remains on paper, and what works in the Bentley Little tale (from which this episode of the second series of _Masters of Horror_ is based) loses its appeal on screen. Too bad for the satirical intent.

title: April Fool's Day
actors: Jay Baker, Pat Barlow, Lloyd Berry, Deborah Foreman, Deborah Goodrich, Tom Heaton, Mike Nomad, Ken Olandt, Griffin O'Neal, Leah Pinsent
description: A group of particularly excited schoolmates meet in a villa on a remote island, to celebrate the last year of high school. Each of the boys reveals a secret from their past to the others, but these confessions cost them their lives. However, it is April 1st, and it could all be a macabre joke. Are they really dead? The waitress, Muffy, seems to be the only one aware of what's really going on ...
notes: Classic 80s slasher, it soon went into oblivion. The ingredients are the usual: party between teenagers in an isolated place, a joke of cat taste, a trail of deaths and revenge. Nothing really original.

title: Dream Cruise
actors: Daniel Gillies, Yoshino Kimura, Miho Ninagawa, Ryo Ishibashi
description: Jack, an American lawyer who lives and works in Tokyo, falls in love with the wife of Eiji, his richest client. Despite the phobia of the sea (which has haunted him since he witnessed his brother's drowning as a child), Jack agrees to go on a boat with the couple for a trip to the bay. However, the three hikers are unaware of what awaits them ...
notes: From _Masters of Horror 2_, when _The Ring_ meets _Ore 10: flat calm_: a plot already seen, especially for those who are not fasting Japanese "ghost" horror. Despite some clever ideas and a couple of twists, it is the plot that flounders in the water and finally drowns before the credits.

title: 12 Rounds
actors: John Cena, Aidan Gillen, Ashley Scott, Steve Harris, Brian J. White, Gonzalo Menendez, Taylor Cole, Kyle Russell Clements, Peter Navy Tuiasosopo, Travis Davis
description: While the madness of Mardi Gras goes wild in New Orleans, detective Danny Baxter is on the trail of the dangerous thug who has kidnapped his wife and is mysteriously linked to his past. Like the cat and the mouse, the criminal challenges the policeman to a competition played out over twelve deadly rounds of "challenges". Will he be able to win them all and hug his partner again?
notes: Between derailing trams, exploding houses, burning banks, reckless fire engines, dangerous elevators, unsafe buses (yes, Harlin must be angry with public transport) little or nothing is saved. The rating is so high for the joke about the FBI and Hurricane Katrina.

title: The Hunted
actors: Christopher Lambert, John Lone, Joan Chen, Yoshio Harada, Yoko Shimada, Mari Natsuki, Tak Kubota, Masumi Okada, Tatsuya Irie, Michael Warren
description: Paul Racine, an American businessman who has just arrived in Nagoya, goes on an adventure with the beautiful geisha Kirina. Back by chance in the woman's room, he witnesses her beheading by Kinjo, leader of a group of ninja, who notices her presence. From this moment a merciless relentless manhunt begins, in which Paul is constantly hunted by mysterious warriors: in the course of the hard battle, he will have to learn the art of sword fighting ...
notes: Everything is merciless, convulsive and already seen. Lambert's acting is almost intangible, stifled by that of the martial arts master Harada (who is an idol in Japan).

title: Snakes on a Train
actors: A.J. Castro, Julia Ruiz, Amelia Jackson-Gray, Shannon Gayle, Giovanni Bejarano, Isaac Wade, Stephen A.F. Day, Carolyn Meyer, Lola Forsberg, Madeleine Falkskog
description: Victim of a terrible Mayan curse, the young Mexican Alma is condemned to die devoured by the snakes that are growing in her stomach. His only hope of salvation is a powerful shaman who lives on the Texas border. With a life span of just a few hours, the girl jumps on a train bound for Los Angeles, accompanied by her husband Brujo. In an attempt to resist, Alma regurgitates snakes that, from small and almost harmless, become bigger and more hungry over the minutes, scattering among the wagons. Soon the unsuspecting passengers of the convoy will realize that they are trapped, hunted by monstrous predators ...

title: The Damned Thing
actors: Sean Patrick Flanery, Georgia Craig, Ryan Drescher, Brent Stait
description: A monstrous force roams a town in Texas, turning husbands against wives, brothers against sisters, parents against children. As the local population self-destructs, Sergeant Reddle, haunted by an uncomfortable past, begins a fight against the mysterious entity in an attempt to stop the wave of anger ...
notes: Adapted from the short story _The cursed thing_ by Ambrose Bierce, this episode of _Masters of Horror 2_ has the mold of the director of _Do not open that door_: plays with primordial fears, leverages masterfully constructed twists, sketches three-dimensional characters. Excellent performance by Sean Patrick Flanery.

title: The Expendables
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Mickey Rourke, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren, Eric Roberts, Bruce Willis, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Steve Austin, David Zayas, Randy Couture, Giselle Itié, Charisma Carpenter, Gary Daniels, Terry Crews
description: A group of mercenaries travel to South America on an extreme mission that aims to overthrow a dictatorship.
notes: It is not just the jam session of a man who inaugurated his late autumn walking with his head held high on the long path of a twilight that shines like an aurora. The mercenaries is above all the proud and humble affirmation at the same time of a melancholy and self-deprecating poetic (the cameo of Schwarzy and Willis is a scream).

title: Bottom Feeder
actors: Tom Sizemore, Wendy Anderson, Richard Fitzpatrick, Amber Cull, Martin Roach, James Binkley, Simon Northwood, Philip Akin, Tig Fong, Joe Dinicol
description: A group of maintainers are trapped in a labyrinth of tunnels where Dr. Leech has been imprisoned, who a miracle cure has turned into a monster.

title: I Am Omega
actors: Mark Dacascos, Geoff Meed, Jennifer Lee Wiggins, Ryan Lloyd, Joshua Schlegel, Gregory Paul Smith, Matthew Bolton, Myles McLane, Frank Forbes, Afton Forbes
description: The last man on Earth finds himself fighting against the hordes of beings who have taken over the planet.

title: Against the Dark
actors: Steven Seagal, Tanoai Reed, Jenna Harrison, Linden Ashby, Emma Catherwood, Stephen Hagan, Daniel Percival, Skye Bennett, Tania Dobre, Mihaela Constantin
description: Earth's population has been decimated by a bloodstream vampire bloodline. The only hope for the survivors laughed in Tao (Seagal) a katana master and in his pupils, a handful of ex-soldiers.

title: Kill Switch
actors: Steven Seagal, Holly Dignard, Chris Thomas King, Michael Filipowich, Isaac Hayes, Mark Collie, Karyn Michelle Baltzer, Philip Granger, Riley Jang, Connor Jang
description: A policeman disturbed by his childhood traumas after which he has devoted his life and career to track down serial killers is sent to Memphis on a mission that will be true bread for his teeth.

title: Pistol Whipped
actors: Steven Seagal, Bernie McInerney, Ashley Greenfield, John P. Gulino, Antoni Corone, Matt Salinger, Paul Calderon, Lance Henriksen, Mark Elliot Wilson, Lydia Jordan
description: Alcoholism, gambling, debt: ex-cop Matt's life has been falling apart since he was kicked out by the police. But a strange case presents him with the right opportunity to remedy and get back on track.
notes: The filmmakers' and Seagal's (who didn't use stuntman) attempt to raise the bar fails under the weight of ridiculous, clumsy clichés.

title: Dolly Dearest
actors: Denise Crosby, Sam Bottoms, Rip Torn, Chris Demetral, Candace Hutson, Lupe Ontiveros, Enrique Renaldo, Alma Martínez, Will Gotay, Rene Victor
description: An American family moves to Mexico to start a business: open a doll factory. Not far away, however, an archaeologist has just discovered the ancient tomb of an accidentally dead child that belonged to a people of worshipers of the forces of evil. The spirit of the child, awakened, will eventually incarnate in the dolls.

title: Crash and Burn
actors: Erik Palladino, Heather Marie Marsden, Mirelly Taylor, Josue Aguirre, Owen Beckman, Melissa Bickerton, Anthony John Denison, Steph Duvall, Erick Florez, Chet Grissom
description: Kevin, a particularly skilled FBI agent, is tasked with undercover infiltrating an underground motorcycle and car racing organization. During his mission, he discovers that this illegal trafficking is linked to the activity of a powerful underworld boss and his gang of gangsters. In danger from two sides, Kevin acts cautiously, but an unexpected and brutal murder increases his fear of being discovered and killed ...
notes: Draft copy of the various _Fast & Furious_. Russell Mulcahy, an Australian from the world of video clips, seems to have exhausted all his creative potential with _Highlander_.

title: Empire
actors: John Leguizamo, Peter Sarsgaard, Denise Richards, Vincent Laresca, Isabella Rossellini, Sonia Braga, Delilah Cotto, Nestor Serrano, Anthony 'Treach' Criss, Rafael Báez
description: Victor Rosa is a Latin American gangster with the ambitions of a young "godfather" and the violent ways of the man of the street. But his life of excesses comes to a halt when his girlfriend announces that she is pregnant: perhaps the time has come to settle down, but leaving the "family" is more difficult than expected. Vic believes he finds a way out when he meets Jack, an enterprising Wall Street broker who could help him quadruple the clan's profits in just six months ...
notes: The plot is classic, but the characters are sketchy, the script is chaotic, and the film doesn't fly any higher than usual punches-and-guns.

title: Love's Long Journey
actors: Erin Cottrell, Logan Bartholomew, William Morgan Sheppard, James Tupper, Frank McRae, Johann Urb, John Savage, Jeff Kober, Richard Lee Jackson, Graham Phillips
description: United States, late 1800s: Missie, a young teacher expecting a baby, follows her husband Willie's dream of building a ranch in the West. After a long journey, the two arrive at Tettsford Junction, take over a vacant lot and, with the help of new friends, get to work hard.

title: Love's Abiding Joy
actors: Erin Cottrell, Dale Midkiff, Logan Bartholomew, Frank McRae, William Morgan Sheppard, Drew Tyler Bell, Brett Coker, Mae Whitman, John Laughlin, Kevin Gage
description: United States, late 1800s. After years of hard work, Missie and Willie have made their dream come true by building a ranch in a western frontier village, which they can now call home. Helped by his two eldest sons, Jeff and Matthew, Willie takes care of the farm and looks after Kathy, the little one of the house, while Missie can devote herself to what has always been her profession: teaching. Life goes on peacefully and, with the arrival of the railway, Missie receives the happy visit of her father, Clark Davis. But the tragedy is just around the corner, because suddenly Kathy falls ill and dies, upsetting the quiet life of the family and triggering dormant conflicts ...

title: Tin Man
actors: Zooey Deschanel, Alan Cumming, Neal McDonough, Kathleen Robertson
description: Dorothy Gale, but everyone calls her DG, is a recently grown girl who lives in Kansas and supports herself at a part-time school as a waitress. During the day she lives a normal life, but every night she dreams of a mysterious place and a purple-eyed woman who warns her of an impending storm. And in fact one day Azkadellia the evil witch of the kingdom of O.Z. (Outer Zone) sends his shock troops, in full Kansas, against the unsuspecting girl. DG thus finds himself in a fantastic realm where he meets Glitch the brainless, Raw the cowardly and psychotic lion man and above all Wyatt Cain, a Central City policeman called Tin Man because of the material of his badge.

title: Defiance
actors: Jan-Michael Vincent, Theresa Saldana, Danny Aiello, Rudy Ramos, Lenny Montana, Art Carney, Santos Morales, Frank Pesce, Don Blakely, James Victor
description: Waiting to re-embark, the merchant worker Tommy moves to New York's East Side, a neighborhood devastated by the violent Souls gang. Despite trying to avoid involvement in every way, Tommy will end up fighting against the thugs, encouraging a reaction even from the previously frightened neighbors.
notes: B-movie whose themes of metropolitan violence wink at _The Warriors of the night_. However, it lacks the strength of Walter Hill's masterpiece and is immersed in an atmosphere at times full of rhetoric. Deeply controversial film: for some a true cult, for others a failed attempt to imitate what has already been said. The second interpretation prevails.

title: The Spoilers
actors: Marlene Dietrich, Randolph Scott, John Wayne, Margaret Lindsay, Harry Carey
description: In Nome, an Alaskan town, Roy Glennister works as a gold digger with fellow Dextry. The two are part of a team financed by the owner of a saloon, Cherry Malotte, but she is threatened by a scammer superintendent named Alexander McNamara, who wants to get his hands on the profits from the extraction. Roy and Dextry decide to wage a fight with the corrupt commissioner, unearthing hidden truths ...
notes: Classic adventure film from the 1940s, with all the limits of staging and rhythm characteristic of the time. Seen today it seems almost grotesque, but the Wayne-Dietrich duo always deserves praise.

title: Sharpshooter
actors: James Remar, Mario Van Peebles, Catherine Mary Stewart, Bruce Boxleitner, Al Sapienza, Victoria De Mare, Jasmine Bejar, Jon Braver, Kaine Bennett Charleston, McKinley Freeman
description: Dillon is a very skilled hitman who has worked for years on a special team of the CIA. Infallible killing machine, he has conducted many missions on behalf of the American government, until, returning from a difficult operation in the Middle East, he decides to retire forever from the activity and change his life. But his plans must be postponed because of his colleague and best friend, who entrusts him with a complicated new mission against a dangerous terrorist. Soon, Dillon will discover that he himself is the target of someone who wants him dead.
notes: Adrenaline-fueled but conventional action TV movie with well-known genre stars such as James Remar, Mario Van Peebles and Bruce Boxleitner.

title: Precious Find
actors: Rutger Hauer, Joan Chen, Harold Pruett, Brion James, Morgan Hunter, Don Stroud, Philippe Mora, Aleks Shaklin, Tim De Zarn, Anthony Guidera
description: Year 2049. Three adventurers leave the moon base where they live to go in search of gold. The three manage to find the precious metal, but from this moment their life becomes complicated. The meeting with the charming Camilla Jones does nothing but cause further trouble for the three adventure companions ...

title: Galaxy of Terror
actors: Edward Albert, Erin Moran, Ray Walston, Bernard Behrens, Zalman King, Robert Englund, Taaffe O'Connell, Sid Haig, Grace Zabriskie, Jack Blessing
description: The crew members of a spaceship must contend with monsters generated by their own imaginations.

title: S.Darko
actors: Daveigh Chase, Briana Evigan, James Lafferty, Ed Westwick, Walter Platz, John Hawkes, Bret Roberts, Jackson Rathbone, Elizabeth Berkley, Barbara Tarbuck
description: Samantha Darko, Donnie's little sister, is now 18 and traveling to California with her friend Corey. The girls' car breaks down in a town in the middle of nowhere. Here, with the fall of a meteorite on a mill, a series of inexplicable events begins which Samantha tries to make sense of.
notes: The S. Darko operation is inadmissible mainly due to a screenplay that mimics the more esoteric passages of the precursor, giving us an imaginary of sterile carryover and completely drained of the visionary force of Kelly's film.

title: Underwater!
actors: Jane Russell, Gilbert Roland, Richard Egan, Lori Nelson, Robert Keith
description: The treasure of a submerged galleon in the Caribbean is contested by a group of daredevil adventurers.
notes: Total flop, despite the Technicolor and a special Cinemascope format. More like a celebration of Russell's beauty, in bikinis and swimwear (designed for her) for much of the film.

title: Supercroc
actors: Kim Little, Cynthia Rose Hall, Matthew Blashaw, David Novak, Allen Duncan, Ernesto Galan, Marat Glazer, Garth R. Hassell, Kristen Quintrall, Shaley Scott
description: A small squad of soldiers, joined by a zoologist, is sent to Northern Los Angeles to hunt down a dangerous giant crocodile, which infests the waters of a lake, terrorizing the population. Apparently the animal comes out of the water and kills people because it is looking for some eggs that have been taken away from it. The fight between man and beast will be ruthless ...
notes: Beyond its remarkable pearls of improbability (how did a crocodile arrive in a Los Angeles pond? And where does it find the skills to attack a helicopter in flight?), This umpteenth movie about "bad animals" is silly, with terrible special effects and ridiculous dialogues. Pure Z series.

title: The Last Airbender
actors: Jackson Rathbone, Nicola Peltz, Cliff Curtis, Dev Patel, Noah Ringer, Jessica Andres, Seychelle Gabriel, Shaoun Toub, Aasif Mandvi, Keong Sim
description: The story of Aang, a ten-year-old boy, heir to a lineage of avatars (incarnations of gods), who must put aside his childhood and take on his responsibilities to stop the deadly war that sees the opposing Fire nation to those of the Earth, Water and Air.
notes: There is almost a challenge in the director in bringing perhaps a subjective shock that could coincide with the second Star Wars trilogy (especially the latest, essential Revenge of the Sith). His is certainly a cinema that thinks big but he also feels that he is afraid to do so. And The Last Airbender is currently his most alien film.

title: Monte Walsh
actors: Tom Selleck, Isabella Rossellini, Keith Carradine, George Eads, Robert Carradine
description: Wyoming, 1892: Mount Walsh and his friend Chet Rollins spend a harsh winter looking after cattle. Back in town, they discover that the ranch they worked for, like many others in the area, has been sold to a group of landowners whose local interests are run by Cal Brennan, who hires the two cowboys. In the city, Monte and Chet pursue romantic interests, the first with the prostitute Martine and the second with a widow who owns a shop. But with the arrival of the railway, life on the border will never be the same ...
notes: Remake, produced by Selleck, of _Monte Walsh, a die hard_ from 1970, directed by William A. Fraker with Lee Marvin, Jeanne Moreau and Jack Palance.

title: Mimic: Sentinel
actors: Lance Henriksen, Karl Geary, Rebecca Mader, Alexis Dziena, Keith Robinson, Tudorel Filimon
description: In the 1990s, the Judas project mistakenly created a breed of mutant cockroaches capable of mimicking the human appearance. Marvin (who then survived the disease spread by insects), observing the building in front of his, witnesses a murder whose perpetrator certainly does not seem to be a man ...

title: Hard Ground
actors: Burt Reynolds, Bruce Dern, Martin Kove, Amy Jo Johnson, Seth Peterson, David Figlioli, Larry Hankin
description: Billy Bucklin, a ruthless bandit, escapes on his way to Yuma. He has a plan in mind: to hire a handful of desperados to put the Mexican border on fire. To finance the project, he rob a stagecoach on which wages destined for the military are transported. He also kidnaps a young woman to sell her as a prostitute. Elder Sheriff Hutchinson persuades the governor to pardon another dangerous criminal, John "Chill" MacKay, whom Hutchinson himself arrested, having him sentenced to twenty years for murder. McKay is the sheriff's brother-in-law and is the only one believed to be able to help him hunt down criminals.

title: Drag Me to Hell
actors: Alison Lohman, Justin Long, Lorna Raver, Dileep Rao, David Paymer, Adriana Barraza, Chelcie Ross, Reggie Lee, Molly Cheek, Bojana Novakovic
description: Christine works in a bank and is in charge of evaluating possible loans. After denying a mortgage on the house of an old gypsy, she becomes the victim of a curse that turns her life into real hell. The only hope for Christine is the help of a visionary, capable of saving her from the demon that has taken possession of her soul.
notes: The filmmaker of _The House_ and _The Army of Darkness_ is back: irreverent, naughty, a little lousy and daring as in the 80s and its surroundings, the last great author, artist and craftsman of genre and degeneration. Laughter, screams, disgust and reflection. Few means, great cinema.

title: Halloween II
actors: Tyler Mane, Malcolm McDowell, Brad Dourif, Scout Taylor-Compton, Sheri Moon Zombie, Danielle Harris, Brea Grant, Margot Kidder, Howard Hesseman, Angela Trimbur, Octavia Spencer, Mary Birdsong, Jeff Daniel Phillips, Nicky Whelan, Daniel Roebuck, Sylvia Jefferies, Caroline Williams
description: Two years after the events described in the first film of the series, the murderous maniac Michael Myers is still around, free to carry out his violent atrocities. The monstrous psychopath, who grew up in the woods in complete isolation, is on the hunt for his sister, whom he himself estranged many years ago. To find the girl, the killer giant returns to the midst of civilization and sows panic.
notes: Halloween II is not a masterpiece, neither was the previous chapter, but the dream sequences reaffirm the concept. We are facing a cinema that takes no prisoners, a sick aesthetic capable of combining death metal and white trash. Not everything goes smoothly but the mad hatter ensures disturbances if you pass his mirror.

title: Surrogates
actors: Bruce Willis, Radha Mitchell, Rosamund Pike, Ving Rhames, Michael Cudlitz, Helena Mattsson, Boris Kodjoe, Jack Noseworthy, Valerie Azlynn, Devin Ratray
description: In the near future, the world is inhabited by human beings who live in total digital isolation, a sort of cyberspace where you can interact with the outside world through surrogates, or through personal androids, real humanoid alter egos. A policeman, also thanks to his robotic clone, is on the trail of a tech terrorist who dreams of a world where men can live without surrogates.
notes: This film may be small, but it has all the stigmata of the great and beloved disciple of Don Siegel's Invasion of the Body Snatchers: ideologies waned, communism destroyed, now we are our own enemies.

title: The Brothers Bloom
actors: Rachel Weisz, Adrien Brody, Mark Ruffalo, Rinko Kikuchi, Robbie Coltrane, Maximilian Schell, Ricky Jay, Zachary Gordon, Max Records, Andy Nyman
description: The Bloom brothers, two young men who make a living from small and big scams, meet a beautiful heiress who will change their lives forever. The young Penelope, chosen by the two as the next victim of their misdeeds, turns instead into an accomplice for a new, grandiose plan. The team play between the two brothers risks breaking up when one of them falls madly in love with Penelope.

title: Unstoppable
actors: Wesley Snipes, Jacqueline Obradors, Stuart Wilson, Kim Coates, Mark Sheppard, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Vincent Riotta, David Schofield, Nicholas Aaron, Kim Thomson
description: Dean Cage is a former military man who is going through a period of rehabilitation after the tragic death of his best friend in Bosnia. A CIA agent, Sullivan, involves him in a dark affair: mistakenly believing that he is responsible for some misdeeds against the Agency, he injects him with a powerful hallucinogen that prevents him from distinguishing reality. Since then, Cage has six hours to find the antidote.
notes: Wesley Snipes, with a few exceptions, seems to specialize in lending his granite face to films all of tension and adrenaline. Here the banal spectacularity definitely prevails over the espionage intrigue, making the film an uninteresting and original product.

title: Monster Ark
actors: Renée O'Connor, Tim DeKay, Tommy 'Tiny' Lister, Amanda Crew, Carlos Leon, Richard Gnolfo, Tommy Nohilly, Bill Parks, Velislav Pavlov, Bashar Rahal
description: The archaeologist Nicholas finds some scrolls which turn out to be the original copy of Genesis. With the help of his ex-wife Ava, an expert translator, he discovers that Noah built a second Ark to enclose a terrible monster. Nicholas' team accidentally frees the creature, risking catastrophic consequences ...

title: Final Approach
actors: Dean Cain, Anthony Michael Hall, Ernie Hudson, Sunny Mabrey, Lea Thompson, William Forsythe, Barry Livingston, Tracey Gold, Scott Paulin, Christopher Cousins
description: Jack Bender is an FBI agent specializing in extreme rescues who has been no longer on duty for several months due to a mission that went wrong. Ironically, he finds himself with his wife aboard a hijacked airliner by a terrorist, Greg Gilliad. He calls for the release of the leader of the extremist movement to which he belongs, Silas Jansen, an old enemy of Bender now in federal prison. If the request is not granted, Gilliad is willing to blow up the plane with a bomb. What only Jack knows is that the criminal is not just a terrorist, but also a visionary fanatic.
notes: Panic at high altitudes with the direction of a veteran of television action movies.

title: The Book of Eli
actors: Denzel Washington, Gary Oldman, Mila Kunis, Michael Gambon, Jennifer Beals, Ray Stevenson, Tom Waits, Frances de la Tour, Lateef Crowder, Chris Browning
description: In the not too distant future, the world has been engulfed in apocalyptic destruction. The only one who can save their fortunes is a lonely man named Eli (Denzel Washington). The survival of humanity can in fact spring only from knowledge and the key seems to be in the mysterious book that Eli carries with him and defends with all his strength, in the difficult journey through a desolate America.
notes: Limits and rainy skies. However, if you are a little inclined towards this type of show, you will have a lot of fun.

title: The Box
actors: Cameron Diaz, James Marsden, Frank Langella, Deborah Rush, Gillian Jacobs, Michael Zegen, James Rebhorn, Andrew Levitas, Holmes Osborne, Celia Weston
description: Norma (Cameron Diaz) and Arthur Lewis (James Marsden), a young couple with a young son, receive a mysterious box as a gift. A man reveals to them that, by pressing the button on it, they will get a million dollars. But in return someone else, somewhere in the world, will be killed. After a long discussion, torn between greed and moral scruple, it is Norma who decides to press the button. And after doing so, he will go in search of the killer.
notes: Inspired by a short story by Richard Matheson (Button Button), written for the second series of At the Edge of Reality, The Box is the first beautiful, full, round title by Richard Kelly, director of Donnie Darko and the terrifying Southland Tales . Apart from demonstrating how the brilliant ideas of Matheson are timeless, the film brings the theme of free will back to a context that is anything but metaphysical, despite the spatial references, but rather everyday.

title: Kansas Pacific
actors: Sterling Hayden, Eve Miller, Barton MacLane, Harry Shannon, Tom Fadden, Reed Hadley, Douglas Fowley, Robert Keys, Irving Bacon, Myron Healey
description: On the eve of the Civil War, Captain John Nelson is sent by the government to direct the construction of a railway. A group of pro-auditors tries to sabotage the project: in the meantime, Nelson meets the beautiful Barbara Bruce ...
notes: Conventional but snappy, with the always powerful Hayden.

title: The Hole
actors: Chris Massoglia, Nathan Gamble, Haley Bennett, Teri Polo, Bruce Dern, Quinn Lord, John DeSantis, Merritt Patterson, Chelsea Ricketts, Douglas Chapman
description: Two brothers come across a strange hole in the basement of their home. Together with a neighbor they decide to explore it, venturing into underground meanders that will prove to contain all their deepest and most ancient fears.
notes: Visions of horror in 3D for the film presented out of competition at the 2009 Venice Film Festival, written by Mark L. Smith and embellished with two cameos, Dick Miller and Bruce Dern, guardian angels from the Gremlins director's factory. Almost a Matinée, but with a more ferocious art of emotion that manipulates teen cinema to evoke the traumas buried in consciousness. The fear of the dark never ends.

title: Tron Legacy
actors: Jeff Bridges, Garrett Hedlund, Olivia Wilde, Michael Sheen, John Hurt, Serinda Swan, Beau Garrett, Amy Esterle, Bruce Boxleitner
description: Sam Flynn (Garrett Hedlund) investigates the disappearance of his father Kevin (Jeff Bridges), whom he hasn't seen in 25 years. The truth is more incredible than you can imagine: Kevin is a prisoner of a virtual reality animated by gladiator games. A fantastic but dangerous world in which even Sam finds himself catapulted: from that moment father and son have to face a desperate journey to escape from cyberspace and return to the real universe.
notes: The promises are largely kept, but the banality and the jams of the script are also accentuated by the first film. Impressive are the sinister and rejuvenated Jeff Bridges, Michael Sheen who dances and kills like a glam rock star and the sinuous Olivia Wilde and Beau Garrett. Too bad that two hours are too long and flow like the update of a glorious but old program.

title: Prairie Fever
directors: Stephen Bridgewater, David S. Cass sr.
actors: Kevin Sorbo, Lance Henriksen, Dominique Swain, Jamie Anne Allman, Jillian Armenante, Felicia Day, Lucy Lee Flippin, Robert Norsworthy, Blake Gibbons, Don Swayze
description: Sheriff Preston Biggs has entered a period of severe crisis since he lost his wife in a robbery. Although perpetually alcoholic, he is in charge of accompanying some women affected by the so-called "prairie fever", a sort of mental instability. Meanwhile, he meets the attractive Olivia.

title: Red Sands
actors: Shane West, Leonard Roberts, Aldis Hodge, Callum Blue, Brendan Miller, Theo Rossi, Noel Gugliemi, Mercedes Masöhn, Govinda Touzene, Andrew Elvis Miller
