description: According to an ancient legend handed down by the Afghan people, the Djinn are ancestral spirits made of fire, who can take any shape and want to dominate the world and humans. The only way to stop them is to imprison them in vessels similar to the mythical Aladdin's lamp. A squadron of American soldiers at the front has the bad idea of ??blowing up a statue, causing a Djinn to wake up. The monster is terribly thirsty for blood and revenge.
notes: Hallucinated horror with undoubtedly original assumptions, even if the idea of ??an evil and monstrous version of the genie of the Thousand and One Nights lamp can be almost ridiculous to Western audiences.

title: Lies & Illusions
actors: Christian Slater, Cuba Gooding jr., Sarah Ann Schultz, Christa Campbell, Robert Giardina, Al Madrigal, Kelly Hyde, Lochlyn Munro, Dominic Salvatore, Tracy Schornick
description: Wes Wilson is a writer who became famous thanks to a bestseller, in which he explains how honesty is the only weapon to save romantic relationships. When his girlfriend is kidnapped and left for dead, his life suddenly takes an unexpected turn: chased by a secret agent, the man suddenly finds himself trapped in a shady game of spy intrigue and stolen diamonds. He will discover that his girlfriend is not quite the person he thought he knew ...
notes: Action comedy with the interesting duo Christian Slater-Cuba Gooding jr. Behind the camera directs the Hungarian-born director who shot the horror fantasy _Do not open that gate_ in the 1980s.

title: Legion
actors: Paul Bettany, Kevin Durand, Dennis Quaid, Doug Jones, Lucas Black, Adrianne Palicki, Charles S. Dutton, Kate Walsh, Tyrese Gibson, Willa Holland
description: The Earth was hit by an apocalyptic catastrophe that wiped out a large part of the human population. A group of strangers find themselves by chance in a remote inn in the American desert: among them Bob (Dennis Quaid) and Michael (Paul Bettany). A glimmer of salvation seems to open: the waitress of the restaurant carries the Messiah in her womb, who will be able to save the last survivors from the total end.
notes: Legion, forty million dollars in receipts in the US, demonstrates two things: that horror is saving American cinema from ignominy and that it is enough to interpret the genre well to entertain.

title: Half Past Dead 2
actors: Bill Goldberg, Kurupt, Jack Conley, Robert Madrid, Morocco Omari, Angell Conwell, Robert LaSardo, Alona Tal, Noelle Evans, Robert Torti
description: The situation inside a maximum security prison is critical, the various and warlike gangs of inmates dictate their laws by force. After yet another act of blood, a revolt between prisoners explodes in all its violence. The guards seem to have received strict orders not to intervene. Among the inmates, newcomer Twitch must choose which side to stand to save his skin. He teams up with the dreaded Burk, the self-proclaimed boss of a powerful gang. With his cooperation, Twitch begins to try to trace the person responsible for the riot. However, some do not like having certain issues investigated and their lives will begin to be in danger.

title: Sorority Row
actors: Briana Evigan, Leah Pipes, Rumer Willis, Jamie Chung, Margo Harshman, Julian Morris, Matt O'Leary, Caroline D'Amore, Maxx Hennard, Audrina Patridge
description: A group of girls, part of a female university fraternity, organize a joke on one of them. The game becomes too heavy and the young woman dies tragically. In order not to jeopardize their future, they make the joint decision to make the body disappear and to keep the secret about the misfortune. After a year, someone will begin to haunt them and sadistically kill them, one after the other.
notes: The breath of the devil in Blood Pact is very labored. It is so bad that the horror remains only on the surface through sound effects and serial killings, shown with zero inventiveness.

title: Diary of the Dead
actors: Michelle Morgan, Joshua Close, Shawn Roberts, Amy Ciupak Lalonde, Joe Dinicol, Scott Wentworth, Philip Riccio, Chris Violette, Tatiana Maslany, Todd Schroeder
description: Jason, an aspiring filmmaker, wants to make an independent horror in the woods with some friends. During the first night, the boys hear incredible news on the radio about dead bodies coming back to life and attacking human beings. Despite the violence and fear, Jason always keeps the video camera with him, with which he documents the looming horror. His filming will become the documentary entitled The Death of Death, which is the film we are seeing.
notes: With a skilful use of horizontal means of communication, that is, accessible to all, including the Internet and digitally, the director from Pittsburgh demonstrates how independent and experimental cinema can be made with the breath of a beautiful story. If even death is not certain in a reality show context or in front of the television cameras, what remains of the "truth"?

title: Ninja Assassin
actors: Naomie Harris, Randall Duk Kim, Rain, Sung Kang, Rick Yune, Sho Kosugi, Ben Miles, Guido Föhrweißer, Togo Igawa, Stephen Marcus
description: Raizo was picked up on the streets as a child and raised in the powerful and top secret Ozunu clan, a sect of assassins led by the ruthless Takeshi. Having become a perfectly trained killer, he goes into crisis when the clan sentences a friend of his to death. With the help of Mika, a Berlin agent of Europol who wants to defeat the organization, she prepares her revenge.
notes: Given the umpteenth fighters fly, the physique of the young Rain appreciated, very little remains. The memory of a lot of massacres and a lot of action.

title: 24: Redemption
actors: Kiefer Sutherland, Cherry Jones, Bob Gunton, Colm Feore, Powers Boothe, Robert Carlyle, Jon Voight, Peter MacNicol, Gil Bellows, Hakeem Kae-Kazim
description: Jack Bauer, to escape his past and the government's investigation of him, exiled himself to the African town of Sangala where he works on a mission for orphaned children, coordinated by his friend Carl Benton. The territory is controlled by General Juma, who is about to carry out a coup. His right-hand man, Colonel Dubaku, is determined to kidnap the mission's children to make little soldiers, and Bauer and Benton must fight to save them. Meanwhile, in Washington, the presidency is about to pass from Noah Daniels to Allison Taylor, the first woman in the White House.
notes: Tv movie based on the famous series, produced between the sixth and seventh season.

title: G-Force
actors: Bill Nighy, Will Arnett, Zach Galifianakis, Kelli Garner, Tyler Patrick Jones, Piper Mackenzie Harris, Gabriel Casseus, Jack Conley, Niecy Nash, Justin Mentell
description: The guinea pigs Darwin (the team leader), Juarez (martial arts specialist), Blaster (weapons expert), together with the mole Speckles (computer expert) and the fly Mooch (the vigilantes), form a superteam, a very efficient and deadly team. It will be to them that the United States government will entrust the mission to thwart the evil plan of a great tycoon, Leonard Saber, who plans to destroy the world with his appliances.
notes: Guinea pigs against killer appliances! A premise crazy enough to snatch a few smiles, despite the fact that films with digital and talking animals can hardly be taken anymore. It is a pity that the do-gooders spread to the point of infecting even the villain of the film: without a major nemesis you can have fun, but only a little.

title: Hollow Man II
actors: Christian Slater, Peter Facinelli, Laura Regan, David McIlwraith, William MacDonald, Sarah Deakins, Jessica Harmon, Sonya Salomaa, Terri Anne Welyki, John Shaw
description: A Seattle cop and a biologist join forces to hunt down a mysterious and invisible killer.

title: Takers
actors: Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen, Matt Dillon, Zoë Saldana, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Johnathon Schaech, Michael Ealy, Steve Harris, Chris Brown
description: A well-known gang of bank robbers scoffs at the police by landing a series of spectacular shots. The guys have just worked out the perfect plan: a robbery that will yield a whopping 20 million dollars. On their trail, however, is a stubborn Manhattan detective (Matt Dillon), determined to give young criminals a hard time.

title: Buried Alive
actors: Leah Rachel, Erin Reese, Tobin Bell, Germaine De Leon, Terence Jay, Steve Sandvoss, Lindsey Scott
description: A group of university students goes to the family ranch of two of them to spend a weekend of fun: René wants to test two freshmen, subjecting them to humiliating initiation rites for his brotherhood. Meanwhile, the ranch keeper is on the trail of a buried treasure, but stumbles upon a witch's grave. The creature awakens and wanders bloodthirsty around the estate, seeking revenge on the descendants of its killer ...
notes: Routine horror, predictable at every turn, in which the gruesome deaths of the protagonists follow one another without imagination. In the role of the keeper we find Tobin Bell, alias the Riddler of the horror saga _Saw_.

title: Hatchet
actors: Joel Moore, Tamara Feldman, Deon Richmond, Kane Hodder, Mercedes McNab, Parry Shen, Joel Murray, Joleigh Fioravanti, Richard Riehle, Patrika Darbo
description: A group of tourists embarks to visit the swamps of Louisiana, where the memory of what happened to Victor Crowley, killed by mistake with a hatchet by his own father, is still alive. Legend has it that his spirit still roams the swamps and many say they saw a gigantic man, terribly disfigured. When the boat they are traveling on sinks, unsuspecting tourists discover that legends always have a grain of truth.
notes: We appreciate the vintage style, devoid of digital and with very gore and artisanal rips, as well as the presence of two iconic figures such as Robert Englund in the prologue and Kane Warren Hodder (four times in the role of Jason) in a flashback. Unfortunately, despite the short duration, everything else is boring and one would like to run fast forward from a quartering to a beheading, to enjoy the riot of dismemberments without unnecessary (meta) narrative interruptions.

title: Living hell
actors: Johnathon Schaech, Erica Leerhsen, James McDaniel, Jason Wiles, Terence Jay, Charissa Allen, Dylan Kenin, Judy Herrera, Vic Chao, Josh Berry
description: In the middle of the Cold War, a top secret military project gives life to a deadly organism that feeds on light and energy. The creature storms out of the laboratory and wreaks havoc, destroying everything in its path. The only person who can stop it is a professor, aware of disturbing connections between his past and the origins of the lethal organism ...
notes: The film harks back to the 1950s sci-fi tradition, without claiming to evoke the atmosphere of old b-movies. The production is almost television, as well as the cast, but the director manages to imprint the subject, which is not too original in itself, a fast pace that makes it enjoyable.

title: Paranormal Activity
actors: Katie Featherston, Micah Sloat, Michael Bayouth, Amber Armstrong, Mark Fredrichs, Randy McDowell, Ashley Palmer, Tim Piper
description: A young couple (Katie Featherson and Micah Sloat) soon realize that the house they live in is infested with demons that feed on negative energies. To feel protected, they decide to install a video surveillance system inside the home that can record what happens at night while they sleep. There will be unpleasant surprises.
notes: Paranormal Activity is a decidedly traditionalist film. Despite its [REC] style reality horror air it owes more to Lars von Trier's dogmas than to George A. Romero's zombie videodraphs. A kind of digital Poltergeist, while effective and at times funny, exhibits too much of its own functioning to really scare.

title: Black Dynamite
actors: Michael Jai White, Arsenio Hall, Tommy Davidson, Kevin Chapman, Richard Edson, Darrel Heath, Buddy Lewis, Sorana Black, Juka Ceesay, Sean Christopher
description: African American Black Dynamite (Michael Jay White) is a former CIA agent. His brother is killed by the criminal The Man, guilty of circulating drugs in local orphanages and wanted for marketing an adulterated liquor. Black Dynamite has the difficult task of shedding light on the matter, even at the cost of endangering his own life.

title: The Ministers
actors: John Leguizamo, Florencia Lozano, Diane Venora, Wanda De Jesus, Harvey Keitel, Manny Perez, Saul Stein, Susan Porro, Luis Antonio Ramos, Jaime Tirelli
description: A New York District Police Officer (John Leguizamo) desires at all costs to avenge his father's death thirteen years ago, but unfortunately becomes involved in a shady affair organized by a religious order known as "The Ministers", which appears to be the culprit of the murder.

title: Bubba Ho-tep
actors: Bruce Campbell, Ossie Davis, Ella Joyce, Heidi Marnhout, Bob Ivy
description: Elvis Presley is an old and sick man and now lives in a hospice. But everyone thinks he is actually her double, Sebastian Haff. The reality is that Elvis himself, years earlier, tired of his own success and the resulting media wave, had made a pact with Haff, under which the two would momentarily exchange identities. With the death of the double, however, Elvis can no longer take possession of himself and is considered only a charlatan. Meanwhile, unexplained deaths occur inside the hospice ...
notes: Based on the short novel by cult author Joe R. Lansdale, the film offers a reinterpretation of Elvis Presley's old age comedy and horror movie. The game of parts and the misunderstandings about the exchange of identities are the real humorous core, while the continuous deaths tinge the plot of yellow, keep the tension high and, consequently, the level of attention.

title: Ben
actors: Lee Montgomery, Joseph Campanella, Arthur O'Connell, Rosemary Murphy, Meredith Baxter
description: Some abnormally large mice, after killing Willard Styles, who in turn wanted to exterminate them after using them for revenge, lurk inside the sewer pipes of an American town. Ben, the most cunning of all, periodically guides them in search of food, in continuous raids that cause several deaths. The police are groping in the dark and in the meantime Ben becomes friends with a sick child, who acts as an informer on the movements of human beings ...
notes: Followed by _Willard and the mice_, the film chooses to impress thanks to a purely horrific staging and guilty omits the narrative fluidity. Some sequences repeat for no reason, but on the whole they can work that way too. Michael Jackson sings _Ben's Song_ on the credits.

title: The Way of War
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., J.K. Simmons, Vernel Bagneris, Brett Beoubay, Kyle Bradley, Edrick Browne, Vince Canlas, Patrick Michael Carney, Brad C. Carter, J. Omar Castro
description: David Wolfe is a soldier operating in the Middle East with a three-man squad trained to eliminate a terrorist known as the "Ace of Spades". The mission, however, does not proceed as expected and ends in blood: Wolfe is the only survivor, but he finds himself in possession of burning information in spite of himself. In fact, he discovers that the terrorists who escaped the military operation are part of an international conspiracy in which members of the presidential cabinet are also involved. Determined to bring out the truth, Wolfe breaks his orders and returns to the United States, where he will have to escape capture to enforce his charges against the powerful indicted.

title: Bats: Human Harvest
actors: David Chokachi, Michael Jace, Pollyanna McIntosh, Marty Papazian, Melissa De Sousa, Tomas Arana, Mike Straub, Todd Jensen, Ivo Simeonov, George Zlatarev
description: A group of soldiers in Afghanistan is on the trail of a terrorist who has taken refuge in the maze of underground caves. Men set out in pursuit, but in the darkness of the underground they will find a swarm of genetically engineered bats, programmed to feed on human flesh.

title: Highlander: Endgame
actors: Christopher Lambert, Adrian Paul, Bruce Payne, Mihnea Trusca, Lisa Barbuscia, Donnie Yen, Ian Paul Cassidy, Peter Wingfield, Damon Dash, Beatie Edney
description: In the mists of time the immortals made their appearance. They drag themselves along moved by an unstoppable desire to fight, it is a battle that knows no limits of time or space. The one who will excel will receive an extraordinary prize, even if an immortal does not manifest joy in victory, because in the end he knows that there will be only one winner.
notes: Fourth episode of the saga.

title: Season of the Witch
actors: Nicolas Cage, Claire Foy, Ron Perlman, Stephen Graham, Ulrich Thomsen, Stephen Campbell Moore, Robert Sheehan, Matt Devere, Nick Thomas-Webster
description: During the fourteenth century, when the black plague ravages Europe, a knight (Nicolas Cage) is ordered to escort a young woman (Claire Foy) accused of witchcraft and suspected of being responsible to a monastery. of the spread of the plague. Convinced of the girl's innocence, the knight and some traveling companions will fight to reach a consecrated land, where they can prove the girl's innocence and free Europe from the curse of the plague. What the knight ignores is that the dark forces of evil are waiting for him.
notes: Thrown to the wind the attempts to build a barracks complicity with Ron Perlman, Cage settles in monoexpressiveness and Sena in the flatness, packaging a serious fantasy, very boring and totally devoid of ideas, seasoned with a bad CGI: disappointing even for the diehards of the genre .

title: Command Performance
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Melissa Ann Smith, Hristo Shopov, Dave Legeno, Zahary Baharov, Clement von Franckenstein, Ivaylo Geraskov, Shelly Varod, Katarzyna Wolejnio, Ida Lundgren
description: American pop star Venus is in Moscow for a benefit concert in the presence of the Russian President. The event turns into tragedy when a gang of terrorists raids and takes the young singer and the head of state hostage. In general panic, the only one to come to the rescue of the victims is the drummer of the shoulder group, a heavy metal band. Together with a young FSB agent, the man tries to restore order and save the hostages, but the two find themselves fighting against a lethal organization, from which the ghosts of the Soviet Union emerge ...
notes: Written, directed and performed by martial arts king Dolph Lundgren, who also performs as a musician.

title: Killers
actors: Katherine Heigl, Ashton Kutcher, Catherine O'Hara, Tom Selleck, Katheryn Winnick, Rob Riggle, Martin Mull, Mary Birdsong, Larry Joe Campbell, Kevin Sussman
description: Jen Kornfeldt, a young computer programmer recovering from a bad breakup, meets Spencer Aimes, an undercover spy paid by the government, on vacation. They both find true love and soon get married. Everything seems to be going well until Spencer's 30th birthday, when the two discover that the man is the target of a mysterious killer who has been following the couple for years. Jen and Spencer's marriage turns into a real struggle for survival.
notes: There is little to save from _Killers_. Between Katherine Heigl and Ashton Kutcher there is no trace of chemistry, the comic moments are trite and predictable and the action scenes bland and monotonous. To be avoided.

title: Ring of Death
actors: Aesop Aquarian, Justin Bethancourt, Freddy Bouciegues, Jonathan Chase, Shannon Garnett, Meredith Giangrande, Jawara, Stacy Keach, John Koyama, Nelson Lee
description: Burke Wyatt, a former policeman, freshly separated from his wife, is recruited by the FBI to go and find out why so many inmates find their deaths inside the Cainesville prison. Wyatt will discover a dense and mysterious network that organizes illegal fights between inmates and will get involved, ending up in a maelstrom of violence and crime.
notes: A TV movie that rests on an obvious and banal narrative construction but with a good dose of action to thrill fans of small entertainment. A blockbuster like many others, which however counts on the credible interpretation of Johnny Mesnner in the role of the protagonist. Without infamy and without praise.

title: Sand Serpents
actors: Jason Gedrick, Tamara Hope, Elias Toufexis, Sebastian Knapp, Michelle Asante, Chris Jarman, Viscreanu Constantin, Duma Iulian, Imran Khan, Andreea Coscai
description: In a remote area of ??the Afghanistan desert, a small troop of American soldiers is tasked with locating and rendering a Taliban base harmless. The operation turns into carnage: only a few men survive, but are captured, while the explosive used to flush out the enemies awakens monstrous creatures that have been lying underground for a long time. The prisoners are blindfolded and feel only strong earthquakes: when they manage to free themselves, the Taliban have mysteriously disappeared into thin air. But they will soon realize that they have to fight against something much more dangerous: the giant worms are lurking in the tunnels around them ...

title: Street Warrior
actors: Max Martini, Nick Chinlund, Jane Park Smith, Max Perlich, Valerie Cruz, Erin Cottrell, Jayden Lund, Kiko Ellsworth, Danny Arroyo, Jon Braver
description: War veteran Jack Campbell returns home after four years in prison and discovers that his brother Joey is in a coma from being beaten during an illegal boxing tournament. Determined to find out who is responsible for what happened, Jack conducts his own manhunt, making use of his deadly skills in the martial arts. The thirst for revenge will bring him in front of the local mafia boss, constantly looking for inexperienced fighters to sacrifice in the ring in his clandestine contests. Jack pretends to be one of them and prepares to face all the fights necessary to be able to defeat the man who massacred his brother: the champion Isaiah Griffin.

title: Bangkok Dangerous
actors: Nicolas Cage, Shahkrit Yamnarm, Charlie Yeung, Panward Hemmanee, Nirattisai Kaljaruek, Dom Hetrakul, Tuck Napaskorn, Steve Baldocchi, Chris Heebink, James With
description: Joe (Nicolas Cage) is a remorseless killer who is in Bangkok to assassinate four enemies of a ruthless crime boss named Surat. For this purpose he recruits Kong (Shahkrit Yamnarm), a street thief, whose job will be to carry out some errands on his behalf; once he has completed his assignment, Joe will kill him, thus erasing all traces of his passage. Despite his plans, Joe finds himself mentoring the young man and falls in love with a girl who works as a saleswoman at a local store. Slowly and inexorably Joe falls prey to the influence and intoxicating beauty of Bangkok, begins to question his lonely existence and let his guard down. Too bad the dangerous Surat has decided to take care of him.
notes: The two directors, already overrated since the days of The Eye, remake their 1999 film of the same name (the best) by pushing on the accelerator with chases, shootings, insistent details.

title: Beastly
actors: Alex Pettyfer, Neil Patrick Harris, Justin Bradley, Vanessa Hudgens, Mary-Kate Olsen, Dakota Johnson, Erik Knudsen, Peter Krause, LisaGay Hamilton, Gio Perez, David Francis
description: Kyle is a guy from New York whose too bold attitude leads him to have unbearable bully attitudes. A behavior that will pay dearly: a witch in fact, having witnessed his excesses, unleashes a spell against him that has the effect of making him monstrous in appearance. The disfigurement will last until Kyle, over the course of a year and despite his beastly appearance, fails to find true love.
notes: There is a huge and substantial problem behind this teen adaptation of the legend of Beauty and the Beast. The question is only apparently frivolous, in reality it empties the operation of meaning and ends up making it harmful. The problem is this: the Beast is not a beast. The synthetic bodies of Pettyfer and Vanessa Hudgens are immune to any deformation (so as not to frighten the fans too much?), (An) aesthetic and dangerous: too beautiful outside to worry about their interiority, they are the spokespersons for a generation that should scare us.

title: The Net 2.0
actors: Nikki Deloach, Cengiz Bozkurt, Sebnem Dönmez, Demet Akbag, Neil Hopkins, Courtney Vye, Ertan Saban, Güven Kirac, Charles Winkler, Selma Ergeç
description: Beautiful Hope Cassidy is a highly acclaimed computer programmer in America when she is offered her dream job. All well and good, except that the new location where it is to be held is very far away and to be precise in Istanbul. Hope tries to get her boyfriend James to follow her, but he chooses to stay home. Left alone, she leaves for Turkey to discover that someone has stolen her identity. Unable to prove who she really is, she is hunted down as a criminal by the police. Hope will only be able to rely on herself and her computer skills to find out who is responsible and why someone seems to be mad at her ...

title: Call of the Wild
actors: Christopher Lloyd, Timothy Bottoms, Veronica Cartwright, Christopher Dempsey, Joyce Dewitt, Ariel Gade, Devon Graye, Devon Iott, Kameron Knox, Russell Snyder
description: Little Ryann is welcomed by her grandfather to spend two weeks with him, in Montana, on the occasion of a parents' trip. When one night she finds a wounded wolf near the pigsty, the little girl will decide to help him, and then take him to live with her in Boston. But the grandfather knows that it is only a matter of time for the animal to feel the need to return to its wild life.
notes: The adaptation of the London text is limited to reading the novel that an unbearable child, materialistic but ready to convert after about ten minutes in the mountains, listens to her grandfather before going to bed. The film was released in theaters in a rather useless 3D version.

title: Knight & Day
actors: Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Maggie Grace, Peter Sarsgaard, Paul Dano, Marc Blucas, Viola Davis, Olivier Martinez, Stream, Nicole Signore
description: June is a Midwestern girl who finds herself involved in an international conspiracy after stumbling upon (by chance?) Milner who turns out to be a super spy on a mission. June will thus find herself catapulted into an adventure that is truly unexpected for her: a dangerous journey around the world, following the infallible secret agent, to protect an invention that could prove to be the solution to all the energy problems on the planet.
notes: There remains a too glossy look that neutralizes that basic B movie taste, where excess goes hand in hand with splatter and artisanal filming. Occasionally a few lines work, but they are flashes in a dull sky of boredom.

title: Ice Spiders
actors: Patrick Muldoon, Vanessa Williams, Thomas Calabro, David Millbern, Noah Bastian, Carleigh King, Stephen J. Cannell, Matt Whittaker, Clayton Taylor, Charles Halford
description: In the mountains of Utah, between the ski slopes, there is a secret military base that carries out a monstrous experiment, giving birth to genetically mutated giant spiders. The DNA of the arachnids comes from a fossil found in Afghanistan and is used to create animals a thousand times larger than a normal spider, which produce with their web a very light but indestructible fabric, ideal for making bulletproof uniforms for the army. . When the operation escapes the scientists' control and the spiders flee the base causing panic, it will be the former ski champion Dash Dashiell, who recycled himself as a tourist instructor, to try to save the situation ...

title: The Corpse Vanishes
actors: Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Tristram Coffin, Elizabeth Russell, Minerva Urecal, Angelo Rossitto, Joan Barclay, Kenneth Harlan, Gwen Kenyon, Vince Barnett
description: On her wedding day, Alice receives a poisoned orchid as a gift, whose perfume makes her fall into suspended animation. The flower was sent by the diabolical Dr. Lorenz, who kidnaps young brides at the altar and uses their bodies to draw an experimental fluid, a powerful filter of beauty for his vain consort. Journalist Patricia discovers that the disappearances are related to the rare orchid, and the flower is only grown by Dr. Lorenz. But framing an evil genius will not be easy ...
notes: Absurd but linear weave of which it is impossible not to smile. The scene in which Lugosi whips his big, late assistant anticipates a similar sequence in Ed Wood's cinematography.

title: Crank: High Voltage
actors: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Dwight Yoakam, Efren Ramirez, Julanne Chidi Hill, Reno Wilson, Keone Young, Art Hsu, Joseph Julian Soria, Ling Bai
description: The film begins where the first _Crank_ ended: professional killer Chev Chelios falls from a flying helicopter. At the moment of crashing to the ground, he is greeted by a clique of Chinese, who take his heart to sell it to the organ market. In its place, they implant an artificial heart that requires continuous electrical recharges to keep beating. Chev will set off in search of the transplanted heart, helped by strange characters.
notes: At breakneck speed, even more than in the first episode: videogame influences, frenzied rhythm, pure action, without stopping and thoughts, with caricatured characters up to paroxysm. A demented, explosive ending that plays with the bodies with videoartistic cheekiness.

title: The Bounty Hunter
actors: Gerard Butler, Jennifer Aniston, Christine Baranski, Natalie Morales, Jason Sudeikis, Peter Greene, Cathy Moriarty, Siobhan Fallon, Liam Ferguson, Daisy Tahan
description: Milo Boyd, an unfortunate bounty hunter, gets his dream job when he is given the task of chasing Nicole Hurly, a fugitive journalist, his ex-wife. All Milo expects is a quiet day at work, but when Nicole manages to escape him to track down a murder, Milo realizes that, as always, nothing between him and Nicole is simple. The two chase each other continuously until they both find themselves having to escape to save themselves.
notes: With a duo like Gerard Butler and Jennifer Aniston it is already half the battle. The two often steal the show, stop at nothing, and create a lively post-wedding comedy that also has successful moments while not having the classically decadent charm of Garry Marshall. The contamination with the detective is decidedly more forced, with dark fragments that envelop and obscure those intermittent beams of light of the sentimental vein.

title: Out for blood
actors: Kevin Dillon, Vanessa Angel, Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, Lance Henriksen, Kenneth Colom, Alex McArthur, Ismail Kanater, Jim Ortlieb, Melissa Rivers, Adrian N. Roberts
description: Detective Hank Holten is entrusted with the disappearance of Layla Simmons. The case is soon solved when Hank finds the girl at a rave. Together, the two head to a party in an old mansion. While they are having sex, Hank realizes that he is in the midst of an orgy of ravenous vampires, and is bitten by one of them. Has Hank just gone mad or do the undead really exist? The detective will ask for help from his ex-wife, writer of novels about the children of the night.
notes: Vampire story with tempting promises, blood, orgies and decadence, which unfortunately, however, end up in a concentration of rather soporific clichés. Inconsistencies in the plot and acting evidence below sufficient do not help.

title: The Lawless Range
actors: John Wayne, Sheila Bromley, Frank McGlynn Jr., Jack Curtis, Wally Howe, Julia Griffith, Yakima Canutt, Earl Dwire
description: John Middleton must free Picano Valley from a gang of cattle thieves, led by a banker, who terrorize the community by plundering gold-rich land.
notes: B-Western from the 1930s, devoid of merit and stuffed with clichés. Even John Wayne fans will be disappointed with his ridiculous singing numbers.

title: Blood and Bone
actors: Michael Jai White, Julian Sands, Eamonn Walker, Dante Basco, Nona Gaye, Michelle Belegrin, Bob Sapp, Dick Anthony Williams, Francis Capra, Ron Yuan
description: Isaiah Bone is a born fighter who is about to get out of jail. After giving his fellow inmates one last lesson in the prison bathroom, he is released. Returning to freedom means for him to immediately find a way to survive. He rented a room from a woman named Tamara and began earning a living from clandestine wrestling matches, also with the help of her manager, Pinball. Success is immediate and soon Bone will start aiming really high.

title: Invisible Invaders
actors: John Agar, Jean Byron, Philip Tonge, Robert Hutton, John Carradine, Hal Torey, Paul Langton, Eden Hartford
description: The aliens contact the scientist Adam Penner, informing him that they have been on the moon for twenty thousand years but have never been discovered by man thanks to their invisibility. If the earthly people do not immediately surrender to their will, humanity will be exterminated. Once on planet Earth, these beings bring the corpses back to life and take possession of their bodies. Together with his daughter, an army commander and Dr. Carol Noyman, Penner will try to stop them.

title: The Lonely Trail
actors: John Wayne, Ann Rutherford, Cy Kendall, Bob Kortman, Fred 'Snowflake' Toones, Sam Flint, Dennis Moore, Jim Toney, Etta McDaniel, Yakima Canutt
description: Former Union officer Josh Ashley returns to his country in Texas in 1865 and discovers that in his absence the inhabitants have given support to the Confederacy, that is to say, the Northern states, and now suffer the iron fist of corrupt politician Holden. He uses the army to plunder the population and Ashley, pinned by the governor, tries to restore justice with the help of his friend Jed. In addition, the beautiful Virginia makes the veteran's heart beat.
notes: A Western like the many other products of that period (in the same year Joseph Kane alone directed eleven films). For John Wayne a role of pure routine useful for forming the Duke's acting profession.

title: The A-Team
actors: Bradley Cooper, Jessica Biel, Liam Neeson, Sharlto Copley, Patrick Wilson, Quinton 'Rampage' Jackson, Dirk Benedict, Dwight Schultz, Brian Bloom, Gerald McRaney
description: A group of Gulf War veterans, accused of a crime they did not commit, will use all the experience they have learned in the war to escape from a maximum security prison and to carry out some "jobs" as mercenaries.
notes: There is no shortage of fun and crazy ideas, the performers are spot on (without mimicking the models) and there is a priceless metacinematographic moment that makes a mockery of S3D. It is a pity that the film resembles a collage of non-organic episodes: a series of "successful plans" that are juxtaposed without too much attention to the script. Obligatory to wait after the credits to enjoy the cameos of the "real" Murdock and Sberla.

title: Warbirds
actors: Jamie Elle Mann, Brian Krause, Tohoru Masamune, Lucy Faust, David Jensen, Gizza Elizondo, Stephanie Honore, Henry Ku, Jon McCarthy, Marel Medina
description: Spring 1945. In Europe the war comes to an end, but on the Pacific front the Allies are still fighting against the Japanese, mostly in aerial clashes. On the island of a small atoll in the middle of the ocean, some Japanese soldiers digging trenches find eggs of enormous size, while a flying dinosaur swoops down on them from the sky. Meanwhile, a female air expedition, led by Maxine West, is sent on a special mission under the orders of Colonel Jack Toller. While flying over the atoll, the fleet is attacked by giant birds. After a crash landing, the female aviators will have to contend with the surviving Japanese. But not only...

title: The Losers
actors: Zoë Saldana, Jason Patric, Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Chris Evans, Idris Elba, Columbus Short, Holt McCallany, Óscar Jaenada, Peter Macdissi, Peter Francis James
description: A team of operative agents of the US special units, engaged in an undercover mission in the Bolivian jungle, is at the center of a plot hatched by a powerful enemy known as Max, who wants to spark another world conflict. When the five members of the squad are left for dead, they try to settle the score by joining forces with the mysterious Aisha, a special agent with a private mission.
notes: From the comic of the same name by Andy Diggle and Jock (his presentation drawings of the characters and the credits), Joel Silver draws a tamarro, ironic and not a little sexy film. But in the comic the villain was far more sinister, Aisha far more ambiguous and the Losers actions far more dramatic. Nothing more comes to the cinema than a light action, produced with the usual care of Silver but without much personality.

title: Deathlands
actors: Vincent Spano, Jenya Lano, Colin Fox, Alan C. Peterson, Traci Lords, Cliff Saunders, Nathan Carter, Matthew Currie Holmes, Jeffrey R. Smith, Park Bench
description: The whole planet has gone to hell ... The Earth, after a devastating atomic war, is now unrecognizable. The sky is red from unexplained chemical reactions and the nation once known as the United States is now nothing more than a wasteland called Deathlands. Next to humans, then, lives a new species of mutant living beings, gathered in feudal communities where every form of ancient democracy is absent. Ryan Cawdor, twenty years earlier a victim of his mother and brother's greed for power, continues not to give up, hoping for the return of a more human civilization and fighting for this noble end together with his heroic followers: the beautiful Krysty and mutant teenager Jak ...

title: The Night Riders
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune, Doreen McKay, Ruth Rogers, George Douglas, Tom Tyler, Kermit Maynard, Sammy McKim, Walter Wills
description: Talbot shady manages to become the governor of thirteen million acres of land, located in the southwestern United States. The landowner uses his power to harass the honest people of Mesquite, taxing everyone heavily and hunting down those who refuse to pay. But Stony Brooke and his two friends Tucson Smith and Lullaby Joslin - also known as the Mesquiteers - arrive to smash all his power plans.
notes: Part of a series of 51 western b-movies entitled _The Three Mesquiteers_ and produced between 1936 and 1943. Each film featured a trio of Hollywood stars. _The Night Riders_ is one of eight films in the series starring John Wayne

title: Thursday
actors: Thomas Jane, Aaron Eckhart, Paulina Porizkova, James LeGros, Paula Marshall, Michael Jeter, Glenn Plummer, Mickey Rourke, Luck Hari, Bari K. Willerford
description: With a past as a drug dealer behind him, Casey has rebuilt a life in another city: he has a beautiful wife and a secure job. The sudden visit of one of his old "colleagues" shatters the tranquility: Casey agrees to host him for a few days, finding himself at home with a load of heroin that attracts the attention of decidedly disreputable characters ...
notes: Directorial debut by the screenwriter of _Codice Swordfish_ and _X-Men the origins: Wolverine_, is a raid imbued with black humor and a bit pulp (but Tarantino is far away); some scenes of gratuitous violence, a rocking soundtrack and sustained rhythm make up for the lack of inventiveness.

title: New Frontier
actors: John Wayne, Ray Corrigan, Raymond Hatton, Jennifer Jones, Eddy Waller, Sammy McKim, LeRoy Mason, Harrison Greene, Reginald Barlow, Burr Caruth
description: To bring peace to a herding struggle, the Mesquiteers (Stony Brooke, Tucson Smith and Lullaby Joslin) persuade ranch owners to move to another piece of land. Too late they discover that the property has no value, but they are captured before they can warn the ranchers of the deception ...
notes: The Three Mesquiteers, protagonists of a series of western b-movies between the 30s and 40s, return in this well-known but effective adventure, for the last time led by the rocky John Wayne in the role of the leader Stony Brooke; the cast of rude cowboys and treacherous speculators is softened by the presence of the beautiful Jennifer Jones, here making her big screen debut.

title: The Keeper
actors: Steven Seagal, Liezl Carstens, Arron Shiver, Johnnie Hector, Steph Duvall, Luce Rains, Kevin Wiggins, Trine Christensen, Tomas Sanchez, Rio Alexander
description: LA policeman Roland Sallinger and his partner Trevor break into the lair of some traffickers. Trevor suggests that he and Roland pocket a portion of the two million dollars in possession of the captured criminals. Roland refuses and Trevor shoots him, but his aim is not infallible and the wounded man manages to recover. When Trevor learns that his colleague has survived he decides he needs to silence him, but that's not Roland's only problem. His friend Connor, in fact, has a daughter named Nikita that someone is trying to kidnap and asks him to help protect her. Which puts Roland into collision with local gangster Jason Cross.

title: The Lawless Nineties
actors: John Wayne, Ann Rutherford, Harry Woods, George 'Gabby' Hayes, Al Bridge, Fred 'Snowflake' Toones, Etta McDaniel, Tom Brower, Lane Chandler, Cliff Lyons
description: Federal agents John Tipton and Bridger arrive in Crockett City, a small town in the state of Wyoming, to ensure that the referendum concerning the annexation to the United States takes place smoothly. A group of criminals, led by Charles Plummer, tries to sabotage the vote, terrorizing the population. Plummer's men kill Bridger and Tripton finds himself fighting alone. To stop them, he devises a trap: he sends Plummer a false telegram about the capture of some of his men ...
notes: Joseph Kane's film features a predictable plot and the only thing worth noting is the numerous rides. A "routine" western for cowboy John Wayne.

title: Polar Storm
actors: Jack Coleman, Holly Dignard, Tyler Johnston, Terry David Mulligan, Roger R. Cross, David Lewis, Rob Morton, Emma Lahana, Nicholas Carella, Marsha Regis
description: The comet named by scholars "Copernicus" seems to be heading menacingly towards the Earth. Fortunately, scientists' calculations indicate that the celestial body should not collide with the planet, but due to electromagnetic interference the risk of an impact is likely to materialize. A fragment falls on Alaska, thus unleashing a devastating storm that undermines the balance of the planet. The government tries to hide what happened due to the lack of information on the danger. Astrophysicist James Mayfield witnesses the events and together with his wife Cinthya studies the phenomenon and tries to find a solution to the problem. The population is in danger ...

title: Race with the Devil
actors: Peter Fonda, Warren Oates, Loretta Swit, Lara Parker, R.G. Armstrong, Clay Tanner, Carol Blodgett, Phil Hoover, Ricci Ware, Paul A. Partain
description: #Frank, Roger and their wives leave for a campervan holiday, looking for a place to ski. During a stop along the way, they find themselves witnessing a satanic mass that culminates in a ritual murder. When they manage to find the local sheriff, however, it seems that all traces of what happened have disappeared. The need to continue the holiday takes over, but when they resume the journey they find themselves repeatedly subjected to attacks by members of the sect: attacks that they will have to face with their own strength.

title: Traitor
actors: Don Cheadle, Guy Pearce, Said Taghmaoui, Neal McDonough, Alyy Khan, Archie Panjabi, Raad Rawi, Hassam Ghancy, Mozhan Marnò, Adeel Akhtar
description: FBI agent Roy Clayton is investigating an international conspiracy and his main lead leads to a former US Special Forces officer, Samir Horn. He has mysterious links with a terrorist network and always seems to be one step ahead of the investigation. Clayton also has to work with a CIA agent, Carter, who seems to have ulterior motives.
notes: Spying action that tackles the issue of terrorism with an approach halfway between a deep look at the _Syriana_ complex and the adrenaline-fueled simplifications of _24_. The result is a botched product that does not completely satisfy, yet not stupid or too improbable and supported by good interpretations.

title: Predators
actors: Adrien Brody, Alice Braga, Topher Grace, Laurence Fishburne, Danny Trejo, Walton Goggins, Oleg Taktarov, Mahershala Ali, Louis Ozawa Changchien, Derek Mears, Brian Steele, Carey Jones
description: A group of mercenary assassins, Yakuza members and inmates, selected for their ability to kill in cold blood, are brought to a hostile planet. Once they arrive at their destination, they realize that they have been kidnapped and chosen as prey for a new breed of alien predators. The "human predators" will have to rely on their knowledge and skills in an extreme battle for survival.
notes: A cinema made up of ideas and characters that, by coming into contact with a dry and artifice-free direction, produces tension and fun. Antal returns to the charge with a muscular and multi-layered film. Full of possible transversal readings, _Predators_ looks more like a 70s movie than a current blockbuster.

title: Rock Monster
actors: Chad Collins, Natalie Denise Sperl, Alicia Lagano, David Figlioli, Jon Polito, Harry Anichkin, Niki Iliev
description: Jason, an American student, receives a letter: a distant relative, whom he did not know, died leaving him a house in Great Britain. Together with three friends, Jason decides to leave for Europe. But the bus has an accident and the four friends find themselves in a small village lost in the woods. Here the boys come across an ancient sword stuck in a rock. They try to extract it: only Jason can do it without any effort. Upon arrival in the city, friends discover the mystery: in doing so, Jason has freed a monstrous creature that has remained imprisoned for centuries by a magical spell: only he will be able to defeat him using that very same sword ...

title: Machete
actors: Danny Trejo, Michelle Rodriguez, Jessica Alba, Robert De Niro, Lindsay Lohan, Cheech Marin, Jeff Fahey, Steven Seagal, Don Johnson, Cheryl Chin, Shea Whigham, Daryl Sabara, Gilbert Trejo, Ara Celi, Tom Savini, Billy Blair
description: Machete (Danny Trejo), a former member of the Mexican Federal Police, is now a mercenary who roams the streets of Texas. Reluctantly, Machete is hired by Dr. Benz (Jeff Fahey) to assassinate McLaughlin (Robert de Niro), a corrupt senator, a staunch supporter of anti-immigration policies that would eventually drive large numbers of Mexicans out of the US state. When Machete takes action, however, he discovers that he has been tricked and involved in a trap. He will try to get out of it with the help of some old and new friends: Luz (Michelle Rodriguez), Father Benito del Toro (Cheech Marin), and April (Lindsay Lohan).
notes: Machete should be taken for what it is: a slob, excessive and above all, this is the beautiful, incorrect and not at all glossy. Although the dialogues of De Niro, Jeff Fahey and Johnson seem written by Rush Limbaugh or Sarah Palin, whoever wants to see something political is wrong, because of certain issues (border and immigration) instead taken as a pretext only to mess. Machete's sense is Danny Trejo, dangling from a building attached to the guts of a gutted villain. The rest are chatter (and distinctive).

title: Jonah Hex
actors: Josh Brolin, John Malkovich, Megan Fox, Michael Shannon, Michael Fassbender, Will Arnett, Lance Reddick, John Gallagher Jr., Tom Wopat, Wes Bentley, Julia Jones
description: Based on the comic book of the same name published in 1972 by DC Comics, it tells the bloody story of Jonah Hex (Josh Brolin), a scarred-faced wanderer and bounty hunter with a past shrouded in legend. His past will inexorably resurface when fate (and the Law) lead him to collide with dangerous terrorist Quentin Turnbull (John Malkovich).

title: Subspecies
actors: Angus Scrimm, Anders Hove, Irina Movila, Laura Mae Tate, Michelle McBride, Ivan J. Rado, Mara Grigore, Adrian Vâlcu, Michael Watson, Lili Dumitrescu
description: Three young American researchers travel to Transylvania to study some remnants of local folklore that celebrate ancient and legendary episodes according to which vampires have saved citizenship from the Turks. Unfortunately for them, they will discover that the legends all have a foundation of absolute truth, and that if there are "friendly" vampires, like Stefan, there are also absolutely evil vampires, like Radu.

title: MegaFault
actors: Brittany Murphy, Eriq La Salle, Justin Hartley, Bruce Davison, Paul Logan, Jack P. Downing, Miranda Schwein, Jessica Stratton, Sarah Garvey, Jeff Ashcroft
description: In a remote area of ??West Virginia, miner Charley "Boomer" Baxter is conducting a survey of a quarry. After detonating a significant amount of TNT, a huge earthquake devastates the entire area. A few hours later, Dr. Amy Lane, who works as a seismologist for the government, detects the epicenter of the earthquake: with great surprise she discovers that the first quake has opened a deep fault in the earth's crust, directed towards the center of North America. Amy and Boomer will only have 24 hours to try to avoid a catastrophe of apocalyptic dimensions.
notes: Opera of a catastrophic genre, one of the last appearances of the late Brittany Murphy.

title: Love Comes Softly
actors: Katherine Heigl, Dale Midkiff, Skye McCole Bartusiak, Corbin Bernsen, Theresa Russell, Oliver Macready, Tiffany Amber Knight, Adam Loeffler, Nick Scoggin, Jaimz Woolvett
description: Marty and Aaron are a newlywed couple who have recently moved to the Wild West. When he dies, following a tragic accident, Marty finds herself alone and desperate. He thus accepts to settle in the home of Clarck Davis, who was also a widower. In return, she will teach her daughter Missie.

title: In Her Line of Fire
actors: Mariel Hemingway, David Keith, Jill Bennett, David Millbern, Robbie Magasiva, Stuart Devenie, James Gaylyn, Alison Hofer, Paul Dzenkiw, Jesse Hutch
description: The US vice president's plane crashes on an island: the survivors are a journalist, a secret agent and the politician himself. While waiting for the arrival of a rescue ship, the three are captured by a group of local rebels, who take the opportunity to ask for a very special ransom ...

title: Minutemen
actors: Jason Dolley, Luke Benward, Nicholas Braun, Chelsea Staub, Steven R. McQueen, Kara Crane, Dexter Darden, J.P. Manoux, James Jamison, Jason Tatom
description: Charlie, Zeke and Virgil are three high schoolers fed up with being humiliated by hateful peers. To take revenge, they decide to build a time machine that will soon prove to be a double-edged sword. The ingenious invention will cause them endless trouble, throwing them into mind-blowing adventures.

title: The Ward
actors: Lyndsy Fonseca, Amber Heard, Danielle Panabaker, Mika Boorem, Mamie Gummer, Jared Harris, Sydney Sweeney, Laura-Leigh, Milos Milicevic, Sean Cook
description: Young Kristen (Amber Heard) finds herself isolated in a remote ward of a psychiatric hospital, where she undergoes unorthodox treatment. Why she is there is a mystery to herself, as she seems prey to total amnesia about her previous life. All he knows is that it is not safe and that the place hides mysteries and oddities. Gradually the other four girls locked up with her disappear ...
notes: Multiple personalities, childhood trauma, nighttime suspense, nothing is missing, including an expected ending. To appreciate The Ward it is therefore necessary to abstract from the story, even from the trend of psychopathic horror, to let oneself be accompanied by the gaze, once again powerful. A film of pure direction, starting from the trademark of the first sequence, splendid and surgically Carpenterian, to then continue with a Fullerian journey through the meanders of a crazy mind, whose distorted vision coincides with that of the thing seen, of cinema. A film of only primordial perceptions that succeeds in the most difficult task: to create suspense even where you expect it.

title: The Condemned
actors: Steve Austin, Vinnie Jones, Robert Mammone, Tory Mussett, Manu Bennett, Madeleine West, Rick Hoffman, Christopher Baker, Sam Healy, Luke Pegler
description: An unscrupulous television producer decides to organize an extreme reality show in which, on a desert island in Papua New Guinea, ten death row inmates taken from prisons in Third World countries will have to fight each other to the death to gain safety and freedom. . All of this, of course, will be broadcast live on the internet. Among those chosen for the island is Jack Conrad (Steve Austin), a former member of the US special forces, arrested in El Salvador and sentenced to death for blowing up a building. Jack now has only one goal - to stay alive - and to succeed he will not have to use any mercy or scruple.

title: The Storm
actors: James Van Der Beek, Luke Perry, Teri Polo, Treat Williams, David James Elliott, Marisol Nichols, Erin Chambers, Rebeka Montoya, Tony Nevada, Rich Sommer, Ella Thomas
description: The millionaire Robert Terrell has an obsessive interest in technology capable of influencing weather phenomena and for this he founded a real experimental research institute. During an experiment, an explosion of energy occurs that hits the Earth's ionosphere, causing a series of catastrophic atmospheric events. And this will be only the beginning, because in a short time the situation precipitates and saving oneself becomes an enterprise bordering on the impossible. But Terrell is ready to do anything to reverse the effects of the impending natural disaster.
notes: A television film with a Treat Williams bordering on feasible, more embarrassed than in other cases.

title: Love Takes Wing
actors: Erin Cottrell, Patrick Duffy, Haylie Duff, John Bishop, Lou Diamond Phillips, Yvonne Boismier Phillips, Jordan Bridges, June Angela, Annalise Basso, Jonathon Forrester, Andy Scott Harris
description: Shocked by her husband's recent death, Dr. Belinda Simpson moves to the town of Sikeston to become its doctor. As soon as she arrives, she discovers that some of the inhabitants, including many children from the orphanage run by Miss Clarence, have fallen ill or have died from an unknown and terrible disease. Belinda is committed to finding out what it is by relying on her experience, but the inhabitants of Sikeston do not trust her abilities as a doctor, especially because she is a woman, and they believe that it is the little orphans who spread the contagion of the disease.

title: Extreme Days
actors: Dante Basco, Ryan Browning, A.J. Buckley, Derek Hamilton, Cassidy Rae, Chao Li Chi, Virginia Montero, Dylan Bond, Cameron Clark, Scott Fisher
description: Will, Bryan, Matt and Corey are four friends united by an unbridled passion for surfing and extreme sports. At the news of Corey's grandfather's death, they decide to leave to collect the inheritance. They meet Jessie, Matt's beautiful cousin, with whom they begin a journey full of strong emotions.

title: I Spit on Your Grave
actors: Sarah Butler, Chad Lindberg, Daniel Franzese, Rodney Eastman, Jeff Branson, Saxon Sharbino, Amber Dawn Landrum, Tracey Walter, Andrew Howard, Mollie Milligan
description: The beautiful writer Jennifer Hills (Sarah Butler) decides to devote herself to her new novel in the quiet of a cabin in the woods. Some locals decide to scare her but what was supposed to be just a bad joke soon turns into an escalation of violence and perversion. Remake of _Non rapentate Jennifer_, a 1978 horror film directed by Meir Zarchi.

title: Love Finds a Home
actors: Haylie Duff, Sarah Jones, Jordan Bridges, Patty Duke, Courtney Halverson, Michael Trevino, Jeffrey Muller, Dahlia Salem, Thomas Kopache, Chad W. Smathers
description: Dr. Annie Watson recently found out she was pregnant. Since her husband is forced to leave her alone due to a series of work commitments, Annie decides to move to her friend Belinda's house. After communicating the news of the pregnancy to her mother-in-law, Annie begins a personal process that will lead her to contrast her scientific reasons with the principles of popular wisdom in which the old lady believes.
notes: For a sentimental TV movie with a western setting, _L'amore finds home_ fits comfortably into the average, although it is a set of banal ideas and stereotyped characters, "enriched" by a mediocre script and poor interpretations.

title: 2012 Doomsday
actors: Cliff De Young, Dale Midkiff, Ami Dolenz, Danae Nason, Joshua Lee, Sara Tomko, Caroline Amiguet, Shirley Raun, Louis Graham, Jonathan Nation
description: December 21, 2012. On the day when, according to the Maya, the end of the world will come, NASA scientists in Houston detect that a catastrophic reversal of the Earth's poles is now imminent. Meanwhile, in Mexico, some faithful are on pilgrimage near a thousand-year-old temple. Among these is Dr. Richards who, after discovering a golden crucifix, claims that some Christians lived in America before the advent of Columbus. Each of them will try to find out what secret the mysterious pyramid hides, but the truth will be revealed only at the moment of the final judgment.
notes: Apocalyptic catastrophism of the worst kind, with a senseless plot and special effects in the style of the 80s.

title: The Andromeda Strain
actors: Benjamin Bratt, Eric McCormack, Christa Miller, Daniel Dae Kim, Christa Miller, Daniel Dae Kim, Viola Davis
description: A US government satellite falls near a small town in Utah. The inhabitants open it and an alien microorganism emerges from it that will cause a devastating epidemic.
notes: Sci-fi miniseries, merged into a single film, inspired by the novel of the same name by Michael Crichton.

title: The Lost World
actors: Wallace Beery, Bessie Love, Lewis Stone, Lloyd Hughes, Alma Bennett, Arthur Hoyt, Margaret McWade, Bull Montana, Frank Finch Smiles, Jules Cowles
description: In a plateau in Venezuela, the travel diary of the explorer Maple White is found, depicting some sketches of prehistoric animals, which would prove, according to the eccentric Professor Challenger, how dinosaurs still exist on Earth. The reporter Edward Malone, together with the famous hunter John Roxton and a group of adventurers, organize a mission to Latin America with the intent of uncovering the existence of the ancient creatures.
notes: First film adaptation of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's classic, especially for the quality of the special effects - to recreate the movements of dinosaurs the stop motion technique was used - really surprising for the time.

title: Meek's Cutoff
actors: Michelle Williams, Paul Dano, Bruce Greenwood, Shirley Henderson, Will Patton, Zoe Kazan, Neal Huff, Tommy Nelson, Rod Rondeaux
description: 1845, at the beginning of the Oregon Trail era. A three-family caravan on pioneer wagons hired a highlander, Stephen Meek, to drive it to the Cascade Mountains. Claiming to know a shortcut, Meek leads the group on an unmarked path through the desert plateau and then gets lost among the sage and arid rocks. In the following days, the emigrants found themselves suffering from hunger, thirst and a lack of confidence in the survival instinct of their traveling companions. When a wandering Indian crosses their path, emigrants are torn between trusting a guide who has proven unreliable and a man who has always been regarded as the natural enemy.

title: The Devil's Tomb
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Valerie Cruz, Ron Perlman, Weston Blakesley, Taryn Manning, Franky G, Zack Ward, Henry Rollins, Jason London, Stephanie Jacobsen, Brandon Fobbs
description: A select group of mercenaries, under the command of war veteran Mack, connects with Elissa, a charming CIA agent, determined to help a scientist working on an archaeological discovery hidden beneath the surface of the Middle Eastern desert. With the help of a mysterious priest, Mack and his team uncover the secret hidden among the immense sandbanks. A terrible truth that has been hidden for thousands of years, and that does not belong to this world.
notes: Cuba Gooding Jr. (Oscar for _Jerry Maguire_), very little credible in the role of veteran Mack, fails to revive the fortunes of this boring, unlikely and banal sci-fi horror.

title: Devil
actors: Logan Marshall-Green, Bojana Novakovic, Geoffrey Arend, Chris Messina, Caroline Dhavernas, Jacob Vargas, Bokeem Woodbine, Matt Craven, Jenny O'Hara, Kim Roberts
description: During an ordinary working day, a group of people are trapped in an elevator located between the offices of a building. But what appeared to be just a technical accident turns out to have a far more chilling reason: the devil has sneaked in between them. Suspecting each other, they will each try to get out of the elevator unscathed.
notes: Direction and editing are saved, avoiding minimalist and real-time fashion (Buried and Paranormal Activity) by alternating the inside of the elevator with the policeman's rides. However, the most important things are missing, namely the characters and a real mystery that is not solved in a dull and even reassuring way. The exact opposite of what is asked of a film called Devil.

title: Red
actors: Bruce Willis, Mary-Louise Parker, Morgan Freeman, Ernest Borgnine, Richard Dreyfuss, Karl Urban, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Brian Cox, Julian McMahon, Rebecca Pidgeon
description: Frank (Bruce Willis), Joe (Morgan Freeman), Marvin (John Malkovich) and Victoria (Helen Mirren), former CIA members, hold some secret information that the powerful spy agency considers dangerous. Relying on their best qualities (experience, cunning and teamwork) they will try to escape the numerous attacks and uncover one of the greatest conspiracies in the history of the United States.
notes: Compared to Stallone's mercenaries (hired by Willis himself, curiously), the Reds take themselves less seriously and are less forced; it is surprising that everyone regrets the Cold War, grumbling that it was better when it was worse like the classic four pensioners, half poisoned, at the table.

title: Solstice
actors: Elisabeth Harnois, Shawn Ashmore, Hilarie Burton, Amanda Seyfried, Tyler Hoechlin, Matt O'Leary, R. Lee Ermey, Lisa Arnold, Lyle Brocato, David Dahlgren
description: A girl learns of a secret concerning her twin sister, who committed suicide a few months earlier.

title: My Soul to Take
actors: Max Thieriot, Frank Grillo, Emily Meade, Denzel Whitaker, Zena Grey, Nick Lashaway, Jessica Hecht, Dennis Boutsikaris, Shareeka Epps, Trevor St. John
description: In the town of Riverton, legend has it that a serial killer will return to kill the seven people who were born on the day his assassination career was cut short. 16 years later the disappearances start again and the only one who knows the truth seems to be Adam Heller, one of the seven boys sentenced.

title: Skyline
actors: Eric Balfour, Scottie Thompson, David Zayas, Donald Faison, Brittany Daniel, Crystal Reed, Neil Hopkins, J. Paul Boehmer, Tanya Newbould, Pam Levin
description: In the middle of the night, after a party, a group of friends are awakened by a disturbing light which, like a flame does with moths, attracts people to the garden and makes them disappear into thin air. They will soon discover that an alien force is engulfing the entire human population. The survivors will find themselves struggling to stay alive.

title: Unstoppable
actors: Denzel Washington, Chris Pine, Rosario Dawson, Ethan Suplee, Jessy Schram, Kevin Dunn, Elizabeth Mathis, Kevin Chapman, David Warshofsky, Eric Unger
description: Frank is a railway engineer, and along with his young colleague Will, he finds himself caught up in the maddening runaway of a train loaded with toxic chemicals. The situation becomes more tense when the train finds itself crossing a series of inhabited centers, overwhelming everything.
notes: Symbol of the aestheticizing cinema of the 80s, Tony Scott perversely risks rising to the rank of classic in spite of himself. And what once seemed like cinema to be countered, today, in its blatant (and indefensible?) Inactivity, instead takes on the contours of a paradoxical and stubborn authorial politics.

title: Sucker Punch
actors: Emily Browning, Abbie Cornish, Jena Malone, Vanessa Hudgens, Jamie Chung, Carla Gugino, Jon Hamm, Oscar Isaac, Scott Glenn, Vicky Lambert
description: Baby Doll (Emily Browning) has been locked up in an asylum by her evil stepfather, and is in danger of being lobotomized. To defend herself from the pain of the treatments, the young woman creates an imaginary reality that she shares with her four roommates. In this alternate world, the five girls will have to go on missions to suggest a man who wants to harm them.
notes: Zack Snyder, like a Baz Luhrmann of the digital action movie, dreams of the total work of art, but conceives it as the mere sum of a thousand contrasting elements raised to the nth degree. The main interest of the film therefore lies precisely in the cosmetics of the codes that transform Japanese Z series such as Chanbara Beauty (or Hong Kong classics such as Heroic Trio) into a vaguely fetish emo happening that dreams of the cinema that once was.

title: Meteor Storm
actors: Michael Trucco, Kari Matchett, Kirsten Prout, Brett Dier, Eric Johnson, Kevin McNulty, Lara Gilchrist, Travis Nelson, Emily Holmes, Viv Leacock
description: San Francisco residents prepare to witness what promises to be a spectacular meteor shower. Among the eagerly awaited viewers is astrophysicist Michelle Young, who hopes to enjoy the show in the company of her husband Tom and children Kara and Jason. But even the scientist finds herself unprepared when the meteorites, due to the too close to the earth of the comet from which they come, begin to fall en masse on the city ...
notes: An excellent example of a catrastrophic film capable of tracing, slavishly and without the slightest trace of irony, all the worst clichés of the genre. Not even the Michael Trucco of _Battlestar Galactica_ can save itself from the disaster.

title: The Walking Hills
actors: Randolph Scott, Ella Raines, William Bishop, Edgar Buchanan, Arthur Kennedy, John Ireland, Jerome Courtland, Josh White
description: While working on a murder case, private detective Frazee follows a suspect to the table for a game of poker. When one of the players reveals that they know the place where a lost railroad car with its cargo of gold should be buried, the players agree to form a desert expedition and track down the wagon. But the heat, the sand and the revelation of personal secrets are obstacles that intertwine and risk putting not only research into play, but also the life of the participants.

title: The Tracker
actors: Casper Van Dien, Françoise Robertson, Russell Wong, Jason Blicker, Lexa Doig, Brett Watson, George Chiang, Alan Fawcett, Zenhu Han, Oleg Kisseliov
description: Detective Spears learns that his ex-girlfriend has been kidnapped. He doesn't want to get involved, but the feelings he still has for the girl convince him to intervene. From Los Angeles he went to New York and found himself in the middle of a war between the Russian and Chinese mafia ...

title: The Roommate
actors: Aly Michalka, Cam Gigandet, Leighton Meester, Matt Lanter, Minka Kelly, Billy Zane, Danneel Harris, Katerina Graham, Frances Fisher, Lauren Storm
description: When Sara is faced with her unprecedented college experience, all her insecurities come out. To worsen the fate of the poor freshman is also added his roommate, Rebecca, a girl with very unorthodox behaviors.
notes: Known and unpretentious horror.

title: I Am Number Four
actors: Dianna Agron, Timothy Olyphant, Kevin Durand, Alex Pettyfer, Teresa Palmer, Jake Abel, Beau Mirchoff, Callan McAuliffe, Emily Wickersham, Monica Ciszczon
description: The extraordinary teenager John Smith is on the run from a group of ruthless enemies, on his trail to destroy him. The boy changes identity, moving from city to city in the company of his guardian (Timothy Olyphant), without being able to maintain ties with his dark past. When he finds himself in a small town in Ohio, everything seems to change: here he finds his first love and learns of powers and abilities, as well as meeting others who share his same incredible destiny.
notes: The number 4 Pettyfer, non-human lineage and with extraordinary powers as much as its expressive fixity, does not thrill us. On the contrary, we hope he ends up with the top three.

title: Priest
actors: Paul Bettany, Cam Gigandet, Maggie Q, Karl Urban, Lily Collins, Stephen Moyer, Mädchen Amick, Christopher Plummer, Brad Dourif, Bill Oberst Jr.
description: In an alternate, post-apocalyptic world ravaged by centuries and centuries of battles between men and vampires, a legendary warrior priest, hero of the last great war against bloodsuckers, lives in the darkness of a dystopian and oppressive walled city dominated by the church. When his niece is kidnapped by a group of bloody vampires, the priest breaks her sacred vows and goes in search of the girl before she is inevitably transformed.
notes: Priest is set in a world halfway between Mad Max, Underworld and Blade Runner, where the cities are called Cathedral City and Jericho, humans and vampires have killed each other for centuries and to make a difference, in a global war, are absurdly a handful of ninja superpersons. The result is a western, horror, sci-fi all action meatloaf, between vampire lairs and train assaults, where a certain B-series spirit is maintained despite the $ 60 million budget, computer graphics and post-product 3D

title: The Warrior's Way
actors: Kate Bosworth, Geoffrey Rush, Danny Huston, Dong-gun Jang, Tony Cox, David Austin, Matt Gillanders, Kathleen LaGue, Nic Sampson, Ashley Jones
description: The story of Yang, an Asian warrior who is forced to hide in a small town in the middle of the US badlands. Here he meets the local drunk, Ron (Geoffrey Rush), and a knife thrower Lynne (Kate Bosworth) who works in the local circus. Yang seems to finally find peace, happiness and love. But the ghosts of the past also reach him in the American far west.

title: True Grit
actors: Matt Damon, Josh Brolin, Jeff Bridges, Barry Pepper, Hailee Steinfeld, Domhnall Gleeson, Elizabeth Marvel, Ed Corbin, Paul Rae, Nicholas Sadler
description: 14-year-old Mattie Ross is on the trail of Tom Chaney, the hired killer who murdered her father. To find him, the girl hires the toughest of the sheriffs she can find, Reuben J. "Rooster" Cogburn, and insists on following him in the manhunt among the Indian territories. They are joined by Texas Ranger LaBoeuf.
notes: The Coens choose a young protagonist, with Protestant zeal and fully democratic discernment, whose companions in adventure represent the anarchist and republican spirit. In their separation and reunion, a three-way marriage is celebrated between the souls of America. Flashes of humor - often black -, encounters bordering on the surreal and subtle quotes.

title: Born to Raise Hell
actors: Steven Seagal, Dan Badarau, Darren Shahlavi, D. Neil Mark, George Remes, Claudiu Bleont, Calin Puia, Cosmina Pasarin, Alexandra Coman, Irina Antonie
description: Bobby, a very tough Interpol agent, is assigned to a task force in Eastern Europe with the aim of stopping a criminal organization that traffics women and drugs in the Balkans. During the investigation, his team finds themselves in the midst of a bloody feud between a gypsy gang and a group of Russian arms dealers, and one of the agents is killed. Eager for revenge, Bobby prepares to raise hell ...
notes: Steven Seagal provides yet another, masterfully impassive (motionless) interpretation and also puts his hand to the script of this technically at times embarrassing film, stuffed with the usual massive dose of vulgar action, a lot per kilo.

title: Hatchet II
actors: Danielle Harris, Tony Todd, Kane Hodder, Parry Shen, Tom Holland (II), R.A. Mihailoff, AJ Bowen, Alexis Peters, Ed Ackerman, David Foy
description: Marybeth manages to escape from the clutches of the deformed, terrible murderer Victor Crowley through the swamps that the latter haunts. After learning of the connections between her family and the insane killer who kills by brandishing a hatchet, the girl returns to the swamps of Louisiana from which she fled in the company of an army of hunters to recover the bodies of the family and obtain bloody revenge possible.

title: Super
actors: Rainn Wilson, Ellen Page, Liv Tyler, Kevin Bacon, Gregg Henry, Michael Rooker, Andre Royo, Sean Gunn, Stephen Blackehart, Linda Cardellini, Nathan Fillion
description: Frank is like many others, clumsy and mistreated by life. But when his wife leaves him to hook up with a drug dealer, Frank decides to become a superhero, at war with the bad guys. At his side a special ally: the saleswoman of a comic shop.
notes: Gunn knows how to stage a madness with an artisan flavor, far from the cartoon and digital security of the Hollywood patina and crossed by flashes of hyperviolence. The grotesque splatter fun, however, is only one layer, under which lies a sore melon, which in the end will risk breaking your heart.

title: The Satan Bug
actors: George Maharis, Richard Basehart, Anne Francis, Dana Andrews, John Larkin, Richard Bull, Frank Sutton, Edward Asner, Simon Oakland, John Anderson
description: Two deadly viruses, including Botox Satan, are stolen from a top secret laboratory (Station 3), built by the United States government in the California desert. The suspicions fall on an eccentric billionaire who, in exchange for the return of the stolen goods, demands the interruption of all experiments on biological weapons, under penalty of the release of the viruses on Los Angeles. An espionage agent, previously suspended due to insubordination, is put on the trail of the terrorist.
notes: The indolent script repeatedly makes the suspension of disbelief dangerously shake. But a solid cast of character actors and Sturges' good staging are enough to save the film

title: Gulliver's Travels
actors: Jack Black, Jason Segel, Emily Blunt, Amanda Peet, Billy Connolly, Chris O'Dowd, T.J. Miller, James Corden, Catherine Tate, Emmanuel Quatra
description: Lemuel Gulliver is a simple delivery boy who works for a large newspaper. He is a man devoid of enthusiasm, impetus and courage, and feels condemned to a life devoid of everything it takes to truly feel alive, including love. The opportunity of his life presents itself to him when he is given the opportunity to write a reportage from the Bermuda Triangle, where however he will not arrive: a vortex will in fact catapult him on an island accustomed to very small men, making him suddenly a giant. A position he will take advantage of, feeling important for the first time in his life.
notes: Neither laugh nor have fun, the presence of 3D is unjustified, and the film could earn the award for worst live action of our time. Yet the curiosity remains to see it in the original version. In our local one, the Lilliputians speak an unlikely Emilian-like dialect. Mystery and coup de grace.

title: Insanitarium
actors: Jesse Metcalfe, Kiele Sanchez, Peter Stormare, Kevin Sussman, Evan Parke, Olivia Munn, Carla Gallo, Armin Shimerman, Lisa Arturo, Kurt Caceres
description: Lili, a young woman traumatized by her mother's death tries to commit suicide but is rescued and locked up in a psychiatric hospital. since he has been there, however, his brother, Jack, has no longer been able to hear from him. Extremely worried about his sister's fate, he therefore decides to pretend to be mad to be locked up himself in the same hospital. Jack will discover that Dr. Gianetti conducts deadly experiments on patients, testing a drug capable of breaking down their defenses and transforming them into very dangerous killers, with results that, at a certain point, will get out of control.

title: The Skeptic
actors: Tim Daly, Tom Arnold, Zoë Saldana, Edward Herrmann, Andrea Roth, Robert Prosky, Bruce Altman, Reila Aphrodite, Lea Coco, Sara Weaver
description: Attorney Bryan Becket lives his life with cold detachment. Nothing and no one can upset him, not even his wife, who asks him for more time and effort in their relationship. But when the greedy and elderly aunt mysteriously dies, Bryan (skeptical of anything to do with religion and the supernatural) decides to move into the deceased's home, discovering it is haunted. He will therefore have to resort to the advice of a professor of paranormal phenomena and a beautiful and young medium ...
notes: Small ghost film, made independently, but which fails to mask the paucity of means with the right amount of tension to make fear grow. A wasted opportunity.

title: Hangman's Curse
actors: David Keith, Mel Harris, Leighton Meester, Douglas Smith, Jake Richardson, Bobby Brewer, Daniel Farber, Edwin Hodge, Andrea Morris, William R. Moses
description: Some bullies from the American Rogers High School are struck by a mysterious and fatal disease, which makes them obsessed with a ghost whose name they scream. Disease, drug or supernatural? The boys' only hope of salvation is in the Veritas Project team of undercover specialists.

title: Shelter
actors: Julianne Moore, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Jeffrey DeMunn, Frances Conroy, Nathan Corddry, Brooklynn Proulx, Brian Anthony Wilson, Joyce Hurring, Steven Rishard, Charles Techman
description: A criminologist discovers that the multiple personalities embodied by one of her patients all have one point in common: they are all victims of murder without distinction. Starting from this observation, he will soon realize that what appeared to be an interesting psychiatric case actually hides something else.
notes: The film marks the US debut of directors Mårlind & Stein, former authors of TV series in Sweden. In their hands they have a botched script, which mixes psychiatry with religion, reincarnation with multiple personalities and voodoo with cold mountains with impunity. of Pennsylvania.

title: The Rig
actors: Serah D'Laine, William Forsythe, Art LaFleur, Scott Martin, Marcus T. Paulk, Stacey Hinnen, Carmen Perez, Dan Benson, Jacob Bruce, Robert Zachar
description: As a violent storm rages, a small oil company finds shelter on a platform on the high seas. Isolated on the platform and with no way out, the members of the company soon find themselves having to deal with the sudden and mysterious disappearance of one of them. The group discovers that they have invaded the habitat of a monstrous creature of the abyss.
notes: A low-budget production that aims to revive a classic vision of horror cinema. But the naïveté of the operation often turns into a feeling of I wish but I cannot (see the laughable special effects). And good will does not serve to make up for the total absence of rhythm.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
actors: Michelle Rodriguez, Cory Hardrict, Bridget Moynahan, Aaron Eckhart, Lucas Till, Joey King, Michael Peña, Claudia Wells, Noel Fisher, Jim Parrack
description: For years all over the world there have been sightings of unidentified flying objects. In 2011, however, what were mere visual contacts become a terrible reality, with the entire planet attacked by unknown forces determined to destroy everything. And as big cities fall one by one, Los Angeles becomes the last bastion of humanity.
notes: In addition to being reactionary as a sort of Starship Troopers without irony, World Invasion is shot with a shaky, fake-documentary direct take. In short, like Cloverfield, but with the added excitement of repetitive firefights from third-rate video games. The pretensions of realism are also nullified by increasingly rhetorical battles and by the growing volume of the pompous musical commentary. Too bad to find Rodríguez and Eckart in such a fascist film.

title: Cowboys & Aliens
actors: Olivia Wilde, Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Sam Rockwell, Paul Dano, Ana de la Reguera, Noah Ringer, Clancy Brown, Keith Carradine, Walton Goggins
