description: 1873. Arizona. A stranger (Craig) with no memory of his past arrives in Absolution, a not hospitable town in the middle of the desert, where Colonel Dolarhyde (Ford) makes good and bad weather. What is about to happen, however, is beyond all imagination; a series of attacks from the sky on the works of unknown creatures that kidnap the defenseless inhabitants one by one. The stranger who was received with such distrust seems to become the only hope for the locals, also because he slowly begins to remember who he is and what the secret he carries with him. With the help of his former opponents, a group of Apache warriors and even some outlaws, he will form a gang ready to face that unknown and unprecedented enemy.
notes: The irony on genres (s) is very weak and watered down in an exhausting nothing. It is clear that Favreau has seen Leone and the Coens, Eastwood and Harris, who loves B movies (at one point we are also afraid of seeing Totò and Maciste fighting the aliens) and John Ford: the point is that either he understood them very little or they weren't enough to digest this unlikely Hollywood meatloaf. In politically correct America, cowboys and aliens come together thanks to a half-breed and the alien is the ideal enemy because he has no race (and here not even a face). In short, everything is decided at the table. And Favreau did not have the courage, the strength, the desire to overthrow him.

title: Super 8
actors: Elle Fanning, Kyle Chandler, AJ Michalka, Noah Emmerich, Ron Eldard, Gabriel Basso, Zach Mills, Ryan Lee, Beau Knapp, Joel Courtney, Riley Griffiths, Jessica Tuck, Glynn Turman, David Gallagher, Brett Rice, Bruce Greenwood, Dale Dickey, Teri Clark, Jason Brooks
description: Ohio, 1979. Joe is a boy of about ten who is passionate about the possibilities offered to him by a small super 8 camera, to the point that he and his friends have formed an improvised crew to make a film. During one of the shots, the group witnesses a disastrous accident that leads a train to derail and after which it seems that something abnormal is escaping from the train. From that moment everything in the surrounding area takes a strange turn and the inexplicable events are more and more numerous and serious
notes: Super 8, a cinephile operation, almost a remake of a never-made work by Steven Spielberg, who lovingly accompanies it as a producer. Director J.J. Abrams exhibits from the first shot to the last the debt to New Hollywood and its idol who called on Earth the most tender extraterrestrial in space. Abrams may not be Spielberg, but his touch, colors, music are a moving and devoted thanks on behalf of the generation that grew up with the author of Jaws.

title: Faster
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Billy Bob Thornton, Moon Bloodgood, Oliver Jackson-Cohen, Maggie Grace, Tom Berenger, Carla Gugino, Mike Epps, Mauricio Lopez, Jim Gaines, Jan Hoag, Courtney Gains, Michael Irby, Josh Clark, Lester Speight, Jennifer Carpenter, Xander Berkeley
description: A former prisoner goes in search of the men who betrayed his brother, resulting in his death, during a robbery years earlier. In the course of his vengeful mission, an elderly policeman and a self-centered killer come after him.
notes: Less glossy and smashing than usual, Faster tries some awkward emotional foray, inserting the pieces of a cumbersome past and thickening the list of opponents (a policeman - Billy Bob Thornton - a few days after retirement and a hitman - Oliver Jackson-Cohen - with a taste for the art of killing). From hunter to hunt, Dwayne Johnson is too stony to lend himself to the game, he has only one expression, and the admirable attempt to delve into character is lost in the void.

title: Saint Francis
actors: Zalman King, Charles Koutris, Dita Von Teese, Ryan Williams, Casey Anderson, Roxanne Arvizu, Shane Walsh, Christopher Cronin, Benny Ciaramello, Sandy Gardiner
description: Francis, the son of a corrupt TV preacher, gets lost on the streets of San Francisco in a hallucinatory vortex of drugs, sex, aliens and the apocalypse.

title: Deadly Impact
actors: Sean Patrick Flanery, Joe Pantoliano, Amanda Wyss, Carmen Serano, Luce Rains, Greg Serano, John Koyama, David House, Joel Bryant, Christopher Dempsey
description: A ruthless and skilled killer forces Albuquerque detective Tom Armstrong into a veritable spiral of pain for years. Several years later Armstrong finds himself alone in Mexico when the FBI contacts him to let him know that there are traces that would lead to the man who caused him so much suffering. For Detective Armstrong, it's a personal matter: to go back to the United States and hunt down the dangerous killer or stay on the sidelines?
notes: The film essentially boils down to the classic confrontation between an obviously skilled and unscrupulous "villain" and a "good guy" with fairly stereotyped characteristics. Nothing particularly new or original.

title: Game of Death
actors: Wesley Snipes, Zoe Bell, Robert Davi, Gary Daniels, Ele Bardha, Simon Rhee, Vladimir Tevlovski, Ho-Sung Pak, Robert Oppel, Frank Zieger
description: A diplomat's bodyguard and his men are injured in a failed assassination attempt on the politician. After the battle, they are all taken to the same hospital, where the bodyguard will be forced to perform a difficult task: to face five dangerous and unscrupulous killers intent on eliminating the diplomat.
notes: It can be said that Game of Death fails from all points of view: the script is poor, the story trivial, the dialogues embarrassing and, as a corollary, the interpretations of the actors are a concentrate of mediocrity. It doesn't go beyond the action scenes that follow one after the other.

title: Ticking Clock
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Neal McDonough, Nicki Aycox, Austin Abrams, Danielle Nicolet, Yancey Arias, Veronica Berry, Dane Rhodes, Angelena Swords, Monica Acosta
description: Lewis Hicks is a journalist specializing in murder and crime stories. As a reporter, Hicks becomes the protagonist of one of the stories he usually deals with when his girlfriend is brutally murdered. Hicks investigates on his own and manages to find the killer's diary, with a list of the murders committed and a list of intended future victims. Hicks believes he's the only one who can stop the killer before it's too late.
notes: Ernie Barbarash's film is disappointing in every respect. The script is poor, the plot developments too predictable, the dialogues disappointing to say the least and the characters decidedly stereotyped. Mediocre interpretation of Cuba Gooding Jr.

title: Tobor the Great
actors: Charles Drake, Karin Booth, Billy Chapin, Taylor Holmes, Steven Geray, Henry Kulky, Franz Roehn, Hal Baylor
description: 1950s. In full space race, Dr. Ralph Harrison, retired at home, has designed a robot controlled by a sort of brainwave translator that is strategic in scientific research and in the experimentation of space flights. Tobor - as the automaton is renamed, reversing the word robot - soon surpasses all expectations, showing himself suitable for multiple uses and capable of simulating human feelings and emotions. Inevitably Tobor arouses the interest of a great rival power of the USA, which intends to use it for certainly less noble purposes. Secret agents thus kidnap Dr. Harrison along with his nephew Grillo. Tobor, who has developed feelings of deep affection for his creator, must therefore take action to free the two.

title: Skyrunners
actors: Kelly Blatz, Joey Pollari, Conrad Coates, Jacqueline MacInnes Wood, Nathan Stephenson, Kerry Lai Fatt, Linda Kash, Aisha Dee, Andrew Grainger, Kylie Harris
description: 14-year-old Tyler stumbles upon an alien spacecraft which, inexplicably, makes him look older and empowers him by transforming him into a "skyrunner". Kidnapped by aliens, landed on Earth with the intention of invading it, Tyler can only rely on his brother's help.

title: Carnival of Souls
actors: Candace Hilligoss, Frances Feist, Sidney Berger, Art Ellison, Stan Levitt, Tom McGinnis, Forbes Caldwell, Dan Palmquist, Bill de Jarnette, Steve Boozer
description: Mary miraculously survives a car accident. However, in addition to the friends she was traveling with, she loses her memory. He often has nervous breakdowns. She decides to go to work as an organist in a church in Salt Lake City and one day, looking in the mirror, she discovers that a zombie, invisible to the naked eye, is constantly behind her and spying on her.
notes: Cult film in the United States, systematically screened on Halloween nights. The shadow that follows Hilligoss, a pupil of Lee Strasberg, is played by director Herk Harvey himself. The typically gothic tensions are alternated with fabulous moments, in a mixture at the end of which the horror dimension prevails.

title: The Cell 2
actors: Tessie Santiago, Chris Bruno, Frank Whaley, Bart Johnson, Michael Flynn, Amee Walden, Charles Halford, Paul Kiernan, Whitney Labrum, Elizabeth Barondes
description: A serial killer kills his victims and brings them back to life so that, desperate, they beg to die again. Detective Casteneda, who acquired paranormal powers after the coma, will set out on his trail ...
notes: The characterization of the characters is ridiculous, as is the construction of the scenes.

title: 2012: Supernova
actors: Brian Krause, Heather McComb, Najarra Townsend, Allura Lee, Alan Poe, Londale Theus, Stephen Schneider, Rob Ullett, Dana Tomasko, Rick L. Dean
description: In a galaxy not far from earth a star becomes "unstable" and transforms into a Supernova. A scientist devises a desperate plan to protect the Earth from the wave of radiation.
notes: Imitation of blockbusters made with few means and even fewer ideas.

title: Scream 4
actors: David Arquette, Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, Emma Roberts, Hayden Panettiere, Anthony Anderson, Alison Brie, Adam Brody, Rory Culkin, Marielle Jaffe, Marley Shelton, Mary McDonnell
description: It's been ten years since Sidney Prescott left Woodsboro. Sidney, who has now written a book on psychological self-help therapies, is doing a tour of presentations of his text and it is normal for a stop to be where it all began. Thus he finds Sheriff Dewey and Gale, who are now married, as well as cousin Jille and Aunt Kate. Unfortunately, Sideny's return also brings Ghostface back to the scene, plunging the whole town of Woodsboro into a nightmare.
notes: Craven anticipates the criticisms and kills the critics, but the pleasure of seeing those who chatter about cinema killed fades with the passing of (too many) minutes and the moments dedicated to the characters, in a context so over the top, result only in a loss of time. There is no shortage of fun passages, especially for fans, but it doesn't add much to the previous chapters.

title: Drive Angry 3D
actors: Nicolas Cage, Amber Heard, William Fichtner, Billy Burke, David Morse, Todd Farmer, Christa Campbell, Charlotte Ross, Tom Atkins, Jack McGee
description: Milton is a father escaped from hell who has three days and a mission: to find and hunt down the men of a sect who killed his daughter and kidnapped his granddaughter. With him is Piper, a sexy and enterprising waitress, an expert pilot, but both the police and the "Accountant" are on his trail, sent by the Devil to send him back to hell. The race against time, animated by an inextinguishable thirst for revenge, thus turns into a deadly race.
notes: Unfortunately, this cross between Ghost Rider and Fast and Furious deludes itself at the end of finding some pathos, the dialogues are lengthened and the gimmicks leave room for the CGI. You could have cut more and come out better, but there is still something to grin about and, as in Piranha 3D, stereoscopy is used with appropriate brutality. A guilty pleasure of engaging ignorance.

title: Splinter
actors: Charles Baker, Jill Wagner, Paulo Costanzo, Shea Whigham, Rachel Kerbs, Laurel Whitsett
description: Young engaged Polly and Seth decide to take a weekend off by going camping. But their romance is abruptly cut short when a criminal couple, on the run from the police, kidnap them to secure a loophole. The four, however, soon find themselves having to face a much more serious problem: a parasite that attacks and slowly kills its victims. Kidnappers and victims will have to team up to survive ...
notes: Low-cost horror that, while not offering ideas or finding particularly original or noteworthy, is less worse than many others of the same genre. The atmosphere works, but there remains the feeling that underneath there is undeveloped potential.

title: Last Rites
actors: Noel Gugliemi, Howard Alonzo, Ethan Ednee, Ryan King, Dayana Jamine, Enrique Almeida, Danny Martinez, Krissann Shipley, James C. Burns, Stephen Basilone
description: Los Angeles. A meteor falls to earth and transforms a group of homeless people into human flesh-eating zombies. Unaware of what is happening, two drug dealers "at work" in an abandoned warehouse are about to be arrested by the police. The sudden attack of the monstrous creatures, however, upsets everyone's plans. It's just the beginning of a long nightmare night ...
notes: Duane Stinnett packs a zombie movie full of all the clichés of the genre. The film pathetically tries to pay homage to George Romero's films, but it is nothing more than a jumble of mismatched fragments. Mediocre cast, patchy script, and mundane ugly effects complete the picture.

title: Fast Five
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordana Brewster, Elsa Pataky, Tyrese Gibson, Ludacris, Matt Schulze, Sung Kang, Gal Gadot
description: Ex-policeman Brian O'Conner, who has gone over to the side of crime, is now paired with Dom Toretto and has been on the run with him from nation to nation ever since helping him escape controlled freedom. But now they are in Rio de Janeiro and their backs are against the wall: to earn their freedom they will have to do one last job. They then put their team of experienced drivers back on track. On their trail, however, there are various characters, including the feds, led by Luke Hobbs, who unleashes his team on the heels of the two.
notes: Surreal, impossible, very fast, muscular like the previous ones (indeed: more, given the presence of Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson), it does not disappoint its fans and doubles, also addressing those who have a passion for heist movies (movies of robbery), of which Fast & Furious 5 respects every step (recruitment, theft and escape). Devastations, pectorals and booze. Forget the expressions, this is pure million dollar show, doomed to do many more at the box office. The penultimate managed to earn over 350.

title: Real Steel
actors: Hugh Jackman, Kevin Durand, Evangeline Lilly, Anthony Mackie, Hope Davis, Phil LaMarr, Antoinette Nikprelaj, James Rebhorn, Karl Yune, Dakota Goyo
description: In a future where boxing among robots is a popular sport, a fight promoter (Jackman) believes he has found a true champion in a robot that has been discarded. As she works to take him, victory after victory, to the most prestigious matches, she will discover that she has an 11-year-old son who wishes to meet his father.
notes: Between Rocky and Over the Top in a sci-fi key, Real Steel is a modern fairy tale that you can love, both because there is real violence to scare (the beating between robots allows more cruelty even in Disney films and the invasion of the public remembers the AI ​​Meat Fair (Artificial Intelligence) and for the largely profuse irony, with self-referential winks on how well children work with the public.

title: The New Daughter
actors: Kevin Costner, Ivana Baquero, Samantha Mathis, Gattlin Griffith, Erik Palladino, Noah Taylor, James Gammon, Sandra Ellis Lafferty, Margaret Anne Florence, Christopher Harvey
description: John James, a recently divorced writer by profession, decides to move to the small town of Mercy in South Carolina to try to cut ties with his past life. John brings with him his two children, little Sam and teenager Louisa. There the girl begins to manifest behavioral disturbances and discomfort far removed from normal adolescent crises. It will be up to John to try to understand the origin of his daughter's disturbing change.
notes: Berdejo is responsible for the _Rec_ and _Quarantena_ scripts, but as a director he is unable to make the narrative clichés he works on credible, risking frequently falling into involuntary self-parody. Costner is the emblem of miscasting.

title: Dead & Buried
actors: James Farentino, Melody Anderson, Jack Albertson, Dennis Redfield, Nancy Locke, Lisa Blount, Robert Englund, Bill Quinn, Michael Currie, Christopher Allport
description: Potters Bluff is a quiet town on the US West Coast and life flows placidly there, until the day when strange facts begin to happen, such as the discovery of some horribly mangled corpses. It is the beginning of a long series of apparently inexplicable crimes and with the only common trait of a violent and brutal death. The sheriff investigates, but has no lead to follow.

title: Bride of the Gorilla
actors: Barbara Payton, Lon Chaney jr., Raymond Burr, Tom Conway, Paul Cavanagh, Gisela Werbisek, Carol Varga, Paul Maxey, Woody Strode, Martin Garralaga
description: The calm conscience of a passionate murderer is disturbed by a witness, a witch who administers a potion to the murderer that transforms him into a gorilla ...
notes: Reflection on the sense of guilt in the form of an artisanal product made with dignity in just 10 days.

title: Final Destination 5
actors: Nicholas D'Agosto, Emma Bell, David Koechner, Tony Todd, Courtney B. Vance, Jacqueline MacInnes Wood, P.J. Byrne, Arlen Escarpeta, Miles Fisher, Ellen Wroe
description: Young Sam Lawton (Nicholas D'Agosto) has a terrible premonition: a suspension bridge is about to collapse and kill him and many people around. Soon the nightmare becomes reality and Sam manages to save himself from the collapse of the bridge, together with his girlfriend Molly (Emma Bell) and a group of other people. But no one can oppose the plans of Death and one after another the survivors of the tragedy begin to die in a brutal manner. Will Sam be able to stop the deadly design of Destiny?
notes: The fifth chapter (the second in 3D) is the usual harmless macabre fun, the return of the same, full of winking references to regulars and violations of the canon immediately reabsorbed, with irony. Because there is no escape from the logic of the franchise. As from those of death. And so be it.

title: 100 Million BC
actors: Michael Gross, Christopher Atkins, Greg Evigan, Marie Westbrook, Phil Burke, Wendy Carter, Geoff Meed, Stephen Blackehart, Dean Kreyling, Daniel Ponsky
description: Dr. Frank Reno (Michael Gross) has been working for years on a machine that allows you to travel back in time. Six years earlier the machine had been put into operation and a group of men, including Frank's brother, Erik (Christopher Atkins), had been sent back 70 million years, in the height of prehistoric times, in the Cretaceous. The mission had never returned due to a breakdown and now Frank, with a group of specialized officers of the American navy, decides to return to the past and save those who survived the attacks of voracious animal creatures. On the way back to the contemporary world, something doesn't work in the car and a terrible creature manages to arrive on the streets of present-day Los Angeles while Doctor Reno is stopped in the 1950s, where he meets himself (Dustin Harnish) in a young version. Before he dies, old Reno teaches young Reno how to use the time machine and how to get to Los Angeles to fight the ferocious prehistoric beast.

title: Cross
actors: Brian Austin Green, Michael Clarke Duncan, Vinnie Jones, Tom Sizemore, Robert Carradine, Danny Trejo, C. Thomas Howell, Rachel Miner, Jake Busey, William Zabka
description: Callan (Brian Austin Green) has obtained extraordinary physical powers thanks to an ancient Celtic cross that he uses to collaborate, together with a group of special agents, with the FBI in order to fight the crime forces, led by Erlik (Michael Clarke Duncan), and defend the harmony of the city of Los Angeles. When Gunnar, an ancient Viking warrior in search of blood, arrives in the city wreaking havoc and destruction, Erlik takes advantage and joins him in trying to kill Callan. Heard of Erlik's deal with Gunnar, Detective Nitti (Tom Sizemore) tries to warn Callan before the two dangerous criminals find him.

title: The Hit List
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Cole Hauser, Ginny Weirick, Jonathan LaPaglia, Sean Cook, Drew Waters, Michael Papajohn, Brandon O'Neill, J.P. O'Shaughnessy, David Andriole
description: Allan (Cole Hauser), after having a fairly busy day, stops at a bar for a drink to try to relax. Between one glass and another he meets a man who says his name is Jonas (Cuba Gooding jr) who, between one tipsy speech and another, convinces him to draw up a list of five people he would like to see dead. What seems like a meaningless confession dictated by alcohol fumes soon turns into reality and the people on the list begin to disappear. Before it's too late, Allan must communicate the other names on the list to the detective (Jonathan LaPaglia) who follows the investigation.

title: Meteor Apocalypse
actors: Joe Lando, Claudia Christian, Cooper Harris, Madison McLaughlin, T.J. Lepage, Micho Rutare, Jon Gale, Abby Leigh, Ben Daniels, Darrell Philip
description: A gigantic meteor enters on a collision course with Earth's orbit and the US government decides to destroy it using nuclear missiles. Hit by the bombs, the meteor causes a shower of debris that destroys cities. Scientist David (Joe Lando) discovers that one of these meteorites landed and sank in a lake that supplies the entire city of Las Vegas with drinking water. People who drink that water begin to die one after the other and the American president declares a state of quarantine for the contaminated inhabitants of the whole area of ??the city, separating them from healthy people and taking them to a secret place. Even David's wife and daughter, because they are contaminated, are removed and separated from man. David thus begins a long journey in search of an antidote that a colleague is already working on.

title: Your Highness
actors: Danny McBride, James Franco, Rasmus Hardiker, Natalie Portman, Toby Jones, Justin Theroux, Zooey Deschanel, Charles Dance, Damian Lewis, Simon Farnaby
description: The two princes Fabious (James Franco) and Thadeous (Danny McBride) are the opposite of each other. While Fabious is surrounded by an aura of glory for his valiant courage, Thadeous lives by reflection on his brother's fame, preferring, together with the squire Courtney, to run after beautiful women rather than fight. When Belladonna (Zooey Deschanel), Fabious's betrothed, is kidnapped on her wedding day by the evil sorcerer Leezar (Justin Theroux), Thadeous is forced by his father to accompany his brother on his first mission. The two princes are also joined by the charming Isabel (Natalie Portman), a mysterious warrior woman they meet along the journey to reach the kingdom of Leezar. Before reaching their destination and challenging Leezar, the three encounter dead end mazes, minotaurs and other strange creatures.

title: The Evictors
actors: Vic Morrow, Michael Parks, Jessica Harper, Sue Ane Langdon, Dennis Fimple, Bill Thurman, Jimmy Clem, Harry Thomasson, Twyla Taylor, Mary Branch
description: A newly married young couple decide to rent a house in a quiet Louisiana town. But appearances are deceiving ...
notes: Usual remote house that becomes a set of omics in abundance, all very elegantly placed in the off-screen. He wants to be a horror but he just can't do it.

title: Courage
actors: Andrea Roth, Jason Priestley, Genevieve Buechner, Gabrielle Rose, John Shaw
description: Writer Robert (Jason Priestley) organizes a river trip in his boat in the company of his second wife Teresa and his sixteen-year-old daughter Christy, born of the man's first marriage. During the crossing, however, a violent storm destroys the boat and the three castaways find refuge on a small desert island. With Robert injured and without food supplies, the two women are called to smooth out the differences and differences that have always characterized their relationship and provide for survival, clashing with the adversities of nature and with a particularly violent bear.

title: The Marine 2
actors: Ted DiBiase Jr., Temuera Morrison, Lara Cox, Robert Coleby, Michael Rooker, Kelly B. Jones, Sahajak Boonthanakit, Dom Hetrakul, Marina Ponomareva, Levern Gibbs
description: Joe Linwood, a Marine Sergeant, is on vacation with his wife Robin in a tropical location when a terrorist commando attacks the hotel where the two are staying. Robin, along with other guests of the residence, is taken hostage and the sergeant, who managed to escape, has to rely on his military training to save the woman, joining a group of mercenaries sent to help by the local authorities. Between betrayals, threats and explosions, the man will be left alone to face the dangerous criminals.

title: Insidious
actors: Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Ty Simpkins, Andrew Astor, Lin Shaye, Leigh Whannell, Angus Sampson, Barbara Hershey, Corbett Tuck, Heather Tocquigny
description: The Lambert family has just moved into a new home when strange phenomena begin to occur: inexplicable noises, apparitions, objects that move on their own. Until Dalton, one of the three children, suddenly falls into a coma, without the doctors being able to formulate a precise diagnosis. Soon the Lamberts will decide to move, but this will not solve the problem: the mystery will follow them, in fact, in their new home, becoming more and more disturbing.
notes: A tense re-enactment of the 80's horrific atmospheres produced by Poltergeist and, at the same time, exasperating them, serious mockery. And while the repression of the two-dimensional figurines comes back to the surface, the two côté coexist, tight in the same images, in a film that knows how to play with the already seen and with the dullness of the stereotypes of the genre and, at the same time, tries to reinvent those ancient forms, with the purpose for which it was created: fear. The device moves, distress, but it is an exercise in disposable style, totally devoid of soul. And so the lack of happy ending fails to surprise: because when you play with the puppets, it is easy to decide to let them die.

title: Rolling Thunder
actors: William Devane, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Haynes, James Best, Dabney Coleman, Lisa Blake Richards, Luke Askew, Lawrason Driscoll, James Victor, Cassie Yates
description: Major Charlie Rane has just returned from seven years of war in Vietnam and the local community, considering him a hero, pays homage to him with a large sum of money. Interested in getting their hands on the money, some thieves break into the man's house, seriously injuring him and killing his wife and child. Rane, after a period of convalescence in the hospital, decides to take up arms again to search for the criminals and carry out his personal revenge. Two friends will help him in his quest: Linda, an old flame, and Johnny Vohden (Tommy Lee Jones), his ex-comrade.

title: Fearless Frank
actors: Jon Voight, Monique van Vooren, Severn Darden, Joan Darling, Lou Gilbert, Ben Carruthers, Ken Nordine, Nelson Algren, David Fisher, Anthony Holland
description: Frank (Jon Voight) is a young country boy who has just arrived in Chicago in search of independence and fortune. In the big city, however, he dies in an attempt to defend a girl attacked by a group of thugs. The young man's body is recovered by a scientist who brings him back to life, giving him super powers to be implemented in defense of good. The scientist's evil twin, on the other hand, manages to create a bad alter ego of Frank for the world of crime with which he is in league. The paths of the two creatures will cross with tragic results.

title: In time
actors: Justin Timberlake, Amanda Seyfried, Cillian Murphy, Olivia Wilde, Alex Pettyfer, Johnny Galecki, Matt Bomer, Vincent Kartheiser, Yaya DaCosta, Bella Heathcote
description: In the near future, a modification of the aging gene means that the only discriminant to stay alive is the time that a human being has available and that he can buy through money. This implies that the richest are immortal and that poor people are destined to die at the age of 25. Will (Justin Timberlake), a young man trying to buy time for his dying mother (Olivia Wilde), is wrongfully accused of murdering a wealthy man and is forced to flee, taking Sylvia (Amanda Seyfried) hostage. a millionaire heiress. Pursued by increasingly corrupt agents under the orders of Officer Raymond Leon (Cillian Murphy), Will and the girl soon discover they love each other.
notes: Action science fiction with blockbuster ambitions, transforms the two protagonists Justin Timberlake and Amanda Seyfried (she is not very significant, he is more incisive) in Bonnie & Clyde of the future, there are shootings and chases; in short, it is based on a certain amount of multiplex spectacularity that will make those who want only odyssey in space turn up their noses. But action is the very essence of a film where rich oligarchs are slow because they have all the time in the world, while the worker hero, like the replicant, burns at two speeds.

title: Immortals
actors: Henry Cavill, Freida Pinto, Mickey Rourke, John Hurt, Kellan Lutz, Joseph Morgan, Isabel Lucas, Luke Evans, Stephen Dorff, Robert Maillet
description: Blinded by the lust for power, Hyperion (Mickey Rourke), the bloodthirsty king of the Titans, has declared war on the gods of Olympus and all humanity. In search of a legendary arch that would allow to free his brothers, imprisoned in the rock, with his men he sows terror for the villages of ancient Greece, destroying everything and killing anyone who comes within range, including the parents of the young Theseus ( Henry Cavill), who vows to take revenge. Educated by the incarnation of Zeus on earth (John Hurt) and aided by the advice of the visionary priestess Freda (Freida Pinto) and the skill of the thief Stavros (Stephen Dorff), the boy gathers a group of followers with whom he forms an army ready to stop the wave of destruction and restore order and peace.
notes: Mythology is a pretext like the script, made up of bizarre dialogues and rather sensational “historical” and epic licenses. However, it is not the script of the Parlapanides brothers that is of interest, nor the presence of the producers of 300 Gianni Nunnari and Mark Canton. The touch of the director Tarsem changes the cards on the table, and despite the thousand defects that can be found in his baroque and excessive vision, the show is fascinating. The world evoked by the filmmaker and the technical staff constantly challenges kitsch but stuns with dazzling intuitions, like the lights coming from remote points to draw Caravaggesque tableaux vivants on the screen. Tarsem makes even the most barren and lean scenarios appear extremely saturated, alive, like buttons of barbaric energy. A red passion of the gaze where the false 3D (he shot in 2D) is ultimately superfluous.

title: The Mechanic
actors: Jason Statham, Ben Foster, Tony Goldwyn, Donald Sutherland, Jeff Chase, Mini Anden, James Logan, Eddie J. Fernandez, Joshua Bridgewater, John McConnell
description: Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is a meticulous and ruthless killer, the best in his field, under the orders of a gang of criminals. After the murder of his friend and mentor Harry (Donald Sutherland) on the orders of Chief Dean (Tony Goldwyn), he vows to himself to train Steve (Ben Foster), son of the deceased. To the boy, Arthur gives all the notions and techniques necessary to one day be able to avenge the death of his father but their relationship of complicity is destined to become dangerous when Steve discovers who is the perpetrator of that murder that changed his existence.
notes: Remake of the 1972 film of the same name, directed by Michael Winner and starring Charles Bronson. The original version had at least a melancholy Bronson, here replaced by Jason Statham, great for making tamarro in the pay of Luc Besson or Stallone but completely stoned if it is to add even a hint of introspection to the character. Not to mention Ben Foster's insufferable overacting. Director Simon West limits himself to coordinating the work of the second unit and wastes his time trying to give depth to figures that are always backlit, without a soul. The ring (Mini Anden) passes without a trace, Donald Sutherland did not write the part, as if the production executives, the real authors, couldn't wait to get to the accumulation of action of the finale. How boring. How boring.

title: Contagion
actors: Matt Damon, Marion Cotillard, Gwyneth Paltrow, Kate Winslet, Jude Law, Bryan Cranston, Jennifer Ehle, Laurence Fishburne, John Hawkes, Sanaa Lathan
description: The United States is shaken by a possible pandemic, generated by an unknown virus that some people have contracted in Hong Kong. While CDC doctors (Kate Winslet and Laurence Fishburne) and a WHO specialist (Marion Cotillard) are already working on an antidote to save the lives of the infected in time - including Beth (Gwyneth Palthrow), one of the passengers on the flight. , looked after by her husband Thomas (Matt Damon) -, the government is called upon to face the emergency and contain the civil unrest caused by collective psychosis, due to the spreading on the web of some news by a blogger (Jude Law).
notes: The chemical combination between canon and waste, between commercial soul and transgressive drive, produces a more fascinating object on paper than on screen, a substantially helpless operation, a mathematical formula that one would like to be sophisticated but leads to a sterile result, another example of a an automatic way that plays to soil the rules of mainstream cinema with calibrated eccentricity. Because Contagion, despite the valuable premises, remains the verbose verbosity put into images of a plausible misfortune, so cold and fragmented that it cannot involve the viewer in the narration and at the same time lacking an aesthetic force that can make up for this lack.

title: Glass Trap
actors: C. Thomas Howell, Stella Stevens, Siri Baruc, Brent Huff, Chick Vennera, Andrew Prine, Peter Spellos, Martin Kove, Tracy Brooks Swope, Whitney Sloan
description: An army of giant ants, emerging from some exotic plants contaminated by radiation, invade a luxurious palace, sowing panic. Curtis, a newly hired cleaning guy, and a group of tenants will try to eradicate the monstrous creatures to ensure their survival.

title: The Mini-Skirt Mob
actors: Jeremy Slate, Diane McBain, Sherry Jackson, Ross Hagen, Patty McCormack, Harry Dean Stanton, Ronnie Rondell Jr., Barbro Hedström, Sandra Marshall, Steve Balazs
description: Shayne (Diane McBaine) is the undisputed leader of a motorcycle gang. The woman has never accepted that she was left by her boyfriend, Jeff. Discovering that the man has meanwhile married Connie, Shayne asks her companions in raids to follow her in the war she intends to wage against the two newlyweds.

title: The Time Travelers
actors: Preston Foster, Philip Carey, Merry Anders, John Hoyt, Dennis Patrick, Joan Woodbury, Delores Wells, Steve Franken, Berry Kroeger, Gloria Leslie
description: While testing a time machine they have been working on for some time, three scientists and a technician end up transported to 2071, into a future world ravaged by nuclear war. Here, the four will have to help the inhabitants before they can return to the present, even with unforeseen consequences.

title: Chrome Angels
actors: Stacey Dash, Paul Le Mat, Frida Farrell, Eliza Swenson, Kristen Quintrall, Jackey Hall, Dean N. Arevalo, Collin Galyean, Brent Lydic, Monti Domingue
description: On the run after a series of robberies, a gang of bikers led by the beautiful and ruthless Lucy (Stacey Dash) finds refuge in a border town, inhabited by a group of human-like androids, created by the evil Elliott ( Paul Le Mat). The reception will not be the best and the girls will have to fight to stay alive and sabotage the diabolical plan that the man, intent on taking over the world, has in mind.

title: Rogues Gallery
actors: Joe Anderson, Rob Corddry, Ellen Barkin, Odette Annable, Maggie Q, Zach Galifianakis, Adam Scott, Brandon T. Jackson, Emilie de Ravin, Beth Grant
description: A man has just been hired by a government association that, based underground, manages two teams of assassins (the Alphas and the Omegas) whose codenames derive from the Tarot cards. Arrived on the first day of work, The Fool (the madman) finds the corpse of the boss and the two teams, always rivals, must search for the killer, engaging in a fight against time because of a bomb, placed in the agency , which could kill everyone.

title: Dead Birds
actors: Henry Thomas, Patrick Fugit, Nicki Aycox, Michael Shannon, Muse Watson, Mark Boone Junior, Isaiah Washington, Harris Mann, Melanie Abramoff, Donna Biscoe
description: William leads a handful of desertering soldiers who have just robbed a bank. On the run with the loot, the gang finds refuge near a plantation on the border with Mexico, in an uninhabited house. During the night, men will discover that they are not alone and that they have to save their lives, threatened by disturbing presences.

title: The Return
actors: Jan-Michael Vincent, Cybill Shepherd, Martin Landau, Raymond Burr, Neville Brand, Brad Rearden, Vincent Schiavelli, Ernest Anderson, Darby Hinton, Steven Hirsch
description: In a small town in New Mexico, two boys find themselves in contact with an extraterrestrial spacecraft passing through the earth. Twenty-five years later, now adults and with lives marked by that never forgotten experience, the two boys find themselves investigating the mysterious causes behind the discovery of some mutilated cattle carcasses in the area. They will soon discover that between their past and the mysterious events of the present there are many points in common.

title: Bitch Slap
actors: Julia Voth, Erin Cummings, America Olivo, Michael Hurst, Ron Melendez, William Gregory Lee, Minae Noji, Kevin Sorbo, Lucy Lawless, Renée O'Connor
description: Trixie, Camero and Hel, one sexier than the other and with many skeletons in the closet, arrive in a remote place in the desert to try to recover the diamonds that the slimy Gage, taken hostage by them, has stolen from the legendary boss Pinky , never met by anyone. In addition to clashing with the ferocious violence of Gage's accomplices, the three women will also have to contend with an intrusive and curious deputy and with unexpected revelations that highlight how each has a different goal in mind to achieve, ending up annihilating the one with the other.
notes: Tribute to Russ Meyer and the B series with disrupted temporal plans according to the more Tarantinian pulp vein, Bitchslap. Le superdotate is a small film from two years ago, overseas adored by the niche audience but little loved by critics. It is a completely titillating cinema, like a Playboy Channel TV special with minutes out of hand. And just as softcore, therefore devoid of real provocations.

title: A Dangerous Man
actors: Steven Seagal, Mike Dopud, Marlaina Mah, Vitaly Kravchenko, Jesse Hutch, Terry Chen, Byron Mann, Byron Lawson, Jerry Wasserman, Shawn C. Orr
description: Having recently returned to freedom after spending six years in prison on an unjust murder charge, a former special forces agent finds himself in the midst of a war between Chinese drug dealers and corrupt policemen. In order to save the life of a girl, found in the trunk of a car along with millions of dollars in cash, the man must warm up his muscles and weapons to make justice triumph.

title: The Apparition
actors: Ashley Greene, Tom Felton, Sebastian Stan, Julianna Guill, Luke Pasqualino, Rick Gomez, Suzanne Ford, Anna Clark, Meena Serendib, Marti Matulis
description: Since taking part in a university parapsychology experiment together, Kelly and Ben have witnessed strange phenomena inside their home. The couple is convinced that they are being persecuted by one of the spirits invoked during that occasion and asks for the help of Patrick, an expert on the paranormal, before their life is fatally endangered.

title: The Darkest Hour
actors: Emile Hirsch, Joel Kinnaman, Rachael Taylor, Olivia Thirlby, Max Minghella, Dato Bakhtadze, Yuriy Kutsenko, Artur Smolyaninov, Nikolay Efremov
description: The aliens have just invaded the earth. Taken by despair and terror, the survivors of the invasion - by no means peaceful - were unable to react and surrendered to the new reality. But a group of young Americans on vacation in Moscow are trying to devise a plan to annihilate the extraterrestrials and restore order on the planet.

title: Tower Heist
actors: Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Matthew Broderick, Casey Affleck, Téa Leoni, Michael Peña, Gabourey Sidibe, Alan Alda, Judd Hirsch, Nina Arianda
description: Arthur Shaw, a high finance giant, is forced to house arrest in an apartment in a wealthy residential complex. The man is accused of defrauding the clients of the agency he worked for, illegally stealing more than two billion dollars. The neighbors who had entrusted him with the savings of their pension funds, feeling robbed, decide to rob Arthur's home with the complicity of Josh Kovacs (Ben Stller), the administrator of the building, and ask for the help of a professional thief, the clumsy Slide (Eddie Murphy).
notes: Brett Ratner, a director who is certainly not a genius, however, knows how to build a spectacular high-precision mechanism. If the screenplay leverages the indignation caused by the consequences of the financial crisis triggered by Wall Street, the film stages a pleasure of storytelling and of the interlocking game declared from the first shots regarding a remote chess game.

title: On the Road
actors: Sam Riley, Garrett Hedlund, Kristen Stewart, Kirsten Dunst, Tom Sturridge, Viggo Mortensen, Amy Adams, Alice Braga, Steve Buscemi, Danny Morgan
description: In the late 1940s, aspiring writer Sal Paradise (Sam Riley) meets Dean (Garrett Hedlund), a young man just out of reform school and not very tolerant of bourgeois morals. Two years later, the two accidentally find themselves in New York, where in the company of Marylou (Kristen Stewart), Dean's young wife, they decide to go on a trip to the country, living in a wild way and breaking every pattern and taboo. In addition to giving new inspiration to Sal, the nights based on sex, jazz music and alcohol, will allow the two to find old friends but also to meet new ones, such as Old Bull Lee (Viggo Mortensen) and his wife Jane (Amy Adams) .
notes: To slaughter Jack Kerouac like this, it took a special talent. And Walter Salles, one who did not know how to take advantage of an empty penalty like the story of the young Che Guevara to make his masterpiece, let alone if he could grasp the inspiration, the anarchy, the restlessness of the Beat Generation prophet. And his bible, On the Road, in fact. And in fact, it doesn't even touch them, pulling on a boring and flat film that defuses even the expected sexy scenes with Kristen Stewart who, poor thing, with her pale pouting, fails in the slightest to achieve the charisma and charm necessary to be Marylou, an unconscious engine and instinctive of the book.

title: Haywire
actors: Gina Carano, Channing Tatum, Michael Fassbender, Ewan McGregor, Michael Douglas, Antonio Banderas, Michael Angarano, Bill Paxton, Mathieu Kassovitz, Eddie J. Fernandez
description: The work often leads Mallory Kane (Gina Carano) to get her hands dirty in actions that no member or head of state could ever admit. Mallory is in fact often hired by the secret services for dangerous missions or murders to carry out. However, during her latest expedition to Dublin something went wrong and it seems that some of her teammates want to frame her. Forced to return to the United States to save herself and her family, Mallory will have to escape from a group of five special agents willing to do anything to stop her intentions of revenge against those responsible for the sabotaged operation.
notes: Mutation of the canon with sophisticated alternating mounting grafts, lighting now turning yellow now blue, Knockout. Showdown breathes from the trained lungs of the protagonist. Subject / object of an excited and controlled script, it finds its balance between calm and storm in a hotel corridor covered with soft footsteps on high heels, or in the flashback of a Spanish apartment to a soft score by David Holmes.

title: Breaking Dawn
actors: Kelly Overton, James Haven, Sarah-Jane Potts, Hank Harris, Edie McClurg, Kathryn Joosten, Isaac C. Singleton Jr., Diane Venora, Joe Morton, Dave Ruby
description: Eve, a medical student, during her internship in the psychiatric ward meets Don, a dangerous mental patient, becoming more and more fascinated by the secrets that the young man hides ...
notes: The film manages to skillfully blend thriller and psychology. The actors - very good - place themselves at the service of a plot that has the strengths of its structure in the constant crescendo of suspense and twists. And while a relationship of ambiguous complicity and specularity is established between Eve and Don, the final distortion dissolves a tension wisely nourished throughout the plot, surprising with intelligence.

title: Conan the Barbarian
actors: Jason Momoa, Rachel Nichols, Stephen Lang, Rose McGowan, Said Taghmaoui, Ron Perlman, Leo Howard, Steven O'Donnell, Raad Rawi, Nonso Anozie
description: As a child, Conan (Jason Momoa) watched helplessly as his father Corin (Ron Perlman) was killed and his native village destroyed at the hands of the evil Khalar Zym (Stephen Lang), obsessed with the search for Queen Ilira. Miraculously saved and raised amid violence of all kinds, the barbarian has never abandoned the idea of ??one day avenging the death of his parent and the right opportunity for the purpose presents itself when Tamara (Rachel Nichols), Ilira's maid, asks his help in freeing the queen, who has meanwhile been imprisoned by Khalar. Together they will try to defeat the hidden forces of the enemy, who counts on the help of horrible monsters and the spells of their daughter Marique (Rose McGowan).
notes: Nispel has in mind a heavy metal universe of papier-mâché and a superheroic montage all on the surface (the usual slowdowns, the usual accelerations). And if the film follows the path of Conan's Bildungsroman, the steel of the sword as a remedy against superstition, abundant blood or Rose McGowan is certainly not enough to make up for the obvious lack of power of a film devoid of bite.

title: The Hills Run Red
actors: Sophie Monk, Tad Hilgenbrink, William Sadler, Janet Montgomery, Alex Wyndham, Ewan Bailey, Danko Jordanov, Mike Straub, Hristo Mitzkov, Georgi Dimitrov-Bomba
description: Tyler, a young documentarian, is a horror enthusiast and his favorite work is a film directed by the expert Concannon. After learning from Alexa, the director's daughter, that a full copy of that film is kept in a house near the woods where it was shot, he decides to go there in the company of his girlfriend, his girlfriend Selina and his friend Lalo. . Once there, they will discover that nothing they saw was fiction and that the terrible Babyface, the protagonist of cinematic cruelties, really exists and is more wicked than ever.

title: Killing Them Softly
actors: Brad Pitt, Ray Liotta, Garret Dillahunt, James Gandolfini, Richard Jenkins, Sam Shepard, Bella Heathcote, Max Casella, Scoot McNairy, Ben Mendelsohn
description: Jackie Cogan (Brad Pitt), a professional thug with an icy gaze and a rude and violent manner, is hired by the mafia to investigate a robbery carried out during a secret poker game, organized by the slimy Mark Trattman (Ray Liotta), to which was attended only by the most important names of the underworld. His task will be to find the perpetrators of the theft and return the money to the criminal association but to complete it he will have to leave behind a long trail of blood.
notes: Everything is saturated, frontal, cheeky in Cogan. Killing Them Softly, an intricate noir ordinance story. Ray Liotta makes the minor cast of himself; a dose of heroin unleashes the Velvet Underground's automatic Heroin; lysergic hallucinations are those optical deformations with which the cinema of the 70s exhausted us; the slowdowns that aestheticize violence are the graphic exasperation of what Hong Kong and Hollywood have been offering us for 30 years; the allegory of crime and economic policy, gambling and financial speculation is repeated to exhaustion, as if it were a punctuation mark. Dominik (like Coppola's last, misunderstood youth) does not look at reality, but at its usual forms of representation, at the symbols in which it is realized, at the metaphors with which he tries to explain himself.

title: Odd Thomas
actors: Anton Yelchin, Willem Dafoe, Addison Timlin, Ashley Sommers, Leonor Varela, Laurel Harris, Melissa Ordway, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Shuler Hensley, Nico Tortorella, Matthew Page, Kyle McKeever
description: Despite striving to lead a normal existence, working in a fast food restaurant and having an affair with young Stormy (Addison Timlin), Odd Thomas (Anton Yelchin) cannot help but be visited by the deceased who are still unable to detach from earthly life. Between an appearance of Elvis Presley or one of Frank Sinatra, Odd sees above all the souls of those seeking the resolution of the crimes of which he has been the victim or of those who predict future episodes of violence. But when a stranger arrives in the city surrounded by sinister shadows, all that the spirits will provide will be just a date and the boy will have little time to find out what tragedy he will have to avoid.
notes: Dramaturgical repetitions, announced twists, inconsistencies in staging and antiquated superhero / action grammars carried out between slow motion struggles alternating with rapid scrolling, freeze frames and digital video game explosions from the 90s. A full-blown stock fund, good only for fill a lean distributive summer. Freely based on the novel of the same name by the writer Dean Koontz.

title: Abduction
actors: Taylor Lautner, Lily Collins, Alfred Molina, Jason Isaacs, Maria Bello, Michael Nyqvist, Sigourney Weaver, Antonique Smith, Denzel Whitaker, Nickola Shreli, Elisabeth Röhm, Dermot Mulroney
description: Nathan Harper (Taylor Lautner) grew up with his parents with a strange impression on him: that of living the life of another person. The feeling becomes certain when, on a website for missing persons, he comes across a photo of him as a child that convinces him that he was kidnapped at an early age. Intent on tracking down his birth parents, he soon finds himself chased by a team of killers and forced to flee, along with his beloved Karen (Lily Collins). During the frenzied search, Nathan will have on his side only the protection of Frank Burton (Alfred Molina) and Sandra Burns (Antonique Smith), two FBI agents, who will help him discover the burning truth about his origins.
notes: Six years after the Four Brothers, John Singleton, former new Spike Lee, returns with an inert teenage thriller that dwarfs even the memory of the bad 2 Fast 2 Furious. A born old film that disguises itself as an adult to peddle juvenile clichés. And Abduction. Take back your life, the work of a former promise played by a "dog" actor, it never turns into the action werewolf he wants to be.

title: ZigZag
actors: John Leguizamo, Wesley Snipes, Oliver Platt, Natasha Lyonne, Luke Goss, Sam Jones III, Sherman Augustus, Michael Greyeyes, Jullian Dulce Vida, Ivan Basso
description: Fifteen-year-old autistic Louis, nicknamed Zig Zag, lives in dire conditions with his violent drug addict father (Wesley Snipes). Working as a dishwasher in the restaurant of the alcoholic Walters (Oliver Platt), he is often mocked and mocked by everyone, also because of his passion for numbers. The only person who tries to be close to him, acting like an older brother and following the guidelines of a social assistance program, is Dean Singer (John Leguizamo), who recently found himself terminally ill with cancer. When Zig Zag is forced by circumstances to steal money from the restaurant's safe, Dean will not hesitate to get into trouble in order to guarantee the return of the sum within a set time, asking for the help of a cynical loan shark (Luke Goss) and a soft-hearted prostitute (Natasha Lyonne).

title: Mother's Day
actors: Rebecca De Mornay, Shawn Ashmore, Lisa Marcos, Patrick John Flueger, Frank Grillo, Jaime King, Tony Nappo, Deborah Ann Woll, Warren Kole, Matt O'Leary
description: The three Koffin brothers, thieves betrayed by their own robbery companions, seek refuge in the home of their mother Nathalie (Rebecca De Mornay) to escape the arrest of the police. With their younger brother injured by a knife, they arrive on the spot but they find a young couple waiting for them, intent on celebrating a birthday in the company of their friends. Instead of running away, the brothers decide to kidnap everyone waiting for a clarification but, when Nathalie, in the company of her daughter Lydia, walks through the door of the house, the situation worsens. A long and terrible night of revealed secrets and punished sins will await the unwary hostages because a mother's love has numerous ways to manifest itself.

title: Red State
actors: Michael Parks, Melissa Leo, John Goodman, Michael Angarano, Kyle Gallner, Nicholas Braun, Kevin Pollak
description: A group of three friends, college students, responds to an online ad in which a provocative woman seeks participants for an orgy she is organizing. Attracted by the realization of one of their favorite erotic fantasies, once they arrive at the meeting place, they will find themselves having to face the terror generated by Pastor Abin Cooper, a mad preacher who together with the followers of his ultra-conservative church would like to eliminate all sinners from face of the earth. However, they can count on the help of an FBI agent (John Goodman) who will try the impossible to save them.

title: The Power of Few
actors: Christopher Walken, Christian Slater, Q'Orianka Kilcher, Anthony Anderson, Jesse Bradford, Moon Bloodgood, Nicky Whelan, Devon Gearhart, Jordan Prentice, Juvenile
description: Alexa (Q'orianka Kilcher) is a courier who dreams of one day changing his life, improving his precarious economic condition and moving to the residential areas of the city. But good intentions take a dramatic turn when he agrees to deliver a mysterious package, disputed on the one hand by the forces of international terrorism and on the other by the lust for power of some petty urban criminals. Suddenly, the girl's existence will be linked to that of four other people and to the entire destiny of the world, hanging in the balance due to the choices of a few powerful people.

title: Stake Land
actors: Connor Paolo, Nick Damici, Danielle Harris, Kelly McGillis, Bonnie Dennison, Michael Cerveris, Chance Kelly, Sean Nelson, Marianne Hagan, Adam Scarimbolo
description: In the near future, the United States, already devastated by a serious economic crisis, is undergoing a horrific epidemic of vampirism that is annihilating all human beings, transformed into monstrous creatures. Teenager Martin (Connor Paolo), after witnessing the barbaric killing of his parents, joins a skilled vampire hunter (Nick Damici) who, armed with wooden stakes, wants to reach a new peaceful northern land. During the journey, they will find the company of a nun (Kelly McGillis) in full mystical crisis, a young pregnant folk singer (Danielle Harris) and a former soldier (Sean Nelson) but they will have to face increasingly hellish attacks to survive.

title: Warrior
actors: Tom Hardy, Jennifer Morrison, Joel Edgerton, Nick Nolte, Bryan Callen, Noah Emmerich, Denzel Whitaker, Kevin Dunn, Fernando Chien, Frank Grillo
description: For Paddy (Nick Nolte) the abandonment of his boxing career coincided with the onset of his problems with alcohol, which gradually removed him from his family. The opportunity for rapprochement arises when his son Tom (Tom Hardy), a former marine, asks his father to physically prepare him for a violent martial arts tournament with no rules. But Brandon (Joel Edgerton), the eldest son, also intends to participate in the same race, who wishes to win to guarantee himself an economic security that the job of a teacher does not give him. The rivalry between the two brothers will become increasingly bitter until the inevitable final confrontation.
notes: Compared to David O. Russell's less engaging The Fighter, however, Warrior has a different fighting discipline, MMA (mixed martial arts), more brutal than boxing although less noble, in addition to the fact that the brothers fight each other seriously. , and not just psychologically. Here too, among the various redemption needs of these children of the people it is not difficult to see a clear and harsh symbolism, perfectly in line with these times of crisis. If blood ties are like social ones, a handful of dollars is enough to blow them up, triggering a war between the poor.

title: Shark Night 3D
actors: Sara Paxton, Chris Carmack, Courtney Hope, Grant-Antony, Joel David Moore, Chris Zylka, Katharine McPhee, Donal Logue, Dustin Milligan, Christine Quinn
description: Sarah (Sara Paxton), together with six other study mates, decides to spend the last weekend of summer holidays in the holiday home of one of their parents, surrounded by nature: an ancestral place where they can enjoy the clear waters of the surrounding lake. Once at their destination, however, the group will discover how those waters actually hide the horror of hundreds of ravenous giant sharks.

title: Underworld Awakening
actors: Kate Beckinsale, Michael Ealy, India Eisley, Kris Holden-Ried, Sandrine Holt, Robert Lawrenson, Richard Cetrone, Theo James, Stephen Rea, Charles Dance
description: After awakening from the deep coma in which she was held for fifteen years, the vampire warrior Selene, who has always been at war against the world of werewolves, discovers that in the meantime she has become the mother of fourteen-year-old Eve, the result of a hybrid between vampires and Lycans. . Moved by a maternal spirit, she will go after her daughter but will also have to face and stop a new threat that comes directly from a powerful multinational, managed by human beings intent on studying a new superior race, capable of annihilating vampires and werewolves.
notes: The rule of the game is to shoot to forget (the absence of a script, the mythology stripped of epic, the chromatic coldness married to the zero degree of emotion). Sharp splinters rain down on the viewer and a film that has the only mitigating factor of brevity. An unconscious own goal.

title: From Within
actors: Elizabeth Rice, Thomas Dekker, Kelly Blatz, Laura Allen, Adam Goldberg, Margo Harshman, Rumer Willis, Brittany Robertson, Steven Culp, Jared Harris
description: The inhabitants of the Grovetown community are shocked by a chain of suicides, the cause of which seems to be unknown. With the fear of being the next victim, after witnessing the suicide of her friend Natalie, 18-year-old Lindsay begins to investigate the reason for those events, together with the young Aidan, brother of Natalie's suicidal boyfriend, whose family has long been accused. of witchcraft. They will discover that behind it all there is something evil, which appears only when the lights are off, from which they will have to escape.

title: Kronos
actors: Jeff Morrow, Barbara Lawrence, John Emery, George O'Hanlon, Morris Ankrum, Kenneth Alton, John Parrish, Jose Gonzales-Gonzales, Richard Harrison, Marjorie Stapp
description: A flying object of enormous proportions is about to enter the Earth's atmosphere, while a mysterious luminous presence takes possession of an unsuspecting motorist in the American desert. Through him he reaches the nearby space research center and passes into the body of the illustrious Doctor Eliot (John Emery). The UFO (officially believed to be a meteorite) sinks along the coast of an isolated place in Mexico, while three other members of the research center - pushed by Dr. Gaskell (Jeff Morrow), who considers the object as a possible creation of alien minds - arrive on the spot. Eliot is hospitalized, where he shows moments of lucidity in which he manages to talk about his possession only getting to be thought crazy, while the UFO transforms into a gigantic tower that feeds on energy.
notes: Low-cost vintage science fiction, directed by the German Kurt Neumann, director of the famous Dr. K's experiment (1958).

title: To Love and Die
actors: Shiri Appleby, Ivan Sergei, Kristin Dattilo, Christine Adams, Bradley Stryker, Tyron Leitso, Peter Benson, Don S. Davis, Seymour Cassel, Frances Fisher
description: After yet another sentimental failure, Hildy becomes convinced that her problems stem from being abandoned by her father as a child. He then decides to find him and, when he manages to track him down, he discovers that he is a hired killer. The girl decides to become her father's helper ...

title: Neverland
actors: Rhys Ifans, Anna Friel, Charles Dance, Q'Orianka Kilcher, Charlie Rowe, Bob Hoskins, Raoul Trujillo, Cas Anvar, George Aguilar
description: In late 19th century London, the orphan Peter earns his food by committing petty thefts with a group of friends, coordinated by the directives of their mentor and instructor Jimmy Hook (Rhys Ifans). As a reward for a successful shot, Peter receives a glass sphere as a gift which, when broken, is revealed to be magical and catapulted him and Hook into the magical kingdom of Neverland, at the end of the eighteenth century. Here, a war is underway between the pirates, led by the fearsome Elizabeth Bonny (Anna Friel) and intent on taking dominion over the earth, and the natives of the place, who follow the advice of Holy Man, able to speak with the spirits of the trees. . Peter and Hook will bring their contribution to the salvation of Neverland but, siding on opposing fronts, they will start a long rivalry.
notes: Prequel to the fairy tale of Peter Pan, which in the original version also sees the actress Keira Knightley voicing the character of Tinker Bell.

title: Hoot
actors: Luke Wilson, Logan Lerman, Brie Larson, Tim Blake Nelson, Cody Linley, Neil Flynn, Clark Gregg, Kiersten Warren, Jessica Cauffiel, Dean Collins
description: Roy moves to Florida with his family. No time to settle in and will have to engage in a fight to save the owls in the area.
notes: The environmentalist intentions are good, but the film aligns a series of boring children's film stereotypes, resulting in confusing and not at all original.

title: S.W.A.T.: Firefight
actors: Gabriel Macht, Kristanna Loken, Robert Patrick, Carly Pope, Giancarlo Esposito, Nicholas Gonzalez, Matt Bushell, Shannon Kane, Gino Anthony Pesi, Kevin Phillips
description: Lieutenant Paul Cutler is one of the best men in the special forces of the US Army and, as a reward for his work, he is transferred from Los Angeles to Detroit to train a new team. Despite the less than optimal reception from some cadet members, in a short time Paul will earn the respect and esteem of those around him, so much so that he can count on their help when he hunts down a crazy former government agent, who seeking revenge, he kidnapped his girlfriend Kim.

title: Twixt
actors: Val Kilmer, Bruce Dern, Ben Chaplin, Elle Fanning, Joanne Whalley, David Paymer, Alden Ehrenreich, Anthony Fusco, Don Novello, Ryan Simpkins
description: Hall Baltimore (Val Kilmer), writer of third-rate horror books, arrives on the presentation tour of his latest novel in a small town where he is involved by the local sheriff (Bruce Dern) in the case of the mysterious death of a young woman. girl. That same night, Hall, who has also lost a daughter, receives a visit from the ghost of another girl (Elle Fanning) who takes him around to discover old dark secrets, which reveal aspects of the past that also involve him and the writer Edgar Allan Poe (Ben Chaplin).

title: Piranha 3DD
actors: Danielle Panabaker, Christopher Lloyd, Katrina Bowden, Ving Rhames, Gary Busey, Chris Zylka, David Koechner, David Hasselhoff, Jean-Luc Bilodeau, Clu Gulager
description: The opening of a new and spectacular water park becomes a source of attraction for the young people of a quiet American town. Between high slides from which to jump and large pools to have fun in, the kids will see the fun turn into nightmares when, through the water pipes, a group of piranhas with sharp teeth like blades infest the waters of the place, killing anyone with quick and brutal attacks. come under fire, with the local authorities unable to stop them and with the scholar Maddy, together with friends Kyle and Barry, intent on finding a solution to put an end to the ravenous attacks.

title: The Stand
actors: Gary Sinise, Molly Ringwald, Jamey Sheridan, Ruby Dee, Miguel Ferrer, Corin Nemec, Adam Storke, Rob Lowe, Laura San Giacomo, Ossie Davis, Matt Frewer, Ray Walston, Kellie Overbey, Cynthia Garris, Bill Fagerbakke
description: Due to an error, a virus develops from an American government laboratory and spreads around the world, decimating the population. The few immune to the virus come together under the guidance of Mamma Abigail (Ruby Dee), while others under that of the Mephistophelic Randall Flagg (Jamey Sheridan). Thus will begin a struggle between good and evil.
notes: TV miniseries based on a Stephen King novel.

title: Aces 'N' Eights
actors: Casper Van Dien, Bruce Boxleitner, Ernest Borgnine, Jeff Kober, Jack Noseworthy, William Atherton, Jake Thomas, Rodney Scott, Deirdre Quinn, Victoria Chalaya
description: A group of pioneers who have found a home near Oak Hill do not bow to the advance of progress, refusing to give their lands to a group of unscrupulous businessmen, intent on building a new railway line that crosses the whole West. Led by a retired gunslinger and an old rancher, they are forced to take up their guns and do justice for themselves when a group of bandits, specially sent to intimidate them, begin to use hard manners towards their families.

title: Rampart
actors: Woody Harrelson, Ben Foster, Robin Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Steve Buscemi, Anne Heche, Brie Larson, Don Creech, Ice Cube, Cynthia Nixon
description: Los Angeles, 1999. Dave Brown (Woody Harrelson), Vietnam veteran and Rampart policeman, operates with his own code of justice, often blurring the lines between what is lawful and what is wrong. When a tape shows which methods he uses on a suspect, Dave finds himself at the center of a vortex that threatens to undermine his entire existence. As he tries to keep his sanity steady, he will have to confront his two daughters, the recriminations of two ex-wives (Anne Heche and Cynthia Nixon) and his new mistress (Robin Wright), as well as a willful Deputy District Attorney (Sigourney Weaver) and an inspector on his trail (Ice Cube).
notes: Woody Harrelson returns as a natural born killer in a sprawling urban landscape, between cheap motel rooms, dilapidated bars to pick up a few alcoholics and nightclubs with back alleys to be covered in vomit. But this time, together with the dead, we miss a more thorough investigation than usual. And the gates of hell open wide, welcoming. "Rampart" is a film about perdition, populated by female ghosts (fantastic Heche, Nixon and Wright) as projections of wishes that it is too late to realize.

title: 5 Days of War
actors: Rupert Friend, Val Kilmer, Andy Garcia, Dean Cain, Emmanuelle Chriqui, Heather Graham, Mikko Nousiainen, Richard Coyle, Antje Traue, Rade Serbedzija
description: Thomas Anders (Rupert Friend) is one of the best war correspondents, able to tell with his detailed reports the horrors of countries devastated by years of internal strife or foreign occupation, often ending up being personally involved in events. As soon as he returned from Iraq - where he had helplessly witnessed the death of a colleague - he was sent together with a cameraman to Tbilisi to follow the evolution of the situation in southern Ossetia, a region that has always been disputed between Russia and Georgia. But the outbreak of yet another armed conflict, decided by the Georgian president (Andy Garcia) and culminating in an unwarranted attack on civilians, pushes the reporter to put himself in danger for the truths he reveals to the world and for the help he lends to Tatia. , young girl looking for her family.

title: Premium Rush
actors: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Michael Shannon, Dania Ramirez, Jamie Chung, Wolé Parks, Christopher Place, Aasif Mandvi, Aaron Tveit, Nick Damici, Lauren Ashley Carter, Jennifer Butler, Aija Terauda
description: Wilee, who works as a courier for a shipping company and rides her bicycle through the busy New York traffic, has just received a package from a young Manhattan woman to be delivered in the Chinatown neighborhood within ninety minutes. But the content of what he carries is more dangerous than expected and Wilee finds himself chased through the streets of the city by a policeman, with a good-natured appearance and a violent temperament, intent on getting his hands on the package. Fortunately, in addition to his legs, Wilee will also be able to count on the help of his colleague Nima.

title: Men in Black III
actors: Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Alice Eve, Josh Brolin, Emma Thompson, Bill Hader, Jemaine Clement, Nicole Scherzinger, Rip Torn, Michael Stuhlbarg, Lady Gaga
description: K (Tommy Lee Jones) and J (Will Smith), the special agents of the secret unit that fights alien invasions on Earth, must thwart yet another threat to our planet, which this time risks being destroyed by the very bad Yaz (Jemaine Clement). The mission to which they are called involves the past of K, who risks dying as a young man (Josh Brolin) in the sixties, thus irreparably changing the course of events. To prevent the unfortunate hypothesis, J goes back in time and finds himself grappling with extraterrestrial creatures that are anything but peaceful.
notes: Something more could probably be done with the 1969 setting, which however offers a dazzling joke about Mick Jagger and an irresistible scene at Andy Warhol's Factory. Then, of course, there is 3D, which amazes in the dizzying sequence of the leap in time. Despite the retro part, the film remains faithful to the spirit of the series and will delight fans not so much with the excessive action scenes, as with the clash of Agent J's inexhaustible talkativeness against the silent seriousness of Agent K.

title: Area 51
actors: Ben Rovner, Russ Taylor, Reid Warner, Jennefer Ludwigsen, Sandra Staggs, Roy Abramsohn, Glenn Campbell, Jelena Nik, Jonathan Marsh
description: Chris, who has always been passionate about astronomy and the world of UFOs, takes advantage of a vacation in Las Vegas to venture with friends Paul and Rob into the Nevada desert, looking for a former employee of the infamous Area 51 who can tell them about the experience. contact with extraterrestrials. Furthermore, to further increase their curiosity is the meeting with Natalie, convinced that she had been kidnapped by aliens some time before.

title: Deranged
actors: Veronica Hart, Jerry Butler, Jennifer Delora, Jamie Gillis, Jill Cumer, Loretta Palma, John Brett, Jessica Rose, Gary Goldman, Harvey Siegel
description: Joyce, a young schizophrenic, lives in a world of her own, where realities, nightmares, voices and memories alternate and overlap continuously, in a coming and going of apparitions of the living and the dead; to his psychic equilibrium, already precarious, the attack suffered within the walls of his house by a mysterious masked individual gives the coup de grace.
notes: Bizarre psychological thriller, not as successful as other films of the genre.

title: Lone Rider
actors: Lou Diamond Phillips, Vincent Spano, Stacy Keach, Marta DuBois, Terry Maratos, Cynthia Preston, Angela Alvarado, Mike Starr, Robert Baker, Timothy Bottoms
description: Bobby Hathaway (Lou Diamond Phillips) has just returned to his family's lands, after fighting at the front and serving his country with honor, when he learns that the locals are being pressured by Stu Coker (Vincent Spano), an ex. childhood friend enriched over time by exploiting the misfortunes of others. To defend his threatened properties and to put an end to the bullying, Bobby will not hesitate to take the shotgun back.

title: The Bay
actors: Kristen Connolly, Kimberly Campbell, Christopher Denham, Michael Beasley, Andy Stahl, Kether Donohue, Stephen Kunken, Carrie Kroll, Mellie Boozer, Lauren Cohn
description: Two biological researchers discover that the waters of the picturesque Chesapeake Bay, which benefits the entire local community, are highly toxic. The mayor, however, in order not to alert the population, refuses to make the news public. In a short time, however, the situation will degenerate and the spread of a mutant race of parasites will lead humans to lose control of their minds and subsequently of their bodies, plunging everyone into absolute terror.
notes: What in fiction is an investigation that collects films shot in one day and then seized (videos from mobile phones, cameras, Skype, footage of an operator), intends to be a fake horror in found footage skillfully managed by massive doses of accompanying music, surprise effects and constant excuses to justify the presence of amateur footage. It is not surprising that among the producers there is the Oren Peli of Paranormal Activity, to make The Bay the carry-over product of a trend that is back in vogue. Instead, it is perplexing that it is directed by Rain Man's Barry Levinson: according to him, the film was born as a documentary on the pollution of the real Chesapeake Bay, only to become a reflection on the unveiling of truth in the digital age.

title: John Carter
actors: Mark Strong, Bryan Cranston, Taylor Kitsch, Dominic West, Willem Dafoe, Ciarán Hinds, Lynn Collins, James Purefoy, Daryl Sabara, Polly Walker, Samantha Morton, Thomas Haden Church
description: Confederate soldier John Carter (Taylor Kitsch) wakes up with no apparent explanation on the planet Mars. It is located in a desert land and populated by two different races of creatures: the giant, warmongering Green Martians and the peaceful Red Martians, who have always been fighting for power. Escaped from the clutches of the former, who had captured him, John meets Princess Dejah (Lynn Collins), who desperately needs to find a savior for her kingdom of red Martians, and has agreed to put his forces in the service of a new and epic conflict.
notes: Andrew Stanton treats the muscular hero like a cartoon, and in the best sequences the rock-hard veteran Southerner becomes, in the director's hands, a puppet tossed about by weightlessness and green alien barbarians. Unfortunately, Stanton rarely manages to bring out his playful and amused vein: the romantic subplot, which includes grueling explanations on the modalities of "teleportation" of Carter from Earth to Mars, plunges the film into boredom (also due to two interpreters without charisma) and the imagery evoked (from Conan the barbarian to Prince of Persia. The sands of time, passing through Star Wars) makes the film look like an opaque copy of blockbusters already seen.

title: Bullet to the Head
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Sung Kang, Jason Momoa, Sarah Shahi, Christian Slater, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Holt McCallany, Jon Seda, Weronika Rosati, Marcus Lyle Brown, Dominique DuVernay
description: Jimmy Bobo (Sylvester Stallone) has spent his entire life on the edge of legality as a professional hitman, sneaking through the streets of New Orleans when the mysterious murder of his partner leads him to join forces with Taylor Kwon. (Sung Sang), an Asian policeman from New York moved by anger and the desire for revenge against those who killed his colleague who accompanied him. Although they belong to two different sides of the law, they will soon realize that they have much more in common than they thought.
notes: Walter Hill's work involves: nervous directing for an old school action thriller with duels at the right time and jokes that break, winks at the western and the right references to (his) glorious past. Of course, The Hero of the Road is another thing, but New Orleans, despite Hurricane Katrina, remains a natural set, turbid and noir like very few, if treated by skilled hands like these.

title: Prometheus
actors: Michael Fassbender, Charlize Theron, Idris Elba, Ben Foster, Guy Pearce, Noomi Rapace, Logan Marshall-Green, Kate Dickie, Sean Harris, Rafe Spall, Patrick Wilson
description: In the near future, a team of researchers from a corporate body, in which Meredith Vickers (Charlize Theron) works, uncovers a trace that leads directly to the origins and first appearance of mankind on Earth. What they find in their hands, however, leads them on a journey to a remote and dark area of ??the universe, where they will have to collide with something that threatens the survival of all humanity.
notes: Obviously, fans of H.R. Giger put his hand to comparativist theories to tell you that the film is full of improbability and that the screenplay leaks. Sara. Scott instead puts his hand to all his visual paraphernalia which, even if it is no longer sparkling as it once was, is always epidermically engaging and entertaining (modestly, but amusing). As a sort of elegant hysteria of form, the director obsessively traces his cinematographic gesture, extinguishing it in a form of narcissistic eroticism that fatally, once again in spite of himself (?), Becomes a sign of the present time.

title: Hydra
actors: George Stults, Dawn Olivieri, Michael Shamus Wiles, Alex McArthur, Texas Battle, Polly Shannon, James Wlcek, Ricco Ross, Roark Critchlow, William Gregory Lee
description: On a small, remote and unexplored island, a group of explorers is devoured by Hydra, the mythological beast with three serpent heads, after discovering a lost temple of Zeus which also houses the legendary sword of Hercules. In the same place, two months later, a ship also arrives on which four wealthy men travel, called to participate in a dangerous game in which they must first hunt down four inmates, including a former marine, and then kill them. Soon, all of them will turn into prey and only meeting a survivor of the first massacre will help them.

title: 47 Ronin
actors: Keanu Reeves, Hiroyuki Sanada, Tadanobu Asano, Rinko Kikuchi, Kô Shibasaki, Jin Akanishi, Min Tanaka, Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, Neil Fingleton, Togo Igawa
description: After their lord and leader is forced to make harakiri by the will of the grim Lord Kira (Tadanobu Asano), a group of 47 samurai devise a plan to get their revenge and restore honor to their house. Among them, there is also Kai (Keanu Reeves), whose position is not clear to his companions due to the love that the ronin feels for Mika (Kô Shibasaki), the daughter of the deceased master.
notes: The problem with this remake of the film "The Revenge of the 47 Ronin" (1941) is the packaging, and we don't mean the gorgeous scenography and the slightly cloying but gaudy costumes, but the "digital" direction that jumps into an unlikely fantastic dimension with superficial historical reconstructions and a narration reduced to zero degree.
