We are not far from the latest generation Hollywood “fairy tales” (genre "Hansel & Gretel - Witch hunters"), and also in this case the model, more than the "chanbara" of the samurai, are videogames.

title: West of the Pecos
actors: Robert Mitchum, Barbara Hale, Richard Martin, Thurston Hall, Rita Corday, Russell Hopton, Bill Williams, Bruce Edwards, Harry Woods, Perc Launders
description: An elderly industrialist from San Francisco decides to give up a sedentary lifestyle and moves to the West, to the doctor's farm. During the journey with his daughter he gets lost and risks being prey to outlaws. But to the aid of the two comes Pecos, an honest and courageous young man.
notes: From the novel of the same name by Zane Gray.

title: Dracula's Guest
actors: Amy Lyndon, Wes Ramsey, Andrew Bryniarski, Kelsey McCann, Dan Speaker, Ryan Christiansen, Caia Coley, Thomas Garner, Robert Smith, Maya Waterman
description: The story of two young lovers, Bram and Elizabeth, forced by her father, Admiral Murray, to stay away from each other for a whole year to test their love and verify its solidity. It so happens, however, that in the meantime Count Dracula is in London, looking for a new home, and that he runs into young Elizabeth at the train station, while the girl is running away from her oppressive and despotic parent. Dracula kidnaps her and takes her to his castle, where he awaits the arrival of the girl's father to resolve an ancient dispute. Bram, however, is informed in the meantime of the kidnapping and takes action to save his beloved.

title: Children of the Corn
actors: David Anders, Kandyse McClure, Daniel Newman, Preston Bailey, Robert Gerdisch, Jordan Schmidt, Remington Jennings, Austin Dreher, Dominic Plue, Lexie Behr
description: 1975. On their way to California, a young doctor and his partner are forced to stop in Nebraska due to an accident that leads to the discovery of the body of a child with a cut throat and the consequent search for the nearest station. police to report the crime. Unfortunately for them, the first city they arrive in is Gatlin, inhabited only by children dedicated to human sacrifice and the cult of the corn god.
notes: Television adaptation of Stephen King's short story Children of Wheat, formerly the basis of the film Red Blood Wheat (1984).

title: Quantum Apocalypse
actors: Rhett Giles, Stephanie Jacobsen, Stuart Lafferty, Gigi Edgley, Randy Mulkey, Kristen Quintrall, Jerry Leggio, Jenna Craig, Shirly Brener, Collin Galyean
description: A large comet has entered a collision course with Earth and a small team of rebel scientists, with little money and little time, are trying to avoid total destruction of the planet. Someone, however, although not believed, had foreseen everything and seems to have the solution in hand: it is Terry, the autistic brother of the mayor of the town of Lafayette, who for some time had been writing in vain to the US scientific agency.

title: Battleship
actors: Liam Neeson, Alexander Skarsgård, Taylor Kitsch, Josh Pence, Brooklyn Decker, Rihanna, Jesse Plemons, Peter MacNicol, Tadanobu Asano, Hamish Linklater
description: To save the planet from the attack of a superior force, the US military brings into play the best forces in the sector to fight a war that sees the military involved on every front: land, sky and sea. Admiral of the Navy Shane (Liam Neeson) goes the task of coordinating the operations of the two largest warships, entrusted to the commands of the officer Alex Hopper (Taylor Kitsch), the boyfriend of his daughter Sam (Brooklyn Decler), and of the commanding officer Stone (Alexander Skarsgård), Alex's older brother.
notes: From the most static and vintage of board games, unearthed and rejuvenated in videogame format by Hasbro, the naval battle is the pretext for setting up an omnicitational shooter sideshow. Between thundering music and titanic slowdowns on the boat at the peak, patriotism of yesteryear and AC / DC shot at the ball, Battleship is the film you (not) expect: a two-dimensional, multisensory and monoexpressive blockbuster with (self) irony.

title: The Desperados
actors: Vince Edwards, Sylvia Syms, Benjamin Edney, Jack Palance, Sheila Burrell, George Maharis, Kate O'Mara, Christian Roberts, Kenneth Cope, Patrick Holt
description: Tired of the cruel methods that his father Josiah, a Southern war veteran, applies to avenge the death of his wife killed by the Northern military, David runs away from his family and hides under a false name in a small town in Texas, where, unbeknownst to all try to rebuild a new life. Six years later, however, fate brings Josiah and his gang of outlaws to the same village to carry out a bank robbery, and father and son find themselves face to face over a settling of scores that turns into a merciless family feud.

title: Super Eruption
actors: Richard Burgi, Juliet Aubrey, MyAnna Buring, Peter Vollebregt, Sarah Brown, Owen Davis, Daniel S. Ehrlich, Lincoln Frager, Trevor White, Mallorie Woodruff
description: Inside the Yellowstone park, a volcano awakens after millennia of inactivity and causes an eruption that threatens to destroy the climate of the entire planet, plunging the earth into an endless winter. To avert the danger, geologist Katy Brooks seeks the help of the national emergency coordination center but no one seems to give credence to her theories. The only one who offers to give her a hand is Chief Ranger Charlie Young, intent on saving the lives of visitors to the park.

title: Turbulent Skies
actors: Casper Van Dien, Brad Dourif, Nicole Eggert, Patrick Muldoon, Ted Monte, Mark Enticknap, Gerald Webb, Toni Adair, Teresa Barbosa, Cal Bartlett
description: After a plane crash caused by human error, a new software designed by Tom Woodard (Casper Van Dien) allows automation of the controls and is installed on a 747. During the first test drive, wanted by the arrogant son of the owner of the company and hosting potential investors on board, a computer virus attacks the system sending the plane off course. Unable to stop its mad flight, to avoid a massacre the US government decides to shoot down the aircraft but Tom, worried about his wife, sitting among the passengers, tries to get on board and take back the controls.

title: The Half-Breed
actors: Robert Young, Janis Carter, Jack Buetel, Barton MacLane, Reed Hadley, Porter Hall, Connie Gilchrist, Sammy White, Damian O'Flynn, Frank Wilcox
description: Tom Crawford instigates the Red Indians of a reservation to rebel against the whites: he hopes to take over a gold mine. But his plan is thwarted by half-caste Johnny the Hawk and gambler Dan Craig.
notes: An honest but rather monotonous western, clearly inspired by _L'amante indiana_ by Delmer Daves.

title: Coffy
actors: Pam Grier, Booker Bradshaw, Robert Doqui, William Elliott, Allan Arbus, Sid Haig, Barry Cahill, Lee de Broux, Ruben Moreno, Lisa Farringer
description: Coffy is an enterprising African American woman who works as a nurse. When he learns that his very young sister has been made drug addict by a pusher, he decides to devote himself to revenge, declaring war by all means on the drug traffickers who have infested the city.

title: The Woman
actors: Pollyanna McIntosh, Sean Bridgers, Angela Bettis, Lauren Ashley Carter, Shyla Molhusen, Frank Olsen, Carlee Baker, Tommy Nelson
description: A woman is the last survivor of a clan of savages that have roamed the Northwest Coast of the United States for years and is left alone after the last of her family was killed in a confrontation with the police. Christopher Cleek, a country lawyer with a precarious psychological balance, gets the crazy idea of ??capturing her in his head and, succeeding, takes the prisoner to his home to re-educate her in his own way, putting the lives of those around him at risk.
notes: Adaptation of the novel of the same name by writer Jack Ketchum.

title: YellowBrickRoad
actors: Cassidy Freeman, Anessa Ramsey, Laura Heisler, Clark Freeman, Tara Giordano, Alex Draper, Lee Wilkof, Michael Laurino, Sam Elmore
description: In 1940, in Friar, a small town of 542 inhabitants in the countryside of New Hampshire, inexplicably a large part of the population collected their possessions and went on a mountain path, losing their tracks. An American army team, after careful research, finds their bodies massacred and only one survivor, unable to tell what happened and gone mad. For seventy years that episode remains shrouded in silence until researchers, accompanied by the cameras of some directors, decide to return to the place to ascertain the truth, clashing with the hostility of the local population.

title: Never Back Down 2
actors: Michael Jai White, Evan Peters, Alex Meraz, Dean Geyer, Todd Duffee, Scottie Epstein, Jillian Murray, Lyoto Machida
description: Behind the doors of a college, four students from different socio-cultural backgrounds have in common a passion for hand-to-hand clashes and each, for different reasons and purposes, decides to participate in the clandestine tournament for collegiate students that an impresario is organizing and to be prepared from Case, a former star of the discipline now disgraced. Former boxer Zack, wrestler Tim, bullied salesman Justin and wrestler Mike begin their tough training and fighting but, when cops target Case, the suspicion arises within the group that one of them. they double-cross them and are actually a traitor.

title: Offspring
actors: Art Hindle, Amy Hargreaves, Ahna Tessler, Pollyanna McIntosh, Erick Kastel, Andrew Elvis Miller, Holter Graham, Stephen Grey, T.J. Graye, John Kochahney, Tommy Nelson
description: A tribe of cannibals that for decades has been terrorizing the east coast of the United States as far as Canada - made up of an adult man and woman and a group of children - returns to Dead River, Maine, eleven years after sowing blood, and decides to attack the villa where a couple with a young daughter lives.

title: The Midnight Hour
actors: Lee Montgomery, Shari Belafonte, LeVar Burton, Peter DeLuise, Dedee Pfeiffer, Jonna Lee, Jonelle Allen, Kevin McCarthy, Cindy Morgan, Dick Van Patten
description: A group of five teenagers, descendants of those who in the past fought against the evil witch Lucinda, to revive the Halloween night of the town they live in, steal some costumes dating back 300 years from a museum and go to the cemetery to try them on . Here, they find an ancient parchment in which some sacred passages are transcribed which, once read aloud by Melissa, a direct descendant of the witch Lucinda, bring back hordes of zombies, ready to ruin the party evening.

title: A Dead Calling
actors: Alexandra Holden, John Burke, Sid Haig, Leslie Easterbrook, Bill Moseley, Caia Coley, Timothy Oman, Micah Costanza, Mike Korich, Samm Enman
description: Journalist Rachel Beckwith accepts a new job at the editorial office of a local newspaper after a few months away from work due to a home robbery that ended in the murder of her boyfriend. As a first assignment, he finds himself having to do a research on the architecture of the city, visiting the house of Frank Sullivan, in prison on suspicion of being the author of a brutal massacre. Inside the house, however, Rachel comes into contact with the spirits of the victims, ready to reveal what really happened twenty years ago.

title: The Day
actors: Shawn Ashmore, Ashley Bell, Cory Hardrict, Shannyn Sossamon, Dominic Monaghan, Michael Eklund, Sophia Ewaniuk, Brianna Barnes, Kassidy Verreault
description: In a post-apocalyptic future where humanity is in danger of extinction, a group of five survivors, armed with rifles, axes and machetes, walk non-stop to find an oasis of peace. When one of them falls ill, the others are forced to slow down and seek refuge in an abandoned cottage. Here, under the lucid guidance of the leader Rick and with the stoicism and feral instinct of the provocative Mary, who has recently joined the group, they will decide what actions to take against a world from which they cannot escape for much longer.

title: Shock Waves
actors: Peter Cushing, Brooke Adams, Fred Buch, Jack Davidson, Luke Halpin, D.J. Sidney, Don Stout, John Carradine, Clarence Thomas, Sammy Graham
description: A group of adventurers sail the waters of the Bermuda Triangle in search of wrecks of sunken ships. After an accident with a ghost ship, they land on an island inhabited by a former Nazi hierarch who tells them a story that is unbelievable. Soon they will have to fight for their survival.

title: Setup
actors: Bruce Willis, Ryan Phillippe, 50 Cent, Jenna Dewan-Tatum, James Remar, Randy Couture, Will Yun Lee, Shaun Toub, Jay Karnes, Susie Abromeit
description: A group of friends land a fruitful heist, planned in every detail, which turns into something deadly when one of them betrays the others and runs away with the loot. Taking matters into his own hands, Sonny (50 Cent) seeks the help of the most dangerous bosses in town to recover what is rightfully his. But when he comes face to face with his former friend, Sonny will be forced to make a choice that will forever change the course of his life.

title: The Double
actors: Richard Gere, Topher Grace, Martin Sheen, Odette Annable, Stephen Moyer, Stana Katic, Chris Marquette, Tamer Hassan, Nicole Forester, Jeffrey Pierce
description: The assassination of a senator who seems to bear the signature of the ruthless Soviet killer Cassius, causes former CIA agent Paul Shepherdson (Richard Gere) to be convinced by the former mentor to support the young FBI agent Ben Geary in the investigation. (Topher Grace). Paul, who has hunted Cassius in the past, believes the killer is actually long dead, while Ben, who graduated with a thesis on Shepherdson's work, claims he is alive and has returned to do misdeeds. By analyzing the crimes of the past and comparing them with what has happened recently, the two discover that Cassius may be someone who is closer to them than they suspected.
notes: In writing, the proven pair Michael Brandt / Derek Haas shows off an uncommon confidence: in an iron story he resolves the ambiguity within Shepherdson in the first few minutes, risking running out of aces up his sleeve but creating others at each further junction. The direction, on the other hand, is limited to the manner by clinging to re-chewed expedients: the abuse of slow motion clashes with the anti-rhetorical construction of the story and with the formal dryness of the painting, while the sloppy flashback sequences are banally announced by gray filters. Venial sins of the “double” Brandt, brave veteran of the screenplay and debut director.

title: Machine Gun Preacher
actors: Gerard Butler, Michelle Monaghan, Michael Shannon, Madeline Carroll, Kathy Baker, Joshua Drew, Inga R. Wilson, Justin Michael Brandt, Barbara Coven, Souleymane Sy Savane
description: Fresh out of prison, Sam Childers (Gerard Butler) is almost sorry that his wife Lynn (Michelle Monaghan) has meanwhile approached the evangelical church where he found a job but, due to some troubles he gets into, decides to follow it. the footsteps to ensure peace of mind for himself, his wife and daughter Paige. One Sunday, struck by a speech on genocide in Sudan, Sam had the desire to bring his help directly to Africa and he left for a missionary journey from which he returned with a dream to fulfill: to build a house in Sudan for war orphans. . The violence he witnessed, however, threatens his sanity, putting his own life at risk.

title: Lovely Molly
actors: Gretchen Lodge, Alexandra Holden, Johnny Lewis, Ken Arnold, Brandon Thane Wilson, Tony Ellis, Daniel Ross, Lauren Lakis, Tara Garwood, Todd Ryan Jones
description: Newlyweds, Molly and Tim move into the country house of her father, who has recently died. Tim works as a hauler and warehouseman while Molly is trying to leave drug addiction behind. When her husband is away for work, something clicks in Molly that brings her back to remember painful moments from the past and she becomes increasingly isolated, until an evil presence unleashes both a physical and mental attack, plunging her into the abyss.

title: Savages
actors: Taylor Kitsch, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Salma Hayek, Benicio Del Toro, Blake Lively, John Travolta, Emile Hirsch, Demián Bichir, Trevor Donovan, Joel David Moore, Sandra Echeverría
description: In Laguna Beach, Southern California, two friends, a Buddhist businessman (Aaron Johnson) and a former marine (Taylor Kitsch), set up the largest marijuana plantation in the United States. In addition to the business, the two also share an interest and love for the beautiful O (Blake Lively) and have the support of a corrupt cop (John Travolta) but the venture is soon questioned by the interest of the drug traffickers. Mexicans, headed by the ruthless Elena (Salma Hayek), inseparable from her right arm Lado (Benicio Del Toro).
notes: Beyond the well-known discourses on the relativism of the Good (no character is completely "negative") and the parallelism between the "business" methods of drug trafficking and those of high finance (as well as the impossibility of believing in the "morality" of the respectable fund of the film), Le belve is actually a new U-turn with a psychedelic western flavor with playful (or mocking) narrative variables, closed (but no spoilers) between the "absurd" premise of the voice over in the incipit and the unexpected waste of its final redde rationem. Nothing to tear your hair about, of course: but a confirmation of the ineffability of a director who knows he has nothing more to say but continues to make a cinema, even if mocked by most, which too many can only dream of.

title: The Courier
actors: Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Mickey Rourke, Til Schweiger, Josie Ho, Lili Taylor, Mark Margolis, Miguel Ferrer, David Jensen, Adam Sibley, Tom Proctor
description: A courier (Jeffrey Dean Morgan), contemptuous of danger and embroiled in unlawful rounds, is tasked with delivering a suspicious briefcase to a well-known underworld boss, whose traces have long been lost. On his way to the delivery, he finds himself chased all over the country by corrupt FBI cops and agents as well as by criminals, willing to do anything to get their hands on the contents of what it carries and close loose ends with the boss.

title: 21 Jump Street
actors: Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum, Dave Franco, Johnny Depp, Ellie Kemper, Johnny Simmons, Brie Larson, Ice Cube, Jake M. Johnson, Dakota Johnson
description: Twenty-year-olds Schmidt (Jonah Hill) and Jenko (Channing Tatum), due to their adolescent appearance, are hired as agents in a special police team that investigates crimes in schools undercover. The two thus find themselves having to attend the courses of a local high school to foil a drug trafficking run by a group of students, facing a world that in a few years has totally changed from how they remembered it, and struggling with anxieties and teenage problems they thought they had left behind.
notes: We are on the side of the consciously unfaithful transposition to Starsky & Hutch; on the contrary, one can sense the effort of the screenwriters to reveal their knowledge of the stereotypes of the genre by putting them in plain sight, as blatantly as possible, with a meta-cinematographic intent that ends up biting its tail miserably. Overwhelmed by heavy humor, so eager to prove itself politically incorrect as to be unbearable, Lord & Miller's film behaves a bit like its own characters: convinced that it is very clever, it turns out to be incorrigibly idiotic.

title: R.I.P.D.
actors: Ryan Reynolds, Kevin Bacon, Jeff Bridges, Mary-Louise Parker, Stephanie Szostak, James Hong, Mike O'Malley, Marisa Miller, Robert Knepper
description: Nick (Ryan Reynolds) is a young cop who, after being killed for disrupting the plans of an unscrupulous criminal (Kevin Bacon), is hired for a special afterlife police team, the Rest In Peace Department. The goal of these cops is to allow their newly dead colleagues to rest in peace after finding out who killed them and carrying out their revenge. In the search for the culprit of his death, Nick is joined by a gunslinger (Jeff Bridges), who was murdered hundreds of years earlier.
notes: Adapted from the Dark Horse comic book of the same name, Schwentke's film doesn't have an original idea, I don't even have to pay for it, plundering "buddy cops movie", the sci-fi zany a la "Austin Powers" and, above all, the declared model ". Men in Black ", then giving a few taps to horror fantasy and even the western. The recycled humor, the unimaginative action system, the intertwining of holes, characters lost along the way and emotional developments from a nursery complete the breakdown. Reynolds in charcoal mode, Bridges a prisoner of himself and Bacon to add a piece to the self-destruction of a career, do not help. Typical movie to avoid, "R.I.P.D." suggests a new way to throw $ 130 million to the wind. One hundred and thirty. Millions. Dollars. You read that right.

title: You're Next
actors: Sharni Vinson, Nicholas Tucci, Wendy Glenn, AJ Bowen, Joe Swanberg, Amy Seimetz, Rob Moran, Barbara Crampton, L.C. Holt, Simon Barrett, Lane Hughes, Ti West, Margaret Laney
description: Crispian has the bad idea of ??bringing his new girlfriend Erin to the reception organized to celebrate his parents' wedding anniversary during an evening that brings back awkward conversations and tensions with the siblings. Suddenly, as the atmosphere has become unmanageable, an arrow shatters a window of the house and a gang of assassins - disguised as animals and with a wide variety of weapons at their disposal - bursts into the house, starting a brutal carnage.
notes: What saves Wingard's film from the darkest predictability is a healthy and malevolent ferocity that would seem reminiscent of the most grim seventies exploitation and a not exactly banal anti-family subtext intended as a capitalist protocell. Wingard, like a Swedish death metal band, while playing well-known riffoni, manages, thanks to the evident pleasure it exudes, to redeem the inevitable déjà vu of "You're Next" and to promote it to a tiny cult object despite the looming threat of probable sequels.

title: The Violent Kind
actors: Cory Knauf, Taylor Cole, Bret Roberts, Christina McDowell, Tiffany Shepis, Nick Tagas, Joe Egender, Joseph McKelheer, Samuel Child, MacKenzie Firgens
description: During a gathering of bickers in a wood, a girl appears possessed by a mysterious force. Meanwhile, a strange rockabilly band arrives and kidnaps them.
notes: The film is lost between sudden changes of register, citations of _La Casa_ by Raimi and Tarantino, without having the inventiveness or the means.

title: The Grey
actors: Liam Neeson, Dermot Mulroney, James Badge Dale, Frank Grillo, Joe Anderson, Nonso Anozie, Dallas Roberts, Ben Bray, Larissa Stadnichuk, James Bitonti
description: The plane on which a group of workers from an oil pipeline is traveling crashes in a remote area of ??Alaska and the few survivors, led by Ottway (Liam Neeson), find themselves having to deal with the adversities dictated by the rigidity of the climate and by an environment hostile to them, covered with snow and ice and inhabited by a pack of ravenous wolves. Before their forces and resources run out, they will be forced to engage in a frantic battle against time to save their skin.
notes: The Gray is a B movie that, however, played a remarkable championship in Serie A, given the good American box office, while based on ancient situations and concepts (a composite group besieged by external threats), developed with somewhat scholastic diligence. In the sense that everything works because the mechanism of history is well oiled, but nothing is surprising.

title: Roadracers
actors: David Arquette, John Hawkes, Salma Hayek, Jason Wiles, William Sadler, O'Neal Compton, Christian Klemash, Aaron Vaughn, Tammy Brady Conrad, Mark Lowenthal
description: Rebel Dude dreams of escaping the monotonous little town he lives in and becoming a rockabilly star, but gets caught up in trouble with the insane local sheriff and thug son.
notes: After the success of _El Mariachi_, Rodriguez writes and directs this TV movie, broadcast in the USA by Showtime, the first episode of a series entitled _Rebel Highway_ which pays homage to B movies and the exploitation of the 50s. In this case the starting point is the 1959 film of the same name but the plot soon becomes secondary to the hyperkinetic and virtuosic style and particularly ironic dialogues. Stars and stripes debut for Salma Hayek, confirmed by Rodriguez also in the following _Desperado_.

title: Bunraku
actors: Josh Hartnett, Demi Moore, Woody Harrelson, Ron Perlman, Kevin McKidd, Gackt, Shun Sugata, Jordi Mollà, Emily Kaiho, Mike Patton
description: In a future where guns have been outlawed, power rests in the hands of those who know how to wield swords, knives and daggers to enforce laws and conditions. Nicola (Ron Perlman) is the most feared warrior in the entire east coast of the United States and he runs the command in a tyrannical manner along with a handful of talented criminals but more than one person has unfinished business with him and would like to see him dead. One evening, in fact, a mustachioed vagabond (Josh Hartnett) arrives in a bar who, announcing that he wants to kill Nicola, looks for someone willing to help him. His appeal is answered by Yoshi, a Japanese swordsman for some time seeking revenge, with whom he sets up a group of assassins that also includes Yoshi's uncle and cousin, the philosophical Bartender (Woody Harrelson) and Alexandra (Demi Moore), a woman who had a stormy relationship with Nicola in the past.

title: Arena
actors: Kellan Lutz, Samuel L. Jackson, Nina Dobrev, Irene Choi, James Remar, Daniel Dae Kim, Mayra Leal, Vanessa Branch, Johnny Messner, Derek Mears, Katia Winter
description: After being kidnapped, the young David Lord finds himself catapulted into the wild world of fighting to the death, set up in modern arenas where two gladiators find themselves fighting to the death for an audience of spectators who follow them thanks to the internet. The shows, which guarantee an excellent economic return, are organized and managed by an unscrupulous man (Samuel L. Jackson), a bloody supervisor who monitors everything with the help of a computer and two twin sisters, willing to do anything. to indulge him.

title: Parasomnia
actors: Dylan Purcell, Patrick Kilpatrick, Jeffrey Combs, Cherilyn Wilson, Timothy Bottoms, Janet Tracy Keijser, Kathryn Leigh Scott, Brennan Bailey, Dov Tiefenbach, Alison Brie
description: College student Danny Sloan has fallen madly in love with Laura Baxter, a girl admitted to a psychiatric hospital due to the sleep disorder she suffers from after a tragic accident. Laura spends her days sleeping, except waking up for a few minutes and on very rare occasions, and has become the obsession of Byron Volpe, a psychopathic killer hospitalized in the same facility and with extraordinary powers capable of guiding entire armies of evil creatures belonging to the kingdom. of the unconscious. When Danny takes Laura away in hopes of helping her, he unleashes Byron's wrath which forces him to face unimaginable horrors.

title: Trick 'r Treat
actors: Dylan Baker, Rochelle Aytes, Quinn Lord, Lauren Lee Smith, Moneca Delain, Tahmoh Penikett, Brett Kelly, Britt McKillip, Isabelle Deluce, Jean-Luc Bilodeau, Alberto Ghisi, Samm Todd, Anna Paquin, Brian Cox, Leslie Bibb, Connor Christopher Levins
description: Several stories are intertwined on Halloween night. A young girl dressed as a Little Red Riding Hood goes to a party. A serial killer wanders the streets, along with his son, in search of a pumpkin. A hermit receives a visit from a gnome ...
notes: A negligible horror without too many hints of originality.

title: Wrath of the Titans
actors: Sam Worthington, Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes, Rosamund Pike, Bill Nighy, Danny Huston, Toby Kebbell, Edgar Ramirez, Lily James, Reg Wayment
description: A decade after defeating the monstrous Kraken, Perseus (Sam Worthington) retired to live in a small fishing village with his little son Helius. On Olympus, however, the battle between the gods and the Titans is going through a very delicate phase: the gods are weakened by the lack of human devotion and this has benefited Kronos, the terrible leader of the Titans, forced to live in the dark meanders of the Mount Tartarus, and father of Zeus, Hades and Poseidon. In an attempt to overthrow Zeus, Hades and Ares make an agreement with Kronos and, to prevent them from succeeding in their enterprise, Queen Andromeda, the demigod Agenor and Hephaestus ask for the help of Perseus, who gets involved in an insidious underground mission. .
notes: Yet another stage of that "creative revisionism" of the peplum that has a home in Hollywood. This sequel grinds less yawns by softening Sam Worthington's rocky monoexpression with the addition of supporting actors. In a world where the gods die from lack of affection and men live the American Dream discovering themselves better than the gods, the illegitimate son of Poseidon (Toby Kebbell), to whom we owe the humorous notes (in the margin), brings us back down to earth. . Andromeda matures the pugnacious nature of Rosamund Pike, losing charm and credibility. Not so the stereoscopic descent to Tartarus, a compelling maze of joints and the only successful gear of a badly exploited 3D.

title: Sleepaway Camp
actors: Felissa Rose, Jonathan Tiersten, Karen Fields, Christopher Collet, Mike Kellin, Katherine Kamhi, Paul DeAngelo, Tom Van Dell, Loris Sallahian, John E. Dunn
description: Angela Baker (Felissa Rose) is a 13-year-old girl on vacation in a summer camp with her cousin. The two are the object of the jokes, sometimes even heavy ones, of the other boys of the camp: in particular Angela is the favorite victim and proves unable to react. Furthermore, Angela is a very taciturn girl and carries within her the childhood trauma of her father's premature death. A succession of strange and cruel crimes has as its object the patrons of the campsite. The suspicions are immediately directed to Angela Baker, but the girl hides a shocking secret.

title: The Devil Inside
actors: Fernanda Andrade, Simon Quarterman, Evan Helmuth, Ionut Grama, Suzan Crowley, Bonnie Morgan, Brian Johnson, Preston James Hillier, D.T. Carney, Talyan Wright
description: In 1989, Maria Rossi called the police to confess that she had brutally killed three people during an exorcism she was subjected to. Twenty years later, his daughter Isabella tries to shed some light on what happened that night to understand if her mother is crazy or really possessed and goes to visit her at the Italian psychiatric hospital where she is locked up. Witnessing a series of inexplicable events, Isabella requests the help of two young exorcists who introduce her into the underworld of exorcisms not authorized by the Vatican. With horror, she discovers that her mother is possessed by four demons, a symbol of an evil that is difficult to eradicate.
notes: What to say: the fans will find something to rejoice, because the paraphernalia of scares is quite wide, but the experiment is short of breath, the POV tires quickly and then, let's face it, on the same topic and with scenic ideas not dissimilar, even if in an American and Protestant context, enough money had already been spent on Daniel Stamm's Last Exorcism (2010). However, the good US income suggests imitations and / or prosecutions.

title: Hammer of the Gods
actors: Zachery Ty Bryan, Mac Brandt, Daz Crawford, Nicole Ennemoser, Rafael Jordan, John Laskowski, Hristo Mitzkov, Melissa Osborne, Velislav Pavlov, Alexis Peters
description: Thor and his heroic brother Baldur lead an expedition of Viking friends traveling the world in search of glory and a place to settle permanently. During the journey of exploration, however, they come across strange and legendary creatures thirsty for blood.

title: Gravity
actors: Sandra Bullock, George Clooney
description: Dr. Ryan Stone (Sandra Bullock), a brilliant medical engineer, is on her first mission aboard a shuttle. Join the team of veteran Matt Kowalsky (George Clooney), in command of his latest expedition before retiring. Theirs is a routine journey that turns into disaster when, due to an unforeseen event, the spacecraft explodes, killing the rest of the crew. Alone in space, Ryan and Matt lose all contact with the Earth and fear turns into panic when with the little oxygen at their disposal they try the impossible to get home.
notes: Cuarón is no ordinary director, capable as he is of moving from Harry Potter to "Children of Men". The chill of silent technology suspended in the void is constantly challenged by the warmth of an acting that keeps body temperature level. The finale, of Darwinian solemnity (life comes out of the water) is redundant, but not the scenic challenge, the concentration of the movement of the film and its look of spatial modernity. It's not really years where you can throw away stuff like that, carefully offered in the Hollywood mainstream.

title: Freerunner
actors: Sean Faris, Danny Dyer, Tamer Hassan, Amanda Fuller, Seymour Cassel, Mariah Bonner, Casey Durkin, Jia Mae, Ryan Doyle, Curtis Taylor
description: Ryan (Sean Faris) and his fellow runners are used to taking big risks and pushing their physical abilities to the limit in order to earn some money thanks to the services, even dangerous, that they can offer by running from one side of the city to the other. . Frank (Danny Dyer), on the other hand, is a gambler who has no respect for human life and together with a group of people bets on Ryan and his friends, whose neck has been affixed a time bomb: whoever wins. in an hour minutes he will be the first to reach the finish line on the other side of the city while the others will die.
notes: The torture porn breakthrough comes with a wave of ridicule between the volunteer and the accidental, locking the extreme racers in explosive collars that will reduce their heads to a pulp if they don't reach their target in 60 minutes. All this, as in a metropolitan hostel, to the delight of a handful of perverse billionaires who follow every moment through improbable strategic cameras. Every single twist of the plot is so far-fetched as to be hilarious, the acting is below guard level or 3 meters above the top: a memorable mess that, with an extra bit of self-irony, could have been a cult.

title: Crocodile
actors: Mark McLachlan, Caitlin Martin, Chris Solari, D.W. Reiser, Julie Mintz, Rhett Wilkins, Greg Wayne, Harrison Young, Terrence Evans, Vern Crofoot
description: A group of young people go on a trip to the marshes in the middle of the forest on a raft: however, there is a huge crocodile waiting for them. And the tour turns into a horrible experience.

title: The Aurora Encounter
actors: Jack Elam, Peter Brown, Carol Bagdasarian, Dottie West, Will Mitchell, Charles B. Pierce, Mickey Hays, George 'Spanky' McFarland, Mindy Smith, Carly McCullough
description: Early 1900s. The adventure of human flight is taking its first timid steps, but the small and quiet town of Aurora, Texas can already exhibit a very sophisticated aircraft capable of amazing performance. However, it is not a man-made machine, but a UFO that circles around, arousing curiosity and concern among the bewildered inhabitants who spot it. The only alien on board, a gaunt and inoffensive creature who came to Earth with the best of intentions, immediately finds the candid sympathy of children, but not that of adults, for whom he is a foreigner, a "different" to be looked upon with fear and distrust. Only Charlie Hawkins, an old hermit, welcomes him without prejudice.

title: The Prowler
actors: Vicky Dawson, Christopher Goutman, Lawrence Tierney, Farley Granger, Cindy Weintraub, Lisa Dunsheath, David Sederholm, Bill Nunnery, Thom Bray, Diane Rode
description: It all began back in 1945, at Avalon Bay: at night, during the graduation dance, the young Rosemary and her boyfriend are brutally killed by a strange soldier returning from the war. Thirty years later, on the occasion of a new dance evening organized to celebrate graduation, the nightmare returns through a series of horrendous crimes. The boys of a lazy American citizen must therefore deal with a cruel killer who kills inexplicably.

title: Bereavement
actors: Alexandra Daddario, Spencer List, Brett Rickaby, Michael Biehn, Nolan Gerard Funk, Kathryn Meisle, Peyton List, John Savage, Valentina de Angelis, Greg Wood
description: In 1989 in Minersville, Pennsylvania, little Martin Bristol is pushed by the psychopath Graham Sutter inside his car while playing in the backyard. The man is a serial killer who has massacred mostly young teenage girls to atone for his own guilt and has kidnapped the child to teach him everything it takes to continue his work. Five years later, the teenager Allison goes to live at her uncle's house, after the death of her parents, in the vicinity of Graham's house and she stumbles upon the horrors she has committed, ending up immersed herself in an unimaginable evil from which there is no way out.
notes: Sequel to the film Malevolence (2004).

title: The Howling: Reborn
actors: Landon Liboiron, Lindsey Shaw, Ivana Milicevic, Jesse Rath, Niels Schneider, Frank Schorpion, Kristian Hodko, Sean Mercado, Sacha Charles, Erin Agostino
description: Shortly after graduating from high school, Will Kidman decides that it's time to put aside the books that made him the best student in high school and try to devote himself to conquering Eliana Wynter, the girl he is secretly in love with. since four years. One night, however, Will is attacked by a werewolf from which he discovers that he is the descendant of a lineage of werewolves, thus finding himself making a choice that will forever condition his future and endanger Eliana's life, as well as his, due to an army of enemies bent on killing him.

title: The Expendables 2
actors: Jason Statham, Bruce Willis, Sylvester Stallone, Liam Hemsworth, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jean-Claude Van Damme, Jet Li, Chuck Norris, Dolph Lundgren, Scott Adkins, Terry Crews, Randy Couture, Yu Nan, Charisma Carpenter
description: During a dangerous mission in Eastern Europe commissioned by Mr. Church (Bruce Willis), Tool is murdered by a group of bloodthirsty fighters, employed by a terrorist willing to change the geopolitical order of the whole world with six kilos of plutonium. for military use ready to explode. His companions, the mercenaries in the service of the CIA led by Barney Ross (Sylvester Stallone), joined by the two new members Billy Timmons (Liam Hemsworth) and Maggie (Yu Nan), vow to take revenge one day for the murder and they work to ensure that every detail is well planned. The revenge for the mercenaries will come after a long trail of destruction in the ranks of the enemy forces.
notes: Only at times the irony resurfaces with success, for example with a pun about Chuck Norris reported by Norris himself or when Dolph Lundgren cites his own scientific studies, and Schwarzy and Willis are priceless on a Smart where they find it hard to get into. But the other lines are stale: "Houston, we have a problem." Or even painful: «Now who is missing? Rambo? ». Also this time, there is not the slightest sense of the epic: although in English the mercenaries are called "expendable" in reality they are not at all. In addition, the actors have a good say that human and non-superhero characters, when in hindsight they are put in less difficulty than the Avengers. It will still appreciate the target audience, that is, the nostalgic of action a lot a kilo of the old days, but only up to a certain point. The final duel between Stallone and Van Damme is choreographically nil: Schwarzenegger comments that they are museum pieces, but more than a joke it is a bitter observation.

title: Rosewood Lane
actors: Rose McGowan, Lauren Vélez, Ray Wise, Bill Fagerbakke, Lesley-Anne Down, Lin Shaye, Rance Howard, Ashton Moio, Judson Mills, Steve Tom
description: Sonny Blake, a psychiatrist who dispenses advice from the microphones of a radio talk show, decides after the death of his alcoholic father to return to the house where he spent his childhood. As soon as she arrives, she realizes how the whole neighborhood is terrified of Derek Barber, the boy who delivers the newspapers in the morning and who has a habit of turning children's nursery rhymes into macabre omens of what could happen, convincing himself that behind the death of the parent there is her hand and that she is the next intended victim. Since no one seems to give rise to her words and the evidence gathered against Derek is insufficient to initiate a police investigation, Sonny is forced to face her fears alone, ending up the protagonist of a grueling hunt in which she is the one the prey.

title: This Means War
actors: Tom Hardy, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Pine, Laura Vandervoort, Til Schweiger, Chelsea Handler, Natassia Malthe, Warren Christie, Rebel Wilson, Angela Bassett
description: Two of the best agents the CIA has ever met, Tuck and Franklin (Tom Hardy and Chris Pine), have been close friends since time immemorial, loyal to each other on business as well as private matters. At least until the day they both discover they are dating the same girl, Lauren (Resee Witherspoon), from whom they hide that they are aware of her double game by deciding to challenge each other in a confrontation to the massacre that will decide which of the two will be the lucky one who can. continue the love relationship.
notes: Not the triangle, if it is orchestrated by McG, who has always nourished more attention for muscle tension than for cardiac expansion. Contaminating romcom with action is a mediocre expedient, when the protagonists are stale caricatures of professional deformation: she tests the suitors as if they were detergents, they enter her house with a bug and a video camera and come out as a synthesis of the perfect man. In love and war, everything is allowed, but brain cells are urgently needed for the tried and tested “conqueror's war scheme”.

title: The Big Trail
actors: John Wayne, Marguerite Churchill, El Brendel, Tully Marshall, Tyrone Power Sr., David Rollins, Frederick Burton, Ian Keith, Charles Stevens, Louise Carver
description: A pioneer caravan ventures west to found a colony across the Oregon River. It includes, among others, a trapper (John Wayne), a girl with brother and sister, a gunslinger in disarmament, reduced to being a braggart, and two renegades, who have committed a murder. The journey will not be easy or without dangers.
notes: Classic Western by one of the authors who helped define the rules of the genre.

title: Catch .44
actors: Bruce Willis, Forest Whitaker, Nikki Reed, Michael Rosenbaum, Brad Dourif, Deborah Ann Woll, Malin Akerman, Shea Whigham, Edrick Browne, Jimmy Lee Jr., P.J. Marshall
description: Tes (Malin Akerman), Kara (Nikki Reed) and Dawn (Deborah Ann Woll), three criminals looking for the chance of their life, are hired by the evil Mel (Bruce Willis), an opportunistic drug boss, who entrusts them with a delicate task to complete. Along the way, the three girls face many difficulties caused primarily by a dangerous killer (Forest Whitaker) who moves in the uniform of a policeman killed long ago. To create further problems comes the certainty of having been scammed by Mel: now, however, they can no longer hold back and are somehow forced to carry out their mission.

title: Storm War
actors: Jason London, Wes Brown, Erin Cahill, Stacy Keach, Stanton Barrett, Jesse De Luna, Miles Doleac, Robert Grimm, Gary Grubbs, Indigo, Lance E. Nichols
description: After years of misunderstanding, David and Jacob Grange, the two sons of a formerly famous meteorologist, find themselves putting aside their differences to investigate some strange climatic phenomena that are affecting the entire Washington district. The suspicions that behind the machinations of the father are confirmed when the latter, interrupting the radio and television broadcasts, communicates to the nation that he is ready to alter atmospheric phenomena causing unprecedented destruction if a certain senator does not give up the posts he has just taken on in the Department of Defense . The two brothers just have to join forces to understand what are the motivations that move the father and be able to stop him in time.

title: Excision
actors: AnnaLynne McCord, Traci Lords, Ariel Winter, Roger Bart, John Waters, Malcolm McDowell, Marlee Matlin, Matthew Gray Gubler, Jeremy Sumpter, Ray Wise
description: Pauline, a depressed medical student with some mental stability issues, is obsessed with the continued approval of a pushy mother who has pinned all her failed life expectancies on her. In order not to disappoint her, the young woman is ready for any action, even to stain her hands with blood with increasingly atrocious and extreme crimes, which lead her to hate the church and, in particular, the Reverend William. Nobody seems to understand the reasons for her actions except her sister Grace, suffering from cystic fibrosis, but the situation begins to degenerate with unpredictable implications when Pauline gets into her head the idea of ??losing her virginity, losing control of her actions.

title: Life of Pi
actors: Suraj Sharma, Irrfan Khan, Rafe Spall, Gérard Depardieu, Adil Hussain, Tabu, Ayush Tandon, Shravanthi Sainath, Andrea Di Stefano, Vibish Sivakumar, Ayan Khan
description: Pi Patel is the young son of the owner of an Indian zoo and, living in close contact with animals, he learned about their habits and characters with encyclopedic precision. Pi and his family, however, are forced to leave India and embark for Canada taking some of the zoo's animals with them but the ship they travel on sinks and only he and the giant Bengal tiger that Pi call Richard Parker. At the mercy of the ocean waters for 227 days, Pi manages to save himself from Parker's ferocious instincts thanks to his knowledge and the anomalous relationship that is created between them.
notes: The adaptation of the novel of the same name by Yann Martel, winner of the prestigious Man Booker Prize and a fixed point among the bestsellers of the “New York Times”, is remarkable. Also complicit in advanced CGI techniques, the film represents an important evolutionary step, giving the pleasant sensation that the third dimension is not only an end in itself, but rather is indispensable in transporting certain truly spectacular settings to the big screen. Doubtfulness and "political correctness" are not lacking, of course, but the effect is less dull than what could have been risked.

title: Final Examination
actors: Kari Wuhrer, Brent Huff, Debbie Rochon, Amy Lindsay, Belinda Gavin, Ted Monte, Jim Valdez, Richard Gabai, Marc Vahanian, Stefany Baclaan
description: Jenny Davis, newly admitted to the exclusive Hobbs College, dies in a car crash during an initiation test, necessary to get her into the most prestigious sector of the college, the Sigmakappa. The other girls try to hide the truth until, a month later, a mysterious young woman, Jill, arrives on campus.
notes: Cheap, straight-to-video slasher from the sculptural director of Bikini Girls from the Lost Planet.

title: V/H/S
directors: Adam Wingard, Glenn McQuaid, Radio Silence, David Bruckner, Joe Swanberg, Ti West
actors: Joe Swanberg, Adam Wingard, Lisa Marie Thomas, Sophia Takal, Kate Lyn Sheil, John Walcutt, Calvin Reeder, Matt Bettinelli-Olpin, Jason Yachanin, Chad Villella
description: A group of petty criminals is hired by a mysterious subject to recover a rare piece of found footage, kept inside a dilapidated house in the center of an isolated area. As soon as they arrive at the scene, everyone realizes that the task is not as simple as they thought when they find themselves in front of a corpse surrounded by piles of videotapes, containing increasingly gruesome and very different recordings.

title: Safe
actors: Jason Statham, Catherine Chan, Chris Sarandon, Robert John Burke, Reggie Lee, Danny Hoch, James Hong, Anson Mount, Victor Pagan, Oksana Lada, Igor Jijikine
description: Luke Wright (Jason Statham) is a former special agent who participates in second-rate mixed martial arts matches to support his family. Called to take part in a rigged fight, Luke refuses to comply with the orders given to him, antagonizing a powerful Russian mafia boss who, in revenge, kills his wife and forces him to a lonely life on the run. Wandering through the streets of New York, Luke saves the life of Mei, a 12-year-old Chinese girl used for her brilliant math skills by the same Russian mafia boss who also persecutes him and is also sought after by the Triad and some corrupt cops because of numeric code that only you know. To protect her and redeem herself from an existence of humiliation and suffering, Luke decides to take care of her at any cost, waging a bloody war against those who want her dead.

title: Act of Valor
actors: Alex Veadov, Ailsa Marshall, Roselyn Sanchez, Emilio Rivera, Jason Cottle, Nestor Serrano, Gonzalo Menendez, Drea Castro, Timothy Gibbs, Carla Jimenez
description: The core Bandit, a platoon of US Navy special agents, is employed to rescue a CIA agent who has been kidnapped under somewhat suspicious circumstances. As the team hunts down kidnappers around the world, they come across a dangerous terrorist cell planning a deadly attack on the United States. To prevent thousands of civilians from losing their lives to senseless folly, the military will be called upon to bring out all their courage to demonstrate their attachment to the nation, the team and their own families.
notes: Aesthetics of light shooting, agile and tight editing, flashes of raw violence, subjective views from the Seals rifle and a cast composed mainly of former soldiers make the action story for images a high example of postmodern war movie graphics. It is a pity that the aesthetic core is closed in a dramaturgical package imbued with the worst macho rhetoric.

title: The Innkeepers
actors: Sara Paxton, Pat Healy, Kelly McGillis, George Riddle, Alison Bartlett, Lena Dunham, Jake Ryan, John Speredakos
description: After more than one hundred years of service, the Yankee Pedlar Inn, a hotel with a glorious past, is preparing to close its doors forever. Claire and Luke, the last two employees left at the facility, are determined to let the world find out what caused what is believed to be one of the most haunted hotels in New England, due to the presence of the spirit of an unhappy bride. failure. While they are busy recording the strange noises they hear, just seven days after closing, they welcome two unexpected guests, a former actress recycled into a medium (Kelly McGillis) and a mysterious elderly gentleman with somewhat suspicious behavior.

title: Hostel: Part III
actors: Brian Hallisay, Kip Pardue, Kelly Thiebaud, Skyler Stone, Thomas Kretschmann, Zulay Henao, John Hensley, Barry Livingston, Sarah Habel, Evelina Oboza, Danny Jacobs, Nickola Shreli
description: Before marrying girlfriend Amy, Scott is persuaded by his best friend Carter to say goodbye to the carefree single life with a bachelor party in Las Vegas of sex, booze and wild fun, to share with two other close friends. During the evening, the group is bewitched by two sexy escorts who manage to be followed to an exclusive private party where the four friends will become the subject of sadistic torture by a secret organization of wealthy bored in search of strong emotions.

title: Chicago Overcoat
actors: Frank Vincent, Kathrine Narducci, Mike Starr, Stacy Keach, Armand Assante, Danny Goldring, Tim Gamble, Martin Shannon, Barret Walz, Gina D'Ercoli
description: Lou Marazano was Chicago's top killer for decades. Part of an organization called Chicago Outfit, he went down in the history of the underworld for never having left a trace behind his crimes but, having reached the age of sixty, nothing seems to be left of his glory. On the threshold of old age, Lou needs money to earn a well-deserved pension and move with her beloved Lorraine away from the city. For this reason he agrees to do a big favor to the boss Stefano D'Agostino, worried that after the arrest for corruption of an important public official, the links between the underworld, politics and the police forces will be discovered. To complete the task, however, he must beware of detective Ralph Maloney who, strong in the belief that his hand is behind the wave of new crimes, is constantly on his ribs to frame him once and for all.

title: Castle Freak
actors: Jeffrey Combs, Barbara Crampton, Jonathan Fuller, Jessica Dollarhide, Massimo Sarchielli, Elisabeth Kaza, Luca Zingaretti, Helen Stirling, Alessandro Sebastian Satta, Raffaella Offidani
description: An American family, made up of a father and mother on a collision course (Jeffrey Combs and Barbara Crampton) and their blind daughter (Jessica Dollarhide), travels to Italy to visit a castle they have inherited. They do not know, however, that the castle hides dark secrets and that a deformed being thirsty for revenge lurks in the basement.

title: Mirrors 2
actors: Nick Stahl, Emmanuelle Vaugier, Evan Jones, Christy Carlson Romano, William Katt, Lawrence Turner, Stephanie Honore, Jon Michael Davis, Wayne Pére, Lance E. Nichols
description: After losing his girlfriend in a tragic accident for which he feels responsible, the agent Max struggles to overcome what has happened and return to normal, considering the possibility of ending his life several times. Reluctantly he accepts the position of night watchman at a shopping center, where in every mirror or window he begins to see the ghost of a young girl, who is desperately trying to get in touch with him to carry out his purposes of revenge against of those responsible for his death.

title: Warm Bodies
actors: Nicholas Hoult, Teresa Palmer, John Malkovich, Rob Corddry, Dave Franco, Analeigh Tipton, Cory Hardrict, Justin Bradley, Patrick Sabongui, Ayisha Issa
description: R (Nicholas Hoult) is a young zombie in the middle of an existential crisis who, unlike his lineage that is putting the entire United States on fire, dreams of being able to have a normal life. Without memories of the past and without any identity, after killing a human teenager and eating his brain, he meets his girlfriend Julie (Teresa Palmer), whose sweetness and vitality push him to experience emotions never known before and make a decision that will change. forever the fate of the entire planet.
notes: Jonathan Levine's film is a putrescent and enthusiastic Bildungsroman, ventilated by the freshness of the original pages (by Isaac Marion, first-time author) and rides the trend of urban gothic full of erotic and sentimental implications. Levine makes fun of himself without forgetting the essence of every revolution: the heartbeat of the individual can put the blood of a people back into circulation. Alive or (not) dead.

title: Sinister
actors: Ethan Hawke, Vincent D'Onofrio, James Ransone, Fred Dalton Thompson, Clare Foley, Cameron Ocasio, Victoria Leigh, Juliet Rylance, Michael Hall D'Addario, Blake Mizrahi
description: Ellison (Ethan Hawke) is a writer-journalist who constantly changes house with his family, moving into residences that have been scenes of heinous crimes that he intends to tell in the books he writes. During his last move, he finds himself inside a house where an entire family has been massacred. Thanks to a box containing old footage, Ellison discovers that the murder was the work of a supernatural entity that also endangers his life and that of his loved ones.
notes: From The Blair Witch Project to the unprecedented V / H / S, passing through Paranormal Activity, there are a multitude of fake cinematic exhibits that conceal horror stories. In Sinister there are moments of real tension, but Derrickson resorts to elementary terrorist strategies, above all to a sound design beyond any aesthetic and narrative coherence. The script, then, is quite naive: only the protagonist does not understand who is filming.

title: The Possession
actors: Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Kyra Sedgwick, Madison Davenport, Natasha Calis, Grant Show, Matisyahu, Agam Darshi, Quinn Lord, Rob LaBelle, John Cassini, Nana Gbewonyo
description: Clyde (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) and ex-wife Stephanie (Kyra Sedgwick) start to worry when their youngest daughter Em becomes obsessed with an antique wooden box bought at a flea market. As Em's behavior becomes more and more mysterious, the couple fear the presence of an evil force and deepen their research on the box. They thus discover that it is a dibbuk, which belonged to a group of women of Jewish origin locked up in the Lodz concentration camp in Poland during the Second World War. As per legend, once opened, the dibbuk has released an evil spirit capable of taking over human bodies and Em is in serious danger of life.
notes: Alongside sonic gasps, childish voices, white eyes, joint and subjective impersonal convulsions, the Danish Ole Bornedal showcases a retro taste for settings and lighting, making the most of the potential of (counter) light to convey horror. At the same time, four-handed writing inserts the figure of Dibbuk, an evil soul taken from the Jewish tradition and partly betrayed in its presuppositions by a staging that it gives shape (first a hand coming out of the possessed's throat, then even the whole figure) to a spirit that should be disembodied.

title: Django Unchained
actors: Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio, Samuel L. Jackson, James Remar, Kerry Washington, Don Johnson, Franco Nero, Jonah Hill, Walton Goggins, Dennis Christopher, Dana Michelle Gourrier, Nichole Galicia, Laura Cayouette, Ato Essandoh, Miriam F. Glover, James Russo, Russ Tamblyn, Amber Tamblyn, Bruce Dern, M.C. Gainey, Danièle Watts, Zoe Bell, Michael Bowen, Robert Carradine, James Parks, Tom Savini, Michael Parks, Quentin Tarantino, Misty Upham
description: In the southern United States, two years before the Civil War, the black slave Django (Jamie Foxx) was able to regain his freedom thanks to King Schultz (Christoph Waltz), a former German dentist turned bounty hunter, who he mentors and guides with the hope that Django will lead him to the dangerous Brittle brothers. After learning to juggle guns and duels, Django in turn becomes an excellent bounty hunter but in his head he continues to have only one goal to materialize at any cost: to be able to track down his wife and free her from the slavery to which Calvin Candie forces her. (Leonardo DiCaprio), the diabolical owner of some plantations in Mississippi, where slaves are trained to fight against each other for the sheer amusement of their master.
notes: For Quentin, a bulimic devourer of pulp cinema and B-Movies, the time for the western could not fail to come. And here it is then, a western that has an important subtext, which only partially refers to the Italian tradition, but which bears the signature - always very recognizable - of its author. Success with critics and audiences, despite the open debate and some detractors.

title: Assassination Games
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Scott Adkins, Kevin Chapman, Ivan Kaye, Valentin Teodosiu, Alin Panc, Serban Celea, Michael Higgs, Kristopher Van Varenberg, Marija Karan
description: Brazil and Flint are the best killers on the square. They team up to eliminate the leader of a gang of drug traffickers, but they will do so for different reasons: one to get the ransom, the other to avenge the death of his wife.
notes: Acrobatic action movie, it marks the comeback of the icon Van Damme.

title: The Bourne Legacy
actors: Jeremy Renner, Edward Norton, Rachel Weisz, Joan Allen, Oscar Isaac, Albert Finney, Corey Stoll, Scott Glenn, Stacy Keach, Sheena Colette
description: After Jason Bourne reveals the existence of the secret Treadstone program to the world, the CIA fears that the other programs used to train spies and fighters will also be discovered. The program most at risk is the Outcome, a direct evolution of the Treadstone and used to train six special agents for the Department of Defense such as Aaron Cross (Jeremy Renner). Bourne's revelations also worry Ric Byer (Edward Norton), the real mastermind behind the two programs. To prevent the links between the Bourne case and his research agency being discovered, Byer is willing to erase all traces of the Treadstone and its derivative Outcome, including the scientists, doctors and agents involved.
notes: More "important" characters (but Norton's role remains superficial) and an even more complicated and less linear story, stretched for over two grueling hours. Tony Gilroy, screenwriter of the previous trilogy and now also director, is more interested in the plot than in the action (apart from a good scene in the Weisz house, the pace is sluggish) and the great Dan Bradley who usually directs the second unit. A film about Bourne without Bourne is a paradox from the start; Renner, elsewhere convincing, constantly makes Matt Damon regret and this legacy was not really needed.

title: Island of Lost Souls
actors: Charles Laughton, Richard Arlen, Leila Hyams, Bela Lugosi, Kathleen Burke, Arthur Hohl, Stanley Fields, Paul Hurst, Hans Steinke, Tetsu Komai
description: Following a shipwreck, Parker is rescued from a freighter carrying exotic animals bound for a small island where Dr. Moreau lives and works, a scientist banished from London for his delusions of grandeur and the immoral experiments he conducts to give life to creatures half men and half beasts. Believing that sooner or later another American ship can bring him home, Parker remains on the island ignoring that Moreau has a plan to use him as a guinea pig with the exotic Lota, the panther woman he himself generated. Meanwhile, on the mainland, Ruth, Parker's girlfriend, begins to worry about his absence and begins a frantic search that will lead her to the island when all creatures have decided to rebel against Moreau's overwhelming power.

title: The Collection
actors: Josh Stewart, Emma Fitzpatrick, Christopher McDonald, Shannon Kane, Erin Way, Daniel Sharman, Johanna Braddy, Lee Tergesen, Andre Royo, Navi Rawat, Brandon Molale, William Peltz
description: Arkin managed to escape from the house of the "collector" but was unable to save and take with him the beautiful Elena, who ended up in the clutches of the psychopathic maniac. Still in the hospital to recover from the shock, he receives a visit from a group of mercenaries hired by Elena's father, on his trail to force him to return with his men to the kidnapper's house and try to free his daughter.
notes: Sequel to the film The Collector (2009).

title: Death Tunnel
actors: Steffany Huckaby, Melanie Lewis, Yolanda Pecoraro, Kristin Novak, Annie Burgstede, Jason Lasater, Gary Wolf, Robyn Corum, Gill Gayle, Brian Dyer
description: To complete an initiation rite, five female students are forced to venture into an old abandoned hospital in Kentucky, where in 1910 more than 63,000 people died from a strange white plague epidemic. As soon as they discover that the structure is haunted by five ghost spirits who cannot find peace, the girls search for an escape route through a long and endless underground tunnel, used in the past to get rid of the bodies of deceased people.

title: Ninja
actors: Scott Adkins, Tsuyoshi Ihara, Mika Hijii, Todd Jensen, Togo Igawa, Garrick Hagon, Miles Anderson, Valentin Ganev, Atanas Srebrev, Fumio Demura
description: Casey (Scott Adkins) is an American who has long traveled to Japan to be trained in the deadly fighting techniques of the ninja. The time to put everything he has learned into practice will come when his sensei asks him to return to New York with the task of protecting the legendary Yoroi Bitsu, a chest that contains the precious weapons that belonged to the last Koga Ninja.

title: The Baytown Outlws
actors: Billy Bob Thornton, Paul Wesley, Eva Longoria, Clayne Crawford, Daniel Cudmore, Travis Fimmel, Andre Braugher, Serinda Swan, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Natalie Martinez, Michael Rapaport, Zoe Bell, Brea Grant
description: When ex-husband Carlos (Billy Bob Thornton), a trigger-happy psychopath, kidnaps her beloved godson Rob, Celeste (Eva Longoria) finds herself forced to seek help from the Oddie brothers, a trio of lawless people who have the dominance over the entire territory of Alabama. Moved by his story, the Oddies accept an assignment that will prove to be the most dangerous of their criminal career and that will put the sheriff of their hometown, a secret service agent and Carlos with all his minions at their heels: an army of corrupt cops, mobsters, hijackers and armed bikers.

title: Riddick
actors: Vin Diesel, Karl Urban, Katee Sackhoff, Jordi Mollà, Nolan Gerard Funk, Matt Nable, Bokeem Woodbine, Dave Bautista, Conrad Pla, Raoul Trujillo, Nolan Funk, Keri Hilson
description: Left for dead by his enemies, Riddick (Vin Diesel) has been abandoned on a sunburnt planet populated by alien predators, far more dangerous than the humans he'd found himself fighting against. The only way to survive their attacks is to try to reach an emergency beacon and alert the ships of mercenaries who could bring it to safety. Unfortunately for Riddick, the first spaceship to arrive is that of the arrogant Captain Santana (Jordi Mollà), at the head of a group of hunters willing to brave even the greatest storm ever seen in order not to leave without his head.
notes: Riddick's new initiation is the real theoretical heart of a film capable of reflecting for a long time on the character's body. Body engraved with scars as remnants of memory. Body worn out by the struggle and often helpless. Body for the first time granted to sex, in the only moment of the saga in which ours satisfies its impulses by calling us to testify (in "The Chronicles of Riddick" there were only the desiring concubines in the frame). There is no weaving fantasy. The world around the protagonist is missing. Credible enemies are missing. But Riddick and Vin Diesel have closed (their) circle, and basically that is enough.

title: Project Eliminator
actors: David Carradine, Frank Zagarino, Hilary English, Brett Baxter Clark, Drew Snyder, Joshua Bryant, Calista Carradine, Michael Durrette, Frank Rivera, David 'Shark' Fralick
description: Dr. Markson, genius inventor of weapons, wants to destroy his latest invention: a very powerful laser called "the eliminator". The weapon, however, becomes the object of the desire of a group of mercenaries eager to enrich themselves with its discovery. They decide to kidnap the scientist's daughter to force him to collaborate, but his friend Ron (David Carradine) and John "Striker" Slade (Frank Zagarino), a soldier with a turbulent past, rush to his aid.

title: Freelancers
actors: Robert De Niro, 50 Cent, Forest Whitaker, Dana Delany, Beau Garrett, Ryan O'Nan, Michael McGrady, Matt Gerald, Hilary Cruz, Jeff Chase
description: Fifteen years after witnessing the murder of his father, a New York district policeman, Jonas "Malo" Maldanado (50 Cent) also joins the police force and is recruited to be part of a team of dirty-working agents led by Vic. Sarcone (Robert De Niro), his father's old partner. As Malo begins to delve into a universe of corruption and violence, he slowly comes face to face with the truth behind his parent's death and devises a plan to expose the identity of the man who determined it.

title: American Samurai
actors: David Bradley, Mark Dacascos, Valarie Trapp, Rex Ryon, Melissa Hellman, John Fujioka, Douvi Cohen, Mark Warren, Koby Azarly, Shalom Avitan

title: The Ring Two
actors: Naomi Watts, Simon Baker, David Dorfman, Elizabeth Perkins, Gary Cole, Sissy Spacek, Ryan Merriman, Emily VanCamp, Kelly Overton, James Lesure
description: Six months after the terrible events that shook them, Rachel and her son Aidan move to escape the ghosts of their memories.
notes: Nakata creates another autoremake by remaking his _Ringu 2_; but the conventionality of structure and the banality of certain narrative mechanisms play completely against the film.

title: No One Lives
actors: Luke Evans, Adelaide Clemens, Derek Magyar, America Olivo, Beau Knapp, Lee Tergesen, Laura Ramsey, Lindsey Shaw, George Murdoch, Gary Grubbs
description: A dangerous gang of criminals, after taking a young couple hostage, finds refuge in an abandoned house in the middle of nowhere. However, the situation soon gets out of hand and the girl is killed. Blinded by the desire for revenge, the boyfriend proves himself for who he really is, proving to be less defenseless than everyone thinks. Turning the tables, the criminals find themselves faced with a ruthless killer who, having already killed often in the past, intends not to leave any of them alive.

title: Brake
actors: Stephen Dorff, Chyler Leigh, JR Bourne, Tom Berenger, Bobby Tomberlin, Kali Rocha, King Orba, Pruitt Taylor Vince, Sammy Sheik, Kent Shocknek
description: Jeremy Reins, a secret service agent, wakes up stunned after being taken hostage. He has in front of his eyes a digital device that marks a countdown that is fast approaching zero. Outside, the world seems close to collapse and its captors would like to know the location of the president's secret underground bunker. To get an answer, they are also ready to kill and Jeremy is called to choose between the life of his family and the revelation of a secret that he has kept for years.

title: Wyatt Earp's Revenge
actors: Val Kilmer, Shawn Roberts, Matt Dallas, Daniel Booko, Scott Whyte, Steven Grayhm, Levi Fiehler, Trace Adkins, Diana DeGarmo, Brian Groh
description: After the ruthless Kennedy brothers kill his beloved Dora Hand, Sheriff Wyatt Earp (Val Kilmer) forms a squad with Doc Holliday, Bat Masterson, Charlie Bassett and Bill Tighman to track them down and get revenge. Before being able to restore order throughout the West, Earp and his men are forced on a long journey that will take them from Dodge City to Mexico to clash directly with the founder of the Kennedys, a very powerful man and always ready for a challenge. to the death.

title: The Lone Ranger
actors: Johnny Depp, Armie Hammer, Helena Bonham Carter, Tom Wilkinson, William Fichtner, Barry Pepper, James Badge Dale, Ruth Wilson, Bryant Price, James Frain, Damon Herriman, Mason Cook
description: Tonto (Johnny Depp), a Native American with a warrior spirit, recounts the never-revealed backstories that transformed John Reid (Armie Hammer) from a man of law into the Lonely Knight, a legend of justice. On a moving train, in front of an enthusiastic audience, Tonto retraces step by step the epic adventure that allowed him and Reid, as unlikely heroes, to meet and get to know each other, working and fighting together against greed and the corruption.
notes: Verbinski brings to life in a fun and spectacular way - with a perfectionism that places him far above an honest Hollywood craftsmanship - to a world reinvented by cinema, against the real backdrop of the monumental landscapes of the films of John Ford, Sam Peckinpah and Sergio Leone, which he had already mentioned in "Rango 3D". Fluvial and a bit hypertrophic, like all generous films that end up overwhelming them with stimuli in an attempt to give so much to the public, "The Lone Ranger" is also a rollercoaster with a soul, in which the hero's motto - «never taking off the mask ”, or not accepting compromises with power, staying on the sidelines and maintaining one's moral integrity - is perhaps the strongest and least obvious sign of a character's modernity, obsolete only on paper.

title: Looper
actors: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Bruce Willis, Emily Blunt, Jeff Daniels, Piper Perabo, Paul Dano, Garret Dillahunt, Tracie Thoms, Han Soto, Pierce Gagnon
description: In the near future, science has come to penetrate the laws of physics to allow bodies to move in time, but the authorities have forbidden anyone to leave the present. As a result, a burgeoning illegal market has developed that allows big shippers to move back and forth over the years. Those who want to eliminate their enemies benefited, and 30-year-old Joe (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) became rich thanks to his work as a hired killer. One day, Joe is contacted to carry out a new murder. Unbeknownst to him, someone is plotting to take him out and the intended victim is himself in the future (Bruce Willis).
notes: One of the great themes of cinema (and of humanity as a whole) - time - reigns supreme in this futuristic action thriller. And Johnson, who looks to Andrew Niccol with less philosophical ambitions, chooses to play (well) in Serie B by calibrating the action sequences and the surrounding characters among which a rather restrained villain played by Jeff Daniels stands out.

title: Jack Reacher
actors: Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Jai Courtney, Robert Duvall, Richard Jenkins, Michael Raymond-James, Werner Herzog, Alexia Fast, David Oyelowo, Kristen Dalton
description: Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise) is a former cop who has spent most of his life wandering around town frequenting the underworld of crime. He's trying to stay out of trouble when he gets caught up in a seemingly meaningless massacre. In the heart of a small Indiana town, James Barr, an expert sniper, is accused of firing six shots and killing five people. Once interrogated, however, Barr pleads innocent and offers only one clue: Jack Reacher. With the help of a young lawyer, Jack will try to find the truth and find out who and what reasons are behind the massacre.
notes: Jack Reacher, the literary creature of Lee Child, so far the protagonist of 17 novels, arrives on the big screen at the hands of McQuarrie - already successful screenwriter of many works (from The Usual Suspects to Wolverine). A measured direction at the service of well-structured characters and interpreters who take possession of the staging. Pike holds the foreground like few others and Cruise does Cruise, demythologizing, with the usual irony, yet another action character in a film that amuses and engages.

title: Bad Ass
actors: Danny Trejo, Charles S. Dutton, Ron Perlman, Joyful Drake, Patrick Fabian, John Duffy, Winter Ave Zoli, Danny Woodburn, Donzaleigh Abernathy, David A. Arnold
description: Frank Vega is a Vietnam War veteran. After the first tributes paid on his return to his homeland, for forty years he was sidelined by the company and remained alone after breaking up with his old high school girlfriend. Suddenly, one day, fame comes knocking on his door turning him into a little local hero when on a commuter bus he defends an elderly black man from the racist wrath of a group of skinheads. The sudden popularity achieved, however, results in a desire for revenge and revenge following the carelessness shown by the police in solving the case linked to the murder of his dear friend Klondike.

title: Resolution
actors: Peter Cilella, Vinny Curran, Zahn McClarnon, Bill Oberst Jr., Kurt David Anderson, Emily Montague, Skyler Meacham, Carmel Benson, Justin Benson, Catherine Burns
description: Michael does his utmost to ensure that his friend Chris can free himself from the ghost of the heroine and can definitively return to the path of salvation. What begins as a life-saving attempt quickly takes an unexpected turn and, during the days they spend in a house in the woods on an Indian reservation, the two friends find themselves confronted with their own demons, with the consequences of some actions of the past and with their mental faculties.

title: Dragon Eyes
actors: Cung Le, Jean-Claude Van Damme, Kristopher Van Varenberg, Peter Weller, Crystal Mantecon, Monica Acosta, Edrick Browne, Eddie Rouse, Luis Da Silva Jr., James Rawlings
description: In the St. Jude Square neighborhood, people live in fear and despair. The gangs of bosses Dash and Antuan terrorize the streets and citizens live without hope until the arrival of the foreigner Ryan Hong brings a glimmer of change. Challenging the two gang members with his unrivaled martial arts skills and keeping in mind the teachings of mentor Tiano (Jean Claude Van Damme), Hong almost gains control of the neighborhood when he unexpectedly finds the hostility of Mr V, the ruthless and corrupt police chief.

title: Maximum Conviction
actors: Steven Seagal, Steve Austin, Michael Paré, Bren Foster, Kirby Morrow, Christopher Gordon, Zak Santiago, Aliyah O'Brien, Steph Song, Lauro Chartrand
description: Special Agent Tom Steele (Steve Seagal) and partner Manning (Sean Austin) are tasked with dismantling a maximum security prison and guarding two dangerous recently arrived inmates. In a short time, however, they find themselves facing the assault of a group of elite mercenaries, who have arrived in the prison in search of the two women, whose true identities force Steele and Manning to face something much greater than they could. never imagine.

title: Salvage
actors: Lauren Currie Lewis, Chris Ferry, Cody Darbe, Maureen Olander, John P. Miller, Jessica DeLong, Sam Dahler, John Briley, Joseph M. Colombo, Adam Morris
description: Claire accepts the passage of a stranger who claims to be friends with her boyfriend.
notes: Low-budget, independent horror that struggles to fill the 75-minute length, suffers from a stale soundtrack and amateur acting, but manages to deliver more than a scare and a few surprises.

title: The Barrens
actors: Stephen Moyer, Mia Kirshner, Erik Knudsen, Demore Barnes, J. LaRose, Chantelle Chung, Allie MacDonald, Peter DaCunha, Max Topplin, David Keeley
description: Richard Marlowe decides to spend a weekend with his family in the pine forest of Wharton State, land of the legendary Jersey Devil. The holiday immediately reveals some disturbing unexpected events such as the discovery of some corpses of mysteriously mutilated forest animals, the disappearance of a boy from the campsite and a strange fever that takes Richard by surprise. Delusional and hallucinating, Richard becomes convinced that a hideous creature with yellow eyes, pointed horns and bat wings is hiding among the pines, forcing the family to struggle against a shocking reality.

title: Rush
actors: Olivia Wilde, Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Dormer, Daniel Brühl, Alexandra Maria Lara, Christian McKay, James Michael Rankin, Jensen Freeman, Pierfrancesco Favino
description: In the mid-seventies, Formula 1 fans witness a heated duel for the conquest of the world title. James Hunt, handsome, sexy and charming like a rock star, finds himself facing his rival of all time, Niki Lauda, ??more humble, conservative and shy towards worldly life. A tragic unforeseen event during the 1976 German Grand Prix compromises Lauda's entire season as Hunt is busy fighting his personal demons, both on and off the track, when the time comes for the decisive race. The last Grand Prix of the season, in Tokyo, will turn into an exciting opportunity for revenge for both, during which both will show their best skills but only one will be able to climb the top step of the podium and become champion.
notes: A dry, careful work that opens up to emotion by simply telling what happened with rare philological expertise. The reconstructions of the period are always exact - without any recourse to easy archive images - and frame a graphic, narrative and scenic sporting evocation in which the chronicle data marries a refined research on the shooting devices of the races, able to engage the subject treated to the codes of contemporaneity.
