Car cameras, shots in the cockpit, in the rear view mirror, at track height or on the pedal board alternate to restore the completeness of the gesture, the adrenaline of risk, the power of the encounter between the human and mechanical body. The crudeness of the few, shocking images of the disfigured Lauda's hospitalization does not ask for any empathic pledge in return. He does not blackmail, he simply tells. Thus "Rush", from a simple biopic of a sports rivalry, becomes the great narrative of a lost era.

title: The Philly Kid
actors: Wes Chatham, Devon Sawa, Sarah Butler, Neal McDonough, Lucky Johnson, Chris Browning, Adam Mervis, Bernard Hocke, Ava Bogle, Eric Scott Woods
description: After spending twelve years in prison for the murder of a corrupt cop, former wrestling promise Dillon McCabe is released and re-enters his old neighborhood. He wants to keep out of trouble but the presence of the former colleague of the agent he killed and that of his old friend Jake cause him a lot of trouble. Then, when Jake is kidnapped and tortured by a Russian mobster for some unpaid debts, Dillon offers to recover the entire sum he owes by participating in three fights and promising to lose the last one.

title: Stolen
actors: Nicolas Cage, Malin Akerman, Josh Lucas, Danny Huston, Sami Gayle, Mark Valley, M.C. Gainey, J.D. Evermore, Tanc Sade, Edrick Browne
description: Will Montgomery (Nicolas Cage) spent the last few years of his life in prison for being betrayed after a robbery whose millionaire loot was never recovered. Upon returning to the wild, Will plans to leave his criminal past behind and rebuild his relationship with his daughter Allison (Sami Gayle). However, he is contacted by his old partner Vincent (Josh Lucas), who has to offer him an exchange. Vincent has just kidnapped Allison, keeping her in a taxi, and demands a ransom of ten million dollars to free her. To find the money he needs, Will has only 12 hours to trust his instincts and his other former robbery partner, the beautiful Riley (Malin Akerman), before it's too late for his daughter.

title: Chernobyl Diaries
actors: Jonathan Sadowski, Jesse McCartney, Devin Kelley, Nathan Phillips, Ingrid Bolso Berdal, Dimitry Diatchenko, Olivia Taylor Dudley
description: In search of extreme fun, a group of six tourists exits the canonical paths reserved for foreigners and with the help of a guide, ignoring all warnings, heads to the town of Pripyat, once populated by workers employed in the nuclear reactor. of Chernobyl. After a brief visit through the streets of what appears to be an uninhabited area since the terrible explosion of the power plant, tourists are strangely stranded in the city discovering that they are not alone.
notes: Oren Peli goes from directing to subject, from familiar interiors to off limits exteriors. These are the only weak reason for interest in an "office horror", which does not thrill despite the radioactive setting. Creating tension without (or almost nothing) showing is the art of a few, and newcomer Bradley Parker fails: his deformed and hungry "bad guys" don't scare him, his Boeotian and reckless protagonists don't amuse. The initial blaze of "Wow! Incredible! " it soon becomes a chorus of screams and a frenzied tangle of limbs. Filming from the mobile phone alternates with imperfect subjective views, but the only striking image is the inert skeleton of a panora wheel

title: The Host
actors: Saoirse Ronan, Diane Kruger, Jake Abel, William Hurt, Frances Fisher, Max Irons, Chandler Canterbury, Boyd Holbrook, Rachel Roberts (I)
description: Following an intergalactic war, the Earth was invaded by an invisible enemy, the Souls, spirits who, after wandering from planet to planet, settle in the body of the earthlings to take over their brains. However, some humans have tried to escape by hiding in secret places that the terrible Seeker (Diane Kruger) tries to find by all means. The young Melanie (Saoirse Ronan), on the other hand, has been captured and her body has been invaded by Wanderer, a Soul who immediately realizes how much it cannot free itself of its conscience. Knowing of the girl's resistance, the Seeker would like to use her to track down free men while Wanderer, increasingly torn about what to do, decides to face an epic journey in the desert in search of Melanie's family and boyfriend, exposing himself to the overwhelming beauty of human emotions. .
notes: Human not human. All of Andrew Niccol's cinema travels - in time and space - between the borders of this dichotomy. A cinema that thrives on the urgency to denounce all forms of colonialism - physical, mental, material, frontier - in the hope of overcoming it by fighting. Andrew Niccol adapts Stephenie Meyer's novel of the same name and draws from it yet another masterpiece of a sober and intense journey. Romantic, metaphorical, poetic.

title: Oblivion
actors: Tom Cruise, Andrea Riseborough, Melissa Leo, Morgan Freeman, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Olga Kurylenko, Lindsay Clift
description: In 2077, after a few decades of a war that made the Earth an arid and devastated planet, veteran Jack (Tom Cruise) is one of the last survivors. A drone repairman, Jack has the task of recovering the last vital resources from the earth's surface and has almost completed his mission before leaving the planet for good. One day, however, the spaceship on which a mysterious woman (Olga Kurylenko) is traveling crashes near him and from their meeting a series of events arises that force Jack to revise his vision of the world and to face dangers that he had not foreseen for the salvation of all humanity.
notes: Joseph Kosinski certainly has no problem visualizing a science fiction story, but perhaps he forgets that the most special effect is always the script. With Oblivion (born from his suggestion, rather than an idea, for a graphic novel) the director signs two distinct films that almost never match: one fascinating and original in its graphic and architectural aspect, the other derivative of dozens of science fiction films, repetitive and confusing in structure. It's a shame, because such a beautiful cover deserved a better book.

title: Ender's Game
actors: Asa Butterfield, Harrison Ford, Abigail Breslin, Ben Kingsley, Viola Davis, Hailee Steinfeld, Moises Arias, Aramis Knight, Nonso Anozie, Jimmy 'Jax' Pinchak
description: In a future where Earth has seen two different invasions by the Scorpion aliens, the brightest children are brought into a special war school to be trained to fight against a third and imminent invasion. Among the children there is Ender Wiggin (Asa Butterfield), particularly loved by Colonel Graff (Harrison Ford) for his extraordinary strategic skills and for this isolated from his companions. Rapidly advancing in level, Ender finds himself admitted to the great hall of battles, where in a zero-gravity environment he is called to fight against the hordes made up of other more experienced companions, finding a bitter enemy in Bonzo and a valid ally in Petra. (Hailee Steinfeld), before moving on to Teacher Mazer Rackham (Ben Kingsley) School of Command six years ahead of schedule and facing his first real battle.
notes: The construction of a graceful and merciless universe holds up the transposition from the written page (Orson Scott Card, 1985) and does not follow the fashion of speed that sacrifices the heart of products "for young adults" on the altar of the cascade of events: the film by Gavin Hood also stumbles into downtime, but grows into the changing gaze of the surprising Asa Butterfield, mirror of a victor painfully aware of his necessary crimes.

title: Snitch
actors: Dwayne Johnson, Susan Sarandon, Jon Bernthal, Benjamin Bratt, Barry Pepper, Melina Kanakaredes, Rafi Gavron, Michael Kenneth Williams, James Allen McCune, Nadine Velazquez, Harold Perrineau, David Harbour
description: John Matthews (Dwayne Johnson), a businessman, takes a violent blow when his teenage son faces a heavy sentence for a drug ring he is wrongfully accused of being a part of. To prove his innocence and with the complacency of a politically ambitious solicitor (Susan Sarandon), John infiltrates the criminal organization of a violent drug dealer but his cover is discovered by one of Mexico's most dangerous drug traffickers.
notes: Plot reduced to the bone and air of a 70s B movie at the service of the protagonist in a role that years ago could have been of Joe Don Baker. Noteworthy is the crowd of surrounding faces among which Barry Pepper's face stands out with a goat's lace that makes him look like Nick Oliveri of Queens of the Stoneage. Also noteworthy is the air of a boxer played by Jon Bernthal (The Walking Dead) and the sublime Nadine Velazquez (My Name Is Earl). All already seen, all right, but with a certain artisan honesty that partially compensates for the predictability of the whole.

title: Hellgate
actors: Sterling Hayden, Joan Leslie, Ward Bond, James Arness, Peter Coe, John Pickard, Robert J. Wilke, James Anderson, Richard Emory, Dick Paxton
description: At the end of the civil war, veterinarian Gilman Hanley naively finds himself treating a dangerous Southern fugitive who was injured by a fall on horseback. When the Northern troops find out what happened, accusing him of being a conspirator, they arrest Gilman and take him to hellgate prison, located in a gorge in the New Mexico desert. Following an epidemic, however, Gilman will earn forgiveness thanks to his courage and his medical expertise which he will implement without hesitation.

title: Dark Angel
actors: Jessica Alba, Michael Weatherly, Richard Gunn, J.C. MacKenzie, Valarie Rae Miller, John Savage, Jensen Ackles, Alimi Ballard, Martin Cummins, Kevin Durand
description: 2019. Genetically engineered humans are engineered in a secret government laboratory to form perfect soldiers. However, not everything will go as planned and a rebellion will lead to unfortunate and unexpected consequences.
notes: Pilot episode directed by James Cameron creator, author of the screenplay and productions of the series which lasted from 2000 to 2002.

title: Sidekicks
actors: Chuck Norris, Jonathan Brandis, Beau Bridges, Mako, Julia Nickson, Joe Piscopo, Danica McKellar, John Buchanan, Richard Moll, Gerrit Graham, Dennis Burkley
description: Due to his asthma, Barry is unable to participate in his school's sports activities and is the object of mockery by a bully classmate and his sadistic gymnastics teacher. Unhappy because of this, he often takes refuge in fantasy where he can fight alongside Chuck Norris, action movie star and his idol. After a few unsuccessful attempts, Barry manages to find someone willing to teach him the rules of karate and, thanks to the teachings of Mr Lee, he sets up a small team, with which he can participate in a tournament and which is also joined by Chuck Norris himself. .

title: 10th & Wolf
actors: James Marsden, Giovanni Ribisi, Brad Renfro, Piper Perabo, Dennis Hopper, Brian Dennehy, Lesley Ann Warren, Leo Rossi, Dash Mihok, Tommy Lee
description: Tommy Santoro grew up with the conviction to always remain on the side of the law, not wanting to end up like his father, a prominent member of the Philadelphia mafia, who was murdered. His brother Vincent and his cousin Joey, on the other hand, ended up joining the criminal organization and Horvath, an FBI agent willing to do anything to stop the illicit activities of the company, set his eyes on them. city. So, when Tommy is arrested for impulsively stealing a jeep while serving in the army, Horvath takes the opportunity to propose that he join his brother and cousin in order to infiltrate the underworld and act as a secret informant for the FBI.

title: The Terminators
actors: Jeremy London, A Martinez, Paul Logan, Lauren Walsh, Sara Tomko, Dustin Harnish, Clint Browning, Lucinda Rogers, Mark Hengst, Gary Miller-Youst
description: A small group of survivors fight against the cyborgs who have taken control of the planet.
notes: Yet another _mockbuster_ from Asylum, from the assistant director of _MegaShark vs. Giant Octopus_.

title: Amusement
actors: Keir O'Donnell, Katheryn Winnick, Laura Breckenridge, Jessica Lucas, Tad Hilgenbrink, Reid Scott, Rena Owen, Kevin Gage, Brennan Bailey, Preston Bailey
description: Three childhood friends have gotten lost over the years. But the past hasn't forgotten them.
notes: Episodic structure with frame to contextualize: an eccentricity, for a horror. Entertains: but lacks consistency, verisimilitude, originality. Anywhere directly on home video.

title: Embryo
actors: Rock Hudson, Barbara Carrera, Diane Ladd, Roddy McDowall, Anne Schedeen, John Elerick, Vincent Baggetta, Jack Colvin, Joyce Brothers, Dick Winslow
description: Shocked by his wife's untimely death, Dr. Paul Holliston (Rock Hudson) abandons his research on mammalian embryo development but an unfortunate car accident brings him back. Bringing to birth some dog embryos grown outside the maternal womb, Paul is convinced that he can treat human fetuses in the same way and, with the aim of creating the perfect woman, he works on a revolutionary project destined to subvert his existence and the rules of nature. After being born, the guinea pig grows so quickly that it becomes an adult within a short time and falls in love with its creator. But when she becomes pregnant, Paul must find a way to stop her aging fast and prevent her from dying before she gives birth.

title: Big Bad Mama
actors: Angie Dickinson, William Shatner, Tom Skerritt, Susan Sennett, Robbie Lee, Noble Willingham, Dick Miller, Tom Signorelli, Joan Prather, Royal Dano
description: Texas, 1932. Wilma McClatchie (Angie Dickinson) has taken over the reins of her latest lover's smuggling business but the business is not producing the desired results. When she meets Fred (Tom Skerritt), a bank robber planning a big heist, Wilma doesn't hesitate to get involved with her two daughters in her criminal plans. After recruiting another accomplice, the group enacts the kidnapping of a millionaire's daughter with the hope of getting rich by paying the ransom but the FBI is soon on their trail.

title: Eyeborgs
actors: Adrian Paul, Megan Blake, David McGee, Luke Eberl, Emad Aly, James D. Ballard, Tim Bell, Joshua Brocki, James Marshall Case, Charles 'Chuck' Coyl, Alexandra Dimopoulos, Danny Trejo, Devin McGee, Katrina Munday
description: After a serious terrorist attack, the United States government decides to place different electronic eyes in the cities that can monitor every event and every movement of people, creating the Eyeborgs, mobile robots able to move around the city. Their cameras reach everywhere and record continuously, allowing the police to arrest fugitives and criminals. However, when strange murders begin to occur, committed in a different way than what the tapes show, FBI agent Gunner Reynolds (Adrian Paul) begins to suspect that the security system has been breached and that the machines are turning into something. very dangerous.
notes: The idea about invaded privacy is interesting, but the film is poorly written and fails to develop the initial premises. The cast does not shine. Danny Trejo gets some laughs.

title: Dead Man Down
actors: Colin Farrell, Noomi Rapace, Terrence Howard, Dominic Cooper, Isabelle Huppert, Armand Assante, F. Murray Abraham, Luis Da Silva Jr., James Biberi, John Cenatiempo, Robert Vataj, Roy James Wilson, Andrew Stewart-Jones
description: Victor (Colin Farrell), former Hungarian elite soldier, desires more than anything else to avenge with the help of his friend Gregor (F. Murray Abraham) the death of his wife and daughter, caused by Alphonse (Terrence Howard), the powerful New York boss of which he is the right hand man. As someone else is trying to kill his boss, Victor begins to investigate the identity of the killer but is fascinated and seduced by Beatrice (Noomi Rapace), a young woman who has turned from victim to avenger and has just moved in with her mother (Isabelle Huppert) in the building opposite him. Their destined encounter, whose intensity is heightened by a common desire for revenge, will lead them to a dangerous and cathartic spiral of violence.
notes: The Taste of Revenge, the first work on American soil by the Danish Niels Arden Oplev (Men who hate women), has an “old European” look that pervades many sequences. Between Albanians, French and Hungarians it seems Games without Borders, except that stereotypes dominate. Apart from an apt scene (that of the "trap" in the empty apartment), you can navigate on sight between acting as a suburban amateur drama (which does not benefit from Italian dubbing) and a cast bordering on trash. Maybe, who knows, we'll reassess it in ten years.

title: End of Watch
actors: Jake Gyllenhaal, Michael Peña, Anna Kendrick, Cody Horn, America Ferrera, Natalie Martinez, Frank Grillo, David Harbour, Shondrella Avery, Hugh Daly, Kristy Wu
description: Taylor and Zavala are two patrol cops from the Los Angeles Department. With their car, they guarantee safety in the area south of the city, putting their own safety and that of the people closest to them at risk.
notes: End of Watch. Zero tolerance is not a film to be avoided, indeed, but in the end you find it hard to remember a good reason for being in the theater, if not for a couple of sequences designed and shot very well. If you want to remember how much cops can be bastards, in short, you can fish out Tropa de Elite. The death squads, if you want to remember strong personal relationships in uniform, The masters of the night. The real element of novelty, perhaps, is the pressing, aggressive camera, which leaves a few centimeters, which persists on adrenaline-pumping narrow fields, highlighted by tight editing.

title: Transit
actors: Jim Caviezel, Diora Baird, James Frain, Harold Perrineau, Elisabeth Röhm, Sterling Knight, Beau Brasseaux, Jake Cherry, Ryan Donowho, Robbie Jones
description: After being arrested for tax evasion, Nate Sidwell lost the respect of his wife and children. To rediscover the harmony of the past, he suggests they go camping, starting with their SUV. Shortly after departure, Nate is stopped by the police and forced to spend a night in a cell for reckless driving. As the journey resumes, the Sidwells realize that this is just the beginning of a long odyssey. In their trunk they discover a bag containing 4 million dollars of unknown origin and belonging to four ruthless killers already on their trail.

title: The 27th Day
actors: Gene Barry, Valerie French, George Voskovec, Arnold Moss, Stefan Schnabel, Ralph Clanton, Friedrich von Ledebur, Paul Birch, Azemat Janti
description: Five people from five different states of the world, including the United States, the Soviet Union and China, are abducted by an alien from Sigma, a distant and dying planet. The alien gives each individual a capsule that can be detonated within 27 days and capable of razing everything in its path within 3,000 miles. The aim of the alien is to destroy the human race and allow the inhabitants of Sigma to colonize the Earth. While the two Soviet citizens accept the assignment, the other three kidnapped refuse to carry out the order.

title: Train
actors: Thora Birch, Gideon Emery, Kavan Reece, Derek Magyar, Gloria Votsis, Todd Jensen, Vladimir Vladimirov, Koyna Ruseva, Valentin Ganev, Ivan Barnev
description: In Europe, after missing the train, a group of American students decide to take a different ride.
notes: Slasher conceived as a remake of _Terror Train_, it later became an original film. It looks like the less creative and badly shot draft of _Hostel_ and _Turistas_. The torture scenes are not original either.

title: Tides of War
actors: Adrian Paul, Catherine Dent, Kent McCord, Mike Doyle, Matt Battaglia, Mark Deklin, Eitan Kramer, Eyal Podell, Todd Babcock, Larry Wegger
description: In the freezing waters of North Korea, a US Navy submarine is suddenly attacked, but no one can figure out who the attacker was. Some sailors lose their lives and so Commander Habley is investigated as the only culprit for misconduct ...

title: Hit and Run
actors: Dax Shepard, Kristen Bell, Bradley Cooper, Tom Arnold, Kristin Chenoweth, Michael Rosenbaum, Beau Bridges, David Koechner, Ryan Hansen, Joy Bryant, Jess Rowland
description: Apparently, Charlie Bronson (Dax Shepard) lives a quiet life with his girlfriend Annie (Kirstie Bell) in a small town. In reality, he is the former driver of a gang of thieves, trapped because of his testimony, and is part of the witness protection program. When Annie, unaware of her boyfriend's past, has to go to Los Angeles to get her dream job, Charlie decides to accompany her regardless of the risks she may face. Along the way, their path becomes increasingly complicated and dangerous and they soon find themselves chased by Alex (Bradley Cooper), Charlie's former boss thug seeking revenge. Forced to reveal his past to Annie, Charlie will push further and further down to save her life.

title: The Last Stand
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jaimie Alexander, Peter Stormare, Rodrigo Santoro, Zach Gilford, Eduardo Noriega, Forest Whitaker, Genesis Rodriguez, Johnny Knoxville, Luis Guzmán, Daniel Henney
description: After leaving the LAPD narcotics squad due to a botched and bad operation, Sheriff Ray Owens (Arnold Schwarzenegger) has left the metropolis to move to tiny Sommerton Junction, where he is dedicated to fighting the little girl. crime. His peaceful existence is ruined when Gabriel Cortez (Eduardo Noriega), a famous drug trafficker, spectacularly escapes from an FBI convoy. With the help of a ferocious band of outlaws, led by icy Burrell (Peter Stornmare), Cortez heads to the Mexican border in his special Corvette ZR1, taking a hostage with him. Cortez's route includes a stop at Sommerton Junction, where police forces across the state await him, including Officer John Bannister (Forest Whitaker). At first reluctant to get involved, Owens ends up taking matters into his own hands and leading operations to stop Cortez.
notes: Kim Ji-woon's first Hollywood film presupposes a gigantic suspension of credulity and verisimilitude, but, even if the script is watering on all sides, one is amused by Schwarzenegger's apt performance, by the light-hearted tone of the whole and by some well-placed jokes.

title: Age of the Dragons
actors: Danny Glover, Vinnie Jones, Corey Sevier, Sofia Pernas, Larry Bagby, Kepa Kruse, David Morgan, Raphael Cruz, Yanique Bland, Wayne Brennan
description: In a universe where the skies are populated by dangerous dragons and the existence of planet Earth depends on a precious liquid found in their throat, the young and charismatic Ishmael joins a group of hunters led by Captain Ahab. Leading the ship with which they move in the skies is Rachel, the daughter of Ahab, for which Ishmael immediately expresses his interest. Ahab's main obsession is to track down the old White Dragon to carry out his very personal revenge. Once in the depths of darkness in the cave of the old White Dragon, the unveiling of some secrets will force Rachel to make a painful choice to safeguard her future.
notes: A modern and sci-fi reinterpretation of the novel Moby Dick by Herman Melville.

title: Mulberry Street
actors: Nick Damici, Kim Blair, Ron Brice, Bo Corre, Tim House, Larry Fleischman, Larry Medich, Javier Picayo, Antone Pagan, John Hoyt
description: An ordinary day in Manhattan, along Mulberry Street. The TV announces with concern an invasion of rats in the sewers; rodents begin to spread a disease that turns humans into zombies.

title: The Reunion
actors: John Cena, Ethan Embry, Amy Smart, Boyd Holbrook, Michael Rispoli, Jack Conley, Rio Alexander, Richard Barela, Josh Berry, Morse Bicknell
description: Sam, Leo and Douglas are three brothers not on good terms with each other who have not seen each other for a long time. On the death of their rich father, they receive the call of their sister Nina who communicates to them the existence of a substantial inheritance to share. To obtain it, however, they must agree to work together. The three, one of whom is a policeman, set out on the trail of a gang of thugs who have kidnapped a rich millionaire for ransom.

title: Pacific Rim
actors: Charlie Hunnam, Idris Elba, Rinko Kikuchi, Charlie Day, Ron Perlman, Max Martini, Clifton Collins jr., Robert Kazinsky, Robert Maillet, Burn Gorman, Diego Klattenhoff, Heather Doerksen, Lance Luu, Charles Luu, Mark Luu
description: Legions of monstrous creatures called Kaiju emerge from the depths of the sea, threatening to destroy all of humanity in a short time. To combat them, a special weapon is designed. These are huge robots, the Jaegers, each controlled simultaneously by two pilots whose minds are connected by a neural bridge. When even the Jaegers prove helpless in the face of the relentless fury of the Kaiju, the forces defending Earth have no choice but to turn to two unlikely heroes - a former pilot (Charlie Humman) and an inexperienced trainee (Rinko Kikuchi) - and put them in charge of an obsolete Jaeger with a glorious past.
notes: As a lover of popular and pop mythologies, Del Toro reworks and hybridizes, with the added value of his Latin sensibility, both the films of Japanese monsters (the kaiju-eiga) and the cartoons of Go Nagai (Grendizer, Jeeg robot steel, Mazinger ). Kaiju vs. mecha. Columbus's egg, one might say. The difference, and the value of the operation, lies in the respect that the director brings to the starting materials. Del Toro makes the film that (no) the kids at the end of the 70s dreamed of in front of the two-dimensional silhouettes of the first Japanese cartoons, making clear the promise of the future contained in those images. No betrayal.

title: Escape Plan
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sylvester Stallone, Jim Caviezel, Sam Neill, Vincent D'Onofrio, Vinnie Jones, 50 Cent, Amy Ryan, Faran Tahir, Matt Gerald, Caitriona Balfe
description: Ray Breslin (Sylvester Stallone) is a structural safety expert. In his life he has designed hellish government prisons from which it is impossible to escape and of which he knows every secret. His abilities, however, are put to the test when, framed, he ends up being a prisoner of one of the structures he has designed. In search of an escape route to take revenge on those who put him behind bars, in prison Breslin meets Emil Rottmayer (Arnold Schwarzenegger), the leader of the prisoners as eager as he is to be free as soon as possible.
notes: 2013 is not so different from what Stuart Gordon had imagined in 2013 - The fortress, and the high-tech prison in which Breslin is held is evocative and original in its exposed cells, in the vertical structure, in being on board of a cargo ship. The subject is also not bad, with the escape expert paid to test "the Tomb" but deceived and abandoned in the death monument. Too bad that the script includes jokes already obsolete in the early 90s, the direction is entrusted to Mikael Håfström and Stallone gigioneggi non stop with his friend Schwarzy, elephants called to interpret the parody of themselves. At this point, Cobra and Over the Top would be missing from the appeal of hot reminiscence. Someone stop him first.

title: Beautiful Creatures
actors: Alice Englert, Alden Ehrenreich, Emmy Rossum, Emma Thompson, Jeremy Irons, Viola Davis, Kyle Gallner, Zoey Deutch, Thomas Mann, Margo Martindale, Andrea Frankle, Jack O'Connell, Tiffany Boone
description: Ethan Wate lives with his writer father and housekeeper Amma in a boring town that he hopes to leave as soon as he finishes college. While all his companions dodge Lena Duchaness, just moved to the city and grandson of the hermit Macon, Ethan is mysteriously attracted to her because of the extraordinary resemblance to the girl who dreams all the time. Deepening the knowledge, he discovers that Lena is a Caster, the descendant of a family of wizards who will soon have to decide whether to be on the side of the forces of good or those of evil. A strange locket will lead Ethan to learn a secret that, since the days of the Civil War, has linked his family to that of the girl.
notes: Epic and intimate, punctuated by thenewno2's rock, LaGravenese's adaptation of the bestseller for young adults by Kami Garcia and Margaret Stohl is a film with a mature breath: it steals the heart of an intriguing story and synchronizes its heartbeat with life beyond the paper.

title: Spring Breakers
actors: Vanessa Hudgens, James Franco, Selena Gomez, Ashley Benson, Heather Morris, Rachel Korine, Emma Holzer, Justin Wheelon, Ash Lendzion, Lauren Vera, Gucci Mane
description: With the intention of paying for their spring break, Candy (Vanessa Hudgens), Faith (Selena Gomez), Brit (Ashley Benson) and Cotty (Rachel Corine), four students who share the same room in a boring college dormitory, decide to rob a fast food restaurant. When their nights of partying between alcohol and drugs call the police back and end up in prison, "Alien" (James Franco), a drug dealer and arms dealer over the top, asks them to help him free himself. of his enemies by involving them in some dirty chores. With the support and encouragement of their new friend, the four girls will be the protagonists of moments they will hardly forget.
notes: It is not for a divertissement that Korine sends three queens of the protected band to the fray in all kinds of rough situations. MTV aesthetics taken to the extreme, annoyingly attractive show, so aimless you can't stop watching. Irresistible narration, elliptical and dreamlike, of Nothing, pure entertainment that dismantles the forms of television entertainment, Spring Breakers will be loved by the same users of the crazy holidays it paints mercilessly.

title: Boogeyman 3
actors: Erin Cahill, Chuck Hittinger, Mimi Michaels, Matt Rippy, Nikki Sanderson, W.B. Alexander, Elyes Gabel, George Maguire, Jayne Wisener, Kate Maberly
description: When student Sarah Morris helplessly witnesses her best friend's suicide, no one in college is willing to believe her thesis about the presence of the Black Man, she believes indirectly responsible for what happened. Everyone thinks Sarah is crazy, but as the days go by on campus, a chain of mysterious and unsolved crimes follow one another. It becomes clear to anyone that in order to survive, you need to know in advance when the Black Man will strike again.

title: Killing Season
actors: Robert De Niro, John Travolta, Milo Ventimiglia, Elizabeth Olin
description: Benjamin Ford (Robert De Niro) is a former American soldier who fought on the front lines during the conflict in Bosnia. To try to forget the horrors he witnessed and remove the most painful memories of a past that continues to haunt him, he retired to live in an isolated cabin in the Rocky Mountains. Here, however, he soon runs into Emil Kovac (John Travolta), a former soldier of Serbian origin who has arrived there to close some unfinished business. Their meeting will spark a close physical and psychological warfare during which old wounds will reopen and the secrets of both will be revealed.

title: Detention
actors: Josh Hutcherson, Dane Cook, Spencer Locke, Jesse Heiman, Lindsey Morgan, Brooke Haven, Walter Perez, Aaron Perilo, Shanley Caswell, Richard Brake, Aaron David Johnson
description: The road to graduation is not easy. Achieving this goal involves sacrifices and struggles for survival, especially when Cinderhella, a ruthless masked killer who seems to have taken life from a horror film, wanders through the streets of the college. As the murders escalate, the school principal becomes convinced that the real perpetrator is hiding between the repressed 17-year-old Riley Jones and her friends Sander, Clapton and Ione. To prevent the prom from turning into tragedy, he decides to lock them up in detention for the whole day. Cinderhella, however, is still at large and the four friends will try the impossible to stop him.

title: Elysium
actors: Matt Damon, Jodie Foster, Sharlto Copley, Alice Braga, Diego Luna, Wagner Moura, William Fichtner, Michael Shanks, Brandon Auret, Josh Blacker, Emma Tremblay, Carly Pope, Talisa Soto, Faran Tahir
description: In the year 2154 the human population is divided into two broad categories: on the one hand the very rich people, who live in a pristine space station called Elysium, and on the other hand, the rest of the people, forced to live on an overpopulated planet Earth and in ruins. Delacourt (Jodie Foster), a strict government official, stops at nothing in enforcing strict anti-immigration laws designed to preserve the luxurious way of life of the inhabitants of Elysium. The Terrans, however, try to emigrate by any means possible and the unfortunate Max (Matt Damon), cornered, undertakes to carry out a difficult mission, which if successful would change many lives and bring equality between the two. worlds.
notes: If the future is already written, Blomkamp had described it better. The social metaphor of "Elysium" weighs like the exoskeleton surgically applied to the protagonist: the action is powerful, the tension dizzying, yet the annoying sensation of an implant remains. Dystopian sci-fi as efficient as her characters (in addition to ailing redeemer Damon, a seasoned Jodie Foster with a lack of compassion), she soars over the heart of the class struggle and speeds up bullets, amplifies explosions and contains provocations (the computerized corporate vigilantes ). Entrusting to Sharlto Copley, a dirty laborer of high society, the thermometer of a frustrated and commodified humanity: the real crazed splinter of a film that is more spectacular than political.

title: Maleficent
actors: Angelina Jolie, Sharlto Copley, Elle Fanning, Sam Riley, Imelda Staunton, Lesley Manville, Juno Temple, Kenneth Cranham, Brenton Thwaites, Miranda Richardson, India Eisley, Vivienne Jolie-Pitt
description: When Princess Aurora comes into the world, the whole kingdom is thrilled. The only one to be furious is the evil witch Maleficent (Angelina Jolie) who curses the little girl, foreshadowing her death at the age of sixteen due to a prick of a finger on the spindle of a spinning wheel. Growing up under the protective wing of her father and the three fairies Giuggiola, Florina and Verdelia, Aurora will find herself at the center of a conflict between the forest kingdom she has learned to love and the human kingdom she belongs to as Maleficent realizes that the princess could be the key to peace by making drastic decisions that will change both worlds forever.
notes: With "Maleficent", Disney continues the work of demythologizing its past: the live action rereading of its animated masterpieces. Comforted by the box office, she therefore dedicates herself to the most precious film in her collection (a real work of art produced in 1959 after a decade of study and preparation) and overturns it without problems, superimposing on it a curious feminist morality. It is operations like these that make us regret the ancient magic of fairy tales in which the bad guys had no need to justify themselves.

title: Mega Piranha
actors: Paul Logan, Tiffany, Barry Williams, David Labiosa, Jude Gerard Prest, Jesse Daly, Cooper Harris, William Morse, Clint Browning, Matt Lagan
description: A mutant lineage of giant and ferocious piranhas flee the Amazon and bite into Florida ...

title: Empire State
actors: Liam Hemsworth, Dwayne Johnson, Nikki Reed, Michael Angarano, Jerry Ferrara, Emma Roberts, Chris Diamantopoulos, Gia Mantegna, Paul Ben-Victor, Sharon Angela
description: In 1982 Chris Potamitis (Liam Hemsworth), a young Greek immigrant who survives in the New York jungle, and his close childhood friend Eddie Argikatos devises a plan to land the biggest robbery ever committed in the United States. To permanently change their lives, they will steal $ 15 million from the armored car company where Chris worked as a security guard. Once the heist is struck, police detective James Ransone (Dwayne Johnson) will stop at nothing to arrest them and recover the stolen goods.
notes: Inspired by a true story.

title: Backmask
actors: Gage Golightly, Kelly Blatz, Brittany Curran, Brett Dier, Nick Nicotera, Michael Ormsby, Nick Nordella, Kevin Chapman, Meredith Prunty, Aaron Dorsey
description: During a party of sex, drugs and rock, six teenagers from a small town find an old vinyl record and decide to play it backwards, looking for any hidden satanic messages. After listening, a seemingly evil spirit quickly infiltrates the group, moving from one body to another and wreaking havoc. The spirit, however, is only trying to convey a message to them to warn them that the greatest danger is not something paranormal but rather something or someone closest to them.

title: Planet of Dinosaurs
actors: James Whitworth, Pamela Bottaro, Charlotte Speer, Louie Lawless, Harvey Shain, Mary Appleseth, Derna Wylde, Max Thayer, Chuck Pennington, Michael Lee
description: The Odyssey spacecraft is lost in space and the crew is forced to make an emergency landing on an unknown planet. Morphologically similar to Earth, the planet shows no signs of civilization and, believing it to be uninhabited, the crew members are forced to wait for someone to come to their rescue. However, they discover that the planet is actually populated by a colony of prehistoric dinosaurs, of which the most dangerous for their survival is a bloodthirsty Tyrannosaurus rex.

title: Carrie
actors: Chloë Grace Moretz, Julianne Moore, Judy Greer, Alex Russell, Gabriella Wilde, Portia Doubleday, Ivana Baquero, Ansel Elgort
description: Ultra-conservative and deeply devoted Margareth White (Julianne Moore) lives in the quiet suburb of Chamberlain, in the state of Maine, with her daughter Grace (Chloë Grace Moretz), a mild-mannered and well-mannered girl who is sheltered by her mother from the dangers of the surrounding society. Physical education teacher Miss Dejardin (Judy Greer) tries in vain to protect Grace from attacks by classmates who, led by popular Chris Hargenson (Portia Doubleday), never miss an opportunity to taunt and humiliate her. Sue Snell (Gabriella Wilde), one of Chris's friends, regrets her treatment and, to apologize, convinces her boyfriend Tommy Ross (Ansel Elgort) to accompany Grace to the school prom. During the evening, pushed beyond all limits, Carrie will take revenge for any abuse suffered by unleashing the extraordinary paranormal powers that she acquired in the transition to adolescence.
notes: After a promising start, in the remake of De Palma's Carie, ideas disappear and the register turns towards the television-derived teen drama. If on the side of the supernatural De Palma played with rhythm, synchronizing a quick editing to the splendid soundtrack by Pino Donaggio, the remake trivially and blandly focuses on special effects, so Carrie ends up reduced to a banal imitation of the X-Men, a teenager with uncontrollable superpowers . This was not enough, the ending is consoling, probably by the will of the producers given that the release of the film in the US has been postponed for several months. The discarded one, visible on YouTube, recalled the prologue finding a circular completeness, the closure of the version in the room is instead consistent with the worst part of the film, that is, it is completely insignificant.

title: C.H.U.D.
actors: John Heard, Daniel Stern, Christopher Curry, Kim Greist, Eddie Jones, Sam McMurray, Ruth Maleczech, J.C. Quinn, Cordis Heard, Vic Polizos, Frankie Faison, Graham Beckel, Bill Raymond, Brenda Currin, John Goodman, Jon Polito
description: Numerous disappearances are taking place in a New York neighborhood, mostly of homeless people, apparently for no reason. Captain Bosch (Christopher Curry), after his wife also goes missing, begins to investigate the case. The "Reverend" (Daniel Stern), a former prisoner who runs a soup kitchen, Cooper (John Heard), who in the past had made a photo shoot of homeless people living underground and his girlfriend (Kim Greist). The clues all lead to the sewers, where terrifying mutant beings kidnap and kill anyone who comes within range.

title: 2 Guns
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Denzel Washington, Paula Patton, Bill Paxton, James Marsden, Fred Ward, Edward James Olmos, Robert John Burke, Patrick Fischler, Tenaj L. Jackson, Evie Thompson, Lucky Johnson
description: For twelve months Bobby and Stig have been working together while being wary of each other. Both are undercover agents who have been tasked with infiltrating the underworld: while Bobby is a Goddess agent, Stig is a Navy intelligence officer. The failure of their mission and the consequent loss of a large sum of money attract new enemies to them, some of them in the ranks of superiors, and force them to work together to avoid prison or death.
notes: Like a rock blues jam session in which ZZ Top cross guitars with Outlaws, Cani sciolti touches all the right chords that every self-respecting lover of American cinema knows inside out but can't help but continue to love. Clichés and déjà vu are part of the game but Kormákur doesn't exaggerate with quotes and winks and, by remaining respectfully within the enclosure of the genre, allows the characters to carve out a believable humanity even when the volume of fire reaches levels of guard. Post-post-modern Western, Loose Dogs mourns the frontier but keeps pace with today's Hollywood. Oliver Wood's photography works yellow and ocher very well, saturating the image as befits any film set south of Nogales, while Michael Tronick's editing is always intelligible even in excited moments. Adaptation of Steven Grant's novel of the same name.

title: In Old Oklahoma
actors: John Wayne, Martha Scott, Albert Dekker, George 'Gabby' Hayes, Marjorie Rambeau, Dale Evans, Grant Withers, Sidney Blackmer, Paul Fix, Cecil Cunningham
description: In Oklahoma, oil cowboy Don Somers (John Wayne) and rival Hunk Gardner (Albert Dekker) have always faced each other for control of the oil business and for the love of beautiful teacher Catherine Allen (Martha Scott). The contrast reaches its climax when Don is offered an interesting contract in exchange for a shipment of oil to be delivered within a certain deadline. Hunk will do anything to keep Don's shipment from reaching its destination.

title: After Earth
actors: Will Smith, Jaden Smith, Zoë Kravitz, Sophie Okonedo, Isabelle Fuhrman, David Denman, Lincoln Lewis, Kristofer Hivju, Sacha Dhawan, Chris Geere
description: A millennium of years after the Earth was struck by the cataclysms that forced mankind to move to the planet Nova Prime, General Cypher Raige (Will Smith) returns home after a long mission and is ready to be the father to the thirteen year old son Kitai (Jaden Smith). While aboard their spaceship, Cypher and Kitai are hit by an asteroid storm that sends them crashing to Earth, which has in the meantime become very wild and dangerous. Because Cypher is badly injured and unable to leave the cockpit, Kitai ventures into hostile territory to find their missing rocket.
notes: Obsessed with the founding image, Shyamalan stages the origin of the world as a set: the "father" Will Smith who guides the steps of the "son". A director able to move by filming the leaves closing in view of the night frost, Shyamalan reaffirms the primacy of a threatening nature as in "And the day came". A purely theoretical work, "After Earth" is pure direction. Rather than blaming the director for the alleged failure of the film, it would be appropriate to think of Shyamalan as the true savior of "After Earth", which in other hands would certainly have proved less exciting.

title: Autopsy
actors: Michael Bowen, Robert Patrick, Jessica Lowndes, Ashley Schneider, Ross Kohn, Jenette Goldstein, Robert LaSardo, Arcadiy Golubovich, Ross McCall, Gregg Brazzel
description: After a car accident, Emily is taken to Mercy Hospital. But something strange happens at the polyclinic ...
notes: The direction of Adam Gierasch aims to shock on a visual level, forgetting, however, the content. The comatose performance and predictable storyline make the film uninspiring.

title: Machete Kills
actors: Danny Trejo, Michelle Rodriguez, Sofia Vergara, Amber Heard, Charlie Sheen, Lady Gaga, Antonio Banderas, Jessica Alba, Demián Bichir, Mel Gibson, Alexa PenaVega, Vanessa Hudgens, Cuba Gooding jr., William Sadler, Tom Savini, Marko Zaror
description: Machete (Danny Trejo) is recruited by the United States government for a mission considered impossible for any other human being. He must travel to Mexico and take out Mad Mendez (Demián Bichir), a cartel boss who threatens to fire a lethal missile at the United States. After discovering that the missiles are remotely controlled with a mechanism born of the twisted mind of Luther Voz (Mel Gibson), an eccentric billionaire arms dealer with delusional delusions of power, Machete will try to stop in time a plan to create the global anarchy.
notes: With the saga of "Machete" Rodriguez has found the measure of his project, the right balance between the Tarantine "grindhouse" recovery and the new sweeping by Asylum. The second act is pure trash increased to art, thanks to an aesthetic research studied at the table that raises the archetypal material of the golden age of genre cinema, especially Italian, to power. Trejo, now a stable icon like George Hilton, Luigi Montefiori & Co. before him, is flanked by the acting residues Sheen, Gibson and Banderas, by the icon of the trash cleaned up Lady Gaga and by a group of plus sizes that spit lead from the Wonderbra ( Vergara) or wandering around with machine guns under the bridesmaid dress (Heard). Missing the plot? So here it is: Machete kills the bad guys.

title: Assassin's Bullet
actors: Christian Slater, Donald Sutherland, Elika Portnoy, Timothy Spall, Ivaylo Geraskov, Ivan Kotsev, Tanya Mickov, Vassil Mihajlov, Bashar Rahal, Mariana Stanisheva
description: Robert Diggs (Christian Slater), a former FBI operative, is contacted by US Ambassador Ashdown (Donald Sutherland) to prevent an international incident from developing. Diggs's task is to trace the identity of the unknown vigilante who in Bulgaria is killing one after another the terrorists on America's most dangerous wanted list in Europe. While trying to track down the killer, Diggs runs into Ursula, a sexy belly dancer, whom he immediately falls in love with. With her he thinks he can overcome the shock of his wife's tragic death, which occurred some time before, but Ursula hides something very dangerous.

title: Soldiers of Fortune
actors: Sean Bean, Christian Slater, Ving Rhames, James Cromwell, Dominic Monaghan, Colm Meaney, Freddy Rodriguez, Charlie Bewley
description: Captain Craig McCenzie (Christian Slater) achieved remarkable results during the war in Afghanistan until, to save the life of his closest friend, he broke an order and was forced to leave the army. Reduced to working for a security company, he agrees to lead a group of five billionaires (Charlie Bewley, Sean Bean, James Cromwell, Ving Rhames and Dominic Monaghan) who secretly want to organize a war. The tycoons' goal is to get their hands on Snake Island, a diamond-rich atoll in the Black Sea, freeing themselves from the overwhelming power of the brutal dictator and his head of security, a former CIA agent. Since nothing goes as planned, McCenzie is forced to transform a handful of arrogant and selfish men into an army of real soldiers, capable of surviving the enemy's attacks.

title: A Plumm Summer
actors: Jeff Daniels, William Baldwin, Henry Winkler, Lisa Guerrero, Chris Massoglia, Owen Pearce, Morgan Flynn, Brenda Strong, Tim Quill, Peter Scolari
description: Rocky Plumm, a five-year-old boy living in Montana in the mid-1960s, has an inordinate passion for TV presenter Happy Herb (Henry Winkler) and his talking puppet Froggy Doo, who cheer up TV afternoons. But when Froggy Doo is stolen and the show suspended, Rocky and his brother Elliott decide to venture together with Haley in a frantic search for the puppet that will lead them to meet a couple of federal agents and a long list of suspected thieves.

title: The Quiet Ones
actors: Jared Harris, Sam Claflin, Erin Richards, Olivia Cooke, Rory Fleck-Byrne, Max Pirkis
description: A university professor of physics (Jared Harris) with unorthodox and highly controversial methods gathers his best students with the aim of conducting an experiment never attempted before: probing the paranormal with science. Based on the theory that paranormal activity is generated by human negative energy, the experiments on Jane (Olivia Cooke) are fraudulently performed, pushing her even further into the abyss. When terrifying events unfold with gruesome consequences, they will quickly realize that they have triggered a more terrifying force than they could ever have imagined.
notes: This Hammer production, optimizing costs and ideas, possesses a largely new strength, capable of overcoming the fences of customs and a well-known dramaturgical score. Power of framing and dialogue between devices fueled by the craftsman Pogue, rather inspired after the mediocre Quarantine 2. Despite the register imbalances, The Origins of Evil is a conscious and rigorous horror, which opposes a solid philology to excess.

title: Arctic Predator
actors: Erbi Ago, Velizar Binev, Lucy Brown, Dean Cain, Louisa Clein, Laia Gonzàlez, Mike Johnson, Iliana Lazarova, Mike Straub, Steven Waddington
description: A group of explorers are looking for a ship that sank in the 19th century off the Antarctic coast. During the research, they will have the misfortune of awakening an alien creature buried for centuries in the middle of the ice with devastating and dangerous consequences.

title: RoboCop
actors: Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton, Samuel L. Jackson, Abbie Cornish, Jackie Earle Haley, Michael K. Williams, Jay Baruchel, Jennifer Ehle, Marianne Jean-Baptiste
description: In the year 2029, the American multinational OmniCorp developed the most modern technology for building robots. The drones designed have been successful in all the various wars around the globe and the company wants to give its creatures a leading role also at home. Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman), a loving husband and father, works every day on the streets of Detroit trying to stop the wave of crime and corruption that is gripping the city. Badly injured on the job, Alex is rescued by OmniCorp's cutting-edge robotic technology, returning to service with extraordinary new abilities but with problems a human has never faced before.
notes: There are sequences, in the new "RoboCop", that leave you speechless. The thundering clash with thermal goggles at night, the image of what remains of agent Murphy which demonstrates the value of the single shot in synthesizing an emotional process, the opening words in a Tehran under robotic surveillance worthy of the best cyberpunk imagery. But can these (and other) visual peaks of the Brazilian director be enough to make us digest an embarrassing script? If the hero we knew in Paul Verhoven's film of the same name (1987) was the bearer of a depth linked to his nature as a man-machine, this is simply a man inside a machine, conceived in the name of progress and money. And some subtext on free will is not enough to ennoble an operation more similar to the pilot of a very expensive TV series than the complexity of cinema.

title: Dragon Crusaders
actors: Dylan Jones, Cecily Fay, Feth Greenwood, Shinead Byrne, Tony Sams, Simon Lloyd-Roberts, Charles Barrett, Christian Howard, Gary Crosbie, Ambrose Flemming
description: After their order is disbanded, a group of Knights Templar arrives in a small village just attacked by a pirate ship. By defeating them, the knights fall victim to an ancient curse that forces them to assume the guise of horrifying monsters. The only chance they have to free themselves from the spell and save themselves is to set out on the trail of a terrible dragon, under whose features a sorcerer is hiding, and face him.

title: The Devil's Rain
actors: Ernest Borgnine, Tom Skerritt, Joan Prather, Eddie Albert, William Shatner, Ida Lupino, Keenan Wynn, Woody Chambliss, John Travolta, Claudio Brook
description: In a small rural Arizona town, a sect of devil worshipers thrives, led by Mephistopheles Jonathan Corbis (Ernest Borgnine). The sect possesses a strange crystal amulet which, according to tradition, guards the captive souls of their sacrificial victims. Determined to get his hands on a book that contains the identities of all the victims, Corbis does not hesitate to order the massacre of the Prestons in order to keep the existence of the volume a secret. Having escaped the massacre, Tom Preston (Tom Skerritt) plots his own personal revenge.

title: Pursuit to Algiers
actors: Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Marjorie Riordan, Rosalind Ivan, Morton Lowry, Leslie Vincent, Martin Kosleck, Rex Evans, John Abbott, Gerald Hamer
description: Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) and loyal Watson (Nigel Bruce) are hired by to escort the heir to the throne Nikolas (Lesile Vincent) to his country, where he must take the place of his murdered father. Theirs will be a dangerous and accident-studded journey by the enemies of the throne, who plot for the young dolphin to be killed too.
notes: Based on Conan Doyle's novel The Return of Sherlock Holmes.

title: Aftershock
actors: Eli Roth, Selena Gomez, Andrea Osvart, Ariel Levy, Nicolás Martínez, Lorenza Izzo, Natasha Yarovenko, Paz Bascuñan, Gabriela Hernández, Dayana Amigo
description: On the coast of Valparaiso, Chile, the vacation of the American tourist Gringo (Eli Roth), who has come to visit his friend Ariel (Ariel Levy) after ending his marriage, turns at its best when he meets a group of three beautiful tourists ( Natasha Yarovenko, Andrea Osvart and Lorenza Izzo) to go have fun with. But when during the night a violent earthquake hits the area and devastates everything including the underground nightclub where they are having fun, terror takes over and trying to reach the surface will only be the beginning of the hellish chaos that awaits them once. outside.

title: The ABCs of Death
directors: Nacho Vigalondo, Adrian Garcia Bogliano, Ernesto Díaz Espinoza, Marcel Sarmiento, Angela Bettis, Noboru Iguchi, Andrew Traucki, Thomas Cappelen Malling, Jorge Michel Grau, Yûdai Yamaguchi, Anders Morgenthaler, Timo Tjahjanto, Ti West, Banjong Pisanthanakun, Hélène Cattet, Bruno Forzani, Simon Rumley, Adam Wingard, Srdjan Spasojevic, Jake West, Lee Hardcastle, Ben Wheatley, Kaare Andrews, Jon Schnepp, Xavier Gens, Jason Eisener, Yoshihiro Nishimura
actors: Ingrid Bolsø Berdal, Erik Aude, Dallas Malloy, Iván González, Peter Pedrero, Kyra Zagorsky, Darenzia, Sarah Bonrepaux, Lee Hardcastle, Lucy Clements
description: 27 different directors stage 26 different ways - perverse, brutal and violent - to die. Each short film is made starting from a letter of the alphabet, the initial of a word that each individual director has chosen to give vent to their horror fantasy.
notes: Among the various directors, mostly rookies, involved in the project are also Ben Wheatley, Ti West, Jason Eisener, Adam Wingard, Xavier Gens and Nacho Vigalondo.

title: The Raven
actors: Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Lester Matthews, Irene Ware, Samuel S. Hinds, Spencer Charters, Inez Courtney, Ian Wolfe, Maidel Turner, Anne Darling
description: Dancer Jean Thatcher (Irene Ware) falls into a coma following a car accident. To save her, her father (Samuel Hinds) begs Dr. Vollin (Bela Lugosi), fond of Edgar Allan Poe and instruments of torture, to return to the medical profession, but when he falls in love with the girl, already engaged, the judge Thatcher refuses to give it to him. The dot. Vollin then, with the help of the convicted Bateman (Boris Karloff) who managed to blackmail, wants to take revenge on the girl's whole family, inviting them to his home.
notes: The canvas is very loosely inspired by the poem of the same name by E. A. Poe. The director is credited as Louis Friedlander.

title: The Werewolf
actors: Steven Ritch, Don Megowan, Joyce Holden, Eleanore Tanin, Kim Charney, Harry Lauter, Larry J. Blake, Ken Christy, James Gavin, S. John Launer
description: After being seriously injured in a car accident, Duncan Marsh unknowingly becomes the test subject of a pair of unscrupulous scientists. Intent on experimenting with a cure for radiation poisoning, the two scientists have developed a serum that, when injected into Duncan's body, has an unexpected side effect. Duncan slowly transforms into a murderous werewolf and wreaks havoc in the Big Bear Lakes area.

title: Unknown Island
actors: Virginia Grey, Phillip Reed, Richard Denning, Barton MacLane, Dick Wessel, Dan White, Phil Nazir
description: John Fairbanks is a former marine who, while on duty, discovered a mysterious island in the Pacific where prehistoric creatures and dinosaurs that survived the extinction of millions of years earlier still lived. Still traumatized by the experience, John is convinced to return to the island by Ted, an ambitious photographer who sees in photographing dinosaurs a chance to get his career off the ground. On the journey, they are accompanied by Carol, Ted's girlfriend, and by Captain Tarnowski, a man who is best not to be trusted.

title: The Giant Claw
actors: Jeff Morrow, Mara Corday, Morris Ankrum, Louis Merrill, Edgar Barrier, Robert Shayne, Frank Griffin, Clark Howat, Morgan Jones
description: Scientist Mitch McAfee claims to have seen a giant bird in the skies, arrived from space and capable of attacking aircraft in flight. But no one is willing to give credit to his words until the bird reveals itself to everyone, targeting humans as well. However, any attempt to take it down is useless due to the antimatter shield and the force field that protect it, forcing Mitch to find a way to create an opening.

title: Wendigo
actors: Patricia Clarkson, Jake Weber, Erik Per Sullivan, John Speredakos, Christopher Wynkoop, Lloyd Oxendine, Brian Delate, Daniel Sherman, Jennifer Wiltsie, Maxx Stratton
description: Jeff, a professional photographer from Manhattan, decides to take a break from work and travel with his wife Kim and son Miles in upstate New York to a house in the snow. During the journey with his car, Jeff runs over a deer, attracting the dislikes and fury of Otis, a long-time hunter struggling with the animal. After arriving at their destination and discovering that the house is close to Otis, Jeff and his family realize that a dark presence has targeted them, believing it to be a wendigo, a mythological Indian creature half man and half deer.

title: 4D Man
actors: Robert Lansing, Lee Meriwether, James Congdon, Robert Strauss, Edgar Stehli, Patty Duke, Guy Raymond, Chic James, Elbert Smith, George Karas
description: Scott and Tony Nelson, two brother scientists, develop an amplifier that allows humans to enter the fourth dimension and pass through to solid bodies. When Scott experiments with the amplifier on himself, he finds that every time he enters the fourth dimension his age grows rapidly and to regain vital energy and youth he begins to kill people. Only girlfriend Linda and brother Tony will be able to stop his murderous rampage.

title: The Thompsons
actors: Cory Knauf, Samuel Child, Elizabeth Henstridge, Daniel O'Meara, MacKenzie Firgens, Ryan Hartwig, Sean Browne, Tom Holloway, Joseph McKelheer, Selina Giles
description: After the bloodbath caused in America, the Hamilton brothers ended up on the most wanted list and, changing their surname to Thompson, they move to Britain in search of another clan of vampires who can help them survive. Arriving in the picaresque village of Ludlow, they find the support of the Stuart family. But soon Frances Hamilton begins to suspect that the Stuarts are hiding other intentions behind their kindness. With the help of Riley Stuart, the only member of the family who is not thirsty for blood, Francis tries to find out what the real intentions of the Stuarts are before an epic battle between the two clans begins.
notes: Sequel to The Hamiltons (2006).

title: Chained
actors: Vincent D'Onofrio, Eamon Farren, Julia Ormond, Gina Philips, Jake Weber, Conor Leslie, Evan Bird, Shannon Jardine, Amy Matysio, Jodi Sadowsky
description: A trip to the movies turns into a nightmare for Sarah (Julia Ormond) and nine-year-old son Tim. Kidnapped by Bob (Vincent D'Onofrio), a crazy taxi driver, they are taken to their home and, helpless, Tim witnesses the murder of his mother. That, however, is not the only crime that Tim becomes a witness: enslaved by Bob and held in chains, the boy is forced to bury the corpses of the man's victims. As time and years go by, domination and death for Tim (Eamon Farren) become routine until the day Bob promises him freedom if he too turns into a killer. Suddenly, a reluctant Tim finds himself having to decide between following in Bob's bloody footsteps or trying to get rid of them for good.

title: Long Distance
actors: Monica Keena, Ivan Martin, Kevin Chapman, Tamala Jones, Emily Galvin, Lonnie Farmer, Richard Snee, Tim McIntire, David Ian, Alice Duffy
description: Nicole is a lonely young woman who one day dials a phone number by entering a number wrong. A trivial mistake that will prove fatal: on the other end of the line there is an answering machine. She hangs up but immediately receives a call from a man who talks to her in a strange way. The next day the police arrive and have traced the calls made to that number as belonging to a woman who was killed just as Nicole accidentally called her. The killer, who now has Nicole's number, begins to involve her by updating her by telephone on the chain of crimes she is committing as she approaches Nicole's home in Boston.

title: The Wolverine
actors: Hugh Jackman, Hiroyuki Sanada, Famke Janssen, Will Yun Lee, Rila Fukushima, Tao Okamoto, Svetlana Khodchenkova, Hal Yamanouchi, Brian Tee, James Fraser, Luke Webb
description: Logan (Hugh Jackman), eternal warrior and outsider, is in Japan, land of valiant samurai warriors. Here samurai steel will collide with the adamantine of Wolverine's claws when Logan is forced to face an enemy of his caliber. Vulnerable for the first time and pushed beyond all physical and emotional limits, he will confront his inner struggle against immortality, coming out even more strengthened than before.
notes: Mangold rides the wave of the injured / humanized superhero and the consequent rebirth, but the Wolverine stripped of his powers cannot suffer any more than a functioning X-Man already does: mutants, you know, are not supermen, but an outcast minority. The director then pushes the pedal of sentimentality, weaving ample romantic brackets torn by fights in the action fabric. Hugh Jackman slips into Logan for the sixth time and is the only one really comfortable; now he is one with his character and, in a work that is a sequel / reboot / spinoff of well-known imaginaries, surpasses any new face. So much so that the best comes, with the usual suspects, after the credits.

title: El Gringo
actors: Scott Adkins, Christian Slater, Yvette Yates, Israel Islas, Erando González, Sofía Sisniega, Valentin Ganev, Zahary Baharov, Bliss Kelley, Blaire Noonan
description: "The Man" (Scott Adkins) is a man shrouded in mystery who roams Mexico with a bag containing two million dollars. On his way he gets stuck in a remote town in the middle of the desert waiting for a constantly delayed bus. When the news of the money in his possession spreads, The Man will have to face attacks from corrupt cops, thieves and gangsters ready to do anything to get their hands on that money.

title: 6 Bullets
actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Joe Flanigan, Bianca Bree, Kristopher Van Varenberg, Anna-Louise Plowman, Louis Dempsey, Terese Cilluffo, Jimmy Townsend, Uriel Emil Pollack, Charlotte Beaumont
description: Former mercenary Samson Gaul (Van Damme) has decided to retire from the business following strong pangs of conscience. However, he decides to accept a new assignment when a mixed martial arts champion hires him with the aim of finding his young daughter who has been kidnapped.

title: The Congress
actors: Paul Giamatti, Robin Wright, Kodi Smit-McPhee, Harvey Keitel, Sami Gayle, Frances Fisher, Danny Huston, Michael Landes, Michael Stahl-David, Christopher B. Duncan
description: Robin Wright lets herself be scanned by Miramount for the creation of digital avatars that the big film company will be able to exploit at will, inserting the actress in any type of upcoming film. For the next twenty years Wright will be forced to attend the Miramount Nagasaki congress as a guest of honor until, in a changed world with fantastic appearances, she witnesses a new invention that offers her the chance to experience her film on request, following a simple prescription.
notes: Of The Congress - a mix of animation and live action, loosely based on the novel The Congress of Futurology, by Stanislaw Lem, author of Solaris - the new film by Israeli colonel Ari Folman, courage and ambition must certainly be emphasized. In the second lysergic part, The Congress becomes more tiring and cerebral, while maintaining an undoubted visual appeal. Of note is the excellent Danny Huston, sophisticated villain.

title: Annihilation Earth
actors: Luke Goss, Marina Sirtis, Colin Salmon, Casey Angelova, Velizar Biney, Louise Cliffe, Theo Cross, Ryan Spike Dauner, Didem Erol, Laura Giosh
description: In the not too distant future, the entire West's energy supply depends on two super-reactors. A terrorist attack destroys one of the two reactors, putting the very existence of mankind at risk but a mission of heroic scientists tries to save the Earth.

title: One in the Chamber
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Cuba Gooding jr., Billy Murray, Claudia Bassols, Leo Gregory, Louis Mandylor, Lia Sinchevici, Andrew Bicknell, Aaron McPherson, Alin Panc
description: Two mafia gangs have long been at war with each other. One of the two hires a hitman named Craver (Cuba Gooding Jr.) to eliminate the rival boss. The job is not successful, however, and in his place is then called Wolf (Dolph Lundgren) another murderer for a fee. Meanwhile, Craver has moved on to work for the rival gang: at this point the clash between the two killers becomes very hard.

title: Triassic Attack
actors: Steven Brand, Kirsty Mitchell, Jordan Bonev, Nathalie Buscombe, Emilia Clarke, Lincoln Frager, Veselina Ilieva, John Laskowski, Jazz Lintott, Vladimir Mihailov
description: Museum owner accidentally brings dinosaur fossils back to life. The giants of the past wreak havoc on the small town.
notes: A low budget production by the mythological Syfy, responsible for countless horror and sci-fi sculptures, cinematic experiences beyond any conception of trash.

title: White House Down
actors: Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Jason Clarke, James Woods, Richard Jenkins, Rachelle Lefevre, Joey King, Lance Reddick, Garcelle Beauvais
description: Agent John Cale (Channing Tatum) has just been denied the chance to work for the defense of US President James Sawyer (Jaime Foxx). In order not to disappoint his daughter Emily's expectations, John decides to take her to visit the White House when the complex is attacked by a heavily armed paramilitary group. With the government in chaos and time running out, it's up to Cale to save the president, his daughter and the entire nation.
notes: James Vanderbilt's screenplay sparked why Columbia Sony would pay $ 3 million for it. An out of market price: the model is the same as "Crystal Trap" (and other followers). A Teutonic wind blows on both films: in the first, the team of marauders led (magnificently) by Alan Rickman was German; in "Under siege" the filmmakers come from Germany and Austria, from the director to the producers to the musician to the talented director of photography Anna Foerster. With the similarities we stop here: the playing field is the same but Channing Tatum is not Bruce Willis. The only really interesting thing is the character played by James Woods, for the rest we are sailing on sight in the muscular predictability of similar productions. Those looking for exactly what the film promises will not be completely disappointed.

title: Troll
actors: Noah Hathaway, Michael Moriarty, Shelley Hack, Jenny Beck, Sonny Bono, Phil Fondacaro, Brad Hall, Anne Lockhart, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Gary Sandy, June Lockhart, Robert Hathaway, James Beck, Dale Wyatt, Barbara Sciorilli
description: An American boy finds himself fighting a Troll, an evil elf who, having settled in the building where he lives, has decided to conquer the world by transforming it into a fairy kingdom.

title: Edge of Tomorrow
actors: Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Bill Paxton, Brendan Gleeson, Jonas Armstrong, Tony Way, Kick Gurry, Franz Drameh, Dragomir Mrsic, Charlotte Riley, Noah Taylor
description: In the near future, the Mimic, an alien super race, attacked Earth, destroying cities and leaving a trail of millions of human victims. Ferocious, brutal, armed and endowed with extraordinary telepathic abilities, they have met no one capable of stopping them until the day when armies around the world decide to join forces for a last desperate attempt at resistance. Among the commanders chosen is also Bill Cage (Tom Cruise) who, untrained in combat, is killed in a few minutes along with an alien. Inexplicably Cage awakens from the dead but is doomed to repeat the same day and fight over and over. Refining techniques and skills in battle after battle, Cage joins forces with Rita Vrataski (Emily Blunt), a special warrior who has killed more Mimic than anyone else.
notes: Reinventing the Normandy landings, paying homage to Yoshiyuki Tomino's exoskeletons that make the soldiers of Daitarn 3 look and in fact rewriting the plot of "Source Code", Liman unrolls and wraps reality as if it were a Moebius strip. The aliens, the Mimics, a tribute to Del Toro's film of the same name, look like crystallized lichens, while Christopher McQuarrie keeps the suspense bolts tight. Emily Blunt bending over while doing pushups is spectacular and Tom Cruise, increasingly mysterious in his glamorous appearance, is flawless.

title: Blood Out
actors: Luke Goss, Val Kilmer, Vinnie Jones, 50 Cent, Tamer Hassan, AnnaLynne McCord, Ed Quinn, Ryan Donowho, Stephanie Honore, Sam Medina
description: Michael Spencer (Luke Goss) is a small town sheriff who decides to leave the police when colleagues refuse to investigate his brother's death. Spencer will thus decide to carry out the investigation on his behalf, infiltrating the criminal gang of which the relative was part.

title: Hold Your Breath
actors: Katrina Bowden, Randy Wayne, Erin Marie Hogan, Seth Cassell, Joshua Michael Allen, Alex Ball, Darin Cooper, Steve Hanks, Jordan Pratt-Thatcher, Brad Slaughter
description: Seven friends who spend a weekend camping find themselves walking past a dilapidated cemetery. According to an urban legend, in front of the cemeteries it is necessary to hold your breath so as not to allow evil spirits to take over. One of the friends, to dispel the myth, however, refuses to hold his breath. Unknowingly, he frees the spirit of a well-known serial killer who, moving from one body to another, begins to kill his friends one after another.

title: The Black Cat
actors: Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, David Manners, Julie Bishop, Egon Brecher, Harry Cording, Lucille Lund, Henry Armetta, Albert Conti
description: Writer Peter Alison (David Manners) and his wife Joan (Jaqueline Wells) are on their honeymoon, heading to Gömbös, Hungary, alone in a reserved compartment of the Orient Express. By mistake, Dr. Vitus Werdegast (Bela Lugosi), on his way to visit an old friend right in the vicinity of Gömbös. Werdegast says he was interned for fifteen years in the harsh Russian prison of Kurgaal, a place from which few have managed to return. Once off the train in Visegrad, the couple finds a car waiting for her specially sent from the hotel in Gömbös. Werdegast and his servant, who was waiting for him at the station, take advantage of the aircraft to reach the estate of his friend, engineer Poelzig (Boris Karloff). On the way, at night and while a storm is raging, they go astray. The driver dies instantly, the others reach the Poelzig estate on foot, built on the ancient site of Fort Marmorus, "the largest tomb in the world", where many men lost their lives during the Great War. After Joan's minor injuries are healed, the young couple sets out to rest, while Werdegast remains face to face with Poelzig. In reality Poelzig is not an old friend, but the former commander, who sold his men to the Russians while he saved himself. Werdegast had a wife, Karen, and a little daughter, whom the wicked officer persuaded to follow him, after reporting that her husband had been killed. Now Werdegast intends to take back his wife and daughter, and take revenge, not by physically eliminating the traitor, but by slowly killing his soul, the same way his own was killed in Kurgaal.
notes: The first of many films shot together by the two sacred monsters of horror Bela Lugosi and Boris Karloff. Despite the initial titles attribute the inspiration to him with the caption "Suggested by the immortal Edgar Allan Poe classic", the eponymous story of the great writer does not c 'nothing enters. The soundtrack is arranged from pieces by Liszt, Schubert, Schumann, Bach and Brahms.

title: Smiley
actors: Caitlin Gerard, Melanie Papalia, Shane Dawson, Andrew James Allen, Roger Bart, Keith David, Toby Turner, Michael Traynor, Liza Weil, Jana Winternitz, Nikki Limo, Patrick O'Sullivan, DeStorm Power, Steve Greene
description: Mentally frail girl Ashley learns of a modern urban legend that an insane serial killer named "Smiley" can be summoned over the internet. Since then, she's obsessed with becoming Smiley's next victim and finds herself having to decide between finally losing her mind or taking matters into her own hands.
notes: Michael J. Gallagher, born in 1988 and all over YouTube, did not do it "for the lulz": his very low budget horror, between a gross editing error and the other, tries (with partial success) to baste a discourse on the viral idiocy of the “internet people”, aiming high and using a professor of logic as a theorist of the operation. The ambition is great and inversely proportional to the mastery of the cast & credits, but the game of the young authors is aware and not (too) sterile: in part update of "Scream" to the era of web 2.0, in part collegiate that looks to the sequel, "Smiley" opens the big screen to terror that runs on wi-fi.

title: Evil Dead
actors: Jane Levy, Shiloh Fernandez, Jessica Lucas, Lou Taylor Pucci, Elizabeth Blackmore
description: A group of five friends in their 20s find themselves in a remote mountain home. Here, the boys discover a book of the dead that belonged to an old archaeologist, through which they involuntarily summon the sleeping demons that populate the nearby woods. In succession, the children will experience on their skin the dramatic effects that this error causes until only one, left still alive, finds himself fighting for survival.
notes: By bundling slasher structures and exorcist nuclei, zombie drifts and witch-like openings, Alvarez loses the thread of the story he has to tell and of the one that preceded him, sacrificing the playful-grotesque matrix in the name of a chased and never achieved drama. Between electric saws, green vomit and showers of blood, in that house one touches the ridiculous, in a logic of the accumulation of obsolete horror from supermarket and worthy, rather, of a discount store. What to leave, then, in the cart? The power of the single image and the bloody make-up of violence, at times pleasantly disturbing. The rest are damaged goods.

title: Orgy of the Dead
actors: Criswell, Fawn Silver, Pat Barrington, William Bates, Mickey Jines, Barbara Nordin, Bunny Glaser, Nadejda Klein, Coleen O'Brien, Lorali Hart
description: While driving down a dark road, Bob and Shirley have an accident and seek help at a nearby cemetery. There they witness a curious orgy of the dead, dominated by the Emperor of the Night.

title: Fast & Furious 6
actors: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson, Jordana Brewster, Michelle Rodriguez, Luke Evans, Gina Carano, Gal Gadot, Tyrese Gibson, Sung Kang, Ludacris, Elsa Pataky
description: After overthrowing the empire of a boss in Rio, Dom Toretto (Vin Diesel) and Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) have dedicated themselves to traveling the world, unable as they are to go home and take back everything they left behind. behind. Meanwhile, Hobbs (Dwayne Johnson) has instead stumbled upon the case of an organization of criminal pilots, whose boss (Luke Ewans) is assisted by a woman who turns out to be Letty (Michelle Rodriguez), the ex of Dom who all they thought she was dead. In an attempt to permanently knock them out, Hobbs asks Dom to put London's elite squad back together.
notes: More and more exasperated, the saga loved by the box office and designed for tuning fanatics and lovers of cursed James Dean is enchanted by the action pedal that has marred us since the 90s, the one that mixes irony and good reconciling feelings on cartoon evolutions of the bodies and the virtuosity of choreographies always happy to cross the threshold of credibility, so as to elicit laughter and applause from the amused satisfaction of the public. Watch out for the finale, which winks at Marvel ways and launches the inevitable sequel.

title: Dead Man's Burden
actors: Barlow Jacobs, Clare Bowen, David Call, Joseph Lyle Taylor, Richard Riehle, Jerry Clarke, Adam O'Byrne, Travis Hammer, Luce Rains, William Sterchi
description: 1870. In the areas near the New Mexico border, the scars of the American Civil War are still open and Martha, who has lost her father, together with her husband Heck decides to leave misery and destruction and move to San Francisco in search of new life. But before they sell the family ranch to a mining company, Wade, Martha's older brother, believed to have died in the war, reappears. With his return, old secrets slowly come to light that increase tensions between brother and sister, threatening what's left of the family.

title: Zombie Nation
actors: Günther Ziegler, Brandon Dean, Axel Montgomery, Phil Lander, Martina Bottesch, Szilvi Naray-Davey, Karen Maxwell, Naidra Dawn Thomson, Victoria Ullmann, Kevin McCloskey
description: Police officer Joe Singer lives a secret nightlife where he kidnaps women, takes them to his apartment and kills them by injecting them with a mysterious liquid. During his last shift of the day, enraged over some work-related issues, Joe arrests the wrong woman, inadvertently causing his previous victims to awaken. Returned to life from their eternal sleep, the women demand revenge for the fate that Joe has reserved for them.

title: Messiah of Evil
actors: Michael Greer, Marianna Hill, Joy Bang, Anitra Ford, Royal Dano, Elisha Cook jr., Charles Dierkop, Bennie Robinson, Morgan Fisher, Emma Truckman
description: A young woman named Arletty arrives at Point Dune, a small seaside town in California, to visit her estranged artist father Joseph. As soon as she arrived, she did not find her father but a diary in which he noted the strange facts that occurred in the area, inviting her to never look for him. Realizing immediately the disturbing atmosphere that hovers among the inhabitants, Arletty will make gruesome discoveries about the centenary and cursed legend of the "blood moon".

title: Oldboy
