actors: Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Olsen, Samuel L. Jackson, Sharlto Copley, Michael Imperioli, Pom Klementieff, James Ransone, Taryn Terrell, Caitlin Dulany, Joe Chrest, Ciera Payton, Linda Emond
description: Joe Ducett (Josh Brolin) is an advertiser who is kidnapped and kept segregated for twenty long years for no reason. When, in an equally inexplicable way, he is released, he begins a long and obsessive search aimed at finding those who wanted to give him such cruel treatment. His thirst for revenge will lead him into a new web of conspiracies and torments.
notes: Spike Lee does his best in some ways, he stands out from Park Chan-wook above all for his stylistic choices, shooting with three different types of film and with a much less glossy look. The tragedy remains powerful, Josh Brolin's interpretation is generous, the side-to-side combat is a piece of virtuosity, and the sex scene is well above average in Hollywood, yet something no longer works. The crucial question is of register: while Park treated the plot as a story over the top and allowed himself passages with a pop or comic-grotesque taste, Lee instead takes himself completely seriously but his "Oldboy" is no longer dark or plausible. , only more bleak and tired, devoid of the inventive energy and postmodern irony that loaded the original.

title: Crash!
actors: José Ferrer, Sue Lyon, John Ericson, Leslie Parrish, John Carradine, Jerome Guardino, Richard Band, Gary Baxley, Ron Carter, Barry Chase
description: Marc Denne, an expert antiques dealer, is forced by a car accident to remain locked up in a wheelchair at home. Convinced that his wife Kim, who has recently joined a cult, caused the accident, Marc sends his dog to attack her while he is driving his demonic black Corvette. Off the road, Kim survives the accident but is hospitalized in serious condition. As doctors try to figure out the connection between the woman and the idol she holds in her hands, the black Corvette with no one driving begins to wreak havoc on the California countryside.

title: Sabotage
actors: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sam Worthington, Joe Manganiello, Harold Perrineau, Terrence Howard, Max Martini, Josh Holloway, Olivia Williams, Mireille Enos, Kevin Vance
description: A task force of selected agents of the Goddess is in charge of dismantling the cartels of the drug world. Specializing in complex mobile operations, the team carries out a tactical raid on a secret drug den. What seems to be just a routine operation, however, turns out to be a very elaborate robbery and studied in every detail. After hiding the stolen millions of dollars, the team is convinced their secret is safe until someone begins murdering the agents one after the other.

title: Olympus Has Fallen
actors: Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart, Morgan Freeman, Angela Bassett, Cole Hauser, Ashley Judd, Melissa Leo, Dylan McDermott, Radha Mitchell, Rick Yune, Finley Jacobsen, Han Soto, Phil Austin
description: Mike Banning (Gerard Butler) is a secret service agent who has lost his job and his honor, held responsible for the first lady's accidental death. When the White House is attacked by a group of North Korean terrorists, Mike voluntarily goes to the site to prove that he is the only man who can save the life of the President (Aaron Eckhart) and the future of the nation itself.
notes: American commercial cinema is truly incorrigible: patriotic and superficial, it ridicules itself for its nightmares that are always the same interpreted each time by different actors and at the same time is admired for how it knows how to grasp the air of the times. It is obviously a question of playing along, of adhering to the stereotypes of action thrillers or of rejecting them and at the most recognizing some merit.

title: Red 2
actors: Bruce Willis, Anthony Hopkins, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Helen Mirren, John Malkovich, Mary-Louise Parker, David Thewlis, Neal McDonough, Byung-hun Lee, Brian Cox, Paul Hopkins
description: Retired CIA agent Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) is getting into trouble again with the "Nightshade", a dangerous nuclear weapon that disappeared 25 years earlier under mysterious circumstances and of which he had never heard of. While former colleague Victoria (Helen Mirren) has been given the task of eliminating him from MI6, supported by Marvin Biggs (John Malkovich) and his wife Sarah (Mary-Louise Parker) in tow, Frank sets out on a hunt which, passing through Paris, London and Moscow, it will lead him to discover the mystery behind the Nightshade, a weapon coveted by the FBI, special agents, terrorists and former spies, and the role played by Katja (Catherine Zeta-Jones), his most seductive former flame , and the brilliant scientist Bailey (Anthony Hopkins).
notes: The all-star cast from the first episode lost Morgan Freeman, Richard Dreyfuss and Karl Urban, while earning Anthony Hopkins, Catherine Zeta-Jones, David Thewlis, and Lee Byung-hun. Beyond the laughable plot, the more or less successful (more less than more) action scenes, the spy story and its parody, the absent-minded performance of Bruce Willis and John Malkovich stands out, who while they fight, love manfully, dialogue wittily, they seem lost in some inaccessible thought.

title: The Cursed
actors: Louis Mandylor, Brad Thornton, Costas Mandylor, Francesca Cecil, James Marshall, Tom Wright, Holt Boggs, Josie Davis, Christie Lynn Smith, Irish Ann Burch
description: In a small, quiet Tennessee town, Sheriff Jimmy Muldoon and his younger brother, Deputy Lloyd, ensure law and order. However, the day stranger Denny White arrives, some strange events begin to occur. After losing his girlfriend, home and job, Denny is about to start his new career as a writer and, by delving into the history of the town with the help of librarian Sara, he unearths an ancient and infernal curse.

title: 13 Sins
actors: Mark Webber, Ron Perlman, Rutina Wesley, Pruitt Taylor Vince, Judd Lormand, Devon Graye, Stephanie Honore, Tom Bower, Lance E. Nichols, Ritchie Montgomery
description: Elliot Brindle (Mark Webber), a mild-mannered social services coordinator, is about to marry his fiancée despite drowning in debt. A mysterious phone call informs him, however, that the hidden cameras of a game show are filming him and that to win the millionaire prize up for grabs he must complete all 13 tasks that will be assigned to him: for each task completed, the money will be credited to him. on account. Immediately after the first two simple instructions, his bank balance begins to rise and, albeit skeptical, Elliot continues the game. As he progresses the tasks become more and more extreme and Elliot finds himself trapped in horrors driven by unseen onlookers that lead him to a devastating point of no return.

title: Fingerprints
actors: Leah Pipes, Kristin Cavallari, Josh Henderson, Andrew Lawrence, Lou Diamond Phillips, Sally Kirkland, Geoffrey Lewis, Ginger Gilmartin, Glen Jensen, Morgan Brown
description: A young woman moves to a city where it is said of the presence of the ghosts of some children, killed in the past by a train.
notes: Horror with few action scenes and a predictable storyline that combines themes of the supernatural with the actions of a mysterious killer, in a slasher drift.

title: Peter Pan
actors: George Ali, Esther Ralston, Cyril Chadwick, Mary Brian, Jack Murphy, Philippe De Lacy, Virginia Brown Faire, Betty Bronson, Anna May Wong, Maurice Murphy
description: When the Darlings decide to go to a party, their children Wendy, Michael and John are left alone in the house, along with their dog. During the course of the evening, they receive the magical visit of Peter Pan and the Fairy Tinker Bell, who lead them to Neverland. Here they will experience a series of adventures to defeat Captain Hook and his gang of pirates.

title: Elephant White
actors: Djimon Hounsou, Kevin Bacon, Jirantanin Pitakporntrakul, Weeraprawat Wongpuapan, Abhijati 'Meuk' Jusakul, Suteerush Channukool, Sahajak Boonthanakit
description: The mercenary Curtie Church (Djimon Hounsou) is commissioned to exterminate a well-known Thai gang engaged in sex trafficking by a father whose daughter has been kidnapped. With the help of a ruthless and mysterious arms dealer (Kevin Bacon), Church manages to track down his targets but soon realizes that he has ended up at the center of a war that pits the violent world of the gang against that of lies of the man who hired him.

title: Tape 407
actors: Abigail Schrader, Samantha Lester, James Lyons, Melanie Lyons, Brendan Patrick Connor, Ken Garcia, Samantha Sloyan, Everette Wallin, Jude Gerard Prest, Savannah Ward
description: On board a plane on New Year's Eve, two teenage sisters playfully start filming videos that quickly turn into testimonies of the horror they are about to experience. An accident leads the plane to crash into a restricted area of ??the government and the few survivors find themselves persecuted by a group of predators, the result of a secret experiment.

title: The Zero Theorem
actors: Christoph Waltz, David Thewlis, Lucas Hedges, Tilda Swinton, Melanie Thierry, Ben Whishaw, Matt Damon, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Radu Andrei Micu, Peter Stormare
description: In a futuristic Orwellian world where humanity is controlled by corporate power and "camera men" who respond to the shady figure known only as Management, computer genius Qohen Leth (Christopher Waltz) lives in seclusion. of a former chapel destroyed by flames. Eccentric, lonely and plagued by existential anguish, Qohen has long been working on a mysterious project - Theorem Zero - aimed at discovering the purpose of life, if one exists. His work and isolation are sometimes interrupted by visits from the sexy and flamboyant Bainsley (Mélanie Thierry) and teenage prodigy Bob (Lucas Hedges). It will be thanks to one of the inventions of the latter that Qohen will face a journey inside the hidden dimensions of his soul, where the answers that both he and Management are looking for to prove or disprove the Theorem Zero are hidden.

title: Succubus: Hell-Bent
actors: Gary Busey, David Keith, Lorenzo Lamas, Robert L. Mann, Kelly Hu, Natalie Denise Sperl, Jayson Blair, Shawna Marie Nelson, Tim Herzog, Ahna O'Reilly
description: During spring break, Adam meets Lilith, a beautiful and very sexy girl. But Lilith is a demon.
notes: Scult for the straight-to-video market, with a pure recycled horror system and a staging to make your skin hump ... with laughter. To season it all, the monoexpression of Lorenzo Lamas.

title: Europa Report
actors: Sharlto Copley, Michael Nyqvist, Daniel Wu, Christian Camargo, Karolina Wydra, Isiah Whitlock Jr., Anamaria Marinca
description: For decades, scientists have theorized the existence of oceans of liquid water on Europa, one of the moons of the planet Jupiter. Further discoveries have led to suppose that there are also ideal conditions for life. To validate these findings and prove the existence of extraterrestrial life in the solar system, six astronauts of different nationalities are sent on a three-year trip to Europe.

title: Lost Signal
actors: Al Santos, Sandra McCoy, Brian McNamara, Ella Joyce, Ashley Gardner, Anne Marie Howard, Dihlon McManne, Helene McCardle, Don Fischer, Alex Boyd
description: Kevin and Tiffany, returning from a party, have a car accident and get lost in the depths of a forest.
notes: Based on a true story, or so they say, it's a frighteningly sloppy film. The use of digital suggests a family-sized set, but the artisan spirit of that cinema is just as far away.

title: All Is Lost
actors: Robert Redford
description: A man (Robert Redford) finds himself confronted with the wildest nature. On the open sea, after his 14-meter yacht collides with a container, he is forced to cling to his own strength to win a desperate and lonely struggle for survival. With the radio out of order and a violent storm to overcome, he will be at the mercy of the currents with the hope of soon crossing other passing boats on his route.
notes: "All Is Lost - All is lost" is a subjective story, whose point of view is now entrusted to Redford - face hollowed and immobile in the fatalistic struggle for survival - now to the water that surrounds him, an authentic narrator. With an experimental attitude, Chandor emphasizes the sound component, relentless in returning noises without intrusive music or human voice (except for the internal opening monologue). Antispectacular while staging storms and cataclysms, it accounts for the irreversible decline to which the civilization of progress is destined, whose constituent elements (computers, radio) are the first to sink.

title: Rogue River
actors: Michelle Page, Art Alexakis, Chris Coy, Michael Cudlitz, Lucinda Jenney, Bill Moseley
description: Still saddened by her father's recent death, Mara decides to disperse his ashes in the Rogue River, Oregon. When she runs out of a car on the way, Mara accepts a ride from Jon Wall, an affable guy mourning the death of his young daughter. A short detour takes them to the house in the woods where Jon lives with his wife Lea. Struck by Lea, Mara finds comfort by sharing with her the pain of their personal tragedy. However, not everything is as picturesque as it seems and Mara soon finds herself prisoner of a nightmare, forced to fight to survive in the dark and violent world of the couple.

title: Skinned Deep
actors: Forrest J Ackerman, Eric Bennett, Karoline Brandt, Bill Butts, Kurt Carley, Bill Corso, Warwick Davis, John Deall, Neil Dooley, Jason Dugre
description: The Rockwells are on their way through the streets of the American desert when they are forced to stop at an isolated diner due to a hitch. Here they are greeted by the apparently nice woman who runs the place but soon they discover that they have ended up in the den of a group of deranged people. The Rockwells are brutally massacred, with the exception of Tina, the teenage daughter who struck Brain, one of the woman's three children, in the heart.

title: Alien Origin
actors: Chelsea Vincent, Peter Pedrero, Philip Coc, Trey McCurley, Daniela Flynn, Andres Rash, Kent Noralez, Rupert Tablada, Saul Pech, Mjr. John Frear
description: Journalist Julia Evans (Chelsea Vincent) is granted authorization to join the military in Belize, engaged in the capture of rebels and terrorists. As the expedition proceeds filmed by their cameras, the group will come across a terrifying truth about the origins of life on earth, involving a mysterious alien spacecraft.

title: The Conjuring
actors: Vera Farmiga, Patrick Wilson, Ron Livingston, Lili Taylor, Mackenzie Foy, Joey King, Hayley McFarland, Shanley Caswell, Joseph Bishara, Steve Coulter, John Brotherton, Sterling Jerins, Shannon Kook, Kyla Deaver
description: A New England family has close encounters with the terrible spirits that haunt their farmhouse. To get rid of the evil presences, the family is forced to enlist the help of investigators Ed (Patrick Wilson) and Lorraine Warren (Vera Farmiga), experts in occult phenomena.
notes: Written by the Hayes twins, it is based on the extrasensory experiences of the real Warren spouses, here played by Vera Farmiga and Patrick Wilson, but thanks to Wan's staging it moves away from the pseudo-documentary style of fashionable horror. Also thanks to the translucent setting of the 70s, the film involves without seeking forced or false aesthetic originality but remaining functional to one thing: fear. Which for the director is first of all a matter of gaze, because narratively everything appears derivative and nothing should surprise anymore. Yet no: the expectations, the evocation of archetypes, even the worn creaking of a wooden door are stereotypes used at best.

title: sxtape
actors: Caitlyn Folley, Ian Duncan, Diana García, Julie Marcus, Daniel Faraldo, Eric Neil Gutierrez
description: In an attempt to revive their relationship, Adam and Jill decide to make a hardcore amateur video in an old abandoned mansion. However, the two quickly realize that they are not alone inside the structure. Something very threatening will turn their game into a desperate struggle for survival.

title: The Package
actors: Steve Austin, Dolph Lundgren, Darren Shahlavi, Monique Ganderton, Jerry Trimble, Michael Daingerfield, Lochlyn Munro, Mike Dopud, Kristen Kerr, Eric Keenleyside
description: All Tommy (Steve Austin) has to do is deliver a package to rival drug kingpin nicknamed "the German" (Dolph Lundgren). His seems like a chore until on the road he finds someone else willing to get their hands on the contents of what he's carrying. Forced to fight firsthand to make sure the package reaches its destination, Tommy soon realizes that he is carrying something very different from what he believed, finding himself involved in a very dangerous affair.

title: The Purge
actors: Ethan Hawke, Lena Headey, Max Burkholder, Adelaide Kane, Edwin Hodge, Rhys Wakefield, Tony Oller, Alicia Vela-Bailey, Tom Yi, John Weselcouch
description: In an America ravaged by crime and prison overcrowding, the government has established a twelve-hour period per year during which any crime or offense committed is not punished. Within 12 hours, the police cannot be called, hospitals suspend all forms of help and citizens are forced to regulate themselves without thinking too much about the consequences. When an intruder breaks into Sandin's "free" hours and begins a sequence of threatening events, James (Ethan Hawke), wife Mary (Lena Headey) and their children will see their limits tested to protect themselves without transforming themselves. in the monsters they are trying to hide from.
notes: Under the mask of the genre DeMonaco conceals abysmal social and anthropological reflections. The good neighbor of America 3.0 sharpens a cleaver in the yard, preparing for the slaughter. The class clash rekindles the engines, in a hopeless renewal of slave mechanics who want the homeless as picks for the redemption of the bourgeois classes. In DeMonaco's instant cult, the narrative developments are elementary, the characters do not always convince and some screenplay choices do not add up. But the subtexts that feed it respond to a pulsating urgency, the imagery it feeds on is alive and unsettling, the reflections it stimulates bring to light the fears and deep distortions of the social man.

title: Bad Milo
actors: Patrick Warburton, Peter Stormare, Stephen Root, Gillian Jacobs, Ken Marino, Jonathan Daniel Brown, Mary Kay Place, Toby Huss
description: A young married man discovers that the severe stomach pains he suffers from are due to a terrifying goblin who, fueled by his stress, lives in his gut and goes out to take revenge on the people who cause his anxiety. Only by managing the stress, the young man will be able to face the demon and protect himself and those around him from gruesome mortal suffering.

title: Horns
actors: Daniel Radcliffe, Max Minghella, Joe Anderson, Juno Temple, Kelli Garner, James Remar, Kathleen Quinlan, Heather Graham, David Morse, Laine MacNeil, Dylan Schmid, Desiree Zurowski, Mitchell Kummen
description: After a night of excess, 26-year-old Ig Perrish (Daniel Radcliffe) wakes up with a pair of devilish horns on his forehead. As the horns grow, Ig realizes he can feel the hidden thoughts and temptations of those around him. It will be thanks to this new ability that he will be able to solve the mystery related to the recent murder of his latest girlfriend Merrin Williams (Juno Temple) and get revenge, after being found guilty of the crime by all the public opinion.
notes: Adaptation of Joe Hill's novel of the same name.

title: Homefront
actors: Jason Statham, James Franco, Winona Ryder, Kate Bosworth, Izabela Vidovic, Frank Grillo, Rachelle Lefevre, Clancy Brown, Nicole Andrews, Christa Campbell, Omar Benson Miller
description: Phil Broker (Jason Statham), a former drug department agent, retires to live with his family in a quiet place, seemingly away from the world of drugs and violence he was used to. However, he soon finds himself dealing with a local drug lord who, threatening the life of his family, will force him back into action to save his loved ones and clean up the entire town.

title: Cold Harvest
actors: Gary Daniels, Bryan Genesse, Barbara Crampton, David Sherwood, Isaac Mavimbella, Chris Buchanan, Greg Melvill-Smith, David Dukas, Cecil Carter, Rohan Coll
description: Following a meteorite that devastated the planet, the scientist Chaney embarks on a journey with his wife and other men to a land in which to re-establish civilization. However, they end up victim of the local gangs, led by the evil Ray (Brian Genesse). Meanwhile, the bounty hunter Roland (Gary Daniels) brother of the scientist, sets out in search of his relative and his wife ...

title: Cobra Woman
actors: Maria Montez, Jon Hall, Sabu, Lon Chaney jr., Edgar Barrier, Mary Nash, Lois Collier, Samuel S. Hinds, Moroni Olsen
description: Tollea (Maria Montez) is unaware of her origins nor is she able to explain the two signs, similar to the bite of a snake, which she has imprinted on her wrist. Just on the eve of her wedding with Ramu (Jon Hall) she is kidnapped by a mysterious individual (Lon Chaney, Jr.) from the island of Harbor, where she lives with her father MacDonald (Moroni Olsen). He reveals that the young woman belongs to the Cobra people, where he managed years earlier, without knowing how, to miraculously escape the death sentence inflicted on the intruders, finding himself alone on a boat in the company of a very small girl, who later raised as a daughter. Ramu decides to reach the island, secretly followed by his young friend Kado (Sabu). Meanwhile Tollea has learned the truth about her origins from her grandmother (Mary Nash), the queen of the island, now tyrannized by the high priestess Naja, twin sister of Tollea, who holds her people in her hands by scaring them with the cult of the cobra and the help from the evil legislator Martok (Edgar Barrier). The sovereign's plan is to remove her from office, to entrust her to Tollea.
notes: A film with splendid colors, which sees Maria Montez engaged in a double role.

title: Sherlock Holmes
actors: Ben Syder, Gareth David-Lloyd, Dominic Keating, William Huw, Elizabeth Arends, David Shackleton, Rachael Evelyn, Neil Williams, Dylan Jones, Chris Coxon
description: Sherlock Holmes and trusted Doctor Watson face their most bizarre case when London is held in check by an army of dragons, dinosaurs and giant octopuses.
notes: Asylum is a production house specializing in low-budget home video clones of Hollywood mega-productions: this, quite evidently, is their answer to Guy Ritchie's _Sherlock Holmes_ with Robert Downey Jr. which, just as evidently, has nothing. to do with it. However the film has its charm, a certain B movie dignity, offers decent action scenes and a plot - Sherlock Holmes vs. the dinosaurs! - so knowingly ridiculous that it can't help but tear a smile.

title: Non-Stop
actors: Liam Neeson, Julianne Moore, Michelle Dockery, Lupita Nyong'o, Nate Parker, Scoot McNairy, Corey Stoll, Omar Metwally, Linus Roache, Jason Butler Harner, Anson Mount, Shea Whigham, Bar Paly, Frank Deal, Corey Hawkins
description: Bill Marks (Liam Neeson) is a flight safety cop who sees his job as routine and low-risk. However, he is forced to change his mind when, while aboard an international flight from New York to London, he is forced to take action to save the lives of 200 passengers. An anonymous text message informs him that a passenger will die every twenty minutes if the government does not transfer the sum of $ 150 million to a secret account.
notes: Produced by Joel Silver and directed by Spaniard Jaume Collet-Serra, who in tandem with Liam Neeson (quite convincing at this stage of his career) had already worked on "Unknown Without Identity" and has just finished filming "Run All Night, Non- Stop". This umpteenth variation on the aero-catastrophic subgenre, here all played on the action thriller, travels on tracks interspersed with frequent déjà vu, which resist despite the spasmodic offer of red herrings and clues to deceive spectators into playing detectives.

title: Yankee Buccaneer
actors: Jeff Chandler, Scott Brady, Suzan Ball, Joseph Calleia, George Mathews, Rodolfo Acosta, David Janssen, Joseph Vitale
description: In the mid-19th century, the US Navy ship under the command of Captain David Porter has just landed after a year of sailing when Lieutenant David Farragut, a former student of Porter, informs the captain of a new mission. To unmask criminals attacking the ships of the American merchant fleet, Porter and his men will have to pose as pirates. The task will lead to the discovery of an international conspiracy.

title: Big Ass Spider
actors: Greg Grunberg, Lombardo Boyar, Clare Kramer, Ray Wise, Lin Shaye, Patrick Bauchau, Lloyd Kaufman, Alexis Peters, James C. Mathis III, Sarah Oliver
description: A giant alien spider manages to escape from a military laboratory and pours all its destructive fury on the city of Los Angeles, not stopping in front of any obstacle. It will be up to an intelligent exterminator and his assistant to attempt to kill the creature before the entire city is brought to the ground.

title: The Green Inferno
actors: Lorenza Izzo, Ariel Levy, Sky Ferreira, Daryl Sabara, Kirby Bliss Blanton, Nicolás Martínez, Aaron Burns, Magda Apanowicz, Ignacia Allamand, Richard Burgi, Matías López, Adam Leong, Antonieta Pari
description: A group of student activists set out from New York to reach the Amazon and lead the battle there to protect a tribe of Indians that is in danger of extinction. In the jungle, however, the group will find itself hostage to the same natives that it has taken to safety.
notes: A work that does not take off and disappears precisely in terms of disturbance. Roth's (and many other quotationists, devoid of Tarantino's talent) continues to be a cinema of enthusiasm, cross-references and good intentions, never devoid of amusing ideas, almost always lacking in rhythm, tension and, specifically, primordial mechanisms. of fear.

title: The Last Keepers
actors: Zosia Mamet, Sam Underwood, Virginia Madsen, Olympia Dukakis, Aidan Quinn, Nat Wolff, Joshua Bowman, Jee Young Han, Max Schneider, Alexandra Metz
description: Rosmarie (Olympia Dukakis) and Abigail (Virginia Madsen) are the last survivors of a dynasty of artists with mystical powers. When she falls in love with Oliver Sands (Sam Underwood), an unusual schoolmate, Rhea (Zosia Mamet), Abigail's teenage daughter, also begins to develop magical powers that lead her to discover the truth about the women in her family and a ancient prophecy expected for generations. Torn between the desire to live a normal life and the destiny of the savior of a world on the brink of disaster, Rhea must decide what to do with her existence.

title: Swamp Shark
actors: Kristy Swanson, D.B. Sweeney, Robert Davi, Jeff Chase, Jason Rogel, Richard Tanne, Sophie Sinise, Wade Boggs, Natacha Itzel, Dylan Ramsey
description: #A giant shark of unknown breed is released into the swamps. A group of teenagers pay the price.

title: Jug Face
actors: Lauren Ashley Carter, Sean Bridgers, Sean Young, Larry Fessenden, Daniel Manche, Kaitlin Cullum, David Greathouse, Katie Groshong, Scott Hodges, Alex Maizus, Jennifer Spriggs
description: In an isolated community in the woods, far from the rules and customs of contemporary society, the acquaintance Ada becomes pregnant with her brother Jessaby when she discovers, through a face-shaped jug, that she is the victim to be sacrificed to a mortal creature who lives in a pit. Determined to save her baby, Ada hides the pitcher in the woods, endangering the lives of the rest of the villagers.

title: Mercy
actors: Chandler Riggs, Joel Courtney, Shirley Knight, Frances O'Connor, Mark Duplass, Dylan McDermott, Amanda Walsh, Chris Browning, Joe Egender, Harley Graham
description: George and Buddy, two very young brothers, move with their mother to a dilapidated farm, over 150 years old, to take care of their dying grandmother Mercy. When they suspect that their grandmother may be prey to an evil spirit, George and Buddy begin to witness some disturbing phenomena that they believe to be the work of an old witch, finding themselves having to fight for their own survival and that of the family.
notes: Adaptation of a short story by Stephen King.

title: Ride Along
actors: Kevin Hart, Ice Cube, Tika Sumpter, Laurence Fishburne, John Leguizamo, Bryan Callen, Jay Pharoah, Bruce McGill, Lucius Baston, Gary Owen, Julisita Salcedo
description: Ben, a high school security guard, has spent the last two years of his life trying to prove to the highly decorated detective James, brother of girlfriend Angela, that he isn't a video game lover. Finally accepted at the Atlanta Police Academy, Ben thinks he has earned his respect and is allowed to marry Angela. James, however, decides to put him to the test by being accompanied on a crazy night of patrol through the streets of the city.
notes: Success at home, with sequels already in the pipeline, the colorless film Tim Story sits placidly on the decades-long furrows of the action buddy movie: the granite Ice Cube and the minute Kevin Hart review all the clichés of the genre, without updates of sorts and with names such as John Leguizamo and Laurence Fishburne in outline details. Eight hands in the script simply provide a plot for the one-chord actor / rapper and the talkative Hart, stand up comedian famous in the States and "wannabe" Eddie Murphy.

title: Clash of the Empires
actors: Bai Ling, Sun Korng, Srogn, Khom Lyly, Christopher Judge, Jerry Earr, Armani Nguon, Antonis Greco, Tom Eurt, Kreb
description: In a distant time, the last village of intelligent and peaceful hobbits is attacked and enslaved by the Java men, cannibals who ride on dragons. The young hobbit Goben, together with his father and sister, is then forced to seek the help of the "giant" human hunters to find the lair of the Java and save the last surviving hobbits, including his mother. The alliance between humans and hobbits will forever transform both species.

title: Mr. Jones
actors: Jon Foster, Rachel O'Meara, Mark Steger, Jessica Dowdeswell
description: Scott (Jon Foster) is a director who, in search of inspiration, moves with his girlfriend Penny to a desolate house in the middle of the forest. Here, he discovers that his neighbor is the elusive Mr. Jones. Famous for the haunting sculptures he makes, Jones has always been a mystery to the world and in him Scott and Penny glimpse the perfect subject for a film, not realizing that their curiosity can have chilling consequences.

title: The Human Race
actors: Paul McCarthy-Boyington, Brianna Lauren Jackson, Eddie McGee, Trista Robinson, T. Arthur Cottam, Fred Coury, B. Anthony Cohen, Noelle Locke, J. Louis Reid, Celine Tien
description: Veronica suddenly finds herself together with a group of about 80 people in the streets of a big city. Everyone must take part in a terrifying and surreal marathon, the rules of which must be followed under penalty of death of the offending participants without exception. When the race begins, it quickly becomes clear that only one of them will be able to cross the finish line still alive.

title: Found
actors: Gavin Brown, Ethan Philbeck, Phyllis Munro, Louie Lawless, Alex Kogin, Andy Alphonse, Shane Beasley, Angela Denton, Kitsie Duncan, Kate Braun
description: 12-year-old Marty, who loves watching horror movies and plans to make a graphic novel with his best friend, is the classic good guy who gets good grades at school, listens to teachers, and doesn't cause problems. However, his existence takes a dark turn when he begins to find severed heads in his older brother Steve's closet. Terrified by what could be his brother's reaction to discover that his secret is no longer a secret, Marty will find himself putting his brotherly love to the test in a spiral of events that will cause many victims and destroy the existence of the few who they will survive.

title: Alyce
actors: Jade Dornfeld, Tamara Feldman, James Duval, Eddie Rouse, Larry Cedar, Yorgo Constantine, Megan Gallagher, Rena Owen, Tracey Walter, Bret Roberts
description: Haunted by guilt for accidentally causing her best friend to fall off a roof, Alyce (Jade Dornfeld) embarks on a self-destructive journey of dangerous sex, hard drugs and senseless violence. As Alyce increasingly loses her perception of reality, the danger to those around her grows.

title: Ink
actors: Christopher Soren Kelly, Quinn Hunchar, Jessica Duffy, Jennifer Batter, Jeremy Make, Eme Ikwuakor, Shelby Malone, Shannan Steele, Steve Sealy, Steven Brown
description: A dream wanderer named Ink steals the soul of a little girl in order to be admitted to the evil entities responsible for nightmares, the Incubus. But the Storytellers, their good counterpart, instead work to save her and, to do this, they go in search of her father, a businessman one step away from professional fulfillment.

title: Absolute Deception
actors: Cuba Gooding jr., Emmanuelle Vaugier, Evert McQueen, Ty Hungerford, Jeff Gannon, Brad McMurray, Troy MacKinder, Sean Edward Frazer, Gulliver Page, Raymond Massey
description: When Miles, key informant for FBI agent John Nelson (Cuba Gooding Jr.), is kidnapped and murdered, all that's left of him is a severed finger. In search of useful information, Nelson goes to New York to see Miles' widow, the journalist Rebecca Scott (Emmanuelle Vaugier), who despite her doubts agrees to help him find out what her husband was hiding. The two soon find themselves grappling with unknown attackers and a billionaire seeking revenge and his stolen money.

title: Open Grave
actors: Sharlto Copley, Thomas Kretschmann, Josie Ho, Joseph Morgan, Erin Richards, Max Wrottesley, M. Frakes
description: Jonah wakes up in a pit full of corpses without remembering who he is or how he got there. Without any memory, he finds a cabin with five strangers who, like him, do not know who they are or what happened around them. Trying to find a way out of the danger that surrounds them, the six realize that they are not alone and, in a panic, they begin to turn against each other. Through flashbacks, Jonah slowly realizes who he once was, what terrible identity hides behind his teammates and what terrible reality he has to face.
notes: Like the protagonist upon awakening from a bradycardic sleep, even the script (frozen for more than five years before ending up in the hands of the Madrid-born López-Gallego) stretches and limps in pain for the duration of the film, using solid crutches. the clichés of the horror / thriller of the third millennium. The excess of naivety weighs down a very thin structure, which focuses entirely on the final revelation. A few minutes of explanation and only one, apocalyptic and worthy shot, to repay for too long a wait.

title: Clown
actors: Peter Stormare, Laura Allen, Elizabeth Whitmere, Andy Powers, Allen Altman, Christian Distefano, John MacDonald, Robert Reynolds, Matthew Stefiuk, Sarah Scheffer
description: Jack turns ten. Her birthday party has to be special and everything is ready for it to begin, except the clown hasn't arrived yet. With Jack getting impatient, his father decides to put on the clown costume himself and save the rest of the day. However, the problems begin when the man tries to take off his costume. Locked inside the suit and his mask, he soon realizes that he is dealing with an angry clown and homicidal maniac who has taken control of his body.

title: Jane Got a Gun
actors: Natalie Portman, Joel Edgerton, Ewan McGregor, Noah Emmerich, Rodrigo Santoro, Boyd Holbrook, Todd Stashwick, Cunny Charlie, Sam Quinn
description: Jane Hammond (Natalie Portman), a woman of character married to one of the city's worst criminals, realizes she has to take matters into her own hands when her husband returns home nearly dying and with 8 bullets in his back. To save her farm and defend herself from her husband's enemies who want to finish the job, Jane decides to ask for help from Dan Frost, a past flame she hasn't seen for over ten years and who is now a thief. Together, Jane and Dan will devise a clever strategy that will knock their rivals out of the way as their dormant feelings return to the surface.

title: Hatchet III
actors: Danielle Harris, Kane Hodder, Zach Galligan, Caroline Williams, Derek Mears, Cody Blue Snider, Rileah Vanderbilt, Robert Diago DoQui, Sean Whalen, Jason Trost
description: A search and recovery team is engaged in the swamp scene of the carnage carried out by the disturbing Victor Crowley (Kane Hodder). This is where Marybeth (Danielle Harris) uncovers the real secret to ending the voodoo curse that has set Crowley free to terrorize Honey Island Swamp for decades.

title: Willow Creek
actors: Bryce Johnson, Alexie Gilmore
description: Jim and his girlfriend Kelly are in Willow Creek, California, to follow in the footsteps of Patterson and Gimlin, the two researchers who managed to film bigfoot in 1967. Despite Kelly's skepticism, Jim hopes to be able to film the mythical creature with his camera and, in the meantime, meets the locals, each with their own sighting story to tell. Regardless of the warnings received, Jim decides to venture deep into the forest together with the reluctant Kelly, meeting events that will make them regret not staying at the motel.

title: The Call of Cthulhu
actors: Matt Foyer, John Bolen, Ralph Lucas, Chad Fifer, Susan Zucker, Kalafatic Poole, John Klemantaski, Jason Owens, D. Grigsby Poland, David Mersault
description: 1926. The great-grandson of Professor George Gammel Angell is hospitalized in an institution for the mentally ill. The man is showing to an unidentified man the documents resulting from his lifelong research work, which began with the discovery of some writings of his late great-uncle, who was also almost driven to madness following some of his investigations on a ship that has disappeared mysteriously and about a man's strange dreams.
notes: Based on the famous tale of the same name by H.P. Lovecraft

title: Insidious: Chapter 2
actors: Rose Byrne, Patrick Wilson, Barbara Hershey, Lin Shaye, Angus Sampson, Leigh Whannell, Ty Simpkins, Steve Coulter, Danielle Bisutti, Tom Fitzpatrick, Garrett Ryan, Michael Beach, Jocelin Donahue
description: The haunted Lambert family tries to uncover the mysterious childhood secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world.
notes: James Wan plays with his filmography and with the viewer's gaze as if they were his child prodigy toys. And he does it quite well. More than a sequel in the classic sense, "Beyond the Borders of Evil - Insidious 2" ("Chapter 2" of the original title is more effective) stands towards the first "Insidious" as a board game expansion. Looting "The Shining" (with almost literal quotes) and "Psyco" with aplomb, this sequel is a breakneck ride in a terrifying (albeit less than the previous film) and hilarious (much more) funfair.

title: Divergent
actors: Shailene Woodley, Kate Winslet, Theo James, Ashley Judd, Tony Goldwyn, Ray Stevenson, Jai Courtney, Mekhi Phifer, Maggie Q, Miles Teller, Zoë Kravitz, Ansel Elgort, Ben Lloyd-Hughes, Ben Lamb, Christian Madsen, Amy Newbold
description: In a dystopian future, based on the characteristics of their personalities, individuals are grouped into various factions. Sixteen-year-old Tris Prior (Shailene Woodley), on the other hand, does not belong to any group and is among those who are defined as "divergent". Uncovering a conspiracy to eliminate all the disagreements, Tris will have to figure out what makes them so dangerous before it's too late.
notes: "Divergent", based on the novel by Veronica Roth, addresses the need to rethink the social order in even didactic forms. Divided into classes, society rediscovers the specter of functionalism as an ineluctable determinism as a possible totalitarian horizon. And it is in this context that the affirmation of one's individuality as an element of discontinuity with respect to the strategies of power assumes a didactic value. Discontinuity that calls into question the taboo of the conflict which returns to being a libertarian practice (it is no coincidence that the next chapter is entitled "Insurgent"). Critics may turn up their noses, but these are the stories that are all the rage today. And there must be a (political?) Reason.

title: The Plan
actors: Edward James Olmos, Dean Stockwell, Michael Trucco, Grace Park, Michael Hogan, Aaron Douglas, Callum Keith Rennie, Kate Vernon, Rick Worthy, Lymari Nadal
description: When the Cylon attack on the 12 colonies does not totally exterminate humanity as intended, the Number 1 twins - between members of Galactica and Caprica - are forced to improvise a new plan to carry out the mission and eliminate the survivors. humans.

title: Summer's Blood
actors: Ashley Greene, Peter Mooney, Barbara Niven, Stephen McHattie, Peter Michael Dillon, Cinthia Burke, Paul Whitney, Sean Tucker
description: Summer Matthews, a rebellious teenager, discovers that her mother lied to her about her father and that he is still alive: she decides to track him down. Arriving in the small village of Massey with a photo of her parent, Summer is guilty of the theft in a shop but manages to escape the sheriff with the help of Tom Hoxey, a young man who soon discovers he is not as nice as he seems.

title: Beneath
actors: Daniel Zovatto, Bonnie Dennison, Chris Conroy, Jonny Orsini, Griffin Newman, Mackenzie Rosman, Mark Margolis, Emily D. Haley
description: Six high school friends decide to celebrate their graduation with an excursion to the area of ??an isolated lake. Things take a turn for the worse when they find themselves confronted with a deadly underwater predator who tests their friendship in an extreme struggle for survival. With the boat out of order, the six friends will try to find a way to return to shore and decide which of them should be sacrificed.

title: Haunt
actors: Jacki Weaver, Liana Liberato, Danielle Chuchran, Jan Broberg, Harrison Gilbertson, Kasia Kowalczyk, Aline Andrade, Brenden Whitney, Jarrod Phillips, Vaughn Odenbrett
description: An introverted teenager forms an unlikely match with his new neighbor. Together they begin to explore the haunted house that the boy's family unknowingly just bought.

title: The Homesman
actors: Tommy Lee Jones, Hilary Swank, Grace Gummer, Miranda Otto, Sonja Richter, John Lithgow, Tim Blake Nelson, Barry Corbin, Meryl Streep, Hailee Steinfeld
description: In the middle of the Western era, school teacher Mary Bee Cuddy (Hilary Swank) is a true pioneer and acts like the best of men. George Briggs (Tommy Lee Jones), on the other hand, is an army defector considered an outlaw. Together, the two will find themselves having to escort three crazy women out of control from Nebraska to Iowa, challenging the obstacles that the path will entail.
notes: Adaptation of Glendon Swarthout's novel of the same name.

title: Lone Survivor
actors: Mark Wahlberg, Taylor Kitsch, Emile Hirsch, Ben Foster, Eric Bana, Sammy Sheik, Yousuf Azami, Ali Suliman, Alexander Ludwig, Scott Elrod, Corey Large
description: On June 28, 2005, four SEAL members are involved in Operation Red Wing. Their mission is to kill the Taliban leader Ahmad Shah. Quickly discovered and under attack by the enemy, the four face a tragic fate that will allow only Marcus Luttrell (Mark Wahlberg) to survive and escape capture.
notes: Based on a true story.

title: Jupiter Ascending
actors: Channing Tatum, Mila Kunis, Sean Bean, Eddie Redmayne, Douglas Booth, Tuppence Middleton, Nikki Amuka-Bird, Christina Cole, Doona Bae, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Edward Hogg, Tim Pigott-Smith, James D'Arcy, Terry Gilliam, Hazel D'Jan
description: In a world where humans represent the lowest rung of the evolutionary ladder, Jupiter Jones (Mila Kunis) was born under a lucky star and has an extraordinary destiny ahead of her. Now grown up, she still continues to have big dreams despite reality forcing her to a toilet cleaning job. When she then meets Caine (Channing Tatum), a genetically altered ex-military hunter, Jupiter realizes he is at the center of something bigger than her. In the crosshairs of the Queen of the Universe who fears the end of her reign, Jupiter has on his shoulders an extraordinary legacy that could alter the balance of the entire cosmos.
notes: Anti-liberal parable, visionary, glowing space opera as if Philip J. Farmer and Edgar R. Burroughs had conceived the script in tandem. And then Channing Tatum, in laser rollerblade, pushed towards the inorganic (with a tribute to John Phillip Law of Barbarella), a werewolf with ears to Spock who yearns for the body of his mistress. Jupiter is the most filmic beyond cinema ever imagined. A whole new eroticism. Popular and democratic.

title: The Black Castle
actors: Richard Greene, Boris Karloff, Stephen McNally, Rita Corday, Lon Chaney jr., John Hoyt, Michael Pate, Nancy Valentine, Tudor Owen, Henry Corden
description: In the 18th century, Beckett was invited by Count Von Bruno to his castle in Austria. By accepting the invitation, Beckett hopes to demonstrate how the Earl is responsible for the deaths of two of his friends. On his arrival, however, he finds himself dealing with a sadistic landlord and his guests who plan to eliminate him in a horrible way at the first opportunity. When he then meets Elga, the Earl's reluctant bride, Beckett vows to free her from that cursed residence.

title: Favela
actors: Michael Jai White, Neal McDonough, Lateef Crowder, Laila Ali, Hazuki Kato, Johnny Yang, Jazmín Caratini, Colon Robert, Michael J. Morris, Eddie Valdes
description: John Falcon Chapman is a former Marine who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder due to the guilt accumulated over his years of service. An anti-hero and self-destructive, Falcon is forced to fly to Sao Paulo when his sister is brutally assaulted on a mission to Brazil. In an attempt to track down the perpetrators of the assault, he will enter the squalid underbelly of the city and discover a world of drugs, prostitution, corrupt cops and well-organized criminals.

title: Dead Drop
actors: Luke Goss, Nestor Carbonell, Cole Hauser, David Del Rio, Jill Remez, David Fernandez Jr., Daniel Faraldo, Jack Carlisle, Carolina Castro, Denitza García
description: After surviving falling from a plane three thousand feet above the ocean, a former CIA agent-turned-government contractor manages to re-infiltrate a dangerous cartel of drug traffickers in northern Mexico. Intent on finding whoever tried to take him out, he will find himself dealing with a violent murderous rampage and an unexpected truth.

title: Bone Tomahawk
actors: Patrick Wilson, Kurt Russell, Lili Simmons, Sean Young, Richard Jenkins, Matthew Fox, David Arquette, Sid Haig
description: In the mid-nineteenth century, on the border between Texas and New Mexico, an outlaw unbeknownst to him leads a gang of troglodyte cannibals to the peaceful town of Bright Hope, where monsters kidnap many of the settlers. Despite his injured leg, a faith-filled farmer whose wife has been kidnapped joins a small rescue team made up of the sheriff, his senior deputy and a willing gunslinger. Together with them will begin a journey towards the unknown territories of darkness, where ferocious beasts equipped with an unbeatable weapon leave no hope.

title: Lost River
actors: Christina Hendricks, Saoirse Ronan, Iain De Caestecker, Matt Smith, Reda Kateb, Barbara Steele, Eva Mendes, Ben Mendelsohn, Rob Zabrecky
description: Against the dreamlike and surreal backdrop of a city on the verge of disappearing, Billy (Christina Hendricks), single mother of two, falls victim to a universe of macabre and dark fantasy while Bones, the 18-year-old son, discovers a secret road that leads to an underwater village. Both Billy and Bones will have to dive into the depths of mystery if they are to ensure their family's survival.

title: Lake Placid 3
actors: Colin Ferguson, Yancy Butler, Kirsty Mitchell, Kacey Barnfield, Jordan Grehs, Michael Ironside, Mark Evans, Nils Hognestad, Bianca Ilich, Angelica Penn
description: A gamekeeper moves with his family to Lincoln County, an area of ??Maine infamous for being the scene of some deadly attacks by crocodiles that infested the waters of the local lake. Although it is believed that the alligators have disappeared, the gamekeeper's son finds a couple just born and begins to feed them, allowing them to quickly become voracious beasts.

title: Lake Placid 2
actors: John Schneider, Sarah Lafleur, Sam McMurray, Chad Michael Collins, Alicia Ziegler, Joe Holt, Ian Reed Kesler, Justin Urich, Cloris Leachman, VJ Kewl
description: The history of the Lincoln County lake crocodiles has almost become legend. Riley, the new sheriff of the town, however, finds himself dealing with new attacks by the large reptiles when a researcher is attacked while on the boat. Helping him with his investigation comes from the Fisheries Department Emma, ​​a woman with whom Riley had a somewhat tumultuous relationship in the past.

title: Speak No Evil
actors: Gabrielle Stone, Carl Jensen IV, Olivia Cavender, Elisabeth Cavender, Greg Bronson, Annalise Cavender, Ian Cavender, Kameron Cochrane, Sylvie Cohen, Michael Cortez, Quincy Cowans, Madelynn Eldredge
description: Anna, a single mother, is forced to fight with all her might to protect her daughter from a group of children possessed by the devil and from a city that seems to have gone mad.

title: Labou
actors: Bryan James Kitto, Darnell Hamilton, Marissa Cuevas, Rose Magri, Eric Pollard, Bud Richardson, Copely Davis, Elizabeth Coulon, Barnie Duncan, Dylan Kippes
description: Fed up of being bullied at school, Toddster, Emily and Gavin try to prove their courage by searching for the legendary treasure of the pirate Lerogue, whose ship sank in the Louisiana bay after a hurricane. Struggling with the ghost of the pirate and with a small and curious creature, the three friends will end up joining forces against the oil tycoons, who for profit aim to destroy the swamps in the area.

title: The Maze Runner
actors: Dylan O'Brien, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Kaya Scodelario, Will Poulter, Ki Hong Lee, Chris Sheffield, Aml Ameen, Blake Cooper, Jacob Latimore, Alexander Flores, Dexter Darden
description: A boy named Thomas wakes up, with no memory of his past, in a strange place called Glade. Populated by other boys, the Glade is a closed structure surrounded by high stone walls, useful to protect the residents from the Grievers, the monsters that live in the labyrinth below. Every day, some of the boys are chosen to venture into the maze and try to map a pattern in an attempt to find a way out, without getting great results. The arrival of a girl in a coma will bring great implications.
notes: Compared to the numerous followers of Hunger Games, Maze Runner dries everything, or almost everything, on the essentiality of the action, running fast on the path of pure entertainment, slipping from time to time into some genuinely frightening horror vein, ignoring (for now) every sentimental drift. Unfortunately we are not on TV, postponing the answers and living off the cliffhanger is not a rhythm that is sustained for long, and in fact the film wraps itself in the (multiple) final. That leaves everything pending until the next episode: the public is warned.

title: The Monkey's Paw
actors: C.J. Thomason, Stephen Lang, Corbin Bleu, John Lewis, Charles S. Dutton, Michelle Pierce, Daniel Hugh Kelly, Sabrina Gennarino, Tauvia Dawn
description: Jake Tilton buys a monkey paw, a mystical talisman that grants him the ability to have three wishes fulfilled. After expressing the first two wishes, Jake finds himself, however, with his life turned upside down and again in close contact with collaborator Tony Cobb, resurrected from the world of the dead. When the pressures of a psychotic Tony to use the third wish to help him reunite with his son become more and more dangerous, Jake will be forced to outsmart him to save the lives of his loved ones.

title: Pawn Shop Chronicles
actors: Paul Walker, Elijah Wood, Brendan Fraser, Matt Dillon, Norman Reedus, Vincent D'Onofrio, Thomas Jane, DJ Qualls, Lukas Haas, Rachelle Lefevre
description: The disappearance of a wedding ring leads to the intersection of the stories of different characters, all connected in different ways to a pawnshop in a small town in the south of the States. Among them are a man looking for his kidnapped wife, two methadone-addicted braggartists who believe in the supremacy of the white race, and a sad Elvis impersonator.

title: Need for Speed
actors: Aaron Paul, Dominic Cooper, Imogen Poots, Ramon Rodriguez, Rami Malek, Scott Mescudi, Dakota Johnson, Harrison Gilbertson, Michael Keaton, Nick Chinlund, Han Soto
description: Framed for a crime he didn't commit, car mechanic and driver Tobey (Aaron Paul) comes out of jail determined to settle scores with his former partner, the man responsible for his arrest. He then decides to participate in a car race from New York to San Francisco, starting a gritty journey on the road that soon turns from a mission of revenge into a path of redemption.
notes: If you use a car for a Coast to Coast at high speed, then how is it that your friends in trucks are in front of you? What is the point of a competition where the cars of the other competitors are won if they are destroyed during the race? The plot is elementary yet full of absurdity and Aaron Paul's acting exceeds in grimaces. On the other hand, racing knows the truth: director Scott Waugh has a long career as a stuntman behind him and is inspired by the realism of "Bullit", moreover he is not overloaded with music and indeed lets the roar of the engines and the screech often speak. tires on the asphalt. It may seem little but it is now a very rare commodity, a real pleasure for connoisseurs.

title: Transcendence
actors: Johnny Depp, Paul Bettany, Rebecca Hall, Kate Mara, Morgan Freeman, Cillian Murphy, Cole Hauser, Clifton Collins jr., Lukas Haas, Luce Rains, Cory Hardrict
description: Dr. Will Caster (Johnny Depp) is the foremost researcher in the field of artificial intelligence and works to create a sentient machine, capable of combining the same artificial intelligence with the full range of human emotions. His highly controversial experiments have made him famous all over the world but have also made him the main target of anti-tech extremists, who would do anything to stop him. However, in an attempt to destroy Will, his bitterest enemies unwittingly end up making him the protagonist of his own "transcendence". Evelyn (Rebecca Hall) and Max Waters (Paul Bettany) - Will's wife and best friend respectively and both researchers - ask themselves a thousand questions about what to do when, implanting the synapses in an artificial machine, Will transforms his thirst for knowledge into an obsessive one. pursuit of power.
notes: Pfister really does everything to create a science fiction product that does not resort to the usual set pieces and is not forced to rely only on special effects. Yet nothing works. Film with a leaden gait, philosophically banal, Manichean in the representation of the neo-Luddites, stuck in the supporting sentimental triangulation and ideologically unresolved, not even helped by a Depp at an all-time low, absent as if he were really the hologram of a synaptic filament lost in the network . The only one who is committed beyond the minimum wage threshold is Paul Bettany, but it does not affect the fate of Transcendence.

title: Samurai Cop
actors: Robert Z'Dar, Matt Hannon, Jannis Farley, Mark Frazer, Melissa Moore, Krista Lane, Gerald Okamura, Joselito Rescober, Dale Cummings, Ali Teymury
description: A clique of Japanese mobsters known as the Katana gang takes over the streets of Los Angeles. With the police unable to put an end to their dominance, it will be up to dissident agent Joe Marshal to use his sword and martial arts knowledge to restore order to the city.

title: Ambushed
actors: Dolph Lundgren, Vinnie Jones, Randy Couture, Gianni Capaldi, Carly Pope, Susie Abromeit, Daniel Bonjour, Holly Lynch, Cinthya Bornacelli, Michael Rivera, William McNamara
description: In the frenzied underbelly of Los Angeles, agent Maxwell thwarts an international cocaine trade run by criminal genius Vincent Camastra. When Agent Beverly Royce goes undercover among the drug dealers and becomes more involved than expected, Maxwell's case turns into something personal. Thus begins a tough war against ruthless killers and corrupt cops.

title: Curse of Chucky
actors: Fiona Dourif, Danielle Bisutti, A Martinez, Brennan Elliott, Summer H. Howell, Chantal Quesnelle, Maitland McConnell, Ali Tataryn, Kally Berard, Kyle Nobess
description: Following her mother's suicide, Nica, who has been in a wheelchair since she was born, is forced to reunite for the funeral with her sister Barb, brother-in-law Ian, niece Alice and her nanny. But when the people she hates begin to die mysteriously, the fearless Nica is horrified to discover that the culprit could be Chucky, the strange red-haired doll received a few days earlier in the mail. What he doesn't know is that Chucky has to settle an account he had left open twenty years ago.

title: The Banshee Chapter
actors: Ted Levine, Katia Winter, Michael McMillian, Monique Candelaria, Chad Brummett, Jenny Gabrielle, David Midthunder, J.D. Garfield, Cyd Schulte, Vivian Nesbitt
description: In 1963 the United States government began experimenting on unsuspecting citizens with certain chemicals intended to induce mind control. The program was called Mk-Ultra and the results were horrific. Decades later, when she has no news of her best friend James Hirsch, web journalist Anne Roland decides to see it clearly and discovers that he had made a video before he disappeared in which he was seen taking a mind-altering drug. The search leads Anne to the anarchist poet and novelist Thomas Blackburn, who uses powerful hallucinogens provided by a friend, and to the discovery that these are extracted from the pineal glands of dead humans in the mysterious Chamber 5 of a research center in the desert of Black Rock. Here, Anne will be forced to confront an alternate universe of altered sanity, brain receptors, sinister positions and Lovecraftian illusions.
notes: Based on actual documents attesting to the existence of secret CIA experiments.

title: Sharknado
actors: Tara Reid, Cassie Scerbo, John Heard, Ian Ziering, Aubrey Peeples, Jaason Simmons, David Bittick, Connor Weil, Chris Jordan Wolfe, Sumiko Braun, Marcus Choi
description: A violent hurricane hits the city of Los Angeles, terrorizing the population with thousands of sharks that have escaped from the ocean. When high-speed winds form a tornado that blows into the desert, the deadliest of marine predators will find themselves dictating the law for water, land and air.

title: 12 Rounds: Reloaded
actors: Randy Orton, Brian Markinson, Cindy Busby, Tom Stevens, Venus Terzo, Sean Rogerson, Colin Lawrence, Chelsey Reist, Sebastian Spence, Janene Carleton, Sean Owen Roberts, Charlie Kerr
description: Nick Malloy is an emergency room nurse who finds his life shattered when on an evening shift he is targeted by Heller, a man linked to his past as a paramedic and seeking revenge. With little time on his hands and his wife Sarah's life in danger, Nick must figure out why he finds himself in the middle of a twelve-round deadly game and try to stop Heller's destructive rampage before it's too late.

title: Midnight Sun
actors: Dakota Goyo, Goran Visnjic, Bridget Moynahan, Kendra Timmins, Duane Murray, Jacqueline Loewen
description: In the ice of northern Canada, little Luke discovers that a young polar bear cub has been separated from its mother. With the aim of finding a way to reunite the two, Luke finds the help of Muktuk, half Inuit and half Canadian, who knows the territory where polar bears live. To complete the mission, Luke must learn to protect himself and the cub from the dangers that the wilderness offers.

title: Rise of the Zombies
actors: Mariel Hemingway, Ethan Suplee, LeVar Burton, Danny Trejo, Heather Hemmens, French Stewart, Chad Lindberg, Madonna Magee, Andy Clemence, Peter Ngo
description: During a virus-generated zombie apocalypse, a group of San Francisco survivors hide in Alcatraz Island prison in hopes of escaping the growing hordes of the non-living. When the island is also attacked, the group decides to set off again in search of a luminary who seems to have found an antidote.

title: Bad Ass 2: Bad Asses
actors: Danny Trejo, Danny Glover, Andrew Divoff, Ignacio Serricchio, Jacqueline Obradors, Jonathan Lipnicki, Charlie Carver, Dante Basco, Leon Thomas III, Patrick Fabian, Jeremy Ray Valdez
description: Vietnam veteran Frank Vega is back in action to clear the streets of Los Angeles of crime. Pursuing his dream, he opened a community center for young boxers to educate. But when Manny, his best pupil, gets into trouble and ends up dead, Frank and his friend Bernie find themselves trapped in a situation that puts their own lives in danger. On the run with the only weapons at their disposal (intelligence and fists), they will have to survive the fury that has befallen them.
notes: Sequel to Bad Ass (2012).

title: Bullet
actors: Danny Trejo, Torsten Voges, Jonathan Banks, Kyle Villalovos, Eve Mauro, Seri DeYoung, Eric St. John, Tinsel Korey, Eric Etebari, John Savage
description: Frank "Bullet" Marasco (Danny Trejo) is a veteran cop who, despite being close to retirement, is still the baddest undercover agent in Los Angeles. Whether he fights against criminals or ends up in the middle of a fight, Bullet is always the first to use his fists or the gun. But when he ends up clashing with the drug-trafficking brothers Kane, first the governor's daughter and then his nephew are kidnapped. Bullet is thus forced to try to get justice with his hands.

title: Dead in Tombstone
actors: Mickey Rourke, Danny Trejo, Anthony Michael Hall, Dina Meyer, Richard Dillane, Catalina Grama, Ronan Summers, Edward Akrout, Dan Badarau, Radu Andrei Micu
description: Guerrero Hernandez (Danny Trejo) is the leader of a gang of outlaws who, after freeing his half-brother Red from prison, plan to ransack the mining town of Edendale. Red, however, has a different plan and kills Guerrero. A year later, following a pact made with Satan (Mickey Rourke), Guerrero returns from the dead to seek revenge and transform the streets of the town, now renamed as Tombstone, into a river of blood.

title: Force of Execution
actors: Danny Trejo, Steven Seagal, Ving Rhames, Sarah Minnich, David House, Jesus Jr., Jenny Gabrielle, Bren Foster, Eric Steinig, Tina Borek
description: The affairs of Alexander Coates' (Steven Seagal) criminal empire are in full swing until Roman Hurts (Bren Foster), one of his best men, messes up what was supposed to be a routine heist. Alexander spares Roman's life but paralyzes his hands, causing him to be forced to retire from the tour. In a short time, however, Alexander realizes that he needs Roman's help for the last time in the face of the appearance of Iceman (Ving Rhames), a ruthless killer.

title: Oculus
actors: Karen Gillan, Brenton Thwaites, Katee Sackhoff, Rory Cochrane, Annalise Basso, Garrett Ryan, James Lafferty, Miguel Sandoval, Katie Parker, Courtney Bell
description: Kaylie and Tim Russell are two brothers who were struck by having witnessed the harrowing odyssey of their parents as children, driven first to madness and then to murder. Reunited as adults after a long time, the two are convinced that it was a supernatural entity that generated the events of her past and their efforts converge to destroy what they believe is truly responsible: a legendary mirror once owned by their family.
notes: Extending his 2006 short, Flanagan measures horror and its tricks, at a time when the genre appears saturated and predictable, with an imagery in need of testing itself. Thus an inexorable interlocking score comes to life, in which the present and the past progressively approach, until they merge with the entry into the remote scenes of the current characters, in a schizoid mechanism reminiscent of Cronenberg's Spider. Horror survived the Paranormal mania, reaffirming the validity of its assumptions and its gray areas.

title: Abstraction
actors: Hunter Ives, Richard Manriquez, Korrina Rico, Ken Davitian, Eric Roberts, Natalie Victoria, Manu Intiraymi, James Arthur Lewis, Alfred Rubin Thompson, Mindy Robinson
description: Tommy and Gary are two criminals who fearlessly engage in major thefts to make ends meet, but after a routine robbery goes wrong, the two are forced to leave their business behind. But when the relationship with his new girlfriend Scarlet takes a more serious turn, Tommy must face his financial difficulties and, on the advice of Scarlet herself, plans an ambitious plan with Gary to steal a half-million-dollar painting.

title: Bounty Killer
actors: Matthew Marsden, Christian Pitre, Barak Hardley, Gary Busey, Kristanna Loken, Abraham Benrubi, Beverly D'Angelo, Eve, Kevin McNally, Alexa PenaVega
description: In 2042, for over twenty years, multinationals have taken control of the Earth and their insatiable thirst for profit and power has led to the outbreak of a new world war. The conflict has permanently altered the face of the planet and the Council of Nine Roses was formed in the rubble, whose sole objective is to identify each manager responsible - directly or indirectly - for what happened. Made up of ruthless cold-blooded killers but also amateurs, the Council wants to completely eradicate the root of the apocalypse and try to bring the situation back to normal.

title: Butcher Boys
actors: Ali Faulkner, Johnny Walter, Derek Lee Nixon, Tory Tompkins, Sonny Carl Davis, Phillip Wolf, Bill Johnson, Marilyn Burns, Edwin Neal, John Dugan, Gregory Kelly, Teri McMinn
description: A birthday party at an upscale restaurant sets events in motion that bring Sissy, her brother Mikey, and friends Kenny and Barbie face to face with the macabre world of the Butcher Boys, international predators who deal with living or dead human flesh.
notes: Inspired by a short story by Jonathan Swift.

title: Mojave
actors: Eric Christian Olsen, Dash Mihok, Rider Strong, Vince Vieluf, Bumper Robinson, Genevieve Padalecki, Wayne Young, Brendan Fletcher, Aaron Rhames, Chance Romero
description: Four friends head to the Mojave Desert to attend a winter rave. After the party, their journey turns into something hellish when the four meet a couple of bad local thugs.

title: Winter's Tale
actors: Colin Farrell, Jessica Brown Findlay, Jennifer Connelly, Eva Marie Saint, Russell Crowe, William Hurt, McKayla Twiggs, Ripley Sobo, Will Smith, Matt Bomer, Kevin Durand, Lucy Griffiths, Kevin Corrigan, Brenda Wehle
description: New York City is overwhelmed by arctic winds, dark nights and white lights. The life of the inhabitants revolves around the largest house ever built and there is nothing that can affect its vitality. In this fantastic setting, one winter's night Peter Lake (Colin Farrell), an orphan and a great mechanic, tries to rob a fortress-palace in the Upper West Side neighborhood. Though he believes the mansion is empty, he finds Beverly Penn (Jessica Brown Findlay), the owners' young daughter who is dying, waiting for him. Thus begins a love story that travels back in time thanks to a flying white horse.
notes: Adaptation of a Mark Helprin novel.

title: The Expendables 3
actors: Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren, Randy Couture, Terry Crews, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Wesley Snipes, Antonio Banderas, Harrison Ford, Mel Gibson, Kellan Lutz, Ronda Rousey, Victor Ortiz, Glen Powell, Kelsey Grammer
description: Barney (Sylvester Stallone), Christmas (Jason Statham) and the rest of the Mercenaries team come face to face with Conrad Stonebanks (Mel Gibson), who years earlier had co-founded the group with Barney. Because Stonebanks had become a ruthless arms dealer, Barney had been forced to kill him, or so everyone believed. Stonebanks, on the other hand, managed to survive and made it his mission to end the Mercenaries. To avoid this hypothesis, Barney decides to recruit new members who are younger, faster and more technologically savvy.

title: Trilogia del terrore
actors: Karen Black, Robert Burton, John Karlen, George Gaynes, Jim Storm, Gregory Harrison, Kathryn Reynolds, Tracy Curtis, Orin Cannon
description: Three episodes. Julie: a teacher is being blackmailed by a student who is a little too enterprising; Millicent and Therese: two sisters with very different personalities torment each other, involving their doctor; Amelia: an American woman buys a voodoo doll to give to her new boyfriend, an anthropology teacher.
notes: Three stories taken from as many short stories by the American writer Richard Matheson (who personally scripts the third episode). The common thread is also given by the presence of the actress Karen Black, who plays all the female characters.

title: Nothing Left to Fear
actors: Clancy Brown, Anne Heche, Ethan Peck, Jennifer Stone, Rebekah Brandes, James Tupper, Heather Roop, Carter Cabassa, Wayne Pére, J.D. Evermore
description: Wendy and her husband Dan move to Kansas in the small town of Stull, of which Dan has become the new reverend. In what at first appears to be a sleepy community inhabited by friendly neighbors, however, a series of horrifying events await them. Their teenage daughter is in fact haunted by gruesome visions while the youngest has been chosen for a depraved ritual. Deep in darkness, one of the Seven Gates of Hell demands the blood of innocent victims to unleash its damned creatures.

title: Savaged
actors: Adrienne Amanda, Rodney Rowland, Samuel Marc, Ronnie Gene Blevins, Rick Mora, Brionne Davis, Marc Anthony Samuel, Natalie Sutherland, Kyle Morris, Willow Hale, Joseph Runningfox, Peter Sherayko
description: A beautiful young deaf-mute girl is kidnapped, raped and left nearly dead by a criminal gang. Attempting to save her life is a Native American expert in medicine but his every effort takes a disastrous turn when the girl wakes up possessed by the spirit of an Apache leader, dead murdered and seeking revenge.

title: Wer
actors: A.J. Cook, Brian Scott O'Connor, Sebastian Roché, Simon Quarterman, Vik Sahay, Stephanie Lemelin, Oaklee Pendergast, Angelina Armani, Brian Johnson, Collin Blair, Corneliu Ulici
description: Attorney Kate Moore (A.J. Cooke) takes on the defense of Talan, a man suspected in the brutal murder of an American family. While Talan appears to be a quiet and gentle type, Kate will soon discover that she is facing a werewolf.
notes: Images from GoPro cameras mounted on SWAT rifles and confusing night mode footage open the way to the breaking in of an almost superheroic action, in which the Wolfman meets The Planet of the Apes and the medical-scientific realism slips into the implausible and into a melodramatic ending that blatantly pays homage to The Fly. The overabundance of registers proves to be the greatest limitation of a work that is always uncertain about the direction to take but capable, for long stretches, of giving glimpses of pure horror.

title: The Hunters
actors: Victor Garber, Michelle Forbes, Alexa PenaVega, Robbie Amell, Keenan Tracey, Kira Clavell, Dan Payne, Eric Breker, Alex Zahara, Mark Ghanimé
description: 21-year-old Paxton Flynn is preparing for a solo world tour in his sailboat when he is surprised to see Tripp, his sixteen-year-old brother who is supposed to be in boarding school. Soon, the two are visited by two Interpol agents who inform them that their parents, who have long since disappeared, turn out to be international thieves who have stolen a precious object from a museum. Joining their forces with those of Dylan Savini, the parental assistant, the two brothers embark on an adventure that, on the trail of Snow White's magical mirror, will lead them to save the world from the clutches of evil.
notes: Based on Joshua Williamson's comic Mirror, Mirror.

title: Cinderella
actors: Lily James, Richard Madden, Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham Carter, Hayley Atwell, Holliday Grainger, Sophie McShera, Stellan Skarsgård, Nonso Anozie, Derek Jacobi
description: The father of the young Ella, a merchant who has been widowed, marries Lady Tremaine (Cate Blanchett) in second marriage and takes her to live at home with her two daughters Anastasia and Genoveffa. When her father mysteriously disappears, Ella (Lily James) finds herself at the mercy of a family where jealousy and cruelty reign supreme. Relegated to the role of scullery maid, Ella does not surrender to the difficulties she encounters and, mindful of her mother's last words, she always shows herself courageous and kind, never giving in to despair or contempt for those who humiliate her continuously. Her luck is destined to change when the possibility of participating in a real event looms on the horizon, where she hopes to meet again the mysterious and fascinating stranger (Richard Madden) whom she met in the woods, completely unaware of how he is in actually the prince.
notes: Kenneth Branagh unrolls all the timelessness of the classic on a baroque carpet of opulent and luxuriant details in balance between the wonder of the fantastic and (relative) verisimilitude of the plot. Cinderella adds to her characters the thickness that is enough not to make them disfigure in three dimensions and consciously chases the glories of Hollywood that was, of a luxurious and sparkling cinema capable of realizing the substance of dreams on film.

title: The Giver
actors: Brenton Thwaites, Jeff Bridges, Meryl Streep, Alexander Skarsgård, Odeya Rush, Cameron Monaghan, Katie Holmes, Taylor Swift
description: In a perfect dystopian world, where there is no suffering and everyone seems happy, young Jonas (Brenton Thwaites) is in charge of receiving the Memoirs of Humanity, setting out for training in close contact with an old man called "the Giver" ( Jeff Bridges). From the Giver, Jonas learns of the pain, sadness, war and unhappy truth of the "real" world. Faced with the awareness of the falsity of the universe in which he lives, Jonas finds himself having to make difficult choices about his life and his future.
notes: The challenge of transposing into images an awareness based entirely on sensations is solved by Noyce in the worst possible way: the memories transmitted by the Donor are a mix between a Super 8 holiday film and an accelerated television history course. And, while preaching the need to rebel against conformism, The Giver turns out to be the listless photocopy of every contemporary young adult saga, adapted from Lois Lowry's novel of the same name.

title: The Wicked
actors: Devon Werkheiser, Justin Deeley, Jess Adams, Jamie Kaler, Caitlin Carmichael, Diana Hopper, Jackelyn Gauci, Chase Maser, Robert Young, Cassie Keller
description: It's almost Halloween and in the small town of Summerset, six undeterred young people, not frightened by the folklore and spooky tales that circulate in the community, decide to head to the home of a legendary and evil witch with the hope of perhaps provoking her. They are not, however, prepared for the horror they will unleash and the nightmare they will find themselves living in.

title: Bigfoot
actors: Danny Bonaduce, Barry Williams, Bruce Davison, Sherilyn Fenn, Howard Hesseman, Andre Royo, Alice Cooper, Stephanie Sarreal Park, Cynthia Geary, Noelia Rodriguez
description: When a legendary mountain creature bigfoot attacks an Eighties-themed concert in the famous town of Deadwood, a concert organizer and environmental professor who played together as young people will do everything to protect the "endangered species" from a hunter without. scruples.

title: Godzilla
actors: Bryan Cranston, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Ken Watanabe, Elizabeth Olsen, Juliette Binoche, David Strathairn, Sally Hawkins, CJ Adams, Richard T. Jones, Brian Markinson
description: Nuclear tests carried out by the Americans in the Pacific Ocean in 1954 awakened a gigantic amphibious creature, believed by all to be the fruit of the legends of Eastern mythology. After surviving an attempted destruction by the US Navy through an atomic explosion, the creature takes refuge in the depths of the ocean until a new threat awakens it, bringing destruction and terror everywhere.
notes: Edwards draws suggestions and quotes to pay homage to the monster-icon and the genre of the kaiju eiga, without forgetting that, originally, the fun of the blows between giants was accompanied by the clarification of (more or less) ancestral terrors (here updated with references to Fukushima and the tsunami) and the denunciation of a civilization prodigal of errors. Humans are completely annihilated by ancient forces, by animalistic logics that ignore good and evil. The US military and the characters can only diligently follow the narrative rules of the blockbuster. And let Godzilla - terrifying and effective - do the rest.

title: The Harvest
actors: Samantha Morton, Michael Shannon, Natasha Calis, Charlie Tahan, Peter Fonda, Leslie Lyles, Meadow Williams, Amina Robinson, Hayden Skigen
description: Katherine (Samantha Morton) and Richard (Michael Shannon) decide to move to a secluded environment to make their son Andy live better, who came into the world with a serious degenerative disease and grew up protected from the outside world. However, their controlled existence is endangered by the arrival of young Maryann in the house next door. Maryann immediately tries to make friends with Andy, clashing with the opposition of two over-protective parents who do nothing but feed her disturbing suspicions about the shocking truth they hide.

title: Tokarev
actors: Nicolas Cage, Rachel Nichols, Peter Stormare, Aubrey Peeples, Danny Glover, Michael McGrady, Max Ryan, Patrice Cols, Pasha D. Lychnikoff, Elena Sanchez, Weston Cage
description: Paul Maguire (Nicolas Cage) and comrades Kane and Doherty live a criminal existence. One night, they set up an ambush for a Russian mobster, intercepting him while he is on the way to deliver the money to his boss. They make a huge amount of money and a Russian pistol called Tokarev. This prompts Paul to decide to leave the crime but the theft unleashes a bloody war between his Irish crime family and the Russian mafia. While waiting for the waters to calm down, the three accomplices hide the money for five years, after which they meet to each take what is due. After marrying the beautiful and ambitious Vanessa (Rachel Nichols) and becoming the father of the now adolescent Caitlin (Aubrey Peeples), Paul obtained permission from his former boss and mob boss O'Connell (Peter Stormare) to "clean up" but one evening the unthinkable happens. While he and Vanessa are at a charity dinner, Paul is informed of the kidnapping of Caitlin by some Russian men. Convinced that this is revenge for the theft years ago, Paul ignores the police and embarks on a dangerous investigation of his own.

title: Space Warriors
actors: Thomas Horn, Josh Lucas, Mira Sorvino, Dermot Mulroney, Danny Glover, BooBoo Stewart, Ryan Simpkins, Grayson Russell, Savannah Jayde, Sean McNamara, Sahana Srinivasan, Michael Zhang, Nicholas Lobue
description: Teenager Jimmy Hawkings gets the opportunity to make his dream come true when he wins a scholarship to a summer space camp and finds himself side by side with a team of highly skilled peers from around the world.
